name: Diluvion - Original Soundtrack
short_description: The Diluvion Original Soundtrack includes every haunting and riveting music tracks from the game. It also includes two additional bonus original tracks which were composed for the game's trailers.Track Listing:01 The Deep02 Diluvion03 Luminous Ice04 Icer Guild05 Icer Dive Bar06 Icer Towns07 Tonnesburg Courtyard08 Tonnesburg Engineering09...
reviews:
Good, but not full. Good soundtrack for this game - really worth the money Too bad....It's not include the music when explore ship,structure and when encounter hazard.
(Hope there are 2nd volume, Cause those are my favorite) Bought this primarily to support the devs for continued development (and to listen to these nice tunes of course). All this product is, is the soundtrack. it has all the songs and there really isn't anything to say bad about it.

name: Belladonna
short_description: Belladonna is a gothic adventure game, twisted and dark. Take the role of a corpse girl rising from the dead in an abandoned laboratory, and unravel the mysteries concerning your own death and reanimation.
reviews:
The reason I recommend this is because it gets really cheap with sales. Not as cheap as it "should" be given how Plug In Digital somehow missed the memo on adding regional pricing for the LATAM region, but still cheap enough for me to let slide how short and [b]generally[/b] easy this is. I did spend a considerable amount of time going in circles because there's a crucial item that's needed at the game's most open point which I had to use a guide to use becuase I confused it with a mere artistic detail in a closeup scene. It does get slightly annoying in retrospect that right after this you unlock an in-game hint system which makes one end game subquest easier (it's an item which also blends with the background, though it's not as obscure). 

There's a fair share of flavour-only hotzones, though the game does seem to cheapen out a bit in a few rooms. Most of the plot gets delivered via some very obviously placed letters from the game's background characters. Only a few of these end up impactful on their own, but they're an okay gothic epistolary tale, albeit without much in the way of twists (hell, the final note you find does hint at a final twist that doesn't really go anywhere).

It's also a bit deceiving in how it has tons of card drops for a game that's not even particularly replayable. A simple point-and-click game inspired by the Gothic, Frankenstein specifically and with a few references to the ideas of Romanticism. There is a lot of reading to do for such a short game; this doesn't bother me, but it might to someone else. So, there's a lot of story to the game but the puzzles are not very engaging.

Pros: Spooky art style and lesbians are always a win for me. The soundtrack is nice and melancholic, not much variety, but I liked it.

Cons: The gameplay and puzzles are simple and easy, and can get a bit stale after a little bit of time. Granted, this game does not take long to complete. Voice acting could be better.

I got this game on sale, so it was cheap as chips, and I would recommend getting it only on a good sale if you really want it, but it is a game I will probably forget about and not play again. Belladonna is a VERY short Indie itch/io game.

A nice little atmospheric attempt at a game.
Mostly reading notes which turns the gameplay into somewhat of a visual novel.
The "show don't tell" rule flies out the window with this one..

The point & click gameplay is baby level easy, it is downright primitive.
You leave the lab, walk around a few rooms and go back to the lab. That's it, that's the whole game..
-
The story is greatly inspired by Mary Shelley's famous "Frankenstein" book, it is obvious. It only inspired the monster part.
The writing is weak and the plot get sloppy, characters start talking like in a play, no actual person talks this way. The motivations get way too ridiculous. Bad writing.

Make an army of animated dead? Why? Lives of the dead matter? They are dead, they have no lives. WTF?
Trying to paint the husband as some kind of abusive monster, yet the wife is having an affair and is thinking of unjustly committing her husband to a mental institution so she can keep cheating? Who is the villain here? I fear it has some feminist undertones. Everyone is a monster in this story.


I can forgive short length of the game, even amateurish art and gameplay design, even the journal notes that serve as padding, but the weak story is just too much even for an Indie title.
On sale for $1 might be worth a try if you have nothing else to do.. üëçüëçüëç I like the 19-century literature vibes. [h2]Belladonna[/h2]

Has a total of [b]13[/b] trading cards. frankenstein but make it wlw. it's an easy, fast to finish, point and click game. the art style is cute. would be best to buy on sale. what a win for the wuh luh wuh community honestly... absolutely loved this game, i wish it was longer! Very short, the whole game plot is felt like the beginning of something reals... for just getting to sudden end. Game is playable and rather pleasant but don't overpay for it, buy only with a good discount. A really short, by the numbers point-and-click game with light puzzle elements, obviously inspired by the story of Frankenstein.

It's got beautiful graphics, a decent story (which is predictable, but is built and presented quite nicely with the use of notes/journals - I really liked the writing), good voice acting (at least as far as the protagonist is concerned, the umm... other one is rather bland), a fairly spooky atmosphere, and runs smoothly with no glitches or bugs, at least none that appeared during my run.

As advertised, it's really short. I took my time, even left it running while doing other things and I barely reached the 2-hour mark while having explored everything that can be explored. It's also very basic, so much so that there aren't even any settings options (beware, the game is LOUD and you will have to decrease the volume on your machine quite a bit).

There also isn't a save option, but the game does a good job returning you almost exactly to the point you left things via the autosave feature.

Storywise, the ending feels abrupt and lazy. In general, the game could have been much more than it is, a pretty basic, beautiful to look at and listen to, point-and-click game with a passable story.

The original asking price of $5 and some change feels a bit much considering the limited content, but the game is often on a huge sale (I got it for less than a dollar), so with that in mind I can easily recommend it for 1-2 hours of point-and-clicky gothic adventuring.

[b]PS:[/b] I really don't get people downvoting this because of the "lack of puzzles". The game does NOT advertise itself as a puzzler, so I don't know why people go into it expecting puzzles.

name: Void & Nothingness
short_description: Void & Nothingness is a short visual novel horror story set in Manhattan.
reviews:
Short story with nice music and art work, would have liked a longer story
or two or three more short novels after the first, what I'm saying is, I liked it,
it was just to short. 
Worth having in the collection, when you get it on sell. It was actually tedious to follow to for such a short novel. Overdetailed and overtalked narration does not fit the ending... Has a promise though. I preferred Carpe diem even though it was 4 times shorter. I will give a try to other titles by this developer though. It's a neutral review. [I] Void and Nothingness [/i] aroused in me rather conflicting emotions xD I'll leave it to you to decide if you'd like to experience that. 

Praises:
+The greatest feature in my opinion is art (‚ô•œâ‚ô•*) The style feels quite unique, plus it's so dynamic, visuals change so often, sometimes it's almost like watching a video. I mean how it often happens in typical visual novels--you may read for dozens of hours looking at the same sprites (rarely reflecting their emotions in their facial expressions), backgrounds are changed occasionally, still we have to look at the same image again and again. If you are lucky, you'll stumble upon a breathtaking CG and it feels like an amazing achievement. In this very short game I saw so many exciting images, several times I clicked hoping to see a more suitable for ss text but...it was gone, artist has made such an awesome job just to present their art for a second to change it with something equally beautiful. That was truly enjoyable! <3
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2834063460 
+The story is quite thought-provoking. There were totally unexpected plot-twists. Horror and sexual content tags are presented in an unusual way. In general, that was quite an atmospheric read. Some things felt familiar. I was born in a Siberian village but several years ago I moved to the capital. And the contrast is huuuuge. I don't share MC's negative thoughts and revelations but many things she mentions are close to me too in this regard.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2834063275 
Complaints:
--short. You can finish it for less than an hour.
--I think the price is too high. If I remember it right I bought it during the summer sale, I'd recommend the same, to purchase it only with a good discount.
--I wish the text was bigger :( The beginning and the end is just tiny white text somewhere lost in the huge black background. In contrast to bright and vivid main story that felt like such a flaw/loss really. I mean maybe it was something contributing to the name of the game. But anyway the text could be presented in a more convenient way :(
--My greatest complaint is SETTINGS! T_T The game lauches immediately, no main menu. That's how I start any game‚ÄîI go to the settings section first and set everything the way I prefer. Nothing like that here. :( I couldn't save. Dunno I was playing somewhere at 5am, sleep deprived greatly, maybe my brain was lagging but there was only quicksave but clicking it nothing happened. So I finished the game in one go xD Though I initially planned just to check it before going to bed :D I couldn't hide the text, H didn't work. F12 didn't work for screenshots. I think I used special programs for such games years ago, that was a serious exercise for my barely staying conscience brain to recollect where that program was on my computer XD and how it worked. It took me several attempts to upload my screenshots. 
--typos and several times there was text in brackets with (/) as if they forgot to delete some author's/editor's remarks, I dunno even what it was but it shouldn't be there for sure. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2834063127 
--The ending felt kinda...weird. O_O I mean, those final lines would be fine and all but then there was that annoying button to Restart and clicking it the game just started again, the way the button claimed xD No changes, no skipping key. I was furious. Then I kinda found out pressing randomly different keys on my keyboard that 'Space' forced the story to skip, I don't even know if the text was absolutely (un)read. Perhaps it was planned as a constant loop, that never-ending wheel of life. No idea. Because at one point without any warning the game just closed on its own xD For some second I was looking absentmindedly, half asleep/half awaken at the screen, questioning what's just happened‚Äîwas it smth intentional, some devs' genius feature or...just a bug xD But finally decided it was the perfect finale and went to bed. XD

Perhaps, I should choose a neutral review with a thumb down considering the number of '‚Äì' here xD But story-wise and visually the game is enjoyable enough. I want to believe the story may be fixed in all other aspects. 

[table]
[tr]
[th]More thoughts about the game in a [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/readingnook/discussions/0/3419937528178146329/] Reading Nook [/url][/th]
[/tr]
[/table] It's a very short game. Took me 24 minutes to finish reading it
and there is zero replay value.
All the scene changes made me confused and the ending is abrupt.

The only redeeming point is the art.

To the developer, please reconsider redoing the story again. A short (~30 minutes) kinetic novel. Needs more proofreading (there's a handful of typos, as well as two odd instances of what look like placeholder notes that were accidentally left in), but the writing has a wonderfully dreamy, poetic feel, flowing from one thought to the next, sometimes vague as to what the protagonist is actually saying out loud and what she's thinking. The art is beautiful, and the music really builds up the atmosphere.

I was all set to give this a positive review, and then a twist ending abruptly sucked everything interesting and ambiguous out of the story, leaving only a husk of tired cliche, and I just felt cheated. English visual novels have such a shortage of artfully crafted short stories like this. Fuck that ending for ruining it. I'm mixed on whether to recommend this.  I really wish there was a Neutral button.

Pro: somewhat interesting story - is it real or a dream?

Cons: 
short 
not as engaging as other VNs I've read 

[spoiler] Also, beware of "restart" and getting into a loop trying to see if there's more to the story.[/spoiler]
 I bought this game based on the title because I am a nihilist and have a passing interest in Steam's vast library of animu trash. This visual novel does not seem bad, especially when compared to other visual novels. It lacks some things, like an options menu, or a story that isn't kind of lame. If you like this sort of thing you will probably enjoy Void & Nothingness more than not. I guess. Interesting and very thought provoking little story here.  This is a story that you'll need to read as it has no voice acting, just music that you can turn off and on or adjust via the volume control on your speakers or headset.

This novel, even though about a call girl living in the big city.. tells a deep story that anyone older then a young teen can relate to as far as life itself.  It contains some very surprising twists and turns that will have you wondering "what the heck?" and make you want to keep reading until your finished.  

I read this aloud to a live audience on my YT channel, and they all seemed to enjoy it, and the average rating from them after listening to me read it was about an 8 out of 10.  

It might be a little over-priced at $3.99 USD, but it took me about an hour and a half to read it outloud.  The story was pretty good, it definitely kept my interest, but I felt like it was a little overpriced.  Because of the higher price then I'd like to see for this, I give this visual novel a 7 out of 10, knocking one point from my viewers score of 8 due to a little too high of a price tag.

name: Legacy of the Elder Star
short_description: Legacy of the Elder Star is a mouse-driven shoot 'em up for the rest of us. You are the Cosmonaut, an eternal cosmic hero who must shatter the robotic Infinite Legion and rekindle a dying star!
reviews:
Readers might find this odd to mention first and foremost, but I have to start with praise for the music of Elder Star. Props to the composer for writing something that's at once epic, spacey and robotic that evokes the classic 8/16-bit legends. I'm particularly sensitive to music in video games, and this one struck the nail on the head for me.

The gameplay is through controling the protagonist as if he were a mouse cursor on the screen. Left click is the classic gun, right click is a smash attack that turns your little robot into a ball of death when you touch enemies. There are upgrades that I assume come with each successful completion of the Story Mode. 

Story Mode is five stages, and using about 12 continues (most on Stage 4), I managed to beat the game in under 30 minutes. This is good because you about six weapons to unlock, and you unlock one weapon per play-though (I am assuming). I unlocked one new gun (left click), and a new play mode (Practice Mode, i.e. choose any stage to play). 

Most of the game's worth is through replay value. The story is simple, but well done. It's not the centerpiece of the experience, that's learning how to survive. 

The enemy attacks aren't very forgiving, but they are fair. The stages ascend in difficulty at a correct rate, so that I was learning from my mistakes quickly rather than being bombarded by a million bullets from the get-go. The artwork, which emulates the Behemoth Games style cartoon work, makes it easy to distinguish bullets trying to kill you, moving enemies, and backgrounds. You should be able to recognize what kinds of attacks are coming at you to move accordingly through the deeper circles of bullet hell. 

If I have one major complaint, it's that the final boss was one of the easiest for me to defeat. I was expecting a THIS ISN'T MY FINAL FORM sort of ordeal, but nope. I'll probably give this another couple playthroughs, but I'm not likely to unlock everything. If you are looking for a quick bullet-hell game, this is it. Looks good by the the graphics and sounds but it's a very strange, awkward, clumsy and poor controled shooter. Not compatible with controllers or keyboard control because relies on a weird mouse sensibility input changed with the mouse wheel as you play the game, what? So you gotta play a shooter game using only your mouse while the keyboard input is configured by default to... take screenshots and record animated GIFs, LOL? I've just played for 5 minutes and felt some strain in my right hand, gee I ain't gonna keep playing this.

What were this game developers thinking? I don't understand it... This game plays as beautiful as it looks.  It is a well-crafted shoot-em-up whose departures from genre norms are both intuitive and refreshing.  Legacy of the Elder Star shows off all the things a modern-day shoot-em-up is capable of being. Finished the story in 30 minutes. Then I unlocked practice mode. A bit backwards, don't you think?

So here's how it works:
You are the cosmonaut, basically a herodude out to kill hordes of machine enemies who share your colour scheme. You move your mouse to move around like it was the mouse pointer, left button is a standard attack, right charges your super attack when you hit/kill things with it, both buttons at the same time unleashes your super attack. You gather points and unlock in-game achievements in the 5 different stages. 

There are things I like - the infinite continues, the mouse moving the character (as a concept), but I really don't care about hunting points and trophies when the story and gameplay is this anemic, the soundtrack just alright and the design sort of bland (with some additional issues keeping track of the hero and shots). The stage variations are of the early arcade model - they're a different background with a different set of enemies, there's no terrain features that do anything (to my recollection).

In short and my humble opinion: cool controller idea, needed some more work before being worth 7.99 Euro. I'm a casual fan of the shmup genre and this game hit just the right spot for me. There are options and modifiers to crank up the difficulty to challenge even the most skillful players, but the game remains friendly to the less skilled with continue after death options that allowed me to play through and experience all the levels at the cost of a decreased score.

Every level has a scoreboard as well as various challenges that drive you to replay and improve your score, also the soundtrack is kickin' Legacy of the Elder Star is a simple SHMUP with a very pretty art and twist in the control scheme.

The beautiful art, nice effects and good music unfortunately masks a game devoid of any character in any area. It's telling that the only characteristics of the protagonist are his name and his tacked on grin, without which he would sit right at home amongst the enemy drones. The pattern continues with art which lacks most of world building background detail and most enemies have a theme of mechanical and gray. I'd really like to see more beautiful high-resolution 2d art in games, but the resolution must be filled with detail - otherwise low-res pixel art is better when I can use my imagination subconciously to fill gaps of pixels with detail. The Music is great and fits the game very well. 

Nothing above would really matter if the game had an interesting gameplay that challenged and surprised the player. There's a serious lack of bullet patterns in this game. Fighting becomes so predictable and boring way too fast. Unfortunately bosses know only a few tricks, different phases only having more difficulty or speed added. Same applies to basic enemies. First level of most other shmups has more to see that this game. Most shmup pattern staples are just missing like bullet barrages that move at different speeds or mazes. Currently once I find where the bullets come from and find a safe spot I rarely have to move.

The replayability is really nice touch with challenges and different weapon loadouts. Unfortunately replayability won't fix these problems. Great 2-D shmup.  The artstyle isn't my thing, but it's lovingly drawn and exudes a ton of character.  Controls require only the mouse, which is cool and different for a shmup, and they're innovated upon ingeniously.  The Star Dash ability essentially requires you to angrily shake your mouse all over the screen, lol.

Really liked it.  Recommended. How many fucking screens do you have to skip through during this game? Oh, and *then* the game decides to do some loading. Couldn't do that straight away, had to waste your time counting score, giving an intro for the boss screen and pissing about with a fucking progress bar filling of your score. I get it, game developer, you don't value my time. Well I don't value your shitty game. First played this at Salt Lake Gaming Con last week.  Fell in love with it then and there. The controls and gameplay are simple but function beautfully. All in all, one of my favorite Indie game of the year.  Great Job. Makes the genre very accessible by allowing for unlimited continues and modified game speed at the cost of score. You can even boost the game speed up to make it harder and increase the score multiplier.

The varied enemy patterns from run to run makes the game more about adapting to situations rather than wrote memorization that is common in most shmups.

The controls are tight and feel good and there is a proper balance or risk reward throughout all your decisions.

name: NIDUS
short_description: A symbiotic Flower and Wasp struggle to complete their lifecycle, in a challengingly twisted arcade experience. Control both characters at once in mind-bending Single Player, or team up with a friend in hectic Local Co-Op. Master the symbiotic duet, devour the swarm, and ascend the leaderboard.
reviews:
Worth it for the art alone. Fun for a couple runs, unfortunately unbalanced at the high end. acid trip I don't understand how this game is so incredibly niche despite it having some of the most fun gameplay and art direction I've seen in a bullet hell roguelike. The things you can pull off and the satisfaction you get from seeing a million little flowers flying off your dude gives an incredible dopamine hit. PLEASE give this game a try, it's so cool. Very hard (not surprising), but so good. This game is gorgeous, and has some really neat synergistic design concepts, but it's really absurdly hard, with no way to make it easier (you only unlock harder difficulties). I think that's a fine thing if you want to present your game as an experience that can be challenged and overcome, but it doesn't really make it accessible to outsiders in any way. Also, if you suffer from epilepsy or flashing light sensitivity, steer clear of this one.

6/10, cool art game that's also tough, not for everybody. This game is one of the most fun games I have ever played in my life!!! One of the best indie games for sure 100%! Also, Kudos to the dev/s for a flawless bugless game. No pun intended! I really CAN'T recommend this game enough. 10/10 for me! Go try it right now!!!!!!!!!!
 This game is 100% heat. The combat is really unique and the animation is crazy good Stick with this, and definitely read the "tips" page. It's really fun if you can understand what's happening! incredible game, hard as balls but controller left hand and mouse in right hand gives you a lot more control than either controller or m+kb alone If you thought this was a fun, trippy game you could play while high then think again.

It's a relentless ever-evolving gameplay loop. You decide in which order to tackle the onslaught of pests and monstrous creatures that plague this psychedelic hallway of hell. But whichever road you take it becomes increasingly perilous, with the final boss becoming grotesquely overpowered.

In Nidus you simultaneously control the duo Flower and Wasp. With the keyboard Flower weaves through swarms of enemies, struggling to avoid being devoured. Your mouse contrls Wasp, whose sole purpose is to protect Flower. You can choose rudimentary upgrades to either friend; go all out on one or split the power between them equally. Either way Flower and Wasp are dependant upon and empower each other -- their bond is what keeps them alive.

Yes there's a steep learning curve but once it clicks it's second nature. And what you get in return is an experience that is visually mesmerizing and brutally satisfying. Unstoppably beautiful, I feel like I'm getting better each round I try. If you want to have your bullet hells with a flavor of love and connection, to feel like two halves of a greater whole, this is it.

name: The Dark Horde
short_description: In The Dark Horde, you control the battlefield with a deck of cards. Summon hordes of minions, cast devastating spells, and tap into the forbidden power of the Four Domains: Death, Destruction, Corruption, and Frost. It‚Äôs not just what you‚Äôll conquer, but how you‚Äôll become the most feared Dark Mage!
reviews:
A fun little game. A deckbuilder combined with one of those games where you and your enemy spawn minions from a tower that advance on each other. This game is an insane value for the price. Overall:
* Insanely fun with huge potential (for multiplayer PvP as well)

Positives:
* Tons of different playstyles, you can go aggro, you can go economy, you can go full defense and upgrade your tower cannon instead, you can go straight up spell face dmg, each of these having several more variations

* Visuals/fx can be surprisingly juicy at times

* Decent music and sound

Negatives:
* Some factions/synergies are a WIP and are insanely weak rn, being unable to pass the even the 1st lvl with their starting deck, but there's already a huge variety of working things to play with

* There are some overly complicated cards with little to no payoff (like, you have to meet 2 or 3 different hard to reach conditions to barely scratch the weakest enemy unit), they should either activate way easier or do way more than they do. For example there is a skeleton that costs a lot, has weak stats, moves slowly, but has a really weak stun/dmg effect ONLY in the middle of the map (that isn't even well defined where exactly it is)
Not to mention some frost cards, oh god

* AI art is a bit all over the place and pixel art sprites are mismatched scale-wise, but the gameplay makes up for it The pixel art is cute and charming, watching those lil guys bouncing around is a joy. The gameplay loop and the colors do well in satiating my ADHD tendencies, im locked in when im playing this. This game has so much to offer at a great price point. I enjoy the time-unit mechanic, theres always something happening to keep you engaged and if you wanna slow down you can take your time. The synergy possibilities is fun to interact with in the deck-building making the decision making enjoyable for me. The replay value is high, im always end up lying to myself when I say just one more run. A hidden gem! This is a really fun game with incredible music. There's a lot of strategy involved too, as you have to balance your time with summoning monsters and casting spells. The artwork is top notch. I love the classic monsters theme, plus summoning the grim reaper is so much fun! Love it! A really fun roguelite with tons of content.I find the endgame challenging but possible. Insanely fun game with so much content. I really don‚Äôt understand how this is only early access. I can‚Äôt wait to play more of this. There are barely any reviews for this year but every review is upwards of 40 hours playtime. Honestly that‚Äôs way more of a recommendation that tons of 30 minute playtime reviews. New to Heroes of Hammerwatch 2 this is definitely the most engaging game I‚Äôve played so far this year. Need to play more but I just wanted to do my part to help boost the positivity for this great game. Buy this. Stupidly good with so much content for like $6 Gday CardLovers,

The Dark Horde is a fantastic deckbuilder that utilises time to play out cards rather than the mana or energy as in a turn based concept. 
This unique gameplay combined with collecting gold and souls and the familiar open packs to obtain rare cards and upgrade your deck just works.
The game is in pre release BETA so I will review it fully on release but at the absurd price and the fact that the devs are releasing new content and upgrades constantly it is a no brainer purchase.
Hours of fun for 10$ 


 +Fun turn based deck builder 
+Lots of synergies
+Impactful upgrades
+Challenging 
+Very high replayability  
-Can feel RNG dependent at times
-Took me 20 hours to find out what a BigWig is  :P A charming and unique (at least to me) on the rogue-like deck building genre. Unlike most games in the genre, you don't have 'energy or stamina' in which to play your card. Here you use time or 'Time Units (TU)'. Every card has a TU cost which goes by fairly quickly - half a second if I recall correctly - and combat proceeds in real time. This leads to an interesting scenario where you have to strategically use your cards and various actions in order to win battles. It took me a bit to get used to this and I admit that I still spend a lot of time rapidly clicking on the action I want to undertake even though time is ticking down. 

The art style is cute and the pixel graphics serve it well. I will say that there are times that there are far too many minions or sprites on the screen that when you try to pause and examine them to see their statistics, it becomes clunky as they overlap over one another and you can't quite get the minion you want but it's a minor gripe. 

There is a bit of a grind but it isn't unbearable. The fun comes in working with the synergies amongst the cards and card types (domains). Sometimes you have a zombie deck that is dependent on the generation of corpses or destruction of corpses but there are cards in the corruption domain that will more readily do this for you. So you are encouraged to experiment and find new ways to play.

Most battles are short with a deck run of fifteen rounds taking about anywhere from 15 to 30 min for me at least with deck building in between each round.  So not at all time consuming and quite rewarding in the end. In the early access stage, it's got most of the content already there which is exciting and well worth-the price.

Certainly looking forward to what the full release comes out with.

name: The Sims‚Ñ¢ 4 Cats & Dogs
short_description: Create a variety of cats and dogs, add them to your Sims‚Äô homes to forever change their lives, and care for neighborhood pets as a veterinarian with The Sims‚Ñ¢ 4 Cats & Dogs*.
reviews:
all of my pets dies I'm going full rant mode on this (discusing good and bad) BUT I will have a summary at the end! 

Ok, lets start by confronting problems other simmers had: it's buggy and over priced | OK, that is not true in my expirience. I have never gotten a bug from my sims 4 packs (except one where the gerbils kept dying, coming back alive and then dying) so this actually has never been true for me. I also use a really good PC, so for laptops not meant for gaming (which most people have and that's fine) might make it buggy. I find though that it only was buggy for my friends in the beginning. 2nd problem: Overpriced | I think people underestimate how LONG it takes to code, how much effort must be put in! All that time designing, so yes, it is worth about 40$ in my opinion. If a sale is coming up soon (EX: It's November and their gonna have the annual Holiday sale in December) then WAIT.

My problems: I wish there were more things to do...AND THAT MAYOR WHISKERS WOULD STOP SHOWING UP AT MY HOUSE CAUSE I CAN'T HELP BUT ADOPT HIM !! Sorry, I do wish there were more activities but other than that..no comment? Yes, there aren't many things the pets can interact with, and yes, you can't control your pet. But I kind of like that??

Overall pros: I LOVE DESIGNING THEM!! Paired with the cottage-living pack, horse pack, and the "gerbil" pack (sorry forgot the name) its REALLY fun!! Love how they interact with toddlers too :3. Perfect for people with or without pets. If you have pets, I have fun using the breed selector to make them, and the painting tool to add anything special they have. If you don't have pets, trust me this pack will make you REALLY want one!!

Summary: Not buggy for good computers, not overpriced because they work REALLY hard with the hours of code. I wish there were more activities. Love this paired with other packs. Perfect whether or not you have pets! Try to buy on sale, but its worth it off sale. I LOVE THIS PACK!!

Hope this helps! I'm a long-time simmer with my last account gone, this was the first pack I bought. Its a good one, but it is hard to play it after losing your beloved boi...

If you are a pet peson like me, its one of the best dlcs you can get in sims universe. Though I would "personally" buy this DLC when its on promotion/sale, and I think it could've been a game-base addition. I love the little dogs/cats that run around the area when playing. This mod adds a little more humanity into the Sims and is super nice to own. Riddled with bugs to the point that it's almost unplayable. I was playing the free base version of the game and enjoyed it and had almost no problems, and then I downloaded this game and suddenly nothing worked. Sims won't do what you ask and will freeze frequently. My dog got sick and I was stuck "Waiting for a vet" for hours until I finally loaded a previous save of the game to get out of it. Sims freeze before walking the dogs. Pets glitch into walls and under floors. I don't use any mods and have 3 human sims and 3 dog sims. I have looked up how to make the game run more smoothly in case it was my computer, but I don't believe it is because the base game worked well. I don't recommend buying this version of the game and definitely won't be buying any other Sims games in future. buy it on sale, don't be like me who bought it at full price just to realise it doesn't do much .... 

its really fun to make cats n dogs though so i would recommend to get it (WHEN IT IS ON SALE) I do recommend the DLC for the creating of your pets, but it's reaaaaally frustrating to have bought it at a great price even if it was in promotion and have my expectations blown up a bit.
I was hyped because I thought the pets would be playable like in The Sims 3, but they're not, so, if your main purpose is to play with them, you shouldn't get the DLC if it's not in an enormous discount.
However, it is fun to """waste""" time creating a pet almost identical to your own IRL and it's fun to try to figure out why is your pet unconfortable for example. There is an option to ask them what's wrong but it's only for social purposes, your pet won't reply (LOL) you but sometimes what's making them unconfortable will appear over them in a bubble, or you can figure out by watching their behaviour.
Anyway it's fun and cute and can bring you to an experience you aren't able to have IRL, so I still recommend. This pack only really shines if you like playing with cats and dogs because duh that's the entire point of the pack. There's barely any furniture your animals can interact with though and there's not much your pets can do considering you can't directly control them unlike in the sims 3 (which has the best pets gameplay of all mainline games). If you are a huge fan of small homes or buildings then the cats and dogs will just end up glitching your sims' pathing which is a huge con

Tldr: Pets are just walking mannequins that starve in this dlc i only got it to make my dog in it but you shouldnt be able to buy 4 half lifes for what shouldve been a base game feature Amazing:3

name: TS Marketplace: Strasbourg - Karlsruhe Scenario Pack 01
short_description: Enjoy a mix of high-speed traction, regional express and heavy freight motive power on Bahnstrecke Strasbourg ‚Äì Karlsruhe with these new Career scenarios.
reviews: it wont come in the game

name: Erra: Exordium
short_description: Erra: Exordium is a 2D action adventure game in Dieselpunk setting. Explore a world based on Sumerian-Akkadian mythology. Take the role of a scientist who was able to cheat death and fight the rebellious army of mechatrons.
reviews:
I like the look, but playing through it really wasn't fun. Though you definitely get used to it, the combat is quite clunky and punishing. There's a specific parry move you kinda have to use all the time, and the timing on it feels way wrong, even after you master it. The whole game feels designed to have you replay the same sections over an over. Walk into the room - turret behind your back. Jump down a hatch, surprise enemy you can't dodge. It's often not about skill and more about nasty traps which you only know to deal with after reloading the section. It gets much easier after the first boss when game starts throwing more checkpoints, upgrades and ammo at you, but getting to that part is painful. I've literally uninstalled the game in frustration, but came back to collect a few more steam cards.

The story starts with an interesting set up, but then it's kinda formulaic and boring. very fun. loved the art and story. parrying and shooting feels good.  steamdeck ran it perfectly –î—è–∫—É—é –≤–∞–º –∑–∞ —Ç–∞–∫—É –∫–ª–∞—Å–Ω—É —Ç–∞ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—É –≥—Ä—É! Awesome platformer, atmospheric, but with a balanced difficulty for those of us whose reflexes aren't that good anymore haha I have been experiencing several serious bugs throughout this game, including my upgraded carbine rifle being totally non-functional; I reload it, but I press the trigger and it does absolutely nothing. EDIT: I exited the game totally, and when I reopened it, the rifle seems to work fine now. I have no explanation.
Furthermore, this game contains some very unfair difficulty spikes, and mechanics that seem poorly balanced; a major problem I have been having is that many of the jumps are near pixel-perfect to clear fully, which is a serious problem because one jump early in the game requires you to clear it without grabbing the ledge, or you take damage. At another point, the new shotgun I got as an "upgrade" was effectively a nerf right before a difficult combat section, as my previous gun had a much larger magazine which would have been a lifesaver.
Another flaw with this game is that the English translation needs some work.
It's a pity, because the world and atmosphere of the game are terrific, but the gameplay is very rough and unpolished. This is more of a mixed review than a negative review (Steam please add mixed reviews)
[h3] The good [/h3]
-MAAN what a bleak enviroment and atmosphere. This sense of the dread for the situation this world is in is superb. With the countless bodies you find littered everywhere and the crumbling buildings. It truelly gives the fallen empire sense as you travel throughout it (ESPECIALLY in [spoiler] the fire station [/spoiler]). WIth the minimalistic music that supports it gives it that dystopian feeling.
-The amazing art. Im a sucker for pixel art and this is some good shit. The robots look sick, the bakcgrounds are mystical and the attacks look surprisingly smooth. Very good stuff, bravo!

[h3] The OK [/h3]
-The combat is fine, nothing experimental about it (Which you don't really need). You do change what guns you have, but not the melee weapon you take at the start of the game. There are a few gripes about the combat i will address later.
-The story was confusing from what i could piece together, with the ending throwing a massive wrench in my understanding. Not to say its bad though, it was good, but my ape brain didn't compute with it.

[h3] The bad [/h3]
-The parring mechanic feels incredibly off. Not much of the parry itself, but more of the stun after it. It feels really easy to knock an enemy out of the stun, only being able to hit them twice even with the upgrade.
-The worst combos of enemies imaginable, Litterally the rhino and any of the ranged or hard hitting slow enemies is a nightmare for me, most of the time they hit me into a stunlock to death. 
-Dodging rockets, especially from turrets and the poison rocketier in the end game areas, is impossible sometimes.
-Easy to get stunlocked from turrets and especially from lasers and fire. Once you are on the pain train, there is no getting out.

One last thing that really disappointed me at the end game (Spoilers from here on)

[spoiler] When I was picturing what the final boss would look like, I took inspiration from the flying dragon (Which was cool btw) and used it in this situation. What I pictured was a duel against an amalgamation of the disseased water and multiple robots that resembled the god that the people praised for all their lives to give a "god's punishment" feel to it. Once you killed it, you would go to the source and blow it up.

What I didn't expect was a mining wave defence phase, filled with enemies that I had seen to death at that point, and a trial-and-error puzzle phase with a worm thing. Ending off with the realisation that it was just aliens, not some "God's wrath" through a plague that the priests mistakenly fed to the zigarat that created the green water. I had completely forgot about the meteor crash that had happened at the start of the game at that point. [/spoiler]

All in all, It showed great potential, but suffered in some of the gameplay departments that slightly irritated me. Even with that, im excited on what you devs cook up next! the concept is very nice, however combat mechanics and very clunky. the most extreme ridiculous fight is flying boss. you can't mellee the boss and ammo runs out in first minutes. then you have to rely on RANDOM drop from enemies, which might not happen in two cycles. very frustrating descision to make such a mechanic. Erra Exordium is a deeply flawed and fascinating experience. The theme and art direction are fantastic, the enemy variety is high, the combat is satisfying and weighty, and the story is decent although hurt somewhat by the localization to English. The level design is varied and well done, and you will constantly be seeing new assets and layouts. The developers use this in their encounter design as well, and you will see many different combinations of enemies, traps, environmental placements etc. You will also use a variety of different firearms and acquire some metroidvania-esque upgrades.

The issues stem from the particular combination of design decisions: the encounters are extremely challenging and their design varied, so you will probably die a lot. However, the game uses a checkpoint system, and checkpoints are not always in obvious places. There is no backup save or way to overwrite a checkpoint, so if you backtrack through an area there is no way to save. There are also optional areas and multiple routes in some places, although this is a double edged sword as with the checkpoint system and many, many commit drops and traps in the level design you may not realize you are now committed to progress until it is too late. The metroidvania-style upgrades are all backloaded and mostly along the critical path, so they seem superfluous. The variety in guns is welcome, but each time you pick up a new gun you replace your old one with no option to go back if you don't like the new one. There is only one boss in the game, and it's a puzzle fight; you're supposed to [spoiler]shoot the drones it releases so that they explode on the boss[/spoiler], but most players don't notice this and waste all of their ammo, leading the developers to patch the game in response. The end of the game has a huge enemy gauntlet and puzzle section instead of a boss, and while thematic it is very strange. The game is quite challenging and expects a lot of the player, but the checkpoint system combined with the branching level design with commit drops and one way traps leads to a lot of frustration.

It took me many shorter sessions to finally see the credits due to frustration, but I was regularly impressed by the level and encounter design. It was just let down a bit by the trial and error rhythm of dying and reloading, going through everything I was familiar with, getting to a new section, then dying and reloading again. If more of the commit drops were two-way and the game had reusable save stations dotted around, I think it would be a much more enjoyable experience. The game is not a metroidvania or soulslike; it is a very difficult, methodical, linear platformer. I recommend the game mostly due to the theme, visuals, and the very interesting level/encounter design, but anyone easily frustrated by repeating sections should stay away. A nice metroidvania with beautiful pixel art, cool gameplay and story. I'd love to see a sequel to this game or at the very least a dlc. Keep up the great work Devs! Cool atmosphere, great story, great music and sfx

name: Tsundere Girls
short_description: This game is a classic memory game with several levels of difficulty and beautiful arts. Enjoy ;-)
reviews:
Memory game. Four sets of ten pictures. First set clothed, second set underwear, third topless, fourth nude. The sets feature tsundere-style girls. If you like these sorts of games, get it. A bad understanding or interpretation of "Tsundere". The artist is not good at facial expressions, most of which are bad. 

The girls 7, 8 and 10 are good. Their expressions are lively. But the other ones look awkward. Especially, the girl 1 is terribly bad. 

The breasts and labia of girls look well, but the artist should practice more on facial expressions.

name: EquiMagic - Galashow of Horses
short_description: Magnificent horses and glittering costumes. Become a star in the Galashow of horses. Unique Horseshow Simulation with breathtaking horse dressage, grandiose costumes and stage sets.
reviews:
Sure, Fine i recommend it, Lol. 

Okay look, i completed the game in about three hours. Was it a good time? 
Actually yes, the game runs really well, there weren't any technical hangups. Aside from one really glaringly obvious one when it comes to the competitions, which, is the whole game. 
When you're in a show, or a competition, you cant freely move your camera, so, you cant see the number you need to press in order to complete the action. 
But honestly, that's my only gripe, this would make a great kids game. Its straight forward, you get to spend time with the horses in any way you want when you want. The money system is so lax you could probably buy the whole store by show 4. 
And you know what im pretty happy about the price too, most horse games now a days its hard enough to get them to run properly let alone you're being flat out robbed based on how little content they offer for such steep prices.
This one did great, id happily pay 10 dollars for an experience like this. I was going to recommend EquiMagic after about four hours of play, but the further I went into it the less I liked it. The overall idea is neat and probably appealing if you find stuff like Cavalia or the Lipizzaner horses interesting, but what you'll get is something more akin to the lowrider minigame from GTA: San Andreas - yes that irritating, rage-quit inducing one. You MUST get very good at "steering" your horse via mouse as well as timing key presses to the second if you want to finish this game.

EquiMagic is also missing features listed on the store page, namely breeding. You earn money from successful shows and can buy five separate horses with that cash, nothing else. Heck, the Shetland Pony which will be your last purchase doesn't even have a show to be used in and its sole achievement is glitchy. The "Learning missions" are really just a super-lacking tutorial that ends abruptly after your first show. Horse care boils down to waving your mouse over the animals in a pre-set direction and hoping it registers to "clean" them.

I have a feeling this was intended to be a far longer game, as upon completion you'll find lots of items in the store not assigned to anything as well as vaulting moves you'll never use. There is one show that contains vaulting for your character but the game does it for you, you don't need to own the moves like you do those of your horse. English translations get worse the farther you play, although they mostly stay readable.

Achievement hunters...I'd suggest avoiding this one. Most of them work but the Shetland Pony achievement took a couple dozen tries to register so I wasted probably two hours running the lil fuzzball around a track and repeatedly cleaning him. Stat tracking for overall cash earnings as well as show level seems to break after completing the final show for the first time, as I'm currently sitting at 137k thalers while it shows me at just under 44k.

EquiMagic *might* be worth a purchase on steep sale and if you're fine with never finishing it as it is a neat idea but the execution is pretty lacking. This feels like a cross between a bad mobile game and a just plain dated indie title with a healthy dose of rushed to release on the side. i love it Can't recommend the game in its current state. After around 2 hours a gamebreaking bug prevented me from progressing. Spent another 2 hours trying everything I could think of to fix it but nothing worked. Wrote a mail to the developer but didn't get an answer. Requested a Steam refund but - of course - it didn't go through due to over 2 hours playtime + over 2 weeks since purchase (even though most of the playtime is from trying to fix the game and it's been over 2 weeks because I waited for the answer that never came from the developers). Even though I enjoyed the bit I was able to play, I regret having wasted my money on a broken game. It's Different from any other game i've played before, though some controls are a bit odd in the show arena and training hall but overall it's fun. Few updates and this game will be even better. This is probably one of the worst games ever created.  Clunky controls, almost no music/sound design through most of the game, a tutorial that is extremely unintuitive and not to mention actually broken as the grooming minigame seems to require an item it didn't give me and just altogether a completely unpleasant experience.  The shame is that it's a solid idea that COULD have been done very well, but it's just bad.  It's just a bad game. I like this game a lot. The graphics are nice, the gameplay is fun, and the premise is unique and it makes this game very enjoyable. My only problem is the tutorial which doesn't explain a lot. There is no map so you are on your own if you want to find out a layout for this place. Also the game doesn't tell you about the scrolling or the fact you can also use the arrow keys to control your horse. Ok, so, I was borderline with this one as to whether to recommend it or not. The concept is definitely good and the horses are fairly nice-looking so far, plus I love that you can wander around your ranch and do things at your pace. I also love that the main focus of the game is actually dressage (though you are actually putting on a performance rather than doing dressage tests).
 HOWEVER, I'm not sure what language this was originally developed in, but the translation to English is pretty terrible in that majority of the items and horse breeds are spelt incorrectly. Another thing that is bugging me is that some of the descriptions of movements are completely incorrect. For example, the game describes a canter as a slow gallop, which it is not. One other major thing that is bothering me is the tack models, which are horrendously inaccurate. The Icelandic 'snaffle' bridle was missing a throatlatch and the bit was attached incorrectly so that it more resembled a bitless bridle than a bitted one ( I actually had to check the title of the bridle to see whether it was supposed to be a bit or not). The saddles are also way too large on the icelandics.
 Now this all may sound really pedantic, and it quite possibly is if you are just a casual gamer looking for a fun horse game to play, but if you have actually ridden before (like me), and know how things are supposed to look and be, then you may also be incredibly frustrated by this. Otherwise it is a decent game that for once doesn't have racing or jumping as the main focus.

name: 3DMark Fire Strike benchmarks
short_description: Includes three DirectX 11 benchmark tests for high-performance gaming PCs.
reviews:
what the fuck kinda game even is this? I like it. üëç Has a naked wire-frame lady in a surreal fighting scene. Runs over 30 FPS on my custom-built PC. Need I say more? üòè yes it sure does fire my strike or something üëç This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you Another good test to try, I recommend getting all the dlc in a pack, you save some big money and have a lot to play with Just Love this tool a must have

name: Lockheart Indigo
short_description: A private-eye must deceive a rich family into revealing their darkest secrets, before the killer amongst them silences everyone.
reviews:
Very fun little game. Really appreciate the GBA style based of the Gameboy Zelda games i presume. well written and the persuasion game is good too. wish there was more, or a sequel i like the protagonist quite a bit. Excellent detective game, 2-3 hours long. Great characters, setting, story, and art. 

Then I learned about the secret ending and HOLY HELL At the time of writing, this game only has 48 reviews, which is just a shame. It's a damn good adventure game with beautiful artwork, cool gameplay mechanics, engaging characters, a well-written story and a FANTASTIC soundtrack! I did encounter a couple glitches during my playthrough but it didn't marr the experience too badly! Lockheart Indigo is a cool murder-mystery noir that I would highly recommend, especially since it's free (well NOW it is, after I had already paid for it lmao)! So much style, and I love how at home a game like this would feel on an old handheld - it just really reminded me of some great 8-bit experiences from back in the day. 

Chiptune music was lovely, and I really enjoyed exploring the mansion and trying to break the resolve of the various characters you stumble across. Lovely subtle animations and artwork. I had a great time. A short game with a distinctive atmosphere. I loved playtesting it and I love it even more as a finished game. Harmless knows their strengths and plays to them well. Does it live up to the numbers of 10 suspects and 100 rooms? I couldn't tell you, I was busy having a philosophical discussion with the previous gravekeeper. If you see him again, tell him I said hi. If you've got a spare 2 bucks and like mystery, this has my rec. It's a pretty solid small story that'll keep you occupied for a night. I had a wonderful time with it. The game was short and straight to the point, which I appreciate (and wish more games were like). My only minor gripes are that I didn't care much for the robots, and I wish the color-coded doors were marked on the map. My game soft-locked in a hallway with the robots, thankfully the game saves often enough that it wasn't a big set-back. Aside from that, I 100% recommend.

 This game is fabulous. It's unique gameplay is amazingly immersive and very fun to work with. I had a lot of fun exploring this murder mystery and meeting all the well developed and interesting characters. I love the art style and I just really enjoyed playing this game. I love it to death! You should really check this one out. good murder mystery Me and my friend liked it a lot, good value for money

 Since nobody gonna read this, I can confess that I'm stupid as Hell.
Why? Because I forgot to read the reviews!

[h1]The game no longer works no matter what you do.[/h1]
Needs a specific server which was shut down at least a year ago.
And no one gonna revive it, I'm pretty sure.

"Then why the 5.2 hours of gameplay?"
Because of cards. And still didn't worthed.
34 cents (-66% coupon) for a completely dead game which gave me back 11 cents.
23 cents loss.
Which is in this state, counts as a SCAM for me. Why is this still on Store? ‚Äé DO NOT BUY THIS GAME
I bought in December for cheap with a steam coupon from crafting a badge. Only got round to trying it out now to find it is IMPOSSIBLE to play the game ==> it requires an internet connection to a server that has been shut down. You are stuck on a screen that says 'no internet' and cannot do anything (even get to the menu). The only use of this game is to idle for 2 hours to get the trading cards. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME, IT DOES NOT WORK Unplayable, servers are dead; only get if you have a coupon and want Steam trading cards. Unable to connect to the server a single time. Just run the stuff to get the steam cards so far. Just hope that the servers will be back, but it seems that the problem is massive with users since april at the very least.
So i don't have an opinion per say about the game.

name: Beachhead 2000
short_description: In the immersive world of BeachHead, you assume the role of a lone gunner, the last bastion against an overwhelming onslaught of enemy forces. The stakes are high as you're tasked with defending your post against threats from land, sea, and air.
reviews:
iTS CHEAP FUN! the non loading issue has since been fixed whenever i start the game , the screen turns black, the disply resolution drops down and nothing works, have to press ctrl + alt + delete to access the task manager and close the game then return the display settings to normal
if anyone could help i would appreciate it This game works right out of steam. No compatibility issues on windows 11!!! I loved this game as a kid! So glad I found it after the compatibility was fixed! This is a great game, an old favorite for focusing in. BUT the game stability really needs to be fixed. It freezes up over nothing. Fun nostalic game

name: 7'scarlet
short_description: The remote town of Okunezato is shaped like a crescent moon and shrouded in dark myths and legends. Take on the role of a brave young woman journeying into the unknown to uncover dangerous truths and locate her missing brother with her childhood friend.
reviews:
In search of her missing brother, a young woman decides to visit the last place he known to visit - a small mountain town called Okunezato. Together with her best friend and other patrons of the hotel they're staying in, they work together to uncover the mysteries hiding within this town and how they are connected to her brother's disappearance.				

Rating: Teen
Length: Medium (~15-25 hours, depending on reading speed)
Warnings: Major character death, graphic violence, animal death/abuse (not visually depicted or written in detail), and (spoilers for secret route) [spoiler]pseudo/step incest.[/spoiler]

Branching visual novel in ADV format. There are 5 routes, with two available from the beginning, as well as a continuation of the true route unlocked after the five routes are completed. There is also a secret route made available after the true route.

Pros:
‚ú® The main and major supporting characters are truly what makes this game. Each character is full of life and personality and you'll become quickly endeared to the characters. 
‚ú® The character and CG artwork is fantastic and the watercolour backgrounds are lovely. 
‚ú® Full voice acting and all of it is wonderful. Japanese only. 
‚ú® The core concept of the story is very interesting. 

Cons:
‚ú® The story is a little awkwardly written. They're really obvious about a LOT of the mysteries and don't leave enough room for the player to speculate, which I find is kind of detrimental to a mystery game. The romances can feel rushed and I feel like this visual novel really could have benefited from letting things be a bit more fleshed out. The fifth route and the secret routes in particular feel more like excuses to infodump the remaining mysteries of the games rather than build up the romances. 
‚ú® Spoilers for the secret route: [spoiler]The romance between MC and her brother COMPLETELY came out of nowhere and will be incredibly offputting to most people.[/spoiler]
‚ú® Feels like it was not fully adjusted for PC when ported. No buttons over the text box to click to get to the menu/log/auto. Must have keyboard shortcuts memorized to access these while playing. The game only tells you the shortcuts in the game launcher. Cannot click anywhere on screen to advance the text; must click within the text box. 		
‚ú® All characters are voiced EXCEPT the MC. 

Overall rating: 7/10
Recommendation: Wait for a sale before buying. I got the game as a recommendation from a friend but I'm disappointed that there is no lesbian route. The main route sets up an intriguing mystery, only for each individual route to completely disappoint, with the romance falling flat due to how short they are. Its only saving grace is Yuzuki‚Äîone of the best kuudere love interests I‚Äôve seen in a long time‚Äîand one of the wildest true routes I‚Äôve ever had the (dis)pleasure of reading. If you think you can predict the twist, you‚Äôre in for a weird surprise.

I‚Äôd recommend it just for the sheer rollercoaster that last route was. A bit disappointed that it‚Äôs not more talked about in the (English-speaking, at least) otome community.
 ÊàëÂÖ®ÊàêÂ∞±‰∫Ü‰ΩÜÊòØÊÄªÁöÑÊù•ËØ¥ÊàëËßâÂæóËøô‰∏™Ê∏∏Êàè‰∏çÂÄº‰ªñÁöÑ‰ª∑Èí±„ÄÇÊúâÂá†‰∏™ÂéüÂõ†

È¶Ü‰∏ªÁöÑ‰∫∫Áâ©Â°ëÈÄ†ÂØπÊàëÊù•ËØ¥ÊØîËæÉÈöæ‰ª•Êé•Âèó„ÄÇÊàëÊòéÁôΩÂèØËÉΩÈ¶Ü‰∏ªÊÉ≥ÂÜôÊàêÂÇ≤Â®áÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØ‰ªñÂ∑≤Áªè‰∏çÊòØÂÇ≤Â®áËÄåÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏‰∏çÂ∞äÈáçÂ•≥‰∏ª‰∫Ü„ÄÇ‚ÄúÂú®ËøôÈáåÊàëÊâÄËØ¥ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂàáÈÉΩÊòØÁªùÂØπÁöÑÔºåÊé•Âèó‰∏ç‰∫ÜÁöÑËØùÂ∞±Êªö‚ÄùÁ±ª‰ººÁöÑËØù„ÄÇËøòÊúâÈ¶Ü‰∏ªÁà∂‰∫≤‚Äú‰Ω†Â∑≤ÁªèÈ©ØÊúçËøô‰∏™Â•≥‰∫∫‰∫ÜÂêó‚ÄùËøôÁßçËØùÔºåËÆ©ÊàëÊÑüÂà∞Âæà‰∏çÈÄÇ„ÄÇ
4. Â•≥‰∏ªÁöÑÂ°ëÈÄ†Êàë‰∏™‰∫∫‰πüÂæà‰∏çÂñúÊ¨¢ÔºåÂ§™Âº±Â§™Ëá™Âçë‰∫Ü„ÄÇÊØèÊ¨°ÈÅáÂà∞Âç±Èô©ÈÉΩÊòØÊó†Ê≥ïËá™ÊïëÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊúÄÂêéÈÄâÊã©Èó≠‰∏äÁúºÁùõÊîæÂºÉÊäµÊäóÔºåÊØèÊ¨°ÈÉΩÊòØËøôÊ†∑ÔºåÁ≠âÁî∑‰∏ªÊù•Êïë„ÄÇÂ∞±ÊÑüËßâÂ§™Âº±‰∫ÜÔºåÁîöËá≥ÊúâÁÇπË†¢‰∫Ü„ÄÇËÄå‰∏îÁªèÂ∏∏‰ºöËØ¥ ‚ÄùÂÉèÊàëËøôÁßç‰∫∫ÔºåÊÄé‰πàËÉΩÂ§ü‚Äú ËøôÁ±ªËØùÔºåËÆ©‰∫∫ËßâÂæóÊó†Ê≥ïÂ∏¶ÂÖ•„ÄÇ

ÊÄªÁöÑÊù•ËØ¥ÊàëËßâÂæóÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÊãøÊù•Ê∂àÁ£®Êó∂Èó¥ÁöÑÊ∏∏ÊàèÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÁªùÂØπÁß∞‰∏ç‰∏äÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πà‰Ω≥‰Ωú„ÄÇËÄå‰∏îÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÊòØËßÜËßâÂ∞èËØ¥ËäÇË¥≠ÂÖ•ÁöÑËØùÔºåÊàëÂèØËÉΩÁúüÁöÑ‰ºöËÄÉËôëÈÄÄÊ¨æ„ÄÇ I wanted to like this otome. The art is beautiful, especially the background scenes. The story and characters seemed intriguing, but were executed so poorly. Every route was boring and recycled, the romances were not fleshed out. I liked the idea of the character development and plot twists but they were revealed by info dumps at points where I barely cared. The secret route was disgusting. It took me a long time to chug through and finish the game. Fav guys were Yuzuki and Soa I wished their stories were written better. Technical issues are the nightmare. Every 3-5 min it force the program to stop responding. I have to save every choice because you might just get kicked out of the game any second. The story itself is not too bad, the love is just too shallow and come out of nowhere (but I am okay with it because all otome games are like that). while it's certainly not an awful game, it's also not good nor is it worth almost 40 dollars. the characters and general plot are intriguing, but the routes are short and give no time to establish any real romance. if you want something that's short and sweet, but not all that deep or well written, then this is certainly for you and not for me lol If you're a fan of mystery and suspense, 7'scarlet will absolutely captivate you. From the very beginning, this game draws you in with its eerie atmosphere and a plot that keeps you on the edge of your seat. The story is full of twists, and with each new route, you're slowly fed more clues, which encourages you to keep coming back for more. However, despite the intriguing hints, I still found myself stumped as I neared the route‚Äî and that's what makes this game so good. It‚Äôs the kind of mystery that challenges you, making you feel like you're right there with the characters, unraveling the secrets step by step.

What I love most about 7'scarlet is how it keeps the focus on the mystery rather than pushing a romance angle. While there are romantic elements, the heart of the game lies in solving the complex puzzle of what's really going on. This makes the game appealing even for those who aren‚Äôt particularly into romance-heavy narratives.

Each character has their own unique backstory, and you‚Äôll find yourself second-guessing everything, trying to figure out who‚Äôs telling the truth and who might be hiding something sinister. It‚Äôs a perfect game for players who enjoy a good challenge, as each play through brings new discoveries, and the suspense keeps building.

7'scarlet is a brilliant mystery game that masterfully builds tension and suspense, with a story that evolves as you dig deeper. The thrill of uncovering more with each play through, even if you can‚Äôt solve it right away, makes this game a must-play for any mystery lover. I‚Äôve just finished 7‚Äôscarlet, and I think it‚Äôs one of the most captivating otome games I‚Äôve played. This mystery-themed visual novel strikes a delicate balance between suspense and romance, set in the atmospheric, folklore-rich village of Okunezato. While it‚Äôs not without flaws, the overall experience is one I won‚Äôt forget anytime soon.

The plot revolves around Ichiko Hanamaki, who travels to Okunezato to uncover the truth behind her brother‚Äôs disappearance. Each chapter brings a mix of suspense, drama, and intriguing revelations about the village‚Äôs dark secrets. The pacing is spot-on, with every route adding new pieces to the overarching mystery.

What I appreciated most was how the game kept me guessing without feeling overwhelming. Even the true ending‚Äîwhile somewhat predictable‚Äîwas emotional and gripping. While this isn‚Äôt a lighthearted romance, if you enjoy a mix of thrilling mysteries and love stories, 7‚Äôscarlet won‚Äôt disappoint.

The love interests in 7‚Äôscarlet each brought something unique to the table, with their routes offering a mix of suspense, personal growth, and romantic moments. Here‚Äôs a quick breakdown of my impressions (without spoilers!):

Hino: His route feels like a warm-up for the rest of the game. While his romance leans into the classic childhood-friend trope, it‚Äôs lighthearted and amusing. His character‚Äîa mix of sporty and secretly dorky‚Äîadded a fun, endearing vibe to his story.

Isora: If you like your otome with a touch of creepiness, this is the route for you. While his story doesn‚Äôt dive deeply into the overarching mystery, it creates an unsettling atmosphere that left an impression. Isora‚Äôs personality is surprisingly complex, though I wish the game had delved more into his temper and actions rather than leaving them unexplored.

Toa: What a surprise! I started his route with low expectations, but it completely floored me. Toa‚Äôs story is easily one of the highlights of the game‚Äîfull of unexpected twists and emotional depth. His arc caught me off guard in the best way possible, making him my favourite character by far üíñ.

Sosuke: This route had me on the edge of my seat. The suspense builds beautifully, with plenty of intense moments balanced by a romance that feels genuine and well-paced. I loved how both Sosuke and Ichiko grew as characters, and his perfectionist quirks made him more relatable and fun.

Yuzuki: If you‚Äôre after a route that combines drama, action, and romance, Yuzuki‚Äôs story is the whole package. Despite its fast pace, the events never felt forced or overwhelming. His cold, aloof demeanor hides a warm and caring side, making him a compelling character both romantically and within the mystery‚Äôs context.

And what of the protagonist?

Ichiko is a bit of a mixed bag. She‚Äôs determined to find her brother, which drives the story forward, but her recklessness and naivety sometimes made me want to yell at the screen. Still, she had her moments, especially when she got adorably awkward in her romantic interactions. While she‚Äôs not the strongest otome protagonist I‚Äôve seen, she‚Äôs far from the worst‚Äîand her persistence and occasional clumsiness made her endearing enough.

And finally, the art in 7‚Äôscarlet is gorgeous, and the character designs are spot on. The backgrounds capture the eerie vibe of Okunezato perfectly, and the CGs are beautiful. The animations and cutscenes were a nice touch, but the story would‚Äôve been strong even without them.

The music really stands out, setting the tone for both the mystery and the more emotional moments. The voice acting is solid and brings the characters to life.

What I Loved:

- Gripping mystery with excellent pacing.
- Each route adds something unique to the overall story.
- Gorgeous visuals and a great soundtrack.
- Toa‚Äôs route is an absolute masterpiece!

What Could‚Äôve Been Better:

- Some routes and character actions could‚Äôve been fleshed out more.
- The secret route‚Äôs ending felt rushed and underwhelming.
- Ichiko‚Äôs naivety and recklessness could be frustrating at times.

Would I recommend 7‚Äôscarlet? 

Absolutely! If you love mysteries with romantic elements and a touch of suspense, this game is for you. It‚Äôs not perfect, but its unique setting, gripping plot, and memorable characters make it a standout in the otome genre.

Whether you pick it up on sale or at full price, 7‚Äôscarlet is an experience worth having. Just be ready for some emotional twists and turns‚Äîyou‚Äôll get attached to the story and its characters before you know it! While the romance and (most of) the characters weren't all that interesting, the plot was so intriguing that I felt compelled to keep playing. I probably would've finished the game in half the time if it hadn't crashed every fifteen minutes or so. Remember to save often!
