name: Donut County
short_description: Donut County is a story-based physics puzzle game where you play as an ever-growing hole in the ground. Meet cute characters, steal their trash, and throw them in a hole.
reviews: Casual game, great to pass your time, funny story. Donut County is a funny and cozy game where you go around and delivering donuts to customers. The game and story is short, but worthwhile. If you like Katamari, you will feel right at home with this game. The puzzles weren't too difficult, and they were fun to solve. I loved the music very much and it's one of my favorite soundtracks already! I really enjoyed it! Ryan said I would like this game.  Ryan said it was really good.  Ryan is always right. <3 raccacoonie is that you cute game CUTE FUN AND QUICK!!! Cute, fun, indie... with achievements Great game! I'm not recommending it to anyone until they add a goddamn SKIP BUTTON and CHOOSE LEVEL feature. This game is total BS, especially the boss levels.  This is supposed to be a chill game and it is not and it cheats. DO NOT GET SUCKED INTO BUYING IT. Funny dialogue (though there is quite a lot of it and you can't easily skip much) and a real satisfying feeling when you consume all the stuff.

name: Flight of the Amazon Queen: 25th Anniversary Edition
short_description: The year is 1949 and you assume the role of Joe King, a pilot for hire who will embark on a quest to rescue a kidnapped princess and in the process, encounter a dangerous temple, fearsome Amazonian warriors, and a powerful mad scientist intent on taking over the world!
reviews:
interesting game If you enjoy adventure games with gentle, off-beat humour, then I am sure you will enjoy Flight of the Amazon Queen. Classic Adventure game, played this back in the  90`s and was fun to replay. Puzzles are for the most part straightforward tho towards the end can be hard without a walkthru on certain parts. The remaster has some issues but can be navigated by reading the forum. after the update all my saved files are lost... Great game, brings back memories from when i was a young boy.
Completed game and crashed after it said "The End" after all the credits and the blimp going into the sunset. Maybe this is due to an emulator or virtual machine problem...? Hopefully it recorded the completion. Great Game enjoyed it. Played this many moons ago and could never finish it for some reason! A decent point&click with plenty of tongue in cheek humor and puns. Look no further than the protagonist's name. An underrated gem from the past. The controls were a little iffy, especially when scrolling on the item wheel, but if you can get through that, you'll have an enjoyable experience. Maybe someday we will see a sequel! It wants to be a parody of/tribute to LucasArts adventure games. It does it's job, but it's still pretty boring compared to the actual LucasArts games. Absolutely LOVE it! [list]
[*]Cozy
[*]Nice music
[*]Interesting story
[*]There is always the ScummVM-edition if you do not like the new edition.
[/list]

name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth
short_description: A companion app for The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth board game from Fantasy Flight Games, a fully-cooperative board game for one to five players! This companion app dictates the setup of each encounter, tracks your party‚Äôs inventory and skills, and resolves combat while you brave the looming forests, quiet clearings, and...
reviews: Best app driven board game The system as whole is completely immersive. I HIGHLY Recommend SLEEVING the cards!!! They take on wear and tear from so much shuffling! Innovative approach to cooperative adventure/rpg in a board game. Another winner from FFG.

name: BootyBuns & 21
short_description: Play a simple version of the card game 21 with your sisters best friend. But when you start winning and she starts offering you her clothes to buy back in, what do you do?
reviews:
This game is good and fun but I feel like she gets too many favor game simple as "cheat" she almost often gets an 20, one point high than what I have, often draw, almost never been random numbers on its own. No matter I tried, there is no way she get almost perfect numbers in every turns, but I feel like it been cheating. Meh First of all, the opponent's hair style is hideous. 
It's about 80% waiting, and 20% actually playing.
Long gaps between draws are annoying, and a major pacing issue.

The terms "stick" and "card" show a complete lack of understanding of the game.
There is no double down, there is no split, and there is no insurance.

If the opponent has 21, it still let's you contemplate your moves even though you are doomed to lose.

This game has a long ways to go, and as it stand currently, I cannot recommend this dumpster fire joke of Blackjack. It's pretty bad. 
There are two reasons one would play this sort of game. The 21 and the boobs.
The game really fails pretty spectacularly at both.

The 21 is lackluster and your opponent hits or stays very predictably. 
The boobs lack variety and the girls face is pretty horrid.

It's only real value is as a gag gift for freind. Terrible Simple game. needs more girl choose.  lots of wiggling :) Okay, it`s a simple enought set up. you are going over to play some cards against a friend of your sister and apperantly she got a little crush on you. ( how sweet isn't that ^^) and it is a straight forward try to get the highest number but do not surpass the number 21 in value of the cards, while place a few small bets to make it more interesting.
sometimes when she smiles she can look a little creepy cause of the graphics and sometimes shes just a tease. XD

how ever there are a few things that I may think could be done something with.

Suggestions:

- Setings, I wish there was a adjustable volumbar so I could lower the music or mute it completly incase I want to listen to my own music instead. ( and the one melody going on over and over can grow tiersome)

- A saving option while in a game. ( So I could get back online and continue where I left off last time I saved)

- Redo the beting ingame, cause it's to much of a shot in the dark to bet before you get your first two cards. Maybe instead have like a small blind before the cards are dealt that both chip in 10 credits and then after you get your first two cards then you could raise that bet from the 10 you already chipped in to 20-50 credits. makes it possible to try and bluff that you got greater card's then you actually got and maybe trick her to fold or draw one to many card's herself. ( would give a more feel of in control while playing the game. and would help if you get to high cards and bluff her to get to high cards herself and get it at a draw.)

- And perhaps change the equality of cards in the hands like: She got 2 cards in her hand and it adds up to 19 and you draw and get 3-4 cards in your hand and get 19, at this point its a draw in the game but since she has less cards that adds up to the same number then she get the win because that she use less cards to get the high number. ( and the other way around ofcourse ^^)

All in all it ain't a bad game and I would recommend it to my friends. You can have lots of fun trying to unlock all of the unlockable outfits and gallery, if you got the time to play a single match in one go. I'm looking forward to see what future updates might bring and do hope more will give this game a try. 

A Fun card game with good company, do one need to say anymore? ;D EHH!! I enjoyed this game about booty and 21. The female character model's face is a little scary with some of her facial expressions, but she has a hot body which was entertaining enough for my tastes. One suggestion in a future update would be a button to quit to the desktop.

name: We Are Open
short_description: We Are Open is a shopping simulator game, that makes you rely on your memory and skills to successfully help everyone complete their shopping lists. Can you beat the rival AI? The stocks are randomly generated, so demands change up each round as well. And guess what? The shops swap their places too!
reviews:
I had a fun time playing the game :)

I love how you have interesting abilities, makes it much more exciting! I like to chill as well while the AI is set to the minimum speed haha!

Can't wait to see what this game will have to offer in the future. Good luck! The game concept is interesting but 
1) it's a little too messy with multiple people with the shopping lists around all at once, gets a little overwhelming tbh
2) those people move around a lot so even after you get the item, they have moved to the other floor and you have to go find them again lol, a little annoying ngl
3) the AI obviously knows where all the stuff are so it's like impossible to try and compete with it at all really
4) each item for each person can only be fulfilled once by you or the bot so it's kinda frustrating that you scramble to find the item only to return and see that the bot had already gave it to the person lol
5) not sure if it's a bug but when you and the guy with the shopping list is on the escalator, you can't see their list clearly
6) I feel it would be a better game if it has a career/story mode where you have to find a list of items within a very short amount of time like maybe 1-2mins to complete the level or being able to compete against friends/other people or like some shopping simulator with different levels/story 

Hope my honest feedback will help develop the game! (:

name: Hul√¨ The Mage
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Early Access
short_description: Are you looking for a game both relaxing and adrenalinic? A weird plot with lots of NPCs and monsters to slay? Then, this is the game you are looking for. Beware! Do not get fooled by the nice and happy graphics, it is not as easy as you may think.
reviews:
bought this game because i missed the free key from your 9gag post, lol

i play this game on 1680x1050 monitor (i know, it's not your usual monitor resolution). if i play on fullscreen, the screen will be cropped, left and right part is missing. so i played on windowed mode, smaller resolution. it would be great if the game support not only 16:9 scale but also other scale like 16:10 or maybe older 4:3 monitor.

next, it would be better if we can use ESC key as "back" button instead of clicking X button on the screen

character movement is responsive, no input lag or i just don't feel it at all

slow and curved ranged attack insist you to calculate it's projectile movement. these increased the difficulty and become more challenging for people who usually plays game, but i think it would be a little bit too difficult for casual gamer. well it depends on your market target.

PC Spec: Xeon E3-1270 V2 (IvyBridge), RX 480 8GB, 16GB RAM. using epic setting.
about >75fps on tutorial area, and drops about 60 on the area after that. >180fps on trader area.

i think this game have a great prospect in the future. i love the low-poly models and the world design.
still haven't played for long because I have to get back to my work (will try to play again later)

wish you all the best in developing this game, cheers!
*sorry for my bad english It's not a bad premise but attacking using the controller didn't work and the maze is incredibly frustrating: insta kill traps and a requirement that you start from the beginning each time. It might get better through early access.

https://youtu.be/hawXTM1wAkk

name: Winning Putt: Golf Online
genres: Free To Play, Massively Multiplayer, Simulation, Sports
short_description: Join the ultimate free-to-play PC golf experience. Perfect your golf game across ten beautiful courses. Play with friends worldwide anytime, anywhere.
reviews:
the ground is superb white Haha nah this game can fuck right off hey. Absolutely stupid piece of crap. Graphics are great, swing meter is pretty good (resolution of swing is too low). The courses are are very nice looking and other players are great so far. Ive played this about a month now have a level 19 power player and a 20 accuracy player. Here is the whats not so great. Accuracy players have it way easier the punishment for running out of mentality as a power player is so bad that your either buying tons of mentality drinks or your round is done the meter moves like lightning. The physics need alot of work yet. Sometimes the wind seems random as to if it will effect the ball flight or not. Bunker shots are a joke most of the time. You can wing a full meter and go 2 ft even with a straight swing. The greens are definately more along the lines of putt putt vs golf. There are holes in middle of hills down in pits in the green and some greens the shot can have 3 breaks and a downhill so bad a full swing meter wont get you there. I really like this game and I want it to be the next big online golf game but its not there yet. I would like to see them really study the courses and fix geometry and physics issues like hole 10 or 11 on Seven Angels if you land just at the top of the hill before the first water trap all the shots go straight down into the water reguardless of club. I had to pitch backwards and redo the shot. I would like to see better servers as the lag effects the swing meter as well as the group play we see alot of disconnects and game pauses from players being dropped. I have done my part to support the dev I spent roughly 250$ on this game so far seeing if the premium stuff made it better. To be honest it almost makes it playable the clubs are able to go longer distances with better accuracy if you dont hit the perfect shot. Nice game! The golf aspects of this game are mediocre at best. The game takes very little skill, and how well you do is entirely based on your stats.

However, where this game really fails is that there is simply no feeling of character progression. In other words, in a game that is entirely based on stats, the gains in stats when you level up are hardly noticeable. Like you would expect after gaining a few levels to be able to go back to a course that was challenging before and now do much better. Unfortunately, that simply is not the case.

Plus there really doesn't seem to be any gear or clubs to ‚Äúsave up‚Äù gold for. There was like 1 shirt in the apparel shop and then some clubs that seemed like a downgrade from the clubs that you got for free from quests.


Edit: To explain my point more.  When you start the game at level1, it is impossible to reach the green in 2 shots on a par4 even on the easiest courses.  Pretty much every par4 hole is:

Shot1: hit the crap out of the ball with the Driver
Shot2: hit the crap out of the ball with the 3W
Shot3: hit the ball onto the green with a wedge
Shot4: 1 putt for par

What you would expect is that you could come back in 15 levels, and now easily be able to make it to the green in 2 swings on the easiest courses.  However instead, the only change is that now your pitch on shot3 is 40 yards instead of 70 yards.

Also, I don't like the fact that if you are in the rough (or worse the sand), there is a totally luck based chance that you next shot goes off in a random direction even if you hit it perfectly (get a ‚Äúnice‚Äù).  Why not make it skill based? Gay tells me to install direct x 9.0...
but i have all direct x up to 11.
shitty game dont download it ...
not worth bullshit
steam why the fuck you add this to free play games..
 Great game This game is fun, but the controls seem to be more suited for someone with a controller Much better shaft gripping and ball whacking experience than offered from any EA golf game! This game is great. It's simple and doesn't require you to be a golf expert in order to play.  
However, it needs  some optimization; It runs poorly on older cpus. Also I want to point out that this game apparently doesn't work at all under 32bits systems even though the game requirements says otherwise.

name: TraumaCore Violence
short_description: TraumaCore Violence is a 2D Action Game with a focus on intense, snappy combat and in-depth movement mechanics; set within the psyche of a woman who has just had her mind snap.
reviews:
this game kicks so much ass holy shit dude holy shit dude it's so cool so awesome and so cool and so awesome high octane chaos. so much flow to the combat and a messed up little story. you'll know if it's for you right away. worth every penny A neat little game about a pretty heavy story topic. The sparse bits of story through the levels is engaging through all the blood and gore splattering the screen. Part of me wants to say that the amount of gore and particles lowering the fps to the point of playing in slow motion is a bit strange, but the other part of me believes it helps manage a lot of the more chaotic fights. Strangely as someone with pretty nasty dyslexia it never really seemed to get in the way of losing the main character through the slurry of giblets, it's crazy how readable the more intense fights get. The final boss was truly sick as fuck and I can just see myself refighting it in the future just because of how fun it is.

For $2.99 it's crazy how much of a deal this game is. it is shockingly good and short and i've replayed it a lot, fun speedrunning game fast paced 2d combat my beloved,,, its such a good game please its 4$ for me, for you americans its probably 2 PLEASE BUY IT ITS SO FUN :D its so close to being a sick game its just too janky at times. idk ive had the game just make me get stuck in a level i already completed so i had to redo it. awsome style and the parrying is cool but can get a little old especialy when you completed a level but you r softlocked so you needa reload last checkpoint. the fighting is rly smooth and tactile but sometimes it dosent let you move when you normaly attack is kinda annoying. its a cool game tho i like it so far :) fun MURDER KILL BLOOOD SHED, ABSOLUTELY TRAUMA CORE VIOLENCE!!!! FDGSAJ: i like how the big confrontation with yourself at the end is set in the :3 void, great game

name: WORDLAND 3
short_description: The continuation of the successful WORDLAND. This game is a mix of puzzles and crosswords. Answer the clues, arrange the pieces and discover the words.
reviews:
By far the most wild and nonsensical crossword hints we've ever seen. The only way I can imagine these were made by hand is if the designer didn't speak English and tried to translate them. Half the puzzles are just frustratingly bad and leave you guessing random words until something fits. Zup! Z gives you 512 achievements in less than 90 minutes of gameplay, but for some reason this enjoyable word game with double the content is "too small" to have the 100% achievements count towards your total. 

Valve is fickle, its judgement is irrational and harsh. 

Still worth playing. Challenging in normal mode [b]wordland 3[/b] is exactly the same as [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/dohi64/recommended/1599690]the first game[/url] and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/dohi64/recommended/1640760]the second[/url], essentially another level pack, so I posted pretty much the same review for it.

it's still a great word game/crossword/tetris hybrid. there are various shapes with letters on a grid and they have to be arranged to form all the words described on the bottom. no diagonals, only left to right or downward, but they don't all have to be connected to each other. in fact, the game accepts layouts that wouldn't fly in a real crossword (e.g. 'sir' horizontally, 'pure' above it vertically, so it's technically 'purei' but it's fine here).

[b]100 levels[/b] unlocked one by one, the [b]3 difficulty levels[/b] control the amount of revealed letters (more on easy, only the first letter on normal, none on hard). there's no indication of any of this in the game, and what will drive achievement people up the wall is playing on hard doesn't unlock easy and normal achievements, so 3 full playthroughs for them, while the rest of us can enjoy playing however we please.

[b]controls are very convenient[/b], left click to pick a piece up, mouse wheel to rotate in either direction, another left click to place. my biggest gripe with the game was the size of the board, lots of tedium when the word was one letter too long and the entire thing had to be moved a tile to the left piece by piece. plenty of space on the screen, not sure why only a small area was used if it's not a lazy mobile port, but the current size is mostly good enough.

the same [b]excellent music and background images[/b] with only a few new pictures. some of them are animated, but a surprising amount is too dark and might interfere with the grid and pieces. they change after every restart or new level, and can be changed manually, and also locked so they stay the same all the way. [b]a gallery of them could be a great reward for completing the game.[/b]

settings-wise all the neccessities are present, separate volume settings, windowed mode with a couple resolution options (there could be a few more), and level selection is also a thing. these are all accessible from the main menu and while playing.

[b]difficulty is all over the place[/b], though it obviously also depends on your vocabulary. still, it's really pleasant overall, and [b]the price to become a citizen of wordland yet again is reasonable[/b]. can't say I approve of [b]releasing not one but two identical sequels within a short time[/b] though. [quote=][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37575318-%25F0%259D%2592%25B8%25F0%259D%2593%258A%25F0%259D%2593%2589%25F0%259D%2591%2592-%25F0%259D%2592%25B6%25F0%259D%2593%2583%25F0%259D%2592%25B9-%25F0%259D%2592%25B8%25F0%259D%2593%258A%25F0%259D/] ‚ô° ùìÖùìÅùëíùí∂ùìàùëí ùí∏ùëúùìÉùìàùíæùíπùëíùìá ùíªùëúùìÅùìÅùëúùìåùíæùìÉùëî ùìÇùìé ùí∏ùìäùìâùëí ùìÅùíæùìâùìâùìÅùëí ùí∏ùìäùìáùí∂ùìâùëúùìá ùìÖùí∂ùëîùëí ‚ô° [/url][/quote]

It's exhausting and relaxing at the same time. Purrrrrr~ ‚ô°

name: Yearning
short_description: This 2D horror game is set in Edo period of Japan. The girl notices that her old sister has disappeared. The girl will look for her and clues of her. What will the girl find in end of the story?
reviews:
Yearnings stylistic choice and sound design is great, but as other reviews point out, its extremely slow. There is no sprint and you have to backtrack many times, even more so if you miss something, and that becomes very tedious.

[b] Horror/Surrealist centered Curator: [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/43071910/] KuriKuration[/url] [/b] I know that a lot of reviews here mentioned the weird English translation and such but for me it doesn't really make the gaming experience worse. The game play is pretty good. Got stuck at how to get to the place to put the flowers for like an hour and eventually got through. The game is not difficult at all but the sound atmosphere is great! Highly recommend to play with a gaming headset to enhance the experience even more. Yes, it's 2D. But it can give you a scare all the same. I really loved the game! The atmosphere was great and I really liked the art style, felt very unique. The lantern's radius also created a lot of suspense as I was exploring and the background sounds and music really added to the suspense and creepy factor in the various locations. I loved theorizing about the story and what everything meant as I went (All of my theories were wrong by the end though haha). 

The English translations could have had better grammar but I still found it easy to understand what everything was trying to say so this wasn't a big deal to me. Using the stairs in the storehouse however can be a bit tough, and it took me a few tries moving back and forth pressing and holding z to get it to work but it eventually did, if anything that would be my only real gripe.

Overall this was a great and very enjoyable experience and I highly recommend it! Good news first, it works out quite well for a horror game.  It has the good old Silent Hill feel of enviroments that are both normal and surreal.  I found the mystery of the plot nice (though I kinda guess the answer early), and more than once it was somewhat fairy tale like.  And the art I quite nice too.

Bad news, I really wish I could run.  Rin's walk is painfuly slow, and you will get to feel that as you explore.  And while the atmosphere is quite good, broken english in dialogue and descriptions tended to make me chuckle a bit more than once.

This game is still worth playing despite this.  The atmosphere is great for a horror game and the story is nice to experence.  While it does feel like horror games are dime a dozen, this game is well worth your time. If you liked Detention, I think you'll like Yearning. There are some definite similarities between the two. The only thing I don't like is that once you make it to a certain point in the game, it's very easy to lose a bunch of progress. I wish they had made that section a little easier to progress through but other than that, it's definitely got great atmosphere and it's a fun little game. I enjoyed what I've played of it so far. 

If you think you're still on the fence go ahead and check out my Youtube series to see if it's something you might be interested in:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TgTuBI-5BvQ&list=PL08FwntTpxPClxiq_tmyd6IKj3ISBYAYJ

name: Please close the doors - soundtrack
short_description: There are a total of 16 tracks (mp3 and waw format) used in "Please close the doors".
reviews: chill and relaxing, perfect for winter period

name: Dark Tales: Edgar Allan Poe's The Gold Bug Collector's Edition
short_description: Dupin needs your help!
reviews:
[h1]Too short, and too simple for most of us adults, but it might be fine for kids.[/h1]

For such a lame HOG to bear the name of Edgar Allan Poe is a travesty. There is hardly any complexity that you might assume would come with it - the first part of the game has no backtracking, there are no collectables, no achievements, no card drops ergo no badges, and the puzzles are laughable.

So there are a few hidden scenes (messes with a list of what to find) and a few deductive reasoning scenes (where you follow a domino effect to eventually end up with one item, but everything you find, you use to get that item). But some of these... whew! One that stood out for me as ridiculous was somehow pulling up a boat buried in a lake in a cave, and thoroughly searching it, so as to open an age-old chest to get... a pickaxe! What in tarnation!

There are a few puzzles that might give you cause to stop and think but let me just add that my total play time includes going away from keyboard to get dinner and look after our pet bird, so I'm guessing the average hogger will finish in around the same time as me.

However I didn't even bother with the bonus chapter, such was my distaste for the whole experience.


I have another of these 'Edgar Allan Poe' titles in my backlog... I'm really not looking forward to it.

Also, be ready for your game to crash a few times at random due to runtime errors. Crashed three times but I did manage to complete the main game. Story is average, locks are rather nonsensical and hitboxes are small with some of the HOG items being named oddly (ex. "cone" for a pine cone.) Voice acting is the highlight, but because it's so badly recorded it's funny. A few of the voiced characters sound like they're locked in basements. The voice actors themselves did 110% acting, to the point that I laughed multiple times and grinned a lot listening to them. I would fully recommend the game if not for the crashing issue. The plot about treasure hunt isn't nearly as interesting as the series' usual forray into murders, but the gameplay makes up for that.

8/10 Good puzzles, not so hard that you have to ask for hints all of the time.  Fun! This series seems to follow the plots of Edgar Allen Poe‚Äôs stories. Of course, with you and a Detective involved. In this one you have to save/protect a man who believes he has uncovered the location of Captain Kidd‚Äôs treasure.

HO scenes are fun, minigames challenging, and the plot engaging. Recommend in the bundle, just for ease of purchase.
 Pretty average and it stopped working three times displaying "runtime error" I have always been a fan of Edgar Allan Poe Stories, It is very difficult at this time with the pandemic to take your mind of the worries of each day. I am 49 years old and take comfort that there is games that have a story and puzzles and easy to hard difficulties. For those adult gamers it is worth paying for some break from reality A reluctant thumbs-up. It was too short for the price (8.99 US). But overall a decent game. The mini-games were more varied and better than I normally find with Artifax Mundi. I am not one that cares about story too much, but this story was a bit below average, I would say. I still rate this a bit higher than many of the Artifax Mundi games, though. I just love the series and what they made with E.A.Poes Stories.
This one is rather short and the puzzles are quite easy, but artwork and story are really good.
The only problem for me is, that it really crashes a lot (but I never lost progress).
I would recommend grabbing it on sale (because of the crashes and its shortness). Fantastic, fun game. 10/10
Definitely recommend this one.

- Love the continuous puzzles all the way through. 
- Great mix of puzzle styles from easy to hard.
- Gorgeous old world Kinkade style graphics. 
- Nice music & voice acting.
- You get a dog!

Total of 4 hours playtime and the bonus chapter is a direct continuation of the story.

name: Radical Rabbit Stew
short_description: Radical Rabbit Stew is a hare-raising action-arcade game, featuring fast-paced whack-a-rabbit gameplay, scintillating puzzles, super-sized boss fights, juicy pixel graphics and a sizzling soundtrack, perfect for new players and 16-bit retro fans alike!
reviews:
There's a lot of content for the 2 euro i paid for this.
The gameplay is pretty solid, the puzzles are engaging, the story is pretty well written, the abilities you get are great, and the bunnies must be stewed. The boss fights are very frantic and they test your agility and quick thinking, but they are never unfair.
It's a very good puzzle game, and I saw it has multiplayer, which I haven't played :o fun. The game is fun and the puzzles are good enough but the stock and memey sound effects are incredibly annoying if you can get past that it's a fun game to kill some time This game is pure old school brilliance. It says a lot that I absolutely loved it because I tend to hate when video games make me wait, mechanics like waiting for moving platforms to return are really annoying, and Radical Rabbit Stew's main concept is all about waiting and timing: You start with only a simple wooden spoon, and you must hit rabbits into pots as they walk around to win each level. Yet, it is a joy to interact with these simple mechanics, it never takes too long for the rabbits to line up or for you to have an AHA moment and hit them in a way that mostly automates the rest of the path as it interacts with all sorts of mechanics on the way to its final, stewey destination.

The controls are tight and the game gives you plenty of space to get used with the mechanics you have before introducing new ones, there are new enemy types and gimmicks almost every other couple of levels but the level gimmicks never feel TOO gimmicky, like you're playing a completely different game or a mini-game, oh no, the gimmicks are all properly intergrated with the game and all gel together with the main objective of sending rabbits into pots or breaking apart blocks that stop you from putting them into pots. In that way, it feels like a more puzzly, timing based approach to Bomberman, though there are both levels that favor action and speed while some are purely puzzles, the fact they both work so well is incredible, there is not a single bad or annoying level in the whole game. And it would be a giant mistake to not mention each world has a mini-boss battle and an overall area boss, all super fun to fight, all different enough to be separately enjoyable, the main game might clock in at just about 3 hours long, but it is a creativity filled 3 hours long that wraps up when the ideas of the devs probably wrapped up as well, which is a good thing, more developers could learn from that.

Surprisingly, in spite of being based on old school games, with the music and the graphics recalling the greats from the SNES/PC-Engine era, this one is really approachable in terms of difficulty, there is a hardcore mode for a more old school challenge, but more casual gamers shouldn't skip this one either, if you have any interest in simple, arcade-like gameplay loops with no frills that simply try to be fun from the word GO, you own it to yourself to try out Radical Rabbit Stew. Worth it for the soundtrack alone. A friend of mine said it's a good game, slept on possibly. This game needs way way more attention Still haven't figured out how this is supposed to help me cook stew, I wasn't sure what to expect from this game mechanically, but it turned out to be a level-based top-down action game where your goal is to whack rabbits and send them flying into pots using bouncers on the walls and other stuff. You get some new abilities throughout that are used in some mild puzzle aspects. I wish there was a little more of that, but it's not really what the game is going for, so whatever. It's a solid little game that's fast-paced and doesn't waste your time, and the bombastic animation and music get you pumped. Some of the levels get kinda irritating in certain spots, but nothing too bad. I finished it in about 4 hours, and that's with exploring around a little to find the optional collectibles. It would probably be pretty fun to speedrun if you're into that. There's also a level editor included that seems pretty easy to use. Thumbs up. Excellent game however waaay to short unless you subscribe to player made levels from the workshop which is very limited. Can we get a Radical Rabbit Stew 2 or a DLC? I recommend purchasing this on sale. The levels are creative and the mechanics are a ton of fun!

name: Melancholy Date
short_description: Have you ever felt like you were drowning in sadness, and the only way to stay afloat was to hold onto someone else's hand? Melancholy Date is the story of my journey through depression, and the search for love amidst the melancholy.
reviews:
Game play is a re-hash of the developers previous match three games (which I knew when I purchased it). However, the game makes no sense. Where in the other games, you get rewarded by lewd renders after each level, here you just get a render that doesn't make sense. That could be ok, if the game would deal with melancholy and depression in a serious manner, but instead it just has a "have you tried not being depressed" approach, which I find quite scandalous for such a serious topic. Apart from this appalling approach to depression, the game still have some nudity in it. For some reason, the main character suddenly gets nude if you score enough points. This is in line with the other games from the developer, but complete inappropriate if the setting is supposed to deal with depression in a serious manner.
All in all, the game fails as a lewd games and as a serious game whichever it tries to be.

name: Sharknado VR (Arcade Edition)
short_description: Sharknado VR (Arcade Version) puts you in the middle of the action - use a variety of weapons to battle the terrifying Sharknado. Maim, shoot and explode your way through hordes of hungry flying sharks and other airborne sea creatures in Sharknado VR!
reviews:
[h1]‚ÄúBought a bag of venom and I wish I
Really, really, really didn't~ üé∂‚Äù
~[i]Yoda ([url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Xl0Qr0uXuY]Bad Lip Reading[/url])[/i][/h1]

So... a [b]VR[/b] game for... [b]$0.99[/b]? Huh. Based on popular b-movie series with [b]Ian Ziering[/b] too. There must be a catch. Right? I mean, a good [b]VR[/b] game can't cost less than a buck. It just can't. Sure, it's not like the original [b]Sharknado VR[/b] was a good game to begin with. Exactly the opposite. It's was a mess. Feel free to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/letande/recommended/925090/ ]check out my detailed review[/url] if you want details, but long story short ‚Äì it was a very basic shooting gallery, in which you were supposed to shoot sharks, while avoiding (or destroying) everything else that used to fly at you. Doesn't sound that bad, but the problem is ‚Äì it was [i]ridiculously[/i] cheap and half-broken game. It was all about half-broken controls and terrible physics, thanks to which it was hard to even tell what did just hit you. It was pretty short too and only had four levels. So, da f*ck is this ‚Äúarcade edition‚Äù and why is it so cheap?
 
Well, the thing is... it's a scam. Simple like that. ‚Äú[b]Arcade Edition[/b]‚Äù of [b]Sharknado VR[/b] is just a demo. There's only one level here ([b]LA[/b], the first level from the full game), all the weapons are unlocked since very beginning and there's no way to upgrade them. It looks like our usual demo, it feels like our usual demo and, well, it [i]is[/i] our usual demo. There's literally nothing else to say. It's just a demo of a very, [i]very[/i] bad game. Nothing else here and even that cheesy intro wasn't included. So, here's the question ‚Äì why? No, seriously, why? It's not like I'm angry about wasting a buck (pretty sure I can afford that, lol), it's just... When somebody tries to scam you for a single buck? Guess, it says something about 'em. Shame on you, [b]Autumn VR[/b]. Then again, some people just don't care about their bad reputation. One way or another, don't you even think paying for this. Even though it costs only one buck, it still doesn't worth it. Dixi. chainsaw op i dont have a vr headset There is only one level and it lasts for 5 minutes. The original version of the game has multiple levels and I assumed this was an arcade-ified version of that game but it's just one level and you start with all the weapons. Not even worth the $1. Just get the original version on sale instead. If you go into ‚ÄòSharknado VR (Arcade Edition)‚Äô looking for a game that is just as terribly made as the movies you should get what you are expecting. While the only difference I can see between the original game and this new ‚ÄúArcade Edition‚Äù is all the weapons being unlocked, the rest seems like the same game. It‚Äôs an action shooter that sees you shooting sharks that are flying towards you from a tornado with a range of weapons, most of which run out of ammo pretty quickly. It‚Äôs windy, post-apocalyptic and the graphics are OK at best. Gameplay-wise the game will leave you questioning ‚ÄòIs this game bad because it is supposed to be a terrible game on a shoestring budget just like the movies? Or is it bad because it was made badly? ‚Äò For just ¬£0.79 it‚Äôs worth a look, but the answer to that question is Yes, in both ways. If I could give it a neutral rating I would have, but it did make me laugh with how sh1t it was, so I gave it the thumbs up.

name: Beat Saber - Muzzy - "Feeling Stronger (feat. Charlotte Colley)"
short_description: Get track "Feeling Stronger (feat. Charlotte Colley)" by Muzzy, slash the beats and show the world how you are rocking it in Beat Saber. This track is part of Monstercat Music Pack Vol. 1.
reviews:
Good song but hard, expert, and expert plus beat maps are atrociously lazy and not fun. The rocket league pack is MUCH better.  @Beat Games!!! get someone competent to remap these terrible maps! Disgusting. pretty shitty and unfun bad This isn't even the actual song, this is the remix by High Maintenance. The beatmaps in this DLC don't seem as good as the original game. (This is on expert)

The beatmaps in the original game flow much better and "feel good" when you hit the notes correctly. 

In the DLC most songs have multiple sections that don't flow well and don't "feel good" to play.

The original maps felt challenging. Most of these maps feel annoying. (Note: I have completed all the original songs on Expert) I enjoy the whole pack!  Each map feels unique and the music gets more enjoyable the more I play. This bundle is complete shit. The only song worth considering in the entire Monstercat Music Pack is ‚ÄúOverkill‚Äù. Even that song sucks, but it‚Äôs the only one that actually felt like I was playing on Expert+ difficulty. All of these songs are terrible choices for this game, and the flow and sync make me think that the Beat Saber devs brought in their D Team to map these ones. I mean really, the songs from the base game are so good, but these feel like they were either sourced from someone who lacks any kind of rhythm, or they were rushed as a cash grab. Either way‚Ä¶ avoid. gg Actual generic music, won't make your ears bleed. Thank you.

name: The Gap
short_description: The Gap is a short first-person horror experience taking place in a ghostly abandoned house on a lonely street corner.
reviews:
You are a father looking for  your daughter who has been trapped in a house. You arrive at the house and have to wander around hoping random jump scares trigger. Not much to the story and then suddenly the game is over. There isn't any dialogue beyond the introduction plot dump.

PROS:
* Couple of good jump scares
* Decent spooky atmosphere
* Creepy entities
* Simplistic M&K controls

CONS:
* Hard to see. You have to turn on all the lights in the house, but even sometimes it's a bit too dark to see
* Not fully sure what triggers the jump scares or story progression, so you're wandering around not knowing what to do
* Only things you can interact with are doors, light switches and the TV
* No Controller support
* Story is lack luster
* Very short game (it just kinda ended)

https://www.seravium.com
https://twitch.tv/seravium good game I finished this game in 45 minutes about a month and 2 weeks ago, and I honestly don't even remember it. Even watching, or skimming through a playthrough doesn't ring many bells. Obviously a forgettable game, but must have been decent or I would give it a negative rating after I finished it. It looks nice. That's all I can really say. Some of the scares are ok. The story, what little is there, makes no sense. No task to do 
stupid jump scare 
repeated story 

is sooo bad I actually did not mind this game. It wasn't bad of a game, but I felt like there could of been more added to it. It did get me a good amount of times. Yes, but wait for sale.
https://channel13horror.com/2023/06/11/the-gap/ Very good short horror game. Worth the money.
A solid buy for me. That was quite cool! üòéüëç good short horror game

reviews: :( Scam Alright. I am a fan of this game, but there are useless dlc in here that should have been in the game already than seperated. This dlc you will over look and not even remember that you bought it. It feels useless and in game you will keep forgeting it even exist. You will most likly never pay attention to the unit's look. Why do we have to pay for this separately? A nice add on for flavor. Not the best unit DLC, but still incredible for fans of zooming right into the map and really taking the battles in. they look Persian

name: Dark Deity 2
short_description: Verroa is a peaceful continent on the brink of war as the Asverellian Empire seeks to expand - at your homeland‚Äôs expense. Command unlikely heroes, fight challenging turn-based battles, and watch hardship forge iron into steel. Dark Deity is back, bigger and better than before!
reviews:
Probably the closest I've ever been to reliving the old Fire Emblem Blazing Sword days. The combat is great, the sprites are amazing, and the story is pretty good. I loved the voice acting (the cast is quite stacked as well, surprisingly), and the characters were pretty interesting (they still have their issues, but I cut the devs some slack on this considering how well-done most of the rest of the game was). 

Also Eve is broken asf :p. 

The customization in this game is actually a lot more intense than I was expecting. You have rings, elixirs, weapons, runes, bonds, classes, promotions...there's a lot to get to and some you won't get to in a single playthrough. I don't think I even managed to read what every single ring did by the time I finished the game.

 A step-up from the original; lots of unit customisation evokes a game that promotes gameplay diversity and replay-ability. Overall good game. Rush through the game for the story and will do another playthrough.

Story is ok. Just ok.

Cant stand the MC. Too much whining. TLDR: Give them your money already.
If you like turn-based tactics games, more specifically Fire Emblem, I recommend this! Character build customization is excellent and interesting. It's very entertaining to experiment with different classes, weapons, and rings. This is a game that welcomes and challenges you to break the game. The art and voice acting are exceptional, especially considering this game is only 25 dollars! If you like retro graphics, this game is a no-brainer. It has a solid amount of content and plenty of difficulties and campaign modifiers for additional playthroughs.  This was a massive improvement from the first game, and I did not expect it to be this good. They also did a great job with the main cast. I find all the central characters to be likable and I enjoyed most scenes they were present in.

This game was great, but I will leave some notes on things I was less fond of. None of these things ruined my experience, and I leave these here only for constructive criticism:
- Deity difficulty was a lot easier than I expected. I try not to play games on the hardest difficulty on the first playthrough, but with this game I should have.
- I think the class system needed a tutorial around the time you get your first ingot. I didn't realize you kept your tier 1 skills when you promote. I couldn't find a way to change your tier 1 class after promoting, so I really nerfed some of my characters this way. I think with a short explanation this would not be a problem at all. In fact I think it's a great system.
- I think certain characters might break the game too fast. While it is really fun to use those characters, their pure strength also removed a lot of strategy and planning from maps. Notably, though this is a criticism, I loved that the main characters were actually good.

This game was fantastic. Thank you so much for making. I'm looking forward to more. Did i want a immersive story. check. voice acting characters. check. captivating narrative with simple yet fun combat. check. disclaimer, deity, random level ups, turn timers on for half of the game (i had them off at first and turned them on)

almost finished up with the game at this point, i'm not sure if i'd recommend it (there's no mixed option) it's close for sure. The concept and the first ~15-20 chapters are actually pretty good. I really liked the abilities and the super deep customization in the onset, having mana and unique personals that are really impactful made each character feel different gameplay-wise. I spent legitimate hours trying to plan out how i wanted to build certain characters and what rings to equip them with. awesome stuff there.

i'd say it falls apart pretty quickly in that chapter 20+ area, once you get the advanced classes (25+) it's pretty clear some classes are just ridiculous compared to others, and mastery based units are SIGNIFICANTLY stronger than others for the most part. Only exception there is eve. The entire warrior/vanguard line is borderline useless and it's really discouraging seeing such large gaps between characters, you're probably better off running many multiples of the same class rather than speccing out each character based on their skillsets

also so many of the late joiners are terrible. The two orcs especially, they're understated and underleveled, and you'd have to reinvest ability level ups

pros:
-fire emblem
-skill tree customization
-weapon customization
-decent level design (non Fog)
-side objectives, challenge missions are all super fun
-customizable in difficulty and randomization!


cons:
-writing / too much dialogue, i just dont get invested enough
-class/character balance
-abilities being too strong makes you feel detached from combat (no counter attack, no dodging, penetrates resistances)

pick it up on sale or if you really like the genre Didn't have to do a FE three houses waifu simulator to upgrade my units. 10/10 Good It scratches that Fire Emblem itch for me. Or it scratched at least 90% of it. Definitely a big recommend from this gamer if that's your thing. 

My one complaint would be that the enemies need more special effects or ability to have higher stats (crit/etc) to make it more challenging (and fyi the plot is VERY cookie cutter but I'm not really here for that). Everything else is great. Voice acting really stands out in some scenes but I found some story sections had too much dialogue. I played Dark Deity 1 recently and really enjoyed it, so decided to get this one as soon as it released. This game made many improvements and while the weapon system is completely changed, most other systems were expanded and units gained abilities that could be used in combat. Overall it is a larger game than the first with more scenarios and extra optional challenges. I really enjoyed it and will be looking forward to any more future games.

name: Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword
short_description: Sid Meier's Civilization IV¬Æ: Beyond the Sword is the second expansion pack for Civilization IV - the 2005 PC Game of the Year that has become a worldwide hit.
reviews:
addictive and fun. Epic FAULTLESS GAME Sometimes new isn't better. This game is turn based so it's pretty relaxing to play. But the depth of it is seemly endless. Strategic fun while learning about history. My favorite game of all time. I feel civ 5 doesn't compare either. best civ by far Fun 
 Only the best PC game known to man. Great old game, just can't play anymore after I upgraded software. This *review* ONLY applies to the mac version of the game and its technical state - mostly.

The game feels like a pile of abandonware: it uses twice the disk space it specifies, crashes to the desktop frequently, is buggy and has texture lags. 

Pro for this game is the great number of mods available that do away with some of its most infantile parts, however, over half of those mods do not load or make the game crash. The ones that do load run poorly at best.

If you never change your underwear and if you like your pizza better with lots of cholesterol, your coke with extra sugar and you refuse to quit smoking because you know a really, really old smoker who's healthy as a fish: this is your game. Oh, and you have to think John Wayne (?!?) is a cool dude with a great sense of humor.

 More difficult than "vanilla" Civ IV, Beyond the Sword is a great expansion pack for people who enjoy Civ IV but find themselves wanting more. 
In "vanilla" Civ IV, espionage is very limited. For example, I mostly use spies in vanilla Civ IV to scout enemy territory and evade ambushes from their units. In BtS, espionage has been expanded with great attention to detail. I am still only scratching the surface of the possibilities of espionage in BtS because it's an entirely new and complex game concept that I'm having to navigate while also doing all the usual world building stuff in Civ. 
I welcome any comments and insights from other players, I know this game is practically antique now so the few of us still playing are becoming a little thin on the ground!

name: StratoBash
short_description: Be a contestant on StratoBash! Race up the floating islands along the stratosphere, bashing off Eyeoids, solving puzzles & more to score. Use VR controllers to throw Bashers, or play with a mouse & keyboard.
reviews:
I wish it supported Rift and Touch :(

UPDATE: it does play on Rift/Touch, I just had to add -force-d3d11 in the launch options. Great game! Well now... this is certainly a strange one.  Now, I've been a fan of Phr00t's games for a long time now, and have played most of them.  Going into any of them, I know to expect some surreal procedural weirdness, which is something that I really like but that most developers dont seem fond of doing (which is a shame).  I can think of only a few that are willing to make this sort of thing.  Phr00t though is one of them, and this game doesnt break the trend of creative bizarrity.

How do I even describe this one?  Okay.  So, think of Smash Bros, right?  Nintendo's wild fighting game, where instead of smacking your opponent until they pass out, you try to knock them off the stage to score a KO.  Well, it's like that, except in first person, and you punch eyeballs, except instead of punching you sorta throw rocks kinda?  And it's all procedural and you have an inventory.  Sometimes there's a boss or you solve a riddle, because why not.

The game does a good job of explaining the basics.  Your only true goal is to ascend, clearing 30 levels to end the run.  However you're also after a high score here, but how you go about things is up to you.  Each floor has portals that lead to the next one, but the portal activator has some sort of condition.  Maybe you have to find a star in a crate, or maybe you have to knock at least 5 weirdos off the stage.  Whatever it is, you'll traverse astonishingly strange landscapes in your pursuit of that goal.  Most levels are combat levels, but some will involve friendly eyes that give hints as to some sort of riddle, and you solve that instead.

Traversing the different levels is an experience, that's for sure.  These places sure arent boring, being a huge tangle of ramps, floating platforms, jump pads, and so on.  Phr00t's games, in my opinion, have always been very good at creating levels/worlds that I actually like exploring, and this game does that too.  However, it really takes some getting used to.  At first you can expect to be VERY confused and get lost easily.  After awhile, you'll get the hang of it though.  To help you out, these little green signs are posted everywhere, pointing in the direction of various things.  Learn to pay attention to those and your progress will get much easier.  

Each level will be populated with lots of eyeball dudes.  While sometimes they will fight each other, they will prioritize you if they spot you.  As is typical of games from this developer, they can attack from a seriously extreme range.  These arent enemies that have limited vision range.  The more damage you take, the further you'll be knocked back when you get hit, and the same with the eyeball guys.  You can tell how damaged they are by the fact that they get more and more red as you hit them, so it's easy to keep track of how much damage you've done, and to which enemies.   These guys are everywhere, and you're never safe.  What's more, some of them can cast nasty status effects, giving you all the more reason to learn to dodge them.  

Fortunately, that's not all there is in each level.  All sorts of things are there for you to find.  You have health recharge stations, and a station to undo status effects on each level... so pure attrition isnt going to kill you.  Getting a bit beat up early in the game cant ruin your entire run, which is good.  Items of all sorts can be found lying around too.  You have an inventory and can hold many of them at once (easily accessed with the mouse wheel).  There's all sorts of weapons, potions, passive effects, and so on.  These often have some randomization applied to them, so you never quite know what you'll get, particularly with weapons.  Whenever you fall to your doom, you'll respawn with full health, but you'll lose a random item out of your inventory.

Interestingly, there is no true lose condition.  This seems a bit strange to me, but it works out in the end.  You decide when you think you've lost.  If you've lost enough items that you just feel you're too weak to get further, that's a time to quit.  If you feel you can persist and overcome, you can do so.  It's an odd design decision, but one that I've seen before.

The difficulty overall is pretty high.  Enemies are aggressive, with fast shots that arent so easy to dodge.  Defending yourself isnt just about dodging, but also positioning and angles, so that when you do get hit, you're less likely to end up falling.  Like everything else in the game, combat takes alot of getting used to.  Fortunately there are no issues with the controls or anything.... mostly.  The ONE major thing that bugs me about the game:  There's no settings for mouse sensitivity.  It's not THAT big of a deal really, and doesnt stop my enjoyment of the game, but it's still annoying.  The one other, less major thing that bugs me is the portals.  Portals that go to the next level, and portals that go to the previous one, look exactly the same, except for the beam that shoots out of them.  It's easy to accidentally wander into the wrong portal if you're not paying attention to that beam.  It's a fairly minor issue to be honest... it mostly stopped happening for me after about 20 minutes, but it was still annoying.

Overall, this is a fairly simple and easy to understand game compared to some of the other ones.  It's not like the X089 series where there's a zillion stats and a gigantic workd to deal with.  This is a much more arcadey affair, not a gigantic adventure like those are. However, it does have the same "feel" that Phr00t's games usually do, if that makes sense. And again, this is fantastically strange... there just isnt anything else that plays like this, and there isnt much else that looks like it either.  As such, it's a very niche game.  You might really like it, or you might really hate it.  I personally quite like it, it's definitely my sort of thing, even if it can be frustrating at times.  I find myself coming back to this developer's games fairly often (particularly as they work on my junky other computer) and this one is likely to be no different. game where you throw stuff at eyeball dudes. i had some issues with the vr mode but its a funny game for 4 dollars. Unique take on the level-climbing roguelite. Combat is Smash Bros style, where damage only serves to increase knockback range, and all KOs are ring-outs. The variety of "bashers" (weapons) gives you a lot of options in combat style. Each one is completely viable too, avoiding the "two or three good archetypes and a bunch of vendor trash" trap that many randomized games fall into. Staying alive isn't just a matter of not getting hit, it's about not being too close to the edge when you do, especially if your damage is high. Recovery is possible if you get knocked off, but you can't count on it, especially if you're on the lower platforms of a level. Keeping track of where the restore powerups (debuff removal) and heal powerups are in the level is also critical, as you can find yourself needing one in a hurry. Falling isn't a game over, but you lose a random item when you do and if that item is your main basher it can bring your run to a grinding halt. Your inventory is ten slots, which is a good reason to hang onto old items just as a buffer to lower your odds of losing the good stuff if you fall.

The level randomization works well. Occasionally you get jump platforms or ramps to nowhere, but never inacessible platforms or jumps that are too difficult. Item randomization also stays balanced most of the time, but like all roguelikes/lites sometimes you roll an absurdly overpowered item that boosts you for a few levels, or have to make do with a string of not so good items. That unpredictability is part of the fun though. The learning curve is a bit steep, but since falling isn't a game over learning it isn't a grind, you're just probably not going to finish on your first run.

It's a simple game, but at four bucks you'll more than get your money's worth. Even if you don't plan on powering through the levels, just bashing on the floating eyeballs is a satisfying form of stress relief.

P.S. I don't have a VR set, so I can't comment on that. But this dev has done VR before and gotten good reviews on it, so I expect it's well executed. Hopefully someone with a Vive can confirm that here soon.

name: Play With Me: Escape Room
genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Racing, Simulation, Sports, Strategy
short_description: See how a game created by the very Jigsaw would look like! Use the available objects, outwit tricky illusions and optical puzzles and above all, answer the question ‚Äì will you dare to Play with Me?
reviews:
It is a horror escape room puzzle point-and-click game where you and your wife have been kidnapped and must escape a killer's twisted "Funhouse." Each room presents a series of puzzles that you need to solve to progress.

For a low-budget indie game, it‚Äôs pretty well-made. You can definitely tell that there‚Äôs some inspiration drawn from the SAW franchise, especially in terms of atmosphere and audio design, which are done quite well. The puzzles are engaging at first, but after the first few rooms, they start to feel a bit repetitive.

On the downside, the voice acting feels pretty cringe, and the UI is a bit clunky. Also, the animation for pulling out your phone or matches is slow, which can be frustrating, especially when you‚Äôre trying to solve puzzles quickly. It feels like the protagonist is underwater, and that just slows down the pacing of the game.

If you‚Äôre into achievements, this one is easy to 100%.

Overall, while the game isn‚Äôt perfect, it‚Äôs still unique and different from other horror-puzzle games. If you're a horror and puzzle fan, it's worth a try‚Äîjust pick it up at a heavy discount to get the most value out of it. Didn't run very well, lacks polish (but is Polish) and variety, lost interest in the puzzles as the game went on. Good have been much better if more effort and subtlety went into the puzzles. Tedious puzzles, boring gameplay. *"Play With Me" is a thrilling escape room horror game that will put your brain to the test. With its eerie atmosphere, clever puzzles, and unsettling surprises, it keeps you on edge while challenging your problem-solving skills. Perfect for fans of psychological horror and mind-bending riddles, this game delivers an immersive experience that will keep you hooked until the very end! idk the game is shit af. Finished the first 3 or 4 rooms but got bored to death. I could give it a chance and push through but naaaaaaah. DROPPED XD I enjoyed playing this game, though there were a few things that made it a bit annoying at times. The puzzles are pretty creative and each one feels unique, which kept things fresh. However, some of the code puzzles were a bit off, the solutions didn't always make logical sense, which meant getting stuck and a bit frustrated here and there.

The game doesn‚Äôt go too heavy on horror, so don‚Äôt expect constant scares, but it does have a few solid jump scares. the story was interesting, letting you confused about the whole situation until you finish the game and also keeps you engaged with the short "interactions" between the others characters.

There‚Äôs also cool element like mini-games on the in-game phone. They don‚Äôt affect the main story, but they were a fun break from the puzzles. I think it would‚Äôve been interesting if there was an achievement related to them. 
Overall, while the puzzles might be a bit frustrating at first, the game‚Äôs originality and story make it worth a play.
Took about 5 hours to complete the whole game, achievements included.

One of them being a game breaking bug that doesn't let you continue with the game, in a bugged keypad for a door in one of the rooms ("Crosswords" room). Some people have reported some issues with the menus and other parts too. The UI could be improved a lot more. Having to go to the pack and scroll to find the item I need was annoying. There weren't that many items ingame. They all could've fit in much smaller frame.

There were some puzzles that were fun, both easy and difficult. But others... How did/do people solve them? I had to restart several time duo to bad number. Very hard to see. Other puzzles suddenly use letters, fine. But an elevator that shows only numbers, needs a word also? A single keypad that needs three separate words halfway ingame.

Why the puzzle difficulty wasn't more linear is the more confusing puzzle. Wanting to have as many diffirent rooms as possible at the cost of quality.

Sorry I can't recommend this one. Incredibly boring with a non sensible story and a lame "twist" at the end. Easy enough 10 achievements though so it get's a few points for that. It's very short as well, the only reason I have almost 4 hours is because I forgot the game open when I went shopping. Overall 4/10 and it's only that high because of easy 100% achievements.

name: CARRION
short_description: CARRION is a reverse horror game in which you assume the role of an amorphous creature of unknown origins, stalking and consuming those that imprisoned you.
reviews:
( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) cool monstor gaem üòé
very worth while
good money used üëç Okay, I'm not much into pixel graphics and also not a fan of this 2D-platformer type, I'm also not into gore theme. By this time you probably think why the hell I said I recommend that? Because this game is so satisfying by its little story, by the puzzles (yes, switching this or that levers and finding, gathering your next yummy DOES feel like a puzzle). And the gore part thanks to pixel graphics was not so much gross. It also gives you a choice of how to act - to barge in and crush everything around in one blow or to sneaky beat them, moving step by step, hitting one by one, devouring piece by piece... Sometimes. Sometimes it doesn't. But hey, evolving means being smarter too, not only bigger. 
Do you like to be an alien wicked thing that eats all around? Try it!
Do you like unregular puzzles? Try it!
Do you like exploring levels back again in case you missed something? Try it!
Do you like to feel invincible? Try it!
10 out of 10? No. 10000 out of 10000? Yes. <3 Its good very short game but is fun to try speedrun I like how you get to play as the monster.
 But the puzzels and fights are good too :) Found this game from Pewdiepie on YT from 2020, and after 5 years I finally got it. Both the experience and gameplay are worth it. It's fun to finish all achievements and play mods from the workshop, although the campaign is very short the fun lasted for when you wanna experience being an intelligent tentacle alien monster. It's a great game, cool monster and abilities and perhaps it's a skill issue on my part but like many other I have gotten lost I spent God know how long trying to finding where's the next containment units are. I wish the dev would add a DNA called spatial memory ( basically a map). Otherwise nice game, I hope for a sequel one day (with a map). 7.5/10

*edit: kinda a miss opportunity to not have a secret ending if you took too long to find a DNA, the game would end and a description would say something like the monster got lost and died of starvation Fun game. Parts where I thought there wasn't a solution but I finished it. Satisfying. Fantastic game and the fact that the game supports ultrawide is crazy for a one man team, whenever a lot of games don't and it's no excuse!

name: Kitten Food Alley
short_description: Kitten Food Alley is a casual management sim with the theme of petting cat. You can open various food shops and adjust food recipes, produce food by petting cat employees. Unlock various tools to automate petting. Enjoy the stress relief of cyber cat petting!
reviews:
this game is fun and cute and you should play it

i love the cat sounds and working out the best setup for each level is engaging

üò∏üò∏üò∏ Very cute, simple and fun :D If you're looking for a game in the style of Minami Lane, this is it! But even cuter since all the customers and workers are little animals :D

Edit- took me about 3 hours to finish the currently available levels (5,) it definitely gets more tricky as you go! But all in all, a short sweet little puzzle game.

name: A Night at the Races
short_description: Play as a guy who is trying to beat a platformer to pay his debts.
reviews:
Interesting and unique idea for a platformer but the game just feels absolutely atrocious to play. The controls feel extremely jerky and awkward, the camera is way too zoomed in, and many of the mechanics are just plain annoying. I wanted to like this game, but sadly it is a little too wonky for me.

I played through roughly half the game, seeing as there are 12 worlds and I am on world 6 right now, but it just keeps annoying me more and more.

The Pros:

- The story inbetween isn't much, but I liked that little world and would have liked to know, why the stuff is going on, that is going on. I don't know if it explains it all at the end, but so far I was always happy for a little break to click on a new message.

- The graphics are clear, you can clearly see the path you want to take and most of the time, how to approach it.

- The controls are very responsive, feels pretty good to use.. however..

The Cons:

- For me personally, it feels a little too fast to react to stuff you have not seen yet. There are all kinds of moments where you will die, because you'll need to remember how the level is built to properly maneuver through them. I know that the game has an assist mode, but I've played through all kinds of incredibly hard platformers in my life and never did I need to use some kind of assist mode. If this was the only complaint on my end, I am sure that I would have powered through, since I love a challenge and hard games in general. It's just that it doesn't really feel fair in this game. 

- You don't see enough of the level. This point is probably an extension to my previous point, but if you could see more, you could react better. Sometimes there are "springs" that launch you up into a deathtrap, to which you can only really react, if you know that its there beforehand. Its a cheap death everytime it happens.

- The next point is what made me stop playing this game any further:
It feels bugged. I don't know if everything i've encountered is intentional or not. there are times where you get launched by the little enemies that you need to kill/collect and get so much speed from it, that it launches you THROUGH the walls. I played a bunch of levels that I felt like were way harder than they had to be, just because I had to play around the fact that it would launch me somewhere I am probably not supposed to be. (might even be intentional, but it feels like a bug to me at least)

- Lastly, I reaaaally dislike games that don't let me play in windowed mode, since I play ALL my games in a window. I noticed that if you spam Esc in the menus, it slips into some form of windowed mode, but it doesn't work properly and cuts of parts of the game, and I guess wasn't even intended to work, since I just tried to quit the game at that time, which made me figure it out by accident.

As much as it annoyed me, I also had a lot of fun, but the bad things just kept piling up the further i got. If I could, I'd give a rating between "Yes" or "No" But as I gotta decide, I gotta say no.

Theres definitely fun to be had though! Fun and unique platformer with a cool story, kind of like geometry dash. A Night at the Races is a fun game with an intriguing story.

It's basically consisted of two intertwined games. One is an adventure game, the other is a platformer one. After playing a certain level of platformer levels, you continue the adventure (story) sequence. After the adventure sequence, the platformer game continues and so on.

The adventure part has an gripping story, supported by great visuals. The developer of the game is really talented in story telling. The puzzles are quite easy, I considered the adventure part as interactable cutscenes, which didn't bother me at all. I kept wondering what would happen next in the story.

The platformer game is extremely hard and unforgiving in default, while it's labeled as "Normal" mode. Fortunately, it's possible to change the difficulty of the game, which makes the game much more enjoyable for people who are not platformer experts. I started to enjoy the fun of the mechanics in the easy mode.

In conclusion, this is a game with a gripping story, which might require you to choose the easy difficulty to enjoy the game unless you are a game expert. I came into this game with the mistaken belief that I was somewhat good at platformers. 20 hours and 120 levels later I'm leaving with the knowledge that I'm trash, as well as a blister on my thumb and a deeply ingrained hatred for berries.

Worth a look if you're into the super-hard platforming genre. Super tight camera and auto-run/jump controls means you don't have time to plan a route, it's pretty much all either reflexes and reaction or brute muscle memory. Pretty decent worldbuilding outside of the platforming segments, and the point and click portions provided a good pallet cleanser, but overall the story was sparse. 20 minutes in and I'm hooked. I came to see what others said about the game.
Its quite addictive but I might have to change the difficulty to casual. A good challenging platformer.
Game is simply without much story, you control a box and you need to jump at the right moment to climb up, and make sure not to miss any enemies.

What I begin to find it difficult is to do the jump - dashing and break walls at the same time. 
I stopped right before I got angry about myself.
 The game is definitely unique and is decent in concept

Unfortunately I just wasn't a huge fan of the platforming. 
-The camera is zoomed in way too far for how fast paced the game is.
-The player movement and mechanics just feel a bit too clunky and "jerky"
-There is no quick restart button when you are trying to speedrun the stages for "perfect" status.

The camera being zoomed in too far is the biggest issue. If this was adjusted it would alleviate the clunkiness issue, and you would have to restart far less while speedrunning because you would actually be able to look and plan ahead a bit more rather than basically being forced to rely on pure memorization of the level.

Speedrunning is obviously always about memorization to some extent, but its much easier to remember what is next when you can see more than 1/2 a second into the stage. 

Just using Super Meat Boy or Celeste as comparison, you can only see about 25% to 50% as much of the stage at one time. Awesome and unique style and visuals paired with few simple controls, yet filled with levels that demand everyhting from you from the beginning onwards to not make a single mistake if you do not want to redo the whole level. Outstanding platformer. At the intersection of SMB and Papers Please, this game offers a great deal of fun. The platformer part was quite challenging, and you can immediately bounce back from failure, which reminds me of Hotline Miami in the sense of game feel. 
The point-and-click part had stunning scenes that gives the feeling of a dystopian universe. The game delivers that unique atmosphere with a very tasty aesthetic.
Although the game has a vast untapped potential, I blame the recommendation algorithms and the way that market works against indies, which portrays this masterpiece of art as a humble underdog. Ten years before, a game like this easily would have a cult following. 
I strongly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys the games mentioned above.
