name: Truth: Disorder - Wallpapers
short_description: A collection of 15 high quality wallpapers containing characters and locations from the game, as well as some materials that are not included in the game.

name: You Can Pet The Dog VR
short_description: Fulfill the ultimate fantasy: going outside and petting a dog. In You Can Pet The Dog VR, players can pet and play with an adorable dog in a beautiful environment inspired by the upcoming game DOGGONE.
reviews:
10/10 best game never has there been a more necessary purchase wow really bad... I'm giving this game a thumbs down, but I'm not negative about it. 

When I started the game the graphics jumped out at me, it's very colorful. I was very happy with my first impression. It feels like you're in a Disney cartoon. My pet dog was waiting for me and I spotted a bone, stick and ball I could throw. Unfortunately I couldn't reach any of them as the VR ground was lower than my physical floor. So I had to go into my oculus settings and fake a higher physical floor in order to reach stuff in this game... Petting the dog was also a disappointment to me as the dog barely responds to it. 

If I compare this to the robot dog in the free game The Lab, that dog was more interactive and felt much more real. 

Having pointed all of this out, I hope they will fix the bugs and make the dog much more interactive like make it roll over to rub its belly. I've waited for this kind of thing for many months and for the price of 4 euros I will keep the game and see if my nephew and niece enjoy it as much as the robot dog. I just wanted to take a moment and say that I truly love this game :) This is the greatest VR game I have ever played. As far as dog petting VR games go, this is a dog petting VR game that includes a dog that you can pet. I was a bit skeptical at first given that other VR games I have played did not include a dog to pet, however, my worries were for naught as this game started with a dog that I could indeed pet. Now petting the dog is not the only thing you can do in this game. You can also throw various items that the dog will then fetch and bring back to you. If you decide that this particular pup's fetching prowess is worthy of a pet, then oh boy let me tell you... you can pet the dog.
 Now what the dev does not tell you about this game is that it takes place in a world where gravitational anomalies can occur. When I was exhausted of petting the dog, I threw the stick. The dog then proceeded to fetch the stick and bring it back, so I went ahead and took the stick from the dog in preparation to throw the stick again. However, I grabbed the stick with my left hand, I am not left handed. This posed a minor inconvenience. I went to transfer the stick to my right hand and the stick became stuck in my body. In surprise I let go of the stick and the dog went to fetch the stick that was now stuck inside of my body. What happened next still haunts me....
 As the dog went to fetch the stick, my body expelled the stick at incredible speeds... like how you push bullets out of your body in most first person shooters to regain health. This propelled the dog at an angle straight into the air. I could only stare on in horror as my perfectly pet worthy pooch spiraled out of control into the atmosphere. Still in shock, I quickly grabbed another throwable object, the frisbee, to see if I could summon the dog back to earth. However, this had unforeseen consequences which may have set into motion events that I cannot fathom as of this moment. As I threw the disc shaped potential canine savior, the dog fell from the heavens. I watched as my wayward pup slowly descended behind the treeline, never to be seen again. I do believe what I encountered was the canonical intro to the game DOGGONE, hopefully a developer can specify.
 In conclusion, this game does exactly what it says it would. Is it worth 5 dollars? It really depends on how much you want to pet a dog in VR. Can I ever forget the horrific event that unfolded before my eyes? Probably not.

name: ANDROMALIUS
short_description: Spending the first night in a new apartment can be quite nervewracking. New sounds, and thin walls that seperate you from others in the complex. Do you trust your new surroundings?
reviews:
No Achievements. I streamed this game live in Twitch and my viewers loved it.  Alot  of fun and really enjoyed it.  Proud of myself for finishing the game.  https://youtu.be/2xT0KrZlDA8 Around 40 minutes gameplay time, tense atmosphere, barely depicted backstory.
Successful enough for a low-budget indie horror (more like thriller) game! üëç The scariest part was how loud the doors shut behind you. Like taking a nuke to the ear. This is one of the "short horror experience" games
I have played quite a few of these and based on that I can say that this one isnt really worth your time.
It is not a bad game, but compared to other titles this one just didnt caught my interest in any way.
Best thing about this game is that it's short ...
If you are looking for this kind of game but better quality i would recommend Chilla's Art games or EMIKA_GAMES
 A short and fun game with plenty of jump scares Enjoyable horror.  It's short but well executed.  In a limited runtime it managed to establish the scene, build atmosphere, and deliver a few well earned scares along the way.
It can be a bit confusing what you need to do to trigger the next step in the game but that's just nitpicking.
Recommended. I suck at writing reviews but this is a great game if you like exploring really creepy scenarios.
It has lots of jumpscares, which I absolutely love!
I'm looking forward to their next release :) Only get if it's on sale or you love completing games at 100% with achievements as I did nothing special and got them all. I love walking sim games but there's gotta be a good story attached to it which this one did not.  Also, for walking sims, this one was either, all you did was walk with nothing at all happening, or when there was something, it forced you to stand still which was a lot near the end. Also calling itself an interactive horror story, I wish there had been more ways to interact with things instead of having to walk in circles until the game decided to give you the item it was forcing you to wait for.

Also, I'm a coward in most games which is why I picked up this game ( i wanted to get over the fear ) and most of the time, I was so bored from walking around, I pleaded for the game to kill me so I wouldn't have to walk around again.

So you did it game, you successfully made me want to reach for something scarier. Constructive feedback would be to have more things interact with to showcase the story it was trying to tell.  Maybe being able to read different text messages on the phone or things on the computer. Definitely recommend if you're looking for something spooky, without having to stealth around or fight enemies. It's a good short walking simulator with easy 100% achievements! Well worth the price and time

name: TURRET SYNDROME VR
short_description: Tower Defense game in first person view, it can be played in VR with Oculus Rift or in non VR.
reviews:
This is the origin of the long drive It a very fun Game, but it very bugy neat little time killer, its pretty jank so dont expect to be able to trickshot a zombie with a turret backflip. But if the dev put alittle effort in it could be a pretty alright game. As of writing this review game has received few updates with no plans to continue, too many control One of my favorite games,only bad part is it needs a little working on, its to wonky great game from 49 cents and i even has vr but i haven't tried vr yet cause i don't have one I love this game so much. It's quite janky though. If only they hadn't abandoned the game, it would have been great. TURRET SYNDROME VR is an abandoned early access tech demo/wave survival shooter that the developer misleadingly advertises as working in both VR and non-VR modes, however, the controls don't work properly if you're not using a VR controller, so the game is unplayable.  Deceptive marketing, what a surprise, but the developers here seem to have a few unethical behaviours under their belt. 

I don't think this is an asset flip, the game assets are too primitive for a professional developer to create (this is a different problem in itself).  However the developer very likely ripped off a basic template for a VR game in Unity and just dropped some crap assets on it.  The value for gamers here is no different than an asset flip. 

The game was abandoned roughly 2 weeks after launch and hasn't been updated in almost 6 years.  It blew past the developers commitment to complete the game without any notification or admission of failure from the developer.  The game will never be completed.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The game features lazy low-polygon "retro" assets, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the 1990s.  It's unclear why the developers weren't able to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets for the game, and also irrelevant... what matters is that this looks bad as a result of their decisions, a compromise PC gamers shouldn't have to put up with.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 3 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

Another unethical act of this developer, knowing full well that this game is abandoned and they will never complete it, they are deliberately trying to scam gamers into buying it by offering it on discount from time to time.  It's impossible to "accidentally" discount a game.  The developer looked at their abandoned game, and instead of doing the right thing and removing it from Steam, they instead doubled-down and tried to scam even more people into paying for it.  Greedy, and completely unethical.  Doing the wrong thing, on purpose, for money.  This is not okay.

Furthering the unethical nature of this developer, while they are selling this incomplete game under Valve's failed Early Access program, they're abusing that program, and not working on this game full time, as they have other projects in the works.  That means there's ZERO confidence anyone who buys this in Early Access will receive a complete game, and it's possible that they're being scammed.

TURRET SYNDROME VR is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, and the questionable ethical nature of the developer and/or their associates (as outlined above), this is impossible to recommend.
 this is art Fun game where you fight zombies in an bunker, for the best experience play with vr headset.

name: TS Marketplace: Soldier Summit & Salt Lake City Scenario Pack 01 Add-On
short_description: The Denver & Rio Grande Western (D&RGW) was one of America‚Äôs most famous and fabulous railroads, and now you can go to work on the remarkable Rio Grande in ten highly authentic and diverse career scenarios!
reviews:
i purchase Soldier Summit &Salt Lake add on route and download it buit dont want show on my Trainsimulator game I like this a lot. As with all of the High Iron add ons that I have bought, they do exactly as claimed and in many cases such as this offer real enrichment and enjoyment of the route. I just added the AP weather pack to TS as well and it makes the bad weather scenarios in this very buttock clenching and enthralling. The train 18 scenarios being my faves, mountains, snow and low visibility combine to create, an on your toes two hours of driving.
This is a fine grouping of scenarios and you should buy it with confidence. I really enjoyed this and Pack 02. Quite liked all of the AI traffic. Adds to the experience! Brilliant! Thanks DTG/Developer! We Need MORE Scenario Packs Like This Please! Thankyou for the free version of Train Sim 2019 , greatly appreciated . Went to buy the 64 bit version , message kept saying it was alreaady in my library !!! So I purchased another Loco and Scenario pack to accompany your complimentary gift . My roundhouse just keeps growing massively , together with all my scenic routes purchased . One hell of a simulation for a Loco maniac like myself and many others . Keep up the fantastic work , together with the amazing Train Sim World , another amazing slice of Loco working there too . One highly impressed Locomotive Enthusiast , be it Steam , Diesel or Electric Traction , many many thanks for countless hours of incredible fun and realism , Phill Robbo .

reviews:
ctrl =NO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A bad combination of story-teller and hardcore game.

ok. this game is really good, dont get me wrong. the art style and gameplay mechanics of the game make it pretty unique. however, an incredible ammount of effort is needed, and upgrades get increasingly more expensive, yet they feel as if they dont do much for your plane. you cant play anything else until you beat the campaign, and dont eveng et me started on it. some parts of the game constantly kill you, and they really frustrate you. there isnt much variety, either, with the mobile game literally having better planes than the version you payed for.

also, i believe the best plane in the game costs no actual money, yet isnt available for the main game that you payed around 7 bucks for. this game is quite frustrating, and i think this should only be bought if you want a challenge, and like the odds against you. Please just add the MIG-29 as a DLC.

name: PBA Basketball Slam: Arcade Edition
short_description: PBA Basketball Slam: Arcade Edition! This zany and quirky arcade-style basketball features epic moves, high-flying dunks, and witty commentary that will keep you at the end of your seats. It‚Äôs basketball stripped down to its most fun and basic components which makes it easy to pick-up and enjoy.
reviews:
Are, um it probably needs to be more realistic and it should be NBA teams and players.Overall its not bad. The game is decent but they shall make the price a little lower because the game lacks popularity. But i rate it 7.5/10 Really great arcade-style basketball game. I'm always on the hunt for arcade-style sports games to play with friends on the sofa and PBA really hit the spot. 

A few more power ups rather than the electro dunk one would be great additions and a bit more thought into making 3-pointers more viable would really make this game great. 

I also can't help but think it would work a lot better as a 3v3 on the court.

One issue I found was that the controllers sometimes disconnected for a second while playing and the game does not have an in-game 'select sides' option. This meant that once a controller disconnected, the game had to be restarted which was really frustrating and the reason why we eventually turned it off. works amazing on steam deck. I mean looks like nba jam bit modern but would like to see some changes in the game like add more content and that you can customize your ball but I'll recommend it if you are interested into nba jam ITO ANG LIGA UOOOOOOOHHHHGGGH
ITO ANG LIGA UOOOOOOOHHHHGGGH
 It's like NBA Jam.  High quality game it just happens to be Phillipines basketball. If you love NBA Jam, get this game. While it is way more simple compared to Jam, Slam is still very fun to play with your friends. After playing the mobile and PC version, this one is by far the best way to play. Fun stuff! Scratches that NBA Jam/Street itch, one random number at a time. :D

It plays pretty damn well.

name: Rescue Team: Clouded Mind
short_description: The world faces a brand-new threat as a dangerous cult spreads its influence. People begin to betray their free will and follow the cults orders, as reports flood in from various locations worldwide, it‚Äôs down to the Rescue Team to save humanity once again!
reviews: the older instalments of rescue team were amazing. the levels were challenging and you had to figure out the best and fastest paths to take to get 3 stars. this game does it a little better than the other newer rescue team games but still not "puzzle" enough for my liking. the achievements in this game are horrible too. they are all tied to just finishing the levels. 3 gold stars on every single level achievement? nop. getting all the stickers in the bonus levels achievement? nop. getting 3 gold stars on every bonus level achievement? nop. you know... things that are actually ACHIEVEMENTS. kinda sad. will still give a thumbs up for it being a bit better than previous newer instalments, but i hope to see things improved with the next one. Just as fab as all the others!!!  Just too quick to finish

name: Yet Another Research Dog
short_description: The research dog is a newly graduated Ph.D.. His life-long dream is to become a great scientist, but the fortune is not on his side. After years of hard working, he is finally offered an intern position in a random lab. However, the job is not that easy and happy as he expected.
reviews:
My personal review: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ
This game was laying on my library has been a while, finally i finished playing it and i loved it, the story make me think about my life and stuff, it is a great game. Highly recommend I took no joy in the scant few minutes I played  before bowing out.  Miserable game- which seems to be the point here. Pretty relaxing to do some research that doesn't have your actual career and finances depend on it.  5 stars Although cute and well-made, I wasn't expecting to get so hyper depressed about reliving our hellish capitalist landscape I didn't play much so you can't trust my opinion, but this game is depressing. Which is mildly amusing, because it is about a dog :( Only do science for a living if you REALLY love it. Well this was quite depressing story. At least the end is kind of ok. There could be some improvements for the controls (sometimes you click on a machine and dog just stands there doing nothing). 
Overall an interesting short game, definetly worth the 2$ it asks. I purchased this game as I was finishing college in order to have a job working in a laboratory. This game made me laugh cry as someone who has had this type of job before. It is incredibly accurate with its detailings of life in the lab and spot on with how long some forms of machines take versus other in the matter of operation. This is a cute little game that is easy to sit down and play a day or two of without spending hours on, and is very quick and easy to get the hang of. Great for relieving stress during finals! This game is hilarious for all the wrong reasons... 

It's a game about working efficiently, not really a game outside of it's cute graphics and terrible Engrish rather a training tool for an awful life in East Asia. 

Seriously, the premise is: work like a dog, try to make your boss happy, try to spend your meager wages on food healthy enough to let you survive, do your laundry so your clothes are clean and then sleep... Oh and get some text messages from your mom...

Recommended for people living in an ant colony... Funny game, really enjoy it :)

short_description: When your father goes off on an adventure, it's up to you to keep the lights on and take care of your sister.
reviews:
Goated game, play now, with patch and dlc, enjoy and let your fantasy adventure begin. ages 18+ don't let your kids play! Soo CUUUUTE!!!

Story plot was already very satisfying and with the DLC I'd say it was worth it.
I hope for more DLC's that branches into more different endings. 

As for the R18 Patch is really soooo good. Yet it still needs more improvements, specifically when the sister becomes naughty. Needs to have more depictions on how she initiates her naughtiness, or more naughty secrets she'd be hiding, like she instead be the one to actually be taking her brother's underwear and such. More Ero positions, and also Clothing variety during the actual "actions". And I almost forgot, after experiencing and doing the "Action" several times, I wish there would also be a CG where she would feel frustrated by not doing the "Action" at least once in a week and forces you to get your attention which makes you choose to do what she's craving for. That would be very nice. I want a sister. how long does it that for you able to do the sex thing with i am at day 20 already
 great artwork This game is so good it cured my crippling depression. But made me depressed when i realized i can never experience this in real life. 10/10 Very Recommend :D Surprisingly Well-Made, Deeply Replayable ‚Äì But Not for Everyone

Okay‚Ä¶ this might be an embarrassing one to review, but someone‚Äôs gotta be honest about it. Monotone Sister honestly earns its ‚ÄúOverwhelmingly Positive‚Äù rating‚Äîit‚Äôs far more well-designed than I expected going in, with a stat-building system that‚Äôs engaging and satisfying to play with.

The core gameplay follows a weekly cycle: during weekdays, you‚Äôre working with your guild to train skills, fight monsters, or manage your tavern and town. It‚Äôs a good blend of RPG and life sim elements. Evenings let you make more personal choices‚Äîrest, explore, train, or spend time with characters‚Äîbut your options depend on how much energy you‚Äôve got left from the day. It‚Äôs not just about stat building, it‚Äôs also about relationship development and balancing your schedule.

The weekends, though? That‚Äôs when the game opens up. You get more freedom, more energy, and a lot more chances to pursue relationships, dive deeper into character interactions, or strengthen yourself further with extra training. It feels like a reward for your weekly grind‚Äîand it‚Äôs a great time to experiment with different choices that impact your path toward one of the many endings (good or bad).

Now‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs be real about the content. This game does explore adult and taboo themes, and yes‚Äîyou‚Äôll need to install a patch to unlock all of that. I wasn‚Äôt super familiar with this genre before playing, and I didn‚Äôt expect it to go as far as it does. But I‚Äôll admit: I get the appeal. If you‚Äôre okay with some edgy, risqu√© material, there‚Äôs something uniquely fun and surprisingly deep here. But if taboo content isn‚Äôt your thing, this may be one to skip.

All in all, it‚Äôs a smartly built, emotionally layered stat-sim that‚Äôs way more than just shock value. If you‚Äôre curious, open-minded, and love character-driven progression‚Äîthis one‚Äôs worth your time. quite possibly the game portion of a porn game I've ever played. download the patch and get the dlc. unironically really good turn based combat with well paced daily life mechanics. I hope for a sequel and it's not even about the sexual content, I like the story and gameplay that much. it has changed my opinion on these games and made me more willing to try them in the hopes that I find a genuinely good game and chase that high again. I didn't even realize it was a porn game at first I genuinely thought it was just a stylized and good fantasy rpg at first. Boy was I wrong. This game is sick as fuck...but just so am I.
PS: worth it if your a sick man/woman and like games that are drawn, simple, have story (not big or too much writting, but its alr my opinion) and is interested in kinda fantasy.
Bad things: this game too short dawg, and it gets repetetive a bit. 
It has different endings tho...I got the bad one first (those who know know)

name: Orbit Defender
short_description: You are in the control of the Planetary Defense System of Earth. Your job is to protect Earth using turrets orbitting the planet. You have gotten full control of the planet and you are responsible to keep the planet intact.
reviews:
This is worth the money 100%, its the best game ever!
You better buy this for only 1$ Its so frecking cheap! -good performance
-good gameplay
-looks pretty good

name: Peninsular War Battles
short_description: Peninsular War Battles places you at the forefront of Napoleon‚Äôs campaign to conquer Portugal and Spain. Play is possible as the British, French or Spanish across 5 campaigns with a total of 40 missions.
reviews:
Cavalry are halted on moving adjacent to a unit that retreats so melee cannot occur.  This is daft: if an infantry unit runs away from cavalry the latter should either be able to pursue it or continue and use its remaining movement points.  Granted, this game is a highly abstracted representation of Napoleonic warfare, but it should still adhere to a degree of 'realistic' behaviour by the troop types.

It's a shame 'cos otherwise the game, though limited in scope, could be enjoyable. Easy to learn. At historical level you get much of the flavor of Napoleonic combat. Excellent graphics and audio, progressively more difficult battle scenarios requiring you to change tactics and respond to changing situations.  A definite must for any one who, like me, grew up on table top war games with hundreds of carefully painted minature Napleonic figures and dice! Easy to learn to play and familiar to wargamers. Not particularly sophisticated but good entertainment Lots of fun and pretty challenging , especially in the higher difficulty settings. Covers the Peninsular War campaign of Wellington. Timewise, this happened around the same time as the Russian campaign of Napoleon. Gameplay is as most HexWars games. Decent array of scenarios. If you are comfortable with HexWars style, recommended. Great Game!  Difficult enough to be challenging , simple enough to be enjoyable. If you are interested in the Napoleonic Wars , are familiar with  strategy and tactics , you will probably wish  for Hexwar Games to cover this  period  as well as  their  excellent Civil War and Tank Battle series. The soundtracks are riveting , promoting just one more battle, but could be improved by more varied  period pieces. Thank You for producing these games! Luv all Hexwar games so easy to play well worth a buy if you like hex war gameing.

Thumbs up from me 10/10 Simplistic and solid and enjoyable representation of Napoleonic warfare.  A bit concerned about the ease with which infantry in unformed or skirmish formation form square when charged by cavalry but otherwise I have not found any problem with the game engine.  Artillery merge would be good as in Gettysburg but not essential to playability.  I love this game at the price....Look forward to Wellington's victory when it is released. Overall, this is a fun Napoleonic wargaming experience. A must play for wargamers and history buffs. So fun I could hear Richard Sharpe and Patrick Harper telling me that I needed to do my best to beat Boney.

name: Loop Frogs
short_description: Guide two froggy friends through a pixelated, time-warping adventure. This 2D platformer will require you to master the time loop and leap your way across 30+ levels of hazards and puzzles.
reviews:
frog

Ok but no really, this is an amazing little game. The main story is short and cute, with the levels gradually increasing in difficulty and complexity with no severe difficulty spikes. The cutscenes are kept short and add in a bit of humour and charm. The collectables and target times for each level, as well as the hidden secret levels, add a huge degree of replayability, and the achievements help keep you hooked: I'm about 10 hours in, and I still haven't done everything this game has to offer! The music is amazing and perfectly fits the vibe, and the frog sound effects are adorable. It's not a perfect game - pushing for the fastest times can show some inconsistent physics in the time-loops from Green - but it certainly comes close.

If you're a fan of 2D platformers, puzzles, the 90s, humour, or frogs, absolutely give this a try! 10+ hours of content for a fiver is nothing to sniff at! Very strongly recommend.

Spoiler: [spoiler] The frogs win [/spoiler]
V1.17.8 frog [h1] It's a great game [/h1]
I played for like 1.5 hours and saw it had been 3 hours (to make it clear I played for 3 Hours) [b] time flies by [/b] I beat the game, and I'm thinking about doing it again as a speed run, It was a bit frustrating learning the controls and I wish there was a bit of a tutorial but I just enjoyed it, it was great fun.
[h1] highly recommend. [/h1] Loop frogs is a retro style game that'll inject your brain full of nostalgic pleasure.
It's a puzzle based game that is great to run through but also has a level of difficulty that will push what you think is actually possible in the game.
The retro style graphics are such a pleasure to see in new games and will bring back memories of your mum shouting at you to turn it off and come downstairs for dinner.
I wish there was more games like this around.

"JUST FIVE MORE MINUTES MUM, I JUST NEED TO FINISH THIS LEVEL!!" This game is devilishly addictive and very clever. Its not easy at all, but not so hard that you give up on it. So far, I have only once picked up my laptop to throw it against the wall. but i think thats a sign of a good game. I look forward to playing more games from these creators. A fun game that hits you in the retro feels.

Still got to go back and work on my times but one day I will have mastered every level.

And still have a couple of hidden achievements to work out too.

Highly recommended Great game, I enjoyed solving each levels unique puzzles, and the interesting mechanics of the game. These frogs are fun, funny and great role models for amphibians thinking about a career in the sciences. So far the games really good!
The art is really cool and it actually makes me use my brain lol
Only criticism is that sometimes when i try to double jump it only does it once. 
It seems to work fine if I run then jump but its not that big of a deal
Still pretty cool game Cant wait to finish it!

name: Tick Tock Isle
short_description: Strike is inadvertently transported into the past while attempting to repair a mysterious, abandoned clock tower. ¬†Endeavoring to return to the future, Strike must fix both the time machine and the island‚Äôs dysfunctional family who are responsible for much of the clock‚Äôs disrepair.
reviews:
I enjoyed this. For less than a dollar on sale worth it, just wish it had achievements. trash Love the art style but most of the gameplay so far I've noticed is just going from room to room-why are they so many interconnected?-and getting lost. Tick Tock Isle is a bite-sized adventure game that pays homage to the point-and-click adventures of old but trims absolutely all the fat and leaves you with a condensed and charming experience.

The game has an inventory, a map, and several screens of the titular island and the house on it, but the game only has four buttons, and three of them are directional movement keys. In short, the game streamlines all interactions and inventory fiddling by handing out items for you and using them in the environment when appropriate.

The result is a roughly 1 hour long game (a bit less if you have great sense of direction and a bit of luck) peppered with classic nonsensical item and NPC combinations you used to have in SCUMM games and a neat little ending that ties everything together... or does it?

Some find the straightforward interface limiting and grating, but I found it brilliant; go into this game with without expecting more than what it has on offer and I think you won't be disappointed. Tick Tock Isle hides a surprising amount of creativity and attention to detail wrapped in a little time-traveling package. And it's got a couple of poems in there too!

For the price tag, it's an absolute steal and a great way to try something different. The music was the best part, and the family dynamics were cute, but it was really frustrating going from room to room just hoping something would happen, had to end up looking up a guide to even know what I was supposed to do.

View more honest reviews on my youtube channel CozyAriGames <3 This game is a STEAL for 99 cents! What the heck!? It's "short" being a couple hours to complete everything most likely, BUT I prefer that honestly, like watching a good movie. It was extremely cool and funny and rewarding to work through this story. Squiddershins always makes cute, fun, clever little games I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

short_description: Magic Forest is a classic platformer in which you learn a little history of the travels of the rabbit
reviews:
nice game Decent little platformer. Priced fairly.

Im on a quest of at least trying every game in my library, of which I got plenty from all kinds of bundles, not all though. If you are interested in my journey, check out my other reviews :) Decent little platformer. Its kind of brainless though. I made it to a certain point but it was nice to play. "Each month I will add 10 new levels" ??? I know the game is old but please it should be better to remove that false message. Also I think that initially you could add more levels to the game as it was really simple. The art style is good and cute. I should say that is a nice starting portfolio project. Avvruk Cute game, but not too difficult. I could say a baby mario version. Nice chill out game. very good built but too few levels Far too slow and simplistic for a platformer of this style. The difficulty is far too inconsistent as well. Previously removed from steam Kek Story

https://steamcommunity.com/app/575730

In your account operations history listed as Forest Story

What to do with that info? You decide

name: City of Broken Dreamers Game Guide
short_description: A helpful guide to navigate your way through Book One of City of Broken Dreamers
reviews:
To be honest, I never used this guide and tried to choose all the ways myself 
Although the game is so difficult that the player really needs a guide, if you really think you are confused in the game and don't know how to choose, this DLC is a good option :))) It's just a PDF guide. It's not exhaustive - certain things are missing here and there, but it's decent enough to help you navigate through the game. There are a lot of hidden things, ambiguous choices and unpredictable outcomes in CoBD, so this guide can come in handy. Recommended for the second or third playthrough. Great comprehensive guide for the game with many twists and turns. My only question is there a guide like this for Book 2? This is not an in game guide, but a pdf.

I don't recommend as you can likely find the game for free elsewhere, but if you want to download a pdf (and it's still there to download if you want it again in a couple of years), it's fine. It helped me unlock the library, so it served its purpose. Don't know if PhillyGames is aware but this guide is also posted on the Guides section of the Community Page. I used that guide first and since there are still some scenes I need to unlock I figured buying the "official guide" DLC would help. But nope, it's the same. So even as an Official Guide the guide fails at revealing every dialog/choice result.

I guess this is a case of buy the guide to support the dev, otherwise you're fine using the freebie copy which I think goes against the terms of service and should be removed. The story is interesting, but some of the writing is better than others. It can vary between good and sort of sophomoric. The sex animations are fairly generic, but the character models are very good. There are certainly better examples of this type of game, but it is probably worth the price for the story. The guide do provide some assistance, however, it is still a huge disappointment as it only provides guidance with part of the scenes. DO NOT TRUST THE GUIDE! It will not unlock you the hidden scenes. It will only give you a rough idea how it gonna play out if you choose certain options. The Game Guild is very good, with many explanations and to highly recommended. Furthermore it is a additional support for the developers. If you are not sure, play it once and then decide if you want to continue supporting them and find out everything.

There are some free guides out there in the ether, but with these you will still miss or not experience some things. Yeah, both the main menu "official guide" button and the guide button under the "Help and Guide" tab do nothing. You have to go into your steamapps-->common-->City of Broken Dreamers Book One-->game-->cobd-guide(PDF file) in order to view the guide.

Edit: Day after I posted this review both links immediately pull up the guide in-game.

–ì—Ä–∞ –≤–∏–≥–ª—è–¥–∞—î –º—ñ–Ω—ñ–º–∞–ª—ñ—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ, –∞–ª–µ –ø—Ä–∏ —Ü—å–æ–º—É –≤—ñ–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥—É–∂–µ —Å—Ç–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞. –¢–µ–º–Ω—ñ –∫–æ—Ä–∏–¥–æ—Ä–∏, –º–µ—Ä–µ—Ö—Ç—ñ–Ω–Ω—è —Ñ–∞–∫–µ–ª—ñ–≤, –∑–≤—É–∫–∏ –∑-–∑–∞ —Å—Ç—ñ–Ω ‚Äî —É—Å–µ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é—î –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–µ –≤—ñ–¥—á—É—Ç—Ç—è –ø–æ—Å—Ç—ñ–π–Ω–æ—ó –Ω–µ–±–µ–∑–ø–µ–∫–∏. –°–∞—É–Ω–¥—Ç—Ä–µ–∫ –Ω–µ –Ω–∞–≤‚Äô—è–∑–ª–∏–≤–∏–π, –∞–ª–µ —ñ–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–µ—Å–ª—é—î –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—É —ñ–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü—ñ—ó –π —Ç–∞—î–º–Ω–∏—Ü—ñ.

[b]–ü–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂—ñ —Ç–∞ —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏—Ç–æ–∫[/b]
–°–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∫—É –≥–µ—Ä–æ—ó–≤ –≥–Ω—É—á–∫–∞, –∞–ª–µ –≤–æ–¥–Ω–æ—á–∞—Å –≤–∏–º–∞–≥–∞—î –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–º–∞–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ. –í–∏–±—ñ—Ä —Ä–∞—Å, –∫–ª–∞—Å—ñ–≤ —ñ –Ω–∞–≤–∏—á–æ–∫ –º–∞—î –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è, –∞ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è –º–æ–∂—É—Ç—å –∑—Ä–æ–±–∏—Ç–∏ –≥—Ä—É –≤–∞–∂—á–æ—é ‚Äî —â–æ —Ç—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ –ø—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–µ—Å–ª—é—î "–æ–ª–¥—Å–∫—É–ª—å–Ω–∏–π" –¥—É—Ö.

[b]–í–µ—Ä–¥–∏–∫—Ç[/b]
Legend of Grimrock ‚Äî —Ü–µ —ñ–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏–π –ø—Ä–∏–∫–ª–∞–¥ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —è–∫ –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç–∏ –∫–ª–∞—Å–∏–∫—É –≤ —Å—É—á–∞—Å–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å. –í–æ–Ω–∞ —à–∞–Ω—É—î —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ—ó, –∞–ª–µ –ø—Ä–∏ —Ü—å–æ–º—É –≥—Ä–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–≤—ñ–∂–æ –π —Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤–æ. –Ø–∫—â–æ –≤–∏ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ —Å–∫–ª–∞–¥–Ω—ñ –ø—ñ–¥–∑–µ–º–µ–ª–ª—è, —Ä–æ–∑–≥–∞–¥—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–æ–∫ —ñ —Ç–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –±–æ—ó ‚Äî —Ü—è –≥—Ä–∞ —Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –≤–∞—Å.

‚≠ê [b]–û—Ü—ñ–Ω–∫–∞: 9/10[/b] Turns out I really love Dungeon Crawlers. Terrible game, there's only one massive dungeon. And where are my cutscenes???

Where can I buy character skins for $15/ea.? And why is there no Team Deathmatch game type? Still a fantastic old-school style RPG brought to a well devised 3D rendition. I haven't encountered any bugs, atmosphere is perfect, gameplay is easy enough to get into but fresh enough to keep it from being repetitive, and the world building is straight out of a D&D campaign. Legend of Grimrock 1 and 2 are two amazing games.
I haven't played much classic dungeon crawlers, only Might&Magic X Legacy, which has fun quests and dialogue, but is slightly less dynamic that LoG

Personally I like to limit myself to characters from 1 race. Minotaurs will feel clunky. Ratmen and Lizards quite strong.
Riddles in LoG1 usually are really ridiculous and will end up with online guide. In LoG2 you can figure most of them yourself, only one or two will be unsolvable.

Gameplay is relatively easy, so taking additional challenge may be fun.
-Hard mode in first game is brutal with elite enemies one shoting your warriors. Expect reloading saves. In LoG2 difficulty doesn't feel nearly as tough.
-No map is terribly demanding in first game, as whole adventure takes place inside one dungeon, every floor and corridor looks identical. In LoG2 we explore more enviroments so it's navigation is managable recalling objects around us.
-Saving At and One use crystals (only LoG2, for achievement both need to be on) not recommended for first playthrough due to traps, 2h between saves. The single use is not an obstacle tho.

[h1]Mild spoilers[/h1]
Enemies respawn sometimes. Your party should reach 70 skill points (LoG1) or level 14 (LoG2). Some enemies early on can be immune to Earth/Poison magic, but it's still strong thru the game. Dodge is little unreliable for front characters, thus ignoring armor skill is valid option even on hard (both LoG1 2),. Great music.
Looks good even thought it's an old indie.
Fun and unique.
Has retro rpg vibes, but is very approachable. Looks good but quite boring. There's zero story. Just play EOB. oneofthebest cool game, would like to see more games like it!

name: I Pay No Rent
short_description: Don't let your landlord overpower you with her incredible throwing power, dodge or block those shoes, bottles, and... wait what? bombs?... Try to block, or dodge all the 'things' your landlord ruthlessly thrown at you!
reviews: Bought this game when my small niece came over and i wanted her to try VR, she absolutely loved it, i don't even need to guide her, she became naturally fluent with the game concept. I tried few minutes myself and would understand why, this is a very light-hearted and fun mini game that is very much children friendly. I would really recommend this game to anyone who has children and want to invite them into the world of VR!

name: Business Simulator
short_description: Business simulator is a simple economic simulator. Making their way forward, the player builds the future of their character, earning money and respect, buying real estate, cars, and climbing the career ladder.
reviews:
Just not worth it. It is VERY basic and more like something you would find online for free but not even that. I would not recommend spending any money for this game. where to begin with the glorious game known as Business Simulator,, or triple B as I like to call it.. Boring, Broken, and Borked.. This game is fun, if you enjoy playing a game that is pointless,, in fact this game is more then just pointless, it's a buggy and broken mess..

I gave this game a chance, even after Mc. Shady revoker keys, decided to take a giant flaming dump on people who bought his game via a bundle.. I guess breaking business agreements is what Mr. Shady Dev does best.. Another in a long list of snatch and grabbers< who snatch your money and run with it.... then try to make up excuses and lies to excuse their bad behavior.. but anyway lets get back to the actual game play..

Did I say gameplay, excuse me, the clicking of a button every minute, while you stare at absolutely nothing but a screen with the inability to do much of anything, other then scroll through a bunch of other screens where you can't do anything..

This game tried to be a clicker game, but it's like a clicker game being played by Grandma Rosie, the 105 year old woman with carpal tunnel, who manages to click a staggering 4 times per minute.. I guess this game might have been fun, if you could manage to stomach playing it for more then a few minutes at a time.

Ultimately you'd be better off doing anything else with your money rather then buy this game.. I mean after all, the dev stole enough of our money as it is.. no need to give him more.. The fact steam allows people like this to release broken buggy, almost non games on their service and then sell hundreds of keys to bundle sites, only to revoke them due to the ease with which valve leaves the dev tools open to any Tom ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• or Harry..

If you really still want to buy this game have fun throwing your money down a giant hole,, with this type of shady developer don't say I didn't warn you when they eventually release the patch with the keylogger/miner/ or other nerferious software that installs in the background.. If they have zero issues with robbing people, I'm sure they have no issues with releasing garbage hidden software.. buyer beware..
0 Comments Devs sold keys to a bundle site, then "recalled" the keys a month later. Without the bundle site, no one even knew what this game was, actually gave it good press... completely sullied the dev name, for this title, and their upcoming (which, I have removed from my wishlist). Good and simple game where you don't have to think too hard.  Good to zone out to. First, I am giving a recommendation as the game has promise in the near future.   What changed for me was the developer actually implemented a patch once feedback was given.  That is very important and i respect that.

Second- Yes this game has bugs and quirks that might make it unplayable at certain points as of today.  I am sure with the bug feedback I am giving, it will be fixed soon.

Its actually not a bad game at all, just a rough start.  If you like sims, and business sims, its worth the $5.

name: Dishonored 2
short_description: Reprise your role as a supernatural assassin in Dishonored 2. Declared a ‚Äúmasterpiece‚Äù by Eurogamer and hailed ‚Äúa must-play revenge tale‚Äù by Game Informer, Dishonored 2 is the follow up to Arkane‚Äôs 1st-person action blockbuster & winner of 100+ 'Game of the Year' awards, Dishonored.
reviews:
my game wont even start up and they are doing nothing  to fix the issue Just like my opinion of Titanfall 2's campaign, Dishonored 2's gameplay itself is good, but despite hearing nothing but praise for the story, I believe the storytelling actually kind of sucks. I suppose this is also a review of Dishonored 1.

For the same reasons of Titanfall 2's campaign, I don't like Dishonored 2's execution of the story. And Dishonored 1 for that matter. Something that I can at least credit the Dishonored franchise for is that everything is more or less set up for success - there's an awesome world, an awesome character, and an awesome premise of enacting bloody justice on a kingdom.

To summarise the same points from my review of Titanfall 2's campaign, I didn't like how the story felt like a picture book - events just happening one after the other, with there apparently being a clear to-do list for the protagonists, apparently knowing exactly what they needed to do in order to take back the throne. Heck, in Dishonored 1, the side characters literally acknowledge that all they did was sit around on their asses and order Corvo to get out there and do the real work. Everything just apparently naturally fell into place; there wasn't any sense of mystery or wonder. Speaking of which, the Outsider in Dishonored 2 seemed to play a more influential role to the characters, compared to Dishonored 1 - which isn't a good thing, considering he was seemingly designed as an omnipotent watcher who gives people strength but not ideas (though I could be wrong on that).

But, unlike Titanfall 2, I actually think the Dishonored franchise having a better setup for a story means the poor execution of the storytelling is a little more disappointing.
Something that Dishonored made itself known for was being able to influence the world and story's outcome depending on how chaotic vs. stealthy or lethal vs. non-lethal you played as. Unfortunately, that meant I sort of couldn't enjoy Dishonored if I did anything other than stealthy and non-lethal. I have to admit, I never played high chaos in Dishonored 1. Simply because I didn't like the idea of the world turning out worse because of it.

I think that's one of the problems of the Dishonored games. While the concept of your actions shaping your player character and also influencing the world around you is cool and all, it's also ironically kind of restricting. It sort of makes the Dishonored world more black and white - your player character either helps keep peace, or contributes to chaos. There's not exactly an in-between.
In Dishonored 1, I frankly came to dislike how the city was already super dead and dying. Every new location looked the same - just another part of a dead and dying city. I was excited to try out Dishonored 2 and experience environments that didn't look post-apocalyptic, but Dishonored 2 sort of introduced a new problem - it attempted to give Corvo a personality.
Giving Corvo a personality isn't exactly a problem by itself, but because there's only low chaos or high chaos, Corvo is only either super pacifist and tolerant, or exaggeratedly cold and ruthless. It's like trying to choose a shade of paint for a house, but there's only blue or red, and no choice for some nice purple - some analogy like that.

I guess attempting to design a game for both stealth and loud aggression will inevitably have issues if it gets incorporated into the lore. But one more issue I have would probably be the game's length - I know it depends on whether you're playing stealthy or loud, but I think the games would be better if there was simply just more content for both stealthy players and chaotic players. Like, for stealthy players, more puzzles and secret solutions and helpful map design, and for chaotic players, more satisfyingly challenging and creativity-rewarding combat scenarios than merely enemies in one area.

One last thing possibly worth mentioning - Emily's existence as a character makes sense for lore purposes, but in gameplay, her powers are probably less easy to use than Corvo's? Like, I feel like there's less synergy between them, and less times that they feel like a natural solution? I don't know. But I'm sure the primary reason they added Emily having powers was because Dishonored 2 was a sequel and they couldn't not introduce new powers. For a similar reason, Corvo having stronger powers than in Dishonored 2, like being able to stop time when preparing Blink, absolutely came from Dishonored 1's Daud DLC and the devs realising they can't remove that for the sequel even if Corvo shouldn't have that power.

But that's a tangent. If there's anything meaningful to draw from that last point, it would probably be, keep your gameplay and lore consistent, otherwise don't bother? I guess. fuck Clockwork Soldiers. Great game addicting Finishing this game left me dissatisfied at one mission rendered me spotted by enemy and game wouldn't tell me which one it was, ruining my stealth run. Still a solid game that has better replayability than the first game despite the worse gameplay feel. Graphics are more old school but the story is solid as are the options, 10/10 Dishonored 2 is clearly an underrated game. A quality immersive sim, the level design allows for many different approaches. The powers are well thought out.

I think the game suffers from some flaws that prevent it from standing out from the crowd, notably:

- A lack of precision in the sound. An enemy can hear us walking even when we are a floor above. It's a shame because it ruins our plans. As far as I know, all stealth games have this issue.
- An AI that does really weird things, like running for no reason. The problem is that it's not predictable.
- The graphics are dull. I can see that there is a real artistic direction, but it is not showcased because everything is gray and plastic-looking. And above all, the environments are full of objects, and since nothing catches the eye, it is sometimes difficult to understand what to interact with. I have often spent 10 minutes looking for an object (a key, for example) when it was right in front of me. It's frustrating. The Void Engine is ugly.
- A story/lore/character that is not very convincing. I didn't understand any of the Outsider's dialogue, and yet he talks a lot... I don't feel attached to the universe.

In short, a game that shines mainly through its gameplay thanks to its level design.

Pretty good game. Yes port is bad. game won't launch
EDIT: After an AMD clean and reset it works
Its like assassin's creed except with magic and the enemies can and will throttle you.
World is cool stealth is good. Game deserves a remaster.

name: Queen's Quest 3: The End of Dawn
short_description: Become a true alchemist!
reviews:
This game is more neutral for me but I'm rating it negative purely because it literally tells you the story (through minigames) and yet you cannot and do not do anything about it. You stick to your course as if you had skipped the games. It doesn't let you talk to your best friend, doesn't let you do the things any normal human would do, and has some of the most frustratingly annoying puzzles. It's an alright game, with an alright story and an alright overall setup, but it tries too hard to go for a shock that just isn't there because, once again, they told us this earlier. When it comes down to it, I don't particularly care. And all of that, for $15? Ha. Ha. Haha. No. Good characters and voices in this one, has a Harry Potter vibe with off brand Dumbledore, Snape, and female goth Malfoy. The merchant was very silly and was the star of the game in my opinion, I wish the bonus story was about him instead of the fairies. The fantasy environment in this one has been overdone in most HOGs but the characters really make up for it. Puzzles and HO scenes were all pretty easy, 100%ing the game should be pretty easy for most. Very well done.  Puzzles are simple except for a few which were beyond my meager intelligence.  Scenery was beautiful and fun to look at. Hidden object games were good and somewhat varied. Overall, highly recommend. 



It was okay. Some of the mini-games were ridiculously easy.  Some of the hidden objects were misnamed and/or incorrectly shaped. 
Gameplay 3/5
Style 3/5
Complexity 3/5
Difficulty 3/5
Fun 3/5 This is a game that sh!ts out more dragon crystals than you can ever want or imagine. Cute. Story sucks. Riddles are nice. A third game in the series of Queen's Quest and I have a question...  WHERE is the Queen?!  Or rather...  WHO is/was the QUEEN?!

First game -> The Queen was the MC.  Second -> The Queen was an NPC, but third...  None?  In that case...  This game should be called "The Chosen One's Quest"...  Minus the three.  I didn't spend too much brain power coming up with that one.

But that's just me picking on it for fun.  The game is fine, just fine.  Long gone are the days where H.O.G. would take you a while to do...  Where a mini game could take all your beautiful brain cells, having you complete it in over 10 min + get an Achievement.  The same Achievement you would feel pride over...

Here...  The puzzles have outlines for "jigsaw-type" ones and eh...  Mini-games are simple enough.  Some will take time tinkering with them, but you can do it.

Graphics, everything is beautiful.  Story is nothing new but I like magic and fantasy so that was good and...  Okay, the twist was unexpected.  Just like they got me in the 2nd game.  GOOD.

The Bonus game...  I think most of the time was spent on graphics/designs and they got a bit tired hiding items, so that one isn't too focused on being sneaky/tricky.  Sa right...  It's a Bonus game.  Just something else for you to have fun with.

So not bad, not bad at all and it was enjoyed.  Thank you!  :D =) It may have nothing to do with queen's or royalty in general, and it's also a kind of Dollar Tree Harry Potter rip-off but it's still an enjoyable HOG for the most part. It's certainly way better than the first "Queen's Quest!"

Story: 3.5/5
I did like the story including the (somewhat predictable) twist, but I felt that it went on for a bit too long and dragged near the end. 

Graphics/Animation: 4/5
Lovely environments and landscapes. Plus, you can sort of pet some bunnies and mice here and there. The character animations are actually not bad but the 3D animation sequences look very clunky.

Voice Acting: 4/5
Good for the most part but some character voices were a little flat

Hidden Object Puzzles: 4.5/5
Plenty of them, and a nice variety of the standard "find all these items" and "find these specific pieces/parts." I was a little confused by some of the wording at times. i.e. "Club" actually was the club symbol you see on playing cards, not a weapon. 

Other Puzzles: 4.5/5
A nice variety of easy and reasonably challenging puzzles. I have to call b.s. on the one "puzzle" where you have to find certain branch pieces in a big mess of vines and twigs. 

Music/Sound: 5/5
A very beautiful and epic soundtrack fitting for a fantasy adventure story.

Final Grade: 85% B

Definitely worth buying, although, waiting for a sale isn't a bad idea. great Lazy sequel with very little challenge, and incredibly simple puzzles. Find somethig more interesting to play.

name: Goalie VR
short_description: Experience the adrenaline rush of defending your goal against 5 opposing players, an unrealistic but FUN experience. Play against AI or your friends (requires a compatible iOS or Android mobile device).
reviews:
Games fun and i love it, However one downside is the guessing game you play when they shoot because theirs no indication with their stick where they shoot would love to see it fixed. besides that great game this is probably the best goal tending game ive played so far. it feels very responsive and provides a lot of different shot angles right out of the gate but requires i decently sized room to play it in. however the game is great and id recommend this to anybody given the cheap price range smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff smart stuff stocks stocks stocks stocks stocks stocks stocks stocks stocks stocks BEST its very fun to play with all the set ups you can make and catching the puck is fun I like this game. Update 11/20/17:

The latest verison has fixed my complaints- shooters much more intelligently aim for corners and the orientation of your legs is greatly improved- well done! HIghly recommended!

Original review:


Always great to have more co-op style VR games! However, this particular review will strictly focused on the game in terms of it being a goalie simulator in comparison with its natural competitor in this space: Goalie Challenge VR. 

GCVR: Goalie Challenge VR (competition)
GVR: Goalie VR (this game)

Features:

GVR has significantly more depth to it that GCVR- the passing of the puck between players and the ability to create custom plays is great and both unavailable in the stripped-down GCVR. Most notably to me, the replay system in GVR is really great- being able to see exactly how a puck found its way into the net and learning from it is amazing and really makes it feel like a training tool. Finally, it's worth calling out that GVR actually give you virtual arms instead of the floating glove and blocker of GCVR: using your arm to block the puck heading for an upper corner is a very natural movement that is lost in GCVR. (they both give you a virtual torso, of course)

Mechanics:

I grew up in Minnesota and played competitive hockey for ~15 years so I have a good feel for how a hockey game should act mechanics-wise. In short, GVC currently falls short of GCVR in this space. When the players in GCVR wind up and take a shot, it just looks and feels 'right'- as in you can get a good read of the puck right off of their stick in terms of where they are aiming. In GVR, the angle of the stick hitting the puck vs where the puck actually goes seems to be more random- it's much more difficult to get a read right off the stick and just doesn't feel quite right.

On the goalie-side, GVR also struggles to naturally rotate/position the player's legs compared to GCVR. (Of course, GVR supports/will support Vive's strap-on tracker accessories to *perfectly* track legs, but those aren't available commercially yet and they may never be widely owned). The best example of this is when you drop to your knees in a butterfly position on a shot destined for a low corner. As you slightly turn your head to follow the puck into the corner, the game twists your legs to align with your head, thereby exposing the corner where you otherwise would have had your pad down on the ice to make the save. This was the most common way that the AI scored on me- verified by the replay system. This definitely has room for some tweaking so that the leg rotation isn't coupled to your head rotation once the shot is in motion and/or when you're dropped to the ice. GCVR feels much more natural in the balance that it's struck.

Finally, it's worth noting that in my rounds in GVR, the AI almost never seemed to go for the top corners- preferring the lower corners almost exclusively. I went down to my knees for a bunch of shots to try to make the top corners more attractive to the AI, but it still seemed content to just shoot into my butterflied pads instead. GCVR gives you much more variety in save opportunities- which the glove and blocker saves tend to ultimately be the more 'fun' saves to make.

Final notes:

GVR seems to have laid the foundations of a great goalie simulator here, but has some work to do in terms of the pure mechanics. Of course, this is the initial release and I'm confident that they'll continue to tweak things. Still a very fun game to play- especially with the replay system- and, therefore, I'm still recommending this game. However, at this point, I find myself being drawn slightly more to the more bare-bones GCVR if I'm looking for a more realistic-feeling goalie experience. Really looking forward to seeing the next release of this and watching it evolve- it won't take much for this to become the clear choice in the VR goalie-sim space! I bought this on a whim yesterday and have to say I really enjoyed it. I like the asymmetric gameplay between smartphones and VR. I had a lot of fun playing against my kids taking turns being the goalie and taking shots with smartphones.
Only drawback I saw was no iPad support so I didn‚Äôt have enough compatible devices on my first playthough for my family as my wife and I have phones and my kids have tablets. I will try this with a group of friends another night where everybody has their phones to play. Not a lot of substance to it but would be fun to play a few rounds.

name: Owl Watch
short_description: OWL WATCH is a short atmospheric adventure game where you travel around in different biomes. Awaken from your slumber as you venture out to seek ancient technology to aid you in a time of darkness.
reviews:
randomly bought this game when i was a kid Very magical, yet simple adventure. Short and sweet, I enjoyed it. Simple but fun little platformer with pretty environments "Owl Watch" is a VERY short (around 10-20 min) platforming adventure about an owl warden that needs to reactivate artifacts against an encroaching darkness. "Platformer" may be not quite correct: You dash instead of jump through the top-down levels. The atmosphere is nice and the handdrawn cutscenes are charming and while it is nothing groundbreaking, it may be worth a buck and a half for a quick experience (And it is maybe a good game for speedrunning due to it's length). Cute short platforming game. The controls work fairly well, using the controller your character resets to face up down, right or left. So when you're dashing between platforms you might get thrown off by this. Story is very abstract and uninspiring. The art style is great and the game is fun. Unfortunately it is very short and wished it had more levels. quick & cute game Hooot Hooooot ü¶â A cute and fun, but short indie gem, I dig it! 10/10, easy achievements and unique art style! <3 Wholesome game. Great for kids and casuals. 

Achievement completion in 15 minutes. Short n' nice little game. Perfect game if you wanna kill some time This game is cute, it's fun and it's simple. My only issue with it is that it's too short and I would agree with the price a bit more if there were just a couple more stages and a little bit more depth, but oh well, it's not like it's asking for ¬£20 or anything. I want to see more of this art style and game play. I really hope there is a return to this game some day because after playing it, I just wanted a bit more. Another 15 minutes of game play would be great. If you've got a couple a couple of coins to spare, give this game a chance.

name: Moonbase Alpha

name: Tales Beyond The Tomb - The Last Vigil
short_description: Nick Harrison, a new security guard at the Guadalupe Cemetery, believes he is taking on a peaceful night shift. However, as night falls, he soon discovers he was very wrong. Nick realizes the cemetery holds more than just the dead.
reviews:
Tales Beyond The Tomb: The Last Vigil is a visually stunning (I love the PSX/PS2 style graphics), map-driven masterpiece with an enthralling story rooted in true events. Its gripping twists and immersive design kept me on edge throughout. A unique and unforgettable gaming experience that perfectly blends narrative depth, exploration, and atmospheric brilliance. I was not expecting different game-play elements incorporated in the game. Highly recommended! a beautiful game in the style of Fears to Fathom that tells the true facts This episode felt more immersive than the other two, which I enjoyed. However, I felt like it took quite long wondering what the next objective was or what needed to be done in order to progress. It was so slow and unclear of what triggers the next thing to happen. The transitions were extremely slow and this made the gameplay extends for longer than needed. 

https://youtu.be/L9XZnKKy9dA?si=6H9_9juoIFbtb73v THE GAME GLITVHED AT THE END SO NOW I HAVE TO RESTSRT Last Vigil had me absolutely hooked‚Äîand terrified‚Äîfrom start to finish! The eerie atmosphere, the unsettling cult story line, and the constant feeling of being watched made every moment intense. I found myself hiding more than I‚Äôd like to admit, too scared to make a move, which just proves how immersive and well-crafted the horror is. The tension never lets up, and the sense of dread lingers long after playing. Tales Beyond The Tomb continues to deliver incredible horror experiences, and Last Vigil might be the scariest one yet. I loved every terrifying second of it! Another great episode from the TBTT series. This one became pretty clear who the "bad guys" actually were. Some decent jumpscares, solid music, and the story progression was done really well. Only gripe is the QTE at the end has like a split-second timeout, so make sure you are quick and accurate. I think the QTE sequence needs a bit more of a warning but otherwise I enjoyed the game. Well done 616. You did it again.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bgso5JE7sgg Space, Space, Space, D, S, J, W. Great Episode, Extremely Fun. I Enjoyed This Very Much.
Atmosphere Is Top Notch!

My Gameplay: https://youtu.be/DHuXUHyJdWU

its a arm ¬≠ A more evasive Gerbera.
The damage, directional Jocky abilities, and charged abilities are identical to the base version.
The GP01's neutral ability replaces the "push" of the base version with a vertical Jocky. This propels you into the air from the ground, or straight down if used in the air (up/down Trick from Vergil's DMC4 moveset).
Presumably this makes it less useful for counters, while more useful for outright evasion. Pretty much the only DLC breaker worth having.

name: Code of Princess EX
short_description: Take the role of Princess Solange of DeLuxia as she fights to restore order in a world overrun with monsters. Armed with the legendary sword DeLuxcalibur, Solange gathers a team of fighters, and together they embark on an epic journey to confront the monster uprising and uncover its secret origins.
reviews:
I don't remember what caught my eye about this game so many years back. It definitely wasn't due to me playing the original 3DS version (I love the 3DS as a system and library). I think it was because it was on my recommended list and I wish listed it. Regardless, I picked it up early 2025 due to it being on sale and needing a quick game to play after beating some longer RPGs. And like Steam's comments at the top of the page, my feelings are very mixed about it. So to be clear this is for the EX edition, not the 3DS / original version.

The story is super straightforward and self-aware. Stop me if you've heard it before: Princess lives charmed life. Princess' castle gets attacked by monsters. Princess draws a holy sword and then has to save her people from saving the land. Along the way, she'll gain 7 followers who support her in her quest. Goofiness clearly occurs as they all play off each other with somewhat humorous effect.

Gameplay is also super forward: it's a beat-em up. And the quickest comparison a lot of folks will probably think of is Guardian Heroes. And it's an apt comparison. You have hard and quick swings, simple ability move sets (sometimes I didn't even know how I pulled some of them off), and 3 different layers to jump between. That's where it stops. The combat is solid, but no where as fast as Guardian Heroes. The plot is fun, but lacks the various choices that took players to different levels and influenced the plot. 

One of the biggest differences is how the game is balanced. Again, I've never played the original. From what I understand, there are 3 main differences that are different from the game's original balance: 1) The reliance on equipment to change stats and combat effects (higher damage to the undead, armored enemies, bosses, lower level enemies). It can lead to some interesting builds. However, due to each character having their own stat progression it tends to be better to play off their strengths. 2) How you accrue burst (think of bursting  as a state that can cause some massive damage). The original built it up based upon combos and damage. This time you start with 3 unless your equipment modifies this. Characters with higher MP stay in that state longer than those with shorter MP bars. 3) The move set has been revamped to make certain attacks more viable such as jump attacks.

Different characters are also more viable than others. I mostly played through the game as Solange (princess) and I was fine with that. Ali, a fast thief character, is also a viable choice. However, Zozo the necromancer completely wrecks opponents and bosses with her magic. Sometimes I felt like the game play was very fair. Other times, it was cheap as I got stun locked and lost a decent amount of health. Recovery items are rarely dropped by opponents. At least the game will give the characters you don't play half experience. There were a few times I needed to grind for 30 minutes to have the levels and gold to buy the necessary equipment to get through certain missions. Locking on to an opponent can help as attacks will then cause some extra damage. The 2 problems with it is that it can go away after a period of time, and you don't get a say who you'll lock onto when there are multiple enemies being hit at the same time. Locking on is also the main way to figure out how much health an enemy has compared to every other beat-em-up.

Musically, the game is fine. There's nothing really offensive about it. The same is true for the sound effects. It's fine when I'm playing it, I have no desire to listen to it beyond that.

If you gave me the choice of playing Guardian Heroes and Code of Princess, I would choose Guardian Heroes. The game is more focused, the overt customization between the 5 characters which changes how they play, and the game is a lot faster. Code of Princess can be fast and the mission based structure shows its 3DS roots. It also makes it super easy to jump in and out of the game. Once you beat a level, you can replay it in extra mode with any of the monsters or characters you've unlocked. So you're getting a fairly good value.

Again, I'd rather Guardian Heroes. After playing a tad more than 7 hours, I'm done. I have no desire to go for any of the achievements. I don't enjoy the combat and equipment system enough to replay levels. At least the game makes skipping cutscenes super easy. I picked this game up for around 5 bucks. I wouldn't pay any more than that to play this game. Or you could go to the Xbox store and pay 5 bucks for the game I've been name dropping a ton throughout this review. So do I recommend this game? Well... I'm mixed about it. Yep, the reviews are right. The definition of a game believing damage sponge enemies is difficulty. If you like Maiden Cops, or Dragon's Crown, this game will be your cup of tea for sure. Try to play it with 4 other people for the best experience possible. The controls are a bit stiff, but there are over 50 playable characters, all which play substantially different from each other, you're certain to find a character you really like to play!

I'd say it's easily worth 20$, it's even better if you can get it on sale. I love this game but this "remaster" is terrible with lots of bugs. Please give the original release a go over this one. This was remaster version of Code of Princess, which in this Steam, they have Code of Princess AND Code of Princess EX. The EX version was enhanced/remaster from the original version. The game was port from Nintendo version, so you need to re-configure your game controller if your controller was Xbox/PS version. Trying to move around with any precision is painful.  Pressing left or right should drain your health bar.  It's that painful.  And the translation is terrible, what a hatchet job to an already balls Japanese script.  Bad balls.  There are good balls out there. I really want this game to be good and experience the story line but when I reached a certain boss I just hit a brick wall. I had less problems beating the same bosses in the first Code of Princess game that got released on Steam, so I would say that this game is broken, bugged and no fun to play as soon as you reach that point.
There is another bug where the developers forgot to put a simple loop on the music as well, and I notice it every time when I'm in the shop menu.
So even if the game looks better compared to the first release, I would recommend to stay away from this title. I usually like difficulty games, but this one is pretty stupid, bosses that interrupt your combos out of nowhere, full of invencibility frames and can hit you even when you are behind them.
You can safelly skip it. Be glad someone made a mod for the dub or I wouldn't have touched this lazy port.

name: Crazy Machines 2: Anniversary DLC
short_description: You‚Äôve never seen a 10th anniversary party like this one before! There‚Äôs only one way to properly celebrate a decade of crazy inventions ‚Äì with even crazier inventions! This special anniversary DLC for Crazy Machines 2 includes 23 new parts and levels to add to your inventor‚Äôs toolkit!
reviews:
Crazy Machines celebrates it's 10th anniversary with another small stuff DLC for Crazy Machines 2. It's quite interesting how developers kept on making stuff DLC for CM2, maybe it's more popular than I think, or maybe Crazy Machines Elements never got enough recognition, which would be shame.

But yes, it's another DLC aimed for sandbox players, who would find some good use for new elements. And many ones and zeroes.
As for puzzle players, there are 12 new puzzles, which is the most compared to other small DLCes that this game has. They aren't too hard, but at least they are up the standard, all working and having bonus objectives (of always wanting to have more "party"), with finely written info text. It's nice.
