Nice job, Devs. :)  Def worth the price (as i believe in supporting VR and dont think it makes sense for devs to work for free. I don't work for free, why should i expect them to?)

This was a good, brief simulation and my kids and I enjoyed it. I'll also be demo'ing it for others that come over since it's short and to the point.

Make sure you click the start button in the beginning or you won't be able to move the game forward and pick stuff up, etc.  

Thanks for creating this!  PS: My 5 yr old LOVES the dog and plays the game over, and over, and over, and OVER...  just so she can hide during the earthquake with the dog.  Nice work! TERRIBLE - JUST ANOTHER WHIMPY CASH GRAB BY A DEVELOPER. No sound, cannot grab/hold objects as instructed, animations done by coder with 4 hours experience, flame effect dismal. Refunding this - do not waste your 6mins and then be forced to refund. Not a bad VR experience at all, even though its very short. I like the idea behind this, and I personally think this is some serious stuff that most people should try. I made a first look VR gameplay of Earthquake Simulator VR, so you can judge for yourself. At the end of the gameplay, I¬¥m giving my thoughs what I wish could be added, and also my opinion about the pricing:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wGxUkAOXcv4

To sum the video up:
This is a 5-10 minute VR experience, with only one earthquake scenario. If you do it once, there¬¥s not much more to explore, and I personally think its a shame - as this title has some great potential. Think about it, how many possibilities we have in Virtual Reality creating different earthquake and house fire scenarios. Please developers, add more different scenarios, more content, more different ways of escaping and hiding from the earthquake. For example:

- What happens if the fire starts by the exit door? Or upstairs? 
- What should we do if we are upstairs and the fire starts on ground floor? 
- How should we act if we have several pets, or kids and family at home? 

Also, give us more information about all the 14 items we should collect in the "preparation" part on this simulation. Why should we need every one of these items, and how can we use them?

I mean, you could add endless of different scenarios and content into this - and THEN make download content (DLC) that we can pay for. This "introduction" scenario in the current version of Earthquake Simulator VR should be available for free. Its something that every one of us should get the chance to try out. It could be about life and death - this is serious stuff, so I see this as public information for everyone, and not only for those who spend 3 euro on this. 

Don¬¥t take we wrong, I can easily spend 10 euros or more on DLC's if you add the content Im mentioning above. But in this current state, this version should not cost a cent.

Anyway, thanks for this release - this is something that can get really huge in VR - once you do it right. Thats why I give it thumbs up. I hope you will continue to work on this simulator - and Im looking forward to play more!

Only my 2 cents
Cheers
SweViver
 Ok it's short but very well done, I enjoyed it and it's something I will show people when they come round :)

name: NTBSS: Master Character Training Pack - Minato Namikaze
short_description: A special pack for avatar ninja! Special Ninjutsu Training: Round 6 features Hokage Minato Namikaze! Purchase the DLC to be able to train under him via the Ninjutsu Library!

name: Binary Trigger
short_description: Binary Trigger is a virtual reality precision wave shooter, with an emphasis on accuracy and speed. Competing for the highest score is the focus of the game, and you'll have to be quick and sharp if you want to keep your score multipliers high.
reviews:
Nice little wave based shooter that turns out to be a rather nice way of improving your ambidextrous shooting skills as points are awarded via shooting objects based upon the color of the guns and each of the guns in your hands are of different colors.  Worth the get.

Here's a video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HAuPcCfeBf8 Premise:  A straightforward shooter with wave elements.

This is a non-moving, non-interactable shooter where you simply shoot colored things (cubes, balls and later small monsters and bosses, etc) with the opposite-colored gun.  In order to get a good multiplier you need to be fast and accurate.  

I'd recommend this game specifically for working on your ambi-shooting for other games.  I know my left hand doesn't seem to shoot where my brain tells it to sometimes.  This game definitely helped me work on that.

As it is (early access) there isn't much to it.  I definitely don't think it's worth the $9.00 they are asking for it right now.  But if you can pick it up on a 50-75% off sale, it could be worth your time for a some cheap wave-shooting thrills.

As a caveat, I'm recommending this game if it's deeply discounted AS IT IS NOW (6 Jan 2017).  They may have a patch that comes out tomorrow that breaks this or makes it amazing.  So, take it for what it's worth since.. you know, Early Access.

name: Only Sliding
short_description: A puzzle game with one mechanic (sliding).
reviews:
I didn't think I liked sliding puzzles that much, it turned out that indeed I don't. This is one of those cases where I'm not sure whether it's fair to leave a negative review given that the game is pretty straightforward about wht it's going to be.

But I don't think the title fully equips the customer to make their decision, They still have to ask, isn't the fact that an experienced game developer got this into sliding puzzles a clue that there might be something really magical here?

And my answer is, I don't think so. I don't see it, anyway. If you like sliding block puzzles it is [i]crazy[/i] good for the price, and if you're on the fence I'd recommend giving it a try. I wasn't sure how interesting I would find them and they ended up growing on me quite a bit. Portponky watched me play all the way through. Feel free to be jealous Good game!

However, if you intend to play it, I will warn you that this game with the title "Only Sliding", which has the description "A puzzle game with one mechanic (sliding)", as well as an "About this game" section with an extract that reads "Only sliding is a logic puzzle game with only one mechanic (sliding)", as well as a list of features with the only one being "sliding", does in fact only have one mechanic.

Now, to avoid spoilers I won't say what this mechanic is, but to anyone who makes the understandable and reasonable assumption that this game has more than one mechanic, this game with the title "Only Sliding", which has the description "A puzzle game with one mechanic (sliding)", as well as an "About this game" section with an extract that reads "Only sliding is a logic puzzle game with only one mechanic (sliding)", as well as a list of features with the only one being "sliding" has only one mechanic, rather than multiple mechanics.

Now, to anyone who is intrigued as to what this mechanic may be, but worried it might not appeal to them once they play, I will put in spoiler text the singular mechanic in this game with the title "Only Sliding", which has the description "A puzzle game with one mechanic (sliding)", as well as an "About this game" section with an extract that reads "Only sliding is a logic puzzle game with only one mechanic (sliding)", as well as a list of features with the only one being "sliding" here:

The one mechanic in the game titled "Only Sliding" is [spoiler] sliding [/spoiler]. This can also be spotted in the trailer for the game. If you are expecting multiple mechanics, or prefer games which do not have only one mechanic, like "Only Sliding" does try playing a different game, such as "Ultimate Chicken Horse" or "Half Life 2". Finally another difficult puzzle game from Recursed dude! Simple concept but hard as nails ice puzzle enjoyers are going absolutely sicko mode over this one, let me tell you Very good, very clever design. Well worth the price if you want a nice puzzle game that'll keep challenging you.

Pros: Sliding
Cons: I am stupid Genius in its simplicity. Good slides, good vibes. A+ puzzle design. Quite a challenge.

name: Powerslide
short_description: Powerslide is a post-apocalyptic off-road racing game. With 98% of the population dead there's a lot of cars around just waiting to get driven into the ground. The ferals started the Powersliding competition, the corporates banned it. It's dangerous, it's illegal, it kicks butt.
reviews:
old but gold I had this on CD (google it, kids) when I was young.

Like a fusion of Mad max and Mario kart, super gritty, no grippy driving. 
Its the soundtrack thatll have me coming back for many more years. Ik had wel een vermoeden dat dit geen leuk spel is daar de controller niet werkt en je geen screens kan maken, zowel in de Voodoo Banchee - als in de software mode. Heel weinig verschillende wagens en een handvol tracks.
Neen geef mij maar DethKarz die is heel erg goed ! Nostalgia for the few who owned it back then and good enough for new people, very underrated.
This game is not just a hidden gem, this is an unknown hidden gem.
Very good for it's time.
Good and fun handling/physics
Looks good, sounds are good and OST even by today's standards.
I didn't think I would play a whole 20h just for some nostalgia.
It's all good. This was the best game back in the day. I sunk so much time into it. Still have the CD-ROM. Probably won't play it a lot on Steam, but bought it for a keepsake. The CD-ROM isn't going to last forever. You're here for nostalgia, and this game has it in spades. It's called "powerslide" because it feels like you're driving on soap bubbles at all times. In a weird way, it's pretty fun. Some of the tracks you unlock later are brutally difficult and hard to tell which way to go. The story talks about 2020 like it's some distant, far off sci-fi year, which is super amusing. The character bios and story are absolutely hilarious. Let's be honest, you're not here for a good racing game. Just go get forza horizons, or the newest gran turismo. You're here for vibes, and this game has all of the vibes. "Stunt" is the funnest track. This is an old PC game that came on a CD. The vehicle control and power-slides are great. There are some fun places to drive to, that are not easy to find. "old school computer fun"   Works best with a quality joystick. I played this game for years as a kid and purchased for the nostalgia feel. As a racer it holds up although it is kind of easy. Always thought the real fun was all the cheat codes and easter eggs they hid all over the tracks so you weirdly have a reason to go off on your own and explore to unlock more hidden aspects of the game. Ah yes, the childhood memories I've been playing this game on and off since it came out in 1998 and I remember it really left an impression on me. What really sets Powerslide apart is the unique physics, which are not realistic at all but at the same time make the game so enjoyable. It's nearly impossible to make a turn without doing a powerslide, which at first feels like driving on ice, but somehow it controls just fine once you get used to it. Hitting the other cars is like hitting a wall and will barely make them move, but you can use that at your advantage to make tighter turns. The cars also don't bounce off the ground like they do in most arcade racers, if you do a jump and land upside down, the car will just stay in that position and slide for a few seconds then turn over. That's probably the only thing I don't like about the physics, it would be more fun if the car could just bounce off the ground √† la Rush 2 to make more impressive stunts. 

There is also several very fun cheats you can use to explore the levels and you can go anywhere you want as there are no invisible walls, which adds considerable replay value to the game. The graphics, which were considered very good in 1998, unfortunately didn't age well, but that doesn't take away the sheer fun of the game.

name: Ark Defender
short_description: Roguelike missile command. Survive as long as you can aboard the Ark, humanity's last hope, in a hostile galaxy.
reviews:
Interesting premise! It's a decent enough game, nice genre-mix but some improvements could take it to the next level.

-Art-
Firstly, I think the art needs a little touch up. As it is, it makes the game feel cheaper than it has to be. The first thing I noticed were the edges, they could be smoother. The UI art sticks out like a sore thumb in the corner, they look like placeholder elements. 

IMO, the ships could have better complementary colors, I can't really say exactly what it is but the colors kind of make it look off and cheap. Maybe slight changes in the color tone would make it feel just right. I can say that when looking at the store page, color decisions kind of put me off but the gameplay ideas drew me in.

I think the ship shapes are great, I had no problems with that.

-Gameplay-
There are great ideas here and it's fine as it is but IMO this game could [b]embrace the shmup[/b] more. In a lot of ways, it could feel faster. I think everything could move faster and it would be fine. Given the stationary position of the player (which is good and what makes it unique) [b]adding a defensive right click option[/b] (e.g. similar to what those green enemies in the first few zones drop off- like a temporary small shield field) would add new depth and allow the game to be faster with more enemies. The only time I felt the game came close to this was the trap event. I think the whole game can be like that and get there faster. I started out with normal which was too easy except for the first boss and the trap event. I tried the hardest difficulty and even that took a while to start up. 

I like the ideas with the population a lot, but I'd like to see more interactivity. For example I'm not sure how much pop health affects anything, I ran most of the game at 0 health but nothing seemed to happen? I assume that's why disease outbreak events happened later on? But they were easily manageable so I never felt it was an issue. Besides, there is no real way to consistently increase it besides the hospital ship which requires an upgrade to increase life, but even then it only happens at increments of 1 with a 40% chance. Maybe I was unlucky but I didn't even get any tech points until like level 30. This is what I mean when the game can be faster, if these points mattered more and we could interact more with them the game would feel faster. I have similar thoughts on happiness.

More abundant and frequent unlocks (besides ships, gun types, flotilla types, defensive options, energy options)  would be nice. What makes a good roguelike is the sense of frequent progress. Hades does this very well, obviously it's an unfair comparison but I think its design philosophy can teach a lot. FTL is the closer inspiration and that has a similar formula for unlocks, but you can also buy guns within a run in that so you get the sense of accomplishment and progress that way.

-Soundtrack-
It's okay and appropriate for what it is. Obviously budget is what it is, but with a more faster gameplay a more upbeat track would complement it nicely but I can't say much on that.

-Conclusion-
Overall I like the ideas, there is fun to be had in the game, but it can do more with what it has. Honestly, this is like a game Ssethtzeentach would review years down the line and make it pop off, but it needs some improvements to make it stand out a bit more. Did you ever wish FTL had a story mode? Ever wonder what it would be like to try and keep a population of 1200k happy? How about trying to calculate if you brought enough portable black holes to deal with this round of enemy ships?

I love this game so much. Your story plays out over the parsecs as you explore and fight your way onward. Highly recommend.

name: The Forgotten City
short_description: The Forgotten City is a narrative-driven time loop adventure in ancient Rome. Discover the ruins of an ancient underground city, travel 2000 years into the past, and unravel the mystery of who destroyed it by cleverly exploiting the power to wind back time. The fate of the city is in your hands.
reviews:
I bought this game about 6 months ago and forgot about it and never opened it. having booted up yesterday I was pleasantly surprised to see it was developed in Victoria and played for 4 hours straight. Mythology has always been something that has captured me and the game offers a fantastic and philosophical take on the concept all together. I wish there was a few more hidden things and pieces to explore but I'm not yet finished so maybe i've spoken too soon. The game stands out for its exceptionally intriguing premise: an ancient city lived by the so-called Golden Rule‚Äîif any inhabitant commits a sin, everyone will be punished. You know it‚Äôs inevitable, but you don‚Äôt know how or when it will happen. In effect, you‚Äôre investigating a crime that hasn‚Äôt yet been committed.

But the plot isn‚Äôt the only thing that makes the game remarkable. It‚Äôs the masterful narrative progression and the interconnection of quests and storylines. I can‚Äôt recall another game that handles it so brilliantly‚Äîor gives the player such a strong sense of satisfaction with every step forward. Great depth in the storytelling. Ave! A fps mystery timeloop game where you figure out the full storyline in tiny pieces and get access to more of the map as you gather items.

It took me about 7 hours to complete the various endings.

+ The puzzles mostly make sense and are well signaled.
+ Most locations have multiple ways of getting there.
+ Storyline fits well together and intelligence is rewarded.
+ Characters make sense.

- Some of the invisible walls and lack of them are weirdly placed.
- Archery feels a bit annoying.
- Not much replay value after you figure out the main stories.

A pretty solid game. Maybe not for everyone, but quite enjoyable for what it is: A strange mystery to unravel. A good game with one of the most satisfying endings.

If you like games like Majora's Mask or Outerwilds -- you will like this one as well.  Not as great as those two but it scratches that need just enough. Highly recommend! Very, very fun. The game has a few flaws - places where a bit more reactivity would have gone a long way, where you can solve a mystery well in advance of the character, places where tasks you've been given seem to break, and you're not sure if they're unfinished or broken. And the worthless zipline system.

None of that really matters. It's fun and rewarding to explore and learn about the place you're in and the people who inhabit it, and that's all it needs, and it does it well. I wish more games were made this way. Amazing plot! An extremely interesting game with very deep conversations about philosofy.
With so many puzzle games being about environment and adventure games also having environmental puzzles, it is so refreshing to see a game that most of it's puzzles are people: what they believe, what they feel is safe, what they think other people will think...
The graphics are really good but face animations were weak at times. The game tells you if you don't want a horror/action experience.
The voice acting is really good and it needed to be since what you will do the most is trying to connect with people.

Not long game, has different endings... You should play it.

name: The Heroic Legend of Eagarlnia
short_description: Lay out your grand strategy on the land of Eagarlnia where humans, elves, orcs, dwarves, and the undead each battle out a corner of land. Manage your territories by navigating complex decisions and grow your economy.
reviews:
This is a fun lite grand strategy type game. All the YouTube videos showing the janky English localisation has pretty much been cleaned up and aside from the odd word choice here or there, it's just fine. The learning curve isn't too steep and there's a beginner mode that takes it easy on you as you learn the ropes. I *highly* recommend this game to fans of Gemfire or other games like that. Almost completed the achievements good game. Game doesnt have a massive amount of depth but for some reason it had me hooked for a long while, for the price honestly this game is damn good and to hear it was with a small team makes it even more impressive, look forward to seeing what other titles they bring out Build like a 4x but it has a loooooot of story telling. good Great SRPG Surprisingly fun, reminding me of the days of Dragonforce from sega saturn.

and the raistlin majere easter is interesting. Looks like someone is a fan of dragonlance series.

dont think most of the young chaps would know it tho.

PS: I really want to see a sequel to this game. Pretty good and cheap strategy game. You can control one of the about 20 factions each with their own heroes and slightly different skills in their tree.

To capture enemy territories you need to win two battles in a row 5vs5 and then with remaining forces 5vs(3+towers+gate) which can be pretty challenging in the beginning. Or you can retreat after the first battle and send another team if you have one, but then depending on total amount of enemy characters left you may have to fight 5vs5 again. So balancing developing your strength so that you can tackle two battles in a row and defense so that enemies are scared to attack you and investing in infrastructure for money gains to support your increased strength is the main part of playing this game. You also can collect a ton of different characters most of which have some lore but it becomes overwhelming so unless you get some outstanding character you will usually use the same teams as in the very beginning.

So overall it is interesting, but it is hard to deal with stronger or equal strength forces. Starting to snowball by solving the initial puzzle and keeping it rolling feels great though. The game is badly balanced for a strategy game. There are a lots of thing to do but some of them are just not good enough and you hardly do them.  Also the game have worse diplomatic system that I can see, feeling like every diplomatic move doesn't matter. 
 Great game, the translation is garbage tho

name: Mortos
short_description: Mortos is a FPS video game set in near future where the human race is dying after the arrival of the undead army, the hero has to fight and destroy completely all the undeads in various maps or places that are in different setting/scenarios to restore the dead city and complete the goal.
reviews:
o live in hearts we leave behind is not to die. [b][quote][url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asset_flip]Warning: Asset Flip![/url][/quote][/b]Mortos is a Digital Homicide style asset flip, or what Valve calls a "Fake Game". The "developer" paid for/pirated a few Unity asset store packs, dumped them all in a blender, and submitted it to Valve as if they're real game developers.

The bulk of this game is just reskinning the old [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/game-toolkits/ufps-ultimate-fps-233711]Unity Ultimate FPS[/url] game package with some other assets stolen/borrowed from around the place... actually the game got more attention from the toxic developer harassing reviewers, and the review manipulation than as a game itself.  This is one of the games Jim Sterling picked up on when shedding some light on the increasing number of asset flips and other fake games that had started to flood Steam.  

Which should tell us everything we need to know about the game, and it's very true... asset flips wouldn't even be a thing if the stolen/plagiarised assets were attached to a fantastic game.  I mean, look at games like I Am Fish that use assets from the asset store... but they don't comprise most of the game.

Two notable criteria for what makes an asset flip instead of legitimate use of stock assets are whether those assets comprise the majority of the game, and whether the "developer" properly credited the people who created most of the assets in the game.  This game fails both of those tests.  The "developers" here didn't credit any of the artists and real, actual game developers who created the assets here, so this is plagiarism, as well as cash grab shovelware.

Despite not being in Steam Early Access (where this arguably belongs), the game is missing features and is apparently incomplete.  Due to the lack of meaningful progress from the developer, it's unlikely the game will be completed at all, yet the developers reprehensively have their hand out for money for an incomplete game.  This is a good reason for gamers to avoid this.

Taking this shovelware seriously as if it was a genuine attempt to make a game, it doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, left handed gamers or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

Mortos didn't appeal much to the people who own a copy of the game, either.  It has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game didn't really capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for starting the game, trivial to get, but less than 25 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  Hardly a success story, gamers just weren't all that interested in the game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this only happened once, around the same time that trading cards were applied to the game... so this is just card idlers getting their cards and moving on.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

This game features a number of suspicious, likely fake positive reviews. The reviews all appear at almost exactly the same time, very shortly after the game launched on Steam, all have a direct Steam purchase of the game, and all have very similar wording and writing style (all in Italian, same as the developer, weird huh).  Immediately after this huge peak of reviews, reviews (and player counts) for the game dropped incredibly sharply.  This is highly unusual given the very low quality of the game and poor player counts.  The "Positive" review score on this game should be taken with a large grain of salt.  This might have been done to deceive/mislead gamers into paying for a bad product.

So, should you buy this game?  Is this one of the best of the 100,000+ games on Steam?

Mortos is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, and the questionable ethical nature of the developer and/or their associates (as outlined above), this is impossible to recommend.  Remember that if you buy a game from an unethical developer, you're putting your money at risk. ‚£ø‚£ø‚°ª‚†ø‚£≥‚†∏‚¢ø‚°á‚¢á‚£ø‚°ß‚¢π‚†ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£æ‚£ø‚°á‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚°ø‚°ê‚£Ø‚†Å ‚†Ñ‚†Ñ

Mortos is a survival shooter game where you survive against waves of zombies. I've complained about modern games not having enough hit registration but this is something else. There are no bullet tracers, no hit markers, no blood coming out of the enemies, there is NOTHING. You have 3 weapons, that being an SMG, a shotgun and a pistol and they all feel awful‚Äé‚Äé. Shooting at enemies does nothing because you have no clue where the bullets are going. At first I thought the game was headshot based, but quickly found out that was bullshit because headshots don't do anything. 

The game looks like it was made in 1999 and it's dark. To combat this issue the game has a night vision mode. The night vision mode is literally just all of the textures replaced with lime green. Not only is it disgusting to the eyes, but also takes any challenge out of the game.  AI is broken and they will often fall from the sky and the minimap doesn't accurately show where the enemies are. The incompetence of mortos is so high that they give you limited ammo, but then have these spiders follow you around the map. So you can shoot them and waste your ammo or you can knife them to death but risk taking damage. This is a decision that the player should have to make if they messed up and this is their punishment, not if they've played normally and followed all the FUCKING rules. it should come as absolutely no surprise, that baby's first video game is so bad, but goes to show how AWFUL this developer is, because they're not even capable of ripping off better games of this genre. Fuck this. THIS GAME IS SO SCARY!!!!!!!!
 horse shit Needs the option to invert the mouse. kinda broken Trash

name: Embers Adrift
genres: Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Strategy
short_description: Embers Adrift is a unique fantasy PvE MMO - group play truly shines and solo play is still rewarding. Designed with classic MMO principles in mind we desire to bring players together to create lasting memories and friendships in an immersive world wherein you may lose track of time. Welcome drifter!
reviews:
So unoptimized it feels like it could turn your PC hardware into Embers.
What a pitty. Simple old school MMO where developers actually care about the community. Brings back the old school vibes. But has a shared bank. Soloing is possible but grouping is rewarded by better loot and experience. There are friendly veteran players that are very helpful. super fun, has a map well done This is a fairly polished old school MMO which launched in 2023 and has received frequent updates since. The devs are passionate about their project and are active on discord. It runs natively on linux and is now on Steam. It's good. I want to dislike this game, but it's just too good. I am a prior-to-Steam release player with 100s of hours.

Fantastic game that has plenty of adventuring, crafting, questing, grouping, and soloing fun.  This game starts off differently than other MMORPGs - it does not have a dedicated magic/caster class, and you start as a basic tank/dps/healer that does have further specializations later into deeper class mechanics, and adds "magic" in the form of alchemy at level 20.  In addition, all the classes/specializations have numerous abilities beyond their melee-only abilities that fall into magic casting areas.

The starting combat feels slow at first, and it took me a few hours to get it and understand the mechanics.  As you level you gain new abilities.  As you pick your class specializations, you gain new abilities.  When you obtain Alchemy, you gain new abilities.  All of this adds up to more complex combat outside the initial basic levels - but be warned:  higher level baddies also gain new abilities..... not just more HP/Damage.

Stick with this game until at least you obtain your specializations at level 6, and you at least move past the starter zone and the big city.  Group up and go into a dungeon.  Dive into an ember vein and explore.  There is A TON of content beyond the first zone.

„ÄÄ‰∫å„Å§ Sweet music. Great vibes. Sooooo soothing like like your ear got whisper with wind that blow at the mountain top and some surrounding dew make u just a tiny bit cold but feel refresh. It come to your dream like the sound of enemy monk trying to convert your shuper shlow unit. Nah just here want to thank the DEV which is Forgotten Empires, Tantalus Media, Wicked Witch and not forget our publisher Xbox Game Studios for making this game awesome and I love you guys. Keep it up with ideas and stuff. Make more orchestra since the music affect gameplay experience too. I play the game long since the expansion of age of king something until before buying the DE. After all, AoE2 DE will welcome you with scout rush and archer rush. Have fun and enjoy the game!! um guys???? where are the civ themes??? My first time listening to the music was in the definitive edition and I really enjoyed it. I listen to it when playing the game or doing other things outside of the game. Why don't have Main Theme (Extended Mix)? As someone who played the original [i]Age of Empires II[/i] from 1999, I've had the music from that game firmly ingrained in my memory.

For the [i]Definitive Edition[/i], Masten has honoured the original music by making brand-new arrangements of it. The results are phenomenal and manage to be simultaneously nostalgic and excitingly new.

My only gripe is that the metadata is poorly filled in. For example:

Artist: Todd Masten
Album: [blank]
Genre: Other

Disc #: [blank]

I copied the files to my own collection and fixed the tags for myself, but this is a nuisance and shouldn't be necessary. Does anyone know how to install this DLC? I can not find it everywhere.

name: D&D Lords of Waterdeep
short_description: Lords of Waterdeep is an award winning strategy board game, set in the Dungeons & Dragons world of Waterdeep. Play as one of the masked Lords of the City of Splendor. Intrigue abounds as you recruit adventurers, via your agents, to quest on your behalf and spread your influence.
reviews:
Very good light "Euro" game for amateurs. Bring it on ! . One of my favorite board games converted in a quick and efficient way.  Takes the slowest part of the game and automates it in a passable but quick fashion. This is a fun meeple game . It can be confusing a little if you are not familiar with the board game like myself. Actually is a good game. Nice strategy Serviceable digital adaptation of a great game.  Menu UI is pretty rough, and in-game is still a weird mobile-first feeling experience, but once you get the hang of the flow things should get easier.

Good in multiplayer. very accurate reproduction of the board game.  For me the medium AI is challenging.  Purchased the base game and two DLC for less than $ 15, before tax What can I say that hasn't already been said? This game is amazing. The board game is amazing. The translation from board game to video game was very well done. very pleasing The AI in this game cheats WAY too much.  Signalling in  game is unclear and AI takes advantage of players who don't understand the mechanics, trying to get you to throw out cards when not necessary for example.

name: Labyrinth of Refrain: Coven of Dusk
short_description: Beneath a small town lies an endless maze known as the Labyrinth of Refrain. Dusk Witch Dronya arrives, and with her puppet soldiers, endeavors to find something buried deep within. Embark on an adventure as you discover the secrets underground.
reviews:
I know my way around RPGs, but this game has depths that I didn't even begin to scratch the surface of during my playthrough. While some of the dungeons can get pretty gross even for DRPG standards, this is a phenomenal pickup for the NISA and blobber fans out there. Enjoyable dungeon crawler with unique turn based mechanics, but does a terrible job at guiding players where to go or where to find certain items to progress the story Great story. Good gameplay. I enjoyed it. I love this series so much. This was such a great game. Such an amazing story.

If you have not played any of the two labyrinth games i suggest starting with this one as it is much shorter.

~50 hours for the normal ending and +10-20 hours for the true ending

The game is not very easy. The normal ending is generally doable but the true ending can be really hard so beware. There were multiple points where i wondered if i should just quit.

The story has some dark themes so also beware of that. The game has a solid start but over time the mechanics just become problematic. The whole "gore" system turns avoid into a must-have stat and any other defensive stats are nowhere near as useful. Everything about the gore mechanic just turns the late game into a slog. You'll spend too much time going through menus to disassemble or sell items for repairs. It's just a lot of unnecessary button presses. 

Most of the late-game maps are also just bad designs filled with enemies to pad out the play time.

TL;DR: Great early game, bad late game. Labyrinth of Refrain: Coven of Dusk is a grid-based Dungeon Crawler. As a magical book that can summon puppets, you travel through different realms, battle monsters, find treasure and, at certain points, continue the story in the overworld.

The story of the game is honestly pretty good, though it starts out slow and is a bit hard to understand at times. It's worth sticking with, though, even if it is told a bit too fast, or too slow, or too obscurely here and there. I ended up enjoying it more than I thought I would.

The problem, however, lies in the most important part - the gameplay. It is sadly very repetitive, with a lot of obscure stats, useless pacts (items you can slot your puppets into to gain access to skills) and bosses that you need certain pacts or items to defeat, but if you miss that information, good luck unless you just look it up on the internet because it will not be mentioned again. This is especially terrible with the final boss where you need a certain pact to even begin to scratch it and not die immediately, and how to get it (and that you even have to get it at all) is extremely hard to discern and player-unfriendly.

I was still going wrestling with myself on recommending the game up until that boss, but I think overall, I just can't really. Despite spending quite some time on it, I constantly went from moderately entertained to annoyingly frustrated, sometimes multiple times in the same dungeon floor. Enemies are annoying, because there are a lot of them and while you do eventually get a spell to avoid them, they still can easily run into you or just pop up in a one-grid wide floor. And battles are easy because most of the time you just put your puppets on auto battle or use aoe spells over and over. Only the bosses require a bit of tactics, and even then, brute force wins most of the time, which makes the few times it doesn't even more irritating. It's hard to tell just *why* you lost a fight. Do I need more resistance against the element attacks of the boss? Do I need to grind? Do I need to soul transfer to make my puppets stronger? Your puppet's stats are hard to read and equipment is too numerous and has too many stats to really tell what exactly would make your puppets stronger aside from the obvious strength or DP (think magic). It's complex for the sake of complexity, but it makes it all the much harder to play and have fun with.

The gameplay loop itself, at least, is entertaining most of the time because slowly uncovering the entire grid of a dungeon floor is just fun in most games that feature it. You find treasure chests, and locked chests you can only open with a key later but that usually contain powerful equipment, and grinding, while annoying at times, can be done faster with the Stockpile feature, so you at least feel a constant sense of (very slight) improvement. Only for the next boss to probably kill that sense of improvement immediately.

I don't know, to be honest - just like the game, I feel this review is all over the place. Overall, though, I just don't think I can recommend it unless you are a hardcore fan of grid-based Dungeon Crawlers who loves maximizing their characters even through some obscure, hardly explained systems. The story, at least, is somewhat worth it - if you can make it through the game surrounding it. It's much, much better than Mary Skelter (which I hated), but it's no Grimrock or Grimrock 2 (which I loved). It's off, somewhere, doing it's own thing, for better or for worse. i love the mechanics and gameplay, but the story and writing are awful. i just skip all the story. Solid dungeon crawler, story is pretty good and the art is a plus. Haven't finished the game yet but if things keep up like it is so far it'll definitely be worth the money. Long story short, I'm seriously enjoying this game. 

Short story long: 
I did not come into this title with high expectations. When I see NISA I think of Disgaea, which is well known for its solid game play mechanics and silly bland storylines that are there for the sole purpose of barely explaining why the game play is occurring. This game begins in a similar fashion. The characters seem simple and one dimensional, the art style is everything you're used to from NISA, the humor is simple and slapstick, with some minor ecchi gags thrown in very sparingly. 

The gameplay is solid without being particularly innovative. Breaking walls is a neat idea for the genre, and the concept is implemented well.  Combat strategy is mostly handled outside of combat.  Learning how to manage the right stats on the right characters is the key to winning 95% of your combats, and there is never really a situation that is so unexpected that you won't know exactly which commands to use in combat. This can make the game feel repetitive, but unless you're seriously overleveled, combat encounters are varied enough that some strategic decisions are made on the spot.  If you're getting bored you can increase the difficulty later in the game.  

Progressions systems are fairly similar to Disgaea (leveling characters, upgrading gear, reincarnation mechanics and such). It's simple, it's intuitive, and it's well executed. Basically it's everything I expected from NISA. 

With all of this I expected to go through this game at a leisurely pace without having to think too hard about what was happening. I certainly wasn't expecting the story to take the turns it did.  It was all fun and games...until suddenly it wasn't.  

Put simply, this story gets DARK.  If you're the kind of person that appreciates trigger warnings consider this review to be just that.  This story deals with some HEAVY topics, and by the end of it the narrative is complex, the twists are unexpected, the "hidden" lore is deep, the loose ends are all nicely wrapped up, and the emotional impact is significant.  I was fully invested in the story by the time it was over, and I think it's an experience that's going to stick with me long after I've moved on to other games.  

If you enjoy grid based dungeon crawlers but also want a great story then this is a must-buy. This is quite a bewitching piece of entertainment, one gets to be a part of. A rather mature, captivating story that unfolds as the adventure goes on.
Of course, I recommend playing with the original voice acting, for it is very delightful.

name: Whisper
short_description: Whisper is a puzzle game about sound shaping our reality. Human perception is guided by visual input. We know that a tree is a tree because it looks like a tree. What if we took that away? If you hear the sound of a falling tree, but no one can see it, are you still in a forest? Knock on wood.
reviews: Amazing concept! especially when you get to dynamic objects like water and dogs, i was able to glitch my character into a water state and fly all over all of the maps however. It's an interesting concept, navigating via sound. Quite short but I would be interested to see this game design expanded on. haha breaking glass go brr

name: Captain The Runner
short_description: Captain The Runner is an endless runner game based on retro graphics, where the player must avoid colliding with the cars, buses, spaceships, water bodies and much more.
reviews:
Endless retrostyle (NES) runner game with lots achievements. 
Most of achievements are very easy, but couple little difficult. This is an automatic runner like most mobile games today. There are a few different maps. You move through 3 different lanes of traffic to collect points. You can jump. That is all there is to it. 

However, the graphics are bad. The screen seems to tear when switching lanes to the point of hurting your vision. When you hit something, there isnt a game over. You just go back to the main screen. This makes the game feel unfinished. 

Only played long enough to get all the achievements and got this game through a bundle with other games.

Avoid at all cost.

name: Niffelheim Bloody Moon DLC
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy
short_description: The Bloody Moon DLC features a long night, a red moon and lots and lots of spiders and skeletons. No hens or hares, it‚Äôs just you and your dragon - let‚Äôs set everything on fire!
reviews:
Must have üëç This is absoloutly useless, all the DLC for the game add nothing to the game, this is just some sort of cheat code to unlock everything at the begining, instead of earning it through the game.
Since when this kind of cheat could be sold as a DLC ? Never would have bought them if the description was clear, at first i tought that this was adding awesome content.
Also, for those interested, playing a new game from a DLC deactivate achievments. Niffelheim Bloody Moon DLC Review

Bloody indeed; prepare for a long red night‚Ä¶ The moon is red and enemies aplenty!

Please note that this Review may contain spoilers from the Base game 

Some key points that this game add on has to offer:

1.	Fully upgraded workshops 
2.	No levelling system
3.	A Dragon from the start of the game
4.	No quests
5.	Very challenging experience. 

Replayability:

Niffelheim Bloody Moon DLC adds a new game mode to the list. Full on Survival. It still shares the same replay value as the base game.

Several changes were made to the game to increase the challenge that the game offers you. Along with that comes several benefits to help you survive. The days are shorter and the nights longer‚Ä¶, much longer. 

Here is a full list of changes made to the game:

‚Ä¢	Players have a dragon from the very start
‚Ä¢	No quests
‚Ä¢	No farms
‚Ä¢	Only a wooden castle that you can set on fire using your dragon!
‚Ä¢	No bots
‚Ä¢	The day is 4 hours long, whereas the night is 20 hours long
‚Ä¢	A lot less vegetation, all the trees are dry
‚Ä¢	All workshops fully deployed
‚Ä¢	No character development, just a handful of weapons
‚Ä¢	Spiders can poison you and skeletons can injure you
‚Ä¢	The dungeons are smaller, but there are still enough resources
‚Ä¢	Your castle gets assaulted 100% more often and there is only 1 chest and no vault!
‚Ä¢	The dragon burns everything except for mushrooms!
‚Ä¢	The city is closed and you cannot enter! There‚Äôs nothing to do there!
‚Ä¢	Spiders and skeletons run amok at night

Characters have abilities as default:

‚Ä¢	Warrior - Frugality 75%,
‚Ä¢	Valkyrie - Laborer 75%,
‚Ä¢	Berserk - StunBlockChance 75%,
‚Ä¢	Shaman - PoisonBlockChance 75%

MGR Gaming‚Äôs Conclusions:

Unlike Odin‚Äôs Blessing making the game more relaxed and easier, Bloody Moon does the exact opposite. 
As you can see from the above list. Ellada Games went above and beyond altering the gameplay mechanics, tweaking them to offer us a brand new thrilling experience.

There is no limit, no quests, it is all about surviving as long as possible. The workshops being upgraded to their highest level here is pretty much the biggest help, that and starting with your trusty fire breathing dragon. The perfect go to in a pinch! 

This DLC sells for such a low price, I urge you to buy it just to support the awesome developers, as for the DLC itself, it is more than worth it. Veteran survival players and Niffelheim fans will enjoy this one quite a bit!

Those that bought the game during its Early Access stage, will receive their copy of the DLC for free. Those that didn‚Äôt can still buy the DLC at a very low and affordable price.

Score 7

name: CapooPals - 2023 Summer Pack
short_description: "Completely stress-free desktop games, heal your boredom at work and school Let the cute and funny Capoo accompany you every moment of using the computer"
reviews: more capoo what to not to like

name: BAKERU
short_description: Bakeru's adventure begins in this Japan-esque Wild Action Game!
reviews:
Mario dual wielding bludgeons. I love this game. Well done port and an entertaining game most of the way through! I do think the game kind of drags on towards the end of it (an then just kind of ends) at least there's a lot of levels to go through. I encourage any Nintendo, Goemon fans or fans of Good Feel to support this release to let it be known that there's a market for developers like Good Feel on Steam so that we can get more games and other developers to bring their games here (I.E. to let other developers that (have) worked for Nintendo like HAL, Grezzo, etc that there is a market out there for their games here).

I know some have compared this to the Goemon games and while I see some similarities and enjoy those games a great deal I don't think its an apt comparison since a lot of it is mostly surface level comparisons imo. As far as gameplay is concerned its more akin to 3D World than a Goemon game. I think there's a lot of room for improvement (the story, gameplay loop, easy difficulty, retreads, level design etc) but for a debut game in this series, this is a good foundation. If there is a sequel I think ironiclly adding a couple more elements from the Goemon games (like having town hubs with NPCs and shops, coop, more level variety, more culture influence, etc) would be something I'd like to see. 

To address some of my complaints, the combination of the level design being very uninteresting and the game being generally really easy it can make going through levels back to back feel like a slog (and the idea of going back to find the hidden collectables feel like a chore). With there only being 3 types of levels it doesn't help the feeling of going through the motions. During the first part of the game I feel had a good pace with the story and levels but after that I feel the story takes a backseat and the later levels dont make up for it since it feels like more of the same. I'd honestly wouldn't mind if like almost half of the levels were cut or at least put aside as extra end game levels (cause honestly thats what they feel like). The Henge mechanic was a nice idea but since only one of them is a real transformation that effects traversing the levels while the rest are for combat, it feels really under utilized since once you get the fishing one there's really no reason to use the others 2. The difficulty makes this game feel like a baby game and Im sure thats what the target demographic was but as someone who has played a lot of good feels other games, I feel like they usually have something there for players who are looking for a challenge an its just not here imo. If it finding the collectibles then they missed the mark cause there's not much of a challenge finding them (for the most part). I think this game could have benefited from a hard/experienced mode cause the game gives you a ton of safety nets and it kind turns any challenge the game throws at you into a boring one. Despite all that I still enjoyed the game, I just wish it was more engaging for a player like me.


{Steam Deck notes}
I mostly played this on the Steam Deck and was very pleased with the performance of it both docked and handheld and I really appreciate the buttons glyphs matching whatever controller Im using (it even could detect if I was using a the Switch or Xbox layout). Bakeru is an interesting enigma, especially speaking from someone who did not play much of the Goemon games which this is very clearly derived from. What plays, feels, and looks like a remastered PS2 title, you‚Äôre tasked with beating the living Hell out of demons to the beat of your own drums to restore peace to the country land. You‚Äôll acquire various powerups called Henge that will allow you to hit from far distances, shrink down to access small passageways, and many others. Your gameplay loop is platformer to the core with collectables strewn about the levels to find, coins and energy dropped from enemies you spam light attacks against, and stumbling across secret Scoops with various facts and, uh, ‚Äúfacts.‚Äù

The issue falls primarily on if you don‚Äôt fuck with the loop, you‚Äôre going to lose yourself wanting to progress, because if you‚Äôve played 45 minutes of Bakeru: you‚Äôve played 10 hours of Bakeru. Even with all the additional power-ups and doodads that you find along the way, almost all enemies are handled with spamming light attacks and the occasional heavy to break guard. Bosses are pedestrian with very little resistance to just pummeling them to death without consequence. Bakeru just feels stretched so thin to provide maximum value that its amount of levels is more of a hindrance than benefit. They just start throwing characters that need to be saved in the middle of the game and I could feel myself withering away knowing they just added 15 more levels with that plot addition.

Bakeru isn‚Äôt a bad game per se, it‚Äôs just painfully unaware that a platformer of this caliber can be short and sweet without having to try everything in the wheelhouse to garner its popcorn moments. I put the game down a few months ago hoping some time away would spark some interest, but nothing is drumming up the desire to get back into it. 

[quote][h1]Follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33247611/]A Review Is Worth 1,000 Words[/url] for more Steam Reviews.[/h1][/quote] An abundantly charming game with a colorful cast of characters, bright and vivid levels to explore, and plenty of stellar gameplay variety, BAKERU was a game that I had once lost hope would ever be localized. Now that is actually has, I'm so grateful because it is a stellar game. Every level introduces and expands upon new ideas and concepts, brings with it impressive locales across a fairy-tale Japan to visit, and yes, that aforementioned gameplay variety keeps things fresh. 

Many levels are exploration and platforming-based, yes, but others will have you race in a cute canine robot, dogfight (quite literally) in that same robot within aerial battles, and also enter the cockpit of a massive teapot mech. The game is insane in all the best ways, bursting with creativity, clever level design, and engaging boss battles too. Highly recommended! Super fun 3D platformer / brawler with extreme japan energy. Also just genuinely one of the best looking games I've ever played. My only regret is that there weren't a few more challenging platforming bits, because it's definitely on the easier side. But still, this is an easy recommendation for fans of the genre. Just plain fun. Super charming and unique. If you fw PS2 era platformers you cannot miss this A great collect-a-thon game with a strong Goemon influence in its aesthetics. Hidden Gem and currently one of the best PC titles in its genre.
Lots of humor, great Boss fights, fun platforming , lots of variety and collectibles.

This game was only released for Switch and PC. want to have fun? its time to play bakeru
 This is a wonderful 3D platformer that's bursting at the seams with both charm and content.  You take on the role of Bakeru the tanuki and attempt to liberate Japan from an evil oracle who wants to subject the entire country to a never-ending demonic festival.  Along the way you'll meet new friends and pick up new transformations to help defeat the oracle's party-obsessed minions.

This game felt like a real labor of love from the devs.  This also just feels like a straight-up, fun platformer . . . for me, it had similar vibes to a 3D Mario game or Astro Bot.

Pros:
+ 63 unique levels.  All of them are quite big, and most of them are visually and thematically unique.
+ Three different types of (optional) collectables for you to find scattered throughout the levels.
+ It mixes up the gameplay (e.g. there are some racing, mech fighting, and space shooter levels).
+ There's a decent number of unique boss fights.
+Heavy focus on Japanese culture making for a unique experience compared to other platformers
+You'll be smiling the whole time playing this game

Cons:
-Walking towards the camera causes your character to slowdown instead of maintaining his speed. 
-Revisiting specific levels is a bit annoying towards the end due to the map layout/ travel mechanics.
-There probably should have been a few more regular enemy types. 

In short, if you're a 3D platformer fan this is definitely one you'll want to check out.  It's a great experience.

name: Highway Blossoms - Soundtrack
short_description: All 29 songs written for Highway Blossoms.
reviews:
Phenomenal soundtrack. My personal favorites are 'Hawaiian and Salt', 'Lost with the Wind' and 'Backroads'.
Plus, you get to support the devs, so why not? üíú Great OST for great VN. Highly recommend, if you liked the game. [h1]Loving Highway Blossoms means loving the music as well, this is an absolute must to get.[/h1]

By buying this amazing soundtrack you'll get songs from artists like: Able Kirby, BAGman, Jake Abernathie, Kevin Turner, Sarah Mancuso and Smoke Thief in a total of 35 different songs in both FLAC and MP3, now that's a deal!

Country music, Rock, Jazz and other genres that I don't even know myself but they all give out such pleasent feelings and emotions that it matters little.
An absolute must of an purchase and even without a sale it's still so cheap, I bought it before I even finished the story, that's just how much I came to love it and normally I'm not even much for this kind of music!
And just like with the artbook, it's another amazing opportunity to support the developers.

Electric Shoehorn is the best track of them all, no doubts~ üíú A jarringly good soundtrack for a small indie VN. I dunno what black magic they did to have such a suberb OST, but I'm not complaining. Its the kind of soundtrack that's good regardless of what it's from, rather than being good in context of the game. Like I'd probably buy this album if it was just some standalone ambient album. That good. Good job, guys. Really good job. I often listen to it, especially hawaiian and salt. It's a pleasure to drive around with since I'm in the desert, really is good road trip music. The music was a big part of the game and still makes me feel a lot Perfect soundtrack for Highway Blossoms. The tracks were really good for setting the mood and tone of whatever scene was happening in the game. You just gotta love these emotional tracks. Still listen to it when feeling down sometimes. Absolutely phenomenal soundtrack. One of the best game soundtracks I have heard and worth the full price and even more.

I have been listening to it for hours since I bought it and I know for sure that it will stay in my playlist for a long time to come.

There is MP3 and FLAC version included and I'm so glad for the FLAC this time. I have Marina's Mixtape set to my alarm.

It's just [i] that [/i] fire!
and so are the other songs. This is honestly such an amazing soundtrack. 
Trust me, it's worth it. Felt guilty about getting the game for 1eu

name: InsanZ - Dr.Test
short_description: Are you ready for Dr. Test¬¥s place? Wander his laboratorys, explore his place and discover new enemys, crazy machines and new items. Experience survival-horror.
reviews:
This DLC has no content. 

It does not work until you manually extract it from the local game files and start the "Insanz DRTEST Home.exe" as an administrator. 
Doing only that was already more fun than the original game, so I guess this DLC scored fully at improving the experience.
If you are one of the lucky few to actually run this you will see no change to the game. I have no idea where the screenshots on the store page are coming from, but since the game is literally unplayabe with so many glitched out parts you will not be able to pass you would never get far enough to witness the stunning effects of the Dr.Test DLC anyways... I am pretty sure you wouldn't even want to see them. 
(If anyone can ever prove me wrong on these then I will instantly lose my faith in humanity for containing an individual actually willing to try out InsanZ DLCs... That must really not ever happen.)

Don't wonder about the price. Since a few months ago this DLC will be add to your library for free if you purchase the standard game alone and I doubt they will ever have to be manually purchased anytime soon again. At least that's something. 

So overall this is nothing but some broken coding, but in fact still better than the game, so I rate up, whatever.

name: Coloring Pixels - Patterns Pack
short_description: Unlocks the Pattern themed book for Coloring Pixels. Includes 20 new optical illusion and pattern inspired levels to complete! Expect images designed to trick the eye and geometric patterns which are satisfying to complete.
reviews:
Didnt enjoy it as much as other packs, book 3 was more enjoyable than this i can see it being boring and painful for some (or most) people, but i kinda like it. 
i do recommend this pack; all the images are full squares(there are no empty spaces, meaning there are a lot of pixels to color which equals more content i guess) n plus, i like patterns.
^^ 1 - Honeycomb: Small, and there's only four colors so it's a very simple image.
2 - Spinning: Not difficult to finish, but the colors clash so hard it's a little painful to look at.
3 - Cubes: Rather dull, both in colors and in difficulty.
4 - Circles: Not a fun image to complete. You really have to scrounge for the pixels of each color.
5 - Geometric Fractal: It's okay. Not too difficult, but nothing to write home about.
6 - Rug: Another scrounging, not fun image.
7 - Metal Tiles: See image 6. 
8 - Sand: Another image with only four colors, but an incredibly tedious image to complete.
9 - Color Illusion: Probably the most fun image in the pack, to be honest. Long, simple, and very grey. Not bad to look at.
10 - Corners: More dull tedium, but at least it's kind of pretty.
11 - Scales: Not terrible in terms of completion, but overall it's just alright.
12 - Spiral: It's at this point in the pack I have to wonder if the person who made these images is a sadist.
13 - Beneath: Not exactly a 'pattern' but it's not bad to complete and it's a fun image.
14 - Dot Illusion: Easy but boring.
15 - Rainbow Weave: It's pretty to look at. That's about it.
16 - Line Illusion: Yet another tedious image to complete.
17 - Colorful Fractal: It's at this point in the pack where I know for certain the person who made these images is a sadist.
18 - Jigsaw: This one's genuinely a good image. Not boring to complete, and fun to look at.
19 - Kaleidoscope: This is actually awful. So. Much. Detail work. 
20 - Stars: Pain. Physical pain.

Overall thoughts: This is one of the few DLCs for this game I don't like. Most of the images are tedious and boring to finish, save for three somewhat pleasant images, and several downright painful ones. The only reason I'd say get this pack is if you want to 100% the achievements. Cool One of the better packs, though it does kind of get hard to stare at some of them I did not enjoy this pack at all, but I might have a bad relationship with repeated patterns. Well executed concept Generally better patterns that found in other packs so far. I thought the last picture was a bit too big and repetitive for its design, honestly, but pretty much all the rest were good. No real tiny puzzles here either, even the 50x50's are full-square puzzles. Not the greatest pack so far but one of the better ones. Puzzles are all very low quality in terms of complexity, difficulty, and enjoyment of solving the puzzles.  All of them are extremely monotonous, boring, and extremely easy to complete.  The third largest puzzle in this set, 220x220, I was able to solve in roughly 45 minutes or so.  With 42 different colors, I was expecting a lot more play time with that puzzle.

There is only one puzzle that I think will actually challenge me, and that is the largest puzzle, but with so few colors, even that puzzle, I feel, will still be very mundane to solve after a while.

I cannot recommend these puzzles to buy unless you are a completionist and want to get every achievement for this game. Welp, once again. :D FINALLY


lol ive beaten it, yey.

name: Monster Girl Breeder
short_description: You settle in for a gaming session with the latest erotic fantasy game, suddenly you're whisked away to a fantasy world! Waking up in front of a horde of horny monster girls, its up to you to repopulate their isolated village!
reviews:
I'll be blunt here. This VN really sucks. The translation is awful, phrasing and pacing are equally bad and it was not an enjoyable time. Only two things bring this up from being a total trash fire, but only barely. The price was low, a definite case of 'you get what you pay for', and the artwork was actually pretty good, even if more censored than honestly needed. 

If the creators would perhaps like to fix this total mess, may I first suggest eliminating the phrase 'meat toilet' from use? Following that, make use of a thesaurus. It's one thing to remain true to a translation, but another to make something that isn't a constantly repeating mess that frankly isn't fun to read. Im here for the monsters... the lady ones! Two words. "Dick milk."
Two MORE words. "Meat toilet."
Are you serious? This game is really rocky from the start- the main character is the most basic type- rude, not thought out, no personality other than "horny and desperate". All of the girls look pretty much the same, too- pale with big breasts. There's no differences in them hardly at all, minus the ONE, let me repeat, ONE girl of color. 
The MC is also a dick- like, I guess some people are into that, but the characters are all the same. It's just... sad. Definitely more like, worth two dollars than the ten it costs. And I STILL would have requested a refund. 
Don't waste your time or money. Interesting girls with cute voices (I like the Ogre best), but the story was quite lacking, considering it being in a fantasy world. Not really a game I just skipped the entire story looking for game but all i got was all the achievements Artwork is okay, plot of pretty bad and kind of boring. Man I love Monster Girls

Gosh I need to stop giving these people money this visual novel is not for the faint of heart. If you're into monster girls, anime, and explicit sexual content, then this is the perfect game for you. The story follows the protagonist who finds himself in a world filled with beautiful monster girls, each with unique desires. As the player, you get to explore and engage in sexual encounters with these creatures, building relationships with them.

The artwork is beautifully crafted (Although censored or just a road or tavern...) The music and sound effects add to the immersive experience, making the player feel like they are truly in this fantasy world railing these monster girls

The game offers a wide range of sexual encounters, from vanilla to more taboo. However, the game also offers the option to skip any sexual content that the player may not be comfortable with, making it accessible to a wider audience.

Overall, this visual novel is a must-play for anyone who enjoys anime and erotic content (As long as you are okay with it being censored more than the fcc censors the hell out of everything) . The storyline and character development are not there but come on, saying you are buying this game for the story is like saying "Hey honey i'm gonna go run and grab a SALAD FROM MCDONALDS, or walking up to a hooker and paying for a hug... Either way the explicit sexual content is tastefully done, the moaning really did it for me, i was like a squirrel on meth for half of it...
11/10 i recommend. It's exactly as advertised just so not worth it

name: King's Table - The Legend of Ragnarok
short_description: In this modern take on an ancient board game similar to Chess, one side must defend Odin against an onslaught of attackers as he makes his escape to one of the corners of the board. Use sharp strategy and tactics to help Odin reach safety before he is caught defenseless between multiple assailants!
reviews:
Tags: Boards & Cards
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Authentic dosbox music does not quite make up for the odd custom ruleset of the chess game. No other game modes.

The game is straight from the DOS era. With heavy pixelization, somewhat delayed input recognition. This compounds with the tweaked rulesets of the game and the ease of making mistakes and clicking on invalid things.

Altogether it is slim pickings for the Battle Chess simulations. Perhaps Check VS Mate would offer a viable alternative but it is quite flawed.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/211070/Check_vs_Mate/ So far this is after one game - I'll update if anything is different after further games.  This is to the ancient game HnefTafl what Battle Chess is to Chess.  It gives a game played like HnefTafl with some variations on what you choose for special pieces, table, etc, but gives you little animated battles between the pieces.  However it is from the same time period as the original Battle Chess so very pixelated and at times difficult to see clearly on a modern screen.  But I enjoyed the game and appreciate having a Battle Chess version of this ancient game as well.  I look forward to trying it more.

I would recommend this for those interested in games like Battle Chess that don't mind the aged graphics and it running in Dosbox.

name: MAGIX Music Maker 2015
short_description: Drag & drop to create your own songs with MAGIX Music Maker 2015. You have complete control of all instruments and tools right from the start - no previous experience is required. Your equipment includes more than 3000 sounds & loops, two powerful synthesizers and a heavy-hitting drum machine with an 8-bit look.
reviews:
been using this for 4 years A great piece of software for first time composers wanting to experiment first hand before coming up with original works, this version of the software is simple, easy to use and effective in the outcome of the use of loops. Can also integrate your own compositions and make more out of it I just prefer the looping as my laptop isn't the best for doing separate recording works but none the less a fine software for beginning composers and artists. Bad input lag.
Stuttery playback.
Analog Synth completely froze up while entering notes.
That's as far as I got before quitting to request a refund.
Worst DAW I've ever used. Even Mixcraft is better than this.
 I really like it. It's easy to put together tracks for just about anything. It has drum machines and sythisizers and not just one of each, there are multiple to choose from. It's a little glichy such as the sound bar getting stuck which you have to zoom out or in to get it to fix the ability to horizontal scroll. It's positives out weigh it's flaws, the leasrning curve is steep for this program, help menus do well to curb that somewhat.

I suggest using this program with Sony's Audio Studio.


 Magix Music Maker 2015 is a good tool in terms of ability especially for beginners. However when it comes to operating the software begins to lag no matter what after 10 minutes or so. I personally would not recommend the program because of this simple error. Also, the publishers of this program deserve no money if they can't be bothered fixing it. I used this software for a few days now it crashes all the time. I can barely get anything done in MAgix Music Maker. If you can buy a different DAW than this crap. The interface is not easy to use and writing your own music is harder than other DAW's I have use. Save your money buy something better. Personaly, this software is my favorite, and I also use th full versions of Ableton Live 9, and FL studio. Magix Music Maker also is very easy to use and can help you create good music! But do not get this sofware if you are looking to make dubstep music, (had lots of trouble with that). I think that house producers should buy this ~Pual the Sex Offender Fix the fucking bugs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And it crashes the shit out of me!!!!!!!!!!!! For some reason I can't get any microphones to work with this shitty program. 
I've read how tos on forums and watched youtube videos and i get nothing. 

waste of $$$$ Awsome software..I use this software to make music and sfx and its pretty fun xD

name: LongPath
short_description: You accompanies the main protagonist in this action-packed 2D rogue lite on his quest.
reviews:
This game is similar to the retrogame Zelda of Nintendo. Not really worth it buying even for the low price.
No soundeffects, minimalistic graphic, and the whole game is only in 3 colours.
U can give it a shot if u want It's an insult to even call this a "game" but I will call it that to simplify this review. I'm only doing this so that other people such as yourself, don't get suckered into purchasing it, like I did.  

[Insert Long Breath Rant] Now answer me this. Have you ever played a game that was so terrible that you immediately uninstalled before you even had a chance to think about what it is that you are doing before you did it at an attempt to save yourself every last nano second of time that you spent wasting away playing that particular flavor of doo doo? Well that's this game. 

You can swing your sword and you can move your character using the D-Pad against a green tented background. That's the majority of the "game", with the occasional slaying of enemies, who's AI is worse than Anthem‚Äôs upon the initial release. You obtain health after walking several hallways until you get to mini boss events and if you defeat the challenge you awarded a heart piece, not be be confused with a heart container. Did I mention that A & B are swapped but B doesn't do anything at all? That's right, you can't; inspect, read, pickup, throw, jump, dash, bring up menus, check inventory, switch weapons, pause, etc.

I know it's EA but this isn't that. It's basically a placeholder that tries to trick folks into buying what appears to be a retro style Zelda game but it isn't that whatsoever. STEAM you are failing so hard in your QA/QC (not to mention a million other things but I digress). 

TLDR; Folks this is utter trash with some ok music. Trrust me whne I say, "Hard pass on this!"

name: Galactic Simulator
short_description: Galactic Simulator is a clicker game based on the Fermi Paradox and the Great Filter theory. Players can simulate the evolution of celestial bodies and civilizations in the galaxy from an observer's perspective. The game supports multiplayer mode. Create a unique galaxy with friends!
reviews: It feels wrong calling this a game. Extreme lack of content. Game runs in the background, so if you play it with intent to refund, make sure it shuts before reaching the 2 hour mark. An interesting idea, very poorly implemented.  Progress is EXTREMELY slow. The player has very little influence on the progress (or lack thereof.) The game is very buggy.  Even the Steam achievements (which are pretty much just gratuitous milestones) are badly bugged. Idle game where nothing happens... Interesting idea, horrible execution.

name: The Curse of Kubel+ - Expansion DLC
short_description: Return to Asserya and revisit your favorite characters with all-new character art and voiced lines! Unlock new events as you traverse the fearsome Kaldestan Chasm and save the city of Kaldesta again!
reviews:
absolutely zero nsfw content. not sure what happened but this version, like the princess project, lacks h scenes. Something rising in me when i hear her tsundere voices
And its definitely not my blood sugar (or might be)

It's very nice [h1]Expansion Review[/h1]  

Its rare for these types of games to receive a DLC.  Base game was decent but justifying another 10 bucks is really hard. 

[u]New content[/u] 
Now the ingame text is voiced by the heroine. Good addition in a game that already has such a high amount of quality in it with the very colourful and good art. Also new CG¬¥s by having a whole new ending/post game story that is very liniar though. Also some new standing art. Also some new scenes with another girl i dont care that much about.

[u] Conclusion/TL;DR[/u] 

For 10 bucks if you value the added voice acting and a new post credits ending it might be worth to buy. Atleast it was for me but just barely. I suggest picking it up on a sale. Don't bother buying the DLC (expansion), nothing new... Katrina who? Super-duper dlc. I really like to revisit old games and enjoy them once more. 6/10 how much do i like this? 
When the dlc was released on Dlsite i bought the game again just to play the dlc, that much.

The Curse of Kubel was so close to greatness and was being held up by just two things: a  need for a couple more CGs and the lack of both.

The addition of an epilogue of end C with new CGs,  new scenes with Katrina and full voice acting for Magetano , fix those issues.

Now i have my little personal nitpicks that while dont detract from the overall experience, they still annoy me:
[spoiler]
- END A still has an unnecesary low blow.
-the new epilogue for END C makes Magetano worse than in the fully corrupted END D, wich feel inconsistent since in both she indulges on non-stop sex with Bazria but in END D she shows to feel something when discovered by Cero while in epilogue C she doesnt seem to care about him anymore.
-Epilogue C makes a big deal about Magetano getting pregnat wich falls flat because you can see her literal child in end A

- Missed an oportunity pull an Undertale with Endings C and A. See when you finish a Genocide run in Undertale it corrupts you save giving you a bad ending even if you do the pacifist one.  This game could've pulled out something similar if it used properly the whole "memory of Magetano getting pregnante being  permanent". If you dont have the memory you get a proper happy ending with no brown kid but if you get the "pregnant memory" you get Bazria child in ending A. You could trick them by allow them to lower Magetanos depravity even after completing the ending.

This only makes END C more significant but also rewards those players that went for the pure ending first.
 [/spoiler]

Still a great a adition that allows the original to realize its potential, for the most part. There was an issue with the v2 patch. Not all audio was properly packed. Patch v4 fixed the issue.

Slightly disappointed that not all female character has audio. But all the main protagonist dialogs and reactions are covered. I am happy. A must have, and would like to support the developer. ‚¢∏‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚°∑‚°Ñ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
