name: UBOAT
short_description: UBOAT is a simulator of a submarine from WWII era. It is a survival sandbox with crew management mechanics while its primary theme is life of German sailors. The boat is their home, but it can become their grave at any time.
reviews: Alarm! Alarm! If you like subs like i did this is genuinly perfect, just is kinda a lot memory 68 gigs March, 1941, off the eastern coast of scotland my valiant crew saw a large convoy. I commanded my ship to come into range, during that time my sailor was informed he was now a father. With now more guilt on my mind I pressed onwards with my ship. We fired the first torpedo, was a dud, second a dud, third a dud, fourth was a hit but its too late. Their ships are pressing onto me and I begin to dive. I got to 30 meters before the first depth charges come in. Was a critical hit in the stern. My new father onboard was knocked out, I had 3 leaks in the stern and more charges coming. A few moments later another charge hit the office quarters, I have now lost power to half my ship and we are taking on water fast. In last ditch effort to escape I ordered us to rise to the surface. Yet my kept going down. My hope was peril and my crew was wounded and unfunctional as we sank into the depths of the North Sea. We landed on the sea bed with only a few members alive before the flooding got too high. RIP 1939-1941 It good 10\10 Good game. Realistic mechanics and upgrades are fun! Unterseeboot A realistic experience to say the least. It's honestly incredible just how accurate and in depth the game is. The mechanics of operating the U-Boat requires mathematical thinking and forces you to prepare rather than just go guns blazing, though that is an option if you choose to be so brave. The game does offer the options of the realism for simplicity making it a game that anyone could play without much need to math out your objective. yet stresfull in some scenarios the game will deliver you with the thrill of escape plus you can chose your own mode entertainment mode moderate mode our hard mode i play moderate for some still challanging gamplay that isnt to bad I'm just enjoying the depth charges üí£üí£üí£üí£üí£

name: 868-HACK
short_description: You are a computer hacker. You steal precious data while the world sleeps.
reviews:
Been playing since 2015 but mostly played offline on my laptop hence the few playtime. finally beat it in 2025 hah. but ive always enjoyed it. simple and fun, nice quick play for a bit kind of game. Very fun game. An amazing game for short sessions. Like someone turned a classic arcade game into a rougelike. Accurate simulation of being inside a computer. It's deeper than it seems. yes! I return regularly to this fantastic game and I can't believe it got less than 100 reviews, so here is one more.

A gem of minimalistic game design, 868-Hack delivers a stripped down, tense "Roguelight" experience on a series of 6x6 grids where you have to guide an avatar to the exit while getting rid of an increasing number of adversaries and collecting score if you dare (doing so brings more enemies). Every move is a tough as nails decision where you have to balance resource collecting and management, risk taking, and positional tactics. The large number of possible upgrades (with a maximum of 8 you can get on a given run) makes for the so-called rogue-style experience where you have to improvise in each run a viable and balanced set of powers from what is thrown at you in order to beat the tougher levels and hopefully gather a higher score. The base mechanics are easy to grasp, but you have to experiment to notice some edge effects and interesting synergies between the upgrades. What I appreciate in the minimalistic approach is that you don't need to keep in your mind an entire encyclopaedia of powers, rules and enemies to get good: it is fairly easy to have a good overview after a couple of hours. The elements are simple, but the combinations are always varied and bringing new challenges (when you start getting too good, the game starts throwing more gameplay hindrances at you). Finally, the very simple graphics and sound effects make for a surprisingly unique atmosphere. One of my favorite games! 868-Hack is brilliant in its simplicity and strategic depth. I watched a few videos and didn't really understand the hype until I played it. And yes, I think it lives up to the hype.

You are a smiley face. You run around and activate squares that give you points (your main goal) but run the risk of spawning enemies as well. Some of the enemies can be quite brutal to deal with, but some squares give you active abilities to deal with them. You need one of two resources (sometimes both!) to use them, and thus the analysis paralysis sets in. Do I go for this ability to target all of these enemy types? Do I run the risk of activating 5 enemies to get this point bonus? There's only 8 stages in a run, but by that final stage you are sweating bullets trying to puzzle out how you're going to stop the cyber monsters from swarming you.

It works surprisingly well on the steam deck to boot. At the end of a long day when you're brain is all used up, you fire up a game of 868-Hack thinking "ah this will be a nice relaxing experience to cap the night off with" and by level 8 you're in a cold sweat, viruses and daemons breathing down your neck as you try to struggle out the mental calculus of how to get to the exit with only enough energy to run two abilities. You did it. You survived and escaped. But now do you dare push your luck and try to increase your streak? A classic 868-HACK is one of my favorite games ever! One of the better rogue like loops.

name: Home, James
short_description: James, an aspiring photographer, falls for Cooper, a hard drinking socialite, while working his day job as a sober driver. Consumed by a whirlwind romance they're forced to choose between their dreams and their hearts, knowing it won't be easy either way.
reviews:
Just one of the best romance movies on Steam. Just take it. What is, Home, James?
Home, James, is a movie about James, an Aspiring photographer, James, and a drinker, Cooper, they both meet.
Everything is great in the story, except for one conflict, James want's to stay in Tulsa, Oklahoma, while Cooper wants to move to Brooklyn, New York City. The way they show they love for each other, but at the same time share this difficulty is 
greatly shown in this movie. For .59 cents its a great movie to be watched, for full price, the rental is also very worth it. It's a great movie, and should be one to watch if you like emotional movies. I really enjoyed it.
9/10 A gripping roller-coaster, romantic, emotional indie film. Well worth the money. If something is indie, it¬¥s not automaticly good. The movie starts in a great way, has beautiful scenes. At the beginning they show this fantastic, ambitious girl, but at the end she mutates somehow into a dull, hedonist alcoholic. It¬¥s like the creators wanted to make us hate her, just because she doesn¬¥t obey to the will of the protagonist. The focus on the protagonist¬¥s perspective on the things becomes also too strong in the last half, that¬¥s why the movie loses rapidly its complexity. The trailer promisses a reflection on the problems of the young adults, but the movie gives just another "Girl leaves a guy - story". Amazing movie 10/10.
But i didnt liked the end though. Amazing Film
a must to buy film! 
 A very good and inspiring indie movie.
I can feel the director expressed a very deep affection to his, or her maybe, hometown Tulsa, Oklahoma, which from the movie is a very lovely place.
And the soundtracks of it is great. A little cliche but heartfelt and sincere. A beautiful indie film that, while not the most groundbreaking, is full ouf heart and soul. Definitely worth a watch, or two. I know I'll be watching it again!

8/10

reviews:

[hr]

[h1]Ryan George Style Pitch Meeting: "Packed Train"[/h1]

Game Designer: So, you have a quirky little puzzle game about cute creatures and a train for me?

Publisher: Yes, sir! I do!

Game Designer: Alright, so imagine this: you‚Äôre packing cute, squishy little creatures of all shapes and sizes onto a train. It's simple, fun, and you‚Äôll keep coming back for more!

Publisher: What?

Game Designer: What?

Publisher: Well, okay then! So, what exactly do you do in this game?

Game Designer: Oh, it's super simple! You just take these adorable creatures‚Äîshapes like squiggly little blobs and weird cubes‚Äîand you pack them onto the train. But here‚Äôs the twist: it‚Äôs a puzzle game! You gotta figure out how to fit ‚Äòem all in. It‚Äôs like playing Tetris, but with adorable creatures and trains!

Publisher: Very considerate! So, the game‚Äôs a puzzle where you fit the creatures onto the train. How do you make it interesting?

Game Designer: Well, let me tell you: every level is a new challenge! You get to move creatures around, resize them with power-ups, and watch them squish into place like a jigsaw puzzle of pure cuteness. The levels get harder, but in a fun way‚Äînot one of those ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna cry and give up‚Äù ways. It‚Äôs addictively satisfying!

Publisher: Well, okay then! What makes it different from other puzzle games?

Game Designer: Well, unlike other puzzle games, this one is just SO CUTE! It‚Äôs like if you were solving puzzles while being hugged by a fluffy cloud. It‚Äôs that adorable. Plus, there‚Äôs something oddly relaxing about packing creatures onto a train while hearing chill background music. You‚Äôll want to do it all day!

Publisher: Wow wow wow. Wow. So, how does the game actually play?

Game Designer: So the goal is simple: you take creatures, pack them onto the train, and make sure you have room for everyone. The catch? The train‚Äôs only so big, and the creatures come in all sizes. You need to think carefully, but it‚Äôs not frustrating‚Äîit‚Äôs like a calm, fuzzy challenge that makes you feel like a puzzle master. And the best part? You can move ‚Äòem around with power-ups! You can resize ‚Äòem, squish ‚Äòem, and give ‚Äòem their own little space!

Publisher: Very considerate! Sounds like a very cozy experience. How long are the levels?

Game Designer: Some are quick, some take a bit longer, but the cool thing is, there‚Äôs no pressure! It‚Äôs like a cozy train ride where you just... vibe. Each level‚Äôs got its own little vibe‚Äîcute, chill, and fun. Perfect for unwinding after a long day.

Publisher: Well, okay then! So, what‚Äôs the ultimate goal here?

Game Designer: Well, you keep solving puzzles and filling up trains, but it‚Äôs not about winning or losing‚Äîit's about that sweet, sweet satisfaction of packing everything in just right. You‚Äôre like the most efficient train conductor ever. The puzzle‚Äôs complete, the creatures are happy, and you‚Äôre just vibing. It‚Äôs the ultimate feeling of accomplishment!

Publisher: Wow wow wow. Wow. So what‚Äôs the vibe? Is it relaxing or stressful?

Game Designer: Totally relaxing! You‚Äôre not stressing about time limits or failing‚Äîjust stacking creatures and listening to soft music while the train chugs along. It‚Äôs like a peaceful little journey every time you play!

Publisher: Well, okay then! Sounds perfect for winding down, but are there any challenges?

Game Designer: Oh, for sure! The levels get trickier as you go on, so you‚Äôll have to think more about how to organize the creatures, especially when the train fills up. But it‚Äôs never unfair‚Äîit‚Äôs all about being clever with your space and power-ups. A perfect balance of challenge and fun.

Publisher: Alright, I‚Äôm sold! I love me some adorable creatures and chill train vibes.

Game Designer: Great! Let‚Äôs do this. Choo choo, motherpackers!

[hr]

[h1]Dishonest Trailer: Packed Train[/h1]

In a world where trains are supposed to be organized‚Ä¶ comes a game that will make you wish you‚Äôd never seen a tetronimo in your life.

Get ready for Packed Train, the game where you attempt to fit sentient blocks into an already overcrowded train and fail spectacularly! Forget efficient travel; this is all about shoving your problems into tight spaces and hoping they don‚Äôt explode into pure chaos.

Choose your own disaster and watch as your train gets progressively more ridiculous, like a clown car full of overenthusiastic, block-shaped passengers. Think you're good at Tetris? Wrong. Think you can organize these tetronimoes? LOL nope.

Experience the thrill of:

    >Shoving blocks into spots that you KNOW don‚Äôt fit but doing it anyway because why not?

    >Trying to plan your moves, only to realize every decision you make is a step closer to blockpocalypse.

   >Watching the train get increasingly more packed, and by "packed," we mean a hot mess of desperate, squished tetronimoes and regret.

    >Becoming best friends with your conductor, as they silently judge your stacking skills with every clattering train stop.

Packed Train: It‚Äôs a game where spatial awareness and order take a backseat to chaos, anxiety, and, occasionally, screaming. Will you manage to shove those last few tetronimoes in, or will you be buried in the wreckage of your bad decisions?

Packed Train: Because why just ride a train when you can watch it collapse under the weight of your mismanagement?

[hr]

In a world where trains are packed with squish,
Creatures of all shapes and sizes, make a wish.
They're blobs, they're cubes, they roll and they slide,
They'll squeeze and squish, with nowhere to hide!

Power-ups galore, resize them with flair,
Squish 'em, stack 'em, and fill up the air!
The train's on a journey, with creatures inside,
But oh no‚Äîspace is tight, don‚Äôt let them collide!

No stress, no sweat, just puzzle-filled bliss,
Each squishy block‚Äôs a sweet, blocky kiss.
It‚Äôs not about winning, it‚Äôs just about fun,
Pack 'em in tight, 'til the day is done!

The train‚Äôs always moving, no time to slow,
Creatures get squishier as you go!
Stack ‚Äòem, stretch ‚Äòem, or make them small,
Pack ‚Äòem in tight‚Äîwho cares about space at all?

In this packed-up world, just do your best,
Squish those tetronimos, forget the rest!
So grab your ticket and hop on the train,
Let the chaos begin‚Äîit‚Äôs the cutest brain strain! Packed Train is, well, very likely to be an asset flip.  At face value we can see "Packed Train" is a mobile app (that isn't on app stores, immediately raising suspicions) where you drag and drop Tetris blocks onto a flatbed train carriage.  Pretty shallow stuff and beneath gamers valuable attention right there, but there's more.  See, the game itself is internally titled "Farm Train" by the Polish developers, Ice Code Games, but that's not this game.  Huh.  Is "Games Games" an alt account for Ice Code games?  If not, then we know this is an asset flip.  There's also the matter of the game manifest containing Unity assets from the asset creator, ShaderQuest.  Of course the "developers" behind this credit neither ShaderQuest or Ice Code Games, so it's pretty obvious something highly suspicious is going on.  As always, if it looks shady, it probably is, and my advice is always for gamers to be cautious with their purchasing decisions and stay safe.  There's a lot of unethical developers out there, pushing bad products onto gamers to make a quick buck.

Even if this isn't an asset flip, it has all the same qualities as asset flips, it's shallow, looks like it wasn't designed for PC, feels more like a demo or tutorial than a real game, etc etc.  That alone is enough reason for this to be unrecommendable. 

Well, here's my boilerplate stuff for all the defects that affect this game, if you should decide to take it seriously: 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The game features lazy low-polygon "retro" assets, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the mid 2000s.  It's unclear why the developers weren't able to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets for the game, and also irrelevant... what matters is that this looks bad as a result of their decisions, a compromise PC gamers shouldn't have to put up with.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just iPhone screen tapping stuff.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes "Packed Train" might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 4 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

Packed Train is relatively cheap at $2 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.
 pretty cool friendly cute chill game is like a combination betwin a match 3 and tetris is a neat concept i really recommend this one if you like this kind of colorfull relaxing puzzle games I think this would be a great game for kids.
Very simple to learn, rather easy to master.
The visual style is very much child friendly.
And It is just nice overall, simply enjoyable.
Some adults might also get a kick out of it.
Just a neat little casual arcade time waster.
The default price of this game is quite tiny.
And It simply is a perfect gift for your kids. 
It only requires a mouse. So easy to teach.
This game seems to lack windowed mode.
But that won't matter much to young kids.
I have to give this game: a positive review.
Definitely worth the asking price, for sure.
I'm pretty sure it was all designed for kids.
Perfect for 1st grade in terms of difficulty.
There's also a 'challenge mode' available.
Which might be suited for like 3rd grade.
Dunno, depends on the skills of your kid.
But It's definitely worth buying for them. Yep, it's cheap. Yep, it's kinda fun for a while. Yep, it's cute...in a weird way. Haven't seen hide nor hair of the Steam Leaderboards touted on the game's page. Seems to be only one, yes, a whole ONE puzzle to complete via words even though in the game there's a place to click where you can supposedly see your comleted puzzles...as in plural. Two questions asked in the forums (whew, that's gotta be a record low for any game that's been out for 3 months) and neither with a shred of response from developers. Can a developer answer in shreds? No idea. If there was a rating for MEH I'd choose that. Really fun puzzle game.  Excellent game.

name: Barony: Myths & Outcasts
short_description: Adventure through the Barony dungeons as the evil monster races and all new classes, providing dozens of new gameplay combinations. Or play with a monster skin, just for fun! Play with others whether or not they own this DLC.
reviews:
A DLC that expands Barony with 4 more classes and 4 more races.

These include:
Skeleton(Race)/Conjurer(Class): Skeleton doesn't need to eat, so you can take as much time as you need (watch out if you polymorph, tho, since hunger comes back if you do). HP and MP regen are 25% the normal rate, so watch out. Can recruit Ghouls and Automatons (Not other skeletons, so don't try it). The conjurer is a magic oriented class that summons skeleton allies to aid him in battle. The more they defeat, the stronger they become. 
Vampire(Race)/Accursed(Class): Vampire starts with 2 powerful spells, Levitation and Bloodletting, and can transform HP into MP if magic runs out. You can only feed with blood, however, and water burns. Can recruit Vampires and Automatons. Accursed class is a speedrunner's dream. A strong spell that you can't de-activate that gives strong starting stats, but hunger burns away very quickly (at x5 speed), so you better bolt it!
Succubus(Race)/Mesmer(Class): Succubus gain buffs from cursed equipment and can be unequipped if needed and can't unequip blessed items (they still get the benefits, however), and they start with both Teleportation, and Polymorph spells. Can recruit Succubi, Incubi, Automatons, and drunk or confused humans. The Mesmer class is a magic oriented class that charms enemies to make them fight for you. Specially strong if you can charm and level up named NPCs.
Goatman(Race)/Brewer(Class): Goatman doesn't know how it's got here. You wake up and have a hangover, which you can cure by drinking booze, which also boosts STR/CHR/AC. Can eat tin canned food without an tin opener by eating the tin can directly, and fountains have a chance of giving aditional potions. Can recruit Goatman, Automatons and drunk Humans while you're also drunk. Brewer is a class that focuses on Alchemy. By brewing powerful potions, you can deal big damage to enemies, heal allies, sneak around, paralyze enemies, etc.

Naturally, all of these being monster races, they'll make shopkeepers and humans attack you on sight, so watch out for that.
To play with the DLC classes as other races, you must first beat the game as class with the associated race.
Really fun DLC that expand Barony more. Funny skeleton . This DLC deserves an award just for the last two pictures in the store page! Skeleton is best class in game, trust. SKELETOR, WHY HAVE YOU SUMMONED THE HORDE TO FIGHT FOR YOU? goatman is goated YES! Skelebro ftw hmmm today i will use mix water and acid to duplicate the acid

name: Songs for a Hero - Definitive Edition
short_description: A classic platform with a twist: A dynamic soundtrack and funny lyrics that sings the player's actions and responds to what is happening during the adventure.
reviews:
Well made, fun platformer, great concept. I laughed. Como diria uma pequena pessoinha que conheci: "√â indefect√≠vel". Top! 100! Great game for everyone willing to play a cool platformer with engaging and funny songs Had fun in the start of the game, as the game progresses, the singing becomes very monotonous and boring. The stages doesn't feel that fun, every stage looks the same but with a different color, feels repetitive. Songs for a Hero is a generic platformer that is a waste of time and misuses its one gimmick.

The gameplay is very simplistic to start: Jump, swing sword, and use shield to block. There are 9 worlds consisting of typically 3 levels plus a boss. You gain some new powerup for worlds 1-7 such as charging up to shoot a fireball from your sword, invisibility, swimming, dash, etc. You have lives in this, but enemies, environments and bosses are so non-challenging that you'll rarely die unless you're searching for secrets and get insta-killed in some manner. I had 40+ by the end.

The main gimmick of the hero singing to what you're doing is exaggerated, overdone and not utilized properly. By the time you finish the first world, the singing will mostly be background noise that you'll barely pay attention to while you're platforming or fighting. Most of the time the music is about 1 of 3 things: Something about the current environment of the world you're in, seeing a new enemy for the first time, or something about finding the princess. Typically, the only times the music will be about something you're doing is if some enemy hits you or you land on spikes/environmental object, The music should have been done in a humorous way but most of the time is not. The lyrics are pretty bad and I don't think I laughed a single time while listening. It would've also helped to find a better singer.

There's not too much to complain about other than how generic this all is. You've done all these things in much better games that were far more challenging and rewarding. Of annoyance, there were two spots during the game where there were secrets I could go get but a cutscene triggered and then during the cutscene the hero decides to jump down a pit that there is now no way to go backwards from. One is right after getting the swimming ability which means you'd be forced to replay the level if you want to go swim through the water segments prior to that to get whatever was hidden there.

To further add to the complete lack of challenge and is insulting to the player is that every single level is covered in signs pointing in the direction you're supposed to go or with a skull and crossbones over a pit indicating not to jump into it. Why? Do the makers of this think this is the first platforming game made in the history of videogames and that players will have no idea what to do if there aren't signs everywhere indicating where to go? Was this game made for mentally r3tard3d people? There will be spots with a sign with a down arrow on it right before a ledge and you can clearly see the platform below on your screen and there's no where else to go.

Songs for a Hero is a mediocre generic non-challenging platformer with a wasted and often annoying gimmick. music I'm flabbergasted, this game is WAY MUCH BETTER than i expected. The songs are too good, fun story, real fun gameplay and it's retro looks give a good nostalgia. Come on non-brazilians, give it a try, the english translation is AMAZING, I just had to replay it in english just to listen to it. Unique game. A must play unique platform adventure with specif songs for actions and designs. Fun in English and in Portuguese

name: WALKING IN FOG
short_description: A first-person live-action crime suspense interactive experience. Multiple story branches and endings ‚Äî Dozens of story branches and six different endings. Live-action performances and on-location shooting ‚Äî Real actors and real settings enhance immersion in both the plot and characters.
reviews:
Check out more FMV games at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/45578719]FMV Asia | Áúü‰∫∫‰∫íÂä®ÂΩ±ÂÉèÊ∏∏ÊàèÁ§æ[/url] Important note: This game does have English subtitles, even though it doesn't show on the store page (as another helpful poster pointed out). Just find ËÆæÁΩÆ in the menu, and then change the language arrow to English. For some reason I had to do this every time I started up the game. 
Gameplay: Mostly a series of cutscenes revolving around an undercover cop who's the right hand man in a gang. There's not a lot of romance, but quite a lot of bad choices that can lead to a quick end. In addition, there's not a lot of comedic content, but it's mostly serious and dark in nature, with a fair bit of violence. The suspense and psychological tension that the MC undergoes (illustrated by the spacey time-lapses and loss of focus by the MC's point of view many times) plays a big part in adding to the drama of the story 
It's not a bad game, but I guess, the less smooth scene navigation, slightly confusing paths, and the violence could make it less appealing for those that came here only to play dating sims. It also has one plot and one scene that I still can't figure out how to unlock, and the game might be broken there. But it you like intrigue, plot twists, under cover operations, and the option to choose "questionable" morality choices then this game is for you. You can be a good guy, or a "bad guy" that's really a good guy - it's all in your hands.
And to top if all off, it's only $2, so the couple hours worth of gameplay more than makes up for any annoyances you might experience. And it has English subs! For a $2 game that's pretty good. At first glance, the game seems quite decent. It supports English, although it‚Äôs strange that this isn‚Äôt mentioned on Steam, which could be confusing for potential buyers. There‚Äôs no 4K or 2K resolution support, which might be a letdown for players who prioritize high-quality visuals. The total runtime of all scenes is about two hours, which is adequate for exploring the main character‚Äôs storyline.

name: Trackmania¬Æ Turbo
short_description: Trackmania offers you the ultimate arcade racing universe where everything is about reaching the perfect racing time. Test your skills in over 200 tracks, experience immediate fun by challenging your friends at home (offline splitscreen) or online.
reviews:
ubisoft, remove your stupid malware launcher pls Just plain adreniline This Game really sucks. Dont  be fooled by the pretty graphics. The controlls are horrible. But what really makes this game unplayable is the tracks arent clearly defind. You really dont know where to go. And there are a lot of places on all the tracks for oyu to go off the track or hit somethig on the side and be done with the race.
Why would the devs build tracks that arent clearly defined? Then add to the fac you can hit things on the side of the track and ruin your race? How about tracks with walls? if you hit a wall youll lose speed and time but at least you know where to actually go?
F this game. fun  This game is not worth $40. I do not understand why they keep raising the price. However My friends and I bought it for around $20 and we have sunk hours and hours together in Hot Seat and the campaign is great. Hands down the best arcade racing game on steam. The only two reasons aside from the price that this would receive a negative review is the lack of online multiplayer and the constant prompts from Ubisoft to sign in. I just want to turn my PC on, launch the game and play together. Not mess around with your stupid third party accounts or whatever. Take that out that BS and I will make this review positive. UPlay is the worst, most garbage piece of software I've ever had to try and use. To actually get the game to work:

1. Uninstall UPlay
2. Install latest version of Ubisoft Connect

Actual game is fine if you can get it to work. Excellent performance, gorgeous visuals, and plenty of difficult tracks. The problem is, as always, Uplay. Game is fun, but the required Uplay (now Ubisoft Connect) that comes with the game is so out of date, it cannot auto update itself, and therefore cannot launch the game unless you manually install it. Once again, pirates get a better experience than the people who actually buy the game.

Other than that, the game is great. Plays amazing, and somehow looks better than Trackmania 2020. Highly recommend if you're okay dealing with Ubisoft's BS. Leave it to Ubisoft to ruin a good thing.

Highlights 
1. We can purchase the game via steam but to play it we need Ubisoft App (let that sink in)
2. Downloading Custom Maps is a joke now now. A real joke on the paying customers. (You have to try it to believe it, its so haphazardly put together system and it barely works.)
3. Online Servers are slow and cumbersome to join and Totally Empty.
4. Annoying "Diverse" Voices during races makes my head and my car spin out of control.  (You know you can select your language in other games why pull this diverse joke Ubisoft why)
5. Menus are totally incompetent and confusing. (Menus inside Menus inside Menus inside .............)
6. Its Ubisoft ruining our favourite racing Series
7. Trackmania (2020) is a subscription based scam riddled with adware and bloatware and god knows what else. 
8. UBISOFT CONNECT (BLOATWARE)


To those who haven't purchased Turbo yet and are currently reading this 
AVOID IT LIKE THE PLAGUE. 
And stick to UNITED FOREVER and Trackmania 2. Those are the real Trackmania games.

name: Grim Tales: The Bride Collector's Edition
short_description: After your sister vanishes on her wedding day no one has any idea what happened to her, so it‚Äôs up to you to find the truth!
reviews:
You get ping ponged across the map a whole bunch and the storyline is a bit bland for my liking. I'd recommend it only to get a bit of lore but you get it in other games in the series too. If you love well written stories and captivating characters this game is for you, loved this game since forever so glad I was able to find it again :) It's ok, it's an old game and it feels that way when you play it.
Sometimes the controls are a bit tricky, but it's playable.
Buy with discount =) Honesty this was nightmare, not only you can't go full screen you cant play well, there is thin layer between inventory and going back on next room.. the inventory keeps hovering on and off makes you accidentally go back sheesh! Fun game to beat in under 4 hours GOOD :D I'm giving this game a neutral thumb. I got so irritated by the lack of a map and constant backtracking. The story is not the best either. You are playing with a woman who has a twin sister who vanishes on her wedding day, some witnesses say a dark figure pushed her into the river but her body was not found. You drove to the mansion where you grew up before your sister took it. You noticed it is almost looking abandoned before a demon shows up in front of you to help you find your sister. You carelessly make a pact with the demon and dive into your sister's memories to understand what exactly has happened to her. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2971707712

There are six chapters in the game, whenever you dive into a memory, you'll go to a different area and collect some evidence before going back to the mansion and using whatever item you obtained from the memory. the gameplay is like any hidden object game, but since this is a classic game, it is heavy with hidden objects scenes and puzzles, the puzzles are unique however, and not boring. 

The music is almost none existing, and if it ever plays it is the same track looping over and over, I didn't enjoy it at all, the game sounded quiet most of the time. The journal is good, it gives an additional explanation to the story but I still don't understand how the two sisters separated at a young age and why the main character left. how can she survive alone at the age of 13? Why the twin sister Luisa needs to stay with the nanny while the main character doesn't?
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2971706802

The artwork is good, some of the areas look amazing with all the details. unfortunately the screenshot button not working with this game, I had to follow a workaround method to upload them. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2971707649

Pros:
+Beautiful visuals and location design.
+Lots of hidden objects scenes.
+Beautiful and useful journal keeps track of the story.
+Variety of original puzzles.

Cons
-Some plot holes.
-No fast traveling map.
-No Steam achievements.
-Almost no music in the game.
-No voice-overs.

Sometimes I wish games don't have bonus chapter like this one which doesn't add anything to the story, in fact, you'll wonder why it happened, why they sold the house when they know what is inside of it. Anyway, I only recommend this game if you enjoy classic hidden object games or the series of Grim Tales which I'm planning to play all of it.

Gameplay is very simple/easy

I'd like a larger screen option, but it's still very worth playing at the current size

name: Deadness
short_description: Deadness is a VR game of the horror genre that will literally knock you off your feet. Experience real fear and anxiety helplessly confined to a wheelchair in a super-realistic VR environment. Not for the faint of heart! This is no game anymore!
reviews:
So I'm gonna make this short. The game is pretty cool at times with a decent atmosphere, and it does a really good job at making you feel helpless. With that being said, on my first try I was able to beat the game in under 2 hours. On top of that, I felt motion sick while playing this VERY HEAVILY, and I pride myself on not being very easy to make sick. This game is a pretty good first run through, and I'd say give it a try if you think you can handle being able to use your arms to turn and move. TLDR: IF YOU CAN HANDLE THE MOTION SICKNESS, GET THE GAME. IF NOT, DO NOT BUY Holy S#it !!! This is one of the scariest games ever. It stays tense and builds from there! If you are a fan of horror games BUY THIS! The game's standout feature is its gameplay. It‚Äôs exciting to see developers introduce unique mechanics that work exclusively in VR. Although the movement felt a bit clunky at first, I quickly got the hang of the wheelchair mechanics after a few minutes of practice.

The game presents some well-designed set pieces, with the fourth chapter being my favorite so far. It was also the longest chapter, making it the highlight of the experience. For the developers, this chapter could serve as a strong reference for future projects. While the other chapters had their enjoyable moments, they felt somewhat repetitive and noticeably shorter in comparison. By the time I reached chapter three, I could already predict that the next objective would involve finding a keycard to unlock the following door.

I also really liked the enemy designs. They enhanced the atmosphere and made encounters more engaging.
 Overall, "Deadness" is a thrilling action-adventure indie game that offers a captivating storyline, challenging gameplay, and visually striking graphics. With its blend of exploration, puzzle-solving, and combat elements, as well as its dark and atmospheric setting, "Deadness" is sure to provide an unforgettable gaming experience for fans of action-adventure titles. 
Wow, Deadness is a true survival quest! Picture waking up in an abandoned lab complex, no memory, stuck in a wheelchair, and surrounded by hellish creatures. You've got to navigate this nightmare, dodge zombies, and solve puzzles to stay alive. The controls are realistic yet intuitive, but they also make you feel utterly helpless. It takes cunning to evade those monsters. The story unfolds through audio tapes, adding depth to the terrifying atmosphere. And yeah, it's not just a game‚Äîit's a plunge into genuine horror, where you're face-to-face with your own fears. This is my first horror game in virtual reality. Interesting plot, very scary jump scares. A very cool movement system with feedback to the joysticks. You play as a person in a wheelchair, which gives a new experience, as it is conveyed very realistically. There are no graphics settings, but I had no problems with optimization, although my computer is quite old. The storyline kicks off with a perfect blend of mystery and horror, waking up in a wheelchair with no memory of who you are or why you're in this nightmarish place. The screams echoing in the distance and the unnerving ambiance set the stage for an unforgettable experience.
Survival is not just about firepower; it's about strategy and wit. Deadness requires players to outsmart the terrifying creatures that inhabit the facility, using every means necessary to stay out of their sight. The tension is palpable as you navigate through rickety planks, dodge swinging corpses, and confront inhospitable environments that add to the overall sense of dread. Simulator wheelchair invalid , by the way, because of the scrimmers I recommend immediately play sitting on the toilet. 
In general pleasant graphics, not straight that would wow!!! But nevertheless, I understand this is the first project of this studio, I put 5 points. 
Very reminiscent of the game outlast, I think they are quite similar, but I have not found any passhaloka on this topic, unfortunately. Deadness is an immersive horror game that takes place in a post-apocalyptic world infested with zombies. With its realistic graphics and intense gameplay, players are put in the shoes of a survivor who must navigate through dark and eerie environments while fending off hordes of undead. The game also utilizes virtual reality technology to provide a truly terrifying and immersive experience, making every encounter with the zombies feel incredibly intense. With its atmospheric soundtrack and gripping storyline, Deadness is a must-play for fans of horror games looking for an adrenaline-pumping experience. Deadness takes the survival horror genre to new and thrilling heights, delivering a truly immersive and terrifying experience that will keep players hooked from start to finish. As a fan of the genre, I was blown away by how effectively the game manages to create an atmosphere of dread and tension.

Overall, Deadness is a standout title in the VR survival horror genre. Its exceptional visuals, captivating storyline, and addictive gameplay combine for a truly unforgettable experience. If you're a fan of the VR horrors, this game is an absolute must-play. Don't miss out on this game - it's well worth your time!

name: Distant Sun
short_description: A sci-fi game based on character dialogue and choices. Uncover the mysteries of Pioneer Station by attempting diplomacy and seeking peace or gunning through those that stand against you. The decisions you make will have an impact on the ending.
reviews:
The trailer intrigued me making me wanting to try this game out. I wanted to give this game a fair chance, but right now this is a buggy mess with gamebreaking bug.
I am one hour in, at the VI department. stuck with a bunch of android robots and the game wouldnt let me continue. There's nothing else I can do, looked everywhere for at least 15 mins. Simply stuck with no further instruction.

Given this is an indie game, I can overlook the somewhat amateurish voice acting (I have a feeling this game is either made by an African or Chinese company ), I can overlook the bad coding ( 30fps on a RTX 3090 Kingpin, with DOOM 3 era graphics ). But I cannot overlook at gamebreaking bug unable to allow me to progress further into the game.

Some more bugs I've encountered : 

1. Picking up ammo while you don't have a gun equipped makes the ammo you'e picked up disappear. 
2. Saving the game after killing the robots, if you load the save, all the robots are back and you have the kill them again.

And here are some quality of life issues I have with the game:

1. The computer screen in game is way to messy to read the emails. Each computer screen has very complicated desktop background, and the color blends with the email font in white, making it VERY hard to read.

2. the teammate AI is kind of horrible, they are not smart enough to shoot enemies that are around them.

3. Teammates will keep blocking you near doorways and tight corridors.

==============

So, too bad, I bought this knowing it's indie and had expected some level of roughness. I was willing to find out how I am going to evacuate the survivors, I was even hoping to play this game multiple times to see what different branching options there are, but given the state of gamebreaking bug in this game right now, I'm going to have to refund this game.

Not recommended in the current state. The devs need to quality control this game way more before releasing it.

If dev ends up fixing the gamebreaking bugs, I may buy the game again. So here's hoping. A nice concept but it currently suffers from some major flaws:
-The optimisation is very bad. Very very bad. Major pop-in It suffers from the classic Unreal lighting problem. Some sizing down of the map could help, the assets are clearly very intensive. Also, for some reason, the visual options dont get saved between loadscreens?
-The voice acting strongly needs a second pass
-For some reason, the gun models are very bad. Far be it for me to say 3D modelling is easy but, like, Millenia was able to make much more convincing game models for fallout new vegas of all games. Also, the hands don't hold on to one very well. Especially bad with the glock. The game had me early on when conversing with our crew mates. This presented dialogue options. Even tho the voices are most likely AI, i appreciate that some form of voice over work is there. They sound natural enough. better than text to speech.  The issues arise after a distress call. I couldnt manage to pick up any weapons beside a glock. I also couldnt interact with a door's "unlock/lock" menu. It wouldnt work. Couldn't get past the early part. That's a bti sad as I was lookin forward to seein' how the combat section would play out. Still gonna check it again for updates. 

Gameplay Impressions: https://youtu.be/2eZomrHe9Hg

name: The Conquest of Go
short_description: Learn and play Go, the classic board game that has been played for thousands of years, and compete in the race to conquer the most land in the in-game world, or compete online against opponents around the real world.
reviews:
Not necessarily worth the price, you can get almost everything this game has by just playing on ogs for free but it's a nice platform to play the game on Steam and not too costly so support the developer if you can. I'm new to Go and have been looking for a game that makes learning the ropes fun. I own both Just Go and Conquest of Go, and while I enjoy both, if I had to choose, Conquest of Go is the clear winner. The developer has been actively improving the game, adding cool new features, and encouraging community engagement, while Just Go seems to have been abandoned with no further updates.

The game itself is a fresh and exciting take on Go. The Steam Workshop integration is a fantastic way to add and share new puzzles, custom boards, and more, keeping the experience fresh. The soundtrack is relaxing yet motivating, every time I load up the game, I feel like a medieval king conquering enemy lands! The OSG integration and review mode are amazing! 

Feature Requests:
- The ability to play Tsumego/puzzles in a random order.
- A story mode of some sort. Who are we? A young king looking to grow their kingdom, or maybe a young general looking to prove themselves. 
- A career/tournament progression mode where you climb from a complete beginner 25kyu on a 9x9 board all the way up to a single digit player on a 19x19.
- A more in depth review mode. Right now it only covers 3 or so mistakes per game. 
- The ability to auto add your mistakes, from the review mode, into a custom Tsumego review list

If you're a fan of Go, this game is a 10/10, definitely worth playing! It's a very approachable, lightweight and customizable gamification of my favorite classic board game. 

The campaign mode itself is fun, with widely scalable difficulty (there's multiple different AI engines to choose from, each with difficulty sliders, along with all the clock and handicap options). You capture territory on the campaign map, earn resources, and can then spend said resources to buy meta moves such as a score estimate or an undo. You can also use the resources to purchase legendary game records from famous IRL players to view, if interested. There's some tsumego to do in-between the games, which is a fun change of pace. 

I also really enjoy the fact that you can pit two AI's against each other to follow along how they play, and you can import your own SGF-files to view within the game. 

Pretty much everything I could ask for with regards to keeping my old hobby easily approachable. Thank you developer :) Review in March 2025...

This is a delightful piece of software.  Highly recommended!

To be clear, almost all of its individual components can be found free online:
 - A pleasant introduction to Go/Baduk
 - Playing Go/Baduk against AI in stand-alone software
 - Playing Go/Baduk against people or AI on the OGS server
 - "Life and Death" Puzzles
 - A library of famous games to review and learn from
 - A library of opening moves and variations/joseki
 - Using AI to review your games to focus on 1-3 key moves you made needing analysis and improvement
 - Using AI as you play to see recommended options, estimate score, etc.
 - A "sandbox" mode to use when you have a book of tsumego problems and laptop but no physical set with you

The only component that to my knowledge is [b]not[/b] freely available elsewhere is an interesting "partner mode" for beginners where you and AI take turns making moves, sharing control of one player.

Anyway, with so much available elsewhere what you are actually paying for with [i]Conquest of Go[/i] is the overall experience.  It is [b]BEAUTIFUL[/b] visually and with its music.  It is [b]CONVENIENT[/b] to have all those resource listed above in one place.  And it has [b]PEDAGOGICAL BALANCE[/b] with a "campaign mode" that does not require us (but highly encourages us) to devote time to playing, analysis, and puzzles in similar proportions to well-established learning programs (such as GoMagic.org).

If you enjoy Go/Baduk and will be playing on a laptop/desktop the cost-per-hour for this software will become insignificant.

[b]Tangential note:[/b] If you are a brand new beginner, I also recommend the free classes on GoMagic.org up through "The Fundamentals of Go on 13√ó13 ‚Äî Remake" because that video/quiz curriculum is well-designed and compliments what this software teaches, to help beginners avoid making common mistakes so they have more fun. I haven't played the campaign as I don't play with AI, however the feature set for online gameplay is really good and I can only recommend this for Go fans. If you like go, you'll like this. If you don't like go, this game will probably not change your mind, which is fine. Remind "EATTING" to your opponent [b]TLDR[/b]
If you want to learn Go this is an absolutely amazing software to help you out and ease you in.
Its campaign and tools are all tailored towards teaching and improving your Go play - while also looking and sounding great.
Easy analysis, lots of nicely tuned AI options, SGF support for matches and Puzzles; the list goes on.

[b]Campaign[/b]
The campaign is a great starting point. 
Earning resources via wins and trading allows you to "buy" special skills like "undo", "territory", "move variants", and "suggested move" mid combat. 
Those skills are absolutely amazing when starting out. Basing them on resources ensures that one doesn't overuse them.

After finishing a match the game will run an automatic analysis pointing out the 3 biggest blunders in a little "mini-game" including move variations.
In the end the game will suggest adjustments to the AI and handicap that one can accept or deny.

Once you conquered a piece of land, you can can reinforce and protect it against invasions by doing Puzzles.
Also available after a win is the option to purchase professional tournament game records for resources. 

From time to time you can even see an invasion of your or AI territory and join in on the action.

If you don't want to play against AI, you can also fight actual humans via OGS (online-go.com).
Another option is to exchange resources for AI help, which turns this effectively into Pair Go with you and the AI taking turns.

[b]Story[/b]
A recent addition. Allows to add your own campaigns with characters, dialogue, and battle content (such as invasions, puzzles, and more).

[b]Quick Play[/b]
Three options are available here:
- Play against AI
- Practice Board (freely placing stones)
- Game Review
Available board sizes range from 5x5 to 19x19.

[b]Online Play[/b]
This allows you to play games on OGS (online-go.com) using CoG's interface and background music.

[b]Learning Center[/b]
Contains a tutorial for Go, a visual glossary, and an opening guide (allowing exploration of typical openings).
The big feature here is the steam workshop integration and its available Puzzles and game records.
This can also be used to upload your own Puzzles collections for example.
In general, the steam workshop integration is absolutely amazingly done and adding content is very simple.
 This review is from a Go newbie; never played before purchasing this game.   So if you are an experienced player, skip this review.

Basic features,
[list]
[*]Play by Japanese, Chinese, or Korean rules.
[*]Set a handicap value (playing against the [i]Casual AI[/i] doesn't allow a handicap of 1).
[*]Set a Komi value (scoring advantage for white, since black plays first).  Can be set in 1/2 point increments, for those of us who hate ties.
[*]Different board layouts.
[*]Numerous board sizes including 9x9, 13x13, & 19x19.
[*]Match review: Game will show your 3 worst moves, and suggest what you should have done.
[/list]
It's actually 4 games:
[olist]
[*]Match play against 1 of 4 computer opponents.   The 'easiest' is allegedly [i]Casual AI[/i], which gives a hard time with a zero handicap.
[*]Play against human, online.  Haven't tried this yet.
[*]Puzzles in the Steam workshop.  Found a good set of 10,000 of these.  And there are probably other sets.
[*]Campaign mode.  4x game, where the player wins military battles, by winning Go matches.
[/olist]
Though the review feature is helpful, it doesn't explain WHY the suggested move is better than the one that you played.  That feature becomes useful, as you understand the game.

[b]Campaign mode[/b]: Went through the tutorial, and decided it's not for me.  (Funny thing, this feature was a big selling point, at the time of purchase.)  Graphics are an eye sore; I'm a graphics snob.  And if I want 4x, I have [i]GalCiv4[/i] & [i]Warhammer: Gladius[/i], which do a great job at scratching that gaming itch.  Also, the AI opponent is progressive:  When the player wins a match, the difficulty increases for the next match, unlike normal match play.

[b]So what should a Go novice buy this game?[/b]:
[list]
[*]Excellent control over starting parameters.  Easy to fine tune a difficulty level, suitable to your skill.
[*]Very clean UI.  Hadn't touched this game in over 2 years, and had no trouble resuming play.
[*]Review feature.  Learn from the mistakes that you made in a match.
[*]Puzzles: Great way to improve is play matches against the AI AND solve puzzles.
[*]Supportive developer: Even after having purchased the game almost 3 years, he still answers questions on the forum.
[*]AI is not progressive.  Want to play against a tougher AI opponent?  YOU increase difficulty, vs. having the game do it automatically.
[*]Some of the board layouts are very crisp & high contrast.  Didn't realize how good the contrast was until I bought a real Go set.
[/list] The campaign mode is my favorite. Fun mix of 9, 13, and 19x19 board sizes, along with "fortifying" your land with life+death puzzles.

The music is relaxed. Not something I would have normally listened to but it goes well with the game.

reviews:
Gorgeous girls with an erotic splash of color waiting to be discovered by you! Match the colored blocks to seductively undress them a little at a time. 

Contrast & Girls by Developer IR Studio

WARNING: Nakedness

Classic memory game where you match the correct colored blocks. Has a few levels of difficulty and beautiful arts. The art style is done in kind of a monochrome with an interesting splash of color added. The colors chosen are very vibrant and add to the beauty of the art. Puzzle pieces range from 16-36 pieces. There are 40 puzzles with each girl in various stages of undress. Last stage they are naked. Music is very delightful and I enjoyed it immensely. You can choose to work the puzzles or press H to auto-complete it. There is also a photo gallery for your viewing pleasure.

Cons:

* Profile Features Limited

Rating: 8.5/10

Final Thoughts:
Traditional memory game with beautiful girls starting out partially dressed then ending up fully naked. Music is very lovely and relaxing. Has photo gallery for your viewing pleasure. Price is inexpensive so what's stopping you from adding to your erotic collection?

name: There's No Easter Eggs
short_description: There's no Easter eggs is a casual hidden object game with over 500 Easter eggs to find.
reviews:
Very silly game, no Easter eggs anywhere! I would recommend to anyone who does not like Easter eggs! [h1]I DON'T REMEMBER EASTER EGG HUNT BEING SO DIFFICULT ü§£[/h1]
I'm really surprised at how well some of these Easter Eggs were hidden. This is a fun game for any age, with cleverly hidden Easter Eggs in nine different eras and three difficulty modes.
¬†
[b]DIFFICULTY MODES[/b]
Easy: Find multiples of each Egg pictured on the left.
Normal: The same as Easy Mode but a tad trickier to spot.
Hard: Find 20 Eggs shown one at a time.
¬†
[b]STEAM ACHIEVEMENTS[/b]
You will earn most of the % based Achievements (find 10%-25%-50%-75%) just by completing all 3 Difficulty Modes. Some Achievements can be earned by playing the game in any mode.¬†¬†
The final Achievements can only be accomplished by replaying the levels several times. I found it easier just to keep replaying the same scene, on easy until you see the popup achievement from Steam and then move on to the next scene. Depending on your luck of the draw, you'll probably have to replay each scene an average of five times.

[b]HINT FEATURE[/b] ¬†
You can click the Easter Egg Icon box on the right side to get a hint. (There are no Achievements for not using a hint, so use it!) A black arrow will show you the direction to look for until you reach the random egg, which will have black arrows circled around it.

name: Blue Hunter
short_description: Welcome to hell! Blue Hunter is an RPG roguelike deckbuilder where you forge your own path as a hunter and turn into a god! Create your own army of undead monsters, unlock powerful skills and beat all the gods that stand in your way. How far can you go?
reviews:
A very simplified and out-dated feeling Card battler, but something about that is also aesthetically pleasing. I don't think I will come back to it very much given on all the other amazing rogue-like card games out there, but I will be picking it up again when I just want something simple and relaxing. 100% would recommend this game. For me it gave me the fun of those webtoons and stuff like Solo Leveling while holding fun mechanics of a deck game. Reminds me of Slay the Spire fused with that concept. So, I bought this game based on the fact that the dev seemed very engaged in updating it and the game had a lot of potential.  The dev has since dropped this game completely and now the features you'd expect in a rogue deck builder simply don't exist.  You play as one of two classes and the only way to really change anything between play through is to increase the difficulty.  There's nothing to invest into to make yourself stronger or more versatile, there's very limited enemies, and with only 2 play styles available its a lack luster game at best and not worth really investing into since there will be no future updates. Really clever roguelike that gets straight into the gameplay without any fluff.  I like the rpg stat mechanics to build your character in various directions.  Good monster and card variety, seems like a lot of build diversity is present.  Will definitely be returning to this at some point. Fun game and worth the price tag. Not quite finished, but still feels very clean and well made, especially for a solo dev. The monster-to-card mechanic is neat. Since most cards can improve by obtaining another copy, it means fighting repeat monsters holds significant value. Also, each card is unique to each class, making each class truly a unique play style, even with the same deck and similar stats. Would love to see a progression system that carries over between runs and also a greater variety of classes. (Or maybe just a cheat mode so I can satisfy my need to max each stat in a single run?)  I'm very much looking forward to any updates for this game. Fun game and love Monster collecting and leveling mechanics.

The art and interface feels nostalgic. feels like collecting yugioh cards as a kid again. The premise of defeating monsters and using them as cards is very interesting! There is also a lot of potential for customization. Once there is more meta-progression the game will turn out to be great, even it's good already! This game has the outline to be one of the best games in the roguelike deckbuilder genre. The gameplay has just enough RNG to make every run feel very different and just enough consistency with upgrading your stats to increase damage, dodge etc. to make many builds feel super viable. The problem that I have with it is a serious lack of meta progression but the developer clearly has intentions of implementing it and updates the game on a weekly basis. If you want a really fun roguelike game that has the potential to be a masterclass in the genre, pick this up. What drew me to this game was the premise of the defeated monsters becoming the cards in your deck. It's a novel premise for a deck builder, and it works very well.
There are different strategies depending on which monsters you face, and therefore which cards you optionally add to your deck.  

Even better, your character has stats, which can be increased to add more hit points, more damage, extra mana, and more to make battles easier. 

Further customization is possible using skills, acquired from treasure rooms, the in game shop, or leveling your stats. 

Yet another aspect is the multiple classes to choose from when starting a run. While the skills and stats function the same for each class, the monsters as cards have entirely different functions for each class. 

Then if that's not enough, each class has 10 difficulty levels, each making the game more challenging. 

Being early access, there are sometimes a few bugs. However, the developer is very responsive on discord, and with weekly updates the bugs are usually fixed quickly. 

It's a fun game now, and keeps getting more interesting with each update. I'd recommend this game without hesitation to any fan of the roguelike deckbuilding genre. quite fun. you should try it

name: Castle Doombad Classic
short_description: BE THE VILLAIN and slay any hero who dares enter your dark domain! Deck out your castle with traps and minions as the ultimate diabolical dungeon keeper in this strategy / TD puzzler. Includes the original Castle Doombad game, rebuilt and remastered, plus brand new content.
reviews:
Great TD game. I knew it from the mobile version and always wished for a Steam release good game play on phone while back This is by far a pretty good game. I'm looking forward to the future of this game and what is has to offer in terms of updates. an old classic game that I discover in a Tesla Car (Best Cars by far.. have not driven almost nothing in 3 months)
.. the game is a cool.. even when car, old and this incarnations are no exactly the same.   This is my childhood right here. I remember the good ol' days where  I downloaded this on my old LG G Flex and played that for hours and hours. Playing Endless Night Mode which isn't added in this version yet of course. That it would break a bit but I didn't care too much about the glitches then and now tbh. Well they are annoying to be frank, the sheer factor of it just being so fun that it blows those small issues out of the water. Making up for it most definitely. I highly recommend paying for this game here for this price as you have plenty of hours to enjoy and can come back to it with the new Rogue mode that randomizes things. Support these amazing developers so we can get more content added and the sequel released! When this game was removed from the iOS App Store, it was truly regrettable. Many people love this game, and with the new content with the Steam port, I believe that those who loved this game previously will be appreciative of the new content to sink their teeth into. A true mobile classic ported to Steam. 

In summary, I recommend this game because of the way it forces strategy and quick thinking to collide with its quick, strategic gameplay. The new mode "Roguevenge" appears nearly endlessly replayable, providing new challenge to both those who are new to the game and those who have played it before. If you have a tendency to like both roguelikes, tower-defense games, or puzzlers, I would strongly recommend picking up this game. just got all achievements, had fun Great game, and a fun take on TD games, with an inverted Twist. I loved the game when it was on mobile and got fairly high on the leaderboards. So it's great to get back at it with the new Roguevengeance mode, and to see all the new tools and traps. Just 100%ed it and Llooking forward to the next updates. Recommend you give the game a shot if you're a fan of tower defense games! hi i play this game for 8 years now, and im thriled to see this in pc! And this was my all time favourite phone game

And, i just wanna give some suggestions.(my english aren't so good, sorry about that)

my suggestion is mainly about pc transplantation. the main point is, could you make the game more convenient on pc?
here's some of my thoughts:
1. please all mouse wheel to move up and down, it would make the game waaaaay better.
2. keyboard? like use 1~9 to choose the item.
3. gathering resourses on pc is way more tiring than phone, consider just move upon it to collect resourses? it wont vanish anyway


thats all i thought about for now. i really like this amazing game and i've playing it since i was a child. and i love the new stuff you added in the game!(skins are cooool) Please keep going to update this beautiful game Loved this game when it first came out and love it now still one of my favorite games of all time. please keep making new levels and more skins!!

name: Due Process
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Simulation, Strategy, Early Access
short_description: A PVP tactical FPS about PLANNING & EXECUTION. Sound strategy and good teamwork are essential for victory because new PROCEDURALLY-GENERATED MAPS are delivered every week. You'll face a new tactical challenge every round.
reviews:
is good PLAY THIS GAME, I HATE PLAYING AGAINST THE SAME 30 PEOPLE WITH 300 MATCHES ON THEIR BELT underrated game theres players now yay DONT SLEEP ON THIS GAME WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR BUY IT NOW I recommend it, but only if you're willing to wait for ranked matches. Unranked matches are a complete coin flip as to whether or not you'll get a team that wants to play a tactical shooter. the only real tactical shooter i have ever played i played valorant before but when youre hopping around and dashing at ligjht speed it isnt tactical but this game has planing and ai generated maps so its acually tactical THIS IS FUCKING GREAT.
After two hours of playing a bunch of 2v2 with a friend and some 5v5 with randoms THAT ALL USED COMS (not so comon in other games) I'm amazed of good this game is, can't wait for it to keep growing.
I got a more strategic feeling compared to how Rainbow SIx Siege is being played lately.  Hope I can keep having the same experience in the future. I really like the concept of this game. But the community is very small. good game
very fun

name: FORGE SIMULATOR
short_description: You are trapped in an endless labyrinth. You must find hidden resources scattered throughout the labyrinth to craft your own sword. Overcome the dangers of the labyrinth with your crafted sword, survive, and escape.
reviews:
No FOV slider, bad tutorial, awkward mechanics, terrible menus and menu controls, definitely would not recommend. It'd be nice if the woman didn't walk so far away that you have to loop around multiple times to find her again, but other than that it's a good game. Hope to see more ore types added. This game was fun....I enjoyed grinding to get all the ores and coins and those earth things, not sure what else to call them. I escaped in just over 8 hours. But I was seeing how fast I could escape. This game has hours upon hours of play ability. So, this feels more like a tech demo for a complex forging system than it does a full game.

That said, this is a very fun and in depth forging system that ends up giving each sword you make a unique feel.

For what's here, I'd say this game is worth the price, doubly so if it's on sale. And I'm certainly interested to see what sort of games the developer can make in the future with this forging system. i cant figure out how to make different types of swords and the door is impossible to break even with an s tier diamond rapier I was honestly very excited to play the game but than, i got the "DirectX 12 is not supported on your system. Try running without the -dx12 or -d3d12 command line argument." message and ive done so much to try and fix it but i cant get it to work i do the dsdiag and my game supports directx 12, tryed the dx12 tried the d3d12 even dx11. im not bummed about the money to buy it, im more bummed out not to play the d*mn game Fun little game. Could probably be beaten in one day, not bad for a time sink.

‚Ä¢ Go to forest, collect rocks and wood.
‚Ä¢ Head to Smithy, create a sword
‚Ä¢ Travel to dungeon, defeat monsters, collect rarer materials

Repeat until you reach a tier 3 sword to break down the door and escape.

Edit: First run: 6+ hours, Second run: 1 hour game have a good potential
please keep update this game

name: Do Animals Dream?
short_description: You‚Äôre shipwrecked on a mysterious island of talking animals! You‚Äôll need to make friends with the local critters if you hope to return home. This adventure includes branching conversations, memorable endings, and dark secrets...
reviews:
Short, Simple, and far from Preachy. Heed the Steam content warning. Sound: 7
Graphics: 6
Story: 8
Gameplay: 7
Commands: 6
Fun: 7
Time to load / lag: 9
Bugs / Problems: 9
Final score: 8 This game is not worth $8.50 but suit yourself! While I appreciate the message this game is trying to portray, to treat all living beings especially animals with kindness, I do not agree with the agenda. Consuming meat does not make you a bad person, and just because someone chooses to be vegan, does not make them a good person. I do not agree with animal cruelty.  Just because someone decides to consume meat, does not make them an abusive and horrible human being. I did like the message similar to the man looking in the mirror with the camera option. We can choose to be better people, but choosing not to eat meat doesn't make you a better person. Overall I'd give this game a 5/5 for the graphics, 0/5 for the vegan agenda. It is hard to make a recommendation of this game. I mean it's a short fetch questing walking sim with no added bloat, but the underlying message seems vague. For a game that somewhat censures animal cruelty, you are given an option to actually inflict animal cruelty with no punishment whatsoever lol. Not to mention the game's visuals, main character (why is he walking like that?) and NPC sprites are looking adorable (despite some of them being morbidly misconfigured). I think the juxtaposing is cute, funny even, and made the tone of the endings creepier. I guess I'll give it a thumbs up. It's short and interesting, the Dev is trying to make some pretty big statements in a pretty small game. Straight to some of the points. I think that it was worth buying and playing. It's maybe an hour of your time depending on your pace and the Dev is generous with replay options once you finish.

The various endings gave a variety of closure and each creature's personality was tailored to their theme.

I may have only caught part of the Dev's message. If there was more, or if it were more balanced than I understood, then they might think about how they convey that in future games. 

A few issues for them to spiffy up:
1. Autosave isn't super great. I got to different points of progress and sometimes it saved up until that and other times it didn't. -- however, it is such a short game that this isn't too much of an issue. -- One way that the Dev is forgiving is that, for some things that you might have to run back for if you forgot, instead of having to go back (for those specific things) there's a dialog that lets you stay and "bring the thing to you". I thought that this was a really nice touch.

2. A crucial item for progression didn't end up in my inventory and I spent half an hour trying everything before realizing that it was a glitch and I would have to reset the game, which leads to issue 3:

3. It is VERY UNCLEAR how to start a new game. You can't even uninstall and reinstall, because it reloads your progress, even if you delete the local files manually. TO RESET THE GAME:

3a. Go into the game settings

3b. Click on the bug icon in the top right corner

3c. Now you can click on resetting the game.

I think that this last part should be a top menu item. Most other games have "New Game" or "Reset" along with the continue button in the main menu. The fact that I had to search for it was frustrating. At least it existed.

All in All, this is an entertaining and thoughtful game and absolutely worth your time! Firstly, I just want to warn everyone that this game has a sad story and some of the images may be traumatizing. 

The game is really beautiful and the story makes a lot of sense. You will see circumstances through the eyes of a human as well as the animals and you need to make friends wherever you go. 

I personally would not buy this game at the price it is listed for, however I do recommend getting the game on a special. This game is so bad it's good. I get the message it was trying to get across, but if it wasn't that condescending maybe more would've taken this seriously.

Buy this when it's on sale the controls are pretty wonky. I bought this game because it was really cheap and it seemed weird.  I've only done one playthrough, which took about an hour, and I was not disappointed.  I'm definitely going to play it a few more times and see how making different choices might affect the story.

If you're a fan of strange or dark games this will probably be right up your alley. Gives you something to think about

name: $1 Ride
short_description: $1 Ride is a casual game with a fast paced, timing and reflex testing game-play style. Travel through space at warp speed! Collect power ups to increase your speed or risk your fuel to collect money, missiles and more.
reviews:
5/10 [h2]$1 Ride[/h2]

Has a total of [b]5[/b] trading cards. This mini game is satisfactory; however, there are several aspects that require improvement. The title of the game indicates that it serves as a brief diversion, typically lasting between five to ten minutes, after which it tends to become somewhat monotonous. It is important to acknowledge that this is an indie game. Nonetheless, it provides an enjoyable way to pass the time.

The graphics are straightforward, the controls are user-friendly, and it offers a significant amount of amusement along with a touch of competitiveness. The gameplay fundamentally depends on one's reaction speed, strategic thinking, and timing. As a more seasoned gamer, I find that my reaction speed has diminished since my younger days, which limited my progress. However, I genuinely enjoyed the experience, especially while playing with my children, who took turns sitting on my lap.

Overall, it is certainly worth the cost for a bit of entertainment. Can't complain. I got this on sale for 0.99‚Ç¨ and for the price it's a great game ‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñë‚ñÑ‚ñÑ

 i loved this game so much and its cheap and recommend it I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you. [h1]1$ Ride[/h1]

name: Circuit Superstars
genres: Action, Casual, Indie, Racing, Simulation, Sports
short_description: Circuit Superstars is a top down racing game with a tactile arcade physics model, pitstops, and a pure motorsport approach. It includes 16 categories that span different styles and eras of motorsport.
reviews:

Best lines, pit stop accuracy, qualifying...... When you want to race but want a good break from the Simulator...... This is a good one. Does not start anymore. Really nice and relaxing top-down racer. It could use a few things, including and especially more tracks. 

I can't vouch for the online issue others mention. I've tried 3x to play and twice couldn't find a game. The 3rd time I smoked 3 xbox scrubs for an hour without issue. That was a great, great time. FLIPPEN LOVE IT Simple but exceptional. This is an amazing racing game to sit down with and chill.
Really great racing mechanics and a pleasure to play. 
Love the art style as well. Longer races requiring pit stops add a nice wrinkle for a little race strategy. ~ DIFFICULTY ~
