name: Vectored Armada
short_description: Architect autonomous battleships. Send them on a campaign against deadly opponents. Watch and cheer as they dominate, or cry as they explode. Obliterate dreadnoughts. Configure intelligences. Master weaponry. Free the Great Skies. THE OPPRESSOR MUST FALL.
reviews:
Pretty fun ship building/fighting game reminiscent of Reassembly, could use some finer AI tuning/more specific behaviors but I'm liking it so far. Vectored Armada is a game that has a ton of building options and allows you to build things far more complex and beautiful in structure compared to games like reassembly and nimbatus. the only real complaint i have is that the game is slower-paced than the previously mentioned games. if you wanted reassembly but more strategic and more focused on fleet play, this is the game for you - i personally like it and would recommend, but its not for everyone Proud of you Luke! Very fun even at this early stage and seems perfect for future development I've only played a little bit of VA, but it's pretty alright so far. My biggest complaint are simple UI/control issues. They're the sorts of things that can be fixed easily, and I've already passed my feedback on to the developers in their discord.

Games in this little niche genre are vanishingly rare. I really like the ability to attach custom UI to the ships, and watch them battle it out auto-battler style. So far, this game has a lot of promise and I look forward to seeing what it becomes. tl;dr: It's inexpensive, sandbox-y, and fun. Do recommend.

Vectored Armada is, on the surface, a relatively simple and straightforward sandbox shipbuilder and combat game. The blend of free-form building (comparable to similar games Cosmoteer and Reassembly) combined with the campaign intended to give a variety of challenges (not unlike Gratuitous Space Battles) place this game in a comfortable niche where low mental investment is required to play and have fun, but at the same time ruthlessly maximizing combat efficacy of ships is a plenty-valid way to approach the game.

But one of the ways where this game really knocks it out of the park is 'freedom'. The game hands the reigns almost completely to the player to allow them to customize the aesthetics of their fleet. From coloring individual blocks of the ship to mounting weapons on hardpoints placed on blocks that normally wouldn't allow it, the game lets you, the player, have the final say. Honestly, for an early access game that follows Reassembly quite nicely yet with a different tone and I like the hands off nature of the combat, seeing it as it is now makes me very excited for the future of the game, I hope others find it as enjoyable as I have so far! Fun game. Harder than initially expected. 
Watching one of your fleets finally defeat an opponent who's slaughtered your past 15 fleets feels good. I put 100+ hours into Reassembly, and I loved what it almost was. But the tournament mode didn't quite satisfy after I'd gotten bored with the endless mode, and the balance was broken once I let the AI take the reins. I picked up Cosmoteer to scratch that itch, and it's a good game, but it wasn't really what I was looking for. I think this is it. It's like Gratuitous Space battles in that you put together fleets based on a point cap and let them duke it out based on preset orders, but with Reassembly-style ship design and 2D physics. Already in a playable state and gets frequent updates. If you enjoy Reassembly or Cosmoteer, give this game a run. It's simple and straight-forward, which honestly is just what this genre needs. Don't let them simple graphic designs put you off, it's a fun builder and it plays well. It is early release at the time of my writing this and it does have some rough edges, but a lot less than many EA games I've played. 

The freedom of design and the ability play around with designs till you get what you want to work the way you want is a nice bit of freedom from games that demand you do it X way or no way. And while the dev has stated that a slim roster of weapons and utilities is better than an overwhelming amount, there's still a ton to work with.

Speaking of the dev, props there for being responsive and friendly. I'd found and posted a bug in the discord and got a reply within minutes both acknowledging the issue and that it was being worked on, on top of being friendly about it. It's hard to ask for more from a dev with a game just released. And the fact that that's the only bug I've run into so far speaks well of the state of the game currently.

I hope this game gets the attention it deserves and continues to grow. Want to build ships and blow them up? Welcome aboard!

name: Christmas Store: Santa's Supermarket Simulator
short_description: In the "Christmas Store: Santa's Supermarket Simulator", you run a holiday store. Fill the shelves with Christmas goods, set discounts, serve customers, hire staff and decorate the shop in a wintery style. Expand your store and create the perfect place for Christmas shopping!
reviews:
a buggy ugly mess The pictures look very promising. The city looks nice.
It seems to catch the Christmas spirit, but the exe does not work.

Even for 3 euro, you can expect the game to start up. All my other shop simulators work and my laptop can cope well enough.
This one has less features and still not playable.
Plus there is not much help coming from the makers.
Because of all this it's thumbs down for me. I enjoy the game. I'd love to see an update sometime. Walking around is like ice skating. Items float too. just like supermarket simulator, only with Christmas stuff The Store is a little dark, and needs new music, but otherwise the game play is good. It's Supermarket Christmas edition

name: Firebird
short_description: Firebird is a narrative road trip that takes place in Slavic folklore, in an adventure that ressembles a traditional tale. Aboard your truck, travel to the far north, meet colorful characters, and face the creatures inhabiting these sacred lands.
reviews:
When I found out about this game I was impressed by hand drawn visuals that the game uses which told me that I had to buy this game as fast as possible. I was introduced to amazing story with your choices impacting the story with gameplay which revolves around choosing the right path and managing your truck while accompanied by great soundtrack driving through expanses of Russia. When It comes to characters They are well written and designed there are characters you will like but some you will hate but there are even characters you won't feel anything towards them.

Over the positive things there is also one negative and that's the Photo Mode. Every time I press P It won't stay that way when I press for example f12 to take the screenshot, so when I tried to take any screenshots of the visuals that the game presents I always had like bunch of screenshots with Bubbles and UI. 

But overall the game was perfection to the last bit. Firebird will lead you through a mystical journey in the ever snow part of Russia.
The art is amazing, the music mesmerizing and the writing inspiring.
The author could write touching characters, blending elements and symbols or the Russian folklore into a nowadays story.
The artist vibrant style really gives life to the characters and the beautiful landscape.

I also really the "truck management" part of the gameplay.  I was looking for a light story driven game and when I spotted Firebird the art style drew me right then and there. The vibe it was emitting was so enticing. Story was quite unique too. I think it was inspired by some kind of Russian folklore. That being said, the only minor issue of the game is that English translations have one or two mistakes, but it‚Äôs not something to fret. You can totally tell what the sentence means.
 Gameplay design was also very lenient, including the difficulty. You could also experience different story development depending on your choices. üôÇ Has everything one can ask for in a visual novel. The game is a full package, with a hint of strategy throughout to keep the stakes grounded, enthralling visuals, and a well written story. Would highly recommend for a blind play through! Nice take on a Russian tale. Paths were just rewarding enough to be worth it. Give it a try. An enjoyable choose your own adventure with mild branching elements. Like the excellent Black Book and the not so good The Sin, this is about the overlap between the modern and the ancient in the far north of Russia. The game art by professional illustrator Quentin Vijoux owes more to Quentin Blake than generic anime, which makes a nice change for a visual novel. The coldwave interludes are also very good. There are many interesting places to visit, which would require restarting the game several times to see them all, which I will save for the future. Delightful little VN based on old Russian fairy tales. You play as a woman trying to pay off her debt to a gangster by taking jobs with her truck, the Firebird. When a mysterious girl shows up one day offering a job in exchange for rare goods enough to pay your debt, you start out on a strange adventure through history and myth.  

As a fan of old Russian tales, I was already sold on this game, which is sort of like a Russian [i]The Flame in the Flood[/i] without the survival mechanics. But on top of the engaging and well-translated narrative, the art style has a special charm despite some truly dark subject matter, and the soundtrack is a bop! Dying just takes you back one stop to your last crossroads. No bugs to speak of. I finished it in about a hour and a half without rushing. Well worth the time if it sounds like your kind of game. Lovely game - atmospheric, illuminating and beautifully-designed. It starts slowly with some traversing back and forth between locations, but I was soon gripped and desperate to see where Mariska's journey took her next. The hand-drawn art is absolutely spectacular. I took so many screenshots, especially after discovering you can hide the user interface at any time. There's enough alternate choices and paths (and bad endings, some more prosaic than others) to merit at least a second playthrough. Really charming game!! You can finish it in one sit, took me three hours to get through, had a great time playing it. Lovely art style and story, nice to dive into a folk culture and mythology I don't know much about.

name: Phantasmagoria 2: A Puzzle of Flesh
short_description: All Curtis wants is to live a normal, happy life, but something seems to have other plans...
reviews:
1000/10 curtis rules and bi blob rules treavor is hot we love blob and that's about it Boobs and gore 10/10 When FMV games first became a thing there was night trap ,sewer shark etc. Those types of game continuously played...not only did you often miss the story (especially with night trap as youre looking in different rooms), but it made them very limited with very small choices, basically just creating a different video playing. The first Phantasmagoria was a step forward where you controlled the player, Phantasmagoria 2 went further still. Although you still have premade videos (just like cutscenes in any game), you have MUCH more choice in the game , and it does make a difference to the ending......this was rare in the late 90s.

There is a genuine mystery here, all you know when the game starts is that you were in a strait jacket in hospital, and you begin the game with very little else as to who you are. The unravelling of the mystery is really well done. The characters are good and , for a first, some of the acting isnt bad at all (a rarity at the time). For me though, the excellent sets and ambiance steal the show. The videos are really close to the gameplay graphics in look and feel (the videos are real video and gameplay is kind of green screen super imposed people on photo like computer drawn scenes....its pretty seamless and very well done. The interaction with objects including the computer on your desk is also well done. A lot of thought went into making this an engrossing and interesting game.
         
The game is also quite long which surprised me. Ok the video is grainy and has greatly reduced quality and colour by todays standards, but it still does the job of drawing you into the game.

I wont spoil the game, but it has many characters, not all make it to the end , this increases interest, when people keep dying it just adds more mystery. I love that you can change the path of your character too.

This is , for me, the most interactive FMV game I have played......and Ive played most. Whilst there are others which are excellent too, nothing quite catches the depth and horror of a Puzzle of Flesh : Phantasmagoria 2.

I first got the game when it was released in the late 1990s back in the days of Pentium 2 computers and slow  hard drives.....its a joy to play with an ssd today. 

If you love a great horror like scifi story with a number of clever twists, great sets and quite often decent acting, you will love this game.
An easy recommend and one of the best of the genre.

Please give us a remaster GREAT GAME! 
Takes me back to my teen years. But sadly the game locks up and crashes WAY too often. 
They're relying too much on DOSbox, which hasnt been updated in years..... and is obsolete. 
I can't even save my game easily..... which super sucks. *Played via SCUMMVM

As someone with a decent grasp on the adventure game and point and click genres, I found this game to be quite good, despite the playstyle being something I‚Äôm generally not a fan of. It‚Äôs a click and watch kind of game without any real puzzle-based mechanics or deep problem solving. Actual ‚Äúpuzzles‚Äù are few and far between and the ones you do get are either stupid easy or wtf. Given this major flaw for me personally, I still enjoyed this game for what it did give me. A story that kept me engaged despite not knowing what was happening towards the end, good characters/writing, upmost entertaining acting and cutscenes, and good pacing. People seem to argue over the quality, some because the game's progressive themes make them mad. This game is certainly worth playing and better than the first entry. Huh, that was weird Curtis... You're such a pretty girl, Blob. The lady in the first game did porn. 6/10 Absolutely Horrific! I LOVE 90's & early 2000's games. I played the 1st one and loads of FMV games. While I know they're supposed to be kind of campy and this game is old, that's not the issue. The problem is NEVER knowing what to do next! You finish a conversation, and you can't talk to that character anymore. Then you go around and come back and then you can suddenly talk with them again. And missing that tiny detail bottlenecks the entire progression of the game! Then missing other small details which seem to have no meaning to the story - only in the developers mind did make any sense - but if you miss it, you just end up going around in circles. I appreciate the production value. I am also grateful they are even making old classic games, many of which I love. It's better than them not making it. But this one is just a total clunker. Completely boring. But the WORST PART OF ALL is the "Myst" Navigation syndrome. The Navigation is beyond atrocious!! There are arrows going everywhere in all directions including diaganally.  And it gets super confusing where we're coming from and where we're going. I even checked the walk-through including a video walk-throught. But after a couple of hours, I just wasn't enjoying myself anymore.Farts!

name: Rocksmith¬Æ 2014 ‚Äì Volbeat - ‚ÄúStill Counting‚Äù
short_description: Play "Still Counting" by Volbeat on any electric guitar or bass. This song includes a new Authentic Tone.
reviews:
My fav song 
and its really cool song to play

name: Big Adventure Of Fighting Chicken
short_description: The Furious Eagle led his subordinates and caught the chickens rapidly. Jack, as the strongest warrior among the chickens, lives up to the elder's expectation, overcome lots of obstacles, defeat different powerful enemies and rescue the chicken.
reviews: I bought this game for a dollar, and I still question if it was worth that. It's like, barely functional, and I didn't get very far before it's brokenness made it ridiculously hard. Maybe get this on a 90 off sale if you're curious, maybe.

name: Fatermyth
short_description: "Fatermyth" is an RPG game that combines tabletop role-playing and adventure. The storylines of seven characters from different eras intertwine, depicting an epic of human heroes. The strategic battles with dice + skills add more challenges to the adventure.
reviews:
I using a Minisforum V3, this game does not support touch screen and the stylus pen.
Still recommend it for the content, but i prefer touch screen game play. Super fun game with great story as well as art and game play, highly recomend! Fatermyth is a great game if you know what you're getting into. 

This includes:
‚Ä¢ Interesting, but rarely challenging dice TTRPG gameplay (Every character has a cheese strat- there are few fights that challenge or circumvent it)
‚Ä¢ A story that splits between seven protagonists. You go through everyone once, then go through 4 of them twice, then go back to the start to finish it off
‚Ä¢ Said protagonists barely meeting up in their own stories. 5 of those images up there ^ on the page only happen in the last ~4 hours of the game, and this includes the art and gameplay of the protags interacting with each other.
‚Ä¢ Stiff and passive English translation 
‚Ä¢ You (as a playable character) having to beat and charm a man in combat to have an "intimate" scene with him

I really don't think this is a bad game, hence the positive review, but it's certainly rough around the edges. There are still some untranslated "pages" of the story here and there (thankfully you usually don't lose much), and the overall English translation is written in a way I (personally) found severely unengaging and detached. There are exceptions to this- and the game is wonderfully written when it drops this, but it's not very often. I can tell there's a good story here, with every individual protag and overall, but it was hard to connect to. So, in a way, it's kind of a perfect representation of sitting on a boat while a guy tells you why you should care about all of these people. 

I would best describe this game as a severely railroaded D&D campaign with simpler mechanics. There are choices in this game for sure, but they barely ever matter. If you don't pick what the game wants, it tends to just kill you instantly. There are some situations in which this makes sense, but I got sort of sick of getting fail-states for menial decisions after awhile. The game wants to tell its story, and all you need to do is play the right moves and press the right buttons. 

My biggest active criticism of the game lies with my last bulletpoint. If you don't want to do that (and you have to play through that incident twice on both sides, same result), I wouldn't recommend the game. That incident [spoiler] becomes the basis of Teal Guy and Fox's (using simpler names for identification) relationship, and their second-half stories are about their blooming romance and fated destiny together. The game likes to call their initial incident passionate impulse, but the fact that Teal Guy had to be charmed and defeated for it to happen is... certainly something. I tried to avoid Fox throughout the entire rest of the game for this, to no avail. Gifting her the skinned corpse of her kin gives me a fail-state, and you can't progress to the last section of the game without grabbing her spirit... I just need my boy Bai Chi to find a better girl... [/spoiler] A real hidden gem. Anyone who is a little bit interested in a good story and simple yet quite unique card battle system should try this game.
It has its unique charm not many other game had, and I've played a lot of them. 

Story is split into different characters and you experience their journey one by one. 
And each and every one of them are powerful enough to make your heart beat faster. You can feel how much passion went into this small project

Just give it a try. If you can enjoy the battle system, you will absolutely love this game I honestly didn't expect too much from this game, the whole play dice on cards intrigued me but then I played the demo and what actually grabbed my real attention is that the story is amazing which more or less plays out as a visual novel with choices, deaths and failure states.
I haven't really played (or consumed much Chinese media) to begin with, but all this mythology I have never heard about just makes everything so interesting to me. The commentary from the Fisherman (the DM in the background) is also quite funny.

Also do have to say the story itself gets quite brutal (Ch.2 spoiler) 
[spoiler]R.I.P. Ji Yun, Ji Yu and Ji Feng :'([/spoiler] made me cry for an hour and also has quite some other dark moments but that definetly just adds to the fascination of wanting to see what's next. The failure states are also really intricate and detailed sometimes. Not just "you died" but several paragraphs of horrible things playing out.
The English translation - even though it's noted Alpha in the menu - is absolutely good, some obscure choices of words sometimes, but perfectly understandable.

The card art looks beautiful, and there is so many of it, even scenery you only see for like two paragraphs or so. I also haven't checked the artbook yet due to risk of spoilers.

The game itself does feel a bit janky with some effects, saving inside dungeons seems to run into issues and some of the effect text is really tiny but like those are the biggest issues I've came across.

Completion Edit: I have finished the game at this point, Dungeon saving no longer has issues. Missing text is barely a problem anymore.
The story was stunningly emotional, invoked feelings of happiness, grief, anger, so many tears and a desire to see everything through. Thank you so much for translating this and sharing your culture and mythology. The art is stunning and going into my wallpaper rotation. I learned so many new things too! ([spoiler]Metal[/spoiler] is an element!?)

Bai Chi <3 A card game rpg, with the genshin TCG dice system, which is cool. The interface is a bit weird, but intuitive. The translation is ok. ÂæàÂ•ΩÁöÑÊ∏∏ÊàèÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØËÅå‰∏öÂ§™‰∏çÂπ≥Ë°°‰∫ÜÔºåÈæôÂ•≥Êó†ËÑë2tk Only just started but all around loving it. The dice as your mana/points per turn is cool as heck and not to hard to pick up on. The translation is good so far. The subtitles cut off a bit on the screen when the pretty white haired man speaks to you, but other than that the game explains the mechs pretty well. You are told you can always go back to settings to find the help/tips again. The art work is so amazing!!!! Cool gameplay, never seen using dice as stamina before. The story is pretty good so far. It feels a bit like Hand of Fate. Worth a try. First of all the big question: Is the translation good? Yes it is.

The game is simple yet beautiful. Don't be deceived by how it looks like yet another Slay The Spire clone. The gameplay is very different and engaging. The dice system adds randomness, some of which you can mitigate by your skill choices and equipment. The start feels railroady because it is essentially a tutorial baked into the first run don't be alarmed.

The story seems good. As explained on the store page it is based on Ancient Chinese mythology/history with the creator's interpretation and imagination thrown in.

Gameplay Loop:
1 - On the main map you chose which location to go. This part is linear.
2 - In each location there are story elements, which you access by clicking on their cards.
3 - Each Story Element(which can be a person, a location with people/shops/questgivers, enemy etc...) has its own small story. This part actually is reminiscent of Erannorth Games.
4 - Each Story Element can be solved by making choices, making skill checks, or combat.
5 - After completing a Story Element you gain experience, sometimes you also gain some loot. You gain skill points as you level up.
6 - You can spend these skill points on your character screen to create your own build. My favourite part: You can actually completely change the initial skills, don't like one? Just set it to 0 and regain its point investment. As you spend skill points your passive abilities also get unlocked(Don't be like me and wait 3 levels so that you can buy that +1 dice)

Skill Checks: In this game skill checks are done via throwing dice. There are 6 faces on dice: Yin, Yang, Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise. Yang Dices can be used as substitutes for any other dice except Yin. You have 1 chance to match the required dice type to pass the check. Basically Yin is 1, Yang is 6. Yin is normally unusable but the skills that can use Yin are usually very strong.

Combat: At the start of combat rounds you roll your dice. Each round you also have 3 reroll options and you can use/lock the dices you like before rerolling. You have all your skills available to you. However to use them you must pay their dice cost. This part is similar to Immortal Way of Life's combat. As you level up(or equip related items) you gain extra dice throws or dices of one type so that tutorial episode dice starvation will soon be going away don't worry.

For 5$ this game is a 10/10 buy. 

Note: The game sometimes feels like it is stuck during the start but after a minute or so the menu appears. They probably forgot adding a loading bar at the very start. Don't let this discourage you. It might also simply a me problem but just writing it here in case someone else encounters it.

name: Housekeeping VR
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Early Access
short_description: Housekeeping VR is a physics-based action game with a 70s futurist style for the Vive and Rift. It's a race against the clock as you completely destroy luxurious apartments in an attempt to make as much money as you can, and buy the biggest arsenal of tools to do the job!
reviews:
Crash !! at elevator good idea, could be fun - but unfinished prototype with a lot of bugs and undeveloped game haptics (with using valve index controlers). Too bad! i would have loved it! Abandoned early access game with a pricetag that feels fair...
 
I think hotel rnr is a much better game in terms of game but I won't lie that I do think there is fun to be had here. The levels are packed with detail and look nice, especially the glass and as comments mentioned I experienced no crashes. I had to use virtual desktops boot option to get sound working (directly opened from steam had issues) and the teleport only control feels very early VR.

But for $5 there is a lot of weapons and a lot to destroy that I feel would justify the pricetag if you can handle the jank... and honestly that's the biggest issue for me, it feels so creepy despite not supposed to feeling that way like the sound effects and atmosphere, it doesn't feel like a relaxing place it feels like the hotel in the shinning, speaking of which I never saw the ghosts but I did avoid the attic in the second level as it looked like serial killer den from what I could see.

So while I would say fixing the controls would be nice I think the developer likely realised the project just wasn't working. My advice, find or unlock guns and shoot everything and just try to have fun for $5 or so its hard to ask for more. lemme smash Got a refund coz it wouldnt load up a single stage without crashing, and it aint my high end computers problem. What i saw everything looks way to big, like im a small person who climb up Jacks bean stalk and live in a world of giants, everything is over sized or under, had a hard time finding a middle ground, but dnt take away from the game coz it didnt even load a single stage for me in the time i played. Doesnt mean the game is bad. Cant recommend something that didnt work. This game would easily be in my top 3 if it didn't crash ALL THE TIME. I've tried reinstalling it. I have a 1080 graphics card. This is the game I would show all my friends if it wasn't broken. We allow our two young sons to vent their destructive urges in this game.
Leaves them both tired and smiling.

Catch it on sale, game is fun but content is short for the current $15, unless you have a need to vent by breaking things

Requests: additional levels and weapons, perhaps some challenges or storyline. I LIKE IT! SUPER FUN! heres a link to me playing it https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=irg6_9D9DFI Fun frolic of destructive mayhem at the moment - knew what i was getting from the store video so hard to be disappointed!  At this very early access stage you have access to a very large apartment - complete with its own bowling alley!  I've seen flat out virtual spaces that offer less than that so its already a win for me.  The game promises some massive updates and a lot of additional content to come and the Devs seem eager to listen to feedback so everything positive for the future. 

OH WAIT i forgot the game!  So yeah you just absolutely TRASH the place :P  Everything you destroy earns money for your savings which you can then spend in the apartment complex elevator on bigger badder weapons each of which have their own damage level to cause more chaos :P  
***TIP: just click/tap on the weapon to equip it - don't get distracted by the sign that says grip it - if you hold down the button you dont equip the weapon and will just get frustrated - my first two playthroughs were barehanded because i hadn't figured this out...though that did mean i got to trash the place with a washing machine i picked up so theres pros to that too!  ^_^ ***

The whole things tied up with a neat little bow of a Tony Hawks style mission objective screen where theres hidden things to find and do around the level to clear those objectives off your checklist within a very small window of time (ie. hit Steve Jobs picture with an Apple :D) <-- this alone adds a lot of replayability and a good sense of humor to the game. so bought it and played bout 30 mins of it so far theres only 1 room and i dont know how you get other weapons besides the hammer ... theres tons of weapons but not available i wanted to use the guns so i thought u had to save money to unlock well i made up to 900$ and still had to use hammer..... as of right now this game is not worth the price and still has bugs going on elevator is jittery and when u teleport too close to somthing it automactically breaks it without you trying to use the hammer to break things so in conclusion this game as of right now with little content is worth 7$ in my eyes... i can see it being fun and challaging once they add more rooms and more weapon unlocks and fix the bugs out then it will be a pretty decent game.... i hope the devs get a move on and are fast like some of these other devs on there games .. until then i cannot recommend this game but i wont ask for a refund cuz i have hopes this will be all fixed

name: The path to domination
short_description: Your character is a person whose life begins with a clean slate. You can become a gangster, a knight, a rebel, a slave trader or someone else. You even have the strength to try to conquer the throne of the kingdom, your decisions change the world.
reviews:
This is rpgm project, but qiute contrasting to others. Mainly because of semi-realistic medieval theme and moods. Althought some parts ain't so different. there's still these dull animations and dubious interface. And ofcourse turn-based battle system.
I played a lot of games of that engine, and can say, that game is better than many of such. Conquer or crumble. Strategy, chaos-chaos-chaos-chaos-chaos-chaos-chaos, and power‚Äîpure addictive fun. üó∫Ô∏èüëë The path to domination is slightly reminiscent of gothic with a top view, otherwise everything is like in any RPG, quests, beat mobs, swing
 "Hooked on The Path to Domination! Challenging gameplay, stunning graphics, and immersive sound design. Formidable AI and smooth pacing make each victory satisfying. Multiplayer adds excitement. Highly recommend for strategy fans. 10/10 would recommend!" interesting RPG with a non-linear storyline. Choices matter, but some elements feel a bit repetitive. Still worth trying out "The path to domination" is yet another construction kit template copy+paste from serial shovelware pushers, Seaborgium Entertainment/khukhrovr.  These guys do nothing but copy premade game templates and game tutorials, fill out a few things/stamp out basic levels using the construction kit templates, slap on an asset flipped set of sprites/assets, and dump them on Steam and into cheap nasty shovelware game bundles as cash grabs.  Trying to get paid for someone else's game templates, assets... at best, this is shovelware, at worst, it's a scam/cash grab.

This time the Russians behind khukhrovr made a low effort retro-pixel RPG Maker asset/construction kit flip, one of literally hundreds spamming the Steam catalog, made with the RPG Maker video game construction kit... in their own words, "Our easy to use tools are simple enough for a child."  Like all RPG Maker "games", this is essentially a bunch of low quality/canned assets from RPG Maker coupled with a cringeworthy high school anime club fan fiction.

The only notable point of interest with this asset flip is the "developer" asset flipped a different asset pack from the usual stock RPG Maker asset flips to make it look more western.  It's still garbage, but check out this asset flip scammers rap sheet below. 

As with all RPG Maker games, the poor quality engine displays badly in fullscreen and doesn't have full HD support or any graphics tweaking options, making this unacceptable for any dedicated modern PC gamer.  The point can be made that the intention of RPG Maker is to make demos and small games to pass around friends, and shouldn't be used for "professional" game development.

Like most RPG Maker shovelware and asset flips, the game features extremely low quality copy + pasted 2D retro pixel art, looks awful, and has even worse gameplay.  RPG Maker is an absolutely terrible construction kit, and never results in games of any reasonable quality or value to gamers.

khukhrovr/Seaborgium Entertainment have shown a repeat pattern of unethically dumping other people's work onto Steam as a cheap, nasty cash grab, through this account or through closely linked/alt accounts.  Here's some examples so you can see for yourself:
[list]
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1682610]Tank Zombie Smasher[/url]" = [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rwtm_eZLzKo]Unity 3D Tutorial Create An Infinite Runner Game (With Zombies)[/url] developed by AwesomeTuts (as SimpleSoft)
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1682600]Rolling Car[/url]" = [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/packs/circle-crash-88702]Circle Crash[/url] developed by SgLib Games (as SimpleSoft)
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1686340]AirFighter[/url]" = [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/systems/air-strike-starter-kit-13421]Air Strike Starter Kit[/url] developed by Hardworker Studio
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1834470]Horny Pixels[/url]" = [url=https://marketplace.yoyogames.com/assets/9350/onet-game-engine]Onet Game Engine[/url] developed by Jamie Ford
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1832680]Lovely Anna[/url]" = [url=https://marketplace.yoyogames.com/assets/9350/onet-game-engine]Onet Game Engine[/url] developed by Jamie Ford
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1689980]Yummy Mahjong[/url]" = [url=https://marketplace.yoyogames.com/assets/9350/onet-game-engine]Onet Game Engine[/url] developed by Jamie Ford (as JapanSSJ)
[/list]

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 3 players, and the worst part is these weren't genuine players, these were the Russian fake review accounts that the developer paid to make the fake reviews.  Since the fake reviews are all done, now the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

It's also important to note the "developer" here has connections to a number of shady Russian asset flippers and review manipulators who show an organised pattern to scam and defraud gamers with fake reviews and asset flipping the work of others for profit.  While reviews are about the games, gamers should be informed when developers act unethically.   Whether these connections are the same developer using multiple accounts, or just working closely with other unethical developers, gamers should be warned about the harm to gamers by this developer and their associates.  Buying games from unethical developers puts your money at risk.

[b][quote][url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2017/01/18/steam-takes-down-art-of-stealth-after-developer-posts-fake-reviews/?sh=750e13e12354]Warning: Review Manipulation![/url][/quote][/b]This game features a number of fake positive reviews from accounts known to be in the business of review manipulation/paid reviews.  They're all written in either Russian or broken English, appear at almost exactly the same time, very shortly after the game launched on Steam, all have a direct Steam purchase of the game, and the accounts are used consistently to write fake reviews for asset flips and other cash grabs/scams.  The "Positive" review score on this game should be disregarded due to this blatant, unethical review manipulation.  This is done to deceive and scam gamers into paying for a bad product.

"The path to domination" is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, and the questionable ethical nature of the developer and/or their associates (as outlined above), this is impossible to recommend.  Gamers who want a good retro JRPG experience would be better off playing the originals, like Final Fantasy, Star Ocean or Chrono Trigger.

[b][quote][url=https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/marketing/profile]Profile Features Limited![/url][/quote][/b]Valve have marked this game as "Profile Features Limited" at the time of this review.  This is usually caused by poor sales figures and low community acceptance for the game (to date).  Until this status changes, this game will not give you +1 to your Game Collector badge count, appear in profile achievements or any other Steam meta-accomplishments, nor can it be displayed in some profile showcases.  If these factors are important to you, it may be worth holding off before buying this game.

name: Ria's Hook
short_description: Ria's journey to the strange storm...
reviews:
Ria's Hook is yet another of literally thousands of 2D retro platformers infesting Steam and lowering the average quality of all video games everywhere.  This one eschews the garbage pixel "art" that goes hand in hand with the thousands of amateur made platformers infesting Steam for some hand drawn art, and it's true anything is better than pixelcrap, but it's still not a winner there.

Since the graphics are a fail, that leaves gameplay to try make up the difference, and it doesn't.  This Korean made platformer focuses on a hook swing mechanism, and hook swing mechanisms are not what was needed to revive the old, dead, obsolete platformer genre.  I'd just like to point out 3D graphics hit mainstream in the late 1990's and 2D graphics never, ever had a comeback, so it's unclear why amateur developers haven't gotten the memo.  Anyway, deficient graphics, deficient gameplay.  Let's go into a bit more depth on the technical defects. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The game is comprised of somewhat mediocre hand drawn 2D illustrations instead of professional looking 3D game assets.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget to arrange someone who can create graphical assets properly, or lack of talent.  Regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is very low, beneath what PC gamers have come to expect in this era of cutting edge photorealistic 3D graphics.  At least it's not pixel "art", but if you're looking for contemporary, immersive visuals, this game is a fail.

While there are options to change the resolution for the game, all this does is scale up the simplistic 2D art assets used to make the game, which makes little or no difference to the graphics quality.  Without any other substantial graphics tweaks, it's not possible for gamers to improve the lacklustre 2D visuals.

The controls and game handling are notably very floaty and imprecise.  It's janky and unsatisfying to play... and any experienced gamer will tell you, the handling, responsiveness and general gameplay feel of the control scheme must be well polished for this kind of game to succeed.  Unfortunately, this is something the developer seems to have phoned in, with little to no apparent gameplay testing or polish done.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, left handed gamers or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

This looks a lot like it was designed for consoles, but released on Steam instead by mistake.  While this is on PC, it has all the hallmarks and deficiencies of a console game, from the clunkier than needed control scheme to the less than cutting edge graphics.  There's 10's of thousands of PC games on Steam, and PC gamers deserve only the best.  This might not appeal to many gamers due to the lack of PC-centric design.  It's unclear why this never made it to the video game console appliances it seems to have been designed for.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The game never really caught on with the millions of gamers on Steam, with a very low peak player count close to launch, and then just a handful of players launching this game every couple of days.  This is undoubtedly caused by factors such as those raised in this review.  It's always helpful with buying decisions to consider how popular and successful the product is, and unfortunately while this did accumulate a few participation trophy reviews, overall, people just aren't using it.

So, should you buy this game?  Is this one of the best of the 100,000+ games on Steam?

Ria's Hook is relatively cheap at $3 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.  This is also competing with over 11,000 free games available on Steam, many of them far better than this paid product. Within minutes it had me screaming and swearing and biting my hands. Still, the protagonist is cute. super cute game that make me feel like a game journalist who can't pass the tutorial.

Did I mentioned that the protagonist is super cute? [b]Overall Rating:[/b]
[b]5.5/10[/b]

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
[b]6/10[/b]
‚Ä¢ A platformer game similar to "Getting Over It" and "Golfing Over It."
‚Ä¢ Overall has simple mouse controls but includes numerous physics-related technical skills found through the player's creativity.

[b]Graphics:[/b]
[b]5/10[/b]
‚Ä¢ Simple character and simple backgrounds.
‚Ä¢ A small map in the complete sense, with easter eggs throughout the map.

[b]Price:[/b]
[b]9/10[/b]
‚Ä¢ For $2.99, the game does well in the time to price ratio.
‚Ä¢ The game goes on 50% - 80% sale once every 3-6 months.

[b]Difficulty:[/b]
[b]Harsh[/b]
‚Ä¢ Precise hand-eye coordination is required for the game.
‚Ä¢ A general knowledge of the map is needed to be to progress.
‚Ä¢ In the "About this Game" section, the developer mentions that he does not take responsibility for mental suffering.

[b]Computer Requirements:[/b]
‚Ä¢ The game runs well even on a low-end computer. No noticeable framerate differences between an I3-7100 and an I7-7700K.

[b]Playtime:[/b]
‚Ä¢ Expect around 30 min to 8 hours of gameplay depending on hand-eye coordination.

Edit: Formatting. dnt do it Ïû¶ÎßùÍ≤ú [h1]This game is harder than Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy.[/h1] ÂìáÔºåËøôÊ∏∏ÊàèÂ•ΩÈöæÂïäÔºåÊÑüËßâÊ∏∏ÊàèÁöÑBGM‰πüÂ∫îËØ•Âú®Â§öÊ∑ªÂä†Âá†È¶ñÔºå‰∏çËøáÂ•ΩÁé©ÁöÑÁúüÂÆûÔºåÂ∏åÊúõ‰ΩúËÄÖÂá∫Áª≠‰ΩúÔºå For who wants to play this game: Do not play this game, the difficulty curve is actually not ethical. name: 200 DAYS Zombie Apocalypse
short_description: You must survive a Zombie-infested world.
reviews:
Trailer fails to convey how much repetitive clicking is involved with playing this. It's actually not something you can play for too long at a time. The game looks nice, but reeks of free mobile game design. Those diamonds are a premium currency which you unlock through quests, but supply seems limited. Even though there don't appear to be any microtransactions, it feels like they were meant to be there at some point.

Generally, one of the bigger issues is that the game basically forces you to reset it every once in a while to progress. You get a reset at day 20, then 25, 30 and so forth. You get incremental stats bonuses for doing so resetting as soon as you can is the strategy to get further. After a couple of hours, it really doesn't feel worth repeating the same thing. This is an ordinary clicker ported from mobile phones. 
Nice pixel graphics, acceptable translation, addictive gameplay.
I recommend it, because there is no neutral rating.
PS I requested a refund because I expected a game of a different genre.

name: A Slime And A Civil War
short_description: Go through a world where every living being is a slime and take down the slime dictator in this 2D side-scrolling action game. Discover the secrets of a world no more on your journey.
reviews: Great game Ridiculously difficult and ugly game. slime GOOD GAME BRO!!!

name: Aeterna Noctis: Virtuoso
short_description: Aeterna Noctis: Virtuoso is a boss rush mode that allows players to face the bosses they already defeated during the base game, but includes new difficulty modes, combat patterns, and behavior!
reviews:
Very frequently crashes the game. Also can't save any loadouts, so you have to fill out the skill tree and gems before every fight... Really poorly made. 64 hours, completed (109%) the game and noticed many achievements I didn't have. 0 Game crashes. Great game.

Oh, it has DLC. Oh, it says I can use this to get the achievements from bosses I missed, like beating [name] without using Arrows! Sweet. Beat the boss multiple times, on Hard, even unbound the arrow key, didn't get hit (didn't use bubble either) did not unlock the achievement.

DLC Crashed multiple times loading the boss fight (after screen goes black to load from pressing "B" at the mirror to start, after selecting perks and gems, so you have to do that all over again. To add insult to injury, when you load back into the game, it will be sure to tell you, Challenge Failed :))

Don't buy this DLC if you're hoping to get achievements from the main game, even though it straight up says that it can be used that way. Very frustrating. My personal bewilderment at the fact that this is a DLC pack in the first place aside, Virtuoso is a very, very well made boss rush mode that is generous enough to go the extra mile and even offers up extra boss movesets like it's no big thing (which it is) 
Even just the fact that this DLC allows you to practice bosses without hassle and earn those challenge achievements alone would be worth it in my mind. 

At this price point I definitely recommend this to anyone that enjoyed the base game.

name: Angelo and Deemon: One Hell of a Quest
short_description: Once upon a time, the Grim Reaper chose the wrong door. Angelo ‚Äì a young lazy bum-a-holic, oh sorry - a blogger, powered only by his blogging skills, must turn on ‚Äúpoint-n-click adventure‚Äù mode, go around the inferno, meet the locals, and somehow get back home. Enjoy Hell! We made it just for you.
reviews:
Appealing art style but disappointing point-and-click adventure. Lacking English translation obviously not done by a native speaker. Some nonsensical and/or very far-fetched puzzles I would never have passed without a guide. Annoying characters, especially Angelo. Not enough hotspots and object descriptions. Very little music and it's mediocre. Way too short and the riddles were bloody easy unlike they've promised in their description! Heck, they didn't even mention that this was just the first chapter of their game! The graphics were great though. I really enjoyed this game.  Is it the best game ever made? No, but it is reminiscent of older point a click games that are not usually played any longer due to needing the old hardware to make them work.  I was disappointed that it ended in an unfinished sort of way, but that's just the way it goes. On an everlasting quest to find the perfect PnC games, I found this game on sale and decided, why not? I was a bit dissapointed with the outcome, I really wanted to like this game. It has been 2 days that I finished this game and I kind of forgot what the story was again. I forced myself to finish this game through the cringe. 

The story is about Angelo, this has-been youtuber desperate for views, being mistakenly taken to the afterlife by the Grim Reaper. He then realises that this is his chance to create a once in an "afterlifetime" :3 vlog that will reanimate his dying channel or blog or wtv. Soon after he meets Deemon, a former gangster turned demon after death and the two of them embark on a journey to.... well I actually don't know. Moving on to pros and cons I guess.

Pros:
- The animation is pretty cool.
- Some jokes are funny.
- Some puzzles are pretty witty.
- Cool pop culture references.

Cons:
- A lack of storyline, I don't know what anyone's motivation is in the story.
- Unlikeable characters (Overly edgy, outdated racial stereotypes and so on)
- PnC games are known for its nonsensical puzzles but these puzzles were TOOOOO nonsensical. 
- Walking back and forth between locations was poorly designed.

SPOILERS!
[spoiler]A lot of puzzles had me like... really? At one point I needed to get a balloon from this clown and the only way to do it was put TNT in his brain and blow his brains out? There is no clue or indication as to why I had to do that. [/spoiler]

A lot of puzzles didn't really guide me towards how to solve them. In most point and click games there are subtle hints. but in this game you are just smashing things together and hoping it works. As a PnC superfan, I kept getting distracted and delayed a lot to finish because I kept getting bored. 


Pros
 Just mediocre! It pains me to give a negative review to an indie studio, but there are just too many issues with this game for me to give a positive review. The graphics are fantastic -- kudos devs on the great art. But unfortunately that's pretty much the only part of the game I liked. The story is interesting in theory but kind of falls flat in practice. The puzzles are often nonsensical and poorly designed such that it's hard to know what you're supposed to do. 

But the worst part is Angelo. I hated Angelo so much that I didn't even want to get him out of hell. I understand that he's SUPPOSED to be a bad person, but anti-heroes have to have SOME redeemable qualities to work as good characters. Angelo is just obnoxious and insufferable, with too many cringy, forced jokes, and makes the game a pain to play EVEN AS a form of social commentary.

Also, the insertion of a Trumpian character is cringy and annoying. Give me abstract political concepts all you want, but inserting real-life politics in non-political games is usually just cringy. It's a nice adventure game. Not too long and not too difficult (although I used a walkthrough a few times, but that was also due to me being impatient).
The graphics are nice, the voicing is ok, the story is so so.
Too many 'jokes' about copyright to my liking, only once would have been more then enough.
Looking forward to a sequel (it does end, but it also doesn't, it's more like half way through).

I can't remember if I got it in a bundle or on sale. I see the regular price is 7,49 euro's at the time of writing. As I never buy games above 5 euro's I cannot really comment if the 7,49 is a good price. Personally I would wait until it's on sale below 5 euro's (as I still have such a large backlog anyway). I guess you'd call this the B-movie equivalent of a point and click game.  I thought the demo was humorous enough to try out the game on sale, but not sure about going full price with this one.

On the plus side is the artwork, which is colorful and very striking (thank you for not going pixel art!)

The English translation though is just wacky in spots, with many conversations and responses just not making much sense, although some of them come off as entertainingly wacky.  Voice acting is not too bad under the circumstances.

The puzzles are hit and miss, again not sure how they come up with some of these solutions.  Why do I have to give an item to the doorway that an NPC is guarding rather than the character itself?

Despite the shortcomings, it does seem to have a bonkers kind of charm that is memorable. the game gets stuck on the pc part but the demo works , whats with this ? It's short and funny. I did not expect something more from that, so I am fully satisfied with the expirience.

name: Fire On Fight : Online Multiplayer Shooter
genres: Action, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Early Access
short_description: "Fire On Fight : Online Multiplayer Shooter" is an old-school PvP and Player vs bot online multiplayer first person modern shooter game with stunning 3D graphics and captivating gameplay.
reviews:
I love this game. People still play it and if you to play offline there are bots to play against. if you play it on the steam deck make sure to change controller settings in the game by pressing the select button This is a game that really gets a grip on you... love this game... Steam's 2 hour Refund policy allows little time to really experience a game to give a "fair" review, but as somebody who has played and owned thousands of games since the 80s, I can often [i]feel[/i] when a game isn't worth my time.

There was a point where I've stopped playing newer Call of Duty games years ago. There's a myriad of reasons why I did, which I won't waste time and space explaining here, but ultimately, I sometimes like to find alternatives out there.

With Fire On Fight being barely over $1 on sale, I didn't expect much, but even then, I wanted my money back. What I will say is there will be a small handful of people that will enjoy this game - one player with map knowledge and a clearly better weapon was wiping out the whole room, which is an awful experience ESPECIALLY when a starting player only has one gun selection and you need thousands of points before you can buy another. Players with little money and a lower expectation of game quality might "have fun" in this, but even as somebody who has enjoyed a few low budget, poor quality Military shooter clones.

Most menus are scrolling, and don't properly use the giant wasted space it could, especially when choosing a map for Bot Match, which only shows small Thumbnail images in the scroll menu while leaving a giant empty space on the screen.. The resolution settings in the option didn't seem to have a resolution selected, but when i chose one, a dot did appear on it (It's possible I scrolled past the one it selected by default). The controls puts weapon swap on a single button (the 1 Key), including knife, so in my limited experience, melee is never used, and secondaries are only used if the player is out of ammo. Extra ammo seems relegated to magazine count instead of total bullets, so reloading then gun seems to throwaway the magazine completely, even if it has 60 bullets left. The AUG LMG not only has worse recoil than the standard AKM, but seemingly less damage, resulting in many deaths against bots and players alike due to just having a bad gun. Lobbed grenades might thrown too high, causing them to totally miss where you might expect them to go. Your own grenades also don't hurt you, in which I guess is a good thing, but an unexpected mechanic. Walking and running movement feels clunky and sluggish, but I suppose not terrible...just not good. I can feel the gunplay trying to emulate modern COD Games, down to the hit marker sound, but not quite getting there [i]feelwise[/i]. While I didn't see exactly how many points I got to unlock more weapons, it didn't feel like it was enough to unlock another weapon quickly, meaning somebody (or a bot) that has better weapons will outgun new players easily. The game also begs you to review it for a reward of currencies to unlock weapons and cosmetics - so some of these Steam reviews could very well be misleading. Ironically, just pressing the OK button to go to the review page does eventually give you the points for free, regardless of whether or not you gave the game a review - don't spend you credits on the AUG, its awful.....in fact the same can be said for the game. Don't buy it.

Truthfully, by only spending roughly $1 on Fire On Fight (due to a Steam Sale), most players won't "miss" the money they'll spend on this - so I'm sure someplayers are willing to put up with it's faults to have a CoD clone to run around maps and shoot people with guns - there are worse games out there despite this one being kinda bad. But in terms of these Sh**ty but fun, cheap FPSs, I'd much rather play Warmode or Combat Master personally. good fast easy fps as this game stands right now its superrrr jank, but i think with enough support for the devs they could make this work. great game Someting new :-) reason why i dont like the game is because the audio is bad and i was unable to  set my sensitivity and the graphics and frame rate was awful for the gameplay is good just need to put a bit more effort on gameplay type instead of free for all and team vs  team.The graphic is somehow is nice.And this will be much more fun if the put lotsa battlefield element such as warcry. Add more weapon and skin .This game have lotsa potential to go further.Im loooking forward to see this game in future.Keep it up

name: Trapped in the Forest
short_description: You awake in a mysterious forest that seems strangely familiar. Have you been here before? Is this a dream or a nightmare? Trapped in the Forest is a surreal open world folk horror game.
reviews:
this game is the new minecraft Honestly this game is for the meme's. You kill the guy once then you feel like you did everything. No point in doing anything else. ITS NOT THE FOREST 2 Its not great has the right environment for a great game but falls short with a lot. what they need to do is add more horror based sound in the game and have the antler man be faster.

check out my game play of it
