name: Warlock - Master of the Arcane
short_description: In a time of chaotic upheaval, the player takes the role of a great mage, a warlord vying for ultimate power.
reviews:
A competent 4X strategy game deliberately hobbled and sold in pieces, exploiting the psychological need for completion. The irony is perfect: you play as a power-hungry mage while the developers play as power-hungry merchants extracting your resources piece by piece. You're not the warlock‚Äîyou're the sacrificial offering. Fun. solid Heroes of Might and Magic like I give this game a 4.5 out of 5. 5 out of 5 for value. I bought it on sale and then played it for 183 hours over the last month.
It is like Civ II meets Fantasy General. The different units are very fun to play with. It definitely has that "one more turn" addictive quality. There are a few minor bugs but they didn't interfere with enjoying the game. If you like turn based games and 4x4 strategy games in a fantasy setting, I think you'll like this. Units gain experience and you can also buy them upgrades as you acquire resources on the map. The AI is kind of dumb and there are limited diplomatic options but regardless of these facts, the AI's actions can keep you on your toes. I found this game very enjoyable. I have enjoyed playing this game for quite some time and I can tell you that you will enjoy it too. Have fun. UP FRONT NEED TO KNOW INFO:

It is like Sid Meier's Civilization and Majesty (Ardania world setting) got together, this was the result.  If you ever had an urge for a civ game that was high fantasy, this is the game for you.  Robust set of spells, bestiary, heroes, artifacts, and themes to immerse you in hours of role-playing as a magical emperor.

Pros:
-There are 4 races, doesn't matter what you start with, b/c as you conquer other races, you can use their cities to add to your growing horde/empire
-Learn spells that you can use all throughout the game, the land altering spells are my favorites, I can not describe to you the feeling of being able to raise land from the ocean and building a civ on it
-Units are unique and fun, the addition of the four heroes you can have with artifacts was a nice touch, I recommend the bunny rabbit if you have the gold to spare, he works great as a guardian of an interdimensional gate
-You will without a doubt have your favorite hero choices, mine are the Black Mages, they are cheap at first, but give them time to grow (give em better artifacts and grind them until they lvl up), they become basically walking/talking weapons of mass destruction, I got mine to a point where they are conquering whole nations by themselves w/o assistance
-Speaking of artifacts, one of the spells you unlock is a two-tier crafting session for new artifacts if you are having trouble getting any, you can make some gnarly stuff
-The interdimensional gateways was a nice touch, a very stargate sort of feel to them, you have not only your main world of Ardania but you can go to a couple other (albeit smaller) worlds, i gave one of them to my favorite black mage as a gift for centuries of loyal service to his shadow emperor (me)
-Again, the races are fun, you think you only have 4 options (that is true in terms of theme), but each "race" or faction has a plethora of sub-races, depending on your building options, I got a soft spot for the goblins and the ratmen are fun as well (they are basically pirates)
-game is affordable
-stays true to the Ardania lore, spells, and bestiary, i missed hearing that narrators voice

Cons:
-the only cons are have, i wouldn't really call cons, b/c these are things that can't be helped right now
-the graphics are a bit dated (but it is a 2012 game), every so often there will be a glitch where random strings of light pop up on the map (thankfully so far it has been rare, and not sure what causes it)
-i am upset that i never knew this game existed before randomly stumbling around for another 4X style game, b/c this was exactly the type of game i have been looking for a very long time
-ships are interesting, but a bit too weak at times if you ask me, that includes the bad-a flying ships you can get
-this is a personal preference, but this game would have knocked it out of the park with some steampunk (more airship) and gunpowder options as a late game thing, but that is a personal preference, all-in-all this game stayed very true to the creators vision of a high fantasy realm and game

Summation:
-this is a must have for your library, especially at the price it is going for This game is older now, but it still holds up really well. It has a feel of "Civilization" but with spells and magic thrown in. Easy to learn, and fun to play. An interesting 4X game with powerful terraforming abilities (you can create seas, remove mountains) and heroes who become invincible after buffs (like the invisible flying Granny Weatherwax killing a dragon with a single strike). The drawbacks are typical: the AI is dumb and aggressive, and the controls are poor, unfortunately lacking any gamepad(Steam Deck) support. 
Sometimes crashes. Feels like a cheap mix between CIV and HoMM. On the surface it looks very interesting, but no. Wasn't that good several years ago and by today's standard, it's low tier in the genre Not bad simple civ game.

name: Monster Hunter: World - The Handler's Festive Samba Costume
short_description: This content adds a costume for the Handler to Monster Hunter: World. Let the Handler bring some flavor to your next hunt with this spicy new outfit!
reviews:
mmmmf worth it yesss please
 Woman look like Latina = Game of the Year I don't wanna hear it from any of you. good game yaes Best costume in the game. Lord forgive me for I have sinned I made this purchase in a moment of weakness. I promise I'm in a healthier place now Brown skinned + Samba Japanese Girlfriend

name: Far Cry¬Æ 4 Valley of the Yetis
short_description: Your helicopter has crashed on an unforgiving Himalayan ridge. Explore the frozen landscape and capture, upgrade, and protect your camp from a mysterious cult.
reviews:
Cool idea, lazy execution. This is a fine expansion with an accelerated leveling and collection system that change up enough to make it fresh. The Yetis and in general the reskinned enemies are not threatening, which is a shame because they look cool in this spooky tribal aesthetic. Characters in the story are completely forgettable and there are no cutscenes or NPCs beyond a tied up person or two, so it feels like a fan mod than an official release.

This is the only DLC needed for 100% achievements. The survival element of this DLC is awesome and it is very nice that this is more than just new location. It is also very atmospheric. Unless you REALLY like the main game, and want the same guns, don't get this DLC. There's not much to do in the open world, the yeti's aren't very interesting or challenging, the missions are both boring and easy, and the base defense is incredibly mindless, losing it's appeal after the first time. At the very least they don't stretch everything too thin like in FC6, as the DLC is only about 3-4 hours long. If you still want to try it, wait for it to go on sale for $3 or so like I did. You'll see what I mean. This is just not fun.  Everything does so much damage and staggers you until you die.  The missions are all the same.  There is  way too much unnecessary rope parkour that is actually dreadful. Pleasantly surprised by this DLC, it's very well executed.

Short, concise and has a good flow.

Interesting story, very fun gameplay mechanics.

Ending is a bit "wtf" = as if devs ran out of time to wrap it up properly (again).

Overall, great DLC, very nice! A dull and repetitive dlc that is barely connected together with a needle's thread of a "story." Go do a random mission Ubisoft cooked up to pad time, come back defend outpost. Repeat ad nauseam. Very disappointing after the fun that was FC4. That was fun! Pretty solid DLC if picked up on sale.

Starting from nothing in a new map you have to build up dilapidated base and protect it for 5 nights. Do a couple of missions and it goes to free roam and you can go do mini missions to help gather resources  to upradd your base. These might be liberating supplies, finding/destroying weapons emplacement in the mountains or protecting Yak.  This allows you to fit mine fields, mounted guns or more fortifications/funnel points.   Then you can do the 6 or so main missions ending each night with base defending from 4 waves of attackers from different sides.

It‚Äôs fairly easy to die, so recommended to arse about doing the upgrade quests before the main stuff.  Map is big enough to be interesting without too much repetition . No fast travel, but plenty of snow Mobiles to get around rapidly. You can find weapons and rare guns here and there and upgrade them to suit your playstyle . Initially I found it too hard, until I realised I‚Äôd acquired loads of skill points and money and resources to beef myself up with more health/syringes and holsters. (Hadn‚Äôt played the main game for a few years and bought DLC now achievements added so forgot mechanics). Once you get a load out you like it‚Äôs quite satisfying.

Story is short and to the point. Bit more grapple and climbing than I‚Äôd like but it‚Äôs set in the mountains so expected. Nicely self contained and nothing missable.   Worth ¬£3 and doable in a couple of evenings or one big monster energy/pizza session. great dlc Great DLC, lot's of fun and I would recommend to buy it on sale. It's like a separate mini campaign.

name: Funny Volleyball
short_description: "Funny Volleyball" is a modern remake of the classic arcade volleyball game from the 90s, giving new emotions and nostalgia. Immerse yourself in bright and picturesque landscapes, enjoying the game, but do not forget about the main goal - victory!
reviews:
Well, it's a very good game to kill time and relax after a long day or to compete together without tension!
I played by myself and tried the game mode for two players with my kids using a couple of gamepads, it was exciting for them!)
Funny volleyball has bright and colorful graphics, that creates a festive atmosphere and my choldren really like it!)
The gameplay is also very simple and dynamic, so the game allows me to relax and enjoy it without thinking of controls, tricks and other stuff.
Overall, the game is an excellent choice for anyone looking for something fun and easy-going!
By the way, volleyball runs perfectlky on Steam Deck!)

name: Meeting Her
short_description: Meeting Her is a choice-driven adult Visual Novel. You play as Eric, an adult man who already has a life with friends until a new girl appears in his door. The game contains animated sex scenes with all the girls, But you can pick your path, what girl do you would like to be with? it is your choose.
reviews:
IS MORE TO THIS COMING OUT BECAUSE IT SEEMS UNDONE TO ME Abandoned. Reviewed on: 2024/06/04
Score: 6/10
Playtime: About 9 hours for 100% achievements and unlocks.

[b]Note:[/b]
All signs point to this game being abandoned. Purchase at your own risk.
What's there is serviceable, albeit flawed.


[b]Adult:[/b]
The main flavor of this game is father/daughter incest. With some player choices pointing toward future content about pregnancy, exhibitionism and MFF threesomes.


[b]Visual:[/b]
Sprites are used a lot, where characters are shown on top of backgrounds, instead of posed and rendered. This causes obvious issues with perspective, where characters seem unnaturally tall or small, or otherwise out of sync with their environment.
The animations aren't great.  Lots of clipping of hair and body parts. They also have robotic movements, mostly in the early game. It's clear the dev improved their skills considerably while creating this AVN.
Mandatory pauses are used during animations, blocking players from clicking to skip/continue.
Some textures are very low resolution, most noticeably the ground of the park.
There is some variety in body-shapes, though all LI have (very) large chests.  Estefania is built like an amazonian warrior, which fits her personality nicely. Fernanda is short and thicc. 


[b]Sound:[/b]
‚ÄúMeeting Her‚Äù has music and sound effects.  The music is fairly generic, but not too repetitive or distracting.
The music's volume isn't well-balanced, some tracks are much louder than others.


[b]Novel:[/b]
Albeit marred by its English translation, the writing isn't bad.  In the sense that it isn't perfect, but I've seen much worse.
Two main plots intertwine. One is the main character reconnecting with his long-lost daughter. The other has him investigate money laundering at his place of work.
The only mandatory LI in this story is Fernanda, the daughter. The MC's current girlfriend (Estefania) can be dumped at the start of chapter 3. 
Each LI has their distinct personality, hopes and dreams, and player choice determines how they act toward the MC.
Sadly, the MC is a bit of a mixed bag. He can appear juvenile and creepy, even if the player doesn't make creepy choices.  If the player decides to go after multiple LI's, the relationships will be based on lying and cheating.


[b]Conclusion:[/b]
I would've loved to see this game get finished, but all signs point to it being abandoned.  This isn't just a porn game, but a story about characters navigating their circumstances and history with each other. 

[hr][/hr] 
[b]Socials[/b]
Interested in discussing AVN? Join the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/LewdReview]Lewd Review Group[/url]
Or, follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44944816-Lewd-Review/]Curator page[/url]. Buyer beware - this game is an abandoned Steam project. The developer has gone radio silent and that's usually an indication that the game is DOA. Its been my experience that most developers (with abandoned projects) use Patreon for making money. They then release an EA game on Steam usually with promise of grandiose updates / future content to milk some extra money. And then nothing happens. The latter happened here. Sadly as with many of these abandoned Steam projects, you get invested in the story and then...poof "that's all folks." Save your money (and time) on "completed games" or on others that actually get regular updates / feedback from the developer. Spanish AVNs:  Come for the girls, stay for the misogyny. its a good game for the price i'm looking forward to the next episode Fernanda is very pretty.
 What is it with AVNs that give you a character that is suppose to be the main character's friend, who is so stupid and such a scum bucket?  I guess stupid people hang out with stupid people, but I sure don't, so I don't want a character like that in the story unless I have a choice to have the main character completly avoid him.  Anyway, after 118 minutes I quit reading as I found the whole story to be stupid and poorly written and story boarded.  If you are looking for a good AVN on Steam, I would recommend the following:  Acting Lessons, Depraved Awakenings, Leap of Faith, Love Season, and Sisterly Lust. It's good and interesting story!  I'm excited to see where the story goes from what is in the game so far.  I've enjoyed the game and waiting for more of the story.  The game has really good renders and animations.  I recommend the game but keep in mind that it is EA so it's not finished yet. a bit boring imo..

name: Shadow Trick
short_description: Turn into a shadow and clear all the levels. Shadow Trick is a cute platformer game starring a wizard able to switch between the real world and the shadow realm. Keep an eye on your shadow and don't let your eyes trick you!
reviews:
I would say this game is pretty good all things considered, but the graphics feel a little difficult to look at. The displacement between the non-shadow parts of the level and the shadow parts of the level kind of make it a little difficult to sometimes judge where things truly are, but at the very least the game isn't too difficult. But I would say the displacement between the two can be a little annoying, I'm just saying. Overall a fun game, but not without issues. Mainly two.

1. If you're holding a direction and then take damage, you get "stuck"? You can't just keep holding left/right after getting hit, you have to re-press it, which has gotten me killed on multiple occasions.

2. Snowflakes. Snowflakes, snowflakes, snowflakes. It's a cute novelty, but ultimately a bad mechanic. Any snow level that has them effectively traps you until the randomly generated snowfall allows you to leave [spoiler](which is annoying for the final boss since it uses them.)[/spoiler]

Apart from that, this is a cute little pixelated adventure with a simple but fun gimmick that you can kill an afternoon with.
Overall Rating: Good! I really like this game, but there are a few issues:

- I think the game needs cloud save data like other games. If you play on one device then play another you have to start over.

- If you change into a shadow, then climb onto a ladder, the character falls and gets stuck (I broke the game). Some type of glitch.

- I think there needs to be a UI for the moon objects so you know how many you have on each level (I keep forgetting how many I have after I grab them). But the moons aren't hidden so most of the time you won't miss them.

Audio
There is a weird glitch with the sound:
- If you start the game with your computers speakers, then sound will not come through on headphones.
- If you start the game with your headphones, then sound will not come through on computers speakers.
You have to close the game use the sound that you want, then start the game again. A short, casual platformer with a swap mechanic that's alright. Each level has 3 moon fragments to collect with all of them needing to be obtained to get the ending. Beating each boss without taking damage is needed to get all the fragments but none of them are particularly difficult. Good game, fun levels, great art style, just good all throughout. The game does get a bit frustrating though, especially in the boss levels. It's not even like a "challenging" frustrating, more of just annoying to try and get, especially with the boss levels. Though that it largely just a skill issue. If you want 100% but suck at platformers I would look elsewhere very charming and fun! definitely worth picking up This was an absolutely great game! some parts are kind of hard but you can get through after some while! I would recomend!! This is an awesome little game! Collect moons, avoid enemies, and alternate between background and foreground to progress safely. Recommended. short and sweet platformer! the music and art are wonderful, and the level design is strong! everything is built around the central gimmick of switching to and from the shadow, and for the most part is very solid. the last two bosses are a bit of a pain to complete without getting hit, but all in all kind of just serve as a small challenge (they are all 3-hit jump on head bosses).

if you enjoy short platformers with great cohesion and sense-of-self then i would highly recommend you pick it up! Like other Neutronized games before it, Shadow Trick is short and sweet. You can beat it in about an hour, but that's by no means a bad thing.

The main idea of turning into a shadow to find secrets and sneak up on enemies is pretty fun! I like that the levels make you use the two forms judiciously at times, and aside from a few frustrating choke points, the game's overall a good time!

name: Paris: Jigsaw Puzzles
genres: Adventure, Casual, Indie, Simulation, Sports, Strategy
short_description: Jigsaw Puzzles of Paris including the Eiffel Tower and other famous streets and buildings. Do puzzle in a new way! Advanced puzzle layout and involving game play will help you to relax after a hard-working day. Paris: Jigsaw Puzzles is designed for adults and for kids.
reviews:
Instead of an in-game puzzle selection menu where you can preview and pick a picture, you have to select one of the 15 pictures through the Steam launch option menu, and then remember that "the nice pic I may want to replay is launch option [i]Picture 8[/i]". There are much better, free jigsaw games you can play in a browser.

On the plus side, the whole game is only 6 MB on disc, a rarity nowadays. I also liked the uneven puzzle piece sizes. Some are huge, some are tiny.

In the end, the pictures provided are not impressive enough to overcome the problem of a non-descriptive text-only selection menu.

 That's one seriously basic puzzle game This is like when Icarus made those wings out of wax and shit but then he flew too close to the sun. It's like Adam Sandler, a tragically misunderstood, genius crafter who suffers for his artwork. I love this game more than Dark Souls II, and that's saying a lot. Only buy this game if you're prepared to cream your pants every time you turn this masterpiece on. I cannot choose my puzzles, get a got 2 pictures and on the second one, that was it, it pops up every time I open the game and i have no icon to click to choose another puzzle!  Very dissappointing It's a fun game to try and complete multiple puzzles. Comes with a diverse set of issues that wont leave you bored from the lack thereof. You can't see what you're going to make beforehand so you're left guessing. You can't save your puzzle progress at all so it is best done in one sitting. You also can't even switch puzzles.

name: Summer Puzzles
short_description: Move all parts to form the complete image.
reviews: Great artwork, good game.

name: Gardenarium
short_description: Gardenarium is a chill adventure taking place on a cloud in the sky. You land as a stranger and struggle to gain access to the mysterious Depot by picking up trash and making the land grow.
reviews:
delicious. only wish there was more of it. super enjoyable - basically a cute way to explore cute gradient animations. lovely game. thank u ! Great colors, weird shapes appearing everywhere. However, it is sad that it is too short. It could be a better game with a more detailed storyline and more stages. Maybe we can see some extensions in the following days, who knows, eh? Chilling surrealiality Pure eyegasm, but not much of a game.

If you want an artistic game that doesn't actually have much gameplay (all you do is walk around, talk to NPCs and collect cans) and is very short.

Some would say it's not worth those 3 bucks, and they're probably right, but it's good to support creative developers so they can buy themselves that frozen pizza for 3 bucks. If youre high and thinking about buying it, im here to tell you to do it. I could live here. Beautiful, creative, surreal. Songs of the Lost, Museum of Symmetry, and Fast Machine (PALGAL on itch.io) are also lovely and worth your time I completed it twice in the time I've played. Fun art and really quite interesting for a small amount of time. If it goes on sale for more then 50% off I would say buy it if you like super trippy games and fun art. That was intense, I was not ready for that. Great experience, the art is amazing. Short but very enjoyable. A really trippy experience...i wouldn't reccomend if you don't like minimalist art tho...the game is a bit short, (max 30min of gameplay) but mostly you have to enjoy the art and the animations of it.

name: Take on Helicopters - Rearmed
short_description: Take On Helicopters: Rearmed is a free official DLC for Take On Helicopters.
reviews:
Although this FREE DLC integrates VERY well into using the ArMA 2 game files, there is one fundamental problem.
If used in conjunction with the ToH campaign mission, it screws up the playability of the campaign, leading to "black screens" of the game engine not properly loading for the missions.
In consequence, if you do not care about the actual game campaign and want to just use the Free Flight option with the Seattle map, go for it, other keep it uninstalled.

name: Birth of Shadows¬Æ
short_description: Play as a Shadow Knight with unique rage mechanics. Campaign and Co-op multiplayer. Create new content with powerful map editor.
reviews:
my protection... for the internet said this is not on the safe software list and blocked it (when i tried to start up the game). freaky, and disppointing.

 it looks terrible but i was gonna see if i could get all the achievements on a StopWatch plans are canceled. This is so perfect for what I was looking for. In 20 minutes I was able to load it up, play the campaign just a bit to get a feel for it, then go to the map editor and create a small skirmish map. The editor is quite complete and very intuitive. Decide what you want to place then scroll up and down in the appropriate box to find just what you need.Back to main menu and load your newly made map and have at it.  I'd love to see BOS2 be a 3D version with a great camera setup to really  get into it. All the functions as they now stand would work well or maybe the Dev will come up with some new stuff. If you're looking for something where you can cook up your own battles without spending thqt much time just to have  quick play or spend more time etc.. name: Aesthetic Melody
short_description: Sit back and enjoy 30 minutes of original electronic and vaporwave music in this challenging platformer, push forward to unlock Time Trial mode and a second playable character who completely changes the gameplay.
reviews:
why does some of the trading cards are so expensive? [h2]Aesthetic Melody[/h2]

Has a total of [b]5[/b] trading cards. As a game, this is a bog-standard gravity reversal precision platformer with questionable hit detection. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†à‚¢ø‚£∑‚£Ñ‚£†‚£ø‚°è‚†à‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†â‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†ô‚†õ‚†õ‚†â‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you. [table]

name: Hookshot
short_description: Hookshot is a fun and challenging arcade game in which you must shoot the player progressively up the puzzle area sticking to the walls as you rise. The aim of the game is to reach the end of the level without hitting any spikes or obstacles.
reviews:
It's a bit tough to decide whether I should recommend this game or not. The concept is simple, and it could be a good time-killer. The music is average, and if you're into Steam achievements, you'll enjoy that aspect. However, I find the price of 2‚Ç¨ a bit too high for what the game offers. There are similar games available for much cheaper. It's fun, but not worth the full price in my opinion. 100% completion clocking out at 12 minutes is laughably low when the levels are so primitive you could probably crank out a couple of them in one evening with ease. It's functional, but not worth $3, as much as I want to support newrounds based devs being able to be paid for their work and people who are, from the looks of their libray, learning and experimenting, I felt a bit ripped off even only paying $2 on sale. so my rec is only under signifigant sale. this is a great game. it's short and simple, but it does *A LOT* right given that. the person who made it should be proud Very good game. Had fun to play it. Big Thanks to the developer for creating this game. I'd like to say yes, but the caveat is too great.

[h1]Puzzle game with a simple, neat idea[/h1]

You auto-rotate and can "hook" yourself to the wall being pointed at. If you hit a spike you die, and once you reach exit you win the level.

There are no time limits and the levels are fairly easy, so it's a rather casual game. I only wish the rotating speed was a bit faster.

As you complete levels (each of which grants an achievement), new features are introduced, like moving or disappearing platforms, timed doors and auto-rotating level. It's fine and cool so far.

[h1]But then it ends[/h1]

It lasted less than 15 minutes.

Twenty-four (24) levels sounds like a reasonable number, but they are short. Short is good for this sort of puzzles, but then I'd like there to be way more of them, something of the order of 100.

Therefore, it's [i]not[/i] worth the full price: I got it for ‚Ç¨0.50, which feels almost but not quite adequate to me.

There could be e.g. a challenge mode, say, with time limits or limited number of hookshots. Properly balanced, even the present content could be made worth it.

[h1]Conclusions: decent but not enough content[/h1]

Consider the length: less than 15 minutes. By all means, the levels are nice and puzzle design adequate for the bunch, but it's so short.

There's nothing else compelling about it. I mean, it's virtually bug-free (good) and the soft colorful choices of palette are cute (nice) and its music is okay but forgettable (oh well), but nothing is making me say "woah" for its 15 minutes of stage time.

Yet, if you get this for about ‚Ç¨0.50 or less and want a short achievement/puzzle fix, it may still be worth it.

If it were free, it would definitely be a recommendation. Incidentally, you can play it [url=https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/712242]free on Newgrounds[/url]. So maybe go there first and come back if you want to support the dev and/or get the Steam achievements.

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9997062/]~Twistorian Curator~[/url] For this game I found it hard to decide if i should recommend or not. The game itself is a basic idea and it would be a good game to play, to kill sometime. The music is average. If you like steam achievements then this is the game for you. The price for this game I find way too expensive. You can find games similar to this far cheaper. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FoiRKOT4Yi8

name: Arcana: Heat and Cold. Season 1
short_description: The misfortunes of the unskilled magician who just wanted to make some money and not get into any troubles.
reviews:
Wilx100% (Aug 23, 2022) - VERY nice game. The gameplay is just a visual novel but with a tinyyyy bit of puzzles in it, but the story is interesting and fun, and each character is unique. The art is beautiful, It goes from pixel art to full 2D when any dialogue happens and when the "romance" scenes happen. It's honestly a very well-drawn and story-rich game. I would rate this game 8/10. The game has a good style and a funny plot 10/10 Annoying interface with drag'n'drop without much reason for it to be there, nor any particular depth to the feature. Also, long and annoying expositional talking from NPCs. 
The graphics are OK though. Boring

STEAM is garbage, tries to control what we post. Story: You are a skilled man in the arts of the Arcana (magic) and you live a simple, yet chaotic, nomadic life traveling around aided people. There is a system that affects everyone, balancing hot and cold natures (kind of like Chakras) or the person will become sick. You come across different situations involving a few individuals that need your help. A couple of them are hot, beauties that eventually accompany you along the way and repay you for your help. There is a ton of conversations, friendly banter, and clowning around between the characters on the journey.

Content: MaleXFemale, FemaleXFemale, Female Creatures (a fox and a spider for example)
There are 8 scenes which are somewhat long sequences with still images and voice acting.

Audio/Visuals: The quality of the art is excellent and the game world is a nice, unique RPG of the past (think older Final Fantasy, Octopath Traveler, and RPG Maker games). The sounds and voices are fitting with the context of the game.

Bugs: None encountered.

Length: 3-5 hours, mainly depends on how fast you read and how long you "spend" in the scenes.

Overall, a great, short game with well drawn art for a small price. I wish Season 1 and 2 were one game, but I guess some people like to break things up like this for reasons unknown to me. I would recommend it at its current price and state. more of a reading simulator than an rpg, but the story is fine, worth $5 at least Good plot line,puzzles are bit annoying and music gets repetitive after a while.More like a visual novel then a game. a game which if you win, you actually lose

name: The Culling
short_description: Battle Royale is back! In a remote island paradise, 16 contestants have 25 minutes to explore, scavenge items, craft weapons, build traps, hunt and kill each other. Only one will be crowned the winner, do you have the guts to survive?
reviews: epic Game is dead, devs killed it Scam I'm still mad this shit was fu**ed up, I hope the devs can only afford toenails for breakfast now. i remember 10 year old me opening my 960 ti laptop to get some games of The Culling with my brother. i miss the simplicity yet immersive looting system that made me feel like i was in the hunger games. Hope to see this game or something similar rereleased in the future like many other battle royale fans. The Culling 2 is better I remember liking this game lots when it came out. Truly a pioneer of the battle royale game sector. Sad that its dead these days. I was upset about the changes, but the game was still good. It was fun to play with friends and randoms. It is a shame that this is off Steam now. great game ruined by a shit dev This game was okay when it originally launched and but as it has changed and and tickets are a thing with tons of micro-transactions I'd give it a 3/10 as its okay for a time sink.

name: Dunk Lords
short_description: Dunk Lords is a two-on-two basketball beat 'em up featuring over-the-top special moves, devastating dunks, and game-changing equipment. Choose from 20 of the baddest ballers around, each with unique special attacks and abilities, and do battle on a variety of hazard-filled courts.
reviews:
The other positive reviews (which convinced me to buy this game in the first place) already said it better than I can. If you've ever been a fan of the 'EA Sports BIG' games then this one should be an automatic wishlist at the very least. slam dunk this in the refund basket, dawg Yes, I would like to recommend Dunk Lords for everybody. +1 üèÄ First are the positives: I love the soundtrack to this game. Immediately you are launched into a wonderful bouncy title screen, and the art is equally beautiful. The aesthetic to the game is fantastic and perfect for the type of game it wants to be. That said....

It's way too busy on such a small court. You're immediately inundated with a wide moveset (which is great! but) you have such a small court to maneuver it around on, and events on the court happen so fast that you need to be intimately familiar with the game before you can even think of utilising moves like faking a shot. You're expected to uppercut an opponent when they're about to dunk, but it happens in half a second, and when everyone is crowding in the same spot it's impossible to tell what is even happening, let alone know what move to use. I really want to like this game, because it's solid mechanically, but the way it delivers all these mechanics needs work. It's a soft no, but if it's on sale and you want to grind a hundred hours into becoming a Dunk LORD, go for it. 3 POINT BOOTS What is Dunk Lords ?

Well, what a disappointment, Im someone who really like to keep searching for a long time the steam catalog during a sale looking for some underrated indie I never heard about that is cheap and fun and that may provide something I may not get from an AAA game, Dunk Lords taking a fast look into the images and videos on the store page made it look like a simple basketball indie game and with its cartoony and colorful visuals I expected that I would get a fine sport game that would be fun and easy to get into, the sad thing is that this game just feels off, the controls are unresponsive and messy, the gameplay lacks a lot of polish and it feels way faster than it any right to be so every match becomes a confusing mess that is hard to keep focused into, the maps are too small for the chaotic gameplay they present here and as soon everyone get their upgrades and special moves it feels like a very unbalanced clusterfuck where every character can hit the ball multiple times without being able to stopped, even the moves responsible for taking the ball back from an opponent or blocking their launch feels useless and unresponsive, it all comes to the a rush to who can "dunk" faster so it feels like a half-assed indie basketball game, I didnt expect it to be a topnotch mario-like sports game with colorful visuals, powers or silly stuff happening like many other similar games does, it actually even does have that but doesnt put it into any good use, I just expected it to be fun and the game isnt, it just feels poorly designed, unbalanced, and messy, so I cant recommend it at all. Come for the NBA Jam / NFL Blitz warm nostalgia vibes, stay for the depth of strategy, achievements, and game modes. Really fun game! It's essentially NBA Jam with a Moba-style item system, characters with special powers, and the ability to beat the crap out of each other.

I had a lot of fun playing this game, but the lack of an online multiplayer mode is honestly quite a waste, especially considering the global situation. frank is a sentient strawberry whos the second coming of steven curry

name: MageWorks
short_description: Get ready to embark on an epic journey into the mystical world of MageWorks! Armed with your trusty spellbook and powerful staff, you'll conquer every magical obstacle in your path. Are you ready for the adventure of a lifetime?
reviews:
Just finished (hopefully) the tutorial. As soon as you start, you're greeted by a big scroll with a wavy dragon head. It speaks to you for at least a full five minutes, where you aren't allowed to do ANYTHING besides stand and listen. This is continued further when you're told how to play by the bird familiar, with each individual step of doing one small thing being surrounded by about 5-10 minutes of talking and awkward, uncared for jokes. During this tutorial phase, there is NO free-roam, object interaction, or anything besides the tutorial. I spent the first full hour of gameplay listening to that bird talk, and lost all appetite for the game. I may try it again in the future, but for now the controls are terrible and the tutorial completely ruins the game. Okay so I just bought this game and when I start the game it crashes every times I restarted it I shut it down I uninstalled it and still it crashes So I'm giving it a thumbs up, because I don't think it's fair to downvote a game that is open about its issues from the get go.  Pretty much I knew what to expect when I bought it.

Overall in it's current state as of this review (8/5/2016) it's a neat little tech demo.  The spells load quickly and are kind of fun to play with.  

The graphics need some work.  Textures in specific. It's got a very colorful, cartoony, almost Fable look to it, but the textures are some of the lowest I've seen in VR so far.

I wouldn't mind an alternate navigation system to the teleport since I don't get the motion sickness issue, but I realize that I'm probably in the minority of players who can wrap their brain and stomach around moving without actually moving.

If I could throw the developer some suggestions it would be:

* In addition to the custom spellbook, it would be nice to have a carry slot to hold more than one spell book.  A belt slot for example like you can find in many other VR games.

* In your more aggressive monster levels, work on the AI a bit.  I never once felt threatened or at risk of being killed by the orcs that were in the village. 

* Tighten up the environment textures a bit.  They are pretty grainy.

Overall: This game was worth my $5 entry fee and I look forward to what the developer has coming next. 
 Currently lacking in content but certainly an enjoyable game.
Pretty casual as said in the description.
You teleport around your tower where you can choose different staffs a choose and elemental book for your spells
Each elemental book has a couple different spells, but most are locked.
There are 3 different spells you can choose from but you also find 2 more by traveling to different locations.
The third location I couldn't find a spell, but the mobs were more aggressive and numbered.

I am sure you will also be able to draw your own staff, but haven't figured out how to do that.

Also lacking tutorials, but that will probably be fixed in the future.
The current small tutorial is in form of a book, so it is easy to add more.


Seems like it could be a pleasant relaxed game in the future.
 I found the lack of instructions frustrating when I first played this game a few days back. But the new version released yesterday is a great improvement. I'm happy I contributed money to this game as the developer is clearly making progress. I look forward to seeing where it goes. This is still too rough for me, so I can't recommend it.

The concept is nice, and the ideas presented by the developer sound fun
but until it gets more fleshed out I don't see myself playing this any more.

It's also riddled with bugs and glitches.
Highlighted items staying highlighted forever, the pages of my book were
stuck far outside of the bindings for a while, switching books didn't work half the time
and the teleporting is very fiddly.
I'm also floating 2ft off the ground, which could probably be solved by a room calibration, but is
definetly a problem with the game itself since my floor is perfectly level in the SteamVR hub as
well as my other VR games.

I also disliked the mana mechanic since 99% of the fun is to just mess around with the spells.

Given more time and work this can turn into a decent little game,
and I'd be happy to come back to it if it does - but for now, it's a no. Ok, I visited the three locations now. I think it¬¥s a nice concept and it makes fun so far. You can¬¥t expect too much, but the dev is honest and wrote a good description what he is planing here on the store page. 
Actual status: "Early Access will allow players to hop into the MageWorks world in its current form as a magic playground to casually test spells and explore environments.‚Äù 
If he is honest with one year of development until leaving the Early Access status and if he is using this time good it could get a really great game I think. I liked it more than A Legend of Luca because the environment is really nice and it has some hard to describe fun factor for me. 
But again, it¬¥s Early Access, you can¬¥t even fight atm with the enemies. The enemies direct outside of the castle are only targets for testing spells. The others in the first place also, in the second place they notice you but are shooting in a different direction and in the third one they come and beat you but they are not making damage. But the fight system is really nice and the spells are cool and well made. Made a lot of fun and I¬¥m really looking forward to play the finished game.

Pro 
-nice environment 
-nice spells and good targeting 
-cool concept 
-it¬¥s hard to descripe, I liked the way it is :-)

Contra 
-short and not much content atm 

Possible bugs 
-had some stuttering, but Steam VR was making problems half of the day, so maybe no problem for you 
-I fallen two times in the floor while teleporting back to castle

I will keep it and hope that the dev is nobody that is making cash and then doesn¬¥t deliver more content. If you want to play a game NOW don¬¥t buy it. If you want to support the dev and giving him the possibility to hopefully put more time on it you can give it a try if you ask me. Good starting foundation.  Enough fun with the spells and limited exploration to warrant the 4.99 buy in and support development price.

In my limited playtime so far, I'm a bit put off by the cartoony alien looking monsters. The rest of the game has such a good basic feel I'm not sure why you went with that - I'd much rather see a variety of traditional advasaries.

Combat has quite a bit of room to improve, everything is one shot dead - extremely basic combat mechanics.

If you are going to include the basic hunter/gatherer premise that would add some value, not sure what I'm supposed to be looking for beyond spells?

Overall in July this is a game that I feel is good fun at this price.  By December it will need to be expanded on greatly or like many other of these recent early releases I fear it could be lost in the sea of developed upcoming games.

name: Fantasy Grounds - D&D Wayfinder's Guide to Eberron
short_description: Wayfinder's Guide to EberronEberron was born in 2002 when Wizards of the Coast launched a worldwide search for a new campaign setting.Wayfinder's Guide to Eberronbrings the eponymous campaign setting to the fifth edition of Dungeons & Dragons.
reviews:
Why is this still being sold when everything in here is already in the D&D Eberron: Rising From The Last War plus updates and  a whole bunch more? Please remove this from future sales so people don't feel ripped off like I do. Beware, this product is not the official version of the book for Eberron 5E
You should buy D&D Eberron: Rising From The Last War instead.

name: FSX Steam Edition: Airbus Series Vol. 3 Add-On
short_description: FeelThere‚Äôs Airbus Series Vol. 3 is a detailed depiction of the fascinating world of Fly-By-Wire technology as well as the Airbus‚Äô high-end systems.¬†These powerful aircraft offer unrivaled flying pleasure.
reviews:
i want refund ! WARNING !

DO NOT BUY IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO WASTE YOUR MONEY!

Callouts are horribly made (2,500, 1,000, 500, 400, 300, 200, 100, 60, 50 40, 30, 20, 10, 5)
Some boeing callouts too (Too low, gear! Too low, terrain)
PFD and glareshield buttons/switches suck.
No TCAS. (Useful if you fly on VATSIM like me.) The A330 has a nice and detailed cockpit. It flies well and i have never had problems in the air so far. I have had this for about 6 months now. Some problems: The armrest for the captain covers the speedbrake lever i believe so you cant really use that. One time I logged into the plane and the screen that displays attitude, altitiude, ect was black. To fix it, you hover over it qith your mouse and either scroll up and down and it will get brighter. This has happened to me several times, where you log in and the heading map isnt working( it says in a red text). To fix it, i delete the add on from my computer and then i reinstall it and its fine. Overall a great add on and would recommend purchasing. Terrible!!! Don't waste your time and money. A good bit of the cockpit modes don't work and screens go blank. I can't believe i wasted my money on this crap This really is a shocking add-on and wish I could be refunded for this to put towards a better one. Since getting this I bought the Aerosoft A318/19 and A320/21 and its way better in every way possible, looks,function,play ability, sound etc,this sounds like blender full of spanners.... should of waited and saved to get the Aerosoft A330/A340...

If you're thinking about this add-on...just don't, take it that m,any before you have wasted their money in order for you to save it and spend elsewhere! I do not have in any of the airbus 321-340 or 330 series the GPS/NAV mode button or the course knob in the cockpit view. help It is a waste of money . Buy instead FSX Steam Edition: Airbus A320/A321 Add-On . its not working Unplayable. Controls are a disaster. I have purchased the air bus pack vol. 1-4. Disappointed the some of the auto pilot systems do not work
The speed control switch cannot dial in speed, set altitude and vertical speed. I now want to delete and want a complete refund. Unless of course someone can tell me if I have gone wrong somewhere

name: Monobeno
short_description: This was a story about humans and monsters, disease and haunting, and the past and the future. It leads you to the unusual traditional Japanese culture.
reviews:
"In order to outsmart your adversaries, you must first understand the game they're playing. You must learn to think like them, anticipate their moves, and then counteract with precision.

Camouflage your intentions, for it is through understanding your opponent's mindset that you gain the upper hand.

One must embrace their tactics, not to adopt them, but to dismantle them from within, for to dismantle the fortress, you must first learn the blueprint of its construction."

-Sun Tzu english when? (I have over 90 hours logged on DLsite, the 2 hours on Steam were just so I could buy a background from the Points shop)
This is an [b]amazing[/b] lolige, but you should buy „ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Åπ„ÅÆ ÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂÖ•„Çä (Monobeno Complete Collection) on DLsite instead of getting it on Steam.
It's crazy expensive at full price (over $90), but it regularly goes on sale for dirt cheap (less than $5), and the amount of content you get with it is insane (Plus tons of H-scenes you'll never find on Steam)

Unfortunately, there is no English translation (official or otherwise), and it's highly unlikely one will ever exist, but that's not exactly a necessity for the H-scenes, and you could always leave it on as background noise in any case, I suppose (The music is really really good)

So in conclusion, get this on DLsite when it's on sale (which happens frequently) even if it's just for the H-scenes.

Pretty much everything I wrote above also goes for Maitetsu (except it [i]does[/i] have a partial English translation)
I can't really recommend Gothic Delusion, but it might be worth checking out if you can get it for cheap. Masterpiece üñ§

 [h1]PROS[/h1]
[list]
[*]Interesting story
[*]Awesome artwork
[*]SFW, they're cutting the Adult content for this version
[*]Has branching story routes, you can select one of them as you wish
[*]Can customize their faces according to your mind, it's only for fun not for the main story
[*]Cloud Save
[/list]

[h1]CONS[/h1]
[list]
[*]No English, No Indonesian subtitles
[*]Not compatible with potato devices
[/list]

[h1]ADDITIONAL NOTE[/h1]
Tooru and his little sister, Natsuha, returned to the remote village of Monobeno. Just as they were getting used to living in Monobeno, it was time for the Shichi Seisai summer festival, dedicated to the local deity Himemiya. This was a story about humans and monsters, disease and haunting, and the past and the future.

The game has many different story route, you can choose some story as your wish. some of storyline will give impression according theme. so far, I wasn't found any bad ending occurs. the storyline is very long, might it take the times a lot.

You can customize their faces with your own style, the game has a feature to change the face. The features is for fun purpose only and you can save the image that you've already edited.

No achievements available, will be easier to savor every moments. There is Japanese audio only available. No English subtitles, although Japanese language is fair enough to read. somehow I wanna Indonesian language as it should be.

[h1]RECOMMEND ?[/h1]
Yes, interesting long story. if you understand Japanese and Chinese, it would be easier to play. 1/10 s.h.i.t

4/10 not good
5/10 okay
6/10 good

10/10 omg tooo godt

name: Dieselpunk Wars
short_description: Dieselpunk Wars is a vehicle building game, focused on combat with advanced physics and damage simulation. Use over 300 elements to build a war machine of your dreams. Construct vehicles that ride on the ground, soar through the skies, or dive underwater. Prepare for combat and test your skills!
reviews:
it's flawed, but still pretty fun !!!! :3 The game is good. But the game needs to be optimized, as if there is a vehicle that is too big, it's going to cause lag or too many entities on the field. Quite a difficult game to learn, but once you get the hang of it it is Quite fun My experience has been great so far.  There's a lot to it and you will need to put in some time to get the hang of it but this is a really fun game. Like many other games, it has its flaws, but this will provide hours and hours of gameplay. its just feels worse then terratech yeah it cheaper but just buy terratech Game is abandoned has bugs and errors and is short.  Also the end mission is a duplicate of the demo. Abandoned by the devs after a half-arsed implementation.  Shouldn't have been called a proper release, was more of a beta. I am playing this game for a final project in a college course...take that for what you will about the quality. Slap finished then abandoned.. Poor girl deserved better than abandonment. 

there is no logic, no MultiPlayer, no traction. everything slides. it could be good, but every positive is absolutely curb-stomped by every issue. there will be no more updates.

reviews:
Best dlc ever made for any game ever, literally dlc of the century Car Mechanic Simulator 2015 - DeLorean
Take it apart, rebuild, repair and drive it
a good DLC > i like bttf
> i buy this
> i am happy
nice/10 Absolute must have for Back To The Future fans with plenty of Easter Eggs to discover with the SciFi version. Can be a challenging build due to differences compared to any other car. Incredibly challenging build. Be prepared to rip her apart to find all the problems. A beautiful and iconic car, even if she's very fiddly. it good Best DLC ever i took the sci-fi version on to the drag strip and it actually works like it does in the movies Was  a pleasant surprise when the Delorean Scifi popped up in the auction house and the back to the future music played! That was super awesome. Was not expecting the Delorean Scifi to disappear when I took it out on the drag strip! I was driving it and having fun and then the music started and blue smoke started appearing and then... POOF!! Absolutely love this DLC and can totally appreciate the work put into it because I am a HUGE Back To The Future fan!!! Anybody who is a fan of Back To The Future would totally love this DLC!! And i have to give props to the game devs, well done Red Dot Games. Hopefully Car Mechanic Simulator 2018 on Xbox One will have this kind of love and care in it. I would like to ask, why are there headlights for the two different versions of the DeLorean? The design for the headlighst are the same on the cars. i cant load back in now ive got this car

reviews:

name: Graviteam Tactics: Operation Victory
short_description: First major Iranian counteroffensive named Operation "Nasr" (Victory) in Khuzestan region in January 1981. The main role in the operation was assigned to the 16 and 92ArmBde units. Also, IRGC and militia units were brought to participate in the operation.
reviews:
hands down the best DLC, Like always GTTs engine just flows like water with a modern combat setting. Not a lot of baby sitting necessary and you actually spend a good amount of time trying to hide your troops do to the landscape being a tankers wet dream, its flat and open and the gunners sights can see for MILES. Game has the typical pin point surgical AI arty and yes the 2 sand berms that you have to hide your infantry behind are zeroed in on and yes the boys in those apcs and ifvs take off running as soon as a shell lands near by. i recommend just pulling the infantry all the way back and letting the armor crack that Iranian walnut. Chieftains are peak The devs picked a very rare military theme for the game.
Pay respect to you guys for that!

P.S. for anyone interested in the "Iran - Iraq war" I recommend to read a great book "The Iran-Iraq War" by Pierre Razoux. Please create more modern warfare content like this. hasn't worked for me since i bought this dlc. crashes during the battle load screen, reported the crash, they fix it and put the fix in beta. They have yet to release the fix.

Bought it in November 2022, and Feb 21 2023 the fix has STILL not been released. And have still not been able to play this operation/DLC who will win?
an entire Chieftain Battalion vs some Iraqi guys with funni joystick missiles This is not a hard no, but atm I currently wouldn't recommend it on it's own or for the full price. There's just not a lot you're getting with this dlc currently: the map is quite small, there doesn't seem to be any Iraqi Republican Guard units, and both sides don't have the ability to call in fighter support from the air (at least in custom battles) which is odd considering Iran had a noteworthy air-force during the war. So on its own in it's current state, I would say wait until either they release another Iran-Iraq war dlc, or update this one to be worth $16~ hope you guys are ok. slava Ukraini ! Amazing, when the tanks are clashing and the jets are flying overhead dropping ordinance is just awesome to watch. Well, of course I picked this up.  But I had to wait until it was no longer on sale, in order to do the developer justice.  Thank you, Graviteam, for giving us your complex, realistic game, and helping us to learn patience and perseverance.   Long may you continue to provide us with your art, and for years take us to places, as with this DLC, that we would not otherwise have thought to visit.

name: NASCAR Heat 2 - 2018 Season Update
short_description: The Roval has arrived. Race on this one-of-a-kind track before anyone else. 2018 paint schemes, an updated driver roster and race schedule, and new drivers are also included for the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Finally, compete in the all-new 2018 Chevrolet Camaro in the 2018 Season Update.
reviews:
Honestly, this is a pretty sour note to end the game's support on; I would've preferred it be delayed rather than released in its current state. A whole lot of seemingly tiny technical issues pile up into just a frustrating, incomplete release that feels like too many corners were cut. In turn, you're paying $10 for a single track layout and 40 Cup cars, 1/3 of which are on a new car model.

You're also starting a new save file (and waiting through a hefty load time as it reloads all the assets from scratch once you click 2018) for the privilege of ever looking at these. Unlike Heat Evolution, the two playable years are kept completely separate, and you'll have to reselect your icon, start your speed rating from scratch, and even reconfigure your controls to begin using the 2018 expansion. After all that, you'll be able to play single-player or local quick races, championships, and career; as with Heat Evo, no missions, and no online multiplayer. As you can't use the Charlotte Roval with the 2017 season, it is completely inaccessible for online, as is the 2018 Camaro.

If you're playing the Truck Series or Xfinity Series, absolutely nothing is different. That's not an exaggeration; they're unaltered from the 2017 portion of the game.

If you're playing the Cup Series, you've got a new roster, and it's an interesting mishmash of Cup drivers and drivers from other series. Personally, I'm a sucker for that kind of thing; Hailie Deegan's Cup car here looks frickin' awesome and became my top choice, even with DiBenedetto being one button away. You've also got, of course, the Charlotte Roval added to the track list. Rather than being an alternate event to Charlotte, EA-style, it's listed as a completely separate track.

It was actually finally playing the Roval that made all the frustration not at all worth it. The AI puttered around somewhat cluelessly, the pre-race camera literally just had its animations from main Charlotte copied over (I expected at least one pan over anywhere in the infield, but the angles all focus on the oval and the actual circuit is barely seen), and after I clumsily flung my car through the tight, narrow circuit, slamming haphazardly into walls along the way, I was instantly rewarded with a perfect 105 speed rating I didn't at all earn and, in victory lane, the trophy for the 2017 Coca-Cola 600, which was not the event I was at or the entire year I was taking part.

If you're going for full NASCAR collection completionism, it's important to have this particular layout because, as it was changed just after this DLC was publically revealed, this layout is not actually what will be used at the 2018 Bank of America 400. The last two tight, twisty turns in the infield before you're released back onto the infield were removed in later drafts, but are present here. They're tough, so you might consider this a plus, but if you want accuracy, that's not what you're getting.

As with Heat Evolution's 2017 season expansion, driver photos are replaced with their numbers, but now on loading screens as well.

This really feels like the art department and track modelers did a good job and then absolutely everything gameplay-wise just fell right the hell apart. It's a nearly identical copy of the base game that bafflingly forces you to start from scratch, and the only things it adds aren't accurate enough to be a must-have for fans, crazy enough to be a must-have for novelty value, or really particularly complete.

(As the expansion didn't initially actually do anything on launch day on PC, I do wonder if consoles have a more complete version and this was more hastily ported. I doubt it, though.)

After two years in a row of extraneous bizarre half-measure expansions being slapped together for the start of the season, my patience is running thin. I can do better. You can do better. 704 Games can do better. You don't need this. I would really like to see what the DLC is going to look like. But I can't right now becuase it won't instal. The gtame still works, but the DLC won't instal. This is the worst DLC i ever brought. Cant use it.  If this gets fixed than i will update this review.  Just hold off buying this DLC.  As for now i will not recommend this DLC. Wish we could download it.... Pay'd for it but it will not install.

Update 6:20PM EST It downloaded :) After some panic as the game didnt want to download, when it did downloand it is well worth the money. The 2018 schedule for the Monster Energy series and the Camaro car. Only small grip I have iis that I cant havea  quick race on the Charlotte Roval. but otherwise its a worthwile update. Don't understand why I can't install it! People on xbox and playstation are already playing this but I have paid for this and wanna play it now but it wont download yet My biggest problem is that I can't install the DLC for some reason. Aside from that, I'm excited to drive in the 2018 paint schemes and schedule. I'm just hoping the Charlotte Roval layout gets corrected, and the ISM Raceway layout also gets corrected with its new location for the Start/Finish Line.

name: Bik - A Space Adventure
short_description: A point and click adventure. Bik and his newfound alien friends outsmart hijackers, (eat some brownies), accept a perilous mission, (make some sandwiches), foil a dastardly plot by an evil corporate empire, (argue with disgruntled robots), and save a planet on the brink of destruction.
reviews:
I first played this game almost a decade ago, and I loved it. After thinking about it recently I decided to get it again, and it still sorta holds up to how I remember it. Since I've played this twice before, I do remember the solutions to most of the puzzles, so they're not as hard as I remembered them to be, but some of them can slow the game down. My biggest complaint is that the sounds effects that play can be pretty annoying at times.

Back in 2014/2015 when I first played and beat this game, I contacted the developers asking if they had any plans for a sequel, but sadly they didn't. If a Dev sees this, know that I would still LOVE to see a sequel to this game, or at least a spin-off set in the same universe. Wonderful game. The writing has a lot of charm. Fantastic soundtrack (I actually bought it separately). Overall very recommended!! [b]Imagine being a little boy going on a camping trip with your friends, 
but suddenly you wake up on a spaceship
and together with two aliens and your Gametron you are going to save the galaxy.[/b]

This adventure was so funny and charming. 
It has really great writing, (oldschool-)graphics and music. 
The puzzles are not too hard and there is a walkthrough guide in case you get stuck.
It can be played with a controller, but mouse-input is much more comfortable.
You should definetly give this game a try if you are a fan of the old Lucasarts adventures. Fun and cute humor that tickled me. The interesting, intertwining stories have nice pacing, and the puzzles have a decent difficulty level. Graphics had a couple nice surprise effects. Music and sound was passible. The game uses 285Mbs of diskspace and uses the Unity game engine. I played this game on an old Ubuntu desktop with the keyboard and mouse. I saw no technical issues. I try to avoid "delightful" as it seems like an adjective used by people on the receiving end of pity sex.  Bik is truly a delight however, and well worth your time.

Bik tells the story of the titular young scamp, abducted by a belligerent race that comes in second on the list of the galaxy's vilest gangs.  You're soon rescued by some kind-heated mercenaries whose loose tactical coordination and moral compunctions end with a galaxy-saving adventure.

Bik is simple, fun, well-written and full of surprises.  I almost never consulted a guide and the game presents an amusing variety of challenges.  Bold pastel colors give the pixel graphics a real zest.  The great strength of Bik is its likable characters.  It is perhaps the most anti-Hatred title on Steam, providing lovable characters doing the right thing for their friends.  There is absolutely a place for more cynical storytelling but seeing two scrappy underdogs become friends and save the galaxy is occasionally what we all need, especially when it involves achievements for eating baloney sandwiches.

Pick it up.  You won't be disappointed. A really good point-and-click! It seems criminally underrated, and that's a shame. It's a lovely hidden gem. 

The game's got great writing, story, and characters. There's a lot of good humor, adventure, and even drama (and sandwiches). I really like the worldbuilding this game establishes. Space is an interesting and colorful place with lots of things to discover and genuinely likable characters to meet. I had a lot of fun just clicking on different things and trying items in different combinations just to see what would happen. There's also a bunch of neat little references to classic sci-fi here and there without it being distracting. What I really found fascinating  is that you can use the "examine" button on the character you control, giving you some insight into their mental state; you learn something new about them whichever area you're in. It was an interesting mechanic that gave whichever character you control a little bit more depth. 

The graphics and soundtrack are simple, yet charming. It's got a great nostalgic/retro look going on that didn't strike me as lazy or cheap. The puzzles are logical, creative, and challenging without being overly frustrating. The non-story achievements are really silly and fun to get too (there's a lot of different hilarious ways to die). 

The game's length is relatively short, but it's a good length for the story the game is trying to tell. It doesn't feel rushed and it doesn't overstay its welcome. The price is fair for what the game has to offer. The only real downside is that there's a neat little sequel hook at the end of the game and there doesn't seem to be a sequel in sight. I would've loved to revisit this world again a little bit more. 

Recommended if you like sci-fi, point-and-clicks, solid writing, and fun. It's a delightful game that could use some more recognition. Tags: Adventure - P&C - Point&Click
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Homage to early adventure games. Too faithful to the source with cryptic hard puzzles, walkthrough required. Long and drawn out story without a solid early plot hook. Pixelated and ugly. What a great game! It reminds me of the Sierra games I played as a child and it has a nice soundtrack too. There is nothing really new or groundbreaking here but simple fun like in the older days of gaming. I highly recommend playing this! A wonderful game. 10/10, easy! A fun little game in the tradition of classic comedic adventure games such as Space Quest and Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, although thankfully less difficult. Funny writing, likable characters, and plenty of easter eggs to find.

name: Neighbors
short_description: A folk noir detective horror game. An old time detective trying to find out the truth behind a missing girl in a mysterious place.
reviews:
With the nice creepy visuals and atmospheric sound, I was excited for this one. Unfortunately it's not currently playable for me.

The game is text only (even though the store page lists English audio), but the text is barely readable and doesn't look at all like the screenshots. It's translucent and appears to be overly pixelated and then scaled up into blurry shapes. There are no resolution or graphic options, so you're just stuck trying to decipher what is even happening.

Once you select a dialogue option, the selection pops back up to the first question so that you have to scroll down from the top for every single response. This is a small issue but got tedious very quickly.

When talking to the first character, I accidentally hit the left/right buttons, and the game switched back to the walking view. The player character's walk animation no longer played when moving, but instead his static image would glide along the screen. I tried to start a new game, but this time the conversation displayed options for things I hadn't yet asked, as well as blank lines between a few dialogue options.

I encountered the same issue on two separate computers, that have no problems running things like Until Dawn, so I don't think it's a resource issue. I hope this can get resolved, but I can't recommend the game in it's current state. The game is fairly interestin' from the get go. The story revolves around us as a detective tryin' to figure the truth behind a missing woman in an odd hotel. I like the stylized graphics here. I do, however, think the game could do with more sound effects, ambient music, voice over work, use of mouse etc. Even talkin' to the NPCs is not fluid since the cursors disappears most of the time when selecting a dialogue choice. As a result, you would have to escape the conversation then reengage. It gets rather annoyin'. Also the price point is a bit steep. It's askin' for too much at 18 bucks. Should be around 12 bucks max imo. With all that bein said, I am intrigued enough to continue the mystery. I'll give it a thumb up due to the premise. May wanna wait for sale otherwise. 

Gameplay Impressions: https://youtu.be/Dscoc6rEWHo

name: Space Pilgrim Episode IV: Sol
short_description: Locked away in the most secure prison in the galaxy, with little hope of escape, Gail Pilgrim faces the most difficult ordeals of her life. Her only hope lies in trusting those who she has come to regard as her friends.
reviews:
Well-written, brainy, non-violent RPG Maker experience I'm going to copypaste the same review for all Space Pilgrim games since they're basically one series split in four parts.

A very fun and quirky lil game series about rebellion in a small sci fi setting. I enjoyed a lot of the background worldbuilding and the characters are very charming. Gameplay consist of straight forward fetch quest puzzles which is okay considering this is an RPGmaker game that costs very little. okey The conclusion of the 4 part-2016 story and it got pretty good at the end. Simple point-and-click adventure! awful You can check my review of the first episode for a more general review. Overall the Space Pilgrim saga is a pretty well done RPG (people debate that it's moreso a point and click than RPG since there's no combat) with some clever writing and endearing characters. I found there were some minor gripes with the pacing of the 3rd episode, but this final stretch of the Pilgrim Saga was worth the investment of the three previous installments. There's actually some choices to be made here that can affect the story, and multiple of the storylines wrap themselves up in a pretty satisfying conclusion. I thought the characterization of all the characters were pretty well done, nothing groundbreaking or extremely original in itself, but all of the elements come together for a charming little space adventure. The game I'd say will on average take ~10 hours to complete (episodes 1-4). If you're on the fence definitely pick it up on sale, if you're in the mood for a space adventure and an RPG maker title that's a little different check this out! jogo sensacional... amei demais jogar slk  
üëç Recommended  
tmj ‚Äé A fitting end to the story, for sure. As with the earlier games, occasionally got tripped up by a convoluted puzzle, but we got there! its really fun

name: Minotaur's Maze
short_description: Minotaur's Maze is a tactical tabletop dungeon crawler brought to life in VR.
reviews:
LONG VERSION - So originally bought this game long ago, but couldn't get it to work with my Touch controllers on my Oculus Rift, despite the page showing that it supports Oculus.  The developer confirmed that he didn't know why his page showed this support (he'd never tested it) and didn't mean for his page to show it and said he couldn't remove it.   Could never get it to work, the game stopped being supported later and it disappeared into my list of VR games to be forgotten.   Until I got my Rift S.

Something told me to boot this back up and try to see if the Rift S controllers were any better with it.  You wouldn't figure it would be, but I got curious.  Turns out it worked much better, although clunky for some reason.  I found out on an old youtube comment that the controllers detect touch on the buttons in addition to pressing them, which complicates things.  So if you went into the Steam controller settings for this specific game (Steam VR options, Devices, Controller Settings, then pick the game from the list on the right) and DISABLED the touch feature on the A, B, X and Y buttons (I also did this for the triggers as well, just to be safe), then the game works!

It's a fun game, easy to learn, has some humor in it. and the ability to move around and change distance from the map in 3rd person gives it a cool atmosphere, almost like you're the character and the DM.  If you like D&D type dungeon crawlers I'd recommend it for the $10 if you have a Rift S or a Vive.   

TLDR (short) version - You can get this working with the controllers on Rift S with some minor adjustments in the settings and it's a fun dungeon crawler for ten bucks. No updates for over a year While I am not necessarily a fan of the rougelike, this has just enough of a Diablo feel to keep it interesting. Feels like a real time miniatures RPG game in VR. Pretty fun so far, easy to pickup and play. I picked this up because I just like the idea of "tabletop perspective" in VR games and I am impressed.

Minotaur's Maze does a lot of really cool things I would love to see in more VR games. The UI is fairly minimalistic but feels really good, and the VR controls are tight. The art assets themselves aren't going to amaze anyone in 2017, but they did a great job making everything coherent. With some solid lighting they give the game a pleasing aesthetic that is easy on the eyes in VR and just looks cool to be in. There is a VR tutorial built into the game which is also a big plus. Not related to VR, but I also appreciated the campy-yet-adorable voice acting.

That being said, the gameplay isn't likely to blow you out of the water, but I think the package as a whole is fun. There were a few annoyances - sometimes the menu spawns inside a wall and gets cut-off, and the in-game controls help shows the gamepad controls even if you are using the Vive controllers. It also took a while to figure out how to move the playspace which I don't think was mentioned in the tutorial. All in all, it's a solid take on a tabletop perspective game.  highly recommend this game. I have only played it for about 30 minutes so far, but I was completely enthralled.

The game is set at a 3/4 angle viewpoint and is a point and click diablo-style dungeon crawler game. Being in VR the left hand moves the screen around and has some light zoom in/out. You need to use the left hand as a candle to light your way as well which was neat. I actually sat down at one point to get a closer view. The way the graphics are everything looks like little toys. I actually felt like there were little action figures in front of me animating and fighting. It's a fairly simple game but I can see a lot of cool things being done. Early access so you know there's more to come. For $10 I highly enjoyed this experience so far
 Borderline 'Yes' recomendation ... The gameplay is unique for VR at the moment (similar in feel to Legend of Luca but tries to be more strategic) but a couple little irks bring it down

Starting as a Rogue you will enter the dungeon and immediately get overwhelmed and killed ... really?  

Trying to use your inventory via the floating hud or the controller will often result in moving your character...often to your death.

Those two things really diminish the game at the moment, fixing these will go a long way
