ËØ∏Ëëõ‰∫Æ  
ÊàäÂØÖÂπ¥Áßã‰∫é‰π¶Êàø This is a fun little RPG maker title, with some actually decent storylines. Comparisons have been made to this being a tiny 2D version of the Witcher, which is true insofar you are a mercenary hunting down mysteries and dangerous monsters. The script was a bit better than the standard RPG maker fare, I even found myself laughing a few times and feeling very moved by the conclusion of the story. I found some spelling errors and the game's real-time combat hit detection to be slightly wonky, but never enough to affect my enjoyment. If you're on the fence and want a fun little RPG with interesting sidequests I'd grab this one, especially on sale! I played as an infamous mercenary known as "The Crow" in a decayed and corrupt world, and found my way out of chains and got paid for my contract, in this enthralling Action-RPG with high production values. Good game
Thorne - Death Merchants  6/10
Heisen <3 ‚†Ä Nice game, definitely a bit short, but i know how much work making even a short game like this requires. You can feel it's a labor of love. World is full of events and great to explore. Nice implement of MA Quest Journal. Maybe a little bit too much "default" RPGMaker stuff left in for my taste (like that annoying walking sound effect which doesn't sound like walking at all). But every part that was different than usual, like combat system or map of the area was a nice addition. [h3] Combat [/h3]
-------------------

Thorne - Death Merchants is a fun little RPGMaker game buried under bad combat. It is difficult, but not in a git gud kind of way. Combat just feels unrewarding. Enemies swarm you from all sides. They respawn when you return to an area, or sometimes just infinitely spawn in certain locations.

You can die pretty quickly, from bleeding damage, poison, or being molotov'd to death from a good distance away. A possible glitch(?) means even after using antidote or a tourniquet you can still lose HP to poison/bleeding damage. All this stuff isn't fun and detracts from the game. If you like a challenge, there are better games out there that will really test your mettle and reward your efforts. Thorne - Death Merchants isn't one of them.

If you want to find where your saves live so you edit them: [spoiler] you can search 'Thorne' and you'll find where the are, as they're not in the immediate local file where the game is installed. The rvdata2 files are your saves. There's also a backup Thorne folder so just check you're in the right one.

On Steam Deck the path for me was:
/home/deck/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/compatdata/451920/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/Application Data/Thorne/Death Merchants/ [/spoiler]

But once you balance the combat, you'll have a decent time here. Some people will balk at this, but occasionally a bad game needs a little stat boosting from... external sources. Google is your friend and RPGMaker save editors exist is all I'll say. Whether you want to or not for a game that often costs $1 is up to you. But my beefed up Mr 'The Crow' demolished everything in his path and I had a great time doing it.

[h3] Controls [/h3]
-------------------

Thorne runs... ok? on Steam Deck via Proton. The game looks fine on the Steam Deck and isn't super squished out like it can be in full screen on regular desktop. The controls are a bit weird, controller will work but a mouse cursor will hang around. You can move it out the way with the right joystick, but the menu mainly uses mouse controls instead of controller. It made saving and loading a bit annoying but nothing unmanageable.

The Steam Deck's right track pad tends to click automatically in the main menu instead of scrolling properly too. This hasn't happened with any other games I've played on my Steam Deck recently or in the past, so I'm putting this issue down to weird Thorne tomfoolery.

If you want to mainly use a controller you may want to remap the healing and rage actions to a specific button. This is pretty easy to do on Steam Deck, but on regular pc press F1 to view and change controls. At one point I mapped the molotov attack to left trigger, but Thorne would only face right when attacking. It made the [spoiler] Goblin Cave [/spoiler] annoying because you have to [spoiler] destroy the circle spawn points by facing them directly then molotoving. [/spoiler] Remapping the button to X fixed this weird quirk and I'm not sure why.

[h3] Story [/h3]
-------------------

The game starts by asking if you want to play in English or Portuguese, I played in English. From this, I'm assuming English may not be the dev's first language and it does show. There are grammatical errors, typos and weird syntax abound. It isn't so bad that you have to sit there deciphering what the heck a sentence even means, but if you're precious about perfect grammar it will annoy you.

Once you beef up your merc the unofficial way, exploration becomes enjoyable because you're not getting ambushed constantly. Have a look around and see what you can find. If you get lost, there is an in game map item that I got from a chest near some bandits somewhere off to the right (or check the screenshots page here, I've added one of the map.)

The story in this game is actually decent, if short. A village needs your help and you're the mercenary in need of coin, give or take some other stuff in between of course. If you stray from the beaten path there are side quests here and there. Don't go to the McArthur Estate straight away, have a look around first. Maybe check the helpful achievements guides if you really don't want to miss anything. Check the cute little Encyclopedia in the menu to see a sentence or two on enemies or NPCs.

If you're stuck in the Estate section [spoiler]   interact with the angel statues and the gargoyle. Pick up wiggling items in the rooms and pull a curtain lever thing. After you've found some gems and put them in the marble statues, you'll need 3 key fragments to open the mansion doors to get to McArthur. I think you'll find them in the garden, the curtain lever and a bookcase lever from the room that opens up from the marble statue. [/spoiler]

When I finished the game (killing everything in my wake and somewhat rushing) it took me about 2.5 hours and I ended up missing half the achievements. I'd guess it would take maybe 3-6 hours depending on how thorough you are and whether or not you fudge your stats.

[h3] Final Thoughts [/h3]
-------------------

This might seem like a lot of effort for a random RPGMaker game, but there's something to this one. It feels like a 2D proto baby discount Witcher almost, it just needs balancing to get there. If you can be bothered to do that, give it a shot.

If you like the RPGMaker style, check out these games with some of the aspects I liked from Thorne:

Ara Fell - turn based RPG with good exploration.

The Deed series - dark storytelling where you need to execute the perfect murder.

The Last Sovereign - 18+ very NSFW! turn based, amazing story about politics and war (no seriously). In early access but free with hours and hours of content. Decent.

name: Return to Grace
short_description: A daring space archaeologist has just unearthed the ancient resting place of a long lost A.I. god known as Grace. Adventure with various fractured A.I. personalities as you uncover the great mystery of why she was shut down all those years ago.
reviews:
This is a fun little interactive story/walking simulator - there's not much to do except follow along and uncover the mystery and do a few simple puzzles, but the story is interesting and the characters are fun (and there are some nice references and humour in there too). It's pretty short and sweet - maybe a little expensive for what it is so probably best worth getting in a sale, but it's definitely worth it if you like this sort of thing! Fairly simple, easy to play, good graphics and interesting storyline.  Enjoyable. Return to Grace is a captivating and beautifully crafted game that truly stands out in the indie scene. The storytelling is rich and immersive, with a narrative that draws you in from the start and keeps you hooked until the very end. The atmosphere is incredibly well-designed, with detailed environments that make you feel like you're really living in the world of the game. 

The mechanics are smooth and engaging, offering a great balance of challenge and enjoyment. The puzzles are well thought out and never feel frustrating, making each success feel rewarding. The character development is another highlight, with complex personalities that evolve in meaningful ways as the story progresses.

Overall, Return to Grace is an emotional journey that's hard to put down. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of passion and attention to detail went into its creation, and it‚Äôs a must-play for anyone who enjoys narrative-driven experiences. A very solid walking sim. A simple yet compelling story with enjoyable voice acting and visuals. There are choices sprinkled throughout that encourage a second playthrough for completionists. If you're looking for a breezy game you can complete in one night, this ones a good fit. This game looked promising but I had to refund it because the puzzles don't work. I got as far as the first door puzzle. When I enter the " 9 light square" in the center of the puzzle nothing happens and I can't progress. 

Would of liked to play more of it. I really liked this game! It's an adventure through several different environments, with a small gallery of constantly-changing narrators. I'd place it more in the "walking simulator" genre than the "puzzle genre".

Though it purports to be a story about AI on its surface, it's really more of a story about identity, reconciling the parts of ourselves through conflict and disagreement. What would it mean to banish the parts of yourself you don't like? What do you do when others want something from you that you're no longer able to provide to them? Watching the characters wrestle with these situations is part of the fun.

The architecture in the game is wonderfully evocative, with sprawling retro-futuristic art deco environments, imposing towers and caves to explore, giant abandoned hotel lobbies, etc. Highly recommend this for anyone who likes exploring. I got this game forever ago, forgot about it entirely. Saw it in my library and decided to give it a shot and boy! Was I pleasantly surprised! The depth of the narrative, the well played characters, the environmental obstacles - it all came together into a beautiful story that honestly the ending left me a bit breathless. A good story about the rise and fall of humanity's gilded age! 10/10 will play again! It's a very short game, but the story, exploration and aesthetics totally make up for it. If you enjoy short SciFi stories, this will definitely be something for you. It's been so long since I've gotten to enjoy a narrative exploration game like this!   GORGEOUS environments, intriguing story...   It's on the linear side, but there are branching decision moments as you go, if that means anything to you.   You can see from my playtime that it's not long, but almost the whole thing is bespoke and distinct and beautiful to look at, and the acting is excellent.   Why did it take me this long to hear about this?? Great graphics (yet performs well on the deck).

Puzzles aren't too difficult and don't get in the way of the narrative. Another solid, recent entry in the walking sim genre.

Hoping we'll see more content - it's a rich world with a complex future history that could easily be expanded on in additional discoverable narrative-related items or optional events.

name: Football School
short_description: Football School - Take control of a sports club in a small town. Train your team, compete and climb the world ranking. Management game made by the developers of Boxing School.
reviews:
Not a very deep or interesting game. Just my type of mindless fun when other games get boring. The management is ok, the matches are absolute garbage (lost many a match because I made the winning goal and then during the "you made a goal" animation the ball randomly flew into my goal, tying the match, and then losing in OT). The progression is fast and hard mode is a piece of cake. Not much more to say It aint by far that good as the other games of the studio. The hud is filled with buttons but you alway just click on "next day" and sometimes you need to adjust sth with the training. And you have immense money problems and just may buy sth when you have 4 times the expenditures, at least no one cares how many credits you take. This game is not simulating a sport it is endles waiting for money and player development which is annoying to do. I would just love to have Steam achievements. Fun game I wish there was a third recommendation option like a "sort of" option.

It is fun to build up your team from having a stadium with rocks and tree stumps on it to a pristine condition stadium and winning tournaments to hopefully get to the international stage.

Losing is bad because it means you got to hit the road and play friendlies until the next cup and it will severely impact on your finances. 

It has been said in other reviews that tactics are useless, I'll give an example say you've got a goalkeeper and suddenly they decide to charge at a player at the other end of the pitch to tackle them and your goal is empty and so all the opposition has to do is nudge the ball down the pitch for a goal. 

This game can be great fun, it is just frustrating at times, that's why I said I sort of recommend it. ive purchased this fun game a while ago, but just recently started playing it alot.  Its pretty addicting.  Watch your football team grow or i mean soccer team lol.   Worth playing I paid 1‚Ç¨
You will get a few hours of content :)

It has a unique twist and low difficulty
Fun playthrough

What should be added:
- new transfer system
- more upgradeable infrastructure
- multiple nationalities
- tournaments for national teams (watchable - maybe coachable?) If there was neutral or "maybe" option for whether or not I recommend the game, I would have selected it.

What's the I.Q. of a June Bug? Subtract 10 points from that number and you'll have an idea of the types of players you'll be managing/watching. There might be a good game hidden in there somewhere, but I have to honestly say I am unable to find it. It is obvious that you need to create some momentum to get ahead of salary costs, training requirements, etc. but the game gives little to no feedback on how to adress formations.
This coupled with a complete randomness to games, where it just always seems scewed against you this becomes a VERY frustrating experience, where you do not understand why you are losing, OR how to fix it!
The game might pick up after a while, becoming more fun, but I found it to be a lot more frustrating than fun. beli waktu diskon 90% jadi ga terlalu banyak berharap kualitasnya. ternyata lumayan seru. alternatif lebih santai dari FM. Very fun and addicting football simulator. It is quite challenging, but still fun.
Good price, but I would love to see more character customization.
Thank you.

name: Pixel Puzzles Traditional Jigsaw Puzzles
genres: Casual, Indie, Simulation, Strategy, Free To Play
short_description: Pixel Puzzles, your number one place for digital jigsaws.
reviews:
Both relaxing and challenging in the best way. Fairly easy fun for the most part!
 I love Jigsaw Puzzles, I own mostly all of the ones on Steam. Pixel Puzzles Ultimate and Pixel Puzzles Traditional are my favorites. Lots of topics, puzzle sizes to choose from, and hours of fun. The Developers always put out  packs on a regular basis. Beautiful puzzles. I especially love the animal and various Countries architecture  the most. I highly recommend these puzzles. 10/10 Puzzle pieces spinning through space. It's an interesting take on jigsaw puzzles that I like. It's an enjoyable alternative to physical puzzles. Not 1-1 with them but works well enough to scratch the itch. Good. It is basically [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/MouseWithBeer/recommended/351030]Pixel Puzzles Ultimate[/url], but with better UI and less jigsaw puzzles to solve (currently around 600) of many different sizes and lots of varied images. If you like jigsaws and don't mind shelling out some money for them (in the form of DLC) it is a really solid pick for a game and it has some free puzzles so you can test it out if you like it first before buying more.

Works without any issues on Linux with Proton (tested form 8.0-2 on). Enjoyable, fun way to occupie time. List of Cons First:

The game is poorly optimized when it comes to tabbing over to other tasks and tries to appear invisible on the desktop taskbar unless you specifically alt+tab over back to the game
The game also operates controls if you decide to run it while multitasking with alt+tab,
The worst thing this game has done was delete my local save data after it slowly went into my settings while i was in other tabs.

The Pros Now:

Luckily The game has online features such as making an online account with The Puzzle Club and linking your steam account to it, this feature has saved 52 of my puzzles from being absolutely completely destroyed, and as of the time writing this, 12,121 puzzle pieces placed, 347 hints owned and 40 hints used.
all of my puzzles now appear in game as such:

A Few Examples would be:
zero/640 university with completed puzzle badge
zero/455 lake with completed puzzle badge
zero/840 painting with completed puzzle badge

These 3 puzzles for example count as completed and count towards achievements with the badges still appearing on them.

However: any halfway done or partially done puzzles have bounced back to absolute zero with no completion towards them whatsoever. meaning i have to put at least twice the effort in to complete them.

In Conclusion: The games great regardless of what negative reviews say, So i say to the positive reviewers, DO NOT RELY ON LOCAL SAVE DATA. you will regret not making a puzzle club account and backing up your data to more than just local data. If you love Puzzles this a very nice Pack.
 Why can I play graphic intense games like Baldur's Gate 3 with 30-50% pf my GPU being occupied, but as soon as I start this jigsaw game, the GPU shoots up to 100% being used by this application only - and it stayed this way consistently for the 3 hours I played.
I don't think this is the cozy game to play with my Laptop on my lap like I hoped it would be. The GPU usages makes the laptop far too hot for that.

name: Bleeding Border
short_description: Bleeding Border is a first person 3d survival horror game in which the player must escape through the top of a monster infested building using his own blood as the only defense mechanism.
reviews:
Not recommended. actually one of the worst games i've ever played. it's horribly optimized, lagging and freezing consistently throughout the game. it feels incredibly clunky to play, and the user interface is horrid. sound design is awful, hit detection for attacks is awful (with you stabbing yourself with a screwdriver and attacking with your spraying blood ????????). you ascend this office building or whatever, but only the top floors are extremely flooded? whatever fuck this game, avoid at all costs Infected has a similar "using blood" as a weapon idea, except that game had Slipknot and fire arms. 
This game does not have Slipknot and fire arms, just a fricked up arm you occasionally stab with a screwdriver.  
Its also not very good. what did i just played? Yeah, the game scares a little but the graphics is so bad even if its 2015 they could do better! [h2]Bleeding Border[/h2]

Has a total of [b]7[/b] trading cards. blood, more blood ‚Äé I hope society isn't growing tired of our apologetics It's an awful game where you get to kill monsters by jamming a screwdriver into a gaping wound and letting the blood pour all over them.

Makes you wish it was half as good as that concept.

name: Jigsaw Puzzle Pack - Pixel Puzzles Ultimate: PP1 UndeadZ
genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Free To Play, Indie, Simulation, Sports, Strategy
short_description: Pixel Puzzles Ultimate, redefining digital puzzling.
reviews: Not tasty and not exciting Ew A bunch of low piece count puzzles based on an earlier game in the series (Pixel Puzzles: UndeadZ), free for those who already own that game. Even if you don't, the pack is fairly cheap. To be honest, though, I just don't like the art style of this pack.

name: Life and Debt: A Real Life Simulator
short_description: Life & Debt: A Real Life Simulator is a 2D pixel art game that challenges players to manage their finances and maintain their cashflow while navigating the challenges of new home ownership. Players must also overcome a shopping addiction and make decisions about how to furnish their home.
reviews:
If you want a real life simulator that's not like real life at all, this is the game for you.

Pros:
- Funny achievement names.
- Rent goes up over time, mimicking cost-of-living increases.
- Stock market can be lucrative (get in there early and watch it often!).
- Lotto scratch-off tickets are like in real life -- you're basically wasting your money. (Except they cost WAY more in the game than you'd spend in real life).

Cons:
- You're fired. Constantly. Doesn't matter if job security is high or low, or if you're working a job that requires education... expect to be fired anywhere between 7 and 30 days (more commonly between 14 and 30).
- If you're fired before payday, you get the pay you are owed. However, if you switch jobs before payday, it seems that you don't get the pay owed (or there was no pop-up stating as such, but it seemed to me that my cash didn't go up at all). So if you want to switch jobs but need the upcoming cash from the current job, time it well against paydays, and hope that the classifieds don't change before you switch.
- You can't take on debt to get education. Haven't they heard of student loans?
- The same events happen over and over. How many times can you "overuse" and "break" your TV, or fall down the stairs while on your phone? Apparently, quite a bit.
- Taxes are brutal, especially when you're busy getting fired a lot.
- The shop is buggy. It sometimes shows that you own things, other times it'll show a count of 0 until you buy it again, only to find out that you wasted your money.
- You can't pause the game. "You can't pause real life!" is what it tells you... but since this isn't anything like real life anyway, how about a pause button?
- There's a "save and exit" feature, but no autosave (which is a bummer... the game crashed on me in my first 30 minutes of playing so I completely lost that character). There's also no button to simply save without exiting; if you want to save, you're going to the main menu (thankfully it loads quickly).

Too much of the gameplay is unsatisfying, so I don't recommend wasting your time with this game. The game is cute, and it's nice that it gets updates. But it's wildly inaccurate and was clearly made by someone with a negative outlook on life. There are a lot of really random and completely unavoidable debts you incur (like your mom sending you a $10,000 medical debt to pay?!) and it's nearly impossible to hold any job for more than a couple weeks. Additionally, the stock market in this game doesn't perform nearly as well as any realistic market. Overall, this is a game that really makes things seem harder than they are in real life. This game is still buggy even after the recent updates. This game would b great if only they didn't break something  every time they fix something. The updates are far and few between and most of the breaks make it unplayable. So you are left waiting for a fix for half a year. And in the mean time you can't play. As of right now the stock market is broken. Scratch tickets are broken. Financeing items is broken. Don't buy until it becomes playable again. Very poor game.'This Grand Life' is MUCH better. If real life wasn't already enough to keep you in a constant state of anxiety fueled by debt, and never ending life events that come at the most inopportune times, then hold on to your socks cause Life and Debt is here!

It's a fun game, priced about the same as a good cup of coffee and blacker than the soul of the barista who served it to you. The developer did a great job on such a simple game and the updates over time have been good to see. LaD:ARLS is a good time waster and a funny comparison to the struggles of the daily grind. 

If you need to kill a few hours, this game's worth it. It really sucks First of all I would like to thank the developer for fixing the game as I had purchased prior to the latest update.
The game itself is what it says to be. It's a simulation game of "adulthood" the goal is to buy every piece of furniture (there are 35 pieces total) and pay down your dept. I love how you gain debt with quirky (yet somewhat believeable) scenarios. Such as, "Your car has been blasted by a meteor and insurance does not pay for ""acts of space""". Also, there are quirky scenarios when you gain money such as: You got "hurt" at work and received workers comp. This gives you $10,000 dollars and it may be strange and funny to admit that being hurt on the job was the best thing to happen in this game. One thing however, is about my little bundles of joy (the children) I know this is realistic but, no child that I know has spent $10-20 thousand dollars on credit card purchases a more realistic number would probably be $1,000. Last complaint, When i become a surgeon, I can only keep the job for a payday! I understand you are trying to make the game hard but, Could the job security thing be improved? All in all though, if you are looking for a funny, realistic, light-hearted, challenging game, look no further. Timer/calendar goes forever (at one point it told me it was the 60th of August, and debt doesn't get paid off when I spend my money, but my money gets subtracted. Would be a really cool game if it worked. This game is so much fun to play! The life events keep the game interesting and it is difficult enough to keep you coming back again and again. Definitely worth a try!

name: Magic Heart
short_description: Eve has a dream to develop magic abilities and return to her homeland, but she suddenly develops close relationships with her two female friends instead.
reviews:
Story is ok
Playthrough 7 to 15 min ea.
Got it for 74 cents
 Too short, not enough characterisation or merit given to the romances. Don't really know why the main character is into the love interests or vice versa. Also the art style is overly cutesy and the boobs are just drawn horrible, they look like inflatable sex dolls when they're chests are bared. i think the artwork was great. nice music I have mixed feelings on this product. On one hand, it isn't offensively bad, but it isn't really good.

Firstly, the art is inconsistent, but not terrible. I'd say the sprites are a lot better than the illustrations, but the illustrations aren't too terrible. The music is fine, but it isn't especially memorable. I think the writing is the most disappointing aspect of this. The translation is pretty bad, there's a lot of spelling issues, but overall the writing is just boring. Boring writing doesn't help the already generic story either.

Honestly, if this game was free, I'd not be complaining as much. Get it during a sale. So fucking short..I thought I was in for some good yuri action but smh.Still its playable,not too boring... Super short, but worth the price.  Could've used some more fleshing out of the setting and stories, especially Freya's line. super nice anime pc game! I realy like it! you can play it! Though small, was fun. They could have done more with both stories I fell.

name: Intergalactic Fishing
short_description: Intergalactic Fishing is a fishing RPG that features procedurally generated content and graphics. Travel to lakes all over the universe and catch unique fish, explore uncharted lakes and sell data, complete quests, upgrade your gear, compete in fishing tournaments, design your own lures, and more!
reviews:
Imagine if No Mans Sky was top down and only about fishing and you would have Intergalactic fishing. Don't let the simple graphics fool you, the ambiance and gameplay is great and the story is solid too. Well worth the current sale price of $3 A simple and cute little fishing game with plenty of side activities and things to do, attracting different kinds of fish with custom built lures and learning the ins and outs of the ecosystems is enjoyable and satisfying. best deal in the spring sale hands down, so much fun, one of those "oh crap the sun is coming up..." games... lol for better or for worse. Silly little fishing game, feels a little basic after a while but it's cheap and cozy. Would buy a sequel. absolute hidden gem Fishing games... I remember one of the first ones I ever played was at a friend‚Äôs house. Back then, full games were hard to find, but there were these magazines selling shareware compilations on CDs. One of those had a fishing game. Needless to say, the limitations were pretty clear, but I definitely made the most of it.

Years passed, and more fishing games came out, each with its own unique take. Some focused on graphics, others on mechanics, some on realism... But in the end, the goal is pretty much the same: Just kill time and relax (subjectively) while trying to catch a fish.

Intergalactic Fishing is a mix of fishing and space exploration. I mean, you don‚Äôt exactly hop into a spaceship and go exploring other planets, but you use a device that teleports your boat to random lakes across the universe.

The main story revolves around a lake where the fish are dying, and it‚Äôs up to the protagonist to figure out why. To do that, you need to travel to other lakes and complete missions, which helps move the plot forward. There‚Äôs a ton of different fish to catch, each with their own quirks and preferences. Because of this, item customization and combinations are pretty deep, even letting you craft your own bait. There are also upgrades that allow you to carry more bait and fish.

When it comes to graphics, music, and sound effects, I‚Äôd say they‚Äôre pretty basic, but honestly, that doesn‚Äôt really affect the fun factor. The gameplay itself can be frustrating for beginners since the randomness often pushes you into a trial-and-error loop that can get pretty tiring and annoying. However, once you get the hang of it, things get easier, though I still remember needing to take a deep breath every time I decided to explore a random lake in the cosmos.

That said, I thought this concept was amazing from the very first moment I saw it. This kind of creativity is something you typically find in indie games, and it‚Äôs a blessing that developers have the space to create these kinds of concepts. I really hope they refine this formula in the future for other titles in the genre. Oh wow, this is going to be a fun game to dive into. It's very simple on the cover but I can tell this is going to be a journey with lots of options and customization. Glad I purchased this game! it good I am very much a lover of fishing in games.

This game satisfies that itch perfectly. 
While graphically the game is very simple -- this imo works well for it. It's a fishing simulation game first and foremost. There's an indepth lure system,  procedural generated lakes, handcrafted lakes, and tons of different fish.

I played around 5 hours today, and man -- this game rules. 

This games been sitting on my wishlist for a long time -- and I'm glad I finally decided to pick it up.

I do think the game could use a demo on the store page as imo the first hour or so was enough to sell me -- and I wish I could have experienced it sooner. It's a perfect chill + watch something on a second monitor game. Best fishing game I played. Great campaign

name: 2 Minutes to Die
short_description: You awaken in the dark, a cold shiver running down your spine. The familiar setting of your home feels eerily foreign. Something is wrong‚Äîterribly wrong. As you gather your senses, a wave of dread washes over you. Button 1: Ctrl, Button 2: Alt.
reviews:
Your game is not too bad but like the other review mentions, the controllers are not intuitive. Please see my gameplay and use it as feedback to the game and its mechanics.

not the worst game ive ever played, but certainly not the best. 3/10

A life simulator of a shark that will grow from a small individual before your eyes. The shark has a lot of enemies and you should not think that you are stronger and smarter than everyone else - be careful! Piece of Voxel has proven they care absolutely nothing about making even a decent game with their history of tossing nothing but ridiculously priced asset flips and asset trash up on Steam. name: Spinball
short_description: Spinball is a fast, fun, and competitive sport game for 1-4 players with non-stop scoring action. Rack up the points as you spin your paddles to smack the ball towards the goal, and try not to accidentally score against your own team!
reviews:
of all the games I've played, this is definitely one of them It's a game. I first played Spinball at Ohayocon earlier this year and it was absolute blast! Definitely a very fun couch-game to play with friends. 

This game is a lot like a heavy metal 2D soccer type of game with physics and and power attacks and dodges.

There is a very nice variety of arenas and customization for your character. You can also add more and more legs to your character to make him a strange horror of soccer prowess. If Pong on the Fairchild Channel F and the Hattrick arcade game had a baby it would be this game.

Beware that even after you make your selections you have to highlight GO! or you will never get started.

Worth the asking....

F11 in case you don't notice switches it from Windowed / Full screen, so has that feature!

Played successfully with Logitech Dual Action USB controller.

Windows 10 64-bit compatible!

name: Frog Demon
short_description: Frog Demon supaaa dupaaa shooter!!
reviews:
re It's a nice game but when i faced a glitch my enjoying is over
i just stuck in (bug) checkpoint
only way to carry on close the game and re-open it full of  errors Funny game Can never have enough glitches, can we? I would not recommend getting this game for one dollar, much less for fourteen. I was deceived by a decent look of the game and bought it for few cents at some sale.
It was not worth it.

Whoever is responsible for the sprites in this "game", you should know, you did a great job. 

But all the other aspects... argh.
If you think there is some story, there is none.
1. Menu is just two buttons and you are forced to click them by mouse.
2. Controls. A + D + space + mouse button. I have no idea why I was forced to use the mouse again in a 4 buttons game.
3. 'LOOser' and 'chAckpoint'. Amount of text in the game is not much more above it and yet 2 misspellings.
4. Not bad background music in an awful short loop.
5. BUGS GLITCHES and more BUGS. After reaching one of the chAckpoints and then dying, the game went crazy, removed floor tiles and binded the character with some invisible chains so the froggy couldn't move in any direction. Couldn't even kill itself.
5. In this situation I tried to ESC to menu, but nothing happened.
So I finished playing at this point. 

Avoid. Not bad game,but full screen not work..... got this for 0.10$, refunded and got a steam card instead 0.3/10 gamesense

name: Disgaea 7: Vows of the Virtueless - Bonus Story: The Overlord, Demon Lord, and Sheltered Girl
short_description: Adds a story featuring the following 3 characters. Once completed, you gain them as playable characters and save icons. - Laharl - Etna - Rozalin
reviews:
I liked the story in this one. If you want to main Laharl again he is a great character.

Rozalin - Has a bunch of buffs but probably won't use.

Laharl - Overlord's Strike: +30% crit rate and 100% crit damage when using specials. Unique +10% stats per defeated enemy.

Etna - Gimmick character but has a lot of Evilities for prinnies if you want to play that way. Haaah hahahaha OVERLORD, OVERLORD! OVERLOOOORD!!!

name: Bounty Hunter: Space Detective
short_description: Take the role as the new Detective on Space Port Aurexia, your assigned with checking the traffic coming into the Port and ensure that no bad eggs get through, we know who we're looking for but it get's really difficult when rush hour hits, you're our only hope detective!
reviews:
I bought Bounty Hunter: Stampede, Space Detective and Ocean Diver. Ocean Diver is, I think, the prettiest,  Space Detective is proving to be the hardest and Stampede is sort of in the middle. The three games are really all the same, they even use the same music, they are cheap and they are fun. 

There is a lot of criticism of the game for being short. I've played it and it does feel like that. All the games are short and timed and after completing, or failing, one the player is bounced back to the menu so there is no feeling of progression. However the more I play the bigger the population in my city gets and that's what unlocks Steam achievements .So if you want a quick shot of space based action this probably is not for you, if you want something that will give you  lot of quick achievements this probably is not for you.

Basically this is a cheap, fun game that is easy to pick up and put down and it is a bit different other games I've played. I find Space Detective to be quite challenging and it demands my full attention when I ply it as the differences between the ships are really minor. 

Since the three games are so similar I'd probably get either Space Detective because it's tougher or Ocean Diver because it's prettier. Cute little time-waster. For $1.50 (sale) you can't go too wrong.

It's basically Where's Waldo but with moving parts and a different target each time. It is the same thing over and over again with more of everything as the levels get harder. The backgrounds also switch from dark to light which can really mess with you depending on the ships you're assigned to look for. Even on Easy mode, I was alternating between finding my target instantly to staring at the screen for the entire time limit and never once seeing any of the ships I was looking for thanks to the background being a color that camouflaged the ONE little thing that would have made my targets stand out on a different background.

Hard mode really amps up the number of ships (from 400 to 800) scrolling across the screen and gives you more targets to keep an eye out for. Everything moves faster, too.

You get a score based on how much time you have left after shooting your last target but that score doesn't seem to do anything or unlock any fun new goodies. There are also VIP ships that show up randomly, but only in hard mode. The game could probably benefit from some power-ups or unlockables.

As for the other aspects of the game:

Music/sounds: Only able to turn off or on, no sliders.  Music is actually not too bad, even if it's the same tune forever and ever.
Resolution: I can't find any options in-game for resolution other than the + button in main menu that either makes it fullscreen or some preset windowed resolution that you don't get to choose.
Achievements: There are NOW achievements pertaining to shooting the VIP ships but there aren't any based on scores, so I have no idea what good scores are.

To wrap it up: as I opened with, it's a nice time-waster for the price. Simple, it works, and it's chill. Probably a good one for winding down before bed but once you've got all the achievements, there probably isn't much reason to keep going.

name: Lust Shot
short_description: Immerse yourself in the exciting world of "Lust Shot" - a visual novel with action elements, where each victory brings you closer to solving dark secrets.
reviews:
TL;DR Don‚Äôt bother.

The premise is that you are a highschool student and you have died and gone to purgatory [spoiler]Actually you have not you are in a secret facility being kept as breeding stock and no I am not joking[/spoiler]. You must play Russian roulette with this annoying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so quirky‚Äù chick because she tells you if you win three times you will be ‚Äúisekaied‚Äù into a new life. When you win (the first two times at least) you get rewarded with a sex scene, of which you get what you paid for in terms of quality, low quality that is (honestly just look something up on the internet if you are that horny). I don't know what happens after you win for the third time I gave up.

Gameplay is you and the girl have 5 hitpoints each every time you shoot at each other RNG decides if you miss based on what is in the gun, i.e. 4 bullets and 2 blanks gives you a 67% chance of a hit. You can choose to shoot at the girl or yourself, if you miss the girl or take damage your turn ends. But wait there‚Äôs more there are cards you can play on your turn to shoot in the air, regain an HP, or deal 2 damage instead of 1. There also is a chance to dodge a bullet in which case the current turn ends. Does that sound fun? Because it‚Äôs not, it‚Äôs a frustrating RNG fest that seems to favor the computer.

The visuals are amateurish and bad, but you can see that from the store page.

The sound/soundtrack gets grating after a few minutes the voice actress gets annoying and I cannot believe they actually read some of the lines without protesting that no human talks like that.

I lasted 1.5 hours in this game although the gameplay loop is only worth 15 minutes. I give this a 2 out of 10. Got it for 3 euros and it's worth it.
the story sucks, the bot cheats a lot but the gameplay is what I wanted and the music suprisingly slaps.
Just do yourself a favour and play without the dodge feature
 what the fuck Too little thing while bad game experience Lust Shot is a short but still alright game. It is simply just russian roulette but with the same mechanics as buckshot roulette. Although there was potential for some strategy, that was all thrown out the window with the dodge mechanic which just steals your turn after completely negating your shot. Of course you can turn the dodge mechanic off, but that just feels like a waste to not play with the original mechanic in the game. The dodge itself could have been a great addition to the game play if it were not so heavily rng dependent. Although it was frustrating spending most of the game not getting a turn I still had fun for how short the game is. The story is good for how short everything is, but nothing super amazing either. I enjoyed the character art for sure. 
Overall for the price I would say Lust Shot is worth it, and I look forward to seeing how the dev improves in the future. 4/10: beat it on the hardest difficulty, and it was incredibly frustrating and unfair, though winning felt good because of it. For the price, I would give it a 6.5/10.

You should only play this game if you have nothing to do for a couple hours and you're feeling a little horny.
Play this game on the hardest difficulty; the rush of victory combined with your need to bust a nut should make the H-Scenes worthwhile enough to complete the game.

Also, the story is shit and the ending is corny, But, again, the H-scenes are good enough to convince you to want to keep playing. [code]This game was [b]NOT[/b] provided by the publisher.

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Having had your first date with Truck-kun while commuting to college, you find yourself in a room with boarded up windows where a beautiful girl in a sailor uniform asks you to play russian roulette with her for a chance at getting isekaied.

[h1]Review[/h1]
Well, this was a very short experience, about 20-30 minutes, and there isn't multiple endinge, which I would expect when the main story is this short. The price fits what you get though, so this is more me wanting more rather than anything else. Perfect for you if you want to kill about half an hour somewhere during your day. Game is about the price of a chocolate bar, and offers about as much enjoyment. Looking forward to future games by this dev.
[/code] I found 'Lust Shot' to be a fantastic short game that evokes the spirit of Danganronpa with its engaging narrative style. The story is both good and simple, striking a balance that keeps players intrigued without overwhelming them. The animations were great, adding a visually appealing layer to the experience, and the game mechanics felt refreshing and innovative. I would highly recommend 'Lust Shot' to anyone interested in trying out a Hentai game for the first time, as it‚Äôs approachable and enjoyable for newcomers In 40min i managed to beat this game twice in order to find a replayability (there is none).
Poor game design, developer doesn't understand the concept behind "Russian roulette" and how it works/should work, despite the fact that this is a core gameplay here.
Not recommend. 35 minutes game on the medium level. 2 H scenes, some insane plot. Crap

name: Street Paint Playground
short_description: You are an artist with motor paint machine in a cool beach enviroment with some old walls to put your art into, the police and their dogs just want to stop the fun! make them happy with some tasty donuts, paint the walls and make colorfull creations. This is a game made for chilling and painting!
reviews:
Playing this game only for few minutes, but there are only free and endless spraying with no anything particular to do like some levels about art. When you start you can choose which color of paint you want and you need just to come closely to table and 3 different sizes of spraying. When cops or dog come to catch you, feed them with pizza which is on car left on the map, you cant feed them with pizza if you didnt pick up, throwing pizza on Q and throwing donuts on right mouse click. 
For me it's just simply not finished game with good quality and idea, but somehow it doesn't impress me at all. Just don't. The game is completely unfinished. There are no instructions. You cant paint over paint that you've already put down. You can't throw pizzas (?) so bears kill you constantly. Please don't release games until they are finished.

name: Train Simulator: NJ TRANSIT¬Æ GP40PH-2B Loco Add-On
short_description: The Electro-Motive GP40, introduced in 1965, has proven to be one of North America‚Äôs most versatile and successful locomotives, with more than 1,200 units constructed by 1972. The GP40 was designed to haul tonnage, and with four axles and a robust 3,000 horsepower, the locomotive was ideally suited for intermodal and fast freight duty,...
reviews:
On sale, sure. Not for full price, it's too old with too little to offer in the pack for full price to be justifiable. The overall model looks really nice, but the sounds are yet again recycled from every friggin american commuter pack that DTG pushes out. It literally sounds just like the NJT F40 CAT pack, which is so very wrong. The commuter cars are the same Comet cars we see in literally all of the NJT packs, nothing special there. Physics are not an existing feature lol. Fellow Railfans and Train simulator players,I recommend this fast girl to any of you. Probs one my favorite trains I ever purchased. Im sure theres others. :D This locomotive is fantastic one of the best DTG did a great job with this I give it 10 of 10. The loco looks nice, unique to TS.
Being used more extensively in real life, you can take it to most routes (Quick Drive). It can handle grades.
Also used by 3 scenarios in the additional packs if you fancy those.

Sounds are the usual F40 sounds, better than the stock SD40 but far from an EMD.
Safety systems also trigger the UK warning sounds, from the old Class 47. Loud, scary and inappropriate.
Comes with an old safety system device so you don't really know the aspect or speed limit.
The self-lapped brakes apply so quickly, stuttering is an actual problem.
Scenarios require you to ignore signaling and just race. Gets you fired IRL. Some timetable stops are impossible.
With number boards missing, it's a fair bet that these were ran exactly 0 times during design & testing.
Weather settings for the first scenario have been recently messed up.
Comes with the standard NJCL wagons, not even a matching cab car.

Somebody should fix it and then this would be a blast.

The F40 pack complements the route better with focusing on the diesel section. This is an amazing game for operating various trains across the globe. Its pretty easy to edit and customize your own trains and routes as well. Only downside is the DLC can be a bit expensive, but if you wait for a sale then thats not even an issue. Nevermind what I said before. I just found out that you have to look for the correct scripting for the cab car when making a train with this locomotive. (E.g. Look for the option called "[GP40]Comet V Cab Car" or [MT] Comet IV Cab Car (Diesel)." 3D modelling is good, as are the textures. The sounds are average as usual.

Overall, I would say this is an average DLC for now (untill patched), as there is still an issue with the number lights: when lighted, the number boards will display nothing but bright light (alpha mask issue ?). its a classic that's be serving since NJT was formed. made even better now that the ALP46 pack released the multilevels. good sounds, decend bell ok horn. i just wish the horn didn't auto trigger the bell. it also has a differn't more classic breaking system than the rest of the NJT stock. The New Jersey Transit GP40PH-2B is not a bad DLC, but is lacking in some areas. Unlike the F40PH-2CAT, it does not have a toggleable HEP engine. Like all NJT DLC, it has the run-of-the-mill Comet IV coaches and Comet V cab car (Which is configured as an electric locomotive, rendering it inoperable on non-electified routes). I was massively disappointed with that as I would've loved to see DTG produce another model of NJT coach, such as a Comet V or IIM trailer coach, or even a Comet IV cab car (Atlantic City Line trains often ran with Comet IV cabs; Hoboken Division trains are typically straight Comet Vs) to go with this DLC. I was disappointed that this model lacked opening windows or doors akin to most recent DTG offerings.

The model quality is great as with most of DTG's offerings, and the sounds are generally of an acceptable standard (There are two payware sound packs for this engine). Physics are fine, but it would be best to download Fan Railer's physics mod. The included scenarios aren't the best, but the wintry Bay Head to Long Branch one should keep engineers on their toes.

Finally, I can primarily recommend this DLC to NJ Transit diehard fans such as me. Overall score for this DLC is a 7/10. Amazing DLC, i love the detail and the look, but doesnt come with great sounds though. 8/10

name: Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth3 Shares Quests
short_description: The Shares Quests DLC unlocks four additional quests located in¬†Planeptune, Lastation, Lowee, and Leanbox!
reviews: A decent amount of XP for early-mid game grinding if you want to do it. Also gives you a big swing in shares but only if you have the shares to shift around. I had this in Re;Birth 2 as well and never needed it there. I'm waiting to see if it's necessary in Re;Birth 3. I suspect most people will only get this if they have the deluxe edition, best I can say is it's not the worst DLC and there are a few minutes of entertainment value in taking down a copy of one of your characters.

name: iBLiS
short_description: Demon is a first-person psychological horror game. How much can a game affect your real life? Enjoy a realistic home environment and terrifying moments of being immersed in a real-life story.
reviews:
it literally was one of the best horror games i have ever played until the final part started. you have to wait for like 40 minutes just roaming the house until you can advance. and it became the worst game ever. 0\10, wouldn't recommend. its a very good small game <3 the game has 0 action and it takes for ever to pass a task it was a bad experiment Unsolved mysteries meets horror based on true events this is the game for you! 7/10 great story, recommend ages 7+. RATING AT THE BOTTOM

I gotta be honest i've never said this before but this mf is walking simulator. Honestly the game could be so much better if we weren't so lost not knowing if we've done something or not by walking into the same room for the 9th time. The game was scary and definitely landed the atmosphere i was scared half the time but the other half i was so confused and lost. then out of nowhere someone pops up in front of me or runs at me and now all the sudden my underwear is brown. This game would be soooooo much better  if we didn't have to do soooooo much walking.

I'D RATE THIS GAME A 5.8 OUT OF 10 

I would rate it higher if it wasn't so much walking. I would also rate it lower if it wasn't as scary worst game ever walking simulator not a horror game we got a bug at the end of the game !! we couldn't find the Key and finish the game :(( MY FREIND TOLD ME TO PLAY IT ANDDD IT'S SOOOO BADDD I NEEDED TO WAIT 50 MIN FOR THE LAST JEY AND THERE IS NOTHING IN THAT TIME LAST KEY NEED 50 MIN TO SPWON YEAH IF U HAVE THE TIME TO WASTE JUST WALKING GO WALK IN REAL LIFE This game hits different when you Arab\Muslim, cuz the Quran phrases and everything is spot on , gave me a mini heart attack. but at the end the game glitched and got stuck on the quest before last and the escape key never spawned.

name: OMSI 2 Add-On Citybus O405/O405G
short_description: Experience the next classic in the world of public buses: the Citybus O 405 built between 1987 and 2001 belongs to the last generation of high-floor buses. The successor to the Citybus O 305 was a very popular vehicle and is still in use today thanks to its robustness.
reviews:
I didn't get the DLC with the mod, for some reason, then I tried to reinstall it, BUT IT WANTS ME TO PAY AGAIN!!! WHY?!
 detailed and flawless usage

con is the o405g likes to move and glitch a bit when the doors are open at a station but it fixes after you close them Wow this is a absolute beauty of a bus! I love the O405G gangway. So nostalgic! I would say this a very easy bus to modify. it also have a sound mod for it to have ZF and Voith varients. Repainting is some of the easiest one i done and the layers really helps to make the bus look nicer. Even the prices arent that high. Furthermore, I do love how much setvars there are for this bus, IBIS Destination controller, Rollband numbers to LAWO Flipdot! However, repainting requires you to drop the main layer opacity to 5% or some texture error will occur. I will definetly reccomend this DLC to all OMSI Players out there

Pros: 
Easy to repaint
Have many configurations
Easy to mod
Bus is very neutral

Cons:
Bus repainting requires you to drop opacity.

Overall: I would give a 10/10 for this DLC! Best i have ever given!!! Good Job Pedro! Really nice bus, nice to drive.

The bus is customizable, you can change ticket machine, doors etc my only issue is some of the ticket/ibis machines are difficult to use.

7.5/10 its not repaintable no templates : ( i cant reccomend it for that reason alone The O405 started service in the late 1980s, and started to replace buses such as the O305 and MAN SL200. Overall, a very well executed add on with quite a few good points, and very little to be upset about, and possibly one of the best buses that can be bought for the sim. 

Pros:
+ Customization options including ticket printer type, doors, rollband/matrix displays, dashboard variations, and possibly more.

+Small details that can be opened, such as the boot lid in the back, showing the engine at work.

+Multiple Paint Jobs, with most made for the maps that can be bought for the sim, including 2 BVG paintjobs that would fit Spandau just well. Community also made multiple paintjobs, and there is also a O407 that needs this DLC to work. 

+Solo and Articulated versions. 

+Very well detailed. 

Cons:
Really, non. Possibly one of the greatest addons made for the Sim. Price is a little steep as of 2020, but thankfully it goes on sale, it's worth it. gtvfvftbcfbvfrc I love parts of this bus! We got cool rain and snow effects on the bus! 2 models does not stop the fun. We can customize the bus like the doors, destination sign, etc. and we can open different doors outside the bus like the engine door. You can even drive with the doors open! These buses are very enjoyable. They drive really smooth and I like the way the destination display is like the old Berlin MAN SD200 with separate parts per line digit and per letter. It's also nice that you can open a lot of hatchets at the outside of the bus when you simulate malfunction of the bus, that you can stop somewhere and open them for example. The style of the interior is also quite unique for the Oxxx series in my opinion. And with also having a roll band variant the complete nostalgic experience is complete. O405s in this DLC are way better than those in three generations DLC and Hamburg day and night DLC! 
Apart from every amazing deatil, the manual also told you how to change the type of display,hubcaps and so on,  brillaint!!! O(‚à©_‚à©)O

name: Tearstone
short_description: Embark on an exciting adventure helping the mysterious Professor with an incredible discovery in Tearstone. Explore magical locations, uncover priceless artefacts and discover an array of interesting characters.
reviews:
While I enjoy HoGs, even ones that feel really old, I was determined to play to the finish until I reached the halfway point. I don't know if there's a bug in this chapter, but I missed one object in a scene I couldn't seem to find and another never showed up and then I couldn't go back to get the object I needed. After that, I've had it freeze several times in the middle of game play and I've had it freeze upon trying to load the game. I hate to abandon games, but this isn't the first one I've encountered with such issues.

I would not recommend this game at full price. Just another game I played recently with a game breaking bug and this is so disappointing because I was really enjoying this game. 
nice illustrations, pleasant atmosphere, cute story,  well no need to go on because I was on chapter 6 which is nearing the end so playing for a while ( note my recorded time is only because I don't play it all at once but keep it active since I tend to come back to games sometimes later on and just keep it active).

this is the bug .  [spoiler] While getting the cross for the monk, the game crashes when using lighter on the paper to reveal one of the rubies. [/spoiler]

so I will have to put a NO to getting the game because I want others to avoid the disappointment of playing nearly all the game only to have it crash and also not be able to continue because within the game this bug prevents you from obtaining the needed item.

disappointed! Graphics of 90's, bleak artwork, hint system virtually useless. Can't scale/crop for wide screen. Was it really designed in 2011? After playing for only 30 min this game froze on me.  Then it wouldn't even load to let me play!! Tearstone is a bit old, so the graphics could be more detailed and there is no HDR graphical effect to light up the dark areas.
However, it is less easy than the typical hidden object game, which for me is a good thing because recent HO games tend to be of the sort "Click here, my dear child" and/or "go forward, go back, go forward, ...".
The cursor is not always very helpful and a sharp eye is sometimes needed to locate items in half-darkness. What's more, and more interesting, a touch of creativity (some would say less logic...) is needed to get some of the objects or puzzles.
On the whole, we enjoyed it and, with a bit of patience, we didn't need any hints. This is a very old HO puzzle adventure story and would have been B grade even then.  Graphics are grainy and dark.  Objects very small.  Keyboard controls are very clunky and didn't react fast.  Story was ok, but nothing extraordinary.  There was a game stopping bug in the 6th chapter which stopped me playing.  I was glad to stop as I was getting bored.  I don't recommend it due to the bug and poor graphics.  Thumbs down from me. I didn't love this game. But I didn't hate it either. It had enough in it to keep me occupied...and because I'm not exactly the smartest nor the best of gamers: it probably took me longer than it should have. Some of the goals/puzzles were a tad vague (IMO) and left me scratching my head, but like I said--not the sharpest tack n the box here. Hooray for me that I managed to figure everything out. 

Tearstone is a hidden object game. It has a story that takes you on a quest to various locations where you have to find objects, talk to characters, complete goals, etc, etc... in order to fulfill your sacred destiny and make everything right with the world. The story is pretty simple. However, at times the puzzles can be frustrating. There are no clear instructions on some of them, which left me clicking on random things like an idiot 'til the solution just sort of fell into place. 

This is a nice, casual game. I honestly picture this more on something like a mobile phone or tablet, but I still enjoyed playing it.

name: SAMURAI WARRIORS: Spirit of Sanada - Additional Weapons Set 5
short_description: New weapons are added to the game. At the Blacksmith, select Buy Weapons to obtain powerful weapons for the applicable characters. ‚ñºApplicable characters: Kanbei Kuroda / Hanbei Takenaka / Motonari Mori / Takakage Kobayakawa / Hideyoshi Toyotomi / Mitsunari Ishida / Sakon Shima / Nene / Kiyomasa Kato / Masanori Fukushima
reviews: Nice

name: No one lives under the lighthouse Director's cut
short_description: A slow burn retro horror game, in which you arrive at the old lighthouse on a small island near the coast of the United States. After the previous keeper has gone missing, you need to take over his duties and watch after the light.
reviews:
crap I really wanna like this game more, but its just not mechanically giving what it needs to. I haven't beat it, and I don't intend to. The vibes and visuals are immaculate, but the story just veers off in a whole different (bad) direction, and some of the scares feel a little flimsy. A third of the way through the game items are moved around and the light randomly goes off, it feels like the moth monster is just fucking with you and not in the spooky sadistic hunter way. The monster POV chase scenes are a cool concept but completely fall on their face, and the monster design is a bit underwhelming. The devs are clearly talented, and I hope they keep making stuff, and maybe even take a second crack at this story. But right now, I can't really recommend this game. This game gets lovecraftian horror! the entirety of the story felt like a lucid dream that just can't seem to stop, which is a common theme in lovecraftian fiction and other inspired works! it was beautiful... 8.5/10 This is easily going to be one of my all time favorite games that I will come back to. I paid for it, didn't receive for free. It's the perfect blend of cozy & creepy & calming & scary. The atmosphere is just right, great audio, & the ps1 style graphics enhance the sensations.

I haven't read the other reviews, so I don't know why it has "mixed" (as of this writing) but I'm glad to have found this game. This atmosphere is exactly what I'm hoping to find when searching for hidden gems & I do believe this is a hidden gem. To me this is a perfect example of why you should "disobey" recommendations & give some things a try.

No spoilers, don't worry, but basically I'm pretty on-the-fence about whether to recommend watching the movie "The Lighthouse" with Dafoe & Robinson (though it's probably unrelated.) Personally, it amplified the atmosphere for me since I have seen the movie. 

Once you beat the game, there are a few more things you can do, so don't miss out on that. shits crazy I keep lighthouse, something break lighthouse and i am not happy.
Please no break lighthouse or my sanity. A boring walking simulator that loves wasting your time. Got stuck behind a chair. The World's #1 PS1-themed A24 Simulator.
 Complete random things without any sense. You go there ‚Äì nothing, you go back ‚Äì nothing, you go back and something open. Glitchy stuff with dark black ugly pixel graphics.
Example: Day one was glitch for me, because I dont bring the suitcase from docks. I was stuck in endless loop of day two and suitcase was in house.
Creators knows that and some stages you can skip after a few deaths.
Dont recomend A short, narrative driven game with a lighthouse, but no scenes of Robert Pattinson jacking it.
Starts off interesting, however it quickly introduces 2nd person chase sequences which control horribly and will get you killed several times, as well as spoil the monster way too early. Then in the second half a bare bones plot becomes overly cryptic with Lovecraftian locations and constant perspective changes just to confuse you and seem to be more sophisticated than they actually are. Who am I playing as now? Are these memories? Is it the past, present, or future? What is even happening? I read other reviews and it seems that the Director's Cut added these sequences and I think it ruined a compact experience with unnecessary, generic bloat that doesn't know when to end.

Boring mess. Skip it.

name: 3 Minutes to Midnight¬Æ - A Comedy Graphic Adventure
short_description: In a race against time, Betty embarks on a thrilling, comedy-packed adventure to crack a conspiracy that starts with a bang and ends at 3 Minutes to Midnight.
reviews:
excellent A wonderful point and click adventure game! Multiple solutions to each puzzles, great jokes and references to other games and movies, overall a fun time, and the game has multiple possible endings to get!

I enjoyed the unique looking art style they got going on for this (a point and click HAS to have a nice art style in my eyes, and this one does!).

I hope for a sequel and/or other point and click adventure games from this studio! 
 ‚Äã"3 Minutes to Midnight" is a delightful throwback to the golden age of point-and-click adventure games. From the moment I stepped into Betty's shoes, I was captivated by the game's vibrant, hand-drawn visuals that exude a charming, cartoonish appeal. The attention to detail in each scene is remarkable, making exploration a genuine pleasure.‚Äã

The narrative is a rollercoaster of humor and intrigue, filled with quirky characters and unexpected twists. Betty's witty and sometimes mischievous personality adds depth to the story, and her interactions with the eccentric townsfolk often had me laughing out loud. The puzzles are cleverly designed, striking a balance between challenge and logic, and I appreciated the multiple solutions offered for various scenarios, which added a layer of replayability.‚Äã

The voice acting is top-notch, bringing each character to life and enhancing the overall immersion. The soundtrack complements the game's atmosphere perfectly, with tunes that evoke a sense of nostalgia while remaining fresh. While the game does have its moments of lengthy dialogue, I found that it contributed to the rich storytelling and character development.‚Äã

Overall, "3 Minutes to Midnight" is a charming and engaging adventure that successfully captures the essence of classic point-and-click games while introducing its own unique flair. It's a must-play for fans of the genre and newcomers alike. It's a really good point and click adventure, almost on par with the classics of the genre but slightly misses the mark (in my opinion). The story is unique and intriguing, even if at first it might not seem it. The characters are well written, dialogue well written and voice acting on point for the era and characters.

There is a lot of dialogue. A LOT. My only complaint is not being able to skip dialogue that involves playing any sort of animation. Or skipping certain, repeated animation sequences. This was a tedious part of the game for me, anxiety inducing, even!

If you enjoy a good point and click adventure with a focus on story then give it a try! Fun & Funny! I just started the game and I would totally recommend it, as point and click games fan I can say that this game is from the few Point and Click games that has sharp graphics. I just wish Broken Sword to learn how to make their games look better and sharp like this one. The game seems well put from the menu to the game play.

Update: I couldn't continue the game half way, story is bit long and boring with so much conversations, and the the environment is repetitive, same place and characters.  I really wanted to like this game. A classic style point and click adventure, with great graphics and animation. A mix of old Lucasarts and Sierra games, but unfortunately overshadowed by lengthy and uninteresting dialogue and automated scenes - a lot of which cannot be skipped. This makes it more a cartoon/interactive story on rails than a game. I suspect writers and voice actors were a lot cheaper than graphic artists and animators.

Pick up everyhing, talk to everybody and it is quite obvious when and where the items should be used - with a few exceptions. Repeat.

Betty is an annoying protagonist, and so is the voice acting. Her mother is a bit better. The story is meh, so is the humor. The most funny part was the death scenes. 

In-game achievements might seem as a good idea, but I don¬¥t believe anyone would replay the game to unlock all of these. 

The few puzzles in the game seem to have been added in hurry towards the end. The game is not very challenging, the most challenging is to endure all the meaningless dialogue and automated scenes. Amazing setting and story, reminds me a lot of the Deponia Game series in the style and humour.
10/10 would recommend! one of the best adventures i ever played. An ALL TIME CLASSIC Great game. I live these point and click adventure! This one is marvelous!

name: Tabletop Simulator - Tiny Epic Quest
short_description: A world of peace has been torn asunder by the opening of a vile portal from the goblin kingdom.
reviews:
Tabletop Simulator fills a special need for boardgamers and miniature gamers alike.
Tiny Epic Quest on TTS is like having the board game itself. The "system" does a few "auto" features in the game but otherwise you move your meeples manually and your tracking tokens and your cards and the dice rolls.
The game looks to be fun. I own and have played several other Tiny games and like them all.  They are all different and all fun to play. 
Good games. 
Tabletop Simulator is a blessing to gamers who learn to use it ( a bit of a challenge but what gamer doesn't like a challenge?). Adorable little game with easy automatic setup and straightforward rules. Fun to play both with and without other people. Gonna grab a physical copy if only for the cute ITEMeeples and their equipables :) Super cool game concept, me and a friend had a blast playing it last night. i have one issue, where it was saying my friend had to also purchase the DLC, i looked and only i shouldve had to buy it.. if you can look into that or make sure that the host thing is working before you buy it, then its worth it Our library has the physical version, coworker told me about the Steam version and I had to have it. Very satisfied, game play went well, mechanics work great, resolution good, can see rule book no problem on zoom in. 

For beginners: Couldn't figure out how to start the game. Told by some helpful others that you click on your name in the upper right of the screen and choose a player color to "sit" down at the table. That lays out the board and starts the game. From there you mostly manually move your pieces, but some of it is automated like when you pull a quest you complete, it automatically draws another. 

Also, seems like you need to do part of the resolution first yourself before hitting the resolve round button. Return applicable meeples to their castle, pull any completed quest cards and goblin tokens before clicking the resolve round button as that will set/refill the board and quests for the next round. Awesome game, with very cool rulebook that you can actually flip through. The new item meeples are the future of gaming! Easily modifiable and so diverse. Table auto setupts very fast. Comes with singleplayer mode.. Highly recommended if you're a fan of Tiny Quest like me. Love it!

name: Jet-Story 2018 Donationware

reviews: Remake of old game with new features, enemies. Music similar to ZX version. System of checkpoints - thanks to this, I finally, finish game. It was after +/- 30 years since I played it on Speccy clone Didaktik. Game creates nice retro mood.

name: Warhammer: Vermintide 2
short_description: The critically acclaimed Vermintide 2 is a visually stunning and groundbreaking melee action game pushing the boundaries of the first person co-op genre. Join the fight now!
reviews:
A very well made game! The hours speaks for themself Is good This feels more like a glorified cash shop, rather than a video game.
Everything just feels generic here. Including the art style.


Starting the game brings up a launcher... 
Had a bug with a box that stayed at my display, until I restarted the game. Happened after the first startup.. and never again.
Did you know, there is a """""NEW""""" versus mode? Well the game will remind you every time, before it lets you into the hub area!

Audio is pretty low, even though it is at 100%..

There is.... There is a fucking armory in the hideout... but you can't take anything into or out of the mission areas,...

The storm sorcerers... they cast the storm from far away, hidden behind some stuff and there is nothing that we can do... Until their first storm ends and another begins..

Escort missions... wow... Followed by lighting fires... WHERE YOU HAVE TO APPROACH THE THING YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO LIGHT ON FIRE, BEFORE YOU GET ANOTHER TORCH?! FUCK THIS GAME!!!!!

It also doesn't help, that most of the talents, besides the last 2 to be unlocked, are plain boring.

[i]3.5‚Ç¨ only to unlock 1 single class, without any microtransactions, which cost extra... And I mean really extra. The Necromancer one costs 8‚Ç¨ for the cosmetics, on top of the 3.5‚Ç¨ for the class!
You can get some good indie games, or game just for these 2 "microtranscations"![/i]

[b]Marvel level dialogue is annoying..[/b]
Lumberfoots? Mayflies? Wtf?
The item shop guy, franz lohner is so fucking annoying... Everything he ever says is so ass, I just wish I had the option to throw him to the skaven, that prick..
What is worse, is that he can talk to you in the DLC missions, making them worse than the standard campaign.

At least the Witch Hunter and Dwarf are good.

[b]There are some positives[/b]
-Level design - This is the highlight of the game for me, they have done a fantastic job on that front.
However.. You can't even enjoy something... because every few minutes a horde gets summoned... Like it's overkill!

-Chaos wastes
Especially after reaching lvl 30 with one of the characters. It's fun to have the extra abilities that.. to be honest, would have been great in the base game too. As well as have more than one talent in a given row.
This game mode, is one of the few times I had fun with the game.

-The AI of the bots feels DECENT/OKAYish.

-Lore accurate special and elite enemies
I can only speak for the skaven and those are accurate. Armored, with shield, warpstone thrower, assassin, etc. all make sense as special/elite enemies, lore wise.


[i]PS:[/i]
Yet again, another very positive game on steam with a small completion rate.
As of writing this, only 30% of players finished the game on recruit difficulty. Absolute fun. Great to release pressure and forget everything else, at least for me It is such an incredibly addictive game, absolute must have. Very fun. —Ä—É–±–ª—é —è–π–∫–∏ –∫—Ä—ã—Å–∞–º —Å –∞—Ä–º–ª–µ—Ç–∞–º–∏ DnD on crack, basically Mine! Mine! Mine! kill rarts good

name: Lotte
short_description: A minimalistic five-minute puzzle platformer, where you become a fly when you die. Immerse yourself in a soothing forest and use your ability to become a fly to solve puzzles.
reviews:
I know this was a passion project, but it is one of the simplest and shortest games I've ever played. That said, it works, and it has a personal attachment for the creator, which is nice. I wouldn't personally recommend it, but if you try it, it'll only be 5 minutes. Shout out to indie devs. Lotte is an excellent, short platformer that introduces some truly innovative gameplay mechanics. While it‚Äôs brief in length, the experience is memorable and will stick with you long after finishing it. It‚Äôs a wonderful example of what small indie developers can achieve with creativity and passion. I highly recommend supporting the developer by picking it up ‚Äî it‚Äôs definitely worth the small price! A short but creative platformer that's great for beginner game devs to spark ideas/motivation. I spent 8 minutes, so... not entirely "five-minute" experience. 
Not that I'm complaining here.
And be warned here, that this is [spoiler]quirky platformer tribute to a dead relative[/spoiler],
It is serious, yes. But mechanics are very robust and ready for more levels.
Shame they're never where created... Lotte is more of an interactive art piece than a game. It is a puzzle platformer, but with interesting Indie game mechanics. Extremely short, but somehow emotional and worth that time. A small, efficient and simple piece of game. The mechanic is really interesting I'd barely consider this a game,
It should be free if anything. Nice It's a neat and short puzzle game. Maybe too short for how well designed the puzzles were but considering it was probably not its main focus but rather the memorial of a passed loved one I'd say it did its job quite well and I can respect that.

Keep at it Mathis. Mini meaningful mini map mini masterpiece

name: Stellaris: Galaxy Edition Upgrade Pack
short_description: This pack will upgrade you from Stellaris - Standard Edition to the Galaxy Edition
reviews:
Only worth the OST. Do not buy as of April 2025.
Have not received any of the contents of this DLC, after searching everywhere on both steam and PC. DLC is activated, yet nothing. I did not receive any of the items. DO NOT BUY THIS.  I looked in my local file but did not find anything. The species portrait is great, the soundtrack is amazing, and there's the bonus of the digital artbook and the novel, I love this but would probably only get it if you want the complete edition, or the soundtrack. Go back your mom's vagina and rebirth again.
Take the brain out of your heel and use it again. Mostly rp but there's some limited mechanic increases related, still not worth the price though. Only worth it if you are a fan of the game, and if it is on discount. Gameplay wise, you only get 1 new portrait. bought this pack and never received the in game items so for now you should skip this DLC until they fix it. did not receive any content as of march 2025 After searching my entire computer for many times, I still unable to allocate all the contents as promised by the developer in this DLC. Can anyone please kindly inform me how to find the contents of this DLC, where is the routine? Many thanks!

name: KART CHASER : THE BOOST VR
short_description: Shout out to all racing fans! ‚ÄòKART CHASER: THE BOOST‚Äô has finally made it to the VR world! Immerse yourself in the virtual reality world, take the wheel and feel the thrill of the most realistic kart racing that you've ever seen!
reviews:
