name: Guardians Of The Past
short_description: Guardians of the Past is a fast-paced arena brawler where you use gadgets to battle with or against your friends in a variety of arenas constructed by YOU! Build an array of launch-pads, fields of electrical chaos or even a sea of fire. With hundreds of combinations, every game is unique!
reviews:
It's a great game to play when your friends are around, though you need to find enough controllers for everybody.
But when you have found these controllers, oh boy, fun guaranteed.
Sometimes you need to explain the game a little, and for me it's lagging a bit now and then but otherwise a really fun game. 10/10 Great game to play with friends, has a lot of potential and the devs are active and very responsive. Great game, when you consider the stage its in! Wonderful Dev team who are always listening to ideas and issues, and quickly resolving them.

name: Survivor in the Forest
short_description: Survivor in the Forest is a 3D puzzle adventure game with clicker elements. You find yourself alone with nature and must overcome all obstacles to get out of the forest.
reviews: Completely meaningless game without any proper plot, just 15 minutes of clicking on spiders, no suspence, no action. Literally nothing. top for the money, very interesting to play A very interesting clicker puzzle game. Where you will have to survive in interesting places. This game is something new for me, the game contains a lot of different mechanics. It is really very interesting to play. vertigo gameplay Good sticky clicker. For weak PCs, the graphics are excellent. There is a storyline. It's not a bad idea to combine clicker and survival, I recommend it) COOL clicker this game could be good but no volume control only on or off. if you like left clicking the mouse this game is for you because that is all you do and a lot of it

name: Xuan-Yuan Sword VII
short_description: Xuan-Yuan Sword VII is an ARPG rooted in Chinese history and mythology. Players take on the role of Taishi Zhao, a calm and reliable swordsman who was accidentally involved in a tragic fate. To protect his beloved family, he starts a journey in this chaotic realm to find the truth.
reviews:
I really enjoyed Xuan Yuan 7. This was my first game in the Xuan Yuan franchise.

I am a huge fan of linear action games like Devil May Cry and Ninja Gaiden. While Xuan Yuan 7's combat is no where near as fluid as Ninja Gaiden and has no where near the combo potential of Devil May Cry, it still felt more like an action game than an RPG to me. Yes there are RPG mechanics like character leveling via experience points, but your stats don't scale as high as in most RPGs so in the end this game rewards skilled gameplay more than any of it's RPG mechanics. I played Xuan Yuan 7 on "Nightmare" (hardest) difficulty; if I had played on an easier difficulty I probably would have found it too easy to enjoy.

The combat is entirely melee focused. Your main character does not have a ranged weapon or spell. You have a basic attack combo, a dodge that give you brief i-frames, a block that can trigger a parry if you time it just before an enemy hit, a camera lock-on, a finisher move when an enemy's posture is broken, a manually triggered time slowdown, and you choose 2 (out of 7) stances that provide unique heavy attacks and special attacks. You can also trigger your 2 AI allies to perform a special attack. Not the deepest combat system, but enough for you to tinker to keep your entire first playthough feeling fresh.

I do want to warn you that there is a healthy dose of jank here. Boss patterns, hit boxes, the camera, and physics can all give you a headache. Some animations can be canceled and some cannot. Some attacks will give you I-frames againts certain enemy attacks, but not give you I-frames against other enemy attacks. If you are the type of gamer that wants games to be extremely intuitive, then you may not enjoy Xuan Yuan 7.

I really enjoyed the story. This is not a typical JRPG story line where you end up killing God. This is a smaller scale story about a brother trying to take care of his sister.

Quick Positives:
[list]
    [*]Linear With Waypoint. You will not get lost. :)
    [*]Skippable Cutscenes (although I genuinely enjoyed the story and didn't skip them usually)
    [*]Multiple Save slots (like 15ish)
    [*]New Game+
    [*]The game performed well on my hardware.
    [*]Controller support worked great. (I played using an X Box controller)
    [*]The music was very pleasant. I don't think I will listen to the soundtrack much outside the game, but it works well in this game.
    [*]Aside from some puzzles, I thought the game had really good pacing and didn't overstay it's welcome.
[/list]

Quick Negatives:
[list]
    [*]The loading screens can get annoying. The game will give you a loading screen after every death, including if you retry a boss fight.
    [*]Numerous slow sections like climbing, crawling, shimmy-ing, etc. This game also suffers from "yellow paint syndrome" but it is white paint in this case.
    [*]Puzzles. There are a handful of puzzles and I think the game would have been better without them personally.
    [*]Fast travel can only be done between fast travel points. I would have prefered being able to just fast travel from the pause menu to avoid backtracking.
    [*]The side quests are pretty forgettable such as a tic-tac-toe style board game.
    [*]The camera can be very frustrating and cause you to die because you can't see.
    [*]I did experience a few crashes when I alt+tab-ed to access other apps on my PC. This only occured about ~5% of the time, but still worth noting. The game never crashed while it was the focused app on my PC. I only experienced crashes after alt-tab. I experienced crashes on both the Windowed and Fullscreen settings.
    [*]Unless I missed it, you cannot pause cutscenes and you cannot pause during certain animations like shimy-ing along a ledge.
[/list] Love the wuxia aesthetic here. Would recommend if you can overlook janky combat and barebone story. This might be a 6/10 game but I'm definitely interested in whatever this devs make in the future. Good action RPG.  Wish it was English Dubbed. It kind of upsets me that a lot of people don't like this game. Maybe it's so much more focused on the story than the gameplay that it turns people off.

I love this game so much that I went out of my way to buy the exclusive physical edition. I truly believe that if someone took the time out to play this and went in seeing it more as an interactive movie than a regular game, they would enjoy it so much more. Only reason to play a game like this is for the story. Unfortunately, the story fell flat.

I never cared for the main character and his motivation seems very tangential to the plot. Everything seems thrown together with barely any explanation, even the final boss, which just shows up and has no build up. worst puzzles I ever saw Rich story line with plenty of lore.  Recommend this for a quick run through.  There's a nightmare mode if folks want to challenge their skills.  Nice music and fleshed out characters. Surprisingly good game, fair amount of jank, but was enjoyable until the end. The combat would be better if the enemies were better designed, but it's serviceable. 

7.5/10 If you have played Xuan-Yuan Sword II Dance of maple leaves and Xuan-Yuan Sword IV, then this game is a must play. It completes the stories of the above two games. Otherwise, the game does not worth your time.

Pros: the graphics and the music immerse you in an ancient Chinese world
Cons: the story is too short, and very limited interactions with NPCs Disappointing story....gameplay is a hit and miss...the only thing good is some of the graphic scenery are really good.

name: Total War: SHOGUN 2
short_description: Total War: SHOGUN 2 is the perfect mix of real-time and turn-based strategy gaming for newcomers and veterans alike.
reviews: good game since it was released modded or OG. It's Total War... with Samurai. This is the pinnacle of Total War. Shogun 2 and Medieval 2 are the best Total War games, along with Empire and Napoleon. Shogun 2 is special because of the nodding potential and it being the last true Total War. Everything starting Rome 2 is nu-TW and its all spreadshit simulators with no tactical elements Need Remake or Shogun 3 Best total war game hands down. Honestly, really fun and intriguing for players new to the Total War series. Perfect place to root down before trying something more complex like Rome 2. Great game if you like suffering s GG Top three or four total wars.  The Warhammers I'll group all three as #1, this is either #2 or #4

name: Move Code Lines
short_description: Move Code Lines is a game where you fix programs and make them print needed output. But the only way you can achieve that is to change the order of lines in those programs, and set custom input.
reviews:
THIS IS NOT PYTHON
THIS IS NOT JS / JAVASCRIPT
THIS IS A BESPOKE LANGUAGE
(it would be nice if the author specified this in the description)

Took me slightly over 8 hours to solve chapters 1-12 (maybe i'll come back to this review and update it when i solve chapter 13)

The idea is charmingly simple: you move code lines --- and also provide input, so the title isn't really totally honest maybe.

It's a puzzle that starts out extremely simple and the first few chapters can be used to learn programming, though the later ones are more of a puzzle, and you might even want to write some helper code somewhere else to nail down the exact inputs. Some levels can be done with a bit of guessing and trial and error, though you still have to get the basic idea

There are a couple peculiarities:
- The language used is something the author has made from scratch, with heavy inspiration from JS, Python, and possibly a couple others like Go or Java
- The language always uses pass-by-reference, which is a bit unusual and can throw someone off. It would be nice if passing by reference would be more explicit, even though it would make a couple easy levels slightly easier
- There is no introspection of variables during execution --- kind of a shame really, since if you try using it to teach or learn, it would be really helpful to have some visual feedback when variables change.
- There is no way to save your solutions, barring taking a screenshot and saving it somewhere else. Really frustrating when you get to the later chapters.
- No way to reset your progress. I guess the idea is to just buy another copy on another account, which is more of an inconvenience, since the price is certainly not an issue

All in all, this is a nice programming puzzle, not too simple, not too challenging. Getting all achievements seems to be possible within like 20 hours, although i haven't done so myself yet so soooo underrated. a truly nice game for code learning Great for practicing! I enjoy that this is helping me learn a bit about coding. However, I do wish that it included some tutorials. I'm kinda just winging it. It would be good as a supplement for someone who is learning code through a course. I'm almost a complete beginner, so there's a lot I'm not entirely sure of. It is a bit like a fun puzzle though. Very good coding exercises for who is learning Python. This game is fun in the first levels, but without any debugging and explanation, it is just trial and error. It stops becoming fun relatively fast and I just finished it for the Achievements. 

Idk, maybe the Dev thought it'd be a fun game, but it is just too random and complicated. I did not enjoy the game, because there is no way of really learning. You either know or you don't. Whenever you have a mistake it just says "ERROR" which is really not helpful for a puzzle-game. fun game nice game, train coding logic, and is very applicable generally speaking I'm not a programmer, but I have dabbled in it a bit. I don't know what it'll be like for someone with no prior experience in programming, as you'd also have to gain an understanding of the programming-lingo/logic-concept. I'd also imagine this is boring and a bit silly for a seasoned programmer, but as someone identifying as the target demographic; it's a puzzle game with a programming theme. I'm only a couple dozens of levels in so I cannot speak for the later stages, but so far so good. Great little game for learning basics of coding. I've seen a few other coding games but they had little to no interactivity, this does. Its kinda like a puzzle game, but certain pieces go in specific places. Understanding that and some basic math and a little critical thinking, you can progress forward without much difficulty. It starts out easy but gets progressively more challenging. As someone who's trying to learn Python I found this game fun & informative.

name: Dandelion - Wishes brought to you -
short_description: Dandelion -Wishes brought to you- is a female-oriented game developed by Cheritz. The game was released in South Korea in August, 2012. The English translation for Dandelion was released on Nov, 2012. Dandelion is known as a unique dating simulation with a sensational storyline and charming characters.
reviews:
dandelion was the first otome game i ever watched a playthrough of in like 2014, so some of my thoughts might be colored by nostalgia. but even with its flaws, i really love this game. some of the translation can get wonky every once in a while, nd some routes are a bit meh (looking at YOU jisoo) but over all this is a good intro to otomes!! jieun is my personal favorite, but i really love jiwoo nd heejung's dynamic. plus yet i can't stay is SUCH a banger!!!! i wish cheritz still gave attention to this game... i'd kill for some new merch Made me cry meow Love this game T_T 
It's literally the last day of 2024, and I'm still hoping for a sequel lol so boring i would have been more awake in a philosophy lecture Not gonna lie I felt intimidated by the stat increase mechanic but it wasn't so bad. I liked all of them. All of them were cute. just trust me it's a great dating sim saw it when i was 12 as a lets play waited till i was 20 to get it and i love its quirkiness and early 2012 vibes. Personally, I love this game, but it might be because of nostalgia. Its not really worth this much money. The story is fun, but the romance is non existent, there's just no chemistry between Heejung and her love interests. (I still need to do the wizards route so we will see after that). The game mechanics aren't anything amazing, and the game shows its age. I love the interactions, and the fact that the mc herself has mental problems that she struggles with but still comes on top of all of this. But as I said, romance is non existent, there's just no chemistry, but the interactions between the love interests is very funny and interesting. I don't recommend it also of one of the love interests, Jiuen being around 15-16 (since in Jihae's route there's mentioned he'd be around middle/high school), mind you Heejung is 21. I remember watching one of my favorite youtubers play this game when i was a teenager and it is one of my fondest memories. It is just as fun and exciting to play it myself and i can genuinely sit here for hours and play. I'm a sucker for a good love story so this game is right up my alley. My obsession with this game is far too great...

name: 7-minute HOP
short_description: Interesting jumping game with cute graphics and infinite gameplay.
reviews: 6/10 Its is a great game you can jump in it

name: Cinemaware Anthology: 1986-1991
short_description: Cinemaware's Anthology of classic games gives you a fascinating collection of some of the highest-regarded, most successful games from legendary game developer Cinemaware!
reviews:
Ah, nostalgia. Cinemaware were on my favourite publishers for the amiga500. This collection hasall the hits minus the TV sports games. they all run and play just like i remember. it came from the desert is one of my all time faves. my first foray onto immersive gaming. this coll. has it all. 9\10 Classic games. good Awesome Anthology of games.  I really love It Came From The Desert one and two.  King of Chicago is good too! Check it out! Love some of these old games.  How I miss all of them on the IBM 286. Of course it's not going to run well on modern systems. Loads of features missing from Defender Of The Crown. I don't remember it being this slow, either. Anyway. A bit of nostalgia, I suppose. Gone from the store, anyway. Got it for the Amiga versions, seriously regret it. The Amiga Defender of the Crown is missing features, and crazy slow. You are far better off getting Amiga Forever and running it there. Somehow the IBM version of Defender of the Crown has the missing features though, like passing turns and transferring to your army.  You also cannot play the game in window mode, so at 1440p the full screen of Defender of the Crown looks horrible. 

I was a huge fan of the Amiga in the 80's and Cinemaware, this is just a horrible collection. Repetitive must play-through in one sitting games...

6 of 5 must play.
5 of 5 great story great game-play.
4 of 5 great story average game-play.
3 of 5 average story average game-play.
2 of 5 play only if it's your favourite genre.
1 of 5 play if you have nothing better to do.
0 of 5 play if you're a masochist.
-1 of 5 avoid. 

Cinemaware Anthology score is -1 of 5. Played this on the Amiga many years ago. Love them all but Sinbad and Wings are my favorites from this group. I heartily recommend this collection for anyone needing that old Amiga 'fix.' To many bugs that ruin it. SORT it out. Piss take

name: Ammo and Oxygen
short_description: üî´üëΩ Adrenaline shooter-roguelike with a survival and suspense atmosphere. Caution and accuracy are as important as conserved ammo and an extra explosion that raises the alarm in the lair. Stock up on oxygen, batteries, and ammo to survive another terrifying night.
reviews: Game plays and feels great - a clear labour of love that's going to shape into something amazing. Particularily love the UI design. This is a good roguelike, quite original. I liked the low entry threshold; you can start even without a tutorial. We played in three through sharing, though there were occasional inconvenient delays (which are unavoidable for this type of game). We're looking forward to updates and online co-op! Feels polished.

name: OK/NORMAL
short_description: OK/NORMAL is a short, experimental third-person horror experience, inspired by early 3D console games of the 90's. Journey through a dark, disjointed, dreamlike dimension with your cloud companion! Remember a good diet, take your medicine, and you should be fine!
reviews:
This game is ok/normal. Is this what being high looks like?. If so, it's scary. The game is pretty decent, I liked the vaporware atmosphere and it does get somewhat spooky the longer you play but it's no horror masterpiece by any means. It's pretty short too so the horrible controls don't overstay their welcome.

7/10 this game will make you feel epileptic üëç I'M SORRY
I'M SORRY
I'M SORRY Thank you for the tinnitus Quick warning before getting to my review - please check the Mature Content description on this game, if you're not in the best head space I'd maybe wishlist this and come back later to play it.

OK/NORMAL doesn't really have much of a story-line that I can reasonably pick up on, but it's interesting and frustrating at the same time. There's a lot of things I like about this game and don't like about this game. For how short and cheap it is though, I'd say it's worth it.

Pros:
‚Ä¢ VERY neat graphics
‚Ä¢ I like the approach it had with [spoiler]it reading my computer's name and time to include it as part of the game[/spoiler]
‚Ä¢ Love the lil cloud dude, homie's chill and has [i]the best intentions[/i]
‚Ä¢ Most of the levels are fairly easy to navigate and get through

Cons:
‚Ä¢ I'm not a fan of the camera angles+control handling, ESPECIALLY on that god awful platforming level
‚Ä¢ Sometimes it was very unclear what your goal was or where to go so you'd just endlessly roam around, which got boring after a while [spoiler]and this was especially a problem in the key and final area with the spikey eye boys..[/spoiler]
‚Ä¢ Ending was a tad underwhelming, but I do like the twist it gives you to some degree
‚Ä¢ Too short, but I understand it did describe itself as a short game (this isn't an issue the dev did, I just wish it had more content, just feels like something was missing to really seal the deal.

Overall, for $3 - this is a game I can kind of recommend. If it even looks somewhat interesting to you - get it! It's a neat little game. I just really think there's more it could've done overall. 

[i]As a side note, there's only 4 achievements - if you're someone who cares about or really likes to achievement hunt till completion on a game, then do yourself a favor and look through the steam guides on it because you'll likely miss one like I sadly did and had to repeat most of the game again! I usually don't like to use guides whatsoever, but this one unfortunately needed one for my play-through personally. [/i] can you hear them The Developer used the artistic medium of a Video Game very well and didn't linger for it to become a nuisance.

Lots of non-recommended because of gameplay/storyline. The game's 40 minutes, quit your [strike]BIT[/strike]--whining. I wasn't thrilled myself, but if you're trying to emulate how a person on some rather wacky pills might feel, then making the controls, visuals, and audio the same way as they listen, look at, and interact with the environment is the way to go. A full length game like this would be horrible (control-wise), yet I found myself wanting more levels. –ú–µ–¥–∏–∫–∞–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–∑–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –±–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ø–æ-–≤–∏–¥–∏–º–æ–º—É, –±—É–¥—É—â–µ–≥–æ —à–∏–∑–æ—Ñ—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –ø—ã—Ç–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–ø–∞—Å—Ç–∏—Å—å –æ—Ç —Å–º–µ—Ä—Ç–∏, –Ω–æ, —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ –≤–µ—Ä–¥–∏–∫—Ç—É, –æ–±—Ä–µ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å "–≤—ã–∫–∏–¥—ã—à–∞", –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞—è –≤ —Ä–∞–π.
–£—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–∏ - —ç—Ç–æ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏—É—Ç—Ä–æ–±–Ω–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞. –ú—ã –Ω–∞–≥–ª—è–¥–Ω–æ –≤–∏–¥–∏–º, –∫–∞–∫ –ø–ª–æ–¥ (—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—è) –ø–æ–≥–ª–æ—â–∞–µ—Ç –ø–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≤–µ—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –≤ –≤–∏–¥–µ –≤–æ–¥—ã, –ø–∏—â–∏, —Ç–∞–±–ª–µ—Ç–æ–∫ (–≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ, —ç—Ç–æ —Ç–µ —Å–∞–º—ã–µ —Ç–∞–±–ª–µ—Ç–∫–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑–∂–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è —ç–º–±—Ä–∏–æ–Ω–∞), —É–º–∏—Ä–∞—è –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º. –ó–∞–≥–∞–¥–æ—á–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±–ª–∞—á–∫–æ - —ç—Ç–æ –ø—É–ø–æ–≤–∏–Ω–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∂–¥–∞–µ—Ç –ø–ª–æ–¥ –¥–æ —Ç–æ—á–∫–∏ –Ω–µ–≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∞. –í—ã –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ, —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º –∂–∏–∑–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, —è –≤ –±—É–¥—É—â–µ–º –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ–±—É—é –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –≤ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ —Ñ–æ—Ä—Å-–º–∞–∂–æ—Ä–∞ –¥–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–∏–π "–∫—É–ª–∞—á–Ω—ã–π –∞–±–æ—Ä—Ç". This may very well be the first time I‚Äôve played a game where I didn‚Äôt enjoy it - and yet, that was the POINT of the game. This psychedelic game is unlike no other I‚Äôve played - making it tough to finish in a way I haven‚Äôt seen another game try. It‚Äôs indescribable.

name: The New Apartment
short_description: A man living in his new apartment finds himself in the center of something much more sinister.
reviews:
Very short decent horror game. [b]You've already played The New Apartment.[/b] That right there is its biggest setback. If you have even the [i]slightest[/i] interest in horror and have played [i]even just[/i] [b]one[/b] of those little indie horror games you find everywhere on Steam, then you know [b]EXACTLY[/b] what's going to happen, [b]beat by beat[/b]. That's not to say there isn't anything good in the game, nor am I saying that there aren't other issues worth talking about. [i]Look....[/i] all I'm trying to say is [i]that I've played these games before[/i]. you hear me?


The game begins [b]as any proper horror game should start[/b], by introducing us to a single, 20s something dude who [i]hates his job[/i], is buried [i]in student loans[/i], and [i]can only afford the cheapest and crappiest on the housing market[/i]. how else would you relate to your target audience? [b]he's literally me![/b] (*ahem*) so our hero man (I'm just going to call him Larry), just got home from work, and is doing his usual nightly routine. Eating dinner, washing dishes, brushing teeth, [i]all that exciting stuff[/i]; when all of a sudden, [i]he hears a strange noise in the living room[/i]. [b]w h a t   c o u l d   i t   b e ? ?[/b] Upon entering, he finds one of the framed photos on the ground, and on the wall in its place are the words [b]‚ÄúIn the darkness, you will find us‚Äù[/b]. huh.... whelp, it's awfully late, and I ought to be getting to bed now. [b]G'night[/b].


The first thing you'll notice about [b]The New Apartment[/b] is that [i]there really isn't any actual gameplay[/i]. You're going around your house, just... [b]living[/b]. Wash the dishes. [b]check[/b]. Brush your teeth. [b]check[/b]. Now [i]turn on your little night light and grab your teddy and say nighty night[/i]. [b]check-a-doodle[/b]. That's about as involved as the game gets, and we haven't even gotten to the horror yet. Once the lights go out and the spooky stuff starts, you're tasked with mindlessly moving around the apartment, searching for whatever weird occurrence just happened. There [i]is[/i] a puzzle in the last fourth of the game or so, but other than that, it's a [b]straight up walking simulator, with nowhere to even walk[/b]. And [i]don't get me wrong[/i], moving around in the dark [i]can[/i] be pretty unnerving, but as the game drags on, [spoiler]combined with the fact that you're in absolutely no danger for 99% of the runtime[/spoiler], the only feeling you'll have is [b]boredom[/b].


The production values of [b]The New Apartment[/b] are an equally mixed bag. Visually, the game actually looks really sharp, with hyper-realistic props and textures. I wouldn't be at all surprised if over half the assets came pre-made from Unreal Engine, but [i]hey[/i], it still looks great, and there are enough little details to prove that the developer really cared [spoiler](some of the book titles on the shelf are hilarious. our man Larry has both Politics for Winners AND Politics for Losers. ...I'm sure that joke offended someone somewhere)[/spoiler]. And the sound design is [b]fantastic[/b]; being both distinct and unsettling, without just going down the typical [b]L0Ud NOiSES!! ! ![/b] route. Unfortunately, the game runs like [b]crap[/b], with the FPS frequently dipping down [i]into the 10s[/i], with the motion blur (which you can't turn off) [b]making me want to puke[/b]. (I don't know my exact computer assessments, but I could run Apex Legends just fine at 60). It's also kind of difficult figuring out what items you can and can't interact with, because the icon is [b]so darn small[/b] and the camera makes me feel like I'm drunk anyway. And Larry's comments throughout the whole game just scream ‚Äú[b]I'm a modern horror movie protagonist with no personality[/b]‚Äù. like, [i]can we[/i] PLEASE stop the trope where [i]horror movie characters do stupid things because they're like[/i] ‚Äú[b]heh heh, I'm not in a horror movie or anything! I have so much to live for!![/b]‚Äù? It's not [b]funny[/b], it's not [b]clever[/b], and it feels like [i]you're making an excuse for[/i] [b]bad writing[/b]. And it's not like the rest of Larry's comments are any better: [b]‚Äúwell, that just happened!‚Äù, ‚ÄúI take a dump here every day‚Äù[/b], [spoiler]‚Äúmacaroni. good.‚Äù.[/spoiler]


And now, for the main thing that turned me off about [b]The New Apartment[/b], the [i]very thing that made me decide on the negative rating[/i], [b]we have the ending[/b]..............spoilers, [i]obviously[/i]. After you solve the riddle and open the combination lock, you open up the jewelry box and find a note that simply states ‚Äú[b]It is time. You are worthy. She is coming[/b]‚Äù. Almost [i]immediately[/i], your front door swings open, and the wind becomes unnaturally [b]loud[/b]. The game prompts you to hide in the bathroom, [i]which you do[/i]. [b]you sit in the dark... holding your breath... waiting for it all to end.... you hear footsteps... and heavy breathing.... that... that can't be human.[/b] oh[i]oh[/i]oh-[b]oh my gosh it's opening the door....[/b] it's... [i]it's...[/i] IT'S.. [spoiler]it's a seven foot dark glowing demon thing with no face.[/spoiler] [b]spooky[/b]. and [i]you know what happens next?[/i] [spoiler]...it kills you. ‚Ä¶.like, yeah. The demon guy (or lady, I suppose) kills you, and you're thrown right back to the title screen[/spoiler].‚Ä¶.GGs!! and MAN, what a crazy conclusion!! A horror game ending with [spoiler]a tall dark figure brutally murdering you before abruptly going back to the title?[/spoiler] [b]that is just SHOCKING!![/b] why, [i]I haven't seen a horror game end like that since[/i] [b]The Last Job[/b], or [b]Missing Hiker[/b], or [b]Nightmare of Decay[/b], or [b]The Grave Keeper[/b], or [b]Big Larry[/b], or---y'know what [i]I'm just gonna stop right there[/i]. And as always, my reaction remains exactly the same: [spoiler]‚Äú...........aight. ‚Ä¶..I'm gonna go play Balatro now‚Äù.[/spoiler]


If you want an easy and short horror experience for cheap, you could be doing a whole lot worse than [b]The New Apartment[/b]. While there's not much to it, and it doesn't run very well, the visuals look just fine; and the atmosphere is genuinely [i]really good[/i]. I just can't shake the feeling that [i]I've played these games before.[/i] you hear me? I said [b]I've played these games before[/b]..‚Ä¶.[i]I'm gonna go play Balatro now.[/i] This is how you do a horror game with no unnecessary jumpcares and only with unsettling atmosphere Definitely a great "demo" for what I hope could be a bigger game. It had some good horror aspects and was pretty smooth, however it was a bit difficult not exactly having any objectives. Could be a lot better if there was more direction and story. Nice short game, fair price. Loved how sarcastic the main character is, found that funny. If you want quick grab for your horror fix, grab this one. Full gameplay below üëá 
https://youtu.be/448hv8qelC0?si=hLP156t74ODOOA1y This game is awesome!
It makes you feel that something will come for you or jumpscare you,while you are walking through the rooms!
It has an amazing spooky atmosphere and amazing short spooky story!
For the price is for sure worth it!
Personally,I loved the game & I'm waiting for more!

name: The 111th Soul
short_description: Embark on a touching and creepy journey about sacrifice and how sometimes a person pays for the sins of another
reviews: 5/10 A few of the early jump-scares got me, and I wish it had the budget to be a longer project, though I enjoyed what was here! A cheap indie game made by a single developer. Very short, but the message was clear and effective. Enjoyed the atmosphere. This was alright. Nice and short but enough story to be somewhat interesting. I liked it. Good free game. It's short, but it is free so, no complaints. Good if you like short point and click story games. 6/10 Extremely short, very likely a game made for a two-week jam or something like that, but now free and fine enough for a solo developer. Biggest problem: it has many endings, but you can't skip the (very slow) dialog before changing your choice to see the other endings. Second biggest: audio changes wildly; be ready to turn it down. In any case, if you are in the mood for a very short, slightly horror, a bit unpolished, walking sim game, then this is for you. It has a couple of jump scares, but they are super predictable, so you shouldn't have a problem with those, even if you tend to avoid them. It's a fairly decent short indie horror. The horror elements were fun and it had a decent story. If the game was longer I would say it could have a strong story.  It would have also been nice to have more puzzle elements since it was all very straight forward. It was a cute , short, and sweet indie game. Interesting little free indie adventure/horror game, worth 20 minutes of your time, parabens Ricardo! Despite a few flaws, I still recommend this game. There's clearly a lot of work invested. The dev clearly has a great eye for lighting and atmosphere. Good pacing, a few moments will make your heart race without real jump scares. This game is very brief and in my mind shows the tremendous potential of the dev.

name: Wolfenstein: The New Order
short_description: Wolfenstein¬Æ: The New Order reignites the series that created the first-person shooter genre. Wolfenstein offers a deep game narrative packed with action, adventure and first-person combat.
reviews:
How do you revive a franchise? Well, a little like this. 

The New Order reboots the Wolfenstein franchise. If Doom was the granddad of the FPS genre, then Wolfenstein was the dinosaurs. The original premise was simple: you are BJ Blazkowicz, a prisoner of castle Wolfenstein during WW2. Escape the castle and kill as many Nazis as dare get in your way. Yeah, it's not much of a plot. New Order understands the assignment it's taking on perfectly however. 

It's 1946. The war is still on and the Nazis are winning. Blazko and the allies make one last desperate strike that goes all manners of sideways, leaving our hero in a coma and the Nazis free to take over the world. Fast forward to 1960 and Blazko wakes up and wastes zero time to get back into the fight. If Tarantino's Inglorious Basterds was a videogame it'd be a little like this. And Machine Games saw the comparison during development. Cutscenes have a wonderfully Tarantino styled edge to them. Add in a dark industrial soundtrack from Mick Gordon and presentation is solid. 

And how do you fight the Nazis? Well, however you like really. The game loves to drop you into sandboxes. Enemies will be present, patrolling, doing random tasks, conversing. And you're free to go about eliminating them however you please. Stealthily bypass the guards to eliminate their commanders and avoid having to deal with reinforcements? You can do that with some rudimentary, but serviceable stealth mechanics. Not one for sneaking? Grab your gun. Grab two guns even and go to town! Dual wielding is a thing and it is glorious to turn enemies into red smears on the wall by emptying two shotguns into them. And the game rewards you for your efforts. Perks unlock as you progress. Each kill makes you better at killing. 

Now for the not so great: this game released at the very end of the PS3/360 era and runs on the ID Tech 5 engine. It will look beautiful from the right angle, but only from that angle. pre-rendered cutscenes are a little low resolution, shadows are a little pixelated and PC features that are considered basic like anti-aliasing are absent. These are all issues that Machine Games would resolve with later entries in the series, just not here. Either way, don't let these gripes dissuade you. The New Order is still an amazing shooter that doesn't overstay its welcome and will take you along for a fun ride. its good Probably the best FPS ever made, a must play for any fan of the genre, however the ID tweaker file is reccomended for newer graphics cards on pc :) üè≥Ô∏è pretty good, those fuckin heavy shotgun soldiers are THE HARDEST enemy in the game

7/10 This game is very pog. I think shooting N@zis is a pog time. 

10/10.
 Good very good game from the wolfenstein series. worth every penny peak, i wish more nazis would dematerialize into goop though

name: ËÇùË©¶„Åó„Ç¥„É´„Éï[KimodameshiGolf]
short_description: Kimodameshi Golf is a horror golf game based on golf!
reviews:
Very scary game! I would recommend to those who love golf and I would recommend to those who love the occult. I am very excited to see where the game goes next as it is developed. Thank you! I'll leave this as a tentative review, but I cannot recommend Kimodameshi Golf at this time.

This ultimately feels like it was not play tested, rather than given careful consideration to release. The idea is simple, play golf in haunted environments. And from there, everything goes downhill. I'll break things down to positives and negatives below:

Positives:
[list]
    [*] The game's concept is definitely original, given that I've never seen a horror themed golf game.
[/list]

Negatives (oh boy, here we go):
[list]
    [*] [b] Aiming your shots is broken, nearly impossible in some cases. [/b] The player is able to maneuver around the ball to initiate their shot, but the angle of approach to the ball determines where you can aim it during the shot. Normally this wouldn't be a problem, but the angle at which the player model attaches to the ball is EXTREMELY inconsistent, and at times, impossible due to the player colliding with or getting on top of environmental details (for example, the first course in the playground, you'd end up on a bench when trying to shoot).
    [*] [b] The interruptions from the ghosts. [/b] So there's a ghost that looks like the stereotypical Japanese female ghost from any form of media that tries to hit your ball as you're aiming your shots. The big issue here is that the ghost doesn't need to aim and has FAR TOO SHORT of a cooldown on when it hits your ball. This means if you get cornered by this thing, you can basically kiss a perfectly aligned shot goodbye, and it is beyond frustrating to have this happen. 
    [*] [b] The mini-map. [/b] As if aiming wasn't bad enough, the minimap is completely useless. Even in the most basic games, you'd assume that the shot direction or player facing direction would be legible on the mini-map. Well my friend, you'd be incorrect. Not only is the direction issue a huge hurdle, but the areas that are technically out of bounds (which incurs a penalty like regular golf, but also sends a ghost to kill you when triggered) are not represented in any way on the mini-map outside of "being out of the square you're looking at".
    [*] [b] Physics. [/b] If you're looking at this review, you know what a golf game should feel like. You've played Mario Golf, Hot Shots, Easy Come Easy Golf, whatever. This game takes those rules and tosses them out the window. One of the maps forces you to golf inside of a house, but strangely, the wall seem to be made of some ball-attracting material, meaning if you make the mistake of whangin' it against the wall, it's going to get stuck. The main issue here is that, in this map, the main "ghost" cannot be contacted, otherwise it kills you. This pretty much means there's no way to complete this course if this happens.
[/list]

I'm only popping this review in solely to give other folks an expectation of what this game feels like at this time. The dev clearly states that this is a super early version of the build, but honestly, it should not have been published as it is. I avoided watching Critikal play this because I was legitimately excited to give it a shot, but I ended up walking away feeling haunted by the game in the complete wrong way.

Â†¥Âêà„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶„ÅØ„ÄÅÁãô„ÅÑ„ÇíÂÆö„ÇÅ„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅØ„Åª„Åº‰∏çÂèØËÉΩ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ „Éó„É¨„Éº„É§„Éº„ÅØ„Éú„Éº„É´„ÅÆÂë®„Çä„ÇíÊìç‰Ωú„Åó„Å¶„Ç∑„Éß„ÉÉ„Éà„ÇíÈñãÂßã„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Éú„Éº„É´„Å∏„ÅÆ„Ç¢„Éó„É≠„Éº„ÉÅ„ÅÆËßíÂ∫¶„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç∑„Éß„ÉÉ„Éà‰∏≠„Å´„Å©„Åì„ÇíÁãô„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Çã„Åã„ÅåÊ±∫„Åæ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ ÈÄöÂ∏∏„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„ÅØÂïèÈ°å„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åå„ÄÅ„Éó„É¨„Éº„É§„Éº „É¢„Éá„É´„Åå„Éú„Éº„É´„Å´Êé•Á∂ö„Åô„ÇãËßíÂ∫¶„ÅØÈùûÂ∏∏„Å´‰∏ÄË≤´ÊÄß„Åå„Å™„Åè„ÄÅ„Éó„É¨„Éº„É§„Éº„ÅåÁí∞Â¢É„ÅÆË©≥Á¥∞„Å´Ë°ùÁ™Å„Åó„Åü„Çä„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆ‰∏ä„Å´‰πó„Å£„Åü„Çä„Åô„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅÂ†¥Âêà„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶„ÅØ‰∏çÂèØËÉΩ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ „Åü„Å®„Åà„Å∞„ÄÅÈÅä„Å≥Â†¥„ÅÆÊúÄÂàù„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„Çπ„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Éó„É¨„Éº„É§„Éº„ÅåÁãô„ÅÑ„ÇíÂÆö„ÇÅ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å®„Åó„Åü„Å®„Åç„Å´„Éô„É≥„ÉÅ„Å´Â∫ß„Å£„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÑ„ÄÅ„Ç∑„É•„Éº„Éà„Åå„Åß„Åç„Å™„Åè„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

name: ‰∫∫ÈñìÁâßÂ†¥ Residence
short_description: Kailin does her yoga training every day to stay fit for her upcoming sexfights. However today Yanmei took a place on Kailin‚Äôs spot‚Ä¶.and it was a mistake. Girls start to argue who is the best here and whose body is more fit.
reviews:
6/10 How to win the game asap in this knockoff of a street fighter.
I got this game so I can defeat the characters and see why the other 2 people gave up on it.

After button mashing on the keyboard I understand what each key means.
Controls: w,a,s,d is respectably up, left, down, right.
Controls: T, Y, U is respectably light punch, medium punch, and heavy punch
Controls: G, H, J is the same order but for kicks.

I've never played street fighter 1 but the way the button mashing works it reminds me of some broken combos in there like the infamous Ryu spam down kick.

To win as fast as possible: spam anything that gives you range or do down kicks. Also find the bugs in the game since it was made so poorly.

I'll give each spamable main attack per character you should try to do and the rest of their kit is just button mashing:
-Kailin is Ryu so spam the S and H buttons for the down kick.
-Yanmei has a cool projectile of a support kick. The AI doesn't know how to counter it and it's the best way to spam and stay healthy. When the P meter is full spam G and H together if you're next to the opponent for a P meter ultimate. Her normal atacks are only heavy attacks or medium heavy punches. Don't do the kicks on her since there is no inputs for them.
-Riko is Chun Lee. Main attacks are kicks. Punches are pointless. There is a good bug on Riko if you mash good enough and do the down medium heavy kick you can make the hitbotx stuck under her. Spam it to win. Basically Ryu 2.0.
-Jin-Ae is literally Ken. Spam his up heavy punch for a uppercut hit and spam it. It has 2 hits in it and is one of the fastest heavy punches in the game. Spam it to victory.
-Xiaooye spam her light, medium and heavy punches. The kicks are pointless on her, except her medium heavy kick. If you can get close enough and spam the light punches the AI doesn't know what to do and becomes stupid and usually gets locked in stuns.

All in all for a $3.99 game. It's a ripoff and bad game. For the pictures though? Idk. I played this game for a total no more than an hour to full completion. The AI because it knows the combos correctly is more of a player than any of us will ever be. So by becoming the machine and spam the right buttons you can beat the "player Ai". If anything else I only recommend it for the pictures but anything else game play was terrible. After the fact I think the pictures are AI generated too.
 [i][b]‰∫∫ÈñìÁâßÂ†¥ Residence[/b], really makes you work for those images, let me tell ya.[/i]

There was absolutely no way I was going to be able to fight with those keyboard inputs. You can't move left or right with the arrow buttons, only WSAD, which isn't the problem. The problem are the combat moves being Y, U, G, H and some others. I don't know, it's weird putting my fingers on the appropriate keys.

And there was a delay between the attacks you're doing which doesn't help.

The gallery images are great. The combat? Not so much.

[h1]Who's this game for?[/h1]
[list]
[*]Gamers who want NSFW with sexual content
[/list]

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
[list]
[*]Weird controls
[*]Delay on attacks
[*]Poorly implemented gameplay for a hentai game
[/list]

[h1]Positives[/h1]
[list]
[*]The adult images, if you get to see them
[/list]

Our verdict: [b]Unworthy[/b]

name: Virtual Real Fight
short_description: This is a VR fighting game that pursues realistic fighting, allowing you to hold and open your hands in the game world using intuitive controller operations. Simple, quick tricks can make the difference between winning and losing, giving you a thrilling experience.
reviews: I was expecting a game that would be something similar to a first person street fighter mixed with Kunio. There is no plot, no reasons for the fights, and even when I hit the foe it doesn't register a hit or give me any indication that I am doing anything correctly. Even getting into the game is a hassle because the buttons are to the side and also far away and there is no menu to explain how to walk or do anything else. Bad game all around.

name: Amaranthine Voyage: The Tree of Life Collector's Edition
short_description: After finding an artifact, you're whisked away to a dying world. Can you save it from the darkness?
reviews:
excellent This 1st entry in the series is an instant classic and I highly recommend it to fans of the genre. It would appeal most to those who are up for a bit of a challenge.

The story won't wow you, but it's a fun game packed with a lot of content, all of which is original and logical. It features lots of good hidden-object scenes, quite a few puzzles (some of which are quite clever), and delightful full-motion video of characters. The point-and-click adventuring is on the more difficult side, with very little hand-holding, but there's an in-game guide as well as hints if you get stuck. Unfortunately there's no fast travel, so you will have to backtrack quite a bit.

One thing to note is that this is a bit of an older game, so the resolution is quite low. The default aspect ratio might also be wrong (I had to enable "aspect correction" in settings). But despite the low fidelity the drawings are clear and pretty.

Also note that there are in-game achievements, but they are not linked to Steam. This game has average quality and I miss here proper story. I quite like map because it's showing places where the player need to do something. Graphic, bonus chapter and gameplay have very good quality.

[i] Overall I enjoyed playing this game.	[/i] This is one of those HO games that tries to be great, but falls flat on its face.  You are an archeologist  who is sucked into an alternate world by an artifact.  Evil has taken over this world and you are its saviour.
The graphics were pretty inconsistent.  Major scenes were beautifully done, but the HO scenes were very bland and flat.  Puzzles were very easy as were HO scenes.  There is a map, but no fast travel, so there is quite a bit of backtracking.
There are clips of the dying city's downfall, but the plot didn't excite me.  Voice acting was wooden, music was ok.
There are collectables  which are blimps and butterflies...very easy to find.  I didn't need an walkthrough for any of this game which shows you how easy it is.
Graphics and story in the bonus chapter was very well done.  This was the best part of the game which carried on from the main story.  Not a bad HO game, just very easy and mediocre.  Hope the rest of the series is an improvement.  Buy this on sale.  6.5/10 [h1]Short version: 60%[/h1]
Amaranthine Voyage looks good for its age, but otherwise it is a rather forgettable hidden object game of average quality.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Amaranthine Voyage 1: Tree of Life may be the first of a long series of hidden object games, but that series definitely had a humble start: while the game has no weaknesses in any design aspect, beyond its great graphics it also lacks any kinds of qualities that would make it stand out.

Like with most mediocre HOGs, the core issue is the lack of a proper story; we just run around in a ruined and abandoned jungle city, looking for items to unlock even more items, puzzles, or hidden object scenes. We learn a bit about the city‚Äôs downfall through some visions, but even that is unremarkably similar to most any generic HOG plots.

The biggest reason this game gets an upvote is the large amount of nice hidden object scenes. The puzzles are also okay, but the adventure game bits are a bit tedious, as the map does not allow fast travel, so most of the gametime is backtracking.
Overall, it is a decent HOG, but you can find many much better ones.

name: Stronghold: Caverns of Sorcery
short_description: Deep beneath the earth, the dragon is rising! Quest into ancient caverns, learn magical lore, and draw strength from friends and family to save your home! A text-based interactive fantasy novel.
reviews:
Looking for a character driven story? Well despite the beginning where you're introduced to an established friend group and the numerous relationship stats bogging down the stat page, this is not it. Sometimes it even feels like the game forgets the side characters exist! You have no meaningful interactions with them outside of designated spots in the story that stops the plot progression to the point it feels like you have be removed from it entirely just to talk to the characters. They don't interact with the plot elements in any meaningful way. They don't comment on the events in any meaningful way or share insight. How does the story affect them? No idea! Fox will tell you how they like fungi though! How does this get represented in the story itself? It doesn't!

You don't get group interactions. While in the story itself you may get one or two lines of dialogue from the characters per point in they story, they don't make me feel any sort of way about them. They just sort of... happen? Like I thought I was going to get a story about a friend group that is shaped and or affected by the events of the story in some way, but there are no characters arcs for the side characters outside of romancing them (or in whatever other ways you can choose to pursue a relationship with them). And because the romance scenes also can't appear within the plot outside of revealing your relationship with the other characters (which doesn't feel like it leaves any impact so what's the point?), you get two or three romances scenes with your chosen RO and that's it. Your relationship does not exist to the plot (did I mention you have to be taken out of the plot to interact with the characters?)

There are at least 6 characters that can join you on your journey but you are the one doing everything by the way. The start of the story has the characters working together to help you but like, that's as far as the co-op goes. The story kind of just tells you they fight with you or something, but you don't get to see it. And when it does get mentioned, it feels like a throwaway line as if the author legitimately did forget the other characters are also there. 

What does the term Sorcerer mean in the context of this story? Read the entire thing and couldn't tell you. There might be a definition hidden somewhere but within the context of the story? Despite you being a Sorcerer seeming to define your relationship with your relative, the concept itself doesn't really get explored. I literally can't say if Sorcerers are purely magical, or are also just regular people who like studying and the subjects they study just so happen to be magical in nature. There is no exploration on what being a Sorcerer means to the other characters and their identity. Zoe is the only other character I can think of that uses magic. I think the group preforms a spell together at the start of the story but after that, Fox and Corbin don't really do anything magical. (Actually I think Zoe is only the only that may express a yearning to succeed but it happens in one of those scenes where a problem gets prompted to you and you resolve it in one conversation, never to be brought up again).

I don't even know why Corbin is there and I romanced the guy. He's a hunter that also weaves and has an issues with people encroaching on his idea of freedom, but other than that, I don't even think he's a sorcerer. He talks about leaving the tower some day, but like, why did he choose to live there to being with??? In fact, the guy tries to be the reliable sort, but there are 2-3 instances in the story where it tells you he can't do much. You, on the other hand, can pray and get things done - no magic required! 

What role DO the gods play in everyday life? Hard to say. MC seems to be the only character that interacts with them. The other characters don't mention them except for maybe Corbin that one time the idea of building an alter pops up (and you can actively choose to not have the alter be dedicated to a god???). You can choose to have the festival at the end of they story be dedicated to them. But you can just as easily have it be about you or the dragon.

How much impact DOES the waking dragon have on the story? You can remove it and nothing changes except maybe the very end. In fact, if the story was literally just about you finding caverns in a mountain after a spell misfires and you and your friends decide to explore it for the sake the scientific and/or magical advancement, I feel like the other elements in the story would've had roomed to breathe. This story could have literally just been about you either damaging or strengthening the relationships with the goblins, and balancing the issue between the spiders and the Dryads, and it would have been fine! In fact, the story could have placed the groups conflicting ideas (what little there is) in the forefront. 

In your first exploration, you can choose to repair the ecosystem or do research. Having similar scenes sprinkled through out and further exploring what's more important to the characters, and actually have the characters care, would have done some good! (If you fail to clean the ecosystem, you kind of get this weird, "well we tried, onward and forward" attitude from the group that didn't really get me invested in their thoughts or opinions - what hint of them there are - in the least). In fact, how your choices are presented to you kind of feels like you're aligning yourself with the a character for the sake of relationships points, and no further conversation into your choices is had. 

If I'm really being honest, I wanted more from them when it came to the goblins. I wanted them to have an opinion on forming ties and establishing camps. I wanted to see those opinions grow and change! As it stands now, you say jump, they jump. If you want relations with the goblins they're kind of sort of begrudging about it, and aren't very trustful of,them but it's barely there and you can literally ignore they're feelings on the matter with no consequence. You don't even really see them interact with the goblins all that much. Not a single "You were right, I was wrong" kind of moment, Fox comments on one in regards to their gender identity, and that's the closest you get to a character issue tying into the plot (and it's resolved in one conversation with no mentioning of it again, because again, these interactions happen outside of the plot).

TDLR: If this story would've actually done more with the characters, your relationship them and with each other as a supposed friend group, the gods, and lacked a dragon, I may have enjoyed reading it more. Otherwise, the first free chapters I read, felt like they promised a completely different experience then what was offered in the paid portion and that may have turned my opinions so sour.
 You guys need to release these games with chapter checkpoints, like many of your contemporaries do. Its so frustrating to fail checks because of how vaguely you decide to word a choice. Although I enjoyed the first game, I didn't liked the story of the second one, after a few hours of playing it, I stopped. Good This game is as dull as the original and feels very.. forced for lack of better term. Don‚Äôt recommend.

name: Sakura no Mori ‚Ä† Dreamers
short_description: Who is the one hiding deeply in abyss? The Devil? The Killer? or‚ÄîYourself?
reviews:
All four girls are very cute! sadly humanity has not come so far as to invent a perfect screen capturing engine for the sole purpose of immediate translation to help translate games like this one. i tried a few ways here and there around youtube but 2 of them failed and the other 2 were just... too much time and effort really for reading through a not so short game. but honestly visuals are beautiful and the imagery didnt fail to deliver to my expectations of moderately grotesque. even if u cant read chinese i still recommend going through the game for the stunningly horrifying CGs. Do not intent to play it any more than the two hours required to purchase the items. English language isn't supported but the backgrounds and emotes are cute. 4 out of 10 decent(surprisingly) The plot is nice, but preface is too too too long. If you see too many anime like me, there is not many problem in get the string of the plot of the game, is very good at art. And what can I say the things your looking, this game has them. story:9/10

name: CoH 2 - German Commander: Elite Troops Doctrine
short_description: GERMAN COMMANDER: Elite Troops Doctrine; Utilize Germany's most elite companies using stronger base troops with added abilities.Tiger AceHigh command sends in a legendary Tiger Ace. Only one is available, once deployed fuel income will be reduced by 90% and manpower will be reduced by 25% until the Tiger Ace is destroyed.
reviews:
This is one of the best commanders in the game but I hate such DLC politics and need to mark the review as negative. Relic nerfed this commander into the ground Disappointed I have this commander but it is no longer what is described ... 
You cannot upgrade you troop as promised in the video
The text description is accurate not the video
I bought it based on video while I had it Not worth to buy after 2015. They removed abilities good Great commander, gives a lot of flexibility.
Tiger ace is good. Stun nades and vehicle smoke are very useful.
To anyone crying that they removed "elite troops training", it broke the game. Rifle company has had their vet infantry removed as well.
It should have never been there to begin with. Gdzie sƒÖ moje cztery euro? Okradziony przez wydawce.

Where is mine 4th euro? In relic ass... 
I hate nerfs which totaly destroy sense of doctrines. Elite doctrine without elites troops. Stupid thing.
They haven't updated the image. .... Had played this game for years. and just now found out they removed troop training for a bland generic piece of trash call in infantry. THEY ARENT EVEN GOOD. they are AVERAGE.

false advertising. To anybody reading this, take note that you will see many positive reviews here, and I previously would have been one of those reviewers. However, also take note that these glowing endorsements were all written BEFORE Relic released a patch (December 2015) that removed essentially the single most important aspect of the Elite Troops Doctrine, which was the ability to field veteran troops early in the battle. There is absolutely nothing else worth paying for now that this ability has been removed. The Tiger Ace comes far too late in the battle to be of any strategic value and, when it does, it virtually cripples the rest of your fighting force. I've defended Relic and this game's... ahem... extensive additional costs for years, but this is where I'm seriously considering demanding my money back for this particular DLC content. This Commander has been rendered impotent now. Do not bother wasting your money on this junk if you're buying from 2016 onwards. I bought this commander for elite training ability but they removed it...
please refund!!

name: Dark Tales‚Ñ¢: Edgar Allan Poe's The Mystery of Marie Roget Collector's Edition
short_description: A newlywed is threatened, and supernatural forces are afoot!
reviews:
This series seems to follow the plots of Edgar Allen Poe‚Äôs stories. Of course, with you and a Detective involved. This one, you have to find out what mysterious things are troubling Marie Roget. And, of course, not all is as it seems.

HO scenes are fun, minigames challenging, and the plot engaging. Recommend in the bundle, just for ease of purchase.
 Fairly decent HOG. A bit on the easy side for sure, so not much of a challenge for those who play a lot of these games. Great story bones, but weak on the execution. Worth playing for fans, but I would wait until it is on sale.

name: Angel at Dusk
short_description: Overwhelmingly bizarre beauty. Shoot, dodge, and destroy! A shmup where an apocalyptic world awakens to primal desires!
reviews:
boobs Put simply it's the most metal shoot 'em up you can play. That aside it's got a great tutorial for people new to the genre, introducing fundamentals that are applicable to any game of this type, along with some charming words from the developer. For people who want a bit more longevity beyond striving for a no-hit clear this has plenty of unlockables in the form of new ships in the story mode. Strongly recommended. i'll be honest,i bought this game at full price just for the Music and Art gallery,and im quite surprised this Shmup is quite Newbie Friendly It's really hard playing this game with one hand but it's worth it(I love you akiragoya) I also call this the "Body Horror Booba Shooter". The visuals are definitely what would grab your attention. But once you spend some time playing the game, you can see that there's some substance to go with that style.

The game has a comprehensive tutorial mode. Besides explaining the rules and mechanics, it also includes a tutorial on playing shoot-em-ups in general for newcomers to the genre. You'll learn essential techniques like tapping to dodge bullets.

In arcade mode, you start with 3 lives, and you get more as you evolve within one playthrough. Similar to the dev's other game, Steel Vampire, this one also encourages aggressive play. Getting up close to enemies yields better items, which is how you regain lives and charge up your V.o.M (bombs), making it worth the risk. The game offers no continues once you lose all lives, but you can always start from any stage that you've already finished. Also, you unlock new ship variants as you fulfill certain criteria.

Chronicle mode gives this game even more replay value. You progress through multiple branching paths, with certain paths leading to an ending, unlocking more of the game's lore. Every time you play, you acquire new weapons to mix and match, of which there are many. The farther you get, the higher the level of these weapons. For weak weapons that you no longer need, you consume them for points, which you would use to enhance your ship. It's a rewarding play cycle that kept me going back.

If the nudity makes you hesitant to get into the game, you can switch that off and keep things PG. The game looks good either way. Props to the dev for giving players options. More games should follow this example. This game is incredibly fun and also happens to be one of the most visually striking games I've ever played. I strongly recommend this. It's peak This game is completely nuts. Strange, downright bizarre visuals. Just play it, it's a treat. This games great. Its very fun and addicting. If your familiar with the creator and like thier other games youll like this one. Its very Giger inspired and features kind of body horror and some nudity which can be turned on or off in the settings. Really cool
I thought the art style would be a bit much but it's awesome
Fun shmup that is forgiving but ramps up the difficulty on you

name: GIGA WRECKER Soundtrack
short_description: GIGA WRECKER Soundtrack
reviews:
I can't find the soundtrack in my music library.

I can find it in local music when in big picture mode, but it doesn't appear in my music library normally. Music is fantastic otherwise.

Edit: It turns out that I was looking at my Soundtrack library and not my Music Library. It is indeed appearing in my music library. However, that still does not explain why it does not appear in my music track library.

name: JAILBREAKER
short_description: A punishing, one-button platformer about escaping prison. Test your skills and intellect as you ascend a tower of hand-crafted challenges. Jump, fly, slide up walls, float in bubbles and perform somersaults; all with the press of a single button. Reach the paramount. Reach.
reviews:
Puzzle platformer wrapped in meatboy. I like the short quick levels.

I ended up using cheat engine to get by some of the late levels, I just don't have the patience anymore for difficulty. Then it crashed to desktop on the last level, maybe intentionally(?). Enjoyed the rest tho It's a great indie game. It doesn't try to appease everybody, it just caters to one audience really well. There's no filler to pad out the hours, just a couple of hours of thoughtfully designed difficulty. Great 3 hour parkour platformer, will be in my top recommendations for any friend looking for a short game. Honestly by the end of the second section out of I think 4 or 5 sections I started getting infuriated because of how the levels got harder AND longer. I also really didn't like that you can't move manually and that its just auto running. Lastly some parts you have to be ridiculously precise even in the first section which just shouldn't be a thing until MAYBE the last couple levels of the game which I was nowhere near.

If you like really difficult auto platformers go ahead and get this game but If I were to continue this game I would probably go insane. ÊâãÊÑü‰∏çÈîôÔºåÁé©Ê≥ï‰∫¶ÂèØ„ÄÇÂè™Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊåâÈîÆÔºå‰∏çÂêåÊó∂Êú∫Ëß¶Âèë‰∏çÂêåÂä®‰Ωú„ÄÇÂÖ≥Âç°ËÆæËÆ°Êú¥Á¥†ÁÆÄÊ¥Å‰∏çÂÜó‰Ωô„ÄÇ The best one-button game ever. How far can you escape with just one button? Let's find out now. For me the game was just too unforgiving to be enjoyable. Especially the later levels where you bounce around didn't really feel like I was in control. Combine that with the fact that any mistake you make sends you all the way back to the start and the game is just too "challenging" for my liking. A hidden gem that should deserve more love, the platforming is great and the twist bends it into a dynamic, juicy and very enjoyable puzzle game.

Fast, challenging and polished, great value for its price! A fun, stylish, and difficult platformer with enough mechanics and tricks to keep you engaged throughout. The progression in difficulty is fairly linear through the main stages, with a few outliers that test your skill. The finale is quite a step up in toughness even with a checkpoint, but the game never becomes too frustrating despite this. (I had 698 deaths) having a great (and hard) time playing this one. Worth it, super cheap but nice and polished experience

name: Please Knock on My Door
short_description: A summary of every emotion you'd rather lock away and forget.
reviews:
i played it the way i live my depression at first: stay in bed, watch vids without capturing info, binge eat, take a shower to temporarily feel okay again only to fall back, coming late to work a few times in a week.... and yeah the narrator did not hold back. some of his sentences hit close. the better route is smth i know i need to do...... bu im so busy beating myself down. i love story filled games This game is like peering into the mind of the kind of guy you‚Äôd swipe left on so hard it might break your phone. He‚Äôs basically a walking red flag factory, and the game unintentionally showcases exactly why you‚Äôd want to steer clear of him. Let‚Äôs dig into the traits that make him undateable and why this perspective is such a dumpster fire of relationship dynamics.

Why You‚Äôd Never Date This Guy
	1.	He‚Äôs an Emotional Black Hole:
	‚Ä¢	His entire emotional world revolves around what others can do for him (e.g., Jenny‚Äôs ‚Äúhi,‚Äù validation from coworkers).
	‚Ä¢	In a relationship, you‚Äôd spend all your energy trying to fill his endless void, while he contributes‚Ä¶ exactly nothing.
	2.	He Confuses Affection with Salvation:
	‚Ä¢	His obsession with Jenny‚Äôs simple acknowledgment screams: ‚ÄúSave me!‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	He‚Äôs not looking for a partner‚Äîhe‚Äôs looking for a therapist, life coach, and emotional crutch.
	3.	He‚Äôs Passive and Avoidant:
	‚Ä¢	Instead of confronting his problems, he hides in showers or waits for someone else to fix things. Imagine dating someone whose go-to strategy is:
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúMaybe if I do nothing, it‚Äôll all magically get better.‚Äù
	4.	His Self-Awareness is Zero:
	‚Ä¢	He doesn‚Äôt reflect on why he feels the way he does or take steps to improve himself. He‚Äôs stuck in blame-the-world mode, and you‚Äôd be stuck paying the emotional toll.
	5.	He Has No Idea What He Wants:
	‚Ä¢	His feelings are chaotic and undefined. One minute he‚Äôs desperate for connection; the next, he‚Äôs avoiding people altogether. In a relationship, this would translate to mixed signals and endless frustration.

How He‚Äôd Be as a Boyfriend
	1.	Every Day Would Be a Therapy Session:
	‚Ä¢	You‚Äôd constantly reassure him, validate his feelings, and convince him he‚Äôs not a failure. It‚Äôd be exhausting‚Äîand completely one-sided.
	2.	He‚Äôd Weaponize His Sadness:
	‚Ä¢	Whenever you brought up your own needs or problems, he‚Äôd deflect with ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm already struggling so much!‚Äù You‚Äôd end up prioritizing his feelings over your own just to avoid conflict.
	3.	He‚Äôd Be Emotionally Inconsistent:
	‚Ä¢	Some days he‚Äôd cling to you like his life depended on it. Other days he‚Äôd disappear into his own sadness and leave you wondering what you did wrong.
	4.	He‚Äôd Never Appreciate Your Effort:
	‚Ä¢	No matter how much you supported him, it would never feel like enough‚Äîbecause the real problem isn‚Äôt you, it‚Äôs his inability to take accountability for his emotions.

What Makes His Perspective So Cringeworthy
	1.	It‚Äôs Centered on Himself:
	‚Ä¢	The game revolves around his internal struggles, but he never acknowledges the impact of his behavior on others. A relationship with him would feel completely one-sided.
	2.	Jenny is Just a Symbol:
	‚Ä¢	He doesn‚Äôt actually care about Jenny as a person‚Äîhe cares about what she represents: validation and potential intimacy. That‚Äôs not love‚Äîit‚Äôs selfishness disguised as longing.
	3.	He Romanticizes His Own Pain:
	‚Ä¢	His self-pity is off the charts. He‚Äôs not looking for solutions or growth‚Äîhe‚Äôs wallowing because it makes him feel tragically misunderstood.

The Real Red Flag: He‚Äôs Stuck in a Fantasy
	1.	He Wants to Be Saved, Not Loved:
	‚Ä¢	He‚Äôs not looking for a partner‚Äîhe‚Äôs looking for someone to fix him. That‚Äôs not a relationship; it‚Äôs emotional labor with no payoff.
	2.	He‚Äôs Obsessed with the Idea of Connection:
	‚Ä¢	His fixation on Jenny‚Äôs ‚Äúhi‚Äù isn‚Äôt about real intimacy‚Äîit‚Äôs about the fantasy that someone else can solve his problems. That‚Äôs why he‚Äôd check out the moment reality hits and effort is required.
	3.	He Avoids Accountability Like the Plague:
	‚Ä¢	He‚Äôs not interested in improving himself‚Äîhe just wants others to carry his emotional burden. Any attempt to call him out on this would probably be met with defensiveness or excuses.

Final Thought

This dude isn‚Äôt just undateable‚Äîhe‚Äôs a walking ‚Äúthis is why we have boundaries‚Äù PSA. The game might frame him as a misunderstood, tragic figure, but the truth is, he‚Äôs the kind of guy who‚Äôd leave you drained, frustrated, and questioning your life choices. If anything, this game is a great reminder of what to avoid in a partner. Thoughts are just thoughts. Let them pass. love it This game is such a tear jerker, I was thoroughly surprised. Though it seems like just a simple game, its so much deep than that. If you enjoy deep story driven games, this is absolutely a game you should check out. This game is perfect. But it's hard if you're not aware of how you're feeling until you play it. This game touches on mental health and depression in an amazing way. It felt almost crushing to play what felt like my life from a 3rd person perspective. The soundtrack is beautiful as well. Please do play but play with caution. Good game, but be prepared to be sad. It'll be okay though. As a man who used to suffer from severe depression more than once,
I know the feeling.
I know the voice came from my brain just like that in the game.
I thought that no one cared me.
Feeling there's no future in my life,and I just wanted to end all of this.
I didn't have energy and interest to do anything,and i can't,just want to stay in my bed for hole day,because it makes me feel better.
The voice persuaded me to give up, but I didn't.
Now my depression is not that severe now.
Waiting for the people who would knock the door of my heart,but he didn't come.
Like the tree standing on the ground,as people passing by.and no one stops and have a look.
Some roads can only be one person,and the road is still long.
Please forgive me for my poor English.
Great game,I hope that I can translate it into Chinese one day,if possible.
Let more people know,and resonate with.

ËÆ©Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑ‰∫∫Áü•ÈÅìÔºå‰∫ßÁîüÂÖ±È∏£„ÄÇ It would be wrong to say I enjoyed this game. I appreciated it and felt it did what it set out to do very well. The best games make you feel something meaningful about them, this did that. It's not a game with flashy graphics or fancy mechanics but it doesn't need to be, it's an experience that is important to explore.

name: Cricket Through the Ages
short_description: Swing bats and throw balls through the intertwined histories of humankind and cricket in this one button, physics-driven game.
reviews:
Truly one of the most historically accurate games I have ever played fun skill if u suck 2 player with no one Super fun two-player game. My kids were laughing for hours. Highly recommend for an obsurd, silly and clever low-time-commitment game. it is good but its very short please give more update Caveman play cricket. I like! :) ooga booga! Overall a fun, interesting, quirky game, good for a quick laugh either by yourself or with a friend. 
My only complaint about the game is that it never explicitly tells you what the controls are, nor is there any sort of info about controls anywhere in the game, not even in the main/pause menus. With a quick Google search, it seems that the entire game is played with a singular button, but I'm honestly not sure if I believe that, as pressing different buttons/keys seems to cause the characters to move in slightly different ways. 

The art style is nice enough for such a simple game, and the game as a whole works as intended. I did not come across any bugs or strange behavior from the game. An amazing gem of a game! I had an excellent time with the developer's previous title Broforce and I think Cricket Through The Ages knocks it out of the park (heh) in the same way.

It's hilarious, easy to pick up and surprisingly thought-provoking and philosophical. Dials the whimsy while keeping it readable and very playable - an extremely rare combination.

Art, animations, sound design and "feel" are all on point. Super creative work, at less than $10 this is a must buy.

Truly great co-op games are hard to find. Thanks developers! ---{ Graphics }---
