name: HiddenFrog
short_description: Scale the tower and get back home as fast as you can!
reviews:
Very funny game, hope a sequel game gets made with co-op

Quick tip to get the higest jump possible, while running, turn left down at your feet and shoot right as you jump. This is due to the rocket coming out slightly to the right of the crosshair

[spoiler] And if you move right while in the air and shoot you hit yourself for infinite rocket jump [/spoiler] I think that there is a lot of promise but some of the game's core mechanics are just frustrating. I bought this game for me and a friend and we compared our experiences as we played through it. We concurred on every point. I would for sure recommend this game if the checkpoint system and the jump boost mechanics were altered a fair bit. Let me explain:

1. The checkpoints are single-use and have a very long timer cooldown. This is frustrating if you're a medium-ability player because (especially for reasons explained below) you can't predict how the mechanics of a jump might go, so you end up waiting for the checkpoint meter to refill because that saves you more time in the long run. It's frustrating for a low level player, because you have to keep resetting your checkpoints every time you fall off. It's frustrating for all players, becuase if you forget (froget?) to reset the checkpoint, dowwwwwwn you go again.

2. The jump boost mechanic is really unreliable. Both my friend and I concurred here too. It's very fiddly and you're never sure whether it will work. Hence, you loiter around waiting for your checkpoint meter to refill because you don't want to jump and risk resetting. Neither of us were in any way tempted by the time trial mode, as without checkpoints the unpredictable boost pads would ruin it every time.

But the game has some good points. It's got a very chilled out vibe, and depsite the frustration I never got properly mad at it or anything. I like the aesthetic and it's clearly somebody's labour of love. The core rocket jump game mechanic is pretty sound and I could quickly get into a rhythm when jumps didn't require boost pads. If the developer were to: a. fix the boost pads and b. overhaul the checkpoint system, perhaps by making checkpoints unlimited use and shaving a few seconds of the reset, or even just adding set checkpoints, I think this game has a lot of potential.

In short, I can't recommend this game (yet), but I did still make my friend play it too. Good effort developer; don't give up! First off, this is a rocket platformer. Not super obvious but thats what the game is. Second the jumps are almost IMPOSSIBLE, it took me 10 minutes to get onto the FIRST JUMP. This game is broken and horrible, youd be better off spending your 99 cents on a single bagel from target very simple but surprisingly addictive game, and its only 80c so i can definatly say its something fun to have in your library to play from time to time frog I would only this game because it is 89 cents and if you know how to "rocket jump" and want a platformer. However, spent about 10 minutes trying to get onto the first platform and only got up once. This game does not seem to be playtested. This is a unity game using seemingly built in assets,  it looks cheap but at least the feel of the character is decent.  
Everything you see on the screenshots in the store page is what you are going to get.


"Rocket Jump" is a term used to describe shooting a rocket at your feet to  jump further than you would be normally able to jump. I think there are games in the early 2000's that use this mechanic more prominently. If you have never done this yourself prior to this game, than this game is not the place to learn imo

name: Nature And Life - Drunk On Nectar
short_description: Animal Life Simulator! Live, Grow, Feed & Survive as Butterflies, Grasshopper, Praying Mantis, Jumping Spider, Parasitic Wasp and many more! Set in a beautiful procedurally generated micro-scale world for endless replay value. Birds, Reptiles, Mammals also coming soon!
reviews:
I love invertebrates and such, so just because of that this game is good enough for me. 

+ it recently got a new butterfly species I just.. I don't even know what to say, this game kind of blows my mind with the realistic lives, food webs, and life cycles that you and the AI have to engage in, in order to survive and thrive. . Masterpiece type game outside of a single gripe ill elaborate on later, 

The gameplay is rather pleasant if your looking for quality bug sims this is the go, 

it also has a map editor should you want to customise your experience, 

it has a bit more unique insects, though the gripe i have is it lacks moths, 

which a lovely commentor let me know would likely be remedied in future [even if distant], 

the game seems to have continued to get updates even after i first published this review on dec 26 2024, 

as such if you get this game you can expect to keep having more content to enjoy, 

which funnily enough other games cant claim such I'm gonna be completely honest, this game is pretty good. It has great graphics, great storylines, and beautiful animation. The unfortunate part is, that after a while of playing it; it tends to get very boring and dull; just the same thing over and over again. It is fun about the first ten times, though; so install it if you dare. its a good game needs a better tutorial though A great game, lots of insects eating eachother.

now to ACTUALLY talk about it, it's a survival experience where YOU get to play as the  tiny creatures you may step on and not notice, you get to see how they live and the struggles they go for, you get to learn [i] how [/i] it feels to be a spider, wasp, butterfly, or anything else really. this game has a future and i am lookin forward to it, its good i wish i could eat my mantis husband :(
otherwise good

name: Jardinains!
short_description: The world's favorite brick-breaking, 'nain-bouncing game is back!
reviews:
Fun game, reminds me of the old classic well enough. I could reeeeeally wish there was a way to make it not fullscreen (MacOS). As others have mentioned there are definitely some other QoL things that could be better, it feels like a real minimum release, but it looks like it hasn't seen an update since shortly after release. 

I'll give it a thumbs-up if you want the convenience of Steam, multiplatform, casual Breakout clone fun, but compared to a lot of other games it's hard to justify $15. i spent 15$ on this Good old hempy gnomes. The game needs some quality of life updates but still great. Very nostalgic. Really good game, just as fun as it was back then.
The only thing I would like to have added is a classic mode where you can play with the old graphics and soundtrack.
Jardinains 1 still has the best style and music and it would be cool if we could have that here too.

name: Late at night
short_description: This is a blasting game that fights beautiful girls, Dynamic characters, Exquisite style, Gently swing the mouse to damage the clothes !
reviews:
Don't Waste your time with this garbage :
There's no uncensor and DEVs never ever responded my tries to ask about uncensor pacth !

To tell the truth , this piece of junk is in dead state !

Just keep distance of this... I felt like a creep playing this game. Like I'm ambushing these girls in various situations. Ick.

It's rather annoying to have to constantly summon new jigsaw pieces instead of just having them all on the board. As is the lack of locking them in place when they're correct. It's a nice touch to see how oddly shaped pieces thrown in to mix things up a bit. And after that, you just drag the mouse rapidly across their clothing to see a 1 second looping animation and... that's all. Easy Achievements I guess. A puzzle game. Putting jigsaws together while listening to nice relaxing, music. 
Very short game with only 6 levels to play through. It's also super easy. 
The nudity is censored. Also, there's some really weird and uncomfortable moments throughout. You have to use your mouse to rip clothes off scantily clad women. Definitely not something you can choke your chicken to.. 
If you like decent music and jigsaws, buy it on sale for under ‚Ç¨1. 
4/10 meh! Simple big piece puzzle pieces.
No snap system.
Redundant  '+'  add puzzle button.
Silly drag, hold and swaying of mouse. 

Profile Features Limited.
Achievements and game progress not reflected on profile.

Cheap, Quick
Unless there are complimentary trade cards or backgrounds,

Junk. Small and cute puzzle. note: it's censored no sexual content Strange combination of VN & puzzle and mouse f4pp1ng . Unfortunately there are only 6 levels. Hmm, where is the adult nudity and Sexual content, all i see is spots in front of the adult part of the game hehehe!

So bidmei let me know where the Nudity and Sexual content is so I can change my Recommendation to positive :) 4/10 Late at Night is a realy good Game, its a puzzle game with beautiful Ladys, if you complete the Girls, you can fight with there clothes. *~*
You can play the Game with one hand, also take them off, late at night, and have a lot of fun with this Girls and your Unicorn hand. <3

name: Rojiura Glory Hole
short_description: „Ç™„Ç´„É´„ÉàÁ†îÁ©∂‰ºö„ÅÆÂÖàËº©„Å®ÂæåËº©„Åå„Ç™„Éê„Ç±„ÇíË¶ã„Å§„Åë„Çã„Åπ„ÅèÊ∑±Â§úÂæòÂæä„Åó„Å¶Â§ßÂ§â„Å™ÁõÆ„Å´ÈÅ≠„ÅÜ„Ç®„É≠„Ç≥„É°„Éá„Ç£„ÄÇ„Éï„É´„Éú„Ç§„ÇπÔºÜÁõÆ„Éë„ÉÅ„ÉªÂè£„Éë„ÇØ„Ç¢„Éã„É°„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÅÆBL„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÄÇ
reviews:
LOVED IT!!
It was SUUPER CUTE and funny! The game was a nice short play-through of 6hrs. However, you might find some triggers in it. 

First off, here's a game description, since the store page didn't add one in English:

Follow, the main characters Sanezawa senpai (MC) and his junior Aijima who attend meetings for a club named "The Local History Research Association" which is actually a front for an occult society that likes to study supernatural phenomena. It's an erotic paranormal bl comedy, that follows the two characters around the town on a hunt for a rumored Yokai. A Yokai that appears and traps it's prey, while also giving them a feeling like never before! ;) Curious about the rumored sightings of this Yokai that lures in men, and traps them in dark alleyways, the two set off on the town (if that's the choice you make first) in search of this Yokai entity.

NOW WARNING & Possible game spoilers as I explain: This game does include triggers such as [spoiler]Getting drunk in one scene, but nothing intimate happening other than a kiss, water-sports, (also known as urine kinks), Glory hole sex, exactly what the name involves (this occurs in a bad end) and could be considered dub-con/non-con depending on one's perspective, because although the MC seems to want it, and initiates it --hoping it will help him escape the Yokai's grasp...the MC is still trapped by the Yokai in the first place, and also appears to be under the Yokai's powers/spell (we also never see the Yokai either, just the Glory hole) Hence why it could be seen as non-con/dub-con.

For the other triggers, it's subtly hinting at death in the two bad ends (one is the MCs RO as MC goes back to his apartment, and RO never returns from his hunt for the Yokai), and the other is of the MC and the yokai. Also, the MC's backstory which involves non-con, but you don't play through it if that's of interest to know, it's him relaying what happened to him in his past and where he's at currently with feelings towards having sex back then and now.[/spoiler] 

I tried to put spoilers (it will be my first time adding spoilers on a review, so hopefully it works, and I'll try to fix it if it doesn't work the first time). I do recommend this game tho, it's not really dark in my opinion, it's more funny, lighthearted, and the good end was entirely consenting between the MC and his RO. Plus, super cute! Also, the longest route the game has to offer! Even the two bad ends weren't really that bad, tbh. 

It was a super easy play-through as well and not complicated which I loved about it. The graphics and art also great, but the NSFW scenes are censored with pixels btw. Also, I speak English and had to use a translator to play this game. Yup, btw, NOT AN ENGLISH based game, just an English review of it. Sorry to burst that bubble, if you were hopeful for a min, but this game DOES NOT HAVE ANY ENGLISH TRANSLATIONS as of right now.

You can however, play using a translator you like (I used Textractor, but there are many out there) to help you read the game in your own language (although with usually poor translations compared to a real professional one). But, my translator worked pretty well and it was enough to still buy, and enjoy playing this game! 100% recommend it!

So to summarize:
-Not an English translated game (yet, hopefully they make one in the future), I do believe the menu config screen had the options to play with Japanese or Chinese subtitles, but I just played it as it was.
-It does have some triggers for some people (I left those in spoilers just in case)
-Super cute, funny, and lighthearted
-Has full VA (excluding thoughts, narrative text and side characters), only for the main 2 characters, and during intimate scenes as well.
-Short game-play of 6.1hrs, but enjoyable nonetheless 
-Does include 2 NSFW scenes, 1 in a bad end, and you'll know it's a bad end when the end credits show up with a darker green background of sorts. And the other happy NSFW ending is the one between the MC and his RO. All NSFW is CENSORED, so just fyi in case anyone dislikes seeing pixel di***, lol.

And that's it! Hope this review helped for anyone looking to play it with a translator like I did, or for anyone in the future if they create an English translation! (btw if I have more than 6hrs logged, it's because I'm working on capturing text to make my own set of fan translations if I have time, so that it reads better, so no worries, it really is a 6hr play-through).

name: Europa Universalis IV: Fredman's Epistles
short_description: Bring the sounds of authentic European culture from the age of exploration to Europa Universalis IV with a collection of traditional Swedish songs from the 18th Century.
reviews:
finally some good fucking music This is the worst DLC I have ever purchased. buenardos temas This is unironically the second best music pack in the game, right after the Sabaton pack. If you're not jamming to Epistle 48, Solen glimmar blank och trind, then I don't know what will make you jam. Terrible [h1]This Is Why the Skip Button Was Invented[/h1]
[U][B]OR[/B][/U]
[h1]Beer-Battered Potato Gargling from Hell[/h1]

I bought this by mistake when I took advantage of a deep discount sale at Christmastime. Now I know why it was free with the rest of the music pack.

[B]DO NOT PLAY THE CACOPHONY NIGHTMARES IN THIS DLC IF YOU ARE SUICIDAL.[/B]

In this world, there are many, many bad songs. "F Your God", any lyrics written by "Rage Against the Machine" (the melodies are fine), almost all thug/gangster rap that calls for crime and blood and worse, and, of course, Katy Perry's "I Kissed a Girl and I Liked It". There's every song ever written by Rihanna that isn't "Please Don't Stop the Music" or "Bang Bang Into the Room", and Beyonce's hate and racism in some of her most recent "Black Supr-" sorry, "Black Power" works. Then there was that one time Taylor Swift tried to be relevant by mocking the entire Christian Church (and much of America) as halfwits that only oppose social liberalism (and a law that would persecute the Church) because they are weak, scared, and bred so close together that you can call them a Habsberg. That also includes, of course, every song by Lady Gag Gag that isn't the Rucka Rucka Ali parody of "Poker Face".

Everyone has songs they hate. They may even have artists whose work they hate.

Here with these legendary atrocities is this abomination. Were this "Epistle" an Epistle, I would have become an Atheist, possibly even a Muslim, as no righteous God could permit the absolutely nightmarish garbage that encompasses this album to be distributed to His followers in the Ancient Church.

Do you remember El Presidente, the villainous dictator from the beloved "Tropico" series? His gruff, masculine voice and Hispanic accent is pleasing to listen to and deeply immersive when he narrates stories and missions you have to accomplish.

Take El Presidente and get him ABSOLUTELY HAMMERED on rum, then shove a potato down his throat and demand that he scream and make noises with beer in his mouth. He will gargle the beer, choke on the potato, and produce noises somewhat better than this absolute trash.

The worst "Drunk El Presidente" potato choke-gargling screams are the songs "Gubbarna" (which is painful as the name suggests) and "Kaxraste Bradper", because whatever garbage excuse for a character set this beastial choking used in its title caused my poor Dixie computer to have an anyuerism. I speak and write English. I saw Unicode symbols, such as those that tell Microsoft Word what a page/paragraph break entails, this weird circle with an X through it (no doubt, Slenderman was trying to rescuse my poor, bleeding ears), and more. God knows what dark font that crap was covered in.

That doesn't even begin to remotely describe my unbridled hatred of the granddaddy of all abominable drunken, potato choking, beer gargling, repetitive screams on this torture device they call a series of "songs".

Enter "Movitz Ti Dina Pinnar". If Mikael Samuelson- a pox upon his career -was what was in the kitchen with Dina, I'm going to lay down my hammers and jump on the railroad, begging whatever train is coming all the live long day. No amount of soothing banjos can give me reprieve from the suffering of "Movitz Ti Dina Pinnar".

This one isn't even a song. Rihanna and her ilk put more effort into their melodies and back beat rythems than whatever this was supposed to be. It's a few notes in the background with everyone's favorite Carribean dictator shouting DUN DUN DUN DUN DUN, DUNE DUNE DUNE DUNE DUNE, RUNZ RUNZ RUNZ RUNZ. Do you think I am exaggerating? No. No I am not.

Have you had enough of this trash playing in your EU4 experience? Well, imagine having a little, old-fashioned 1024 X 786 monitor, that is only ever so slightly clipped at a 0.9% User Interface rendering, which makes everything just a little bit smaller than a normal eye can read. Do you know what is clipped? The music player. I cannot turn this off on my home PC.

[U][I][B]I actually turn off my speakers until the song stops.[/b][/I][/U]

This is the kind of crap that an unionized workforce produces, and Paradox knows its union thugs. It's like I asked the California Teacher's Union to make something that would make babies laugh. Except this won't make babies laugh. It sounds like the grunts and choking of something that eats babies.

I don't know whether or not I will be punished for writing this review, so please take my warning before you accidentally purchase every "Europa Universalis IV" soundtrack at once, witrhout sorting through what it comes with.

Nothing will ever spare you from this abomination. The CIA should purchase this entire album to use as sensory torture and sleep deprivation equipment against ISIL terrorists being held in some spook's black site. Or Guantanamo.

I finally tracked down where those fasting choking noises. The only reason I am not filing a request to Valve to permanently remove this album from my library is because I need to retain it in order to warn you just how bad these songs are.

I was playing as Albania and the Ottomans conquered me early on. I thankfully took Colonial Ideas really early and escaped to New Orleans, where I would spend the next three centuries expanding until Theodoro, who was similarly thrown out of the Old World but managed to miraculously colonize the south of what is today Texas. Well, that Theodoro government-in-exile mutated into Texas. Everything is bigger in Texas, including the absolute ROFL-stomping the Texan Gothics gave me in the late half of the eighteenth century. I lost my capital of over three centuries and every state in Dixie except for Georgia and Alabama, who had their topmost clay shaved off by the Texan Goths.

 In symbolism for the losing of all of my state's heartland, I finally lowered the ancient double eagle flag of Albania and became Florida. These songs came on, and I realized that this was the twilight of my legendary run. I knew, though, that being violated by Texas was more pleasurable than the soundtrack to which my entire empire crumbled.

God help you if you accidentally download this. No one would PURPOSELY want this stuff.

These songs make no sense, they are loud and obnoxious, they are mostly tongue rolling, screams, and grunts, and they break both muh immersion and the otherwise smooth EU4 experience. These songs, so terrible they are, will interrupt your EU4 play through and make you PHYSICALLY ANGRY. The most essential DLC to Europa Universalis IV, literally unplayable without it. The game wouldn't be the same without it If you're Swedish, buy this for fuck sake. The songs are lit. These songs are both delightful and my absolute favorites in the songtrack.  They are authentic sounding by an extremely skilled, classically trained vocalist who has a bit of fun playing along in a role as a drunken peasant.  Every time one of these songs comes up, it brightens my playthrough.

I can understand why some might not like the songs, but they are wonderful and appropriate.  Far more appropriate than some pieces that intrude into inappropriate time periods, these folk-type songs fit any century.

name: KOF XV DLC Character "HINAKO SHIJO"
short_description: [Product Contents]"HINAKO SHIJO" can be used in THE KING OF FIGHTERS XV.
reviews: Minimum wage waitress gets tired of living off of tips and started beating the shit out of her customers. She would fit right in at a Waffle House. this is the greatest dlc ever made ever since I bought Hinako, I found a wife, graduated with a PhD, bought a small house, and live with our lovely plants, thanks HINAKO! Step aside E Honda. Hinako is best sumo wrestler.

name: Telling Lies
short_description: Four private lives. One big lie. Search through secretly recorded video conversations to discover the truth. The successor to the acclaimed Her Story.
reviews:
[i]Telling Lies[/i] definitely represents an upwards trajectory for Sam Barlow from the [i]Her Story[/i] days in terms of scope and ambition. I suppose that comparisons between this game and both its predecessor and successor ([i]Immortality[/i]) are unavoidable, both because of Barlow's unique style and also because there aren't that many decent FMVs out there.

The reviews are very mixed, and I think I can get why: the story itself is less riveting than either [i]Her Story[/i]'s or [i]Immortality[/i]'s (it's also possible that I was just unlucky to get very important videos in my first two hours of play and connected the dots together quickly), and the gameplay suffers from endless mandatory manual rewinding which in the end probably accounts for a couple wasted hours.
Personally, I was able to make abstraction of that problem to focus on the interpersonal drama that's the heart of [i]Telling Lies[/i]. I do think the game does a very good job of showing the complexity of the relationships between the characters: Barlow writes women in particular, in a way that is consistently engaging, and I really loved all three actresses here.

Basically, this is not a Must Play game, but if you have tried other FMVs and enjoyed them, I think [i]Telling Lies[/i] is one of the stronger games of the genre. Although it is more for the completionists, and if you want to only play one Barlow game, I'll advise to try [i]Immortality[/i] instead. Loved the tag system here and the way you search keywords to unlock new media. 

Really good FMV game. Telling Lies was a totally unique and immersive experience‚Äîmy first time playing a game like this, and I really enjoyed it. The acting was phenomenal and the story was incredibly engaging. I loved piecing together the narrative through video clips, even though I wish the game had been a bit clearer about its objective from the start. The rewind and fast-forward mechanics felt a little clunky, especially how long it took to rewind. I also would‚Äôve liked the option to view all three endings at the end instead of just one. Still, it was a compelling and memorable game that I‚Äôd definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys story-driven experiences. The only engaging part of this game is figuring out it was based on real events. However, the gameplay, which barely exists, is so garbage it undermines the entire thing. This is BRUTAL. Her Story, Immortality, FMV games in general are a favorite of mine. This game having such long videos, with the longest most boring pauses makes it an absolute chore to play. I got it on sale for $5 and I still don't think it is worth it at that price. I didn't make it far enough to know what the mystery could be and I'm not confident I'll ever be able to. I got the game after playing Her Story and loving it. Unfortunately, Telling Lies didn‚Äôt leave the same impression.

I played the game just like Her Story‚Äîtogether with my wife. I was operating the game, while she was taking notes and directing searches.

One issue was the length of the videos. Previously, they lasted up to a minute, but now the clips can drag on for 10 minutes! Also, many videos have two versions‚Äîshowing two people talking, but in each clip, we hear just one side of the conversation. This disrupts the careful balance between watching and playing that Her Story nailed perfectly.

The main plot didn‚Äôt really resonate with me. In first few hours, you pretty much understand the role the guy played in the lives of the three women. As far as I can tell, there are no sudden twists or turns to shake things up or change your opinion. You just gradually uncover more details without stumbling upon anything truly gripping.

Another thing is that having a sex worker as one of the main characters didn't exactly help pique my wife's interest in the game. 4/10 Bottom line up front: The UI/navigation in this game can sour it for many people; it didn't for me. If you like other Sam Barlow/Half Mermaid games then give this a try (you can always refund it w/in Steam's restrictions). I let the negative reviews on account of the UI/navigation steer me away from this for a long time and I now regret that. It is phenomenal.

The review proper: 'Telling Lies' adopts a very similar gameplay experience as its predecessor, 'Her Story': type a word or phrase into a database search box, watch a clip, use info in that clip to inform future search queries, and unravel a mystery all while doing so. (If you have not played 'Her Story,' I strongly recommend doing so before purchasing this game; it is slightly simpler but will act as a good litmus test for whether 'Telling Lies' will jive with you.) The story is much stronger in 'Telling Lies,' if only because you engage with a greater number of characters (roughly four main ones). By the time one reaches the end of the game (having watched such-and-such many videos, including certain key ones) they are suffused with the narrative's themes, subtext, and irony. It is a slow burn, but one well worth enduring. Fortunately, Water is Life.

The black eye on this game, as most negative reviews single out, involves how one navigates the videos. Unlike 'Her Story,' most of 'Telling Lies' 's videos come from two-way FaceTime-style calls. That means some videos will have minutes-long breaks of silence from one party, indicating its complementary video to involve someone else talking for that time. The game allows for fast-forwarding and rewinding, but the maximum speed at which one can do so can still be painfully slow in many cases. When choosing a video to play it will start at the time during which the relevant word the player searched is tokened by its speaker. In a 9-minute video whose search term appears at the end, rewinding to the beginning at max speed can take minutes. Even if patience is a virtue, in gaming and in life, no virtuous person enjoys spending minutes at a time rewinding a video.

Some have suggested that it would have been useful to have a synchronization function that, once one has identified a correct video-pair, they can synchronize them in order to watch both simultaneously and experience the conversation in real-time, rather than trying to piece it together by going back and forth between the clips. I can't say I disagree, but I wouldn't say this would necessarily make for a better game, just a different one. The lack of such a function didn't bother me in my playthrough. And one can always watch YouTube videos of the completed video pairs afterwards.

Overall, I strongly recommend this game for fans of Barlow/Half Mermaid's other FMV titles. Do not let the negative reviews stop you from at least trying it. I have to say no, because the core of gameplay goes to show the devs have NO talent. You need a mod to have decent control of the video player. Seeing as this is the core of gameplay...it fails.

Nothing else about the game matters. Scrolling through without a mod is painful. The story starts out interesting but becomes a lazy trope quickly. The ending is modern trash, about forgetting the part of your past that is inconvenient.

This game is forgettable trash, made by a team that has no concept of what makes good game play. After 44 years of playing games...this is a stinker. A compelling premise ruined by a terrible control scheme.

The gimmick is that you're searching videos via words in their subtitles.  The problem is, there is no button to go to the front of the clip.  You have to manually rewind it at a maximum of 3x speed.  But there's more! These are local copies of Skype calls, meaning you'll need to piece videos together based on their overlap to get the whole conversation.  Which means you will spend roughly 50% of your in-game time watching videos rewind at 3x speed.

There is allegedly a mod that adds a few controls, but it's not on ModDB or NexusMods.  After 45 minutes, I gave up.

Skip this one.  Her Story and Immortality are both better.

name: Star Realms - Cosmic Gambit
short_description: The expansion contains 19 cards that you can use in online play, versus the AI or a friend, or in the 11th and 12th chapters of the campaign.
reviews:
Yet more trash gambit cards that completely unbalance the game from turn 1
If you are going to avoid any DLC, let it be these gambit ones. This expansion sucks. Gambits will quite often scewer the game heavily in one players favor, from the very beginning. In a game where the luck of the draw, is already a big factor, this expansion will actively break the game. Eeeeehhh ... okay, the only reason to get Cosmic Gambits in the digital is for everything [i]other[/i] than the gambits. The year two promo cards are phenominal. I'm especially a fan of the additions to Trade Fed. Since WWG doesn't seem to want to tell you what you're buying, see below for the new ships. Also, as far as I can tell, it adds 2 new ships per faction, not 1 base + 1 ship as advertised.

Explanation: T=Trade, HP=Authority/Health/Whatever, C=Combat
- Unaligned: [b]Merc Battlecruiser:[/b] 6-cost; pick-your-faction with Draw 1
- Trade Fed: [b]Federal Transport: [/b]2-cost; 1T 5HP, faction +2T <- my favorite here, a great inclusion to any deck
- Trade Fed: [b]Security Craft:[/b] 4-cost; 4C 3HP, faction +3T
- Trade Fed: [b]Bounty Hunter:[/b] 5-cost; 7C, faction +5HP
- Star Empire: [b]Imperial Smuggler:[/b] 2-cost; 3C and [i]Draw a card, then discard a card.[/i]; scrap +2T
- Star Empire: [b]Knightstar:[/b] 5-cost; 6C, and [i]if opponent has a base in play, gain an additional 3C[/i]; scrap Draw 1
- Blob: [b]War Kite:[/b] 2-cost; 5C; scrap to destroy target base.
- Blob: [b]Stellar Ray:[/b] 5-cost; 3C, Draw 1; scrap +6C
- Machine Cult: [b]Probe Bot:[/b] 1T, scrap 1; faction Draw 1; scrap +3C <- [i]possibly the best low-cost scrapper in the game at this point. Some trade, draw, AND self-scrap when no longer needed![/i] 
- Machine Cult: [b]Cargo Mech:[/b] 5-cost; 4T, scrap 1; faction Destroy Base

Gambits are nice; in the physical card game, I love using them in a draft-pick system, where player 1 picks one, player two picks 2, then player 1 picks his second; after the match (if playing more than one), remove the 4 chosen gambits from the pool for the next draft pick (to prevent repetition).

Same as with the previous gambits in this set, though, you're stuck with the bland 2-at-random base mechanic, which sucks and often leaves one player possibly feeling helpless.

Some of the gambits are a huge departure from the previous set though, which is nice. The one that lets your vipers do +2C actually makes vipers useful throughout the game. There are a couple in there that let you scrap early on, which gives you a massive advantage over the one who doesn't have it. Scrap both my vipers on turn 1? Yes, please.

However, I've noticed that a couple of the gambits in the digital version are gimped compared to their physical counterparts. And, I realized that it's because WWG didn't actually code in a persistant scrap heap, or the ability to add cards to the trade lineup. 

Compare:

[Physical] Black Market: Add an additional space to the trade row above Black Market. Once per turn, the player who revealed Black Market may acquire a card from this space for one less than its trade cost. Otherwise, it functions as a normal trade row space for all players.

With:

[Digital] Black Market: Scrap: Choose a faction. This turn, all cards of that faction cost 1T less than normal.

And compare:

[Physical] Triumphant Return: Scrap to Draw 1; When you reveal this Gambit, you may pay the cost of a card in the scrap heap and put it into your hand. (Scouts and Vipers cost 0)

With:

[Digital] Triumphant Return: Scrap: Pay the cost of a card in your discard pile to put it into your hand. (Scouts and Vipers cost 0).

So yeah, I am underwhelmed with the gambits themselves. Get the set for the ships, though.

name: Dynamic Very, Very, Hard game!!
short_description: Dynamic is an indie Platformer game. The goal is to try to avoid obstacles and dangerous enemies who want to kill you
reviews:
[h2]Dynamic[/h2]

Has a total of [b]5[/b] trading cards. You get what you pay for with this one. For a game priced at 70 cents, I didn‚Äôt expect much, but even then, it's disappointing. The gameplay feels shallow, and the level design lacks any real logic or purpose. It feels like the developers threw random elements together without much thought. Overall, it's hard to find any redeeming qualities. Retro 16-bit graphics that look decent, and a platform experience that emphasizes challenge and hard difficulty.

Does not work well in ultrawidescreen monitors, even if windowed, as the game cuts off the top and bottom part of the screen, and making thus the game unplayable in most situations.

Terrible controls, and even worse UI, restarting on death - which will occur a lot - requires manually clicking on a restart button.

Music is the same track looping over and over, and gets tedious extremely quickly.

The game is definitely not worth its full asking price. At a steep discount or for free, could be passable, but there are plenty of better alternatives in the Steam Store. 4/10 I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

‚†Ñ‚†ò‚¢∑‚°≥‚£æ‚£∑‚£∂‚£∂‚£∂‚£∂‚£∂‚£æ‚£ø‚£ø‚¢Ä‚£∂‚£∂‚£∂‚£æ‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚†á‚†Ñ
‚†Ñ‚†Ñ‚†à‚£µ‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚¢∏‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚†Ñ‚†Ñ
‚†Ñ‚†Ñ‚†Ñ‚†∏‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚†ò‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚†á‚†Ñ‚†Ñ Very, Very, Hard game, I find myself having mixed feelings about this game. On one hand, the game can be very challenging and requires a lot of strategic thinking to progress through the levels. The game mechanics are also interesting and keep you engaged with its fast-paced action.

However, there are some downsides to the game as well. For starters, the difficulty level can be frustratingly high, and it may take multiple attempts to succeed at a particular stage. This may turn off some players who are looking for more casual gameplay.

Additionally, the game's graphics and sound effects are not particularly impressive, which may be a letdown for players who prefer games with more polished visuals and sounds.

That being said, the game does have some redeeming qualities. The game's skilled-based nature makes it all the more satisfying when you finally succeed, and the game modes offer a variety of different gameplay experiences to explore.

Overall, Dynamic Very, Very, Hard game is a decent game that is worth giving a try if you're looking for a challenge. However, the game's high difficulty level and lackluster graphics may not be suitable for everyone's taste. Outside of getting it for the trading cards I wouldn't recommend this game. Controls are wonky being the biggest issue.
 Bro... "good" idea but horribly made. Bad collisions, bad level design, levels that are easier than the ones before, some things just don't work (like the final door of red forest). I think that if this game was free, it would be kinda acceptable, but it isn't.
Fix this game or explain to me why this game is worth. They say this game is very hard. The most difficult part about it must be not asking for a refund. Reviews are mostly negative, don't know why I have the game, or how I got it. Screenshots are not appealing to me.

name: Redemption Cemetery: Salvation of the Lost Collector's Edition
short_description: Escape from a mystical cemetery!
reviews:
You can play with a sweet puppy 10/10 :3 This game took me 7 1/2 hours to play including the bonus game.  Good story, good graphics, enjoyable puzzles.  I will soon play the other Redemption Cemetery games. This game follows the same plot of getting locked in the cemetery. You have to set right the wrongs so the lost souls can find peace before you may leave. Another excellently put together story. This game has not only an map it also has a strategy guide (which can be handy).  The letter from the developers is, I think a very nice touch.(thank you devs) The bonus game takes up right where the main story leaves off. The puppy games are cute and can also give you some practice if you so desire. I enjoyed the game immensely. Thanx fair story, graphics are dreamy, long game. [b]Redemption Cemetery 4: Salvation of the Lost[/b] (IHOG)
[i]As always, this is a standalone storyline.[/i]

Your dog is being held for ransom.  The payment for release?  Free three suffering souls!  

Options include separate sliders for Music, Sound and Voices, Full-screen, Widescreen and Custom Cursor.  Choice of Regular, Advanced or Soul Savior Mode, which can be changed at any time.

[b]Story[/b]:

On the way home one night, you suddenly realize that the subway is not making its usual stops, and there's something strange about the passengers... The end of the line, a cemetery where a corporeal spirit takes your beloved cocker spaniel as a hostage in order to gain your assistance.  Help three lost souls find peace, and you and your dog are free to go.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1824508063
Our [b]Journal[/b] tracks the story, per usual, but we also have a [b]Facts[/b] tab, which stores the interesting educational tidbits that we find as we play.

[b]Gameplay[/b]:

Be on the lookout for [b]collectible medals[/b], although they're pretty hard to miss. ;)

You have been given a [b]raven[/b] to assist you in your quest.  This raven will gain the power of the elements as you progress in the game, allowing it to help you with things you'd normally need a tool for... If you were able to accomplish these things at all!  You will need to charge each power (by doing a mini-game) before it can be used, but you will get multiple uses per charge.

Inventory items with a + sign can be combined with other items - just drag and drop one on top of the other.

The [b]MAP[/b] can be interactive, and has insta-transport available.  Directional [b]HINTS[/b] are also available.

We have two types of [b]Hidden Object Scenes[/b]: Lightly-interactive find-by-list, and highly-interactive silhouette puzzles.  HOS repeat, but items you found the first time there will stay gone.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1824631041
Mini-games vary in difficulty, but are generally neither too hard nor too easy.

[b]Sights and Sounds[/b]:

The voices are pretty well done for a casual title, and the rest of the sound work was nicely-suited to the game.  The graphics progressively got more and more beautiful as I progressed, 'til it seemed like I was screenshotting every scene. lol~  Each mini-story is perfectly-represented so as to keep you immersed in the story.  It's really hard to choose a favorite, but I'll go with this one:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1824631145
[b]CE Content[/b]:
[list]
[*]Integrated Strategy Guide
[*]Bonus Chapter
[*]20 Collectible Medals*
[*]13 Wallpapers
[*]21 Concept Art
[*]7 Screen Savers
[*]4 Music Tracks (can be saved)
[*]23 Replayable Puzzles
[*]11 Replayable HOS
[*]24 Cutscenes
[/list]
*Find four sets five of medals to unlock mini-games in the puppy's bonus section.  Each of the four minis has at least one trophy that you can earn for playing them.  They are: Mini-mosaic puzzles, Tic-tac-toe, Memory card-matching and "Paws and tails", which is memorizing the order in which your puppy moves limbs and ears.

[b]Bonus Chapter[/b]:

We have a clear and satisfying ending to the main game, but the extra chapter continues the story just a little longer.  A demon is trying to break into our world, and your help is needed to stop it.

The gameplay is solid - just as good as in the main game - and I might have enjoyed it even more.

[b]Verdict[/b]:

The elemental power of the raven added a nice depth to the gameplay, and I enjoyed all four of the stories.  The built-in breaking points between stories is great for when you have a limited amount of time to play, each story lasting about an hour.  The puppy mini-games added an additional 30 minutes to my gametime.

It was such a pleasure to play this game, I just found it to be really fun.  It seems like every game that I play in the series is more and more enjoyable. Recommended! Recommend... for the most part.

Pros
.Striking artwork/graphics/scenes
.Beautiful music
.Choice of three difficulty levels
.Mini-map with fast travel
.Areas check-marked on map when completed
.Lockable toolbar
.Simple to intricate adventure play
.Three types of hidden object scenes
.Reuse of hidden object scenes was well done
.Entertaining mini-puzzles
.Bonus chapter
.Average length

Cons
.Story made no sense on any level
.No atmosphere
.No indication when objects in correct position for possible use

Final opinion (7.5/10):
I really enjoyed the music, adventure play, hidden object scenes and mini-puzzles and can recommend the game without reservation on the basis of those things.  But I am not really a fan of the game overall.  I expected a game with cemetery in the name and about ghosts to take place in a cemetery and be, spooky, if not actually scary.  Instead the cemetery was simply the base of operations and the action took place at a sun-washed zoo, a sterile power plant and then a pretty moon-lit village in the middle ages, and none of it was the least bit spooky, let alone scary.  Also the 'redemption' made no sense as I did all the work so they earned nothing.  Worse, my interference creates a time paradox, rending the story even more illogical.  And the whole puppy award thing was more appropriate for children.  So it wasn't really for me but might be for you. Part of a series, this continuation is on par with the others.
A bit on the simplistic side, with some puzzles thrown in with the usual hidden object games, if you're intermediate and above, this will be a quick game. It has some extras thrown in... Games to play with your dog if you complete all the puzzles and find all the little dog metals. Concept art, wall papers, stuff like that.
All in all, it's a nice little addition to the series but not something one would strain their brain on. This is definitely an older hidden object game, but not an OLD one. The interface is a tiny bit clunky but solid in function, and the plot is . . honestly refreshingly simple and straightforward.  You're in this to save your dog. There's cute extra goodies, and decent puzzles. Taking a subway late can lead to interesting places or be a meeting place for mysterious people. The three users with you seemed to come from another times and only you and your dog seem to be real, as when arriving to a cemetary, the persons became ghosts. Hina, the keeper of the place, kidnaps your dog, only for you to help these ghosts to find peace by changing the outcomes of the events tormenting them: a gone too soon journalist, a dam worker left behind and a falsely accused of witchcraft young woman...

I must say that it's probably one of the rare casual adventure games without a precise villain. Hina, the keeper, is a kind spirit, your dog is just kidnapped for making sure that you'll help her and the ghosts, lamenting themselves and feeling responsible for the death of others (though the zookeeper is the only one that wasn't driven by selfish reasons and could have save the journalist if only these keys weren't stolen). In fact, the enemies are mainly in these events and are merely humans, none being of supernatural nature. If you want to find the latter, it's in the bonus chapter, set after the main story.

I liked being sent in time and save the life of those who shouldn't have died, tormenting souls for eternity as they're regretting their choices (but again, the zookeeper felt guilty as he was a genuine man that did everything he could but it wasn't enough, I'm pretty sure that given the storyline, you'll be agreeing that he shouldn't have  be in this limbo).

The gameplay is quite the standard one for that kind of games: find items, combine them, use them, solve puzzles and clear hidden objects scenes (list of objects or find objects of the same type). I'm rarely negative for that aspect, however, here, I feel that I should perhaps warn you about some puzzles being long and kinda frustrating or that some hidden objects scenes are just annoying.

The graphics are nice and the soundtrack fits really in the game.

Yet, I was a little disappointed by this game, maybe because I was imagining something else or because I was expecting something else from ERS or because having added its profile to Neoseeker (and the whole series), I misunderstood the concept behind Redemption Cemetery (unless Salvation of the Lost was softer than the other games, as I didn't play them).

The good surprise is probably the letter let by ERS for the gamers and the puppy's room, where you can play with the puppy, if you find medals scattered in the game. It's also the only place where you'll find "achievements". The rest of the bonus are just classic: music, movies, wallpapers, minigames, concept arts, etc..

Should you buy the game? I would say that better games of the same genre are outside. However, it's still enjoyable if you don't encounter the same crash I had on Windows 7, making me switch to Windows 8.1 where it ran perfectly. However, while the price is kinda something normal for Big Fish Games, I would still advise you to buy it when there is a discount. soooooooo gooooooddddddddddddd good real good check it out.

name: Dragon Lapis
genres: Adventure, Casual, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy
short_description: The dawn of a new hero! A tale spanning a thousand years now begins to unfold!
reviews:
Excellent sequel!  Expanded and improved in nearly every way over Dragon Sinker.  This series has won my heart, and deserves attention from any classic JRPG fan. not my first choice for a kemco rpg, or even the dragon series. it's fairly bare bones and has this fomo inducing stat system similar to ff10.  That said it's still enjoyable. just odd the formula regressed since sinker and prana Dragon Lapis, an pixelated light JRPG. It's like playing one on the GBC....but without the depth.
You get your party of 4 and (the biggest pro) can change Jobs. To master said Jobs you must find Job-plates and than gain special points to full those plates (for each Job you'll need many many plates).

Now that is the selling point for this game and also his biggest weakness.
You see to gain points you'll need grinding excessive grinding.
In fact there are 2 ways to play this game:
a) forget about the Jobs and play a real JRPG.
b) do the Jobs and the associated 2 extra dungeons and the rest of the game is like a walking sim.....I played on Hard and finished the last opponent with 1 Hit.

The gameplay is very straightforward. You must defeat and evil and visit several dungeons. Each consist of several levels.
No secrets and encounter every few steps. Even with normal play you'll reach the highest level (99) before the endgame.
Like most of Exe games there is a normal end and if you continue playing you reach the Happy Ending. This time it is only
one short extra dungeon.

So can I recommend this game.....It has is flaws but still it was funny. dragon warrior nostalgia, I recommend the game if you're able to get it with a 35-50% discount Great RPG. Another serviceable entry by the KEMCO team.  Dragon Lapis is a straight-foward retro JRPG.  

Pros: The job system is well-implemented with growth plates giving you real control over how each character develops, making progression satisfying.  There are two sorts of in game currency, gold and lapis.  Lapis gives you the option to purchase items that significantly increase your power, if you so choose.

Cons: Other than the job system, there isn't a lot of depth here, which is unfortunate because the job system would support it.  For example, monsters mostly lack strengths, weaknesses, or immunity.  There are no found items outside treasure chests - which seemed like an obvious mechanic for thieves and merchants.  No crafting to speak of.  The game is also quite easy, even on hard mode.

Recommendations:  Get it on sale.  Its plays well enough it can hook you, which says a lot more than many throw-back JRPGs, so it is worth buying.  Play it on hard mode and stay out of the lapis store if you want a meaningful challenge (doing this will force you to spend skill points carefully as they're otherwise slow to earn).

Edit:  Changing to not recommend. 

There is endgame content that makes lapis store purchases effectively necessary for completion.  Lapis is earned in game, not purchased so its not pay-to-win, at least not with real-world currency.  

Overall, this game just isn't balanced very well.  The main game is way too easy relative to the progression system - the developers really need to start paying more attention to this as it doesn't do justice to otherwise solid work.  Unfortunately, this is EXE-Creates MO - they have some good ideas, but don't take the time to flesh any of them out.  Would be curious to see what the team could do if given the time to really complete one of their games.  This game has an inspired job system, for a throw-back JRPG, that is begging for a more complete game to be built around it.  But that's about it. Very excellent game!! There's two ways to getting your stats up. Through regular fighting and the growth plate system. The growth plate system is very vital to getting your stats up as well and via the growth plate system it can help your stats go into the five digit range with your HP being capped at 99,999 even though  the max party level is only 99. Excellent story as well along with hilarious  dialogue. Definitely worth buying!!

name: Too Much Water
short_description: Too Much Water is a top-down castaway simulator with an exquisite "splash" of humour, and a captivating story.
reviews: NOT ENOUGH WATER :((

name: The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki -Farewell, O Zemuria-
short_description: The latest installment in the popular story-driven Kiseki RPG series is here! The 20th-anniversary title, The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki -Farewell, O Zemuria-, where the epic story of the continent of Zemuria takes a dramatic turn, is now available on Steam¬Æ!
reviews:
peak. peak fiction its peak bros
 I'm not gonna lie when I say I have mixed feelings on Kuro 2 so I was a bit burnt out after I played that on 2023. However, when they showed Kai information and then more news came up the months after, my hype for the series was slowly reignited and then release date came. After a month or two of release, I have heard great things about the game and I was looking forward to seeing what lies in store within it.

Needless to say, Peak fiction. This is the type of game in the series that I've been waiting for where it answers a lot of the series mysteries while still delivering great character moments. Music is still a mixed bag where the highs are really high and then some songs are just uninspired but it's a great improvement overall from the previous Calvard games. This game is a treat for longtime fans especially to people who started the series since Sky FC and followed the japanese release order.

I dare say that this is one of the best games in the series and maybe even one of Falcom's best too.

Anyway, with all that out of the way:


AGNEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEES 104 hours
1200+ screenshots
mythical game
peak fiction

I don't think I will experience another game like this in my entire life man... top 3 Holy cow, did we need a  game like this one in the Kiseki series, something that takes a big leap forward in the overarching story. I finally get to sit through a trademarked Kondo cliffhanger and I'm all about it, next game will be the best in the series up to date, and this one makes it to top 3 ez. Prepare to cry.
 I've played every game in the entire series up to now, and while I've always been a little disappointed by some elements of the storytelling, especially the complete lack of accountability for the bad guys, ultimately I've developed an incredible fondness and empathy for the main characters and their friendships and faithfulness for each other has been a source of refreshment and enjoyment for me.

For the first time ever I have zero desire to play a new game plus and dive deeper in.  I get it that societal changes and marketing to accommodate those changes require games to change, and for all the great games in the Trails series up till now I am very appreciative to Falcom for providing, and I sincerely hope that the next generation of games they produce will continue to provide enjoyment and great gaming experiences for others.  For me, It's been a fun ride on the Falcom Express, but it's time for this gamer to find another ride. Went into this game expecting it to be really good but what I didn't expect was it becoming my second favourite kiseki game (only behind azure) and one of my new favourite games in general. 
This game was phenomenal and that ending is gonna drive me nuts until the next game comes out.

name: Depths of Sanity
short_description: A mysterious signal. A missing crew. And the one man trying to piece it all together. As Abe Douglas, dive deep into a fully underwater metroidvania to explore massive oceanic¬†biomes, battle monstrous bosses, and piece together a mystery that threatens not only your crew, but your own sanity.
reviews:
FANTASTIC UNDERWATER Metroidvania, I absolutely recommend this game to MV fans, and any looking for a good and well made, underwater adventure with, Lovecraftian elements "Depths of Sanity" is a pixelated subnautical metroidvania with heavy emphasis on atmosphere and narrative.

You play Abe, the chief of an unterwater mission gone wrong in his hellbent attempt to rescue the missing crew with his son among them while their chances of survival dwindling the deeper he goes.

The writing and pacing of it does a good job - it is slow-burning and really reels you in (the scattered crewnotes and audiologs remind me a little of "System Shock 2", but maybe this comparison is a little far fetched). Overall it feels like a true interactive lovecraftian tale and the small dev team really hit the nail with it.
Atmosphere is also well done, the score gets more and more eerie and the journey more and more claustrophobic (gotta love it when a Great White charges at you in utter darkness). Only the sounddesign could be a little better in my opinion...

Gameplaywise it is your "typical" nautical metroidvania (which is a subgenre by now, is it?). Movement can get a little finnicky, but you get the hang of it as you go. The current streams and their traversal later on can get a little frustrating. Also, if you explore every nook and cranny, you get quite tanky in the end, which made the later bosses easier than the first ones. 
But these are just minor gripes in my opinion.

Definetly check this out, if you like atmosphere- and narrative-rich metroidvanias, the price is very fair and it deserves a broader audience! I hate giving indie titles bad reviews, and usually, if I can, I try to at least get through a good portion of this game. After a little over three hours, and the first two bosses under my belt, I can't muster the energy to continue. I couldn't help comparing this to the game Pronty--a far superior MetroidVania, with a similar underwater setting and control scheme. This game feels like the exact opposite of everything that made that game fun and worth playing. 

Movement feels like a sluggish, and difficult chore. It demands being slow and methodical, but it is often awkward and troublesome. It also throws enemies that will try and force you into environmental hazards, or just chase you until you destroy them (a fun 'glitch' happened when I got an upgrade, and was reading the text on screen, but a swarm of fish ganged up on me and killed me while reading. Great). Things get even worse when you make your way into the pitch dark areas. You will crawl and go slow, and if you run into any enemies or environmental hazards, then I guess it's your own fault.

There's little reason to engage in enemies since there's little in the way of rewards (the occasional health or missile ammo). The baddies feel spongy (playing on 'Normal' difficulty), and using your weapons is wearisome. The pea shooter you start with takes a lot of accuracy, but it's the best option you've got--The bounce shot feels built for specialized areas that are few and far between. The missiles seem like a joke: they go from zero to max velocity in speed that is insultingly slow. It makes it near impossible to hit the majority of the games enemies that move quickly, unless you are right next to them and risk contact damage. Not that it matters, since the game also feels comfortable to give you very little in means of ammunition.

The artwork in this game is also lacking. Not a big issue necessarily, but everything has this feeling of looking like a first draft of what could've been. Again, not necessary for a game per se, but I do think it should be considered when this game throws so much weight around the narrative it's trying to build. It's harder to build a weighty, immersive story when the art isn't that good, frankly.

I don't want to comment too much on the narrative, since I only played so little, and the story did seem to have a lot going for it. All I will comment on is that while I didn't mind reading all the notes and logs, it added an already slower pace to a game that moves like molasses.

What's truly irking, is that this game seems so highly regarded within the MV community. Everyone is near unanimous in singing it's praises, from r/metroidvania to the small MV youtube reviewing community. I wish I could've played the game people saw here but all I got was a tedious chore.

Pass. Great underwater metroidvania, highly reccomend Moving and maneuvering in this game is absolutely torturous. I get that it's an underwater submarine game but it probably could have been done better. It feels like i'm playing a pinball game and i'm the pinball. This game has great creepy vibes. A perfect setting in diving deep underwater. I loved the story, the ambient music and just the general mood of the game. The controls and gameplay are just okay but the rest kept me engaged for the entire length. A lovely gem of a Metroidvania game! It's lovecraftian and underwater theme, really give it this creepy atmosphere as you progress. This is weaved in perfectly with the game's plot and gameplay. You play as a Submarine pilot named Abe, a mission to find out what happened to his crew and son, who's ship sunk while investigating an unknown signal. What starts with normal environments and sea life, slowly turns into a nightmare as you descent deeper, as everything is corrupted by this lovecraftian horror. Which also takes hold on Abe, who slowly losing his sanity as you progress. Plot has a nice late game twist, which is obvious to those familiar with these type of stories, but it's effectively setup for the payoff.

The gameplay has a few flaws that hold it back a bit. Exploration is fun, but the game decides not to give the player access to fast travel until the last quarter, which makes backtracking very tedious and time consuming. The combat is passable which is held back by a ton of little issues that makes you just want to avoid it at points. Most of the enemies are fast, zipping around the screen making them hard to hit. The weapons have small bullets that make it even harder to hit them, on top of them being bullet sponges. Not a problem with the game's few bosses, which are all fun to fight.

Even with those flaws, I still highly recommend it. Well worth your time if you enjoy the genre. One of the most unique and memorable metroidvanias out there. A legit horror metroidvania. It has a few issues, namely many bomb and missile upgrades that are rarely ever used outside of boss fights, and the final section seemed to bug out a bit on me. However, the story, atmosphere, and experience is well worth a recommendation. A nice story-driven MV though there were few annoying enemies and cumbersome movement.

+creepy and great atmosphere, excellent use of lighting and darkness to create a sense of dread
+story is actually pretty good for a MV
+nice pixel art
-visual acuity could be better, sometimes objects blend too much into the backgrounds
-annoying enemies, some just stick to you like a glue
-map could be more hand-on with collectible locations after obtaining sonar power-up but it only show how much you missed
- I hated that gauntlet near end where you exited your sub and navigated a lengthly section that if you get hit once, you get sent back all way to the start Wow, this is a hard one. This game has so much potential that it totally flopped on. A game with incredible vision that is just painful to play. I think this is a situation where the dev had a dream, and try to make something bigger than he could handle... and thus lost energy and did a poor job rather than instead of descoping. 

Animations are really good, but colors don't mesh so it's painful to look at. (I'm sure you can see that from the store page.) Enemies have terrific variety and are wonderfully diverse, and yet hampered by poor AI that makes them tedious to fight -- that is to say, 90% of them, you can just hang outside their attack zone and shoot them, although they take a long time to kill from their huge health pools. It just seems like there's countless situations where a sub-par implementation killed terrific potential. 

The map design was, I thought, good. The cutscene atmosphere had alot of good elements, but the bland game-screen really robbed it of alot of its power. The storyline was pretty good, although probably held back a bit by the graphics. 

I think if I were to try to make a recommendation to the dev, I'd say "make your next game's enemies more interesting" and "try to make your graphics blend more." Idk, I hope that's constructive. 

Ultimately, this game had masterful understanding of the classics. I'd unquestioningly give it a thumbs-up on itch where it's commentary on an indie game's project, rather than a recommendation for other players. Well, in any event, I want to see more like this, so i'm going to give this thumbs up, although for casual or younger players, you'd probably be happier with better representations of the classic genres. 



Original thoughts below:
--------------------------------------------

Metroid meets Solar Jetman with maybe a hint of Blaster Master, blended very smoothly. 

I'll update the review when i've gotten a bit further in, but right now, all I can say is this captures the beauty of the classics without seeming derivative. 

The aesthetics are a bit weak, as one can see from the pics/videos, but the gameplay is deliciously smooth.

name: Mu Complex Demo
reviews: Excellent Game 8/10 Hacking Simulator

name: Kozue's Strange Journey
short_description: Having barely escaped with her life after being attacked by shadowy monsters, Kozue, and the woman who helped save her decide to team up to investigate the creatures and their connection to reports of mysterious disappearances around town.
reviews:
Trigger warning, lots of rape. 

The game play is very similar with Persona 4, it's a turn based rpg game with daily activity management, getting close to people, getting strong by battling, or working. There is a lot of prostitution in the game. I can't recommend it as I can't get behind it, regret not researching before purchasing. great grinding game I thought it was great.

It's a really strong JRPG with an in-depth system, as well as some fights that are truly challenging and take a great deal of preparation to win [spoiler](I'm looking at you, hidden boss)[/spoiler]. It also uses a Persona-esque system where the day is split up into segments, and you choose between things like deepening your bonds with party members (which unlocks special abilities and items) or going to dungeons. The only issue here is that there is [i]far[/i] too much to do and you'll have to pick and choose what you want to focus on. Oh, and my other gripe is that stats and weapon effects are not explained, and it can be rather unclear if a given weapon effect is positive or negative.

The art though... personally I'd give a hard pass on it unless you like 'em young, which I do not. Body proportions are actually more realistic though, which again could be a good or bad thing depending on what you want from it. Also, focusing on the sexy times comes at the cost of doing the other things like deepening bonds with party members. But if you're one of those twisted individuals that play H-rpgs and try mostly to [i]avoid[/i] the sexy times, then there is still a whole lot of game here. Is this the new Persona? The patch can be obtained from the publisher's website. 

This game is something I enjoy because it is very similar to the persona games. So as a quick review: If you like the persona games you'll like this. If not, well, then don't buy this. The combat is practically identivcval, just watered down and a lower quality, but basicly the same nonetheless. It also has the confidant system and the system of days and whatnot. 

7/10. Get this if you like H-JRPGs and or like persona. i hate limited time games, but the art was worth Persona but H-RPG. Recommend save editing after some point because grinding isnt fun and that's not what you're there for. Story is fun and other side content is too. Worth Base and Sale price. Liked this one but hated the small screen. Didn't know there was a command to fullscreen it. (Alt + enter for those wondering.)

Update: Grind? In a hentai game? Lovely. Rating changed to negative. persona 4 but hetai game [h1]Needs a...[/h1]
[i](see publisher)[/i]

[b][u]Game Is:[/u][/b] H turn-based RPG with VERY heavy Persona influences.

[hr][/hr]
[+]   The art is decent, it won't wow you but it's pleasant to look at. The tags are also good but the scenes themselves can sometimes feel a bit static.

[+]   The life-sim is one of the best parts of the game. It is quite engrossing to carefully juggle your everyday activities with your other-world dungeon-crawling.

[+/-]   The combat is definitely better then most of these types of games due to the Persona-like one-more system. However the dungeon design is pretty bland.

[+/-]   The story is fairly interesting but that's because it's pretty much just Persona, mostly P4.

[-]   The game runs on an older version of RPG-Maker so the play experience can feel a bit rough around the edges at times.

[hr][/hr]
[b][u]Summary:[/u][/b] A surprisingly good H Persona-like. It's not the most original thing ever but it mostly copies what makes persona enjoyable, and so this too is enjoyable.

name: Medieval Battlegrounds
short_description: Set in medieval times, you must vanquish your foes! Fight again players in 6-man teams or join together and fight hordes of AI enemies. Battle with swords, axes, bows, and magic. Teams are formed in-game, so play with your friends, or against them! Team up and take down enemies and friends alike!
reviews: While this game is highly interesting in it's current state, I feel as if it is lacking in some aspects. Sound design is superb, and the outside soundscape fits very well with the surrounding visual atmosphere. Perhaps some music might increase the quality of this game? This definitely has some potential to become a fun game to play, it just needs a tad bit of work in order to round out the game fully.

name: Redemption: Eternal Quest
short_description: Redemption: Eternal Quest is a casual RPG/Sim game which combines the feel of an RPG with roster management sim mechanics. You become the leader of a band of adventurers, guiding them through quests, watching them grow and signing them to pacts while keeping your gold pouch filled.
reviews:
coupon There is a fun game under a pile of technical issues. If you save often and don't mind the crashes - I would recommend it. Refunded üëç I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.
