Bad UI. dont buy this shit except if u need a badge Not bad. Amazing Old Goodie INDLE DnD GAME . I love it ...................... Ok so this game was worth buying, but was still iffy. Here is why

- tons of typos
- the plot is procedually generated, and usually does not add up
- the easiest way to win is to ignore a lot of different aspects of the game such as schooling.
+ very long game, i got a good 3 hours out of this when it only cost 1$ (full price)
+ procedurally generated names for characters, areas, and treasure.

Again, this game isn't anything special, but if you have a dollar you willing to spend, you wont regret spending it on this game.

name: BYTES: The Reverse Tower Defense
short_description: BYTES:T.R.T.D is a twist on the classic Tower Defense formula. Build your own path to the exit and use special tiles to keep your Bytes safe against a dynamic AI that tries to counter your actions.
reviews:
BYTES is an interesting take on the fairly unknown reverse tower defense genre. The level variety and structure of the game provide a solid amount of replay-ability. The story and dialogue elements of the game also greatly contribute to its overall complexity. The wave customization features are a phenomenal way to personalize units and add a healthy amount of variety to the gameplay. It also features a fantastically thematic soundtrack that  enhances the overall experience of the game. I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone looking for a fresh tower defense experience. Tower Offense? Anti-Tower Defense? Reverse Tower Defense? What ever this genre is called, SIGN ME UP. This game is very fun and is worth checking out to any tower defense lover. If you are okay with the fact that the art style is simply little shapes making their way through a circuit board type world, you will love this game. This is a really fun and well made game!! There's that element of strategizing and planning that makes it a fun challenge to get through each level. The learning process is straightforward and well laid out too.
I like that there's a story/background built into the world, it adds an extra layer of motivation and satisfaction of progressing in the game. I also love the visuals and design <3 
I definitely recommend, it's worth getting it! I thought this game was pretty fun. Never really played Tower defense games much, but I've definitely enjoyed this so far. Something different around the Tower Defense genre with greater emphasis around strategy/puzzle.

You really have to think your way around this one and make sure you carefully read the tutorial - I flashed through and struggled for a while. (a 22 minute Youtube video was a big help).

Don't say it often, but enjoying the sound options. Bytes is a refreshing twist on the traditional tower defense genre. Here, the player constructs a path while a cunning AI places the defensive towers. This ingenious role reversal offers a new strategic challenge that is both engaging and Compelling.
The gameplay is wonderfully intuitive and exceptionally layered, requiring careful planning and adaptability around the AI's moves. The visuals and immersive sound design also add to the game's allure, creating a richly detailed and captivating experience.
In summary, it‚Äôs a standout game that combines innovation with strategic depth. It is an excellent choice for any gamer seeking a fresh and challenging experience.

name: Night & Day
short_description: The personifications of Night and Day learn to get along. Discover each other‚Äôs unique skills to help both Night & Day come to realize that new paths will open up if they work together.
reviews: I love the concept of this game. Unfortunately, the physics are rather buggy. There are plenty of times where Dark has room before hitting the light but dies anyway. And when you're stuck on a level because of it, there's no hint system or way around it. You just have to bang your head on the proverbial wall. Level 13 is especially prone to this. Plus the Game Over screen you get takes an annoyingly long time to let you hit R and reset.

name: Ansoku
short_description: Ansoku is a relaxing, fun, simple, and yet challenging puzzle game with a high replay value.
reviews:
As they say + beautiful.

Quite addictive. Unlike some games from CDPR, this game is finished

name: RPG Maker MV - Heist Music Pack
short_description: From precious jewels snatched by a simple cat burglar to the most elaborate robbing of a casino, there's something so thrilling about executing the ultimate heist....
reviews:
Hey, the song "Groove Baby" from your preview video is NOT included in the download! That's the song I wanted the most! What gives?

Can I get someone from your team to give me that song? That's the whole reason I bought this pack! Buddy , that's a cool music pack, 
It make my inmagination to , some kind of thief or robbery, 
or special agent .  It's rhythematical and sounds realy fluent . This is a must have for anyone creating a project revolving around a heist (or just sneaky scenarios in general). Way better than most of the other DLC music I've gotten for MV. If you weren't inspired to make a heist game already, you will be after listening to this.

name: Arma 3 Tac-Ops Mission Pack
short_description: Take part in three distinct military operations and influence the course of events with the Arma 3 Tac-Ops DLC Singleplayer Mission Pack.
reviews:
[h1] it's FIA propaganda eh, it's mid the missons for this dlc were FIA and a NATO mashal commander. for the missons i rate this a 9/10 for the missions. which were hard but worth it for arma spec ops disintegration point is buggy as hell other than that ig its fine approve! üëçüèªüëçüèª I liked the missions, but they should not be the only thing a DLC offers.... Skip this one, random generated mission still better This DLC is borderline non-functional, the missions frequently bug out and don't progress for no reason and require several full mission restarts to work, AI getting stuck in the ground, disappearing enemies, etc.

There's custom modded missions in this game that play better than this and you don't have to pay for them, even if this is cheap(frequently on sale for a few USD) I wouldn't buy this again. I don't see what people are complaining about with this DLC. This is the best DLC I have played so far in Arma III (haven't gotten around to all of them, but I definitely recommend this over things like Contact. Yes, it's a collection of short campaigns, 2 - 3 missions each, but they are all well written for singleplayer stuff. Yes, the AI can be finicky, but no more then the main game.

I thoroughly enjoyed replaying missions in different roles. The infantry missions did get a little annoying. Running across an open field with iron sights or something similar is definitely the start of a bad day, but that's the only thing that bothered me. I enjoyed this mission pack very much A great DLC if you want official campaigns.

name: Ultimate Spinner Simulator - Unstress Yourself
short_description: SPIN SPIN SPIN SPIN WOOOHOHOOO
reviews:
There is not much here
Worryingly long install
AutisMode jumpscare Good game 10/10 This game still goes hard in 2022 awesome game! I love it! <3 This game is the cheapest unstressing therapy you can get. I spent 40 minutes to reach to 1000 in unbreakable mode. Music turned off after beating 550, but I turned on my own calming zen music and it was fine! :) I recommend it to all of you! A Masterpiece in Gaming History this is part of the Enlightenment of our civilisation a Gaming Masterpiece 10/10 would spin again i really don't see the point of such game. in normal mode there's no tut. i didn't even manage to make the spinner move. in destruct mode you move a spinner around and destroy cubes, and... that's all. same speed, same thing over, and over again I honestly thought that for that price I wouldn't be salty if it's a shitty game but this is some next level shit. :D
Buy at your own risk it's a waste of money seriously. gutta spin that spinner, and destroy buildings, oooooooooffffff

name: Construction Simulator - JCB Pack
short_description: Enjoy more variety while tackling your construction contracts: The JCB Pack expands your vehicle fleet in Construction Simulator with six brand-new machines from Great Britain's popular manufacturer JCB!
reviews:
Bought the dlc installed it and wont show up in my game
 Buy it! i would say it worth it, the telehandler is the reason i got this dlc, would be nice if it was cheaper but content wise it is worth the price tag. if you want a decent digger and a telehandler i would 100% recomend this dlc superb quality dlc, very useful cool vehicles and fun to operate This package gives you 6 JCB vehicles.
1 excavator
1 backhoe loader
1 mini crawler backhoe loader
1 loader
1 telehandler
1 mini dumper

The highlight of the pack is the mini backhoe loader, is it functional? Can be used for small tasks. Although the back boom of the backhoe loaders is extensible, it is unfortunately fixed in the centre. Cannot sideshift right or left. That's the part I'm going to criticize. Apart from that, these vehicles are already in the game with different brands. (except mini backhoe) Mini dumper case can turn right or left, that is functional. The JCB Telehandler boom is longer than the Kramer telehandler boom. If you say "I'm brand obsessed" or "I love JCB" you can get this pack. Discount can also be expected.

This review was written with "google translate".

name: Sakura Space
short_description: Captain Shika has seen all kinds of things in her adventures throughout the universe, and with her two loyal crew members by her side, she's managed to make a name for her small company of mercenaries. When Shika finds a bounty job offering an absurd amount of money, she doesn't hesitate to act: tracking hardened criminals is part of the...
reviews:
When Nami says "It's not a problem if there's only three of us right?" while referring to her wearing no clothes on the space ship, the writer seems to forget that the ship's crew actually has four members. u play mario odysey onii-chan~

A bit boring at times, but the ending was nice. Adventure of trio of bounty huntresses on a spaceship with detective elements, mindgames, a lot of yuri and driving you mad "villainess".

Quick summary:
‚ùáÔ∏è Perfect: Female protagonist, Visual style, Engine
*Ô∏è‚É£ Good: Full female cast, Yuri & H-scenes, Character's relationships, Story, Visual quality, Language, Interface, Animations
‚ú¥Ô∏è Neutral: Story progression, Visual design, Backgrounds, Music
üí¢ Vexing: Setting & Worldbuilding
üí• Vile: -

Into details:
‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è Significant influence ‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è
‚ùáÔ∏è Female protagonist / Great positive trait
Shika is a sharp minded one, always calm, serious and thoughtful, cutie, pleasure to play as her.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Full female cast / Positive trait
Our comrades Kotori and Nami are skillful, strong and cute, yet there is no background / development to them. [spoiler]They love Shika, Shika loves them, I love this perfect harem team.[/spoiler]. Main focus here on Akane, our mysterious enemy, ohhh and how strongly I do want to punish this little pest... we will learn her closer during the game and will not hear a single word about how she became so strong.

‚ùáÔ∏è Visual style / Great positive trait
Of course from global point of view anime style is top notch, but compared to other VNs I can see some broken proportions and shapes in characters, still there isn't anything critical and style looks just okay.

‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è Average influence ‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è
*Ô∏è‚É£ Character's relationships / Small positive trait
Shika does really cares about her friends and everytime says yes when they invite her to spend some hot time together, so we will see bunch of erotic happenings. However there is not so much romantic dialogues between team, despite certainly having feelings towards each other, they are more focused on events. And ohhhh how much Akane drives me mad with her speeches and actions, but we will quite talk heart to heart with her to come to resolution.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Yuri h-scenes / Small positive trait
[b]!! You need to manually download from external sources unlocked resource assets. Which is bad, official link is a lot more stable through time, users do not get payed for hosting files on own clouds. Gladly there is bunch of guides with this file.[/b]

Scenes themselves not impressive, neither hot... and there is no detailed depiction of girl's crotches and barely any textual description for any actions, and overall scenes aren't long, so this is more Featuring The Boobs‚Ñ¢ only. Yet all 5 are quite enjoyable.
There is few ecchi, and on CGs we can quite often see translucence clothes, but that doesn't make me happy: nipples are drawn not to my taste and other parts do not drawn at all.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Story & events / Small Positive trait
I liked the idea by being chased by a mysterious dangerous opponent, in the same time digging information about her in detective manner. And there were couple of cool mindgames and tricks, not very complicated, but I liked them. Reading will take 3-4 hours.
Battles are boring: sometimes girls are obliteration machines with perfect reflexes, and sometimes get caught in stupid situations. There is a little or no description how exactly do they fight and what techniques they use, and as overall there is no many detailed explanations of happenings.

üí¢ Setting & worldbuilding / Small negative trait
It is space western, setting just a decoration, story does not use it at all. There is no anything original, yet game pushes in your face cloying and generic space sci-fi every time, I didn't like it. Cosmos and nanotechs are not a joke, so take it seriously. At least there were mentioned Thermal Signatures.

‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è Lesser influence ‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏è
‚ú¥Ô∏è Story progression / Neutral trait
It is almost kinetic, you can make 21 choices which will have no influence (only on your meta reputation as a detective).

‚ú¥Ô∏è Visual design / Neutral trait
Do not see anything interesting here, as I said, for this setting everything is so generic.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Visual quality / Positive trait
Drawing and image quality is good. This is both for visual design and quality: the way how nipples are drawn here makes me sad.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Animations / Small positive trait
There is some characters movement / facial expression changes on screen to make things a bit more lively.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Language / Positive trait
English is good here, with enough advanced structures, but there is no any sophisticated words (which is sad to me, I like them), so you can read this fluently.

‚ùî VFX / None
‚ùî SFX / None
Add at least some female squishy sounds...

‚ú¥Ô∏è Backgrounds / Neutral trait
Looks like exactly what you will expect from your [i]generic[/i] space cruiser. Drawn good.

‚ú¥Ô∏è Music / Neutral trait
Soundbank is small and lame, tunes are weak. Better they found some free music on the interwebs.

*Ô∏è‚É£ Interface / Positive trait
Design is good, font is okay. Does not interfere to see arts.

‚ùáÔ∏è Engine / Great positive trait
It is Ren'Py. Skips fast, every tool for VN is here. You can unpack assets easily. I am still experiencing problems with switching off the fullscreen.


Digression: This is my first game from Sakura series (and I will touch only such ones, where you can see your MC or you are female, and, how fortunately, every Sakura with yuri and full-female cast passes and everyone without does not, what a turn of events with imaginary proportions). I bought to the test only this one, which has the lowest score (79% to notice) among all yuri Sakuras, and it was at least enjoyable, so I think it is safe for me to buy all 18 of these games (MMO 1-3+Extra, Gamer 1-2, Sadist, Cupid, Space, Dungeon, Fantasy, Fox  Adventure, Knight 1-3, Forest Girls 1-3. I checked only up until Alien 2), considering their laughable price during discount [spoiler]especially in region with all the time lowest prices[/spoiler] and what seems that every one of them has trading cards.
But I am thinking that I will not have enough mental determination to write yet 17 of these big shitposts. Man in space with markiplier part 3 is a lot different from the last two parts but a welcome change. 69/80 would ask mark to play again That is one spicy meat ball, especially with the R18 patch. Even excluding the H scenes, the story was actually pretty good for how basic it was. Unlike a lot of H games, the characters actually felt a bit intelligent. I'd recommend this game more than other games of the same target audience.

name: The shelter of patient
short_description: This game is a 3D based simulation horror game and has a high graphic level. Help the protagonist, a journalist, explore a mysterious mansion in the mountains. Of course you shouldn't die.
reviews:
I'm always reticent about leaving negative reviews because I know how much effort it takes to make and publish a game, but I'm too disappointed not to this time. Even if it costs less than ‚Ç¨1, it's still money spent on something that's very poorly made.
The biggest issue is that the game doesn't seem to have an end: once you enter the building there's no way to exit. I've tried to inspect all the rooms (that are very limited in number) multiple times with no results. A couple of ways to escape are hinted through some notes/observations from the character but there's no actual way to use them, mostly because once you collect something in a room you lose it as soon as you exit that room.
Then there's a long list of technical flaws: missing colliders on the fireplaces, bad lighting management (some areas are too dark even with the headlight on), frustrating character controller (you can only go forward and you rotate with the camera, so you can't for example move sideways and it's very uncomfortable, especially knowing that you could die), confusing buttons (why should I use F to interact with some things and X to interact with some other things?), poor sintax (some texts have mistakes), wrong scaling of the building in the first scene (it's way too small comparing to the character and the surrounding environment), very little accessibility (the texts that say what buttons to press are white and if you have your headlight on you can't read them in some areas, but if you turn the headlight off you can't see anything at all since it's all pitch black; also, the cromatic aberration it's maybe too much and you can't turn it off unless you enter a room -if you manage to, it's very difficult to understand what you're seeing), unnecessarly repeated assets (I'm all for optimization, but all the libraries are exactly the same, it takes 30 seconds to switch the order of the books on a modeling software). I don't know if I'm missing anything else but it's already too much so I'm stopping here.
Again, if it wasn't for the fact that I spent actual money on this I wouldn't have left a review at all, but here we are. I'm lost. Is this game broken? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D4kLKwCJ4-k

name: REINCARNATION ASURA ZALANDARA Journey of carnage and redemption
short_description: Fuckin' dress up roguelike shooter action game Zarandara is an action game in the style of a bullet-hell roguelike. The power of Shakti allows you to recover Mp through sexual intercourse, and when your climax gauge is at its maximum, your Hp and Mp are fully recovered.
reviews:
Looking forward to your next work.
Ê¨°Âõû‰Ωú„Å´ÊúüÂæÖ„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ I don't know what to say, other than the game was absolute trash.

1. Incomplete translations strewn throughout the dialogue for the English translation. Tons of paragraphs and names left in the original Japanese(?) language.

2. Story is rather dry with all of the data-dumping during each story segment, which makes the dialogue hard to follow and not seem natural.

3. Combat is similar to a bullet-hell game, but they failed at that. Most enemies can't do much damage to you. Very clunky controls and movement system, along with rather terrible combat abilities and "skills".

4. Graphics are rather craptastic for the game play portion, but somewhat decent during the cutscenes and persistent CG. Additionally, rather few sex scenes for a porn game.

Overall, not even worth the discounted price I got off of Steam. Absolutely either avoid buying, or get a refund if possible. Let me be brief. The game looks like ass, uses defaultish rpg maker soundtracks, and the gameplay is buggy as all get out. The translations are extremely confusing
However, the plot is very enthralling and some of the most fun I've enjoyed playing a janky ass game that feels like its from the 90s.  I recommend picking up and playing this game. Its funny and fun enough to enjoy.

Also its porn. I 100%'d the game in about 3 hours, you can probably do it quicker. I feel I got more than my moneys worth with this. Straightforward, mindless game-play and mechanics. The adult content is a bit bizarre. I just think it's neat. It's short and stands out from other adult offerings on Steam. I almost feel ashamed that I spent 8 bucks on this game. I mean from the preview it looks like a good game but after about 45 minutes its not worth your time anymore. The game play is good, but I figured the game would be harder and it really was a breeze. 4 hours later I was done but at first the story seemed to be pretty good and worth the time but after the 4th chapter I started just clicking through the story because of all the SUPER poor english translations. Translation for this game went to the lowest bidder and it shows. So the story is very hard to understand because HE and SHE are used incorrectly almost 95% of the time. So reading and understanding it was an absolutely CHORE!!  The cut scenes are lazy, if they were animated then this game would be better but they are still images. It's kind of funny when you play the game the animations  for Z and V (the names are horrible so Z and V is what I use) on the left hand side of the screen are perfect. Even some of the cut scenes have some 3d imagery mixed in but they could have made them fully animated. This game has a lot of promise it just so easy and so cheesy at the same time. 2 bucks for this game would be fine but 8 bucks is outrageous!! Bullet hell - Yes
Cutscenes - Bad
Mechanics - Alright
Sexual Content - Should have just did pictures because the animation and place of animation is terrible

[table]
    [tr]
        [td](Adult) Content[/td]
        [td](FxM) Sexual content.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Censorship?[/td]
        [td]Mosaic'd genitalia.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Hours of Gameplay[/td]
        [td]Two or three hours.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Modding Support?[/td]
        [td]No.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Patch Available?[/td]
        [td]No, not necessary.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[b]REINCARNATION ASURA ZALANDARA[/b] Journey of carnage and redemption is a lewd bullet hell about a cursed king and his wife that must save the world from total annihilation.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Dodge baddies and bullets and beat bosses. There are six stages total, each culminating to a boss fight. Each stage begins and ends with long visual novel portions. At least a third of the game is reading -- but you can choose to toggle all cutscenes before starting a stage. By collecting "Zeptomachines" (dropped by foes), you are able to upgrade your base stats and unlock new weapons. Weapons are fueled by "magic", which passively regenerates. Your regeneration can be enhanced via sexual intercourse, and when you [b]climax[/b] all of your stats are fully restored!

[h1]Story[/h1]
The Anantal Ring, a network of orbital weapons has gone haywire. Dubbed the "Black Carnage", hundreds of thousands of unmanned drones have been unleased upon the world, along with nine GigaFlameMachines (or "False God Machines"). The Black Carnage isn't just some technological hiccup; in fact, humanity is [i]chump change[/i] in the face of what's at stake. Armed with the mysterious Spear of Mara and his devoted wife, Zarandala is the world's only hope. Like the Carnage, he and his beloved Vrinda are more than what meets the eye.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The titlescreen is messy. There's text everywhere, and I haven't a clue what the "hukkatu" button does (which is apparently nothing). Though the art isn't "AAA", I did enjoy the overall composition; I feel as though I'm entering a dramatic RPG (which isn't far from the actual game). From "Configuration", you may adjust audio, display and resolution preferences. There is no gallery to review strictly CGs, but you are able to replay cutscenes (which may contain adult content) via "Event" (after starting the game). The English isn't well translated, but you can generally understand what's going on. Misspellings are commonplace.

[b]- The Goods -[/b]
There are a handful of sex scenes, each comprised of dialogue and a handful of CGs. The artwork is okay, but censorship is a major buzzkill. I found the lewd artwork to be amateurish. I didn't see any major rape scenes, but there was one I remember that was abnormally gory. There are a few scenes with pregnancy, and one with childbirth. One of the core mechanics of gameplay is that you recharge magic via intercourse; however, there is only one animation to showcase this mechanic (or [i]two[/i] if you count the pregnant variant). Overall, I found the sexual content to be underwhelming.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Wait for a sale and updates. This game is [i]grossly unbalanced,[/i] but I still had fun. There is no reason to fight outside of boss battles, and boss battles are stupid-easy. There are a few overpowered weapons that can be used to breeze through the game, and strategy typically boils down to "mash attack". Much of the game is reading, but the English and storytelling fall flat. Not only that, but many of the story scenes are just black backgrounds with text! But at the end of the day, [b]REINCARNATION ASURA ZALANDARA Journey of carnage and redemption[/b] is a promising title. I think with some added features and general balance, this could become a challenging and interesting title. But until then, I'd hold off on buying this game.

name: LEAP
short_description: LEAP is a fast-paced, multiplayer first-person shooter featuring epic large scale battles, each with players armed to the teeth. Fight for either the United Earth Defense Coalition (UEDC) or the rebel Exo-Terrans - whoever pays the most, wins your trigger finger and excessive arsenal.
reviews:
It is a really good shooter Very fun but very dead Very fun, It just needs to get more popular as this game is sitting on a goldmine. MORE ADVERTISING played this game for awhile but these are also the people who made the survival wizard game that was left to die once the player count dropped a little im surprised anyone even touches this game anymore Has so much potential, This game was seriously fun but it has NO play absolutely ZERO. So if you are expecting to play PvP then don't bother, but this game does also have a PvE where you (and possibly a friend or 2 assuming you have friends) get to team up and fight against enemy's and capture zones and all that stuff. I just wish it had an actual playerbase :( Fantastic movement, great combat, and large-scale battles. Too bad you won't experience any of it considering there isn't a single human playing this game. The developers didn't even bother populating lobbies with bots, and the PvE mode has received zero updates since day one of launch. Whether they make it free to play or lower the price, whatever solution they come up with at this point will be too little, too late. Out of hundreds of games. This is by far my most regrettable and disappointing purchase. ok... this could have been a fun game but it was marketed wrong and came out unfinished. and it was almost 30$ when i bought it... what these guys should do is take it off for a year, fix bugs, work on marketing and offer lots of beta for free. this could be a fun game to pop into and play and it could have a constant player base of like 10k if things go well. Super fun but I wish the stuff I had from the Playtest transferred to the actual game. Disclaimer: This game is obviously early in development so all that follows is subject to change
The concept of the game is refreshing and fun at first, but when every lobby is the same 20 or so people with one or two absolute virgins running the pathfinder and spamming you from their shield it gets pretty damn infuriating. In addition, the spawns of both players and supply drops don't take enemy locations into account so I very often end up spawning in front of an enemy. 
Overall a lot of promise but don;t buy it yet. Please.

name: Rodina Soundtrack
short_description: Rodina Soundtrack by John Robert Matz! 20 tracks + bonus track. Over 1 hour of music in both MP3 and ALAC formats.
reviews:
Nice soundtrack but it'd be nice if it also came in FLAC and if the mp3 files can be 320 kbps. This soundtrack is so good. Modern techno-classical. I love these songs. All of the Veles Tracks are absolute Bangers! One of my fav soundtracks, just get it Instrumentally stellar Great Wanted to buy this to support the dev, forgot I already bought it. Soundtrack itself somehow makes me feel my own intestines. I don't know how else to describe that. 10/10 for also putting me hard into the Feelzone‚Ñ¢ John Robert does some really fantastic work. I'm using this music as an alarm clock and some ambiant study background music. Stay humble, the both of you! Comes in compressed and uncompressed audio. One of the few DLCs I went out of my way to buy, The music is lovely and great to listen to in the background of other space games you might play; I like playing it while AFK mining in EVE.  It also is very reminiscent of Wall-E.

My only complaint is that a couple tracks have a buzzing sound, though it may be my headphones.

UPDATE: Turns out it was my headphones; bluetooth sucks.

10/10

name: Tick
short_description: A first-person horror game, the player will play a character who enters the dreamland, gather the necessary props to escape in the dreamland, and be careful of monsters during the chase. If you really can't escape, you can try to enter a deeper dreamland (but you may not be alone there)
reviews: SO AWSOME!!!

name: Snowball Christmas festival
short_description: Snowball Christmas festival is a puzzle game, the ultimate goal of which is to swap the blocks to collect the image. But remember, the purpose of this game is to let you relax and enjoy the process. To do this, we added a minimalistic interface and relaxing music.
reviews:
Yet another AI generated attempt at making money. No thought put into anything, no second check if everything is spelled right or anything, they didn't even try to fix the mistakes AI makes. Not recommended. Everyday is Christmas Day!!!

Playing this game is the same as drinking room temperature water at 11am after waking up from a hang over where you drank yourself to sh*t. The game has no progression system, so you don't really know which level are you playing the same way you can't comprehend where tf you are while your head felt like got hit by a truck after waking up from that hang over.

It's an alright puzzle game for relaxing with cute art. But everything is unlocked at start, so you don't even need to play. There're better hentai puzzle games for the same price. Refunded. Some AI-generated BS. Shouldn't have been allowed on Steam in the first place. Don't waste your time

name: Capsa
genres: Casual, Free To Play, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Racing, Simulation
short_description: Capsa combines exploration with a strong social component. It features a large, rich open-world that players can explore and discover together with other players and friends.
reviews:
It could be good, but have never done. Now, no refund issued for "early access" like me who played less than an hour and expected this game to be "full functional", while it turns out to be a joke with free access in the end, treating early access customer like a fool. Pretty much a dead game. Not many people on ever. That is if the game even starts. I was able to hop in there at one point. But the past few times boots up to a black screen and crashes.

Specs.
Windows 10, 64 bit Home
16 Gig Ram
AMD Ryzem 7 1700 eight core processor
Radeon RX 570 A great game with friends. I paid 25 dollars for this game and now it's free? Absolutely embarrassing. I received no compensation for this. it dosent work with the remotes that came with my rift Well I'm bored, so I am reviewing this game. Capsa is a social game made with multiplayer in mind, like your normal MMO. It is made in the Unreal Engine (more on that later) and was on Steam Greenlight when that was a thing. I actually backed this on the service as I was impressed with what it was, especially compared to some of the... other stuff. And now I have it, was it worth it? Well, let's find out!

Gameplay: There isn't much here, as the game isn't meant to be this insane anime super game. For what this game is supposed to be like, it does it well. You have a few things to do, like walking, climbing on specific surfaces and swimming in LAVA!!!! jk, water. Like I said, it's simple, and since more stuff is planned, there is something to keep coming back for, especially online. Does it well, but it might seem bare bones to others, and I agree that more can be added.

Graphics and Presentation: Remember when I said this game was made in UE4? Well, that affects me because Epic Games knows nothing about optimization, but this game has better optimization than others. I cannot experience full graphics due to my potato PC, but looking at pics shows this game's beauty with times of day, nice lighting, and so much more. I wish I had a better PC though. A cool thing is that you can customize your character like crazy. Both male and female have specific options (although Kirbyfan45 law states that female is the true choice). Requesting clothing items might also be a thing, but PLEASE don't ask for nudity! I saw someone on the Steam community actually ask for that. Don't be him. I cannot fully experience this for myself, but if you can, you'll like it.

Sound and Soundtrack: Under normal circumstances, this game does not have either. Sound effects are scarce, only used for water, footsteps, and entering the customization area. That is kinda weird. This game will fail in this area if it were not for one thing: custom songs! By finding music areas like DJ stands, you can insert the URL of any song you know (or copy and paste it) in the text box. This allows custom OST, which is cool. That helps a lot if you can't tell!

Replayability: Well, this is a social type game, with online multiplayer in mind. The replayability comes from what you like. You can explore the areas and find secrets like the 126 hidden items  or go online and make new friends (or enemies). I didn't play online yet, but I might, and you can apparently make your own servers, which is neat. So I guess in this sense you make your own replayability, I dunno.

A fun fact: One of the game's developers, Vetron, is actually on my friends list, and is a cool guy/gal. Vetron answered my questions on the Greenlight page and helped me with the graphics by improving optimization. I recommend befriending Vetron. His profile is in the link provided.

http://steamcommunity.com/id/vetron

Final Thoughts: After looking everything over and from my experiences, I feel this game deserves this score. However, you may have different experiences and thoughts, and disagree with me, and that is fine, everyone has opinions. However, I think this game deserves a 7.1/10 with a side of some cat ears. It definitely has a certain audience in mind for the enjoyment factor. I am not fully in this area, and UE4 being poorly optimized, if, at all, might have hurt this game in the long run. This is a PC exclusive from Steam Greenlight, however, it is not entirely impossible for the game to get ports on other consoles. Skullgirls got ports, and so did Freedom Planet, and I feel this game deserves a PS4 port as a good version of Atom Universe. If you have a good enough PC, than I recommend it, otherwise, you should play the waiting game. very love ly game you can custom full your charakter  and the landscape is awesome the game play is very good + the controller is very good playable  grapichs veryy nice i can play  on 60 fps in one woed amazing game Right now from what I see on my schedule, there's normally 3-8 people on. There may be more on when I'm off doing weird stuff.  The TWO developers Vetron and Carly are awesome, and actually talk with the players.  Now then let me make a strong note here, this game is Early Access. Which, if you don't know what that means, I suggest you take the time to read the Disclaimer that is present on the store page. The devs are activly putting up fixes and patching issues.   So far players are nice, if not a tad ADHD but hell who the fuck isn't nowadays? LOL.   The graphics are well done, the islands have plenty of flora, you can ride horses, and mildly customize little houses.  

That being said. THIS IS A SOCIAL PLATFORM. As in, not a standard modern game. There's no death/drowning/falldmg/Any of that.  It's all about talking, getting to know people, looking good, and having a relaxing time. And honestly if you want to take a break from ARMA3, Dark Souls, or Star Citizen; looking for something peaceful and social based, then this may be worth your time to look into.  


So to wrap up. Good graphics, okay character customization, HORSES!, No Lords Of Cinder, No bitchy significant other, boooty fo dayz, and of course it actually runs pretty well. 




Note: Because this is in Early Access, patches may at times break things known or unknown. That is how game development and Murphy's Law works. But the devs here listen and do their best. That is all Terrible! 
Dead as all hell. 
Customization are totally whack and limited. 
I played this for 15 minutes before I demanded a refund.
I can see they were trying to go for that Second Life vibe, but sadly it didn't work out for them.
This game should be free. Even then it would be dead with no one on any of the servers. Let me preface this review by saying that this isn't my first social game. Quite the opposite really, I've been playing them since the early days, and I try to play all of them that I can. I prefer to have as many clothing options as I can in one of these, but what's here is solid and customizable. I've tried to find something wrong, something that they could improve on, but haven't found anything yet. Despite being only a couple months old at the time of this writing, Capsa is one of the most promising social MMO's I've played in a long time. I enjoy it more than the PS4 ones.

You can see in the screen caps and such that this is a gorgeous world, but what you can't see is that the currently small but active community is welcoming, helpful, and fun to be around. You can't see that the servers are incredibly stable and there's almost no glitches to be found in Capsa. You can't see that all of this was done by two people, who are always at work on this game and who are happy to answer questions or problems people have. You can't see the fact that this game doesn't do the whole microtransactions thing, and once you've bought the game you get everything from now on. You can't see that it's quite a bit fun to search the island on foot or horseback, climb the rocks, chase a friend through a maze, and then chill in front of a giant screen playing a youtube video you like while you discuss with others the stuff you did that day in Capsa.

But after spending as of now 10 hours in this world, I can safely say that you should see all of this for yourself. If you have enjoyed virtual worlds or social games in the past or want to try a good one out to see what the fuss is about, this one's my suggestion to you. It's worth the money, that money goes to supporting a tiny, dedicated indie team, and I really look forward to seeing what else these devs decide to add to this already awesome world.

name: FSX Steam Edition: Cessna¬Æ C400 Corvalis TT Add-On
short_description: The C400 Corvalis TT has been designed to further push the limits of what can be achieved and delivers super high quality detail to satisfy even the most demanding private pilot‚Äôs needs.
reviews:
The rudder does not work. You cannot steer the plane on the ground. But it's a great plane  I am loviing it. I liked this add on by Alabeo.  I'm a real world pilot with G1000 endorsement.  For those of you that are looking for a plane that has a very good modeling of the G1000 this is the plane for you.  Although, it does have a glitch in the software when loading, but I have notified Alabeo about that glitch.  Hopefully, they will get a patch soon. Wow, this is one fast little 4 seater! Really quick and can soar at relatively high altitudes with great range. The lighting is especially nice at night, and the cabin overall is sweet. Don‚Äôt worry about having to use the differential braking to steer. It turned me off before I bought this plane, but I quickly adapted and just love my C400. Get it, especially if you catch it on sale! The disadvantage of this aircraft is that the automatic driving of the rudder will be out of control. I pretty much start FSX anytime I play, in my Corvalis. I notice alot of people dislike the steering, but in real world, that is exactly what it is like to control these airplanes on the ground. It is all differential braking. The displays have so much information, you can actually get sidetracked from the primary reason we fly... the view, because your too busy fooling around with all the things your G1000 can do. It really is a joy to fly. On take off, watch your trim carefully and constantly adjust it in the climb or you will find yourself at 25+ degrees nose up in less than 3 seconds. My only complaints, and they are VERY VERY minor, are the angry bumble bee sound the engine makes when your at max power, and the fuel system. I like my sim to be as close to the real thing as possible, so I noticed that when I don't manually select the left tank before I start flying, the engine will draw fuel from BOTH tanks, equally throughout the flight without any need for switching tanks during the flight to maintain the weight and balance. Real world- this is not correct. As with the Cirrus SR22, you start on the left tank, and you don't let the imbalance between the 2 exceed 10 gallons or it starts making for an interesting flight. But that is seriously all I have to complain about. other than that, the speed brakes are a godsend to keep you on glideslope, maintain that rudder control too keep yourself coordinated and you will get just as hooked on this plane as I am. This one is a very good aircraft to get, outside looks very good, inside is also good. all systems seem to work ok.
lighting and dimming is sick (good)
The PDU is very clear and true, so is the MDU which has lots of info to look at I.E. map, engine management etc, delve deeper to look at a vast number of check lists ( to tick off) covering all aspect of this great little aircraft.
Only two very small issues .
One, the steering is by using the differential  brakes. if useing a Joy stick turn say right and hold the brake and she'll turn on a Dime, add a bit of throttle she'll turn tighter, its just getting used to it.
Second point, when the Engine is at idle the engine has a bit of throb, but when at high speed the sound becomes something like an electric hand whisk. its not an issue, it just lose's its powerful engine sound.
10/10 Absolutely amazing modern aircraft, and nice + functional FSX model...Really great to see 'Kit Airplane' innovations from EAA.org ect are now incorporated in GA aircraft in modern times :)  Like the side-stick controls from Velocity XL, and features from the Q200, high hp engines, composite materials ect, also really nice models to add to your FSX collection. ( should be a sale on these aswell hopefully in Feb ) KTNP 29Palms really nice airport addon aswell ( only $5 or so ) for these planes for flight to KSAN San Diego and back...the immersion and Airport GA activity ect,absolutely stunning.  Can tell modern younger engineers thought about the ergonomics for this airplane.  Light controls front center consol (strange to get used too )  now second nature to me, seperate light controls far away from more critical ( fall out of the sky ) systems etc.  Note plane does not have retractable gear, and Drag penatly is actually not that severe vs reliability gained, why most GA aircraft do this these days, but would have been nice for sim model to include an  immaginaryRG model aswell :)..Overall you will really enjoy this plane if you like advanced GA aircraft, but buy the VELO Velocity XL at same time or before you purchase this one, has RG and is faster.  Onsale the C400 is the better deal.  https://youtu.be/dwShFFzaSag [h1] Cessna C400 Corvalis TT Add-On Product Review [/h1]

Seriously this plane is one of the best plane I bought, all that perfect details, sound, beautiful glass cockpit, animated pilot, etc. only some weird problem I encountered so far: First thing is the sound of the engine is extremely lound, you can prove that by changing your view to an AI airplane (which stay like 40+ NM away from you) you can still hear the sound of your own engine, does it make sense? of course not. The other thing is this plane cannot use steering wheel, to turn the plane during taxi I usually add some thrust and then the differential break (default NUMPAD * and NUMPAD -) to turn left or right.

Worth my hard-earned money

Overall 8/10

name: eSail Sailing Simulator
short_description: eSail Sailing Simulator is an authentic yacht sailing experience with numerous tutorials, sailing, mooring and anchoring modes, charting, challenges, races, Live Sailing mode, 'Learn Yachting with eSail' and more.
reviews:
Highly Recommended Yacht Sailing Simulator!

I am currently taking a yacht skipper course, and this simulator has been an absolute game-changer for me. It provides an incredibly realistic sailing experience, allowing me to practice navigation, maneuvering, and different sailing conditions from the comfort of my home.

The graphics and physics are highly accurate, making it feel like you're actually out on the water. It has helped me build confidence and improve my skills before heading out to sail in real life. I highly recommend this simulator to anyone learning to sail or looking to sharpen their skills! Usefull tool to learn for beginners. I learned a lot at least. Never sailed in real life but I`ve seen a lot of videos and at least finally I can understand what are they talking about "jib sheet, gybing...etc"

The game is a bit blank and the terrain is knd of ugly. The island could help some trees and road and things to be a bit more visually appeling. More boats would be nice too as well ship interiors. Missions? Collect this box and bring into there...etc.

Again Good learning tool, Ok game, bit overpriced (¬£30). Cheper than a real a boat. Buy it cheap or if you want to learn. Learning how to sail with this is fun and easy. Being able to repeat lessons at my leisure until I'm comfortable with them. Great beginner learning tool and easy experimentation with concepts. Helped me build my sailing intuition and knowledge base. Looking forward to comparing it to real sailing when the time comes. I have been playing this game parallel to learning to sail. This game has certainly made learning fun and easier. It gives a good overview of what you need to know and provides insight into what to expect and what will be required of you as a sailor when the time comesüòâ If you're into sailing, this sim is good to practice techniques that you can implement on a real boat without worrying about hazards and consequences of being at sea. Very fun and accurate. This was of massive help before I got IRL sailing cert. It's much cheaper to properly learn the ropes and run a boat into a mooring several times here than it is on a real boat :D Best sailing simulator I've found.  Enjoying it very much. Great way to learn sailing information in many languages! I played through in English and am starting go through in Spanish. This is by far the most immersive and detailed sailing simulation I have found.  Most of the VR sailing is very clunky and does not seem to have enough fidelity to use a halyard or release a cleat.  I really enjoy this game/simulator.

name: Moonbase Lambda
short_description: The base is silent‚Äîas if abandoned. The air feels heavy, and oxygen is running out. In the shadows, something stirs. You can hear it, but you can‚Äôt see it. Every step echoes in the darkness, every sound makes your pulse race. Survive. Escape. Before time runs out.
reviews:
This is basically an old game. In 2015 a game was released called "Monstrum", if you played/know this game, i can tell you that Moonbase Lambda is Monstrum on the moon and with a smaller map. If you dont, imagine runnig through dark rooms and a monster tries to kill you. The differences between Moonbase Lambda and Monstrum are the pixel fliter, the dumber and nearly blind Monster as well as a way to escape the monster once it catches you. I would call this game the young brother of Monstrum. I recommend this for the price of 4,79‚Ç¨ i keep dying Fun game, cool aesthetic, and decent replay value.  Completing all the achievements was a bit challenging, but pretty fun to do.  You'll like this game if you enjoy Alien Isolation, Monstrum, etc.  The AI in my experience tends to camp around the player really tightly sometimes which isn't bad, but can make the game drag on longer than normal.  The monster seems to like walking back n forth in the area it last heard the player, but will only move a few steps not giving the player a chance to run or sneak away.  I feel like this could be more fun to deal with if the random items you can pick up around map that can be thrown would cause noise to temporarily lure the monster towards it making a cool dynamic between managing random items that can be picked up/thrown and glowsticks.  Overall worth the money and is pretty fun spooky as hell Crazy good at building atmosphere and generating tension. Scary and short. Loved this, that's all I want to say about it. Go try it for yourself and don't get caught~ A spiritual successor to Alien: Isolation which boasts several impressive quality of life improvements, including quicker scenarios, a much smaller hard drive footprint, improved visuals that better emphasize the lo-fi "retrofuture" vibe (and immersive bleakness) of the original Alien film, and - perhaps most importantly - no flamethrower that lets you simply bully the monster into a corner. I also really liked the musical cue when the monster is on your trail, leaving you wanting to check every direction in dread, as you know death is already approaching... or just immediately bolt like a rabbit, even if you might blindly pick the worst possible direction and die like the braindead alien food that you were always fated to become. A promising debut for this indie developer. I cant say that AI is well written, and the theme/shader is need a little rework. But game and the idea is really great and its very fun! Definitely worth giving a try. [h1]The moonbase Lambda is quiet and dark.

 Players will have to complete several objectives to escape from the darkness. By turning on the generator, you can check the base map, which is the main hint. There are several ways to escape, and you can turn the flashlight on and off to avoid being caught by monsters, and you can escape from the monsters once with an item called a flare. The concept of a player being left alone trying to escape from the moon base is clear, and it seems like a good game because it presents clear objectives from the beginning, such as restoring communication and attaching batteries to the spaceship. I think it would be a good playground for speedrunners.

name: Luminous Project
short_description: A national project where six girls play melodies to save the Earth. This is a simple rhythm game where you press keys in time with falling notes. Play through a variety of songs and gather the light of hope, Luminous!
reviews:
Okay, I want to preface that while I don't necessarily recommend this game I also don't wanna write it off entirely. I am, at the time of writing this review, still capable to refund but I won't. I plan to play this more and keep it. 

I am still choosing to not recommend it due to its flaws, though.

First of all the characters are clearly AI generated art. Now, I don't care as characters isn't really what I play a rhythm game for anyway. But, I just feel they could have put in some effort to fix up the art a bit after generating it. This is what I do for OCs I create (I am a roleplayer). And considering they use this art for profit and not even personal use like I do, the fact they put in less effort, is a pretty bad look. 

The game offers 120 songs in total which is a good library. All songs I've played so far and browsed through, are ones I've never heard. They're likely royalty free, I am not sure, but the good thing is that most of them sound pretty pleasant and I like that they're not very well known to me. Cuz after 120 diff rhythm games or so, it is nice not to run into the same songs most of them use, over and over again. (Though I can never grow tired of Brainpower LOL) 

The charting seems okay if not a little too easy even on hard mode. The playing field is a bit too wide in my opinion. Most vertical scrolling rhythm games have much smaller lanes granting a much better overview. I wish it was the case in this game, too. Or the option to make it less wide. It would be a lot more comfortable for the player. Of course, the notes do not play the actual music when hit, they just give a clicky sound. You can lower the volume on it to the point of not having it be heard at all, as some prefer.

Another glaring issue is that the game does not offer calibration, neither for sound nor visuals. And while the charting seems okay, as I said, I do feel that, to stay in line with the music, I have to hit the note a bit later than I feel I should based on the visuals. It really feels like I am always cutting it really close to missing the note, as it's almost off the board already by the time I'd hit it to make sense with the music. And if I do not hit it where it makes sense with the music, but solely based on the visuals, it doesn't feel good cuz it'll be off-key. 

I'd say the game is still worth it if you're a rhythm game fanatic like me who loves playing through a bunch of them. Especially since it has a decent sized song library and is not that expensive, especially if on sale. 

But if you just want a cheap rhythm game to start with, then there's many others that are a better choice for little money. I personally recommend MUSNYX as a solid choice. Super cheap, tons of songs, visually better, songs are key-sounded with the actual songs, and you can pick between 4 or 6 key.  It's cheaper than this game and much higher quality than this one, too.

name: Milky Quest II
short_description: You find yourself in a world full of cute monster girls! The only problem is you lost your memories and all the monster girls want to eat you for nourishment! How will you survive!?
reviews:
SPOILERS!!!!! kinda


Game was great with the animations and different girls but had the same animations for the breeding and too much to grind to even have fun unless you like super time consuming grinding best to cheat if you want to hear the story and all that shi instead of the horrible Grinds and beating and useless healing while in combat, only downside was the story and the twist of that and the blue hair boy, brother i want to f not watch someone f, and where are those monster girls that sucked him off?, if there ever do a milky quest 3 or such i hope they do an better story then this and let me do more of the f ing and not cucking, ever Past the obvious RPGmaker/Wolf jank lies a passion project.
It's essentially Pokemon with girls, with combat directly inspired by Helen's Mysterious Castle. Lots of attention to detail, all the characters are cute, ton of events and text to go through. Pixel animations are fantastic.
Hope more people will discover this hidden gem.

In case you weren't aware, this is an EROGE and a patch is required. I also recommend a mod to remove the splash screen and disclaimer at startup for when you reload (for one reason or another) Fun and short turn based rpg game with a good story (I've lost gallons) - making positive reviews for hentai games recommends them to your friends which ruins their steam store page with hentai games

somehow they requires a patch which makes it weird cause kinda the whole thing for this game

kinda meh too basic of gameplay and gets grindy Thanks to some guy who told me how to patch 10/10 game "Sexcellent!" Tiddies and perhaps also booty Nice.
But I wanna play Pokemon now.

Game is honestly a very tedious grind for scenes and unlocks.
If you get burnout from that, fortunately, there is a cheat that helps you out.
But to be fair, I myself had a blast with this game, despite the grind. 
And the Monsters and Scenes are very well designed for a Pixel-Art Game. It's all very cute but waaay too repetitive.
Also the lack of volume and brightness options are annoying. It really makes enjoying it difficult when your eardrums are being blown out and you're being flash-banged every time someone climaxes.

name: Zaccaria Pinball - VR
genres: Casual, Free To Play, Indie, Simulation, Sports
short_description: Experience the atmosphere of Zaccaria Pinball in Virtual Reality.
reviews:
Obviously works for others but for me it has an issue with CTD now and again in VR, refunded. The choice for VR Pinball.

You're not gonna recognize any of the boards, unless you're big on pinball, I guess.

Myself, I just thought it would be fun and funny to have a pinball sim because it's like a hundred pinball machines but in a virtual space.

It really delivers! I think the team did a good job with the IPs that they had, especially when they put all those remix variants together for each of the eras of pinball. This VR mode might actually be the most essential thing a pinball fan can find on Steam and one of the best examples of how VR can enhance an existing genre without feeling like a gimmick. I love pinball in all its forms and I've tried just about every big pinball platform on steam, and while I like them all the one thing that's always a hassle is the fact that very long, very flat Pinball tables don't really display well on very horizontal, very widescreen computer monitors. There have been a number of workarounds over the years and while I can generally find a playable camera angle, trying this VR mode out was a revelation. The scale is perfect, it's like you're actually standing in front of a pinball table and the fact that you can just turn your head or dart your eyes to follow where the ball is and look at what you're doing is so simple and so obvious but a massive game changer for the playability and enjoyability of digital pinball. 

There [i]are[/i] other solutions for seeing the whole table that have come up over the years, if you've got a monitor on a swivel you [i]could[/i] do that, or you could even get one of those virtual pinball machines that has the shape and size of the real thing, but a with a screen, but that's such a massive space and money investment for something that basically does one thing. In my opinion simply playing in a VR headset is far more convenient, especially if you've got a Quest 3 where you can just plug it in with a single cable (or airlink) and forgo all the mess and setup of something like the Index.

My only complaint with the experience, and it is unfortunately a pretty noticeable one, is that if you get an achievement, the "Achievement Unlocked" window is not only massive, but also covers up your flippers which is kind of insane. I'm not sure if there's an in-game setting to change how that pops up but it's the one flaw in an otherwise stellar experience. I really want to love this game in VR, and almost do.....almost!  I think it just needs tweaking as it will be playing flawlessly at 90fps then suddenly drop to 30-40 then back up.  It takes away from the enjoyment.  I keep tabs on my rig and the GPU and CPU never go above 50%.  The game looks beautiful however and the physics are very realistic.  

Please optimise a little more, as I'm sure it's not my rig.

i7 9700k, 3070ti, 32gb ram, quest 2 via link cable Experienced on Oculus Rift.

First of all, [B]don't buy this stand-alone[/b], buy the bundle, even if (actually especially if) you already own the tables, as the tables you own get knocked off the price but the significant bundle discount remains, even if this VR mode is the only item left.

That said, the experience works, though the reduced resolution (at least on my Rift) is both noticeable and impactful. But it does still feel immersive, to the point that I had to remind myself to not try to lean on the table while playing.

I won't make use of it often, as it's easier to see details and the entire playfield at once on monitor, and "fly cam" lets you alter perspective in a VR type fashion to inspect ramps and angles. But I do think it's worth the (bundle discounted) price, for when I am in the mood for a more immersive experience. I bougth the platinum pack and have been playing about 30 hours now. Very very good piece of software. Did not try out multiplayer.

Intel 4790, Nvidia 1080 GTX, 32 GB RAM, HP Reverb G2

Graphics VR Pinball: 10/10
Graphics VR Location: 3/10
Ball Physics: 10/10
Sounds: 3/10
Joy: 10/10 I've changed my previous recommendation after successfully playing this on VR for several months.  I don't know what changed... but it does work now.

[b]Previous Recommendation from April 2022:[/b]
Don't buy the VR game add-on. It's broken, and throws an error with Valve Index. VR Pinball is the next best thing to owning actual tables, flat monitor just doesnt cut it once you have tried VR. This is how you do a VR addition to a game. Every single table that you already have in your collection is available in VR as well. And they look amazing in VR. The other big Pinball franchise on Steam aren't as generous with their (abandoned?) VR effort... Show your support to this great developer and get the VR version as well :) 

I get some stuttering from time to time, but I blame that on my ancient CPU (i5-4670K), not on my GPU (Radeon RX 5700 XT). Using Valve Index and the controls are working fine.

 This works well on the Oculus Quest 2 via Steam VR and looks really great. One thing I hope the developers change is the room layout which is set up as if you are on a film set with a missing back wall with film lighting etc. This really breaks the immersion for me, it would be much better if it were a complete normal room and also that you could move around it as well. But otherwise great - highly recommend.

Edit: When trying the sitting down VR option it was not possible to get the view into a good position (too far away and not high enough) even when modifying with the options available. So if the view options could have a wider range that would be great. Yeah I'm a lazy, lazy man who likes to be sat down ;)

name: Puzzle - STONE BLOCKS
short_description: Games for meditation and relaxation. Have 180 levels.
reviews: It's cool but no window mode throws me off

name: Hidden Deep
short_description: Hidden Deep is an atmospheric sci-fi action game heavily inspired by Aliens, The Thing, and Half-Life. Explore, climb, swim, scan, blast and shoot your way through dangerous missions in a huge sub oceanic mining and research facility. Fear the horrors that lurk below‚Ä¶
reviews:
fun it's gud i hope these guys are getting paid enough for the shit they are put through... the game got popular with the coop experimental feature. if you want to give the multiplayer branch a shot.. don't. it says "experimental" but its like barely functional. we had to restart 4 times for a single campaign mode. bunch of sfot locks, insane visual glitches, overall felt like  waste of time. the friend that suggested me to play this is a stupid bitch. I requested a refund. I hope the dev comes back after 12 months of no update and continues to polish the game. Launch game, go straight to safe-mode, and still doesn't start. Enjoyed playing 6 minutes of safe-mode menu and submitted request for refund. I do not recommend the game in current state, but may revisit when the game is further developed. buggy fucking mess looking forward to the update This game is surprisingly good. It is intense and I love the atmosphere. Keep it up developer and don't give up on this game. I would love to see a fleshed out multiplayer system. First of all, this is an excellent game. Secondly, would I recommend it to everyone? No. So what's the reason for this on the first look contradicting statement?

The game does one thing: it puts you in a setting really similar to the Alien franchise, its spin-offs, and the fan fiction. You explore a facility and adjacent chasms which have fallen victim to a horrible catastrophe and are now crawling with aliens of all kinds. Most people are dead.

If you are a fan of the Alien franchise, you will see a lot of similarities and references to used equipment and monsters, which is really cool since there aren't a whole lot of games that will let you utilize and experience those in the way this game does.

So if you are really into all of that, get the game and have fun; you will probably love it. Since not so long ago, you are also able to bring a friend into the game with you, but only for some selected missions. Also this feature is still in very early alpha/beta, so be ready to deal with a bunch of issues. The developers have been really upfront with that, which is quite rare nowadays. GAME-BREAKING BUGS MAY APPEAR IN THE BETA VERSIONS; THAT'S WHY IT'S A BETA! (Close/open the game, uninstall/reinstall it, restart Steam, restart your system, switch game versions, and reinstall again. Something will work sooner or later.)

Now that the pros are out of the way, let's get to the cons. Who should NOT buy the game:

Anyone that expects a completely finished and neatly polished game. Again, it's a beta and some features are still in alpha.

Anyone that needs a fleshed-out and well-written storyline. The story is existent but mostly only tells you where to go next. It's not a novel.

Anyone who needs a lot of different things to do in a game. You will do the same stuff all the time. Climb in caves, use machinery, blast aliens, search objectives. That's it. Either you love it or hate it.

Really short conclusion:

Pros:

- small size (about 2 GB)

- low system requirements

- Alien fans will love the setting

- the mechanics all feel amazing (shooting, movement, climbing,  actions)

- you can change the settings to give yourself a real challenge.

Cons:

- stability (Beta/Alpha)

- repetitive (might feel like a chore at some points; again, either you love it or hate it)

- little guidance through the individual levels. A lot of trial and error.

All in all, a decent game for 7 bucks if it's on sale. Follow my advice and either get it or don't. I really like it a lot. Cant wait for online coop. Game is amazing.

name: Alien Blitz
short_description: Alien Blitz is a 3d action-shooter with lots of bullets, missiles, weapons, maps and monsters.Take your shotgun and go kill some Aliens !
reviews:

Has a total of [b]6[/b] trading cards. This game is amazing!!! A little rough around the edges as they say, but if you‚Äôre the type of gamer who likes to poke around looking for secrets, and aren‚Äôt turned off by the graphic style, you‚Äôll love it! I‚Äôd love to see a remake of this one day, with a graphic style something like uragun, or armored cavalry. Very fun top-down shooter, really enjoyed all the nods to classic games throughout! Levels are nicely paced and put together, graphics are appealing and sound design is good. Might be cool if you could customize your mech a bit or if it changed appearance based on upgrades.

name: From The Earth (ÌîÑÎ°¨ Îçî Ïñ¥Ïä§)
short_description: "A Journey to the space to find the heartwarming love between father and daughter" - An astronaut father spends his time with his lovely daughter, 'Hae-mi' before he embarks on journey to the universe. One day, he wakes up in the space and unexpectedly comes across aliens. But the truth is, whom aliens actually met is his soul.
reviews:
Enjoyed and recommend. Bought on sale for $2.79, great price. I think the $7 full price tag is reasonable if you're not strapped for cash, just understand it's a short film (~12 minutes).

The developers/storytellers clearly have experience telling stories in VR. This story is short and sweet, but what really brings it to life is the creative visual storytelling utilizing the VR medium. It's very well done, with beautiful and interesting and fun visual moments that are synthesized with the story.

The english voice acting is a little dull, but not bad, and it does its job.
I actually liked this enough that I watched it twice in a row (back to back), first in English then in Korean (which I do not understand) to hear it in its original language. I expected to just watch the first minute to get a sense of how it sounds in Korean, but ended up watching the whole thing over. I'm sure I'm not the best judge since I don't speak/understand Korean, but it seemed to me the Korean voice acting was more organic and emotive, so for my fellow non-Korean-speakers, I do recommend watching it again in Korean after you've watched it in English! I also suspect the last lines work better in Korean than in the English translation, which comes off a bit sideways.

Lovely experience. Nice short story, beautiful visuals. [h1]Experienced on the Oculus Rift[/h1]

This is a 13 minute long, purely cinematic experience. You only need motion controllers at the start, to change language from Korean to English and press start or quit (although it quits automatically at the end so it's strange that it's there). It's running on the Unreal Engine and it is voiced in English.

This is a weird sci-fi story. The visuals are absolutely amazing. It's a mix of cartoon-type models, mixed with almost realistic backdrops & 3D models and environments. Visually, this is triple A quality stuff. Seeing the cartoony-looking characters mixed with the realistic looking environments is odd though. The scales are off in some of the scenes though (characters are way too big or 3D models are way too small relative to the surroundings). 

The story was just okay for me. It's not the quality of Google story-telling. I just found it plain weird and the ending was like WTF to me. The voice acting was nice, nothing special. I think the story was too short and it just didn't allow for the needed depth to this sci-fi mystical tale. Due to a scene involving death, I'm not sure this is appropriate for little kids.

Overall, I do think this is overpriced for what it is. Almost $7 USD for almost 13 minutes of entertainment. Gloomy Eyes was $9 USD, but it's 30 minutes long. However, I got this on sale for $3.49 USD and that seems like a justifiable price (although still on the high side). Ideally, it would only be normal price of $2-3 max. This is a better value proposition (and higher production values too IMO) though than Follow The Rabbit, which is by the same dev!

[b]Rate 5.5/10. Nice overall, just too expensive IMO. [/b] This animated short is about the same quality as Google's Spotlight Stories Shorts that we no longer get on Steam.  That is to say good quality animation and sound.  

The story is emotional and tugs at you, especially if you have children, but also if you think of your parents.  It is somewhat strange and has sci-fi elements.

I always said I would be willing to pay for the Spotlight shorts and here is the chance to pay for something similar and support this DEV.  It is worth the full price, IMO.

Make sure to switch the language to the one you want before starting, because it is default on Korean.

Recommend 9/10

name: Poker Pretty Girls Battle : Fantasy World Edition
short_description: Come play some hot rounds of poker at the Fantasy World casino! Try your luck against a total of 16 Pretty Girls including elves, magical girls, female swordsmen, and demons who are awaiting your arrival! Featuring popular Texas Hold'em rules.
reviews:
Get this one over the 2015 version. I guess one could consider this an intro to Texas Hold'Em Poker. Thing is, the AI can be a bit wonky. As in, it isn't all that great. It either decides to constant raise you, or it checks. But if you enjoy long drawn out battles, or playing against buxom women, this is for you. The pretty Game is for Smug Faces only.
Fav girl - Chicage.
 Same **** as the first game, but with a light fantasy coat of paint on it (even though fantasy elements existed in the first game). It gets really boring, and tedious with the blinds never increasing. So you and the AI can just camp until you have good cards. That's why the blinds are supposed to increase. To keep the players active. It's cheap, you get what you pay for. 

You can sucker the AI in with a 10-20 pre-flop raise, then granted you've got over 150 chips, go all in and force everyone to fold. 

After I got to stage 4 I got bored with this. 

No naked hentai pics, just cleavage.  No backstory on characters either.

name: Sherlock Holmes Chapter One - Season Pass
short_description: Keep your investigation going with the Season Pass, featuring new quests.
reviews:
The DLC bundle is a decent pickup overall on sale. Beyond a Joke is the most fun of the DLCs, I played it last and I was a bit disappointed until that point. With all of the content now released, it's not much easier for me to tell you whether or not it's worth it. In terms of value, you get seven cases; technically there are eight, but the final "case" of M for Mystery doesn't really count for reasons you'll see if you play it. With the exception of the first one, Saints and Sinners, they're all at least fairly good, though they're not particularly long (about the length of your typical side quest case, so an average of thirty minutes to an hour depending on your speed) and may only add up to a few hours of extra content total. It's also worth mentioning that you do get an extra scavenger hunt that's surprisingly fun, and can add some more to that final count, and there are some outfits thrown in here and there if you enjoy the dress-up mechanic.

For $25, I would say it's aiming a bit above its weight class, and personally I'd recommend waiting for a sale -- but if you're reading this before playing the game, I think it's a worthwhile suggestion to at least consider buying it early, after playing enough of the base game to know whether or not you actually like its mechanics to begin with. The base game itself suffers a lot from being open world, at least in my opinion, and for the most part it's very empty, with little incentive to wander around outside of where the cases take you. These DLCs might not add up to a lot, but most of them do activate fairly early on, and spreading any bit of extra content around its open world will probably make it a better experience as a whole, rather than playing them afterward. this "Season Pass"  just 3 mini quest  cut out on full release game
 (2021 to 2022.2.14  no any updata )
DLC ? Season Pass ?  just a f*cking lying
