name: Call of Duty¬Æ: Black Ops III - Zetsubou No Shima Zombies Map
short_description: In this installment of the epic Zombies saga, the Origins characters head to 'Zetsubou No Shima', a tropical island overrun with mutated experiments that are hell-bent on destruction. Get a bonus of 5 vials of Liquid Divinium to help in fighting off the undead.
reviews:
i know people hated it but the easter egg was too easy, aside that i loved it. first map i hit round 150+ this is fun but only sometimes my favorite DLC for BO3. most grounded Easter egg next to origins. meaning you progressing the EE/unlocking weapons feels immersive and like your actually doing things that matter around the map. look up plant recipes. and the spider bait guide to get the most out of the map. you can get infinite quick revive/ammo if you make the eggs over and over again. which you are going to need to get over round 50. 

Issues: 

you need the other 3 morons on your team to get their challenges done to beat the EE. which can be nearly impossible in public games.

SPOILER: the watering the plant step underwater is "rebarded" 3/5 Zetsubou No Shima is fun that fucking plane that i hate The absolute best DLC this game has to offer. The set up is fun and has many tasks to keep your engaged, and the Easter egg is very fun and rewarding with the cut scene. The atmosphere is also really great. 10/10 Underrated map honestly Acitivision is a bunch of scumbags that killed the H2M mod. They can suck my left and right nuts for their greedy actions. Eat sh*t you creatively bankrupt money hungry losers This isn't a bad map at all, it's just simply not for me as most of it feels like a chore rather than a fun experience though it does have alot of good ideas. 

Positives:
- Plant System both a positive and negative but it's worth it just for the revive plant alone as it helps alot during Solo
- Skull of Nansapwe should've been the wonder weapon as it's that good 
- Underwater combat is really interesting and surprisingly works nicely, welcome addition 
- Hiding an OP perk (Widows Wine) behind a boss fight is a perfect example of progression, as locking an OP item or ability behind a boss fight, quest etc should be normalised as it's a perk that built into BO3 so much so that it's a crutch perk so again i wish they did this more often. 
- Spider Boss Fight is simple and easy to access aswell as to fight. 
- Playable Spider 
- KT4 Wonder Weapon being built with the map is a unique idea that again i wish more maps did it often (using it for spores for speed boost, miniboss, plant watering, etc)
- Spider rounds, another positive and negative but the positive being they act unique and are an interesting idea which i prefer compared to the done to death Hellhound Rounds, they also change the map by webbing up doors, paths and perks which makes them unique to go up against.

Negatives: 
- Plant System both a positive and negative but it's worth it just for the revive plant alone as it helps alot during Solo
- Pack a Punch requires a guide in order to figure it out, a casual would be able to find atleast 2 parts while the spider webbed part would be unclear as that's literally the only time in the entire map you need to knife webbed corpses to find a part. 
- Thrasher's feel like they have the Shangri La spawn system but 10x worse, as they spawn literally every round sometimes 3-4 at most and you earn no points from killing them which makes it feel so tedious and annoying
- The maps atmosphere, story and level of detail kinda falls short due to BO3s colourful engine aswell as lack of sound design that makes it not feel scary or even creepy which is a shame since that's what they were going for but doesn't hit the mark at all mainly since the reason Verruckt was so powerful horror wise was due to its atmosphere, sound design and lack of firepower/powerful perks to get you going making you feel underpowered in a haunted location. If you make the player OP or even powerful then any and all fear is lost. 
- The Easter Egg itself is underwhelming as it's literally just fixing an elevator, which sounds underwhelming because it is as it's a really tedious and boring experience due to being a massive fetch quest, the zipline part is really bad on Solo since if you mess it up just once then it's Game Over and all progress is lost due to an underpolished/clear step on how to jump off the zipline.(example would be it doesn't say "Press F to jump off zipline", just that simple idea would fix the entire steps problem) 
- The Easter Egg as mentioned has to do with fixing the elevator which unlocks a new area, on a new playthrough that elevator nor area is unlocked. Both should be unlocked right away as a reward for doing the easter egg exactly how BO2 did it with the pylons changing colour to indicate EE completion. 
- Easter Egg requires a specific gobblegum (Anywhere But Here) yet it never tells you, hints or even gives a free gum as a way to signal it 
- Spider rounds, another positive and negative but the negative is their hitbox being really bad when it comes to knifing so it feels awkward 
-  KT4 Wonder Weapon Upgrade required you to look up a guide since it doesn't tell you there is an upgrade aswell how the steps on how to do it. The hitbox on the hidden plant seed underwater is horrible to the point where you're able to get stuck and drown which is really unfair. 
- 95% of the map with or without EE, is just finding/building parts as a way to setup such as the shield, gas mask, KT4, planting seeds, watering seeds etc which is why the map feels so mixed as it's not bad, it just doesn't execute them in a way that's fun or satisfying. 

If Steam had a "mixed" option i'd select that but i choose negative since i don't really have a reason to go back to the map and if most of the setup process is finding/building items rather than killing zombies then i'm not interested in playing the map at that point.

name: AZURE STRIKER GUNVOLT OFFICIAL SOUNDTRACK
short_description: The original soundtrack to Azure Striker Gunvolt has officially arrived!
reviews:
Good music. I just wish it wasn't DLC and was purchasable without needing the base game. In addition, it'd have been nice if you were able to grab the music files via the "soundtrack" feature of steam without browsing the files of the game after getting the DLC. Superb! If you love Azure Strike Gunvolt, you'll love this.
ÊåÅ„Å£„Å¶„Å¶Êêç„ÅØ„Åó„Å™„ÅÑ„Ç¢„É´„Éê„É†„Åß„Åô Nice music! Hopefully, I can buy more this kind of music in the future! Thanks, Developers!

name: The Zwuggels - A Beach Holiday Adventure for Kids
short_description: Let your kid ( 4 years and older ) join the Zwuggels on an amazing trip in this interactive Summer adventure. Winner of PAEDI 2016 Award for outstanding children's software (Munich, Germany).
reviews:
rewdesgjdfvgtdsy fydts nice game My 4 year old loved it. She learned how to use a mouse(tiny travel mouse) within the first stage. Finished the game in about 2-3 hours total. The cues and pointers are just enough for her to figure out what to do, we were never stumped even when she clicked pass the opening text. Its just a sound track so unless your child can read, you will need to read it for them. No controversial topics or politics. Pretty clean, well made, just long enough game. Id would gladly purchase additional chapters if they exist or come to steam. Highly recommended. Short and does not read itself. That makes no sense to me. It can be played again, and my kid enjoyed it, but she doesn't read yet, I truly do not understand why you would not have voiced the story..... If you want your kid to learn hand eye co-ordination and mouse usage this is very good. My 8 year old daughter loves this game. 

50 hours of quiet so far. üê±‚Äçüë§ Great game. My 4 year old and 7 year old have both played and enjoyed the game. Very good for teaching mouse movement and clicking for the younger one, and a fun story too. A simple game for kids getting used to computers.

Simple controls, colorful graphics... this isn't going to win any Game of the Year awards, but young kids can have a lot of fun. It's great practice on how to use a mouse to control a cursor, so it's a good fine motor activity, as well! A great game for 5-6 year olds to learn to read and use the mouse and do some puzzles. Very quick game. But worth 3 bucks. I was looking for a game where my 6yr old could practice mouse skills without any pressure and this was perfect. The added reading practice really kept their attention. The story was fun and the animation is great. This is the first game they have finished on their own and immediately wanted more.

name: Drone Hunter VR
short_description: Are you prepared to defend the world against an alien invasion? Test your skills and reflexes in this highly immersive and intense game - Drone Hunter VR. You will be put through a series of tests to prove you are worthy to defend our planet using the top secret DH125, a hybrid alien/US weapon. Will you be the chosen one?
reviews:
Drone Hunter is a solid shooter, I always make new VR people play this as their last one.  I say last because it becomes very overwhelming to a beginner.  After you get used to it you just want more....Drone Hunter!! A fun little wave shooter. Junk game. well its decent not god but some dodging and just fire guns, bosses did 2 only was decently fun in arcade.

Refunding due to this being a bundle and teh rolercoster contacted epic games, well firewall killed that but all i did was watch a rolercoster for 2 min. epic might get a cent so taking my 1.34 euro back

This game might acculy be worth the 1 dollar but there are way better stuff out there. Made it through to nearly third difficulty level play through on one life, pulled groin muscle dodging shots on the last boss of third play....

9/10  WILL play again! (when my leg is better HAHA)

1 point removed because the startup tutorial glitches really really bad and jitters, as soon as she is done her speech its perfectly normal and plays fabulously!  Fix that ill make it a 10 :) It is good game, you can have lot of fun with this game
I think it is kinda short but it is fun and will make you enjoy
if  you play against your friends to get better score, i am sure you will have a blast Worth Checking out!!....works VERY well , Highly pollished. Game is too short, but I had fun playing it. It made me look around, dodge, crouch down. It is fun.  space invaders + VR = fun !! dont like this game much

name: TIME SOUL
short_description: TIME SOUL is a souls-like action-platformer with generative unique worlds, platforms and planets. Defeat time guardians, collect clocks and shards, and stop the time before facing the Time Lord. Randomized bosses, mobs, 300+items, 50+weapons and spells, Conquer the galaxy in 60 minutes!
reviews:
This is one of the strangest games I've ever played. The world map is truly amazing - sensory overload of textures, shaders, VFX, and animations. It has a truly unique visual style, and dozens of complex interlocking systems. It's also barely playable. If the dev is reading this, first thank you, and secondly please fix the bug that puts me inside of the giant woman when I die. I have to hard quit the game each time. This game really needed more time to cook and probably even more playtesting on top of that. It has potential from how it's set up, but it's a mess of technical issues which really barred me from even playing the game. The game's graphics settings is pretty standard, but the worst part of it is the fact that the game doesn't actually save anything you actually change in the menu. It appears to change when you're in the title menus, but once you get into the game itself it goes to the default settings and acts as if you never changed anything. It has gamepad support, but half of the time it doesn't work and will force you to use your mouse which in turn will sometimes make you not able to use your gamepad again until you restart the game from the main menu. The bindings for the gamepad also seem to be massively broken, as the buttons you press do not do the action that it says it does in the menu, and I even remapped the buttons to see if it fixed anything but it felt like it removed me ability to even punch with my fists? Before remapping melee defaulted to the left stick button for some reason but after I set it to RB/RT, it just seems I lost my ability to even melee attack.
In terms of other things I've noticed in the little time I've played the game, all the NPCs I've met say the same thing of "Want to gamba?", and in one of the stores there's an item in there several different times with a broken description that just has lines of code in its description,
I know I went into this with lower expectations because of how everything about it seemed too good to be true and with how suspicious a lot of it seemed, but it greatly disappoints me how I can't even play the game long enough to even see if the things in the trailer and this store page are even true to begin with. I can deal with this being a meme of a game if they at least polished out the technical issues so it can be playable,
Update: I've managed to play a bit more, and I'm starting to notice that certain mechanics for the game just don't seem to work or require you to interact with something but there's no indication of that. Restoring my keybinds to default also didn't fix my controls, as I still cannot attack when I press the keys that are bound to attack.
I'll update this if these issues get fixed so I can actually give the game a review based on the content in it.

name: Biolab Wars
short_description: Inspired by the 8-bit games and by the movies from the 80's, your goal is to blow things up, defeat aliens and fight bizarre bosses in this platformer 2D with classic mechanics.
reviews:
This game tries to be an old school run and gun but fails horribly due to the terrible level design. However this issue isn't a kind that gives frustration, it makes the game super easy,bland and boring. Literally every level is just couple of enemy types placed around randomly. There is no thought behind enemy placements at all,they are just there and creator doesn't do anything interesting with them. Boss fights are quite bland as well. They have one or two specific attacks and keep repeating those. I especially find the chicken boss's laser attack quite lame. It always shoots at the exact same place. Had like 100 mins in the game and already got all achievements. Achievements like "kill all enemies" is not fun nor anything skillful. Also you want people to beat the game with each character even though they all work exactly same? That's not good. So overall game has serious design issues and offer nothing interesting. Just a bland run and gun game. So, this tries to be a Contra clone, but there are a couple issues with it. First, there's a time limit per level. This seems unneeded as it ruins the idea of strategy as you feel you need to rush the level. Second, ammunition is limited and requires pickups to main anything besides your base weapon, so you will run out if you do an auto fire type setup. Third, bullets can at times blend into the background; making bullets harder to miss than needed. This is painfully apparent in level 2.

It's not that this is a horrid game, but there are better options out there. I definitely have to recommend Biolab Wars! 2ndBoss managed to capture the look and feel of games like Contra, and just stuck to the basics.

The gameplay is spot on, the visuals are fantastic and the soundtrack complements the on screen action perfectly.

I had a blast playing through this and if you are a fan of run and gun games I'm sure you will too. Bio Lab Wars is a $1 Contra clone. It's not bad either. Not many games can say they have a chicken that shoots lasers as a sub weapon. Really Love this game reminds me of a Super Contra or Midnight Resistance game on steroids! Hell Yea!!! I am the world record holder. un juego entretenido estilo Contra muy retro. uninspired, lazy design Good callback to the NES run and Guns like Contra great soundtrack. Levels and bosses offer an ok challenge. Only issue is trying to beat the game without dying. it's a challenge with the flying enemies and the 1 hit kill lazer in Level 7. Great little gem, all the better for being a very playable contra clone with a health bar. Needs patching it so that a little health is lost when you fall down a hole rather than a whole life. My only gripe with it.

name: We Must Praise Our Glorious Leader The Flumf
short_description: We Must Praise Our Glorious Leader The Flumf is a 2D side-scrolling resource-gathering and building game. Collect items, build buildings, fend off enemies from your pile, and as always fulfil the eternal hunger of The Flumf.
reviews:
this game seems ready for mystery and unsettling spoiler it's not  killed 4 hours on this and it was okay buy this if you need some mindless unsettling weirdness otherwise pass I wish I passed I'm kinda torn on leaving a Thumbs Down on this game. On one hand, I did have fun mindlessly playing it for about 2 hours. It does have a lot of charm with the kind of spooky dark vibes that you can see in the trailer, and progressing through the game feels satisfying... Up to a certain point.

Firstly, there NO ENDING to this game (just a screen and achievement similar to when you pass the first couple "levels"), which was extremely disheartening. I thought I'd be rewarded with some kind of lore for grinding through this game, but no. Just a 2.5 second screen, and then it's back to the game... Except at this point there's no real objective anymore.

The game is also filled with various glitches. Not only does it crash randomly sometimes, there are also glitches that effect the gameplay. Sometimes you'll find that you're not able to build various buildings - for absolutely no reason. If you close the game and open it back up, you MIGHT find that you're able to build it now. Randomly. No rhyme or reason to this.

Another glitch: When you complete your first main objective (I'm being vague intentionally here), your workers will retain their upgrades. If you close the game and open it back up, you'll have to upgrade them again. Not sure which part of this is a glitch, but I don't think they're supposed to stay upgraded tbh.

The game does have its charm and it's only $3 or less. Try it if you want despite the seemingly harsh review. I think I just had high hopes for this game because it looked so intriguing, so maybe I am being a bit critical overall. I would be willing to change my review if the dev fixed some of the problems I mentioned... First and foremost the lack of a real ending.

Anyway, if you want to get a better idea of how the game plays, and maybe laugh at my stupidity, check out [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VwxT4WM0CXM]my video[/url] of the game. -- > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VwxT4WM0CXM

 Funny and addictive.
The only criticism I can lay is that the game crashed and lost all my progress.

Send waves of pals to get garbage for the flumf, build stuff.
Send more guys. Repeat.
Awesome.

https://youtu.be/r5ufS12Ebu0

short_description: 1010 - is an addictive puzzle game with a original storyline
reviews:
Squares are cool.         :l Simple and classic game with a horrific ui. 1010 is an asset flip, what Valve calls a "fake game".  The "developer", Walkboy Studio, took a tutorial for making a 1010 game (most likely the [url=https://codecanyon.net/item/blocks-puzzle-html5-game-construct-23/22640472]Blocks Puzzle[/url] tutorial/demo/game asset pack from the real developers, redfoc), changed the name, and dumped the result onto Steam.  They're attempting to scam people into buying this, so they can get your money for someone else's work.

This certainly gets branded as an asset flip because it's indistinguishable from other Construct2/HTML5 1010 game tutorials... there's no reason to believe this is an original creation, and even in the extremely unlikely chance it is, [i]it's indistinguishable from the stock assets out there.[/i]

And that's really what the problem with asset flips is all about.  Sure, the intellectual bankruptcy of taking someone else's work and putting your own name on it is bad, but as consumers, what matters is that this product has no real value, it's not sincerely made, it's a knock-off.

The original 1010 game is made by Zynga and is a mobile app.  But this is not from Zynga.  It's absolutely unethical to take someone else's entire game (even if the underlying code may be slightly different) and try profit from that. 

The products that result from asset flips aren't "real" games.  They lack depth and content, because they're just simplistic copies of demos or tutorials.  In this case, "Blocks Puzzle" is just a game template that creates a simple mobile/browser "1010" minimalist block placement game made using the Construct2 engine/HTML5, and doesn't have any merit as a proper, fully fledged PC game, so this copy+paste of it can't be recommended.

Asset flips don't involve any professional game development.  Sure, sometimes they may change a few cosmetic things, swap out different assets etc, but at heart it's functionally identical to the asset they're ripping off.

Asset flips like this are harmful to the gaming industry and to Steam because they reduce the visibility that sincerely made indie games should have, and make it harder for gamers to find real games from genuine developers.  It gives genuine amateur/indie developers a bad name.

Don't reward this morally bankrupt, unethical behaviour from Walkboy Studio.
 Based on the modern classic by Zynga, this version is really annoying in comparison. While the premise is the same, here are my issues with it:

- The UI is unintuitive trash compared to the mobile version by Zynga
- The three pieces you're offered float up and down passively at the bottom of the screen which is really annoying and there's no way to turn that off
- The volume has no slider, just on or off
- The piece placement noise sounds like a car door being slammed shut which is such an aggressive noise for a game like this, especially with everything else about the aesthetic seeming to angle more toward magical and cute
- There's no noise when you clear a line like in the Zynga mobile version, which has a cute little discordant jingle that's fun to listen to. This version, line clearing is just dead silent

If you enjoy mobile games, get the one mentioned or use a different PC version. This one isn't worth the dollar, especially when you can get similar online for free. chill If you like puzzle games, this is one of my favorites! It's very much like the Mobile version, except a bit more challenging because it has one extra shape! It's always fun trying to see how high of a score you can get. Fun! jebal cik interesanti The music is nice, but the exact same game is available elsewhere on the web for free as a browser game.That said, there's nothing wrong with this one.

It's barely a cousin of Tetris; a distant relative at best. There's no pressure here from time, anyway. Three pieces appear at the bottom of your screen. You must place all three, and you're then presented with three more. That fact makes it a little more challenging than some of the browser versions I've seen, where when you use one piece, it's replaced with another. Here, there's always the thought that maybe you should reserve room for that one giant piece that sometimes shows up because you never know when it will show up. 

It's a good time-waster, a great game for when you're on the phone and just need something to idly do while you listen, and, then again, you can also approach it with concentration and try to get a great score. 

Recommended because it *is* fun, and cheap, and it might be easier to just keep this version in the Steam library than to keep a bookmark to a free version. It controls really weird, and makes it pretty uncomfortable to play. But aside from that it's a fun game.... but it's also got like 10 free ports on the internet

probably a 3/10 for the pure fact that it's bugs make it uncomfortable, and it's kinda a waste of a dollar

name: RoboCock
short_description: You are a Robo-Chicken that has been sent to hell for your many evil acts. Now you only have one purpose. KILL!!!
reviews:
Man I love robocock so much, i love just like opening it and playing it. man i love cock, robo cock Fun, but very difficult. You could say that RoboCock is pretty...... hard.. 

I struggled surviving even 2 minutes~

name: Cat + Dog
short_description: Control the cat and dog at the same time so they can collect their favourite snacks. The cat loves fish and the dog wants bones! The cat must not touch the bones and the dog must not touch the fish. A relaxing puzzle game with Sokoban elements.
reviews: Another great puzzle game from Fortcullis Games!

name: Stronghold Kingdoms
genres: Massively Multiplayer, Strategy, Free To Play
short_description: A massively multiplayer grand strategy game, Stronghold Kingdoms is about forging alliances, political mind games, city-building and castle sieges with thousands of other players!
reviews:
Amazing game for the ones, who understands. Spent a ton of time and in-game resources on a tournament. Would have gotten the top reward, but it was bugged. No rewards for anyone. The tournament lasted a week, and the devs didnt fix/notice the issue? And if they did notice the issue, they never told the players?? Thats just bad.

This game is a buggy mess. not stronghold but stronghold Lame, time wasting mobile game which has nothing to do with "Stronghold" beside its aesthetics.

Seems to be p2w too.



No thanks.. This game works purely on a pay to win basis, otherwise it requires a massive amount of time that no one would dedicate to a game this old without the support. We'll see how the remasters go. .... Kos o sher Wir ben√∂tigen Ehre 7 day token lasted less than 48 hours after I have spent nearly 45 dollars on this trash. Not to mention the hundreds about 10 years ago with none of that progress available.  I would prefer a refund and dismantle my account. Im horribly disappointed I bothered trying to play this game again after all the money I had spent coming back was the worst thing I could have done total fucking scam.

*copy of message to support A fun way to spend all your hard earned money.

name: Final Upgrade
short_description: Help humanity to spread throughout the cosmos by exploring new worlds, building space factories and setting up trade routes. Research advanced technologies to increase efficiency and unlock new paths of development. Fight off other artificial intelligences in your goal to reach the Final Upgrade!
reviews:
Quite bad!  I'm like half an hour into the tutorial and it hasn't given me any reason why I might want to continue.  I have had corporate HR webinars that were more engrossing than this. Current Playtime: 250hrs
3.5 Playthroughs
- Tutorial
- 30hr (Time Trial) Challenge
- Iron Will Achievement (Super Hard Mode)
- Disassembler + Science Challenge (abandoned)

Outside of the base game mode, this is a logistics/resource management gem. Not for the faint of heart. Building and rebuilding the factories because of territorial acquisition or population demand was a constant. It was annoying how often I would take a blueprint and tweak it slightly for the new circumstance, but really easy, once you got use to the QoL opportunities listed below. There were more than a few times I self-destructed the entire factory because I needed to move some components over a few tiles to make room for a new addition.

The various challenge modes were really good. Forced me to actively plan and work within constraints as opposed to traditional factory games where the answer is just "Increase Production!" Had to abandon my Disassemble + Science challenge run because it was just too brain breaking; Not even sure I had enough of the right base components to make everything needed.

The Factory component of the game is uninspiring and relatively bland.
- Every recipe is a single unit of one or two inputs
- There's no method to increase belt speed
- While there's a building which allows priority outputs, there is no functionality for priority inputs
- Transport is always 1:1; Teleporter A to Teleporter B; Transport Route from Planet A to Planet B; No method to indicate a pool of resource sources and a pool of resource consumers and let the game sort it out for you. (Which could be construed as a positive?)

Combat system is weak
- Constant friendly fire
- Ships will automatically reorient themselves such that they block other ship's firing lines.
- Weapon strength/effectiveness progresses to the top tier laser being the cream of the crop, and should be rushed, removing any strategy for the mixing/matching weapon types. However, lasers seem to have had a bug where they will occasionally stop firing (but still consume energy) when ships teleport in/out. I did encounter this issue even though its reported as resolved.
- Had an issue (bug?) where ships I built new would be considered not combat ready even though they had full ammo and energy. Had to manually order and abort a shot to get the gun to take in ammo? Then on first combat with enemy, they would retreat with the indication they were no longer combat ready? Sending them to fight a second time usually cleared the issue.

Construction needs some QoL updates
- Tooltip often covers desired placement location
- Nothing can be placed floating in space, so cut/paste can be a hassle; Building inward to the Space Elevator is difficult
- Cut operation takes place immediately, so make sure you place it somewhere if the desired placement wasn't actually ready, like no or wrong connection back to the main platform; Otherwise the clipboard is cleared and you've lost that factory bit
- Paste is always a Merge operation, even if overwriting something else; Hope you didn't have any errant belts filling holes in your paste
- Blueprints will overwrite manual changes; Ex: A station is linked to a blueprint with a belt going outward. In this particular station, the belt was deleted and now a new built is being built in the inward direction. Once the belt is constructed, it will be going outward.

Quirks
- Liquids and pipes behave vastly different than solids and tubes
- Pipes push near infinite amount of liquid per second, tubes max at 2/sec
- Pipes connect to everything they touch, no control over direction
- Liquids can flow between buildings through adjacency, solids cannot
- Resources can be transported via Manually defined Routes (specifying ship placement and lining tubes up across structures to let resources flow), Automated Routes (Transport ships teleport resources from across the map and fly off), Teleportation Nodes (skip the ship, extend that pipe across spacetime)
- The game pushes towards Teleportation Nodes because they consume the least energy, however, I found the Manually defined Routes the most intriguing (and tedious)
- Mining, while required at the start of the game, is very quickly outpaced and becomes a negative efficiency, used only as a temporary stopgap or to limp along with a desperate resource shortage; Each ship is limited to eight robot miners, they have terribly slow movement, and the ships want to give each other wide berths around a particularly tiny (regenerating) source of raw ore.
- None of the challenges and few of the achievements are able to be completed in "easy" mode; So the game hasn't really started, the tutorial ended after 10-30 minutes, and you've got 20-30 hours until you reach "the end". I think the UI is atrocious... especially the tech tree where everything pops and flickers into view as you click on it so there's a bunch of difficulty making sense of where you are or where you came from. 

It also irks me that you are building everything for "colonists" but you never actually see any nor does the game have any colony elements..

Otherwise it's very cool with lots of potential.. I'll wait for some more updates before playing it more I wanted to like this game so badly but it feels quite convoluted and had a bad tutorial. A bit rough, and missing a few QOL features from other games, but an interesting and different take on automation and crafting I really enjoyed this for a long time but there are some issues. It gets tedious to actually finish a game. Combat is poorly explained and poorly implemented. The default setting have counterattack turned off, in which case its just a slog. If counterattack is on which is needed for many achievements that means once attacked the enemy simply spawns fleets from thin air until you take all of their sectors and some of those sectors require 1 mil energy instead of the 100k which was the highest prior to this. This is a problem if you haven't built a massive fleet and saved up millions of energy before ever starting. Then you realize the map generation is a bit wonky. You can turn on the map reveal without penalty and try a few generations to see that several maps are much harder than others. Design decisions don't feeling meaningful; once you get the basics, it's just busywork. Fun factory game An amazing game for fans of automation and space exploration!

Final Upgrade has been a true gem for me. The gameplay is so well-designed that it‚Äôs hard to step away. Building space factories, creating trade routes, and researching new technologies ‚Äî all of this brings immense satisfaction.

What impressed me the most is the depth of the automation systems. The developers did an excellent job balancing complexity and engagement ‚Äî the game constantly motivates you to improve your bases and expand your production network. The graphics are pleasant, and the soundtrack perfectly complements the space theme.

I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys automation, strategy, and exploration elements. It‚Äôs definitely worth your time!

 I got about 5 hours in before I hit the factorio style infinite treadmill of upgrades and factory expansions. The game plays nicely and feels good to develop your own prototypes. Unfortunately I'm just not in the mood to scale infinitely right now, lmfao. From my experience playing it, I would judge the game to be worth 5$, 10$ if you're into the factory and space colony genre.

name: Virballs
short_description: Six outlandish planets are overrun with Virballs - viral elemental creatures that consume each other to create exotic hybrids. Clean up this ecological disaster using Virball hybrids as devastating weapons!
reviews:
Whimsical and fun lil 3D platformer, great fun to just kick back shoot cute little evil balls. The element-mixing system is a neat quirk and it's fun to experiment with all the combinations and find your favorite weapon. Good stuff! Really enjoyable premise and artstyle! The game mechanics are a clear love letter to the original Kirby games, and the unlockable power-ups and enemies are very creative. I also like how the difficulty isn't too hard, but it's not a breeze either; boss challenges are hard, but fair. I picked up this game because my daughter thought it looked fun. It's a fun platformer with cute character design. My daughter and i would take turns playing. I would kill everything and she would try to jump out of the world. Fun times. The only issues I've had so far is getting stuck in place at the beginning of one of the early boss fights and turning into a ball when i didnt want to. The second one could just be my controller being old though. Virballs is a very challenging and fun game!  Highly recommended for all ages! The balls are cute! I like the collecting aspect that is paired with the different types of ammo you can use in the game! The bosses can be pretty challenging so you definitely need to utilize the correct type of balls for each. ;) [h1]This is a strange and adorable game![/h1]
I love the [b]Floobers[/b] that are the rescue objective in some of the levels. The sound effects are spot on for the visuals and the music is epic.  Boss fights get more and more intense as the spectacular boss animations grow more complicated with each world. There are many different weapons between the virball elements and the cores that are added with each world completed, and the switching menu is good at showing that matrix.
The game play is smooth, supporting a run and gun or steady assault style of play. Since anything you destroy gives back health to some degree, it's possible to choose to destroy for health or to claw the tiny virballs to get more ammo of their type.
Anyway, it's a solid game and well worth the price. Clever core "Enemies are ammo" design with a lot of fun combinations and weapon choices. Worth checking out. GG! Fun as heck!! Got the game because I know one of the devs and the game doesn't disappoint one bit :33 Cute virballs and the  jumpy guys you gotta save look so funny This has the spirit of the 3D platform adventure/shooter games of the PS1 and early PS2 era, and that's a good thing.
If you think to yourself "Why is there nothing like spyro or ratchet & clank being made today?", give this a try.

It's currently in early access, but the devs are highly communicative, running weekly streams, showing their pipeline, etc - I have confidence this is a team that will finish something, and not a pipe dream. lots of balls 10/10

name: Magical Fairy Force - Champion Edition
short_description: A competitive top-down shooter inspired by 90s arcade games, Magical Fairy Force - Champion Edition is an exciting, action-packed follow-up to 2020's Atari 5200 original. Choose from one of 16 characters and fly into battle against the computer opponent or up to three friends.
reviews:
Three hours with this game, and I'm enjoying it a lot. It's a rather creative game unlike anything I've played before. With elements reminiscent of games like Galaga, Kaboom!, and Street Fighter Alpha, it successfully harnesses their arcade-esque short but fierce style of gameplay. 

Probably the thing I like most about this game is the variety. Sixteen characters, each with three unique attacks, stories, endings, and character designs, keep me from tiring of Magical Fairy Force. Having a large variety of difficulty levels and multiplayer modes (which I wish had more online focus) only adds to the fun.

I also love a good chunk of the character design, especially in Queen Sugar and her nemesis. I got a lot of anime and vintage Street Fighter vibes from the sixteen characters, and how their unique stories are relationships to the characters are carried out. 

Overall, this was five bucks very well spent, and I hope to see more updates in the future. This super creative and visually charming game is clearly a labor of love that I'm immensely glad to have discovered. Highly recommended!

name: Bitcoin Or Bomb?
short_description: You are playing for the FDB agent (Federal defense of the Bitcoins), and you need to find all the bitcoins, before the time runs out and the bombs explode
reviews:
Wowzers! This sucks!

It boils down to a trial and error memory game. You have to guess where the bitcoin is, without hitting a bomb. Every time you pick the wrong object, you have to restart, so you have to keep testing to see where the bitcoin is. As the levels progress, there are more bitcoins and more options (or bombs) to choose from, so you have to memorize where each bitcoin is, through making mistakes, until you figure out the correct pattern to beat the level, awful game mechanic. There's also a time limit of like five seconds per level, leaving you no time to think and just react quickly.

I could hardly hear any music either, it was just deafening sounds playing throughout.

As per usual, if you want an actual good game, this isn't the one, 'cept if you want a +1 to your perfect games score. Bitcoin Or Bomb? is a memory puzzle game.

I played through the entire game and finished it in 6 minutes (failed the last level a lot, so that's around 3 to 4 minutes for the entire game if you don't...) Such short games shouldn't be accepted on Steam, this is just... ugh. So the goal of the game is to reveal all Bitcoins and avoid bombs. If you click on a bomb, the game stops and you have to restart. So it's just trial and error to guess where all Bitcoins are 1 by 1, then use your memory to remember where they are and click them in a row relatively quickly (there's a timer.) The music loops every times you die, and in this game you are supposed to die every few seconds, rendering the audio experience borderline torture.

Overall, avoid. It is not fun, 5-10 minutes long and just not worth your time. Bitcoin Or Bomb? is more minimal effort Russian shovelware polluting Steam and making gaming worse for everyone.  Once more, Ghost_RUS has used the childrens toy ClickTeam Fusion drag and drop game construction kit to make a "game", this time the game is just a blind minefield game, like minesweeper but without the clues.  Click on the green dots and try to remember which dots have a bitcoin pixel blob and which ones don't (the ones that don't reset the level).  That's all there is to it, it's just more Russian cash grab pollution.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

Bewilderingly, the game doesn't include proper audio controls, so you can't turn off the annoying background music, you'll need to alt+tab out and stop the music using the Windows sound mixer.  This is obviously not okay and it's unclear why the developers chose not to include this basic feature.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just point and click stuff like a browser/Flash game.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

Some of the defects in the game can be attributed to the choice of using the Clickteam Fusion construction kit - the "No-Code" construction kit that "Anyone can make games with!!".  Including, you know, people who aren't game developers.  Which is a problem.  This is a very poor quality toolset sometimes used by amateur developers as it's free (so they don't have to pay for GameMaker Studio) and doesn't require advanced game development skills, but unfortunately has very limited capabilities (it's arguably worse than GameMaker Studio).  Just as you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear, you can't make a great video game if you use a terrible engine.  So it's inappropriate when amateurs try to use these for profit, without any actual, real game development effort taking place.  This doesn't result in products that have any real meaningful value for gamers.

The very poor quality of this game puts it squarely on-par with ancient 1990's Flash/Java games, and given it's 2023 (and this was released not so far back in 2018), gamers and the industry expect and deserve better than this kind of low effort shovelware.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 3 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

While game reviews must be about the game, as this review has been, it's sometimes important for gamers to be aware when there's problems with the developers.  In this case, Nikita "Ghost_RUS", a Russian shovelware scam artist who routinely abuses Steam by polluting the marketplace with shovelware like this game.  Nikita "Ghost_RUS" continually sends a message of racism, bigotry, homophobia and hate speech through his games, in direct violation of Valve's guidlines for acceptable game content.  You can read more about it in [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Sentinels_of_the_Store/announcements/detail/1663386372399476871]this article by the Sentinels of the Store[/url] curator group.

This is something I feel potential customers should be aware of for two reasons.  First, I understand completely that gamers may not want to buy games with such horrible, antihumanitarian messages of hate such as games from Nikita "Ghost_RUS".  Secondly, gamers must be aware that if Valve decides to do the right thing and enforce their policy against hate speech and bigotry in games, games such as this will be banned.  So, buying games from Nikita "Ghost_RUS" may be putting your money at risk.

Bitcoin Or Bomb? is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

[b]Note:[/b] Because this is more of a "joke" game, intended to draw attention from controversy or in the hopes of going viral because it's "so bad it's good" (but it isn't good at all), there's nothing here to offer to serious gamers.  As usual, with most awful/joke games, all the comedians come out of the woodwork.  The vast majority of the reviews for this game are joke reviews, such as "this game cured my cancer, saved my marriage, changed my life" etc.  Because most of the reviews are as insincere as the game itself is, the positive review score for this game should be disregarded. Lame This game is very similar to Anime girl Or Bottle? but it comes with a memory version of puzzles.  You have to click all the circles until you find which ones are bitcoins and then select them all without blowing up to complete the level.  There are 15 levels which can take a person less than five minutes to complete.  Overall rating 1/10 based on price and the fact they sell you a MIDI soundtrack as DLC.  Not worth the time to play unless you are an achievement hunter for 100% completion. 1/10 This game is one of the most engaging ones ive played.
The storyline was heartbeaking and every second the game pulled me in more and more.
I believe this game is a definate Game of The Year winner.
I cant wait for a sequel.
This game is amazing and may even start its own genre.
It will change gaming as we know it. ‚îÖ¬¶ Bitcoin Or Bomb? ¬¶‚îÖ

name: Crown of the Empire Around the World
short_description: Crown of the Empire: fun adventures await! The queen needs your help!
reviews:
"Crown of the Empire Around the World" is a tablet clicker/ripoff of the "12 Labors Of Hercules" clickers.  Click on various resources/obstacles on each map until the level is done.  Much like the Hercules games this is aping, 

There's no real gameplay or meaningful decision making, even though, much like the Hercules games, it's pretending to be a resource management game, it's not.  The graphics aren't as good as 12 Labors either, so there's a second fail

The shady developer behind this valueless shovelware has proven to be a persistent nuisance abusing Steam Direct... they've dumped over a hundred valueless mobile app tier asset flips onto Steam, many featuring plagiarised/stolen stock art and other unethical, shady behaviours. 

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this particular game, with minor reskins, an insane THIRTY THREE TIMES onto Steam... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of 8Floors's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] Argonauts Agency: Captive of Circe
[*] Argonauts Agency: Chair of Hephaestus
[*] Argonauts Agency: Glove of Midas
[*] Argonauts Agency: Golden Fleece
[*] Argonauts Agency: Missing Daughter
[*] Argonauts Agency: Pandora's Box
[*] Crown of the Empire Around the World
[*] Elven Rivers 2: New Horizons Collector's Edition
[*] Elven Rivers: The Forgotten Lands Collector's Edition
[*] Emergency Crew 2 Global Warming
[*] Emergency Crew Perfect Getaway Collector's Edition
[*] Emergency Crew Volcano Eruption
[*] Garden City
[*] Gnomes Garden
[*] Gnomes Garden 2
[*] Gnomes Garden 3: The thief of castles
[*] Gnomes Garden Lifeseeds Collector's Edition
[*] Gnomes Garden Lost King
[*] Gnomes Garden New Home
[*] Gnomes Garden: Christmas Story
[*] Gnomes Garden: Halloween
[*] Gnomes Garden: Return Of The Queen
[*] Lost Artifacts
[*] Lost Artifacts Mysterious Book Collector's Edition
[*] Lost Artifacts: Golden Island
[*] Lost Artifacts: Soulstone
[*] Lost Artifacts: Time Machine
[*] New Lands
[*] New Lands 2 Collector's Edition
[*] New Lands Paradise Island Collector's Edition
[*] Royal Roads
[*] Royal Roads 2 The Magic Box
[*] Royal Roads 3 Portal
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?  This valueless copy + paste garbage is taking up marketing space for genuine indie developers who are doing the right thing.  It's harmful to the industry and to gamers.

The ridiculous price of the game ($5 USD) exceeds that of 12 Labors of Hercules, worse gameplay, worse graphics.  I didn't recommend 12 Labors because that's a lousy tablet game on PC, and this is worse... so no recommendation from me. One of the most polished and vibrant games in the genre, they really upgraded every aspect of it. Enjoying it so far and definitely recommend it when it hits a dollar to people wondering if it's worth it. The gameplay is well designed and you can tell the developers have put a lot of thought into it after creating so many of these types of games.

EDIT: Level 13 is INSANE! Took a good hour to 3 star it. Giving the game a break after that but looking forward to picking it back up again.

EDIT 2: After completing 24 levels now, basically the difficulty of each level is in the wrong order. One level will be super easy while the next level is super difficult. It doesn't ruin the experience but I just wish that's how it was in order I guess. Still LOVING the game!

EDIT 3: I've now completed the game and I must let you know that once you get to level 40 the game gets SUPER hard to 3 star. You have to do everything perfectly to do it. Once you eventually get 3 stars after replaying the level countless times, it's all worth it. Level 46 is by far the hardest level in the game. Took me 18 times and I finally 3 starred it.

name: Playcraft
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Simulation
short_description: Playcraft is a multiplayer game-creation sandbox accessible to anyone!
reviews: can't wait to see how this game gets built on to. The game has good building tools and graphics in general, but the developers could make a simpler way to edit builds and to allow more creativity without getting lost in the menus. For me, It has proven a good game, and can spark a lot of creativity, but makes it a little hard to if you can't figure out what to do and how to do it. Point is that it uses a lot of settings that for a kid, or myself, to get lost in when opening a building/editing menu. Developers, If you read this, please consider changing the menus a little. Thank you. The game is really good - you can put your creativity and imagination in work. The only one problem for now is that there is no integrated tutorials for all the options and possibilities. There is still no content from the community

name: MindHunt
short_description: MindHunt is a solo/multiplayer detective like game (1-10 players), where you as an agent try to find out which androids are infected in order to shut them down! Well, if you are the infected one, you better blend with other androids and complete all tasks necessary!
reviews:
[b] [/b] its a fun party game, somewhat similar to among us/spy party. it can get pretty exciting surreptitiously completing tasks when the agent can be right around the corner at any time! Nice game. Need some fixes but, can be really fun with friends.  [h1] This is a party game at its finest! [/h1]

It really doesn't get much better than this. 

The visuals are stunning and the map is very well crafted. It offers an interesting detective/social deduction gameplay, which got me thinking and second guessing a lot. In a good way. I felt unneasy because of being watched, I felt the pressure of finding out who is the bad guy. And it's fun to experience these feelings in any game.

There is a single player mode as well, very good for training and learning the map. But multiplayer is where it's at! Grab your friends, make a lobby, join a voice call and prepare to: laugh, argue, being surprised, deceive, being confused. What a rollercoaster and I loved it.

It's really amazing that you can customize the game in a lot ways, each game can feel entirely different and unique. Different number of players, tasks... You can always keep it fresh. And there is still so much more that can be added.

If you have a group of friends, this game will keep you entertained for a long time. I definitely recommend you try it out!

name: MAFIA: Sex Noir
short_description: MAFIA: Sex Noir is a visual novel game with Live2D animated sex scenes.
reviews:
short visual novel, english translation is poor, the story is confused set during the bootlegging period of prohibition but talking about WW2. There are 5 animations, 2 of which are on the store page. Save your money. Boring, unimaginative, and achievements are broken. The art is nice. About a half hour of game play if you use the auto feature. Poor value. Pure Garbage! The game can be finished under an hour. The artwork is generic. S*x scenes are pure joke. You can get more enjoyment if you use Google and search "naked ladies" Very short - 20 min. performance issues, no vsync so fps higher than 700, so my graphic card works hard. . $3 for 30 minutes play. Not even play, just slideshows of a single topic conversation. Spend $3 on a bag of chips is better spending than this piece of trash! the scenes in the store preview are cleaner than in actual game. the in game scenes clip after every 5 seconds. the story, well honestly it was so... not anything you would expect in an ecchi let alone a pr0n game, too clean and kinda boring.
mot woth your money or your time Not something i was hoping for
there is no violent sex scenes
ntrÔºågang annexion
nothing excited or disgusting
and the mafia just get away so easily
really  a pain in the as The skinny:
Story is typical gangster/mafia style
Animations are so buggy, if you look at the NSFW scenes you will see 1,2,3, and 4 in the bottom left. Switching between scenes will cause a glitch that you can see the home screen. Total NSFW scenes are 4 or 5 total and the entire game will take you less than 15 minutes to read through (the story is not finished). My advice is save your money or wait until the game comes to $1.00. My issues are three fold. 

1. I completed the story in just over an hour. The inappropriate scenes do not flow, they have buttons to change the pace of the repetitious action. 
2. The story is actually interesting, kind of... The grammar is not excessively bad, but many words are miss used. Obviously put into English by someone that has English as a second language. They did not understand the vernacular of the period either. 
3. Finally, no one that actually understands the mafia or the period created the story. As a fan of history, this was actually just annoying to me.

name: EXFIL
genres: Action, Indie, Simulation, Strategy, Early Access
short_description: EXFIL delivers raw tactical FPS intensity with no distractions. No loot grinding, no gimmicks‚Äîjust pure realism. From the co-designer of 'Squad,' this milsim tests your strategy, comms and teamwork in high-stakes, single-life matches. Will your squad rise to the challenge?
reviews:
I will ask for a refund, there is no one playing online. Empty servers. For my persona view, these creators are overwhelmed putting hands on so many unfinished games that by the end of the day causes delays on every single one of them.  Good graphics, looks promising, but please do not release an early access peace of crap to have a character going around on some empty worlds. 

Yes, the game looks great, but anyone can put Unreal Engine 5 characters in empty worlds with IA or downloadable characteristics and Procedural Programming. please. There is a lot of potential here, and I hope that by the time Early Access ends, I can have a positive recommendation.

But I bought this on the back of the AI update, expecting to be able to play "Single Player Multi-Player" (basically, I wanted an offline game with bots).

But the AI release only created bot opposition - there's no friendly bots on your team, so its you against an enemy force instead of you+your team against them.

Feels very lonely and one-sided. EXFIL is a pretty fresh take on the extraction shooter genre. There isn't any loot, there isn't a hideout and you don't even buy any weapons or gear. The second you load into the game you're basically ready to go. You already have access to everything in the arsenal, although the some of the weapons are faction specific (which I'm not the biggest fan of in this game due to there being like 6 total weapons). You don't lose any of your stuff when you die, which is really dope because I hate losing everything though that's the whole point of an extraction shooter lol. There are a lot of options to customize the missions to your liking (i.e. time to extract, if there are enemy bots, when the mortar fire starts, blah blah blah), and I'm really looking forward to how much more configurable the missions will be in the future. Where this game really shines is in its customization, and I honestly believe in the future we as players will be able to make our perfect extraction shooter right here in EXFIL.

All of this menu stuff is great, but the actual gameplay is honestly not the best. Like it needs a TON of work. The gunplay is horrendous, there is absolutely zero weight to any of the guns and the recoil is a bit ridiculous. I do like how they simulate the ballistics though, kinda similar to Tarkov. The AI enemies are not great and they don't even seem to spawn in sometimes. This makes the game world very barren, especially with 0 players online (I had 8 server options to choose from and every one of them was empty). When the enemies do spawn in they either miss every shot or absolutely demolish you, but they seem to prefer not hitting their targets. They have a configurable difficulty level, but I haven't tested any level other than 3. I should also mention the performance, which is awful until you turn on frame generation. Once you turn it on though it should run great. I think this is all I have to say about the game right now. 

The whole gameplay loop is essentially just load in, grab intel, MAYBE see a group or two of bots, extract and boom. Raid finished in less than 10 minutes. It's not a blast but it's not necessarily boring. This game has a TON of potential, and while I don't recommend paying full price for it, definitely give it a go when it goes on sale or they do another free weekend. Overall rating 8/10

Exfil is an overwhelmingly positive addition to the extraction shooter genre, delivering a precision tactical experience that keeps players on edge. From the moment you drop into the battlefield, the game demands tactical thinking, rewarding those who plan their moves with calculated precision.
The gunplay is sharp and responsive, offering a satisfying balance between realism and accessibility. Every firefight feels intense, with the stakes rising as you push toward extraction. The thrilling engagements ensure that no match ever feels the same, keeping players hooked on the adrenaline rush.
As an early access title, Exfil shows immense promise. The foundation is solid, and it's easy to see where this shooter will go with continued development. With refined mechanics, deeper customization, and expanded content, Exfil has the potential to carve out a lasting legacy in the extraction shooter space.
For fans of tactical shooters, Exfil is a must-watch‚Äîa game that already delivers gripping action and tactical depth while hinting at an even brighter future. If you're looking for a high-stakes, immersive experience, this is one to keep on your radar.
 one of my favorite steam games not glazing but the developers are great the lead developer even joined my game. Though the game has his problems but it also is in  very early access 9/10 would recommend. nah actually i DEMAND GET THIS GAME NOW! and if you dont have enough money every 8 weeks the game devs do a free weekend event where they make the game free for a whole weekend so everyone can try it out for themselves. from the small details in the guns and map to how bullets bounce off walls this game is awesome i truly loved this game. I think the game is a great, realistic military game. You should try it out now and the developers know what there doing and what to add. I never buy 'Early Access' Steam games, but this is an exceptional case. I bought the Founders Supporter Edition, because the Developer has shown commitment to finish and polish the game.
 Even in its current early state, Exfill shows serious promise. 

The foundation is strong:  
- tactical gameplay with up to 4 spec-ops teams ( competitive aspect )
- enemy AI forces ( coop )
- drones!!!
- a few good maps for the start ( I bet there will be more! )

It‚Äôs rough around the edges‚Äîsome balancing issues, occasional bugs‚Äîbut that‚Äôs expected at this stage.

What stands out most is the potential. The atmosphere is intense, the extraction-based design keeps the stakes high, and when it clicks, it really clicks. If the devs keep up the pace and listen to the community, Exfill could become something special.

One to keep on your radar. fun game, as any early access, still going through the motions. The concept and future additions to the game are what keep me attached. Multiple tourneys and different gameplay options are a plus. Solo or Coop against AI, PVPVE, and even PVP. Big hopes for this and cant wait to see more currently dead, many servers but none of them have anyone, missing objects for certain animations, mission sounds for certain reloads, janky gunplay at best.

Worth the price for fans!

name: Mechanibot
short_description: In this tactical rogue-like auto battler, you'll build your unique team of robots and keep them alive as they fight. Battle through waves of enemies as you travel from planet to planet on a mission to fix the sun. Strategize, protect, survive. A Mechanibot's wrench never rests.
reviews:
This is a simple but very enjoyable little game. At first I had trouble enjoying it as I had to micromanage the robots in a frantic way, which was not very enjoyable. Two things helped me get past that. One is holding down the grab button to let me move all of them at once, the other was coming up with a consistent strategy that I was aiming for with the right robots and upgrades to execute it; and then sticking with it. I found the game easier and more enjoyable after that. It is a fun, interesting, nice, and short game. Nice little game. Worth the little price tag it has. It entertained me for the time I played. Yes. This is game should be called manual battler. And this game should be playable with a mouse. Best 15 hours spent

The game is very cheap for how fun it is. Surprisingly every strategy you can think of will most likely work to complete a run. When completing a run, the game offers more difficulty modifiers from enemies dealing more damage to having wrenches spawn less often. There is also a story that takes place with enjoyable characters. The story is not too long nor forced on the player. There's also an "infinite" mode where it turns the game to a more last stand type game where enemies almost always and the store is always available. Enemies in the infinite mode also progressively get faster and bigger. Moving to the units, no two units are alike. Every unit has a primary color/class with most having a unique secondary color/class. This allows a mix match of units rewards players for exploring combinations of unused units. If I had a complaint about the game, it would be the awkward controls for mouse and keyboard. The controls themselves are not bad. The issue I have rather is when I have my cursor over the shops gui or settings and I attempt to cycle through with a or d it uses the cursors position and moves the selection back to where the cursor is. You can use the mouse to buy from the shop, it is however not used in the actual gameplay of the game. The issue is a nitpick honestly the easy solution I found was shoving the cursor off to the corner of the screen and forget I even have a mouse. Everything else about the game is great. Super fun mini manager. Great to pick up for a while and then take breaks between rounds. And the art is amazing! One of my favorites Really cool take on the auto battler format while giving the player much more agency! Feels similar to a tower defense but with much more active player input.
Runs are quick and aren't too punishing if you buy the wrong Robots at first.
It took me just over 9 hours to 100% the game and get the true ending which is a good length for such an inexpensive little game!
Excited to see more from Jon Nielsen! Mechanibot is a rogue-like with a rather unique take on the auto battler formula. You start the game with three coins which are used at the store where you are presented with random options to buy or upgrade the robots that will make up your team. Each robot you add to your team will have one or two classes assigned to them that broadly defines their role, and fielding enough robots of the same class gives a specific bonus to the entire team.

Your job during combat is to keep your little robot friends alive while they battle it out with the enemy. Before you start the round, you are given information on where the enemies are going to spawn in and danger zones where you can't place your robots with out them immediately and steadily taking damage. You place your robots accordingly and then can start the round.

Where this game diverges from other arena-based auto battlers that I'm familiar with is in the active participation of the player throughout combat. You continue to run around the field as the mechanibot during combat and can pick up your otherwise immobile robots and move them around to keep them safe. In fact, it is required that you frequently move them around in order to keep them alive. There are more tanky robots that don't mind taking hits from regular enemies, but even they can get overwhelmed if they're ganged up on enough and none of your robots want to take more than a couple direct hits from bosses and even mini-bosses. The difficulty therefore comes from constantly micromanaging your robots placement in levels that are increasingly full of danger that they have no chance of withstanding if left in the same place for too long.

In addition to robots, you are also given a random selection of items every few levels that modify your entire team for the rest of the run. They can do things like increase healing, give extra projectiles, etc. What results is a highly engaging auto battler with a ton of potential variety in each run.

I've put just over 11 hours into the game and definitely feel like I got more than my money's worth given the generously low price. This just feels clumsy and frantic in a way I really don't enjoy.
