name: Here Be Dragons
short_description: Here Be Dragons is a satirical turn-based strategy game featuring unique "living map" graphics, where you lead a group of crazed captains and eradicate legendary monsters in order to allow Christopher Columbus the discovery of the New World.
reviews:
It is a fun enough game. It deserves better reviews than it has at the moment. "Here be dragons" is unique in many ways, being everything, but not what I expected. And if you're open-minded, that is very positively. The artworks are aesthetically - I like the way everything looks like an old map. When I first saw the scenes with the governor and the walking on the city maps, I expected some kind of management or adventure game, which it isn't. These are - as far as I can see - only fixed sequences to drive the plot. In a humorous way. The gameplay itself is not a roguelike or open-world, but 'campaign'-driven, with campaign meaning some battles in a row, between which I can temporarily upgrade my ships, meaning to add a point for defense for example. The battles itself are the main part of the game, difficult even on 'fun'-difficulty, and being puzzle-like and outcome heavily influencd by dice. And this random dice throwing adds hell of thrill to the game, and every dice-placement has to be well thinked over. You can place dice into abilities, upgrading the ships hull or cannons, and use bottles to change the results to trap enemies. This way, it becomes a puzzle-battler, something I didn't xpect, and highly like! A fun story line, the mechanics have a good challenge as well as a "fun" level which is really fun. Clean graphics and consistent experience throughout the game. Ultimately I think this game is mostly fine, but nothing good about it stands out, and playing it is a little annoying. For me, this is worse than being a bad game with a few good elements,but everyone engages with games differently, so you might not feel the same.

Here Be Dragons' core concept is that it's a dice placement board game simulating naval battles. Placing higher dice has more aggressive effects, but placing a high sum of dice causes you to act second in the initiative order. If you don't place dice, you take damage.

This creates kind of a neat push-and-pull in theory, where you're going for slow high damage on some turns and fast defenses on others, but the balance on the game isn't loose enough to let you play around. It's built more like a puzzle game, but a puzzle game where you routinely need to get certain combinations of dice. Which means one of the strongest moves you can make is just to restart a level and get a different initial roll.

There are some *very* light rpg elements, where you can upgrade your ships between maps, but only during certain short strings of levels. After the string is done, the upgrades reset. Moreover, you switch between characters and abilities after every string, and a lot of the characters don't feel great to use.

It's not *too* hard, but sometimes the rng just hands you a garbage starting roll, or it serves the enemy exactly the dice they need on a round where they have the initiative and they instantly focus down one of your ships, and there's no incentive not to immediately restart the level.

The art is solid, and the creatures look fun and detailed and menacing, but the writing did not land with me. It's a picaresque about bad people plundering and murdering and starting wars with the ocean, but it uses this setup to... quote Monty Python jokes.

Hey, man. Do you remember the Knights Who Say Ni? Yeah, that's SO funny. I'm gonna randomly say Ni and you're gonna laugh and we're all gonna laugh. Over and over and over again.

It feels stale and uninspired in a way that the rest of the game isn't.

I think as a board game, where you're physically interacting with the dice and paging through the rulebook and maybe there's pvp, this would be fun.

As-is, it felt more frustrating than enjoyable.

If you like dice placement games and puzzle games and want to turn your brain off a bit, it's probably not a bad pick on sale. But if you were hoping for a more robust strategy rpg like I was, this ain't that. The game is dirty with it's cheating RNG.
Avoid. combat is very random and difficulty spike is extreme Great game. Simple but difficult! Basically a perfect game as it does what it wants and is perfect for some quick but difficult fun! jokes landed flat and so much RNG. Without enough to influence the rolls I just loved the artwork and gameplay. Funny and a bit challenging too. 

Took me around 12 hrs to beat the game. Dreadful sea monsters are my thing. I wish to see more games like this one. The game is OK, but gets tedious quickly. The battles are unbalanced and depend on randomness way too much. The AI is likewise random. The story tries to be cute and funny, but it too becomes tedious very quickly. I bought it when it was about $2.50 and frankly that is about its worth.

name: Prophet's Legacy
short_description: Includes the 'Immortal Guardian' outfit that reduces Lara's damage from Greek Fire, the "Piercing Truth" dagger and a card pack with two guaranteed rare cards and three other cards that have an increased chance at being rare.
reviews:
Very good looking and highly detailed outfit for Lara, that has a unique effect to help your gamplay[spoiler]Especially suits her when playing in The Lost Valley area[/spoiler]

It says it includes a dagger... but it actually just automatically replaces the default Axes

name: Sea Legends: Phantasmal Light Collector's Edition
short_description: After a yacht crash in a mysterious storm, Jane finds herself on the coast of a mysterious island - and Mike is missing. Exploring the island, Jane must figure out what happened to Mike. Help them in this thrilling hidden object adventure!
reviews:
A decent HOG (Hidden Object Game). If you like hidden object games, buy this one on sale. The game has a good story but very low resolution! Other than that, it's a great game for those who have mid-2000s or earlier computers with a smaller monitor. The problem with these older games is that some only display at 1024 by 768 resolution, which is way too small for my big 4K computer gaming rig. My monitor alone is a 43-inch class monitor (4K). It makes it very difficult to play an old game like this. The game displays a little window basically in the corner of the screen, which makes it very difficult to even see the little puzzles in hidden objects Other than that, it's a great game. It would be nice if Steam made it clearer when purchasing older games like this how they will display on our computers based on our computer hardware profiles, because otherwise we waste a lot of time and money on games we won't be able to enjoy.¬† Sea Legends: Phantasmal Light represents the best and worst of Hidden Object Game (HOG) technology circa 2010. Your experience will depend on your taste in HOGs. For me, the good point was it was very hidden object heavy. There were lots of hidden object screens and you needed to solve them more than once - a classic HOG experience of that era. Then there are the classic problems of that era - low resolution objects with poor translations and lots of backtracking to find where the hidden object puzzles are reactivating. There is also the classic problem of not having an in-game map, which means clicking back and forth through a dozen screens to find the object then get back to where you need to use it.

The story is stuck between the juvenile and mature in such a way to align with neither group. There are hallucinations of people dying that would be disturbing to younger players. Then, at the end of the bonus chapter, there is a giant floating purple head with a goofy voice that made me laugh out loud at how cartoonishly silly it was.

The art style can be ... incongruous. The characters appear to have been animated by different artists at different times. At one point, I was briefly confused when an angry old woman with a young boy's haircut leapt into the scene unexpectedly. Turns out it was supposed to be the main character's boyfriend. I don't think I was supposed to be laughing at that moment, at least not so loudly.

The game has no achievements to hunt, and if you don't like the ending of the bonus chapter, you have to replay the entire game to get a second guess at whether to choose right or left.

Taken as a whole, I cannot recommend Sea Legends: Phantasmal Light when there are so many better made modern and classic HOGs on the market deserving of $5. Got it on special. Thoroughly enjoyed the story, style and presentation. Spooky old man ghost on a lighthouse where things happen kinda fun. If it's on sale then it is worth getting.  
 This game took me a little over 3 and a half hours played casually, and I really enjoyed it. Excellent artwork and gameplay. There was a good range of puzzles with varying difficulties, although nothing overly hard. The story was interesting and the use of objects wasn't too linear so you often had a range of objects in your inventory to think through. Little disappointed with the final puzzle though (the one to do with the symbols). It had the opportunity to be something that you actually had to put a bit of thought into, and then it turned out to be an overly simple solution that breaks the immersion a little as the answer isn't something that the puzzle setter could have possibly known. good This game is HOG heavy (too many for me). I enjoyed the story and the puzzles, except for one that kept glitching and one that would not let me place a piece to begin solving it. Because of the latter issue, I could not finish the game. That's okay since it got rather tedious with the over use of hidden object scenes. The story was interesting enough to keep my attention until the jewel puzzle problem. Oh well.

name: Ad Agency Tycoon
short_description: Ad Agency Tycoon is an Advertising Agency simulator set in the 60's. Choose the perfect combination for your propagandas, develop your company and conquer the golden age of publicity! Your advertising will come to life and face the tough market and the most feared of all: the public.
reviews:
the ideia seems fun but the gameplay feels very raw and unpolished. Mechanics are don't work as expected and the UI is quite buggy and hard to navigate.

Feels like a stripped down version of game dev tycoon No. Just no. I got bored with this game within 20 minutes. I tried to make it to 30 minutes just to give it a chance but it was just sooooooo repetitive that I just couldn't stand it anymore. I got my refund 10 minutes later. Don't waste your time. this game started good back when i 1st got it, but now it keeps crashing.. why does such a simple game crash? please optimise better I cant recommend this at this time. My issue with the game is the lack of clear, obvious feedback to the player in the early game what they are doing right or wrong. The visual cues are not obvious to lead you one way or another and there is barely any tutorial/guidance to explain it. It looks like it would be fun otherwise but with these limitations, I think only someone who REALLY wanted to get into the game would enjoy it. I like to define games by how much I payed and how much play time I got out of it, a price per hour of play time because of how much an hour of my time is worth. I have 1.4 hours put into this game and spent the $11.99 I played this game once and then never thought about it again.

It's got a cute element to it, it just lacks content. It gets really repetitive rather quick. Bug was fixed same day, cool from Devs :) ---{Graphics}---

name: Goroons
short_description: GOROONS is a teamwork-based adventure where you have to combine your unique skills and overcome tough-as-nails puzzle challenges.
reviews:
The TDLR here is I can recommend this game on the price point. I enjoyed my time playing. Your times may differ. I did not get to test this game in multiplayer.

This game is charming and minimalistic in art style, doesn't hold your hand when it comes to introducing you to puzzle mechanics, and encourages experimentation. You will need to think logically and make sure you're planning ahead and executing controls precisely, lest finding yourself in a frantic panic or unable to proceed and requiring to restart the whole level. Goroons is an older game from 2018.  It's a venerable 6 years old at the time of this review.

Goroons is a handheld (Nintendo Switch)/console game that's also been put on Steam as a bit of an afterthought, as it's very much designed for the handheld/console gaming audience.

There's a co-op focus to the game, so you need to co-ordinate with your friends to play this... I guess that's easier for the developer than making a compelling single player experience.  Creating content is hard!  Why bother?

Like I always say, if the only thing that makes a game fun is your friends, that just proves it's fun to spend time with your friends, and doesn't say much for the game at all.  You can play this single player, but it's the opposite of fun... and if you ask your friends to play this kind of garbage Nintendo Switch game on PC, you soon won't have any friends... that's a no-win scenario for this one.

The idea of the game is to move the 4 player blobs to the exit... each blob can morph, and you need to use the abilities of each morph to solve the puzzles/obstacles between you and the exit.  It's been done a hundred times or more, almost always better than this.  So much for gameplay. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The game features simple, cartoony 2D graphics, of the type you normally expect to see in low effort mobile apps.  3D graphics programming does require a degree of skill and competence and unfortunately not all developers have the budget or talent to deliver this, despite 3D graphics cards hitting the mainstream in the 1990's.  Considering this is being evaluated as a PC game, having the graphics phoned in like this isn't going to result in a high quality, visually impressive game that PC gamers are used to seeing.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, left handed gamers or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

Because this is designed for handheld/portable gaming appliances, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the low power handheld gaming appliances that the game was designed for.  These are unfortunate compromises and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was a second thought for the mobile game developers.  The game is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for low power handhelds forces upon a game.  While this might run well on a Steam Deck, we must remember the vast majority of gamers here are gaming on PC.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 5 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 100,000 games for gamers to choose from, the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

So, should you buy this game?  Is this one of the best of the 100,000+ games on Steam?

Goroons is relatively cheap at $3 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.  This is also competing with over 14,000 free games available on Steam, many of them far better than this paid product. Most "cheap" puzzle games are easily solved or the only challenge rests in overcoming the bugginess of the gameplay.  This is a nice exception for the genre.  The designers clearly spent time thinking through how the various Goroon mechanics could be used to create challenging puzzles.

There is some roughness to the game that could use some polishing on the edges, but at the price point this is a solid idea that was pretty well executed.  The game includes leaderboards that are sparsely populated - I have to say it made me sad to see that so few had played the game.  As long as you aren't expecting polish - this is a fun game for a couple hours of puzzles. Fun and challenging puzzle game. I played alone and beat it anyway. Played on Linux.

Divertido y desafiante juego puzzle. Lo jugu√© sola y lo di vuelta de todas maneras. Jugado en Linux. Very clever, funny and addictive puzzle platformer.
Co-op play is great. Love playing with my daughter. Good game in principle, but seems to have a bug that when two people are playing, the switching doesn't work properly and disables the other player - who can no longer switch to another character. The TDLR here is I can recommend this game on the price point. I enjoyed my time playing, it is short but worth the roughly ¬£1 per hour puzzle experience I had. Your times may differ. I did not get to test this game in multiplayer.

This game is charming and minimalistic in art style, doesn't hold your hand when it comes to introducing you to puzzle mechanics, and encourages experimentation. You will need to think logically and make sure you're planning ahead and executing controls precisely, lest finding yourself in a frantic panic or unable to proceed and requiring to restart the whole level.

Positive qualities include:
-Great art style with minimalistic controls, polished appearance.
-Relatively difficult puzzles and high quality level design.
-A sense of learning through puzzles without being force-fed information.
-Includes multiplayer (did not test).
-Worked very smoothly with very few bugs (already fixed by developers).

Negative qualities include:
-I slightly bumpy learning curve (although this could be a personal problem I had with particular levels).
-Sometimes confusing and slightly frustrating keyboard inputs with fairly punishing consequences (game was developed for controllers).
-Nice music but lacked variety.
-Relatively short gameplay time if you're a good puzzle gamer.
-Simplistic sound and graphics options.

name: History of Space
short_description: History of Space is an immersive and educational game that allows players to explore a virtual space history museum, delving into the captivating history of space exploration.
reviews:
I wish there were more virtual museums like this! Beautiful job. I would say avoid at all costs, at any price.
Even at the lowest resolution, I tended to get a very choppy 20 fps.
You see everything there is to see in about four minutes, and there is the impression that it is unfinished, as several areas are blocked off with ropes.
It also really revs up my computer, making me fear there is something going on in the background that is not just the program itself, which shouldn't be that labor intensive.
Shame, as I love the history of space flight, but this misses a lot, I found nothing about the Russian space program, or the astronauts, or any of the international space efforts. It is clearly missing about 80% of the history of space.
Nineteen thumbs down. No reviews, so I thought I'd take one for the team. It's a low quality asset walk through a small wing of a museum with no narration. You just read text on banners next to poor quality 3D models, where the text is even readable. Shocking to see the SteamDB price history shows it starting at $20, seems like it started as a scam and I don't say that lightly.

name: Star Shelter
short_description: Star shelter is a space survival game built from the ground up for VR. You are stranded in space, you must climb around in Zero-G, explore, scavenge, craft, hack and fight to survive. You have to build, arm and upgrade your own space station in order to escape the cosmic graveyard.
reviews:
-The concept is neat, but the execution left something to be desired. It has potential, but it didn't quite hook me. wtf [h1] Development has ended! [/h1]
It is a fun little game that has a few quarks so far and a great way to test vr gear when you are new to it.
I would only get it on 5$ sale though.  okay so ill admit its glitchy a little rough around the edges. sometimes it feels unfair how you died. but a super overlooked feature is that another player can play on your pc while in vr as drone. that is actauly so fun. im not gonna lie i played with my mom who's not technologically inclined and it was so intuitive she managed to do it, so it gets a good rating for helping me have fun with me mom after so many games just didn't, Like Lone Echo?  Wish it was a survival/building game? Well, this is the game for you. Lots of fun. I keep trying to like this game. I just cant. Every time I go out from the hab. Something hits the hab. I then dont have enough materials to repair it. I run of oxy then die. Then when I do get enough to repair it. I dont have any materials to build the quest tutorial plant box. While Im getting the material. The hab gets hit again. Then I dont have enough materials to fix it. Then I die becuase i couldnt eat any food.
Rinse, repeat. its pretty rough around the edges, but its just BARELY a correct, enjoyable game. ive played vr games kinda similar to this one before (like into the radius) but this one actually works by giving you actual objectives. theres a lot of strategy you have to implore to make sure you dont run out of power or oxygen which is something i do like. the main bulk of this game is divided into 2 parts: looting and scavenging for resources and gear, and building your base. its basically a zero g subnautica. there will be some light combat segments here and there, but its not too focused on this. i do like it how the game isnt so stubborn about the hardest to find resources and you can craft them if you dont want to just search and search for one specific rare thing. like i said however its not perfect, but to the games credit none of the problems are due to bad game design, just budget restraints. the game is a little cheaply made, the graphics are extremely simple, and all the stuff that floats around your space ship just stays there until it despawns and some newer thing appears. i would have preferred if the stuff would gradually drift towards your station, pass it, and then drift away. they would help me suspend disbelief and give me a visual indicator of how much time you have before something is too far gone. the game is really buggy and has been abandoned by the devs for years so its pretty likely that it wont get any better, grabbing mechanics are finicky and difficult, the movement system is similar to that of ECHO VR but harder to grab onto stuff (especially if you have a valve index kit)
its not perfect, but it was still able to outshine despite its flaws. it was a one time play, but i still enjoyed it from start to finish. 6/10 The game is not bad but could be better with some bug fix. 

I really liked the survival in a spaceship graveyard, especially in VR.

There is an ending but it will be chalenging so don't be made if you die because that will happen a lots especially near the end but it dosen't affect your spaceship and your progression if you put what you need in your storage.

 great gam evrey thign ive ben lookign for pleas ether bring it back or  make a simlar game with some sort of twist like you pod crashed on a planet cou;d be cool
 Really cool concept but poorly executed :(

name: Incorp Inc
short_description: Create your own company, make money and avoid disasters.
reviews:
Very frustrating game. Workers get stuck walking into walls, income doesn't scale and it's buggy. If you like the idea, armorgames Corporation Inc is a better version of the same thing... and it's a free browser game!

Don't waste your coffee money on this. This game just gets boring, as a simple tycoon there isn't much to do BUT rinse and repeat. yawn i loooooooooooooooooooooooveeee thessssssssss game This is not a game. This is the idea of an game. Why produce boxes when you can`t sell them. Don`t buy this. I can't suggest it, just because of how broken so many of the mechanics are. People will get stuck all over. It will slow down horribly, a lot isn't explained. Like the useless box factory. Eventually your game will get to a point that it's just an unplayable mess.

My janitors all got stuck floating in the air. Couldn't fire them, they wouldn't clean, people were SUPER unhappy. Electritions get stuck in the door constantly getting paid. Money doesn't...go down. I was making enough fast enough to offset it, but it's still there. Worker gets stuck in doorway and never moves. I have screencaps to back all this up by the way.

The devs claim a 2.0 is in the works, but they've gone silent. Just save the $4, or go spend it on something better. Like...anything else. A cute little Early Access sim that might have been bumped to 1.0 a bit too early.


Right now, not much to look at.  Poor game balance, some silly bugs, disorganized UI, but the developers seem to be passionate about making it great and it's worth $4 to support that effort.



I'm looking forward to watching this game evolve into a great title. Fun game little game that for $4 you can't wrong with. This game fits into genre of upgrade / expand / build up more money then rinse repeat.  It's got charm and some cool little details that make it stick out. If you are into these types of game then it's a solid buy that appears to have a lot more coming in the future.  

youtube quick play: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuxGOUuv6Ig&t=25s

If you enjoyed my review please consider following and joining my Steam group
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/MatureMindedGamers#curation]Mature Minded Gamers[/url]
We have free game giveaway's every month for all Members, just click Follow and Join! gets a little boring I love it. I foung this game great, soo great infact that i made a series of it on my Youtube channel (Joedeco)

name: The Blackwell Legacy
short_description: When 3 NYU students kill themselves, nobody thinks that a sinister force is at work. Nobody but fledgling medium Rosa Blackwell & her new spirit guide Joey Mallone.
reviews:
Intersting and nice story. Nicely written too.
Not hard at all but good for spending some spare time.
 ‚ù§Ô∏è I got this game years ago, just to give it a try after a friend recommended the series, although I wasn't particularly hyped about it, and I ended up playing through all five games within a couple of weeks.

The Blackwell games still receive updates regularly, and each entry is better than the previous one. A truly remarkable labor of love.
 Juegazo. I like it - I'm into Point & Click games since the 80s and this one feels just like one of those. It's not a must-play but it's nice, the graphics are quite cute, the characters are well done, the voice acting is pretty decent (although some voices were a bit muted and sadly there was no way to turn the music down and the voices up or something like that - but there are subtitles) and the story is a good one even if it's a bit short. This game was great! A good little shirt game, some of the quests were a bit strange but for it's time I think it was pretty good, my only complaint is how loud the music is, it's insanely loud and running the experience Waay rough around the edges, but a great, moving story with likeable characters. Not a long game, not a particularly hard one either, but I am eager to continue the story. Fun point 'n click with engaging cases. Good 1st part in the series If you haven't played Unavowed, the 2018 game also by Wadjet Eye, go play that instead. It is more polished, with better writing, better sound, better puzzles, better graphics, better everything. It is set in the same universe in the same city in the same genre of story.

If you have played Unavowed and you would be happy with a much less polished game made by a much less experienced Wadjet Eye, then give the Blackwell series a try, starting here. Later installments get better slowly, ending up significantly below Unavowed but still quite nice. 

All in all, I enjoyed this game and the rest of the series. If you don't like this game, I don't think it's worth hanging on for the later installments. Years ago, I stumbled across this series by accident and I am SO happy I did. The Blackwell games are one of my absolute favorite game series ever and this first entry started it all.

The pacing may be a bit slow here but I love the look, love the amazing voice-acting, love the commentary and bloopers, and the story overall.

Definitely a must-have for every point&click fan!

name: FSX: Steam Edition - Embraer Phenom 100 Add-On
short_description: The Embraer Phenom 100 is a Very Light Jet (VLJ) developed and built by Brazilian aircraft manufacturer Embraer.It is normally configured to carry four passengers, but can optionally carry seven passengers with a single crew. First flown in 2007, this twin-engine jet has a range of around 1,200 miles and can fly up to 41,000 feet.
reviews:
Selecting an approach is nearly impossible and and locks up the program. Must kill the FSX task to recover, losing all work.
The FMS is just not ready to use. Seems you must load an Flight Plan from external input and can't just enter a Airport then a runway. Wish I could get my money back. Do not buy this DLC.  It looks nothing like the screenshots and has terrible sound quality. Ugh.

I was hoping for an easy to fly simulator of a nice private jet, and I get this. 

It's slow, it's difficult to figure out, and the autopilot buttons in VC are nearly impossible to manipulate with a mouse - I have to keep going back to the main panel and it's a chore. Not much fun. 

I don't recommend this at all - especially at the price they're charging for it. The graphics are great, but functionality in VC for this price should be 100% and it's not. My nav lights do not go onn Spelet fungerar Ok, men hur kommer man √•t appen " Configuration Utility" f√∂r att att kunna justera Phenom¬¥s prestanda? very good and worth the money especially if its on sale. most buttons in the cockpit work and its a very solid dlc. Loading this aircraft in, it looked great and the cockpit looks nice, but some autopilot functions like speed hold and flying with autopilot full, but no heading mode just do not work. there are some glitches that need to be fixed in order for it to be a complete aircraft. Overall this needs some changes, and one of them is a price drop This is a great intro to jets for pilots looking to expand their hobby into more complex aircraft It took a video on youtube and some practice but once you understand this it is a fun jet! If there was a "not sure" button I would use it. Ngl, this plane is very good for how old the game is. Nearly every switch has a purpose, and it's not too cluttered. It even has  a full interior! However, this plane will whine at you. A lot. "NO TAKEOFF. FLAPS. NO TAKEOFF. TRIM." is its middle name.  Also, be ready to push forward on your joystick/yoke all the time when AP is not engaged. It generates way too much lift for its own good. But hey, this plane was built for the comfort for the rich passengers, not the pilot. And, of course because of that, it lands very stably, and heck would freeze over when this thing lands off center line. So yeah, I both recommend and not recommend this. I am glad comments have been made about the cockpit reflection issue. I am just learning about this plane and trying it out, and really like it, but I came within a inch of tossing it for the very reason of the unnecessary and distracting reflections that impair visibility. I found other folks upset about it, I think it is a major programming flaw. I did a lot of digging and finally found the following remedy that I am just trying out. It comes from a forum (March 19 2014 post):

https://www.avsim.com/forums/topic/353403-feelthere-le-phenom-100-by-embraer/page/4/



- Exit FSX

- Rename reflection_cockpit.dds (SimObjects\Airplanes\feelThere Phenom 100\texture) to something like reflection_cockpit.old

- Copy/paste XGlass.dds in that same folder and name this copy reflection_cockpit.dds

- Start FSX

*************
If it works, and I suspect it will, it will make the difference for me being able to or not being able to use the plane.  I think we had an overly creative programmer here. . I hope this helps! Best regards, CEC

PS: It worked.

*******************************************
Later notes:

After working with this plane for a while, I have decided to abandon it for now.  Flight model seems off to me in some respects (sudden sinks in altitude and floats on approach that just don't seem realistic to me), jumpy screen and flight even in smooth conditions and it does seem much harder on frame rates that my modest computer can seem to hold up to.  I found an EPIC Victory small jet from an external site that fits my bill much better.  The Embraer jets definitely appeal to me (seems like a great company), and the smaller the better, but at this point this implementation seems to be more troublesome than need be on my end. The hassles with the screen reflections above also should have never taken place, and they show lack of rigorous evaluation on the programming side.  Better luck on your side, CEC

name: 2016 Scenarios - Power & Revolution 2020 Edition
short_description: Play as a head of state or as the opposition on 01/01/2016: participate in the numerous conflicts raging around the world (Syria, Iraq, Libya, Nigeria, Somalia) reconstructed to the smallest detail, try to win the US presidential election or quickly get married in France.
reviews: Would be great if it had the same content and graphics as the 2020 mode, this is just a copy paste of the other game with no furhter modification and more cheap and doesn¬¥t allow you to customize the characters of that year

name: From Orbit
short_description: From Orbit is a quick and light single player Action RTS. Guide your stranded crew home as they land on alien planets, scout out the area, build defenses, harvest valuable resources, and launch back into orbit before being overwhelmed by hostile aliens.
reviews:
Boring Nice little game. Graphics look lovely and it's easy to get started.
The main issue with this game is that it feels incomplete. There just isn't much to do other than gathering a couple of resources. 
There are 3 biomes: desert, ice and jungle. The only difference between the three are the graphics. Gameplay and resources to be gathered are identical between all three.
Only two types of resources are to be gathered and all you can do with them is building turrets, gatherers and upgrades. This gets old very fast.
The game looks like a nice prototype which could have been the starting point of a great game. Unless substantial updates  come to the game, skip this one. This is a tough one.  This game seems to be an Early Access game even though it's not.  But it's definitely not complete.

It just lacks the depth I was expecting.  There's only 5 upgrade levels, across like 6 paths.  By the 4th-5th planet I had almost half the upgrades already.  I could see the difficulty was also going to spike.

The planets are basically all the same with a few monster generators that spawn every minute or so.   But this isn't a tower defense game.  Unlike in Gauntlet, you can't destroy these monster generators, and if you're not careful, they'll spawn when you're right next to them.

I really wanted to like this game as I loved Eufloria, Deep Rock Galactic.   I was hoping this game would really be a rougue lite rts, but alas it's not even that.    There's definitely a gem in there somewhere, but it needs some work.  If I had received this on sale, I probably wouldn't have minded as much, but at full price, the content is severely lacking.

I originally wanted to refund it, but just didn't have the heart to go through with it.. I did have some enjoyment for 2 hours, and I really hope the developer uses the money I spent on improving this game. A charming RTS (with a touch of tower defence) roguelite.  Basically the gameplay consists of - land on a planet, explore as quickly as possible to find resources to extract.  Periodically a wave of enemies comes to attack your ship.  Once you've extracted what you can/want, you head back to the ship to blast off, buy upgrades and select a new planet.  
Likes: The art syle and UI are nice, very clean. Music is good, but can see it getting a little repetitive. 
Dislikes: The steam store page gives more of gameplay guide than the game does.  Takes a little while to work out what you're supposed to be doing.  Would like to see the upgrade tree expanded, to give more variety on each playthrough.  Would also like to be able to change the keyboard shortcuts. Not a single word or hint about what the goal is or how to play! A really charming little.... rogueliteish rts sorta dealie. You come to care for your little beepboops, you really do.

name: Transpile Girl Rescue Operation!
short_description: You can fix her! Transform Hina from a cold, emotionless robot to your strict & ideal wife!
reviews:
I'll have to say it: the game needs some fixing so it runs better. Somehow despite the graphic options at their lowest it still runs slowly, there's noticeable lag when switching scenes, and the game froze and I had to exit after half an hour of playing. Laggy and buggy game. Drops a lot of frames. 

Although the music is very good, that song is a bop. This will be the end of humanity. w This game gave me:

 it's cheap for a reason TL;DR 6/10, If you are into a mix of emotionless sex, ahegao, and robot girl turning less robotic, you will find something here, but more than that, it is a really simple mindless game that will burn around 4 hours.

Break down of the overall gameplay loop: 7 days to save your waifu. 6 action point each day. 5 locations to interact with that increases "Research" points (Mini challenge every 25%). Minigames are to be replayed for unlocking special scenes. You can finish the game before day 7.

Design: 6/10

-The waifu's decent to look at.

-2D live-like animation to stimulate your eyes so you are not just staring a still png for 4 horus.

-CG art style is all over the place. Some are really good, but some you can clearly tell they ran out of budget to refine.

Gameplay: 5/10

-It is a mindless clicking game. Which has its pros and cons.

-The pros is that...well, it keeps the game short so all of us hentai enjoyer can just get to the sex CGs with enough engagment so we are not just spending $4 USD on a image pack.

-The cons...The varieties and simplicity of the challenges/mini games makes it tedious because:
1. The day-to-day action points are rechargeable through sex...which is a button with no limits, so yes, you can basically cheese everything by day 3. 
2. The 5 mini games help unlock special scene through points (Total is around 12,000, and each minigame give your around 500), so have fun playing the same or your favorite one over and over again just to grind enough to unlock. 
3. It is really hard to fail. The "Find the pair" minigame gave me 500-700 seconds to find a pair of 16. Why even give me the timer at all?

Writing: 6/10

-The story and the attitude of the MC brings up convos about robot/AI companion. It keeps me invested in the narrative. But don't be mistaken, it is not Detroit: Become Human, this is just a hentai game.

-The robot waifu become more human in the most generic, unnatural way. Like the archetype that she possesses or are going to possess feels like it is either going against what the story is suggesting, or it is copy and pasted onto her.

-The pacing in this game is all over the place that sometimes it becomes comedic, and other times it makes you go: "Oh...That's how much time we are going to spend on this conversa...Nevermind?"

-Consistency in this story be damned. Because the writing started off not knowing where to go with the idea of "AI girlfriend", and it was getting somewhere, but by the end it kind of went back to the start, but now you saved your wife, I guess. Or did you? What? Also, you will never know what she know or doesn't know even though it is something a advanced AI should know.

Overall, this is a $4 USD hentai game with good-looking waifu. A fun VN with mini games and straightforward story. The MC has a unique perk that allows him to regenerate energy merely by c**ming! How's that! And yes, you can literally clear the game in Day One. (there is an achievement for this as well). 

The H scene is fully voiced, seiyuu is pretty good. Though the art can be improved slightly in my opinion but still doesn't break the momentum too much. There are minor translation error but not too painful to be nitpicked. Overall recommended for a quick and chilling game.

name: Cinderella Phenomenon Digital Artbook
short_description: Re-live the Cinderella Phenomenon experience in this artwork archive!
reviews:
This DLC is a artbook of all things Cinderella Phenomenon. It's simple, yes, but did brighten up my day. It's in pdf format, and you just flip through it. Was honestly just really happy to flip through and see all the wonderful memories from Cinderella Phenomenon. Getting to look at all the CG's with their quotes brought an uncontrollable smile to my face.

If anything, it's a great way to support the creators of such a wonderful game. They deserve it, wholeheartedly. <3 A wonderful addition to any fan of the series; this artbook allows you to see not only the images we loved in the story itself, but promotional artwork that make for amazing backgrounds and wallpapers. I mainly bought this as a show of support for the creators of the series, but beyond that, I genuinely enjoyed the contents.

As other reviews have mentioned, to access your art-book PDF file, go to your games library, right-click on Cinderella Phenomenon and select 'Properties.' From there, you'll want to click on 'Browse Local Files.' Your new collector's item should be in the folder that pops up! Enjoy! Bought this to show support for the original free game which I loved.  Thank you Dicesuki! Happy Goodness. Bought this DLC just to support the developer since the base game is free. Looking forward to other games from the same developer! (: I purchased this digital artbook in order to support the creators for their amazing VN Cinderella Phenomenon.  I'm looking forward to the second part Evermore. I will gladly purchase it!  I highly recommend purchasing this artbook in order to support Dicesuki for releasing CP for free.  Also, any DLC alternate endings would be awesome. Take my money!! :) Good: All the game art in one place. Its beautiful. Some promo work too :)

Missing: Anything other than finished game art. I would have enjoyed early designs, things that didn't make the cut, that kinda stuff. Bought this to show support for the game considering it was free and I quite enjoyed it. The digital artbook itself is such an eye candy, packed with character info and icons used throughout the game. I especially loved the short trivia part at the end and the promotional pics.

Recommending this artbook for those who enjoyed the game likewise and has some bucks to share. :) Seeing as how the game is free, I bought the artbook to support the creators in some fashion. I would have gladly paid more for the game itself, but this will have to do. The book itself is nice. There are some new pictures that weren't in the game, and overall the layout is nicely done. Can't complain.

name: Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 4
short_description: Prepare for Halloween with Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 4. 500 photos means 500 excellent puzzles and ideas for a happy holiday!
reviews:
"Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 4" is a basic browser/Flash/mobile-app like jigsaw puzzle game.  Solve various jigsaw puzzles made up from images that the "developer" stole off the Internet and used without crediting the actual creators, making this plagiarism, as well as an asset flip and a cash grab.

An example of the stolen, uncredited/plagiarised artwork is [url=https://www.freepik.com/premium-photo/girl-with-creative-visage_29527476.htm]"Girl With Creative Visage"[/url], stolen and used without any apparent permissions or rights from the photographer, "raisakanareva", via stock image site, Freepik.  Sure, the image rights may allow some stock images to be used without credit (although there's no reason to believe so in this case), and claiming credit for the work of others, as is happening here, is unethical, and the creative and intellectual bankruptcy going on here is unacceptable.

So what we have here is a basic jigsaw puzzle engine that's been skinned with a bunch of photos stolen off the internet and used without attribution.  The icing on the cake is the "developer" here has copy + pasted + reskinned this same asset onto Steam [i]a lot[/i]. 

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this game an insane SEVENTY SIX TIMES onto Steam with minor reskins... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of Creobit's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] 1001 Black Raven Jigsaw
[*] 1001 Jigsaw American Puzzles
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Castles And Palaces 1, 2, 3 and 4
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Detective 1, 2 + 3
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Home Sweet Home Wedding Ceremony 
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Legends of Mystery 1 through 6
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour Africa
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour Asia
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour: Europe
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. 6 Magic Elements
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Cute Cats 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Earth Chronicles 1 through 9
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Home Sweet Home 1, 2 + 3
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Home Sweet Home. Back from Vacation
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Ice Age
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Interior Design
[*] 1001 JIGSAW. MYTHS OF ANCIENT GREECE
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Wild Animals
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: Australian Puzzles
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: France
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: Great America
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London
[*] Alice's Jigsaw Time Travel 1 + 2
[*] Alice's Jigsaw. Wonderland Chronicles 1 + 2
[*] Caribbean Jigsaw
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Christmas 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Easter 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 1, 2, 3 and 4
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Thanksgiving Day 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Valentine's day
[*] Jigsaw Boom 1 + 2
[*] Jigsaw Puzzle Beach Season 1 + 2
[*] Jigsaw Tour
[*] Pirate Jigsaw
[*] Royal Jigsaw 1, 2, 3, + 4
[*] Tasty Jigsaw: Happy Hour 1 + 2
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes this might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 3 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

"Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 4" has the farcical price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.

name: Skat Stammtisch
short_description: With Skat Stammtisch you can enjoy a match of Skat on your PC whenever you feel like it!
reviews:
Skat, a game where you can play to lose and win by losing every play (Stich).

I have always liked playing Skat and I like playing this game.

There are some regional rules that have not been implemented (like Null-Ouvert, Revolution - Null Ouvert where the opponents can swap out cards, and Kontra-Reh-Bock-Jungfrau-Hirsch) The original Altenburger German Face of the cards is missing, and so some cards are unclear to me.
The comments of the AI players (and my own) become very annoying very quickly. I regreted paying for the game after the first game. (I played a lot of Skat in the past and really enjoy the game but this is not fun!) This game is a poor skat game, the AI is not fun to play as it never takes chances and only plays when it has only a 100% winning hand which takes away all the fun. You cant fast play a turn, there is no option for that, you can only give up, but it does not really matter as I wrote above AI only plays when it gets the 100% winning hand. Graphics are poor for a 2018 steam game. Game speed could be faster. Music is poor too. I regret spending money on it. Gutes Spiel.  Good card game. 10/10.

name: Eternal Starlight VR
short_description: Activate your Neural Link to gain an omniscient view of the battlefield. Experience the conflict at any scale, as you plot the course that will lead your fleet to victory. Eternal Starlight is a tactical space combat game, built from the ground up for VR.
reviews:
Really impressed so far. 

Reminds me a lot of BattleGroup VR. I would say there are some dialogs where because the audio doesn't work for all I'd remove them. The admiral for instance only says one thing, over, over, and over again. :(

Also I would like that I like the side missions, scanning, finding damaged ships, etc... Nice little filler. This game smacks Another example of butchering what makes a genre. This game gets both RTS and RogueLIKE/rogueLITE wrong. Story mode is honestly god awful. Same missions that are either a cakewalk, or a death sentence where no matter how hard you try, you will just get obliterated as all you are given is a capital ship with barely any combat capabilities and a single fighter that can barely provide any fire support, while you are fighting at least 4 ships each more than capable to destroy you alone. And there isn't an option to buy any other ships aside from more fighters taht are barely any help. After dying on one 'easy' mission 4 times i've explored other options, and those missions are straight up filler content. And out of 5-6 playthroughs i had the exact same content and the exact same outcome as the "random" prizes for said missions barely make any difference in your playthrough. 

Controls are pretty bad as well. My PC runs much heavier games with ease and when the entire game experiences microstrokes each time i try to use the voice commands it is irritating, not  to mention how awkward it is having to stare at my wrist and not at the action while giving commands is honestly bad and disruptive. 

From the positives i will say that the action looks smooth and it is nice to zoom in and out to see the action unfold. Too bad i am returning the game as it is more frustrating than enjoyable. Fun fleet strategy game. Took me until my third try to really start getting into it, but using voice commands certainly improved the experience. This is a great VR game, very enjoyable, great example of what is possible! Multiplayer/Co-op would be the next step but not sure if these are on the cards. Either way recommend 10/10

It reminded me a little of starfox back during the snes days when talking to the factions. Very good game! Awesome game! Similar to Battle Groups VR, if you‚Äôre familiar with that game. But without the ability to take the driver‚Äôs seat of your spaceship like you can in BGVR. I love how you control the space battles in both games.
I completed the campaign on the easy setting in about 6 hours. I kinda took my time, and enjoyed it. There‚Äôs three difficulty settings, easy, medium and hard. Most games I‚Äôve completed on one of the difficulty settings, I usually don‚Äôt go back and replay it on another difficulty setting. But this game I really like, and I‚Äôm gonna replay the campaign on medium next. There‚Äôs also a skirmish mode too, but I haven‚Äôt tried it yet.
I love this game, and I have no complaints. I would‚Äôve liked to have had the option to control the ships from the captain‚Äôs chair like in BGVR, but still a great game without the option. The graphics and sound are amazing. The gameplay is really fun, and I haven‚Äôt experienced any bugs, lagging, stuttering or freezing in the game. Everything runs super smooth for me. There‚Äôs several ships to unlock as you progress through the game. Also there‚Äôs plenty of weapons and armor attachments to unlock and purchase for your ships.
I highly recommend Eternal Starlight to anyone that likes space games. I‚Äôd give Eternal Starlight an easy 4/5‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è from what I‚Äôve played so far. And that rating could very possibly go higher as I play the other modes in game. Just finished the game under 4 hours on easy. Good game but short. Now will try Endless mode and some Skirmish mode.
Definitely recommended. Just wish for some dlc. Beautiful ships
Fun small scale combat
A lot of options when it comes to ships, hard-points, weapons and special powers
Beautiful environments

!!! Try the demo, it will tell you more that any review will. !!! Amazing VR RTS. Good game to get on sale. Simple enough to pick up and has enough little features to keep it interesting and not [i] too [/i] simple.

name: Braveland Pirate
short_description: The Braveland trilogy concludes with the most exciting book of all, number three ‚Äì welcome to Braveland Pirate strategy game! A crew of pirates led by Captain Jim embarks on a search for the Eternal Treasure.
reviews:
While this fun little mobile game series is not bad, it is not worth your time in 2025. There are thousands of games better than this one on steam. 
Also it has annoying bug with text centered and going out of bounds on top and bottom which is just unforgivable. I was unimpressed with the Braveland, due to it being just a simple mobile port. A lot of reviews agreed. But the dev was responding to those reviews asking people to try Braveland Pirate, so I did. And while it is an improvement over the original Braveland, it's still just a better mobile game. Yet another entry in Braveland series, a collection of cheap mobile games mimicking Heroes of Might & Magic. While this game offers several improvements over previous games, it's still pretty dull and full of grind.

Everything that I said about previous games applies here as well:
* This game is made for mobile devices so it lacks many quality-of-life features of PC-oriented games.
* While there‚Äôs an attempt to make the world design more open by adding optional islands, it's still a simple point-and-click game, and the main path is linear. It still lacks open exploration and strategic depth of HoMM games.
* Battles are repetitive and get tedious and dull very quickly. Majority of the enemies you'll encounter are reused from previous games, and you'll encounter the same enemies over and over again.
* Player hero now directly participates in combat, but the talent system still feels uninspired. 
* The game is longer than its predecessors, but only because it relies on grind to pad out the limited content.

Ultimately, while Braveland Pirate adds some new features, it does very little to make the experience less tedious and shallow. A chill game Improved Braveland Wizards and a bit longer. Playing time is around 5-6 hours than previous games which took to finish in 3 hours Simple and straight forward time killer Game becomes impossible to play very quickly. Grossly unbalanced with no way around it to continue playing. Completely ends game play since you can not get past either of the two battles because it is unbalanced with no options to work with. Or try different tactics as you only have one heal and two players other than change the square you get beaten on there is no other tactics. You can't heal another player. you can't level up with lower battles. You can't go get different weapons. What happened to the people you hire? You have no other tools or ability to attack with range. You only have 2 swords and a single heal for the battle. Leaving you with your only option to choose which square you die on.  As a developer why do this? What do you gain from this? Is there a secret you are hiding from the player I couldn't find that opens up other tactics?  I couldn't find any. +
Fun.
Easy / Medium / Very Hard levels. [I'm getting to the age where playing on the easier levels.]
Funny story-line and cartoon characters, Nice music.
Choose your favourite crew types.  As the game goes on their strength grows, special abilities and dress in better clothing. Visit inns and get reinforcements. Maybe avoid really difficult bits and double back to them once more powerful.
Bravery increases special powers such as the devastating broadsides from your ship.
-
You never really lose a battle.  Indeed get compensated.
Monsters lay traps under leaves then blunder into them themselves.
Never did rob the Iron bank; they called in the big fiery stuff...

Note - some of this developers games are "freemium" type games that I avoid. This is not that type. I will look to get more of this type (you buy it you got it) from them. + Heroes of Might and Magic style combat
+ Cheap
+ Simplistic

- Wish there was more

My enjoyment:
8/10 Fun little game for your KB or HoMM fix. TL;DR: this game is the definitive Braveland experience and pretty simple fun at that. Get it on sale, play it, and forget about the first and second game.

This game, on its own, is fine fun. However, after playing through all 3 Braveland games, I've grown discontent with the series as a whole. Braveland is a frustratingly long trilogy for a series that almost never innovates on anything. The only thing innovated from the first game is the forgetful talent system in Wizard and Pirate.

Sure, the heroes and troops are different in each game, but not really... just stack troops and focus on doing as much damage as you can, GG. 

The only other difference is that each game is longer than the last.

By the end of this game, I was thoroughly exhausted with the formula and just wanted to be done with it, but only because I had 20+ hours of it already under my belt from playing through the first two games.

name: Invercity
short_description: Invercity is a puzzle-platformer that features the action "Handstand". A handstand looks like hanging when you look it upside down, doesn't it? This game really makes it look that way. A reporter who loves doing handstands follows a mystery while reporting the "Invercity Phenomenon‚Äù in the city.
reviews:
Very fun game reminiscent of something like Super Hook Girl. Good use of free assets which is something I always admire. Strong, defined puzzle mechanics and a charming look/cast. [h3] Pros [/h3]
+ Qute art style
+ Very interesting mechanics
[hr][/hr]
[h3] Cons [/h3]
- Inconsistent art style 
[list]
[*] Background & People have big pixels
[*] Foreground & MC have tiny pixels (looks bad when she stands near other people)
[*] Taxi in the end of level has corparate style (or something like that) for some reason??
[*] Hand drawn (?) style outside of the "camera" (actually good, half of reason why i bought)
[/list]
- Blurry UI some times
[list]
[*] Whole main menu & settings page is blurry (including text)
[*] In game everything mostly OK, but some times some things get blurry
[*] Also for some reason it thinks my screen is 2304x1296, instead of 1920x1080
[/list]
- Strange jumping physics
- Takes more from Sokoban than Platformers, because of that feels more tile based, unlike usual platformers
- Story can be interupted by accidentaly dying in pit/sky
[hr][/hr]
[h3] IDK [/h3]
? Story (havent finished)
? Wrong font compared to store page screenshots? (tho in game one is better) 
? Actual worth for you (cus these are [b][i]MY[/i][/b] opinions) The game is fun and challenging, would love an update with more levels! A simple puzzle game about inverting and flipping gravity and your orientation.  The main game is short and is really more of a tutorial of how all the puzzle mechanics work. 

The real meat of the game is the side puzzles. Those are definitely more difficult. I have not cleared all the puzzles but I have clocked more than 3 hours just clearing the first bunch of side puzzles. 

Definitely a good game for a day off to complete. What a great retro experience! This game really captures the magic of the old Nintendo (Famicon) games: simple and engaging mechanichs, charming aesthetics, funny music and cute characters in pixel art.

The game offers a great experience for casual playing while having a drink or relaxing a bit before going to bed. The puzzles hit a sweetspot of difficulty, not to easy not to complicated, and if you like a bit more of a challange you have extra levels that demand a bit more of thinking besides the main route.

Overall, Invercity feels like the games I grew up with and made me fall in love with gaming, so give it a go. And If you happen to have little kids, this is a great game to share with them to introduce them to gaming, I know I would. Game Length: 4+ Hours (has bonus stages for more challenges as well)
 5/5
Story: Not much but got more than oldschool mario platformers
 n/a
Gameplay: Platformer Puzzle game where you can invert gravity and flip the screen.  Brain banger stuff!
 5/5
Visual: Pixel Cute
 5/5
Music: Derpy upbeat fun
 5/5

Grand Total:  I really like this game!  If you dig puzzle games like Sudoku or stuff and finding the right patterns etc....this games pretty good!
 10/10

Honest Opinion time!  I love puzzle games, i love strategy games and technical stuff like card games and sorts....So i really like this game!  I gave it a max 10/10 because it hits me hard on all the categories.  Its not a perfect game, but it scores statistically perfectly in each of the genre for a "Puzzle Game".  Highly recommend to ppl who like problem solving games!  Makes a great game to play for your week if you got nothing going right now!  If not, you can wishlist it on a sale but the game really is fun!  (if you like puzzle tags that is!)

name: BattleRush - Heavy Tanks DLC

The M26 Pershing was a heavy tank/medium tank of the United States Army. The IS Tank was a series of heavy tanks developed as a successor to the KV-series by the Soviet Union during World War II.
reviews: DONT BUY, YOU NEED TO CRAFT THAT IMPOSSIBLE TO DO

name: AtmaSphere 2
short_description: Embark on a frosty medieval journey! Guide your ball through snowy platforms, conquer obstacles, and collect pickups. With stunning graphics and immersive gameplay, brace yourself for a chilling adventure! Roll to victory in this winter realm!
reviews:
This was a surprisingly decent sequel to the first AtmaSphere. I was pleased to see that the coins and vases were given a complete overhaul, with the vases actually breaking and providing more coins. The coins were even given a bit of a purpose, allowing you to spend them to change the skin of the sphere. I just wish there were an achievement for unlocking all the skins.

Other than that, the game is, at the time of writing this, poorly optimized and even crashes seemingly randomly. I posted about this in the discussions and the dev answered, which was a nice surprise. I made sure I was on the most recent Windows update, had the latest graphics drivers, and verified the game files, but still experienced a single crash before beating the game.

I would like to point out, which might be obvious given what I just said, but the dev does seem to be quite involved and active within the community, providing as much help as they can and whenever they can. I popped into their discord and noticed how active they were, which is quite refreshing! With that said, I think the issues I mentioned would be resolved given time.

+1 perfect games! Movement is really bad, it was fine in the first game I'm sorry but I can't recommend this one. I actually really enjoyed the first game and bought the 2nd as soon as I finished the first. 

But this game..... This game feels like the developer discovered Mario maker troll levels while developing it. The checkpoints make no sense at times, some of the jumps flat out abuse the inconsistent physics and rolling, and other jumps abuse the poor camera angle.

I fully cleared the first 3 categories but the "insane" category isn't hard in a git gud sense but more of a disrespecting my time sense. I put it down for now. 

The music also randomly stops in this one and it isn't relaxing or as enjoyable to play. Buy the first one instead. 

I'll keep plugging through the impossible levels and I'm sure I'll clear them all, but they just aren't fun or consistent. First AtmaSphere was nice and chill but this one is just frustrating and not fun at all. Refunded. Nice game 9/10 Harder than Dark Souls i liked the first game a bit more, probably because of the art style, but the new additions like statistics and leaderboards were really nice. If you want a small game that you can just turn your brain off, watch a podcast or something while playing, these games are great for that As the ball rolling game curator, I cannot recommend this.

We're looking at about 60 levels where you roll left to right, with limited 3d to move up and down.

Levels spread across 4 difficulties, and the only spike for me happened when hitting the hardest difficulty.  Dev chose to simply remove checkpoints in the harder difficulty, adding too much tedium.  Seeing myself as #3 in the global leaderboards for those last few levels - Not a good thing! Very atmospheric and beautiful game. The ball is controlled perfectly without any problems. The game is very well developed, thanks to the developers. Atmasphere 1 was a functional, if unexciting example in missed opportunities, that wile woefully unengaging to me, was at least somewhat functional as a work. Atmasphere 2 ramps up the presentation, and improves vastly upon the level design...but is broken on a fundamental level.

Even before diving into any of the actual stages, I found my controller to be completely non-working, and menus broken, with the options not letting me scroll to the off-box resolutions, only to have it completely imprison me on said screen, neither Esc, nor any controller button working.

Restarting, and actually diving into a level saw my keyboard thankfully working, however, the moment I let go of something, even with the left stick on my controller neutral, would see the ball rolling away from the camera. As well, the cursor was only usable on the menus if W was held, which caused things to scroll off the cursor, and thus you need to time it to get the option that was wanted.

Restarting [b]again[/b] with my controller off showed the same thing happening, and it was only when I physically unplugged said device, that ‚Äúnothing pressed‚Äù equalled ‚ÄúNo Movement‚Äù. Unfortunately, this was not the end of the issues, as the other issue I encountered continued to make the game unplayable.

Specifically, rather than accelerating to maximum speed smoothly, and facilitating any form of precise control, the ball ‚Äì contrary to what the gameplay footage in-trailer shows ‚Äì instead ‚ÄúSnaps‚Äù from minimal speed to maximum, complete with frame-rate hitch. Lowering this from 240 Hz to 120 in the options did make it semi-playable until Medium stage 4, but after the 16th death that could have been averted if this didn't occur, I lost all will and motivation to even try playing more of it.

I don't know if this was a by-product of ‚Äúunlimited FPS‚Äù being auto-selected, or something else, but in the instance the former option was the culprit, that said option is greyed out, making it unable to be toggled, and thus me check if that's at fault.

That's not it, though: the game never tells you double-jumping is possible, so unless you stumble upon it like I did, Medium 3 will be impossible. On the topic of that word, though, apparently a later stage exists that is literally impossible to clear unless you jump off the course, and wait for the platform to regenerate, then jump back on. This may sound innocuous, but in any other level, you die the moment you fall onto the background terrain, meaning the only way any player could possibly know to do this is if they either intentionally tried to lose a life out of frustration, or otherwise accidentally fell onto said part.

In other words, exceedingly poor design.

[b]Verdict:[/b] Completely unplayable without an extensive update, and thus, going into 5: Dourly Dismissed.
