name: Blocky McBlockFace
short_description: Dominate blocks as a block.
reviews:
The graphics are bad but the game is, surprisingly, fun. Pretty fun to get all achievements. Worth the $0.99! This game is like Super Mario Bros. on the NES because it shaped the gaming industry in a way that cannot be described with words. I don't think the same way when starting up a game anymore. The intricate details that this game displays blows my mind. After playing this game, anything else is dull and mindless. Please make another. Best Game ever As accurately described on the Store page:
[quote][i]This game is scrubby.[/i][/quote]

It's a stupidly simple top-down shooter / meme game, made with Paint‚Ñ¢-style graphics.

It is also, perhaps surprisingly, fun for half an hour, the time it takes to kill enough blocks to get all the achievements.

There's nine weapons to wield and an upgrade system that lets you shoot faster and get auto-shooting guards. The enemies (big and small melee mobs, one shooter and one spawner) aren't challenging at all, even in large quantities. Still, it's entertaining watching the gold spew out of them as you kill them.

A couple of small qualms to note:
- You can't remap keys in-game (but you can in the Unity launcher)
- If you let lots of enemies to fill the screen and/or use spammy weapons like shotgun with maxed fire rate, the game may slow down.

Inexpensive as it is, get it on sale and have half an hour of internal chuckles and/or cringing to the fact this game exists.

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9997062/]~Twistorian Curator~[/url] fun for 1 hour, then it gets boring, price is fine tho I'll take your entire stock!!

name: Arkham Horror: Mother's Embrace
short_description: Inspired by the award-winning board game franchise, Arkham Horror: Mother‚Äôs Embrace is an¬†investigation game served with turn-based combat, set in the cult universe of H.P. Lovecraft.
reviews:
A great game. I wish there would be a sequel Not perfect but a great port! Let's make one thing clear. Arkham Horror: Mother's Embrace is not the digital version of the famous board game, nor was it much beloved card game.

Arkham Horror: Mother's Embrace is more in spirit with JRPG than TTRPG. Was the game good? No, it is not as good as it should have been, but it could be way worst than what we got.

What you love/hate about Arkham Horror is here. The colorful character roster, the Sanity check, the Mythos penalties and so on. The graphic is decent, the soundtrack is fine, and surprisingly, the dialogues are fully voiced.

So would i recommend Arkham Horror: Mother's Embrace? It's depend how much you love Arkham Horror as a franchise. If you do, yeah, go ahead. Not like there is other option. If not, you would not miss anything. This game sucks. The game won't let me change enemy targets, keeps forcing me to select the enemy the game wants me to select.  This game is a major fail. It's fun if you enjoy the source material. If you like the Arkham Horror Games (especially Mansions of Madness): Take a look, you might like this game! Otherwise: Don't bother, there are better options.

That being said: I liked it. Primarily because I like the Arkham Horror Franchise and its characters. '..snatched from the jaws of victory'.   The game not my playthrough.  I cannot in any way, unfortunately, recommend this game.  I have played through 6 of the chapters so far but gave up having twice not got through the final fight in no 6.  But that is not the reason I stopped.  It is all the annoyance created getting to that point.  Main issues - problems with movement, I have had to ctrl alt del to get out of the game numerous times because my character was stuck and unable to move as it was blocked in by the scenery or other characters.  Luckily when I rebooted it took me back to the same place but in a different position so I could carry on.  But is this acceptable?  Given the price of the game, is it really that unfinished.  Secondly, the sheer nauseating monotomy of clicking on every white dot mostly to find that you get a sanity check.  As others have said, you pick up a piece of paper that has today's date on it, oh no sanity check, lose one sanity.  that is not gameplay that is weak playtesting and only annoying to the people trying to play the game.  If you want to play the story ie get to the end, use one of the guides which say 'if you click on the shrine you will get a sanity check'.  You can then avoid them and the game actually flows better.

Alas this is not like the boardgame, there is no thrill of the chase or team bonding here, it feels like a cop-out.  To be fair I dont think it started out that way and there are lots of familiarities here with the original Arkham but  I feel that this would be much better done as an X-Com or Phantom Doctrine type background with Arkham layered over the top.  That way the movement would be excellent, you could have sanity and health for each character, you could have your base with team members working on other things while your team goes out to discover clues and battle the cults, and you could create the right atmosphere.  Lots of scenarios such as finding the other team members, investigating a suspicious event, battling a known cult hideout and eventually build up to the grand finale etc.

This game is a travesty I am surprised it even got a mixed grading.  I went for it because it was Arkham but wish I hadnt bothered. It is a nice touch. Not quite terrifying, but interesting, especially, if you like the tabletop games with the same characters. If you're a fan of the Fantasy Flight Arkham Files series of board games, you'll love this! The game play is reminescent of the old Sierra games. Limited text bases choices requiring you to do what the devs thought was the right answer. I find it clunky. In the late 1980's, it would have been acceptable tech. Not now. The Developer Lucky Hammers closed in 2019.

name: Starship Traveller (Standalone)
short_description: YOU are the hero in Starship Traveller! Captain a futuristic Starship in Steve Jackson's classic sci-fi RPG gamebook!
reviews:
old school choosse your path Robot Comamando is the best book ever...not this

Check the game here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TEFdIHizTxg I was too young to play the original hardcopy version back in the day.  Having said that, I thought this game was fine. The game isn't flashy, but neither is playing the tabletop version. The game is reminiscent of old text-based games of the early 80's, when computer graphics weren't really anything beyond what a Commodore 64 could offer. 

The game works as a single-player standalone, and it's a nice little jaunt for a quick adventure. On the PC it works, but like the tabletop game - it's not flashy. If you want a more engaging experience, buy No Man's Sky or something else. If you want an easy-to-digest experience that you can enjoy by yourself without spending hours doing the same pointless repetitive tasks - then Starship Traveller works, and it works well - and best of all, it costs less than the soda you're going to buy while waiting for your friends to show up at the gaming store to actually play Traveller on a tabletop. I love this book. Really captures the feel of the original Star Trek series! True to the original, there seems to be no link between the choice made and the outcome. Fun Definitely one of the better CYOA games out there. Love the story along with how interactive the game is (especially with using dice as well as being able to set skill, stamina, etc). I enjoyed finding all the pictures as well as experiencing all the different choices. The music was pretty decent, would've been great if there was voice acting but no biggie though. The art was also pretty decent Overall, if you like CYOA games, this one is for you. Not badly priced either, considering all the time I spent playing the game, it was definitely worth it. A great on-screen production of one of the early Fighting Fantasy gamebooks.
A change of direction from the usual sword&sorcery style games set in the world of Allansia, this one is set on board a spaceship [i](as if you hadn't guessed)[/i] which has been trapped in a parallel universe to Earth.
Steve Jackson's star-trek style original book has been brought back to life [i](beamed down?)[/i] on screen here. The gameplay is just as it woz [i](all those years ago!)[/i] and altho the original artwork has been redesigned with new, colour illustrations, it complements the game perfectly.
There are options for futuristic background music and sound effects, as well as a series of 20 Steam achievements ranging from tricky to amusing. There are also Steam trading cards for this game, if you like that sort of thing.
In addition to your own skill, stamina & luck scores, you have a small specialist crew with their own individual scores, who may need to fight with you or make skill roles in their area of expertise. Your starship has scores for weapons and shields.
As well as the standard FF combat, this game also has systems of combat for personal phaser duels (quick & deadly!) and ship-to ship battles. You have the option to custom name your character, crew, ship & even the ensign.
The game is not very combat heavy, but does need very specific path choices to find the info required to make your way safely back to Earth. The game is quite short, but that is because the original book woz only 340 references rather than the usual 400, so not a fault of the developers.
TinManGames have produced several of the original FF games as standalone titles (more about them elsewhere) and this is an enjoyable variation on the theme. Game rating

Innovation: Ultimate

Indulgement qualities: Ultimate

Illustration: Ultimate

Creativity and writing qualities: Ultimate

Overall size: Ultimate

name: The Land of the Seazogs
short_description: Professor Meme, a renowned 164-year-old genetic scientist, receives a mysterious call for help from his old friend Gustav, the head of the animal research base on Zerulia, an inhospitable planet inhabited by ancient aquatic creatures: the Seazogs.
reviews:
A fun mini-adventure that hearkens back to the [i]sense of wonder[/i] days of Golden Age Science Fiction -- this openhearted simplicity emphasized by references to the [i]nearer[/i] days of CGA monitors and soaring, uncluttered synth (interspersed with broad stretches of ambient life support noise, of course).  The translation is very effective, and fooled me into thinking that the native language of the game [i]was[/i] English -- though there are numerous typos that could be ironed out to give more of a professional gloss to things.  There are a few bugs, too, these all showing up toward the end, but nothing game -breaking, mostly just dialog flags resetting when you reload.  

Generally, I was impressed!  Will Professor Meme have further adventures, I wonder? Pleasant retro adventure for nice afternoon. Story is a bit hurried in the end, it tries to aim high, but has not enough space for it. So it could have been tad longer after all. Overall was an interesting and fairly short point and click adventure.  Playtime was about 2 1/2 hours without a guide.  The story is a scifi fantasy mystery where you play as Professor Meme after landing at the base on Zerulia.  Your friend Professor Gustav is missing and it becomes your job to find him and discover the mysteries of the strange creatures, the Seazogs.  The game is not without it's faults, and some puzzles are not as intuitive as I'd have liked.  There were two sections where I became stuck for a while.  For the first one, thankfully the base is fairly small so I was ultimately able to exhaust options to stumble on the answer.  The second however was thankfully not a game breaking bug, but was a softlock where I was unable to ride an elevator back up in a room.  I was able to quit to menu and when I continued, I was back in the starting room with all my inventory, so I was able to progress and ultimately finish the game.  I am considering typing up a guide so more people can ultimately finish the game, I feel that because there are times it is not clear on what to do, some people may be discouraged and not want to continue the game.  I hit that point previously, when I had originally purchased the game and gave up for a while. Only today I came back to try again and was able to complete it in one sitting, but I was also determined to see the end.  Again, I feel it was a neat game and very affordable for the short experience it provides, but it has faults and can be hard to know where to go next. Despite some technical glitches, I enjoyed this short sci-fi adventure.  The cute graphics might make you think it is a light story but it is actually kind of serious and dark in some places.  I got stuck a couple of times but nothing seemed too outrageous.  There is an issue with scenes resetting if you go back into another area and then return, also an object didn't appear in my inventory until I re-did a scene.  Still, I liked the character development and the setting.  you have to like retro-graphics obviously, and sci fi.  Beyond that some patience with the interface and this story can be quite rewarding.  I'm glad I bought this one, a fun evening well-spent. A very interesting retro style point and click adventure, would recommend always, even more if you feel like kind of nostalgic about those spectrum times, also nice little futuristic story to spend a couple of hours exploring this world. It's a nice game. 
It has a classic point & click gameplay, simple but very effective pixel perfect graphics, inmersive music and simple but effective sound effects. 
It also has some interesting and tricky puzzles. 
Resolving all puzzles quickly the game lasts about 2 hours.

name: Chess Multiple Boards
short_description: Chess battle is re-imagined as 3D! In this variation of chess, we have up-to 8 parallel boards and the pieces can travel between them.
reviews: Interesting concept. I've never seen a 3 floored Chess game before. Rules are a bit strange but seems consistent. It has regular and 3 floored modes. If you are a Chess enthusiast, you should have this in your inventory.

name: Shaper
short_description: Shaper is an integrated 2D dungeon editor allowing you to create your own adventure. Create a dungeon with enemies, objects, decorations and share it with your friends and the community!
reviews: How can I describe Shaper? Super Zelda Maker maybe? You can design your Zelda-esque dungeons, share them and play other players' creations. It's a pretty fun concept and I like it. Of course there is a room for improvement. For example I find the default keyboard controls awkward but at the moment there is no way to remap them. But I'm sure that after some polishing this hidden gem will truly shine.

name: Gnomes Solitaire
short_description: Help the brave heroes overcome all the dangers and unravel the secrets of the kingdom!
reviews:
Disappointing solitaire game cashing in on the Gnomes Garden series.  It reuses the same backgrounds repeatedly (without any story context), has limited game design (it never evolves from the original setup) and worst of all very poor level design.  Some levels you have a pile of 40 cards to use to unearth 4 cards by revealing 12 (i.e. no challenge), others you have 15 cards to unearth 8 cards under 60 staged so that you only have 8 cards on display but have to remove 2 to get to 1 underneath (i.e basically impossible without using ridiculous numbers of jokers/shuffles).  These are randomly distributed so it doesn't feel like you are progressing but hitting walls.  I also have no idea how they are calculating their card packs as I've come across layers with 8 cards of the same number but the total card count was only just over 60. An aggravating play - there are far better solitaire games available. SImple and easy. A fun game to play Gnomes Solitaire is a basic mobile-app like solitaire puzzle game.  Solve various puzzle levels using Klondike style card moving and matching.  It's been done a million times before, for free, and free on mobile app stores too... yet this one has a hefty price tag on it.  Who knew you can just charge $5 for mobile trash?  I guess Creobit does. 

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this game an insane SEVENTY TWO TIMES onto Steam with minor reskins... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of Creobit's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] Dangerous Solitaire. Zombie Fever
[*] Dark Solitaire. Mystical Circus
[*] Detective Solitaire Inspector Magic and the Man Without Face
[*] Detective Solitaire Inspector Magic
[*] Detective Solitaire The Ghost Agency 1 + 2
[*] Detective Solitaire. Butler Story 1 + 2
[*] Detective Solitaire: Inspector Magic And The Forbidden Magic
[*] Egypt Solitaire. Match 2 Cards
[*] Fairytale Solitaire. Witch Charms
[*] Fairytale Solitaire: Red Riding Hood
[*] Gnomes Solitaire (this asset flip)
[*] Holiday Solitaire Easter
[*] Knight Solitaire 1-3 
[*] Mystery Solitaire Cthulhu Mythos
[*] Mystery Solitaire The Arkham Spirits
[*] Mystery Solitaire. Cthulhu Mythos 1 + 2
[*] Mystery Solitaire. Dreamcatcher 1-3
[*] Mystery Solitaire. Powerful Alchemist 1-3
[*] Mystery Solitaire. The Black Raven 1-4
[*] Mystery Solitaire: Grimm's tales 1-8
[*] Pirate's Solitaire 1 + 2
[*] Restaurant Solitaire Delicious Lunch
[*] Restaurant Solitaire: Pleasant Dinner
[*] Solitaire Beach Season 1-3
[*] Solitaire Bonbon
[*] Solitaire Christmas. Match 2 Cards
[*] Solitaire Christmas
[*] Solitaire Halloween 1 + 2
[*] Solitaire Jack Frost Winter Adventures 1-3
[*] Solitaire Legend of the Pirates 1-3
[*] Solitaire Match 2 Cards. Thanksgiving Day
[*] Solitaire Match 2 Cards. Valentine's Day
[*] Solitaire TED and PET
[*] Solitaire Victorian Picnic 1 + 2
[*] Strike Solitaire 1-3
[*] Sweet Solitaire: School Witch 1-3
[*] True Detective Solitaire 1 + 2 
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The game only displays in 4:3 pillarboxed aspect ratio (with some lazy "wings" to fill the pillar).  It's possible they developed this using an old CRT they found in a dumpster, or this game has been specifically designed for people gaming on PC's from 1995... either way, this isn't really acceptable in the modern era of PC gaming.

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes Gnomes Solitaire might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 3 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

Gnomes Solitaire has the farcical price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.
 It's a fun game that's easy to pick up and play to pass the time. The gameplay is simple, but it is difficult to achieve the necessary scores due to the limited number of cards in the deck in certain levels. This forces you to replay levels more often, which can feel a bit repetitive at times.

name: Jetpack Stadium
short_description: Jetpack Stadium is a hilarious VR sports game that will have you flying around a virtual stadium. Use your head to hit a massive soccer ball into your opponent's goal using two hand-mounted rockets. Duke it out against other players in a soccer-like competition!
reviews:
Rocket League + VR sounds like an amazing combo, but all of my time was spent flying around waiting on people and they never came. Really unfortunate. ‚ÄòJetpack Stadium‚Äô has one big problem. Its not the graphics that are a little sparse, as they are also colourful and fun looking. It is not the amount of content because even at full price ¬£4.79 this COULD be worth many times that amount. And it most certainly isn‚Äôt the gameplay. The rockets feel responsive and while slow starting you can get the giant football moving at quite a speed because this game is essential Jetpack Football and I have an absolute blast playing it.

The problem is I played this game on my own with no AI, no other players and no-one showed up at all. There is no community of players waiting to play this and that is a shame. Without any single player options nor online players this game is dead before it got started and that is a big shame because this is overall a great game! While I marked it down for now there is MASSIVE potential here that I hope shows its face in future updates. Maybe a small single-player league or some tournaments, anything to counteract the lack of online players that makes this game feel like an empty shell waiting for something great to grow inside of it. where is everybody

name: Action Arcade Wrestling
short_description: Perform a BODY SLAM, knock‚Äôem down with a CLOTHESLINE, pull off the classic PILEDRIVER AND‚Ä¶ shoot LIGHTNING BOLTS into your opponent's face?! Whatever you do‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt find yourself looking up at the lights!
reviews:
fun easily worth the 4 dollars on sale if you are a wrestling fan No Bueno If you do a CPU vs CPU match. You CANNOT turn off the health bars or those button mashers that appear when a wrestler is in a grapple. In a CPU vs CPU match
if there is a weapon on the outside. One of the CPU wrestlers will go outside the ring and then quickly get back inside. Then the other wrestler does the same thing - over and over - eventually it stops and they start wrestling again.
I like the arena/ring creation very similar to Fire Pro Wrestling World.
The create a wrestler edit add on requires more 3rd party tools than in game options. There are many options here but without paint.net or adobe photoshop or something like that. Wish they added template heads that you could modify.
Also you need to upload your arena and create a wrestler in order to use it in the game.
Lots of moves to choose from but no real CPU logic like in Fire Pro Wrestling World.
The game had potential - last update to it was in 2022....so not sure if they will ever add to it or improve it any longer.
I would avoid it - I was issued a refund. This game is total trash, super repetative and some of the worst tutorials as they dont work, i love this game 970 hrs and still counting cant get enough of the matching wrestling biggest names against each other and watching who would win oh did i mention it has both royal rumble and battle royal you can create the greatest rr or br       i would tell u but figure it out yourself I Kinda Do And Dont Recamond Seems like an unfinished game As is the actual wrestling in this game is pretty bare-bones with some animations looking clunky or too stiff. The real charm of the game therefor is not the gameplay itself unfortunately, but in the novelty of the custom content you can create or download. It's undeniably fun (for a little while) to play a wrestling match with a ninja turtle against the likes of batman or 1980's Hulk Hogan dropping the leg on Todd McFarlane's Spawn. Beyond that though, there just isn't much under the hood. You get exhibition matches and can create gauntlets which feels like a poor excuse for a career or season mode. Probably because it is. The game has potential, but it really needs a lot of love and care to make it last. Even little details like post-match celebrations and physical championship belts are missing. How hard is it to make a belt that can attach to a wrestler's hand during intros or play a cinematic camera celebration after a win?

All in all, if you're a fan of wrestling and crazy dream matches and you can find this on sale for less than five bucks? Sure, give it a go. This game is really good. would love for a few things to be added. That could make it better.
1) More over the top moves (like wwe allstars or battlegrounds) and more finishers twist of fate, styles clash, etc...
2)Taunts during the match. maybe a taunt button. the taunt selected from profile. (if there is a way already its not shown in the tutorial.)
3)The option to increase or decrease the game speed.
4)Last but not least custom music. a folder that you can put your music for this game. Then when picking a character you can pick the music from that folder to play for that character if that character wins.  and also in game music as well(during the match). would love to set up gauntlet with custom music..

but i like the gameplay reminds me of smackdown 1 and 2 mixed with wrestlemaina arcade.

name: Knightfall: A Daring Journey
genres: Action, Indie, Racing, Free To Play
short_description: Two knights, a strong bond, and a long journey. Take up the race for the rose, ride from town to town and take shelter before nightfall by any means necessary! If your bond is strong and your horse drifts well, you can be the recipient of the fabled rose. Luckily you brought guns!
reviews:
I went through all of that... just for a rose. I‚Äôm literally fighting sweats and running away for a plant. 10/10 would get again, but next time, I better get a bouquet. Remember to tell your homies you love them 10/10 very fun game When horse sideways i come funny game and enjoyable Will you have the courage to push forward and fight everyone and be the best horse-drifter of the realm? Will you then, have the courage to propose to your partner?
Farewell Knightfall, it's been tons of fun good game while it lasted

rip knightfall it is a  ton of fun i miss my wife tails. i miss her a lot

name: Warfront Defenders
short_description: The¬†gameplay¬†is¬†inspired¬†by famous last stands from some of history's deadliest conflicts, such as the Second World War and the Sino-Japanese War. A¬†hybrid¬†of¬†Tower¬†Defense¬†and¬†Real-Time¬†Strategy¬†with¬†a¬†lot¬†of¬†replay¬†value.
reviews:
The game was abandoned. I read negative reviews and unfortunately did not believed the game could be that bad, but I was wrong - what a steaming pile of early access this is:
- interface will take tons of work to make it usable,
- micromanagement based on points just makes the game tedious,
- there is no planning nor strategy elements,
- I can hear the same "taking fire" sample over and over again, but there is no indication which soldier is actually under fire,
- soldiers just die even when there is noone around to shoot them at this moment,
- shooting through the walls is quite common,
- shelling kills everyone in range, even if they had cover from the point of impact,
- I put guy with LMG next to the wall, so he could shood every enemy that will cross the gate... unfortunately he died without firing single bullet, because he was staring at the wall and I can't (or don't know how to) point him in right direction,
- interface often treats click on soldiers icons as selecting soldier that is close to the bottom of the screen, which in game depending on reflex actions is not a good sign,
- I gave guy machine gun, so, of course, he shot two friendlies that were in front of him

I could go on, but just like this game, it would be pointless Pretty good game, should add a beach invasion. That would be pretty sick
Really fun and kind of easy to play. +
Lovely graphics and visuals very charming

-
Badly executed game mechanics, heavy micromanagement needed, you have to look at all soldiers to refill ammo constantly and also to give medikits, there is quickseleections at the bottom for soldiers but you cant drop the medikit or ammo there.

Speed: The game is superfast, it could  have been a very tactical game if you could adjust the speed. Hopefully it will be added in a future release.

Annoying music that turns downthe atmosphere
--------------
Still I think it can be enjoyable to those people that like this highspeed game since the graphics are fun, if you are into shootem√∫ps  (even though I am I cant really say its enjoyable hehe) Not a bad game, has some potential, but I can't recommend it at the moment. Nie≈∫le I think this game has possibilities, but requires better unit AI or the ability to target enemies Tags: Tower Defense
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library
Note: Early Access - Might be worth another look when it release

TLDR: Eternal Early Access. Wants to act like a freeform tower defense with relocatable towers. But comes across as a stif poorly designed and half broken RTS instead.

Outstanding Issues:
-Game does not obey conventional control schemes (e.g. no mousewheel for camera zoom, boxed selection not working) 
-Artificial Intelligence is poor. Only foes within a very specific radius will engage
-Game quickly becomes micromanagement hell as each unit has individual health and ammo bars that need to be catered to, along with unit repositioning and compensating for lack of AI
-Not a lot of strategy to adopt. Hard to use terrain and buildings as cover since they are mostly just boxed squares of unwalkable terrain with art placed on them, all thats left is bunching up dudes together near a bottleneck. Units dont really have experience, special abilities, dont radio or work as groups or adopt stances. Sigh.
-Incompetent/Revisionist historical slants

Pros:
+Good audio direction with the ambiant music
+The engine itself looks somewhat tablety, but half decent for what it is, offering some real resolution support
+The UI is not too overloaded and I feel like I could have experimented and learnt everything about it if the game was fun Pros -
- Great soundtracks.
- Easy controls.
- Great visuals.
- Replayability.
- Fun strategic challenges.
- Hard levels which make you have to get to know how the game works in order to win (even know the game is fairly straight forward)
- Very small learning curve, you can pretty much jump straight in and have a lot of fun.
- Oh and the most important thing of all... CHEAP.

My cons lean mostly towards configuration and development issues, l'm sure once the game has had some more patches these can be easily fixed.

Cons -
- Sometimes certain abilities wont work, eg replinishing your soliders ammo, half the time you will need to send him away from his squad/outside a bunker to heal or replenish ammo as the game has a hard time knowing what solider your're selecting when in close quaters with other units and either will use the ability on the wrong soldier or just wont do anything at all until you select the solider you want to use and send him away from other units so you can properly select him to use a ability etc.
- Sometimes enemys will shoot your soliders through walls/rocks and your troops cant fire back.
- General diffuculty/lack of consistency when controling large squads/individal units to move long distances across the map. (Will sometimes just unselect the units so you have to go back and move them small spaces at a time.)
- In it's current form the game only has 3 levels as far as l know which will take you a maximum of 30 minutes to 2hrs to complete.

I could go on about very minor fixable problems but l dont see the point, this game is SO much fun and 100% worth the money. Even if you can only get 1-2 hrs out of it in its current stage, (l hope developers will be adding more levels soon! :) ) it's totally worth buying to support the developers and the general replayabilty of the game.

The game is cheap cheap cheap and is one of those games you can play for an hour or two then go play your primary game like CSGO or pubg. Just one of those cheap mini games that is a tun of fun. l have a feeling a LOT more people will start hearing about this game as it gets developed because even in it's early stages l can see it has a lot of potensial.

name: Caliber: Palm Road Coin Pack
genres: Action, Massively Multiplayer, Free To Play
short_description: A kit containing 5000 Coins, the Palm Road Emblem and 3 days of Premium.
reviews: Good

name: Neurotypical
short_description: You Wake up as A teenager Named neo in a strange place,apparently in someones mind and they want your help?! Collect items,fight enemies and try not to get yourself anhillated! But always remember,nothing in this game is as "typical" as it seems
reviews: holy shit man, give up and try again please

name: Monsters!
short_description: Monsters! is a dual stick shooter with a retro feel complete with pixel art and leaderboards to achieve that good ol‚Äô arcade feel.
reviews:
YES - enjoyable for some runs , easy 100% achievements , super cheap price and controller support
NO - art is mediocre but you can play it on your electric toothbrush
NEUTRAL - not that deep but for a budget game from 2016 I would say this is ok Monsters is a wonderfully addictive twin stick shooter. While my hours may seem low, it was a good time sink for when I had no internet (yay outages). Highly recommend this game, please play it when you get a chance. It's deceptively simple, with a tight difficulty curve. MONSTERS is fun. What you see in the trailer is what you get. If you enjoy a true 80's arcade feel in a pick-up and play arena shooter wrapping, then stop reading this review and spend ONE DOLLAR for this very fun score-chaser/twin-stick hidden gem. Look at it like this; if you play four times, that's one quarter per game of Monsters. Everything after that is PURE DIGITAL GRAVY. Very much worth playing. Enjoy! Monsters! is a bullet-hell game where you play as a wizard and shoot magical orbs at aliens. 

Pros:
-Pixel Art is decent
-Gameplay is fun
-Beating Highscores is addictive

Cons:
-No original game soundtrack, or soundtrack at all
-The game feels empty because it has no music
-No level selection
-Keybinding for keyboard had no effect
-Difficulty is too hard(I can't seem to get past level 1-5)
-Small community

As the game currently is, I can't recommend picking it up. It desperately needs a music soundtrack of some kind, and the game feels empty because of it. I want to like this game, I really do. But with only one level, Monsters! quickly becomes repetitive, and the game isn't engaging or varied enough to satisfy my hunger for bullet hell mania. yo man this game is mad tight dawg. at first i was like, this game cant be that cool, but then i was like damn this game is cool. if you got a spare 2.49 laying around, pop that in your disc drive and buy this game. 2 thumbs up and wet kiss from this guy.

name: Dux Solaris
genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Early Access
short_description: Help Dux save our solar system and learn more about the STELLAE in this adventure with elements of "BULLET HELL" laden with eroticism nd learn more about the STELLAE, discover why planets are not just rocks, and why their beauty is legendary!
reviews: A bit janky especially in the ui, menu and dialogue but overall solid gameplay, artstyle and a banger of a soundtrack make this definitely worth the 5 bucks

name: Movavi Video Editor 2023
genres: Animation & Modeling, Audio Production, Design & Illustration, Education, Software Training, Video Production, Web Publishing

Create top-notch gameplay videos automatically or tweak the settings to perfection by hand ‚Äì you‚Äôll get the best result in a breeze. Make your Let's Plays, walkthroughs, and gaming reviews go viral.

Overall, it's a good program for video editing. Perfect for gamers wanting to make gaming videos with facecam or voice over etc. However, the program does NOT handle clips well, once the background has been removed from them. The software "thinks" for a while, and if you're lucky, it won't crash, and you can keep on working on your video project. I recommend that you save often. name: Fantasy Soul Revenge
short_description: Fantasy Soul Revenge is an exhilarating action RPG game that thrusts players into a vibrant, mythical world where dark forces threaten the realm. Players assume the role of a vengeful hero, harnessing the power of ancient souls to vanquish enemies and uncover hidden truths.
reviews: The game contains 5 levels (although the last one is bugged out); typical Unreal Engine copy and paste Beat em up game; nothing new, exciting or interesting. The only + would be customization but the move-set is limited and repetitive with no combo potential

name: Cosmic Arcade Tycoon
short_description: A cozy sci-fi arcade sim where you build, customize, unlock, expand and welcome cute alien visitors!
reviews:
Cosmic Arcade Tycoon lets you live out your dream of running a space-age arcade, but be prepared to spend an absurd amount of cash on new machines that are so overpriced, you'd think you were buying them from a black-market alien dealer. 

You'll wander around collecting coins while chatting with aliens who, for some reason, love your arcade even though your machines are more expensive than a spaceship. 

The goal? To fill your arcade with ridiculous, flashy machines and weird decorations that somehow make you more money‚Äîif you can afford them. It's a grind, but hey, at least you‚Äôll be the richest arcade owner in the galaxy... if you don't go bankrupt first! Really fun and cute game. Nice feature of changing the camera perspective, helps a lot. Enjoyed it. Enjoyable experience, please add more objects Good game Pretty good Man WOW!! I just started building and its great. Looking forward to spending many hours building my arcades. I just spent 4 hours and all worked great. Will be good for all to join in on the fun. My rating is a 10 out of 10. Keep it up please. Nice small game with plenty of possibilities for future updates.

name: Arizona Rose and the Pharaohs' Riddles
short_description: Arizona Rose is the world's foremost treasure-hunter, and her latest adventure takes her to Egypt, where an ancient temple has been unearthed. Inscribed on its walls are mysterious glyphs - a code, of the sort only Arizona can solve!
reviews:
its as good as the other one
 Good picross with hidden object scenes and geometrical Tetris type puzzles.  The cursor should change between functions though (select/deselect tile) and the select/deselect buttons should be much larger to prevent redoing picross puzzles over. Combo of many different puzzle games. Interesting plot. Recommend. Same as the other Arizona Rose game...you like these types of puzzles, you'll like these. If not, you won't. Not much else to say about it.

The game-killer for me came when a pop-up ad interrupted my game, which leads to an automatic deletion when that happens, so be warned of that as well. This is the reason for the low play time, if anybody cares. Pretty Nice Puzzle Game. Without any discount a little bit expensieve but the developer made a good job to create an addiction puzzle fun factor. 
With achievements and trading cards to collect the prize is okay (Summer Sale Action)

Bei Puzzlespielen bin ich immer skeptisch. Meistens langweilt es mich nach 1 Stunde wenn sich kein guter Suchtfaktor einstellt (z.B. leicht erreichbare Errungenschaften oder leicht durchzuspielene Levels)
Bei dem Spiel ist es nicht so. Gute Sounduntermalung und schlampigkeitsfehler werden mit dem Nichterreichen der Errungenschaften (Fehlerfrei 0-1) bestraft.
Der Vollpreis ist etwas zu teuer angesetzt aber dennoch zahlt es sich aus. Die Entwickler haben keine M√ºhen gescheut das Spiel gut umzusetzten. :-) Pretty decent Picross clone, though the "story" is as bonkers as any old Hidden Object game.
Speaking of, there are a few HO scenes included here and there. Excellent picross with occasional minipuzzles of various types. Helpful touches like highlighting of the cursor's row and column, faded clue numbers for solved groups, disappearing clue numbers for solved rows and columns, and powerups. A bit more difficult than the previous Arizona Rose game; some puzzles are impossible to begin without guessing and risking a mistake, unless one uses a powerup. And if I recall correctly, it advances more quickly to the 20 by 20 board than the previous game does. Hint: Move the cursor while holding a mouse button to select multiple cells (shows selection count too!). While doing so you may click the other button to cancel the selection, so it's handy for counting cells. But be careful, a misclick can rapidly generate many mistakes!

name: Topang
short_description: An adventure platforming game that spans 3 separate main characters' introduction stories. A 2-Player combat versus mode is featured containing 15 playable fighters.
reviews: thought this would be fun to kill 20 minutes with a friend for a dollar, but the two player mode doesn't even work. My wife divorced me and took the foockin kids, because of this game. This game does not have Mtn. Dew Baja Blast

name: Wyrmsun: Frankish Faction Flair Pack
short_description: This faction flair pack adds new flavor to the hardy Frankish factions.
reviews:
bought in order to support this awesome game and the awesome devs behind it.

As far as the content goes,  i think the new graphics are pretty cool and they look nice. They definatley help add a little more flavor to the faction. Support the Stratagus devs and the game development. (y) The only way to support developers <3

name: Bear With Me - Episode Two
short_description: This content requires the base game Buy Bear With Me - Episode One on Steam in order to play.
reviews:
Like in the first episode, the art and overall visual presentation is excellent. The puzzles are pretty well designed, easy but not stupidly so. Most importantly, the story is well composed, well presented, and generally well written. The constant fourth wall jokes are cringy and cheapen the otherwise good story, so that's really annoying. But otherwise, it's a good game with a good story, good storytelling, good art, and good voice acting. Intrigued for Episode Three. Honestly one of the best games and stories I've played in a while. It has everything I enjoy! good game 1 11/2 to 2 hours of gameplay, pretty solid gameplay with the occasional nonsensical puzzle being the only downside. All the good stuff from the first episode but now in a bigger stage. The voice acting is quite good and the pop culture references are very well done. On to chapter three! great game with intriguing story Bear with me is a story about a girl named Amber and her partner Teddy E Bear in the search for her missing brother, and the mystery behind the "red" man who has an interest in amber.

Art 10/10 - The art i found was very Beautiful. The Black and white design added towards the old detective theme that the gameplay was going for.

Gameplay 8/10 - The gameplay was a point and click puzzle game. While fun, it was still simple. The game also offered various options when proceedng through the game.

Story 10/10 - The stroy was very interesting. The whole game seems to revolve around amber acting out fantasies that a young child like her would. For the second episode, the game focuses more on Paper city itself Along with a a fresh batch of new characters and interactions.

Music/Sound 8/10 - The music and sound were very good. The voices of the characters were clear and and easily understood.

Overall - Overall i really enjoyed the Second episode. Finally venturing out into Paper city gave a great deal of depth to the story than the previous episode. The main characters Amber and ted share a weird kind of humor which i found refreshing. Much longer episode with even better jokes. What more we can want? Bigger, interesting city? More relations? New clues and threads? Hard choices? Everything included.

Ted? Come back... please. What a fun second chapter!  The ideas are just so well delivered, the jokes are on point, and this voice acting is 5 Stars good!   I just read about Chapter 3 coming, and I am excited to hear about it!  This is a game, and I look forward to more! Keeping it awesome and interesting :)

name: Korpus: Buried over the Black Soil
short_description: Korpus: Buried over the Black Soil is a first-person horror game in which you have been sent to evaluate an abandoned house, set somewhere in Eastern Europe. Uncover the houses past and the secrets buried within.
reviews:
[h1]I know you are in my house.[/h1]
[i]Korpus: Buried over the Black Soil[/i] is a short but clever game, with a pertinent reminder about an event that has been neglected in western history. The game's main pull - that the house reshapes itself depending on the notes you've read - is sadly a little underexplored, given that notes are seen only in a linear fashion, so the game has zero replay value. The game also falls prey to that all-too-common horror game trope wherein the main protagonist can only run for five seconds before wheezing and slowing to a crawl. 

However, the way the house does reshape is very clever, the graphics and atmosphere are impeccable, there are some very, [i]very[/i] good spatial puzzles, the story is neat, and the game is a decent length for the price, provided you got it on sale. I think this game has been unfairly overlooked (probably due to the price), but it is worth a look. It is well made, even if some of the chase scenes are a bit lackluster (especially the last one, with an enemy who looks a combination of spooky and absolutely ridiculous). Very much worth it on sale, hopefully the developers (who seem to be from Ukraine) have another go at horror.

[b]Backlog Clear: #2[/b] It's decent, worthwhile on sale as it is quite short and full price is a bit much for what you get.  I like the art style, and the levels are well designed.  It's not terrifying, but it is unsettling, and draws attention to an atrocity that is little known in the west.  Although with that said, it's almost like two separate stories - the transition between those two stories was quite jarring.  But overall it's fine, and worth a look if it's on sale and you need a decent horror experience for an hour or two. A genuinely scary, and thought-provoking title. I was pleasantly surprised by this game and would definitely recommend it. During the first section I thought it would just be a horror game where you have to constantly run from the enemy, and not much past that. But I really enjoyed the story, I usually don't care about story when its presented in this way but this was actually cool. And the art direction/aesthetic was super cool too! An atmospheric setting and an rollercoaster story make for a fantastic short story with a few stumbles along the way.

Pros:

Story is great
Notes changing the layout is very cool
Music and sound is top notch
Lots of great visual spooks, think "Layers of Fear" without the questionable narm

Cons:

Iffy door physics can rip you out of the horror vibes, especially during tense moments
The "Estate Agent" set up doesn't really matter in the long run and the supernatural aspects are never really justified
The "Threat Encounters" vary from "Fine, but rely too much on the wonk doors" to "Insufferable mazes with goofy gunman enemy" 


Overall:

I usually don't score games, but If I had to I'd say 8/10. Great Story that gets hamstringed in the end by an awful final enemy section.

EDIT: I forgot to mention the main reason the "Threat Encounters" are a real pain in the arse, and that's because the player character has the stamina of a 75 year old smoker with severe COPD. look I actually like the story and don't mind the 1990s graphics but if you are going to make this a chasing game in some parts...make it easier to open doors and the shift button to run which hardly works....the guy can only run 2 inches from the last spot??? I finally gave up in the cellar after running for the second chase and only not making it because I couldn't get the door opened before he shot me...either make it easier to run or people will detest your game and never buy from you again....I would have recommended this if you change that. There were some moments where I felt like I didn't know where to go. But overall pretty good. There are some chase scenes but they weren't to difficult. is good suck cock Korpus: Over the Black Soil is a solid horror game, not relying on constant cheap jumpscares and going for a more athmospheric approach. The Ps1 era graphics are candy for the eyes. Piecing the story together around the house is a good way to make the environment change. However the gimmick of "changing the environment around you" by reading or looking at pictures is not so well implemented. When it's done with photos it's well done because you have to recognize the place represented. With text it's maube too direct. The mazes are short and not that difficult to manage and still keep a tense athmosphere.
I had a good time with the game for the hour and a half it lasted.

name: Downward: Enhanced Edition
short_description: Downward is a first-person open-world parkour based platform adventure set in the medieval ruins of a post-apocalyptic planet Earth. Make your way through breath-taking landscapes, face ancient guardians and unravel the deep mystery that lies behind the disappearance of humanity.
reviews:
Its not a very good parkour game. Movement never gets to be consistent enough to fun. You will be constantly tripping over small rocks and ledges. As the game gets harder it becomes more apparent that the movement just isn't up to the task with it never quite feeling right. Fun little fantasy parkour game. Bought it a while back, came back recently for the Enhanced 2.0 update of the game, and it's been pretty nice. Easy to learn and difficult to master, straight-forward to beat the story but a lot of challenges outside of that. 

The story tries to be deep and dramatic, but it lacks a bit of punch. You can tell where things are going long before they actually get there, so it probably would've been more effective storytelling with either a different structure or with the presented structure tidied up a lot.

Combat could've had more variation and required required more timing, rather than the same handful of "keep away from the attacks until the weak spot becomes clickable" golems. But still okay outside of the drones that blow up in your face until you learn to backward-dodge away. Pretty fun for the 10 hours or so that it took me to beat it. Pretty cool game made for collecathon players. 
Some of movement kinda janky and need some getting used to This was the first game I decided to play after my father passed away. Honestly, I don't know what I was looking for... a distraction for my pain, maybe... leisure, perhaps?... or a sheer attempt to carry on with my regular life, and that includes keeping my gaming habit to bring me a smile or two. 
When I saw Downward in my Steam Library, I knew I had it for quite some time, among many others I couldn't find the right timing to sit down and play. 
Again, I don't know what I was looking for. I needed to have the sensation of flying, jumping, as if was trying to reach the sky or something. I needed to have a sample of what heaven was like, unlike the types of games I usually play. 
Well, getting down to business, Downward is a short entertaining game with fantasy and exploration aspects, but the main feature is the parkour. You boost for high jumps, touch the sky, fall, rebound, hook up, and all the rest. I mean, if you played and liked "A Story About My Uncle" this would be another nice option for you. I recommend this game, all in a nutshell. It brought me a bit of peace at least. 
 Good game, especially if you play it with UEVR. Played just a little so far and here are my observations.
- The Mark mechanic says you can use it as many times as you like, until after the first 'boss' then you only get 2 charges.. so that's a lie.
- I used the Mark to get behind the first boss but it instant turns 180 degrees making the mechanic completely useless with anything that can turn to face you.
- The upgrades screen doesn't explain what anything is except health, so you're upgrading whatever?
- Much of the items in the upgrade menu are in Spanish.
- The wall mechanic says how to wall-run and jump off, but then the next 2 wall sections have a bouncing auto-jump added to them.
- Much of the items in the upgrade menu are in Spanish.
- There's a climb animation but no animation for picking up, using a lever or drinking.
- Falling (dying) doesn't cost anything, until it suddenly does.
- There's an invisible 'killbox' when you fall too far, except in areas where there isn't.

With all things considered within the first few minutes of gameplay, I still recommend it for the platforming and world detail. It's an ok game. Climbing mechanics are heavily scripted, and sometimes the same jump cannot be done with the same height at a differenet place. The fighting is totally pointless, just as the upgrade system. The gathering is suppose to encourage running around looking at alternative routes and secrets, but the game is so boring, it just kills the vibe. The only real fun part is the ending after the cast. The story is also insanely dumb.

At least it has tits...but that's pretty much it. There are many other much better fps platformer games out there. Downward: Enhanced Edition has beautiful graphics of a post-apocalyptic Earth. That's the only real positive. The gameplay is just boring. The graphics almost make up for the lackluster rest of the game. It's a parkour walking sim, with little else to do since there is little to no story. 5/10 MEH 12 hours across two playthroughs, deserves an expansive sequel This game is junk.  

There is no ability to rebind any of your controls.

Not joking.

Tough luck if you have any mobility related disability.

If you want to buy console trash for your PC then maybe you will love it?

EDIT: the keybind thing is fixed now if you want to play this game.  

I personally don't think you should support PC games that remove PC controls, even temporarily.

Steam and the Steam logo are trademarks and/or registered trademarks of Valve Corporation in the U.S. and/or other countries.
reviews:
Momiji I have to say, I am all for costume sets that include the dudes since they do not usually get many costumes thoughout all DOAs. I really like how they played with a few costumes to make them fresh except Jann Lee's costume. It is just the Yellow jusmpsuit with slight wear and werewolf costume parts? So strange. But, I love them except Jann Lee and Tina's. I hope they add more street clothes to the game. Like a male fashion pack or something to match the abundance of costumes for the women. After all this time, no real male swimsuits for the beach. This is probably the best costume DLC they have released so far.  The fan submissions were pretty good and they did a good job re-creating them in-game!  

Made a video so you can see what they look like in the game: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KFXGxS7Upow This has to be my favourite DLC costume bundle I ever bought for DOA5LR. Of course, my fav Eliot now shows more skin in his PJ!

name: DOA6 Seaside Eden Costume - Marie Rose
short_description: A Seaside Eden costume for Marie Rose.
reviews: MAAAARRRIIIIIIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

name: Shmups Skill Test
short_description: Some say you‚Äôre only as old as you feel. Shmups Skill Test says you‚Äôre only as old as you shoot! Shmups Skill Test is a clever way to evaluate your shmup skills in the form of a "gamer age". Challenge and unlock shoot-‚Äôem-up-based minigames in a gauntlet of shmup nostalgia goodness.
reviews:
It is full of cheaters except for the can game This is a surprisingly addictive shmup that will more than likely hold your attention for a few nights if you're interested in the "Brain Age" angle. 

My first major complaint is no actual tate/portrait mode support. You CAN rotate the display, but it has no actual vertical monitor support, so people with a secondary monitor for tate gaming are out of luck. Who rotates their main monitor without changing from landscape to portrait just to play a game in that awkward way anymore? Really wish there were portrait mode resolutions supported.

There were 2 minigames I didn't like that I wanted to bring attention to (I don't know the names so bear with my descriptions while I wing it):
-Dodge Everything! This one shoots out a very predictable checkerboard pattern shot, vertical then horizontal. This one will either be a very easy one that you get without trying 19 times out of 20 for an easy 10,000pts, or a frustrating miss where you can't predict the horizontal shot depending on your skill level. As someone who falls in the former category, I say this minigame is a total detriment and it's removal would only make Shmups Skill Test slightly better.
-Grab the scores! This one consists of trying to grab 10,000pts worth of 100/1,000 skill bars flying off the screen within 10 seconds. This one will be frustrating until you realize the top of the screen is much easier to grab the points... then after you find that out, it still feels a bit too random when it pops up as far as being an indicator of your "game age".

Both of these minigames are a bit annoying if you think they're being considered hard into the ranking. That said, when trying to figure out the names of these minigames for the review, I looked in the practice section to see what they were called and couldn't find them. I took that as an indicator of these games having less of an impact on your actual ranking and more as just a "street fighter smash the car" bonus stage. Wish there was more of an indication to show this, as these are the main games that really take you out of the whole "game age" ranking system.

All that said, I enjoy the brain age gimmick and thought it was done pretty well. I can absolutely recommend this game for a few nights of fun shmup fun when you just want to jump into some shmup minigames, or if you want a nice warmup before diving into your next 1cc attempt at your shmup of choice.

P.S. In response to top negative review: this isn't a bait title. It's Shmup SKILL TEST, not Shmup TRAINER. That's like being mad at the SAT's for not helping you git gud at math :p kino I kind of feel like I was tricked in getting this.  Shmups Skill Test is definitely a bait title for a game.  

Shmups Skill Test consists of a number of mini games all involving shoot 'em up game play.  You play these mini games, get graded on your performance, and at the end, are given your 'shmup age'.  With younger meaning you're a better shmup player.  Though, I don't know if this is a simple ranking system or does something interesting when you start to get to children ages.  I couldn't get below 40 years.

Additionally, it also offers a breakdown of how well you did the mini games compared to other players.  Which I found a little more interesting, but I also don't know what sort of pool of players I'm being compared to, either.  I mean, I know I'm not very good a shmups... I've played them and my progress, or lack there of let's me know all too well.

Where I think this game could have been good, is if it aided in developing a player's shmup skills.  Something like Gunvein's tutorial.  But without something like that, Radiant Silversword's Cardinal Sins game mode does a much better job of testing a player's shmup skills with a better presentation.  And Radiant Silversword comes with an actual game (Radiant Silversword).  Even SophStar has cadet training section that offers a better set of mini game challenges than the entirety of this game., and it also comes with a really good game.

Ultimately, Shmups Skill Test had a chance of being an interesting name.  But not nearly enough content nor anything to help a player get better at shmups over just playing actual shmups.  And there's a number of them here on Steam for the same or less money that are better than this. It's time to level up! I don't expect it like warioware hahaha.It's so fun, i really enjoy it. Worth to buy if you like shmups game

________$$$$$$$$$$ Decent tool for testing your Shmupping skills. I get to truly see just how good I could be at shmups with some simple exercies, fun challenges and a daunting soundtrack. Give it a go, see how good you truly are at shoot-em-ups. Estoy viejo I'm no stranger to shmups, having clocked in lots of game time in DariusBurst Chronicle Saviours alone. From long running franchises to smaller titles in the genre, there isn't a shmup title I haven't played on Steam. After discovering Triangle Service's shmups, I decided to give one of them a whirl. And what better way to start with their legacy than Shmups Skill Test. Having clocked in at least seven hours of play, how well does it fare compared to the rest of Steam's shmups?

[h1] The Good: [/h1]

+ The replay value of this game is practically bottomless. No two runs are ever alike, as the minigames in a main run change. One minute you're blasting tanks, the next you're collecting medals. If you're lucky, you might have a 'classic' shmup homage level. And on top of that, the minigames you accomplish can be played individually. There's also leaderboards and a replay function, to archive your efforts and compare yourself to other players.

+ Shmups Skill Test is newbie friendly. No nightmarishly hard difficulty to be had here, as the only minimum challenge is memorizing the minigames and trying to get through the game with a good rating and score.

+ Shmups Skill Test also has multiplayer. Four player multiplayer, no less, like on DariusBurst Chronicle Saviors.

+ The music is good, too. It fits the many minigames present, given how some of them are frantic and borderline non-stop.

[h1] The Bad: [/h1]

- I'm getting this out of the way: Shmups Skill Test only has built-in autofire for limited minigames. Everything else is classic button mashing. This is problematic because some of the top scorers and players have controllers with autofire. Hope you have a controller with turbo, or an external program with turbo function.

- Some of the achievements are easy to understand, while others are archaic and complex. For one thing, there's an achievement where you leave the game, wait a week or so, then come back to the game. Another one has a rare 'quiz' minigame that has to pop up; I haven't gotten that in the many playthroughs of Shmups Skill Test.

- The game doesn't record your age result at the end of a replay. A minor gripe, but still.

Overall, do I recommend this game? Yes. Shmups Skill Test will provide a lot of playtime and longevity, and it doesn't require anyone to be extremely skilled at it to play. And if you have friends, you can play this with them, too. A good, solid purchase for anyone that plays games on Steam. Very cool. Fun to "refine your chops" in shooters.

Its a port of the XB360 version which itself is a port of an older title, so it looks like garbage in 1080p.

name: HOT WHEELS‚Ñ¢ - Pass Vol. 1
short_description: Buy HOT WHEELS‚Ñ¢ Pass Vol. 1 and boost your gaming experience!
reviews:
üíã The Grandpa of Car Pack! Milestone you money grabbing POS Some really cool cars in this DLC pack, the Track add on's are great too. 

I especially love the new Batman ones. Not sure about stats (TBH the Superman car is my favourite for racing anyway) but they look awesome. I think the Robin car is my favourite aesthetically. 

All in all I think you get some great bits and pieces from this DLC pack, and if you don't want everything from it, you can simply buy the pieces you do want separately. 

The fact they gave us the option to either buy as a pack or just buy the bits we want is great. I personally bought the paqck up front to support the game, and also so I didn't have to worry about remembering to buy stuff as it came out. 

This way I already have everything when it drops. This is a game I bought, knowing I wasn't going to be playing it much until 2022, when I have people over. By being able to buy the all the DLC ahead of time, it was one less thing to worry about. 

If you want a care free way to acquire all the DLC from 2021 ahead of time, you have the option.

If they do a pack that has all of 2022's DLC as well, I'll buy that as well. 

I only wish I knew about the racing season earlier, as I fear it's too late to unlock everything now. If they had an option t just buy the season cars for a higher price, I'd do that. I don't really have the time currently to invest into a racing season, and as I missed the start of it it's likely I'd never be able to unlock everything. 

I think maybe if they has seasons on rotation, so you can have another go at unlocking everything at a later date, this would be nice. 

Or maybe even have seasons ongoing and overlapping. So once you pay for it, you do not have a time limit to unlock everything. I know timed seasons are an "in" thing with the kids today, but I really would have liked the ability to unlock things from pass at my own pace. The main reason I didn't buy the pass (despite being very cheap) was because I don't like feeling rushed. 

It's a shame I'm going to miss out on those DC villain cars, but like I say I hope they actually give us another shot at them next year. 

 Everything in the pass is out now, so my final opinion is its pretty good! Probably not worth the price but if it goes on sale and you're interested in everything I would say go for it, its a big bundle with pretty much every DLC released as of now (aside from like, the preorder stuff that became DLCs).
The Batman expansion even comes with extra City Rumble levels which is quite nice! Surprising it's not really advertised. Because I purchased this pass earlier I got the Batman Expansion today in addition to lots of other cool stuff along the way; awesome! I love this game  Hot Wheels Unleashed it's one of the funnest games I have played i years! So many different cars to collect and things to create and customise too : D Not worth the price. One of many cash grabs by Milestone. Can somebody explain the point of this pass? I bought 2 season passes for this game but the devs keep putting out DLC that is not included in either of them????? YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

name: Flinthook
short_description: Live the life of space captain Flinthook! Armed with your mighty hookshot, your uncanny slow-motion powers and your trusty blasma pistol, plunder and fight your way through an infinite variety of randomly-assembled spaceships for treasure, loot and fame!
reviews:
Game looks fun, right ?!
But the controls are HORRIBLE !! and not rebindable.
I want to love this game, but I hate it. Controller or mouse and keyboard, it is a pain in the bum. I hope they make a sequel someday... the pixel art is soo good also music is awesome.. Spiderman roguelike, just need to get use to it. Very solid fun and challenging game with great music and art! cool I tried for 10 mins trying to get use to the controls but I could not..... 
The mouse movement being tied to player just throws me from any rapid form of precise movement I want, I looked for options because nothing in control scheme.

and found a post from developer.

"Hi all! We've tried all different ways to do this, and locking the cursor around the hero was the only good way to do this with our mechanics.
Unlocking the mouse made it impossible to zip around a level quickly, as you would need to do large, uncomfortable movements to follow the hero on the screen - I know it sounds a bit weird as it is unconventional, but trust us, it wasn't feeling good at all! The way we did it takes just a little bit to get used to, I hope you will enjoy it :)

Thanks for your comments! <3"

SO I can't play the game.

Update, Found old launch with option that gave more mouse controls made me sad they didn't work. Not enough variety. 
Dull.
 Wait for it to go on sale, and you won't regret picking it up. hook hook, blam blam, awesome game! FLINTHOOK is a rock-solid, 2d rogue-like grapple-shooter ... thing. 
It has very clever game design, art direction-- practically the whole nine yards. 
Fun to hop in for 30 min to an hour and blast away. 

*controversial point* - some people probably think that because the enemies have 
very distinct patterns, they're pushovers. Others will call out the presence of 'too many
gimmicks' among enemies and obstacles. I land somewhere in the middle. There are going 
to be some cheap deaths, and pushover moments - that 's the nature of the randomized
beast. These points don't cause me to dislike the game. 

THIS IS WHAT RAISES MY IRE:
It takes often an entire half hour JUST TO GET TO A BOSS. They're the typical, room-sized variety,
And there's no way to grind for strategies. You just have to get good and watch vids if 
you're struggling. That doesn't have to be! 

I would suggest implementing a wager mode for boss encounters. Say you knock out a weekly challenge. 
GREAT. you've got 500 coin. Head on over to Boss challenge section, and challenge a boss you've already encountered, for more cash, or to grind for strats. That way, you have a better shot of making the gauntlet and beating the boss for real. Everything else about the game can be reasoned away. It just needs a boss mode. 

8. 4  out of  1O stars Definitely play Rogue Legacy 2 instead.  That game is harder to beat, but it's so easy to "read the room" in that game whenever you enter a room that you can race forward without ever stopping.  Dead Cells is the same way.  Meanwhile with Flinthook, the traps REALLY blend into the environment, so you're going to be punished if you don't stop for a few seconds and locate all the hazards everytime you enter a new room, which really ruins your momentum.  It's still beatable, and there's guaranteed healing items in every run, but it's not as fun as it could be.

In this game, we will follow the life of an engineering student who must pass his English exam in order to be allowed to participate in the next tournament. In order to improve his skills, he decides to take lessons and meets a girl who will help him...

At the beginning, I didn't read the summary of the game so I didn't understand anything, I didn't understand where the developer was coming from but in fact, it's just the daily life of a student who tries to improve his skills. The story is a bit dramatic through the 2 bad/good endings but in the end they still say something similar.

In the overall criteria, the game is okay but it deals with the fact that those who have difficulties but still try to develop will be the ones who will have a better chance to improve if a failure follows and that's why they will say : [i]"those who work hard and fail, should have more courage to face failure"[/i].

I didn't really enjoy this game because it was a bit boring, so even though the game is practically free, I don't think I can recommend it.

[i]In each game, the developer tries to deal with an aspect of life, so you should try them.[/i]
[code]Please follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41853285/]curator[/url] page if you want more reviews.[/code] It's a School Chat Simulator Story! I did not expect this! [h1][u]Introduction about Leaflet Love Story[/u][/h1]

Leaflet Love Story is a Visual Novel developed by G+ Gongcheng Tuan company, released in 2019 on Steam, recently they released the English translation for all people to enjoy. This game attracted my curiosity by its price but also by the image of the game. If you like romantic stories with a dramatic twist and set in college, this game might appeal to you.

[h1][u]Criteria[/u][/h1]

[b][u]Graphics/Design[/u][/b]

‚òê Photorealism
‚òê Beautiful
‚òê Good
‚òë Decent
‚òê Bad
‚òê Don't look too closely
‚òê Paint.exe

I have played very few Chinese VN, we feel that there is something different in what it produces compared to Japanese VN, for my taste, the background and the chara-design of the characters are well drawn, it is not incredible but we manage to enjoy the game and follow the story without being bothered by the quality of the drawings.


[b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b]

‚òê Very good
‚òê Good
‚òê Correct
‚òê Looking at the walls is more interesting
‚òë None

In a VN, there is no gameplay to speak of other than clicking. We can still talk about the navigation in the menus, the options offered during the course of the story that are perfectly suited.


[b][u]Audio[/u][/b]

‚òê Maestro
‚òê Very good
‚òë Good
‚òê Not so bad
‚òê Bad
‚òê RIP my ears

I am a little disappointed that there is no opening in the game, the OST are correct, when we get to sad moments, the music played its role well. You can feel the emotion through the sound.

[b][u]Audience[/u][/b]

‚òë Children
‚òë Teenagers
‚òê Adults

The game contains a romantic story, which can be suitable for children and also for teenagers who want to discover what a feeling of love can be.


[b][u]PC configuration[/u][/b]

‚òê Very low config
‚òë Low-end PC / entry-level mid-range
‚òê Mid-range PC / entry-level high-end
‚òê High end PC
‚òê NASA PC

The game is not greedy at all, an entry-level PC will do very well, you can enjoy this game on your grandmother's PC! :)


[b][u]Story[/u][/b]

‚òê Story?
‚òê Text and audio floating in space...
‚òê Moderately interesting
‚òë Good
‚òê Captivating
‚òê Will replace your life

Leaflet Love Story tells the story of an engineering student who is gifted in robotics, but unfortunately he is bad in English, which prevents him from studying abroad. So he decides to enroll in English classes and meets a pretty girl with whom he gets along well. From this moment on, we will be interested in the daily life of these two young students.

What I liked a lot in this story is the dramatic side, a love relationship does not always end as we want. Fate can take over. The game offers road choices that will determine whether the story will be a happy ending or an unhappy one. After finishing the game, I can tell you that you will have 2 happy endings and 2 bad endings. It is interesting to do them all to see how the story will play out. 


[b][u]Duration[/u][/b]

‚òê One cup of coffee (<5h)
‚òë Short (5-10h)
‚òê Medium (10h-50h)
‚òê Long (50h-150h)
‚òê To infinity and beyond!

This will depend on the player's investment and reading speed, in my case I spent quite a bit of time trying to understand every element of the story in detail, plus I don't read fast so it took me about 5 hours to finish the game. Looking at the other reviews, most people finished it in around 4 hours.


[b][u]Price[/u][/b]

‚òë Free!
‚òë Good value for money
‚òë Wait for a discount
‚òê Not recommended

The price is really affordable for the duration of the game, I still advise you to wait for a promo, for less than a euro, it's really a very good deal! 


[b][u]Translation[/u][/b]

‚òê Not translated *not yet*
‚òê Disappointing
‚òê Quite a few mistakes
‚òë Nickel
‚òê Translated into all languages

The game offers translation in Chinese and in English, if you are proficient in any of these languages, it's perfect.


[b][u]Bugs[/u][/b]

‚òë Never heard of it
‚òê Minor
‚òê Frustrating
‚òê So many bugs, impossible to play

No bugs at all, runs great!!!


[h1][u]Conclusion[/u][/h1]

What I really liked about this game is the choice of routes that can vary the storyline. The story is good and can suit everyone if you are not demanding, but that's all. I still recommend it because of the price of the game, you don't risk anything with the amount you will pay. Add it to your game catalog or wishlist for promo! :) Average story with some weird ass endings and terrible translation. The art is really cute tho. bad translate 5/10 [h1]Qin Jingxue is an angel![/h1]
You [b]CAN NOT[/b] change my mind

name: Slime 3K: Rise Against Despot
short_description: Welcome to Slime 3K, an unhinged roguelite bullet-heaven set in the Despot‚Äôs Game universe! Build a deck of crazy weapons, grow stronger and devour hordes of pink puny humans as a murderous jelly blob on a warpath of death, violence and pretzels.
reviews:
Fun, beautiful Survivors-like game with great music and minor grind I've been having fun with this game. The art & animation are absolutely beautiful. The game itself is also plenty varied and engaging. Just a bit grindy with the unlocks. It doesn't provide enough challenge to keep playing. not a lot of strategy involved arbitrary difficulty spikes MASSIVE issue.

I can't find BxCx's OST for this, anywhere. I am literally playing the game, solely to hear the amazing soundtrack.

This one has been perfect on the Deck for me, for when I wan't something fun to pass the time with. I'm always a fan of Konfa Games stuff, and absolutely love the sprite work. It's a great game to look at and listen to. Fine game. I don't understand why there are so many negatives.
Just another Vampire Survivors like. Not really worth your time. Halls of Torment is a better alternative. I should have spent the money on malt liquor and scratchers instead. Thumbs up emoji good yes

name: RPG Maker MV - Omega Modern Graphics Pack
short_description: OMEGA MODERN is a new style with clean pixels and bright colors. Let your imagination run wild with tilesets for modern towns and cities, sci-fi dungeons, stores, caves, forests, and more. Your game comes alive with tons of characters-- including faces, side-view battlers, and monsters.
reviews:
i personally dont like it, i feel like the character sprite is much smaller than the tilesets Amazing arts, I highly recommend it, finalboss blues never let me down! Bought this last year. Finally getting around to learning RPG Maker and making something with it. Thanks Covid! Finalbossblues puts out high quality pixel style art. Recommended

 Just bought it. Played just a little, but I am already very happy with this pack. Was everything I was expecting. Maybe the animals were a bit too serious (if you think that the overall theme is mother/earthbound-ish), but the pack is amazing. A little bit expensive, but totally worth it. This pack is one of the best that I have ever bought from finalbossblues.
