He oughta make some battle backgrounds for his Time Fantasy, Old School Modern and Omega Modern graphics packs as well. Either way, I hope he keeps up the good work.

name: Return the Backrooms
short_description: Return the Backrooms is a Co-op horror game for 1-4 players where you can have a great time with your friends. Think, Explore, Wander, find the key items and try to escape. but be careful because something is lurking in the dark...
reviews:
best backrooms game ever made. achievements dont work, walking sim 3.0, fell asleep multiple times. 10/10 bought just to request a refaund under less then twenty mins, dont waste your time first of all the game is garbage like literately pure garbage i wont recommend even to toddler It's called Return the Backrooms, that's what we all did. Returned this game.

I expected it not to be great but it was very very VERY bad. Don't be fooled by the mostly positive reviews. The English language reviews are almost all negative and for good reason. The scream mechanic did give me a laugh at least. no Crypto mining ransomware, please don't buy this. Honestly it functions but that's about it. Stock assets and  an unclear objective make this game a let down. Buy it as a joke, play it once, then let it sit at the bottom of your library. Nahh not good Game overall not enjoyable. Gameplay is buggy and all does not function well, especially in Co-op Honestly a terrible experience. Most of the souls couldn't even be picked up and the monsters could also open the lockers when hiding. Whats the point?

name: The Final Bastion
short_description: The Final Bastion is a Multiplayer PvP & PvE Tower-defense with a classic Medieval-Fantasy theme. Compete against players in head to head online in a PvP, sending waves against the enemy and growing your economy. Play side by side with your friends in PvE and see who survives the longest.
reviews:
Seems fun but, currently too broken to recommend.

At the moment there's multiple gamebreaking and a few minor bugs in the game.

Gamebreaking:
* The roster currently seems to not do anything at all except for blocking you from entering the game when you havent selected anything.
* The minions you choose in Roster don't appear anywhere in game, it's also not enemy selection, as all enemies pop up regardless of your selection.
* All minions in the waves occasionally get stuck at the entrance of the map, when they do the only fix is to restart game.
* There is no save option.
* Dinosaur monster seems to have an issue that lets towers only shoot one volley at it (might be a non mentioned feature of the Dinosaur)

Minor issues:
* *BUG* If you upgrade your towers their direction gets reverted to the standard (initial) position.
* *BALANCE* wave scaling is a mess (especially if Dinosaur bug mentioned above is actually a feature)
* *BUG?* Some upgrades seem to either be missing or just not implemented at all.
* *BALANCE* Tower balance is a mess. Lots of fun watching the mobs get grinded by my towers. Can't wait to see how this game evolves!

Very laggy even with a very high end computer, every good review is spam, the DLC doesnt even work for me either. I sat in a chair and violently pelted my own sack for 3 hours straight like a monkey on crack cocaine and ecstasy. I blacked out and woke up in a Waffle House meat closet with Grimace in a thong and a cowboy. It smelt like cool ranch doritos dipped in hunk spunk dog that shit was fucking awful. I'm eating goldfish and drinking dr. pepper while writing this review, I highly recommend playing Five Night's At Freddy's 2, basically the same experience but with more quality. This is super realistic! The true-to-life movements and sexy bodies really turned me on! I was able to blow off steam after work! Thanks! My ideal girlfriend really was attractive, and I couldn't help but to fall into a trance. When you get close to the girl the screen starts to flicker, like it's switching between 2 cameras or something, not a pleasant experience for the eyes.. 

The game also runs like total dog water, laggy af for being such a simple game. beautiful! you are amazing! I totally fell in love with the girl who never looks upset. I've completely lost interest in human women. So, this VR game is basically a virtual sex doll. It looks okay, not great but not terrible.

The really awful part is the "game play", if you wanna call it that.
The collision detection & physics are just pathetic.
The controller mapping / lack thereof is also nearly non-existent. 
All you can do is smooth movement, very slowly, & grab.
There are no teleport function & no controller buttons are mapped or are allowed to be mapped on HTC Vive or Valve Index.

Overall just a waste of money.
This product & all the products in the Hentai VR Studios lineup are complete trash.
Don't waste your time or money. i may just have potato pc but when i do anything it drops to negative fps dont buy Please if anyone is reading this. My wife and kids are stuck under a wendys in Hartford connecticut. I am being forced to communicate through steam hentai reviews. PLEASE IF YOU  SEE THIS HELP ME... help us...

Pretty good game ngl

name: The Great Adventures of Hemeko & CH0_CH0
short_description: I am wandering through Hemeko, Cho_cho, and P-hole through which I travel through the endless universe using P-hole, and I am seeing and feeling a lot of things. Where else will I start my adventure this time?
reviews:
I really enjoyed the visuals and music found within this game. 

The goal is to collect 20 polygons scattered across a over sized room as fast as possible. It took me 30 mins my first try.

If you're just trying to vibe for a bit and support some talented people... I would drop the fiver my guy.

name: RPG Maker MZ - Sinister Hollows
short_description: Music can make a scary game feel truly terrifying. Intensify the thrill of your games with Sinister Hollows.
reviews:
Probably one of the best DLC's you can get for RPGMaker MZ.

If you like to make horror scenes or horror games.

The soundtracks this DLC offers can set the atmosphere without a doubt.

You can literally make funny dialogue seem spooky with these soundtracks.

name: Dinoku
short_description: Dinoku is a logic game where you must help the Dinos to eat all the leaves on the way. There are different kinds of plants with special ability, making levels more challenging and exciting.
reviews:
Cute and short game, mostly easy enough for kids and casual players.  Level 67 was tricky for me until I noticed a key detail.
The rest were pretty short taking a few minutes or less to solve.  Bear in mind the amount of content is small and don't expect a lengthy challenge.  That being said, all can be solved by logic, which is nice.  The backgrounds change when you restart a level, which is subtle but gives some variety.  Nicely made puzzle experience. [b]dinoku[/b] is a cute puzzler where feeding dinos is of utmost importance. numbered tiles indicate how many times they need to be stepped on, so it's kinda like a draw a single line game, though I'm sure there's a separate subgenre for it I'm not aware of.

[b]75 levels[/b] unlocked one by one, with various new mechanics popping up every now and then, explained in broken english. things like golden leaves that let you step on an empty tile, hot leaves that won't let you use the magic power of golden leaves (they can still be eaten), and refreshing leaves to negate the effect of hot leaves. golden leaves don't have to be used up with the very next move, but they don't stack if you eat more without stepping on a gap. and there are trees that drop leaves on all four sides.

wasd, arrows and mouse clicks all work for movement, tab or clicking switches between available dinos. there's level reset (without a hotkey, my biggest gripe with the game), but [b]no undo[/b], which is surprising in a game at least partially aimed at kids, but it's very much on the easy side, so whatever.

no timer or move limit, good enough presentation and music, separate volume settings, windowed mode, resolutions and graphics quality settings also available while playing. [b]takes about an hour or so[/b] and with the smaller issues it isn't necessarily a good deal at full price, but if you're looking for a relaxing puzzler or something for the kids, it's worth considering on sale. Nice little puzzle game.  Unfortunately it doesn't seem to be possible to play past level 26 on the mouse as you can't click the empty spaces. I love the game, you need to be focused to solve the problems. Having said that, I'm stuck at level 67  T_T... Heeelp! Wow, excellent game, much deeper than I thought for first. Just try to reach some 50ish level and you will see.  
Also cool for kids!

name: HINA-CHAN's BIG TRADE! Millionaire Lunch
short_description: With no offers to be in the mainline games, Hina-chan finally finds herself with no more than a single cucumber in her fridge. Help her by searching for and trading all sorts of items to various humans and youkai to get enough food to make her lunch a rich one!
reviews:
Do you love Hina? I love Hina. You should buy this game so you can love Hina even more. If you don't buy this game then I guess you don't love Hina, in which case, you should love Hina and buy the game. I mean come on, it's Hina. who couldn't love Hina for crying out loud. I mean she's Hina. Just look at her spinning and sucking up all the misfortune. What's not to love? Spin Hina Spin! I love Hina. Do you love Hina? Very cute Hina game! I do not regret buying. All Hina fans should buy this game. 
It's basically the myth about the guy who buys a house with a pin through procedural trading but its Hina getting lunch
you will play as hina a lot and it's cool and hina is cool buy this game Sanae stole a dirty magazine from me 
dude. its called "millionaire lunch" but hina never acquires an inventory worth more than like $400 so this is clickbait A simple but incredibly fun game, Hina-chan's Big Trade is a great thing to sit down with for an hour or two. With quick playthroughs and snappy comic dialogue, it's fantastic for scratching a puzzle itch when you only have a bit of time. The large variety of trade items makes it fun to replay and try to plot more effective trade paths to improve your outcome. Unfortunately, a lot of playthroughs will feel very same-y and you'll find yourself running through all available dialogue with the small number of characters in the game fairly quickly without new items to trade. It's also a very fangame-y fangame, relying on a player's prior knowledge of characters to hang its humor. Overall I think it's a worthwhile thing for puzzle loving Touhou fans and I've had a lot of fun with it. Cute Hina, tbh the replayable really fun! so many ending and content! Hina has always been my favorite if not one of my favorite girls ever since I first saw her sprite in Touhou mountain of faith and hear her stage music. While her ability is to absorb the misfortune of humans, she is also hiding deep inside a forest that is located under a mountain that is full of youkai, chasing away any human that has mistakenly entered the dangerous realm of youkai and making sure they leave safely. To prevent the absorbed misfortune from going back to humanity, Hina let these dark matters surround her, then distance herself from humanity. People don't know this, they only know they have to avoid her at all costs as the consequences of getting too close to her misfortune can be death, therefore treating her like a plague. They never appreciate what she did, they never try to make a statue, offering or be thankful to this goddess who has been protecting them for the entire time. They only escape when they see her, believing she is the reason why misfortune exists in and fall on them. Even though Hina is taking all the blame, she doesn't hate humanity for this, conversely, she loves humans a lot. She may act dismissive when she saw a human. She does that because she knows she is objectively too dangerous to stay close with, and so she acts uninterested, but deep down in her heart, she likes humans, she just wants these humans to live a safe and intact life and perhaps she wants to know more about human.
Hina is so nice that she never intentionally be hostile to any human beings, she is so forgiving that she never pulls a long face at people who treat her as an enemy or apocalypse. She is so innocent that she thought if she dresses up like a Christmas gift, people will understand she is in fact friendly. Even Nitori considered she is too gentle as an apotropaic god and stated that she won't get angry under any circumstances in the M-1 Grand Prix.
You see, Shion may also be a misfortune god, but Hina is the one who has the thinking of benefiting everyone else regardless of how harsh she is treating herself, and executes it in the best way to anyone possible, except herself. Did she ever reveal how sad, and pitiful she is after all these works and only to get hated on? Hina is THE TRUE SECRET ANGEL that no one admires.
Hina is so underappreciated as a protective goddess, Her ancestry has made up for the best ability material, the best religious material, and the absolute best waifu material. How can you not love, receive any affection from or return your feeling to a person that is willing to give up all she has, and not have a complaint, JUST FOR YOU? One thing is for sure, there won't be a person treating a relationship as serious, as sincere, and as cherishing as Hina does, cause she treats humans with genuine. Unfortunately, people still only acknowledge or referring her as "SPIN" or "hinacopter", they always think she spins for fun, overlooking the fact that this girl has one of the biggest contrast between personality and ability and how she is able to make use of it to help people out.
Hina, she maybe the incarnation of darkness, depression, and danger for most people, but she will always be the brightest, warmest and most beautiful guardian goddess for me. Translator is a filthy hypocrite who doesn't consider his actions for half a second if it could give him a bit of extra profit.
Too bad since the game itself is pretty fun, look into a way of getting an untranslated version of the game if you want to support the dev. Kagiyama nearly dies from reimu :(
Joon has a giant loaf of bread :) Much better than the other ISY game on Steam.
A bug: if you trade wet Kimono right at the time it drys, you get both the trade good and dry Kimono.

name: Memoranda
short_description: Memoranda is a 2D point and click adventure game inspired by author Haruki Murakami‚Äôs surreal short stories.The game tells the story of a young lady who gradually realizes that she is forgetting her own name. But is she really losing her memory?
reviews:
It's a careful "yes" or "maybe" from me. I liked Memoranda's art style, voice acting and many other artistic or impressionist aspects, but found the gameplay and its puzzles very illogical and un-intuitive, so I resorted to a guide pretty much the whole way through and just tried to enjoy the story.  Not the best kind of Point n' Click game, but not the worst either. Looks good but ultimately felt kind of hollow, with the kind of puzzles that make people hate adventure games. How much Murakami do I need to read to enjoy this game? I'd like to leave a "neutral" review. Nice art and atmosphere. Puzzles aren't that interesting or necessarily very logical. Quite quickly you turn to the "trying everything with everything", why else would someone ingest petrol? There's still some bugs that aren't so nice. World changing is arbitrary at times. Sometimes you give the correct solution but the game doesn't accept it because you need to have triggered the solution by interacting with specific things. Sometimes you give a partial correct solution by selecting the right item before combining it and the game tells you you're flat out wrong without hinting you're partially there. I found the ending a bit underwhelming, not great if you like deducing information, because the logic is either a bit loopy or the small puzzles are exceedingly simple. Also why can't I give back the elephant picture or tell the lady where her cat is :( some closure is missing. 5/10 (closer to a 6 than a 4). Yes. Nicely drawn and vocalized, but completely aimless adventure where nothing makes sense, no item interaction, no dialog, nothing, also unpolished in certain areas, opera singer is one nice example where you have to mute your speaker just to get over with meaningless dialog and interaction.

Bad execution with nice artists and strapped "based on" label to try to get extra sales.

On top puzzles are completely uninteresting and most can only be solved with a walktrough, with zero inspiration as well.

Overall 0/5. No amount of "pretty pictures" can help it rise below basic Point and Click genre parameters.

Any point and click adventure enthusiast should stay away from this trap. After encountering the first puzzle in "Memoranda", I was excited: finally, a game with built-in hints! But that probably was the last nice thought I had about the game. I got stuck in the main story line so many times, there are no useful hints for it. For example, I picked up flour from the bakery and the character thought that she can finally bake doughnuts for the little girl. Okay, good, I know what to do! But there is no kitchen or any other place suitable for that. What I forgot during my long break from playing this game, that I already gave a doughnut to this girl. So the flour is actually for something else. And why do some characters repeat their requests all the time even if they were already fulfilled? I got really tired of going through the same places again and again hoping that something has changed. Eventually, I had to look in a walkthrough several times to finish the game. I love Murakami stories and I enjoyed references to them in the game but I did not enjoy the gameplay. So bad it's embarrassing.

The world building doesn't make any sense, the story doesn't make any sense, the dialogue is totally disjointed and never makes any sense... In short, this is some of the worst writing ever perpetrated.
Accordingly, none of the puzzles or inventory uses make any sense, and they all form an endless chain of non sequiturs.
This is probably the worst puzzle design I've seen in over 4 decades of adventure games.
No rhyme or reason to anything.

Easily a thick thumb down.

To which I could add a subpar interface (requiring massive keyboard input in what is supposed to be a point n' click,) rotten animation (of otherwise pleasing graphics,) some illegible texts, and a main voice actress who can't articulate her words (making subtitles a must.)
 I'm sorry, but I cannot recommend this game. The graphics are nice, but some of the puzzles make no sense and other are way overthought. The story itself is silly and characters flat and illogical. There are some minor bugs, that would be charming in a cool game, but are a bit annoying here.

It's not a terrible game. We bought it on a very discounted sale and I suggest you do the same. 

We rushed last 25% of the game with a walk-through just to see the ending. It's an acquired taste. Interesting puzzles, magical atmosphere and many different characters which don't have much to say yet still add to the magical aspect of the game world. Inspiration of Murakami can be felt to some degree I must say. ITS FUN

name: Lost in Vivo
short_description: A horror game about claustrophobia. During a storm your service dog is forced down a broken sewer drain. You find the nearest sewer entrance and run in after it. Along the way you will meet others that are also stricken by abnormal or psychological fear.
reviews:
spooky *Bark* Got this game because I kept hearing the ost on my recommended. Was absolutely not disappointed its an amazing game. The story is deep and seems to be up to personal opinion to an extent. The soundtrack is amazing and the ambient sounds in general are also very nice. The art style is interesting and unique, and its not hard to get every achievement fairly quickly for all the endings. Silent Hill on Fenty Really cool, I got a real kick out of seeing my brother's name in the credits. He also has a drawing in the sewers as graffiti, but I havent found it yet, but I am probably going to be devoting a lot of my time to finding it :) It's a really shitty parody of silent hill.

3 hours long, dated visuals, and crap gameplay with no story, after like 10 minutes I'm just lost and no idea what the point is and just quit and haven't touched it since.

I decided to watch a youtuber play it and well glad I did.  

Game kinda sucks but has some creepy moments, awesome sauce Absolutely awful game. Boring, generic jump scares, aggravating controls, zero story to speak of. Holy Balls...

Kira, pls, Never stop making video Games, they are too good

20/10 Super scary!

name: Kebab Chefs! - Restaurant Simulator
short_description: Kebab Chefs! is a Co-Op, cooking and restaurant management game that can be played up to 4 players. Design your own restaurant. Cook delicious foods, fill your menu with various recipes, feed customers and become the biggest kebab restaurant in town!
reviews:
ITS A NICE RELAXING GAME RECOMMENED its a really good, fun game. the one downside is there is a bit of lag in your imput and the responce it gives you. this game overall is really fun but keep in mind that in order to save your progress you have to end then start a new day. defently recomend!!! Super buggy now and devs abandoned it, still on winter map in april. game is SUPER buggy but so fun that I dont even care lol This game is riddled with annoying bugs that make it unplayable. Kebab tasty LOVE IT got buggy as all hell. food fell into some alernate dimention and i can't get it out. been like this for months. looks like no updates will be any time soon, if at all :\ ---{ Graphics }---

name: Magicolors
short_description: You are a Wizard, who to perfect himself in the art of magic, begins a challenging journey. Using the power of your staff and the ability to solve puzzles, you will acquire the energy of rare crystals and unlock powerful spells. Are you ready to this journey?
reviews:
The way it displays the board makes it completely unbearable. fun! You are a Wizard, who to perfect himself in the art of magic, begins a challenging journey. Using the power of your staff and the ability to solve puzzles, you will acquire the energy of rare crystals and unlock powerful spells. Are you ready to this journey? The game really depends on perspective, but the way it displays the board makes it completely unreadable.
In top view it doesn't show information you need (how high everything is).
In side view everything is hidden behind other objects.

This kills the puzzle aspect and he puzzles aren't even that good to begin with. A fun and not too hard puzzle game. Nice idea and not something I've seen before so quite original. It is probably a bit too easy at times even to get 3 stars but that isn't always bad. I'd like to have seen one more world that was actually a real challenge but as it is it is still a great game and well worth the low price. I love the way this game was created and i love that this game is very cheap like me who wastes all moneys what i get on steam and i have left like 2$ and there is hard to find good games with that price but this actually good game i love the pixel art and its kinda hard i haven't played it a lot but now i love it and that's what its now! A very fun and enjoyable puzzle game with some nice relaxing music.
Recommend to buy, especially on a sale! I loved this game, the challenges seem simple but in reality they are very well thought out and complex, having to deal with 3 different angles, geometry and spells with different mechanics makes this game a new experience at each stage. As for the art it is very colorful with attention to small details which makes this game have an engaging setting. I'm enjoying this game a lot. Nice and colorful voxel art, reminds me of playing classic toys and board games.
The game feel is relaxing and the level and spell progression are well balanced. The wizard gives you tips when you insist trying to do something wrong haha :)
And don't think this game is super easy, sometimes you'll have to be a great Wizard to solve those puzzles, has really good challenges. Enjoyable game. Got it for 50 cents on sale, and am now halfway through the last world. The puzzle dynamic is interesting, I really like the music and I think it's great that such a cheap game has quite some length. The only thing I didn't like is that the three star system isn't strict, in the sense that I found more efficient solutions for many puzzles, often in terms of moves, than was necessary to get three stars. Since I found the puzzles somewhat easy (except for puzzle 16 from world 2), I would have enjoyed it if it was more difficult to score three stars. The other thing is that the game crashed quite often (every half an hour, hour or so). The game automatically saves your level progress and restarting didn't take much time, but it was still somewhat annoying.

name: Monster Sanctuary Soundtrack
short_description: Treat your ears to 41 tracks from across the Metroidvania world of Monster Sanctuary! Relive your adventures alongside the beautiful music of the game!
reviews:
I guess this is what peak sounds like Good OST is good. The DLC songs are included instead of being sold separately which is nice.
Worth picking up if you vibed with it while playing as per usual.

but...

Bad Labeling on tracks makes importing to and playing it from anything other than steam a pain to fix.

The DLC tracks have track numbers, but list the album as "Monster Sanctuary (Original Ga", but they do show titles.

The Non-DLC tracks do not have track numbers other than 01 (or literally no number/year for what is track 30), Artist, Album, Album Artist, or Titles. This makes finding the right track in a player extremely annoying if you haven't memorized the length or file size of what you're looking for.

Not really sure why this is the case as this particular weirdness is the first time I've ever encountered a lack of proper labels on an OST that came from steam. Not sure if it's the software I imported it to, but I doubt it considering it's not been an issue for more than a dozen other soundtracks before this one. This came along with the deluxe edition.  I really enjoyed the soundtrack to this game - all the songs are nice.  My favorites are the Champion Battle, Mountain Path, and Mystical Workshop. [h1]Overall album grade = A+[/h1]

There are quite a few bangers on this album. My favorites are #6 Champion Battle followed by #5 Combat as they synchronize well with the on-screen action and SFX sounds as you fight through battles. These songs build up over time echoing the increasing intensity of the battles. I really like the unique music in each zone, especially the very relaxing and inspired #12 Ancient Woods along with #3 Mountain Path.

I can hear very faint influences from other game OSTs in this album and I love it. For example, #10 Infinity Battle vaguely reminds me of music from the Lunar series. The melancholy #26 Blob Burg reminds me of Legend of Legaia. #20 Sun Palace would not sound out of place in Secret of Mana.

[h1]Edit: They added the Forgotten Worlds DLC music to this for free. Super classy move, gents. You have a customer for life.[/h1]

name: Disaster Detective Saiga: An Indescribable Mystery
short_description: This is an adventure game with a comical and mysterious story. Become the unluckiest detective in the universe and travel around Town with your buddy, a fortune teller, to solve crimes.
reviews:
Light-hearted, humorous VN that follows the misadventures of a comically unfortunate detective. It's not really a detective game, but it's a pretty good story.
It's important to note that the game was designed to be played using a controller, including minigames designed as such. It is possible to play on keyboard but for some reason the menu button is backspace. Very fun game.

name: SENRAN KAGURA Reflexions - Yomi Reflexions Course & 12-Outfit Set
short_description: Yomi Reflexions Course & 12-Outfit Set is for use with SENRAN KAGURA Reflexions.
reviews:
this DLC basically doubles what's in the game with Yomi. this adds an entire story to play through (note that when I say "story" I mean like how the base game has a story). because this adds almsot as much content as in the base game it is well worth the price tag.
Note: this along with the other character DLCs you won't have access to the secret menu option or most of the massages until you unlock them again as the respective character. Nothing, i just want to confess how much i love Yomi in this DLC tho üëç Basically I buy the base game to can play this DLC.

name: Call of Duty¬Æ: Black Ops Cold War - Elite Pack
short_description: Get incredible value on in-game content for Black Ops Cold War and Warzone‚Ñ¢. The Elite Pack includes 1100 Call of Duty¬Æ Points*, plus a legendary Operator skin, two legendary weapon blueprints and MORE!
reviews:
its cool for 10 euro because you get 1100 cp and cool skin and blueprints

also if you're wondering, no it does NOT unlock the BASE operator, only the skin version (in this case, Jackal) if youre gonna buy cod points anyway then you may aswell buy these elite/pro pack things money well wasted again i keep my shootings in this game rather than my school

name: GARDEN&BIRD
short_description: The arrival of birds turned the deserted island into a garden, creating your own unique garden in the sandbox!
reviews: yes This game is so simple and so addictively fun. I downloaded the demo and had to get it immediately. I think this has to be the coziest of cozy games. Very sweet and relaxing. Perfect to destress and find a colourful escape. Even though there is not a lot to do you will allways find something to occupy yourself with, like perfecting a neglected corner with just the right decoration , space out tight spots, or rearranging offset plants after a specificcally challenging birdhunt in a forresty area. I have a lot of fun with the game when I am looking for something relaxing without any hassle or challenge. This is a nice and relaxing game where you gather seeds and gifts from birds and grow plants to decorate with or sell. You can buy items, plants, and NPCs from the crate shop and each NPC likes to be gifted certain plants and as you gain hearts, you unlock more items you can buy from them. It's a good game to sit and watch tv while you wait for birds to land. Very easy to play and if you like decorating, you'll love this.

name: Coniclysm
short_description: Coniclysm is an abstract third person shooter where the player assumes the role of an intelligence adapting for survival in a strange new universe.Key FeaturesThis isn‚Äôt your typical shooter--you will need much more than quick reflexes! Explore the strange universe where everything has a purpose.
reviews:
not good It is quite an interesting experience, which requires an open mind and high tolerance for failure, particularly the first few times you play it. Once you discover the hidden mechanics (e.g. you can create boxes of your own), it takes a completely different angle. 

Surprisingly good bang for the buck :D My experience here was short and frustrating.

I've launched the game twice. Both times, it has asked me to click "Agree" to the same EULA. The game is tagged as "full controller support", but naturally you need a mouse and keyboard to actually play the game due to the EULA screen. So that's annoying, and makes it difficult to play on a Steam link with just a controller.

Second, the game frequently "stops", shows a spinning Windows cursor then jerks back to life 15 or so seconds later. It appears to do this each time I die or quit the actual game. Hard to tell. While this is happening, it appears to also fool the Steam Link and jerks things out of fullscreen and into the Windows desktop. So that's also annoying.

The UI is somewhat small and hard to read. The gameplay is a bit obtuse. Nothing overly so, but I can't say that it grabbed me. So far all I've done is shoot things and move through rings. I'd like to think there's more to the game than this, but my interest has been drained by all the little annoyances that have hit me to this point so I won't be continuing.

Not recommended: 2 out of 5. Maybe you'll have better luck than I did. Love this game. Really surprised it didn't do better considering how simple it is to understand and control, the best part comes after - learning how far you can take it! An incredibly creative game. Its more of an experience than a playthrough though but hey it is super cheap. This game has some potential and the mechanic is complex.
It has low frame cap (30fps) and way too many skills that probably require many hours to figure out.
Game is definitely playable but I felt there weren't enough excitement to continue playing. Shot a void into the energy source.
All of existence immediately collapsed into nothingness.
10/10 would annihilate reality again.
 Coniclysm is an abstract third person shooter where the player assumes the role of an intelligence adapting for survival in a strange new universe. Well, I got it for just 1‚Ç¨ through the sale, but still it's disappointing. The game feels very uneven, like made by an amateur. The tutorial is too long and too intrusive, you never really get to play and test what it tells you. The tutorial doesn't switch off automatically, you have to go to the settings. Even on the easy level you get very quickly killed, and after that the game is just over -- no savegame, no checkpoint, nothing. Each time you start from the very beginning, not even your player name is remembered. And after dying, the default option is not -- as one would expect -- to start a new game, no: the default is to visit the game's website. The end effect is that one has to make a lot of effort just in order to actually get into the game -- let alone enjoy it. This needs a lot of polish, even for a low price of 4‚Ç¨. No. Not even for a dollar.

name: War, the Game
short_description: 'War, the Game' is a RTS for pc in realistic present day setting.The controls are intuitive, the game rules are simple and transparent.The game focuses on strategy and the use of ones brain to complete the scenarios.The map is a spherical version of earth. That's new.
reviews:
Abso-lutely. wont open I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you. this game never works The essence of strategy, distilled to it's purest form. Its just a game of, is my number bigger than yours. No real strategy in the game, even the "economy" doesnt really effect this game. 

If you want a game like this, go for anything else like Superpower 1 or 2. Much better games. simple and fun, lacks different difficulties but also very beautifull graphics . Won't launch anymore for whatever reason. It's an incredibly simple RTS. It's good and fun with friends. I don't get all the bad reviews. It's simple, graphically and gameplay wise and that's a good thing.

name: SHOFER Race Driver
short_description: SHOFER Race Driver takes you deep into Middle East. Real cars, real tracks and also ‚Ä¶ . Some local music. Unlock new cars and tracks by participating in series of races and don‚Äôt worry about anything, because you‚Äôll never be left alone, your partner lady will contact you to get you out of any trouble.
reviews:
Often crash and lag The ultimate arcade game! Do not underestimate this game as it is a very reasonable price for it. Yes, of course, it still needs to be finalized and a patch, but this one has its own flavor and it is really playable, I really want to play it and this is really for fun If Adam Sandler was to make a video game, that would be it.

Nothing in this game makes any sense. Real roads from somewhere in the middle east with balloons everywhere. Real cars on the screenshots and videos, but badges are missing in the game ( to avoid paying licencing I suppose ).  The 'rubberband AI' seems to crash constantly. UI design looks as if it was drawn by a 12 year old with crayons. His favourite colours were obviously toxic green and pink.

I wish I could say something about the handling, however the game doesn't really have 360 controller support. It does seem to detect the input, but there is no way to reassign key mappings. I used to accelerate with the 'X' button back in 2002, trigger support please. The arrows seem to control both the car AND the chase camera. I dont understand how in a team of 10 people that made the game they all thought this is a great idea. If I want to steer my car left, that also rotates the camera left and I have no idea where am I going anymore.

On the plus side, congratulations to the developers for trying. This is the first game I have ever played from their country so I applaud their ethusiasm. However they should have started with something simpler. A Mario Kart clone maybe?

My review is negative for the obvious reasons, but by all means please buy this game. I suspect it will be taken down due to licensing in the next few weeks. Now is your chance to get it and show it to your friends after you have finished watching 'The Room'. A cringe classic in the making.

name: The Entity Code
short_description: The Entity Code is a sci-fi themed 2D puzzle game with simple but challenging mechanics.
reviews:
Fun little matching puzzle game. It was short but enjoyable, ended up paying 80 cents for it during the last Winter Sale and it took me about 90 minutes to complete it. Besides the earlier puzzles most need to be solved within only 5 moves. 

The difficulty curve is nice and it slowly adds different elements to the puzzles throughout the game. The final puzzle was several back-to-back within a time limit and normally I don't like timed puzzles but the timer was fair and it felt satisfying to beat. It had a very minor story/plot and while it wasn't necessary it was still a nice touch. 

Overall I do recommend it but with a play time of roughly 2 hours you may want to wait for a sale. (Although full price is still cheap). A relatively short puzzle game which requires the player to transform a set of nine tiles on a board to mimic the target board in no more than five clicks, with each click on a tile turning adjacent tiles into the same shape as the one being clicked on. Later levels introduce three functional tiles which make tiles adjacent to them swap places, prevent them from being turned a different shape, or recall their shape before the last performed click. The fourth function introduced is not a tile; rather it is a register for storing the shape of the tile clicked on last which can then be used to replace any one tile on the board by clicking the right mouse button.

There is no "undo" button, but, with only five clicks to work with, resetting is fast enough. The game takes around two hours to complete. I had a good time with this game
It's a simple game but it manages to give some good challenges without being impossible to solve
5 moves max, the rules are well introduced and the difficulty is raised gradually

It's nice to see the game tried to add some story. Even if I find it a bit clichee and not very good it added some context and it was way better than nothing.

The other thing that was very welcome is the bit of time the Dev took to add some polish, coffee, particules and music to the game. It is to me what differentiate an unfinished project to a real product, and I really liked it.

Would recommend

name: Nick Bounty and the Dame with the Blue Chewed Shoe
short_description: From the Writer/Designer that brought you Tales of Monkey Island, Puzzle Agent and Strong Bad's Cool Game for Attractive People comes a comedy noir adventure! Play as the smart-ass detective as he tries to discover who murdered the dame with the blue chewed shoe.
reviews:
horrible crap compared to the first two episodes Short game but entertaining enough. Nice game. Silly, but stylish and fun. You have to use WASD for movement, that's a huge minus. Played the original Nick Bounty flash games when I was a kid and the jump in quality between the two.  Obviously it's not a perfect game, a bit clunky, but i'm just happy to have a longer Nick Bounty game Pros
- Good dialog lots of Humor
- Good voice acting
- Graphics seem a step up from previous title, a bit more detail in scenes this time around and some subtle particle effects and lighting.
- Noir themes are appreciated.

Cons
- Controls are awful; it says its better with a controller but the controller implementation actually uses a mouse pointer that you move around with the thumb-stick so its pretty tedious. The alternative is keyboard and mouse, you can't actually play the game with just the mouse as for some reason they disabled the ability to click to walk, although you can still click on a hot-spot and the character will walk to it (or try to walk, see my next point)
- Pathing and collision detection is one the worst I've ever seen. The character will frequently get stuck. If you click on an item then the character nearly always gets stuck in a walk animation trying and failing to walk over or if there is any static object in the world that's even remotely close then character slows down or gets stuck. Navigating some scenes can be a real chore.
- Camera can't be controlled, you can easily miss objects because its too zoomed in or just not the right perspective.
- Why is the main characters face even worse looking this time around.
- If you click on a hot-spot while the character is walking then it doesn't work, you have to wait for the character to be completely stationary.
- Occasionally on entering a new scene the character is unable to move for several seconds.

Overall a game for fans of the series or die-hard point and click fans only. I have played all the Nick Bounty games since they began as browser games and enjoyed them all. I would definitely recommend all of them. The Dame with the Blue Chewed Shoe was done very well. I look forward to hopefully seeing a new Nick Bounty game in the future. Great to see a true sequel to flash game classics.
In a weird way it fulfilled my want for an LA Noire style game, despite being very VERY different in tone and gameplay.
Runs well on Linux! I hope there will be more NIck Bounty cases to solve in the future This game was surprisinging delightful.  I played it thru 3 times to experience the dialog of all three sidekicks.  It was great humor, enjoyable story plot, good graphics,  and just all around silly fun.  Thoroughly enjoyed this--highly recommend. The same brand of crazy humour is still here. The main character is still a fairly competent noir private detective who lives in the modern-day world. It is still almost impossible to get stuck, as the solutions to puzzles are pretty obvious.

However, the game has really clunky, laborious movement which requires a keyboard this time. The speed is fine, but the path-finding is pretty buggy - upon clicking a hotspot, it is very common to see the character spin around it at least once to find the one "correct" angle to interact with it.

The game provides a few slots for manual saves. Use them. At some point I ran into a bug which did not let me collect all the necessary evidence at a certain scene. This blocked progression but was remedied by loading a save from an earlier scene. Not sure if it was related to my choice of partner - the cop-lady - as I could not replicate this bug with the other two.

The game takes around four hours to play through. It takes an additional hour to play it through with a different partner, loading a save right before the choice. In addition to hearing new lines of dialogue, it does slightly alter the way the final puzzle plays out, but I would only recommend that to dedicated fans though, as it is hardly worth it. 

[As a note: the final dialogue before the credits gives three options, only the first of which actually results in a meaningful reply from the partner; the other two elicit a dismissive silence and a confused grunt respectively]

name: Hookbots
short_description: CRAFT BOTS & BATTLE FRIENDS! 99 ways to customize your bots & 14 game modes. From knights and dinosaurs, to bounty hunters and space warriors. Choose, customize and crush tons of different bots.
reviews:
Who is the idiot that thought it would be a good idea to release a game like this with no online multiplayer? Remote play is garbage. . . Fun competitive action for local multiplayer. We had a great time. Reminds me of classic Smash Bros in all the right ways, while still having it's own unique flavor.
The hookshot mechanics are a lot of fun, there's decent variety as far as items without there being too many to remember, and they're all visually distinct so it's easy to tell what you're picking up at a glance.
All of the characters feel unique while being similar enough to try a new character without too much of a learning curve.
The controls are pretty standard for the genre, so those familiar with similar games can pick it up and play without much trouble.
The single player modes are pretty similar to what you get from Smash Bros, but are different enough to stand on their own merits. The sports ball minigames are weird, but pretty fun.

Overall if you want something in the same vein as classic Smash Bros but with it's own unique flavor I'd highly recommend it, solid 9/10 for what it is with my main complaint being lack of online matchmaking. 4 out of 5
For a game that clearly was made to play with others you'll be surprised at how fun it can be to play alone and the many different challenges and party modes you will have fun with. The controls are easy to learn but hard to master, and the games are quick so it's really hard to get bored.

Positive: there's a lot of customization available, specially in the party mode, that's the best mode this game has to offer, even against the ai you will always have fun, you don't win or lose immediately in each round, your score grows a bit in each round until you've completed the whole party mode, and that keeps you from getting impatient or frustrated, you'll be always exited and hooked to your current game!

Negative: you'll see that the sport-type challenges (soccer, basket ball and volley ball) are the most frustrating of the challenges and it's difficulty doesn't change with the 4 different game difficulty settings, it's usually the same experience if you play against the ai in the campaign.

If you like Towerfall, Rocket League, Super Smash Bros, Megaman or Mario Party you'll probably like this game. At first, I thought this game was about robots and hooks‚Ä¶ booiii, I was wrong! It‚Äôs way more than that! I saw passion; I felt love and smelled the truth! This game made me rethink about friendship and family. 

So‚Ä¶ my best friend, Joseph "Joe" Baynes‚Ä¶ I finally got the courage to call him‚Ä¶ I invite him over last night just to play this gem. Context: Joe married my crush (Melissa) some years ago; I was pissed and lonely for a while‚Ä¶ I always saw Melissa as my soul mate and a potential wife‚Ä¶ Anyway, he came to my place and we talked like nothing happened; it was beautiful, nevertheless, he was stinking with a funny smell; I never figured out what was the smell or where did he come from‚Ä¶ Also, he was wearing some fancy glasses, just after realizing that, I noticed he was using a cotton patch in his right eye. At that point, I thought he will be having struggles playing Hookbots; booii, I was wrong! Joe kicked ass last night! Hooks and joy all dispersed in my room, just like the old times.  I named my bot ‚ÄúWANKA‚Äù and he named it ‚ÄúSUPER‚Äù, just like we used to as kids!

Life gives you lessons in the less expected ways; he told me that Melissa was a Guinea pig shopaholic and spends all Joe‚Äôs money in those little bastards. When Joe tried to talk about her problem, Melissa threw a brown Guine Pig to his head and hit him in the eye. Short after that, Joe got conjunctivitis in his right eye; now he‚Äôs always wearing that damn cotton eye patch.  Now I can‚Äôt imagine myself (in my deep fantasies) being married with Melissa, she sounds like issues‚Ä¶

It was midnight, I was going to finally beat Joe in a casual Hookbots battle; but something went wrong‚Ä¶ Joe received a call; a strong rodent screech was heard from his phone and scared him so much that he just threw my controller and ran away; he just disappeared‚Ä¶

As I already told before, life gives lessons in unexpected ways: If you think about it, if it hadn't been for Cotton-Eye Joe I'd been married a long time ago, where did you come from, where did you go? Where did you come from, cotton-Eye Joe?

Thank you, the developer, for making me a wiser person. Great party game. Movement feels great and battles are hectic. Plus the game has a lot of game modes that keep the game fun.

name: Isonzo - Royal Units Pack
genres: Action, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Simulation, Strategy
short_description: The 'Royal Units' pack expands the German faction by introducing the distinctive uniforms of 2 major states within the "Deutsches Reich": Bavaria and W√ºrttemberg. It contains 2 sets of uniforms for all classes, plus a special officer uniform.
reviews:
literally lets you play as Erwin Rommel The [b][i]Isonzo: Royal Units Pack[/i][/b] is a richly detailed and immersive addition to the WWI shooter, expanding the German faction with an array of uniforms and headgear from two iconic states of the "Deutsches Reich": Bavaria and W√ºrttemberg. This content pack provides players with historically accurate uniforms, headgear, facial customizations and more, offering a glimpse into the elite forces of these regions. For those interested in German military history, this pack is a must-have, brimming with unique touches that make each soldier stand out on the battlefield.

[h3][b]A Tribute to the Royal W√ºrttemberg Mountain Battalion[/b][/h3]
The [i]Royal W√ºrttemberg Mountain Battalion[/i] is a centerpiece of this DLC, featuring a set of six uniforms that immediately draw attention with their distinctive "Litewka" tunic. Known for their veteran status and their role in key battles, the W√ºrttembergers are depicted with the authenticity that fans of [i]Isonzo[/i] have come to expect. The inclusion of specific roles like the wire telephonist engineer and the minenwerfer ammunition carrier for the assault class adds a further layer of realism, allowing players to visually engage with the specialized duties that soldiers performed during the war.

The [i]Gebirgsm√ºtze[/i] mountain cap is another standout feature, adding a functional and iconic piece of headgear to the pack. This cap, paired with the rugged mountain uniforms, gives the W√ºrttemberg units a visually distinct look that sets them apart from other German forces, emphasizing their expertise in Alpine warfare.

[h3][b]Bavarian Flair ‚Äì Checkered Collar Tabs and Unique Headgear[/b][/h3]
The Bavarians are not left behind in the [i]Royal Units Pack[/i], with their own set of six uniforms sporting the instantly recognizable Bavarian checkered collar tabs. This attention to detail shows a dedication to historical accuracy, as these small touches were a point of pride and distinction among Bavarian troops during the war. The Bavarian uniforms offer a unique visual contrast to the W√ºrttemberg units, giving players the opportunity to explore different aspects of German military fashion.

The headgear for the Bavarians is particularly striking, with options like the [i]Feldm√ºtze[/i] and [i]Schirmm√ºtze[/i] caps, each featuring their state's distinct cockades (blue and white for Bavaria). The canvas-covered shako's with state-roundels are eye-catching and historically significant, adding an air of formality and prestige to the Bavarian forces. Especially notable is the bare Tschako headgear for officers, which prominently displays the state insignia plate, offering a more ceremonial look that distinguishes high-ranking figures on the battlefield.

[h3][b]Elite Customizations ‚Äì Facial Hair and Accessories[/b][/h3]
The [i]Royal Units Pack[/i] doesn‚Äôt stop at uniforms and headgear‚Äîit goes further by offering a selection of facial hair and facial items that enhance personalization and historical accuracy. The five facial hair styles include nods to notable historical figures, such as Nobel Prize-winning scientist and veteran Eduard Buchner and the legendary Erwin Rommel. These carefully styled mustaches and beards give your soldier a look of both experience and individuality, adding personality to your character‚Äôs appearance.

The facial items also include a special German cavalier smoking pipe engraved with the image of Kaiser Wilhelm II, a fitting and unique accessory that perfectly suits high-ranking officers or elite soldiers. This pipe is not only visually distinct but also adds an extra layer of historical immersion, letting players feel as though they‚Äôre embodying the real-life figures who shaped the war.

[h3][b]The Rommel Officer Set ‚Äì A Nod to Military Legend[/b][/h3]
One of the most notable additions in this pack is the special officer set inspired by the legendary exploits of Erwin Rommel during World War I. Known for his tactical brilliance, Rommel‚Äôs WWI experience is immortalized here through a "Kleiner Rock" tunic, a historically accurate face resembling the figure and his matching mustache. This addition is a wonderful homage to one of Germany‚Äôs most iconic military leaders and is perfect for players who want to embody Rommel‚Äôs legacy in battle.

Rommel‚Äôs uniform and facial customizations offer more than just historical significance; they provide a distinguished, elite look that sets your officer apart on the battlefield. Whether leading a charge or directing troops from a strategic position, your character will exude authority and experience.

[h3][b]Cosmetic-Only, but Immersive[/b][/h3]
It‚Äôs important to note that the [i]Royal Units Pack[/i] is cosmetic-only, meaning it does not change gameplay mechanics. However, the level of detail in the uniforms, headgear and facial items ensures that this DLC makes a significant impact on how players experience the game. The historical accuracy and attention to detail in this pack deepen the immersion, making battles feel more personal and rooted in the diverse military cultures of Germany.

Each uniform tells a story‚Äîwhether it's the elite status of the Royal W√ºrttembergers, the distinct Bavarian identity, or the leadership qualities of Rommel, the cosmetic enhancements allow players to step more fully into the roles of these storied soldiers. For players who value customization and historical depth, the [i]Royal Units Pack[/i] is a fantastic way to elevate the visual experience of [i]Isonzo[/i].

[h3][b]Verdict[/b][/h3]
The [i]Isonzo: Royal Units Pack[/i] is a beautifully crafted addition to the game, offering a deep dive into the unique uniforms, headgear and facial items of Bavaria and W√ºrttemberg during World War I. With a strong focus on historical authenticity, this pack not only enhances the visual diversity of the German faction but also adds a sense of pride and prestige to the units represented.

Whether you‚Äôre donning the mountain-ready uniforms of the W√ºrttembergers or sporting the distinctive checkered tabs of the Bavarians, this DLC ensures that your soldiers look as formidable as they feel. The inclusion of facial hair inspired by historical figures and the special officer set based on [i]Erwin Rommel[/i] makes this pack a must-have for fans of history, customization and immersive gameplay.

While it doesn't offer gameplay changes, the [i]Royal Units Pack[/i] makes a significant impact on the overall experience of [i]Isonzo[/i], bringing more character and personality to each battle. For players looking to take their German forces to the next level, this content pack is a worthy and highly recommended investment.
