name: JET SET CORPS
short_description: JET SET CORPS is a retro-inspired shoot 'em up action platformer. Fight aliens, rescue colonists, and explore planets in this pixel art adventure. Features co-op multiplayer, endless runner mode, weapon customization, and more! Add to your wishlist now!
reviews:
This one is hard to find but it`s a retro gem.

From ZX Spectrum style loading screen to every aspect, pure retro, pixel perfect, done with heart and knowledge and it may look as a small game but it takes hours to complete the Campaign and if You like endless runners there is a second game mode - New School.

I like that all planets are based on real objects in space, so there`s even some educational aspect.
Every stage and enemies are different, some deeper into the game are crazy - my faroite is the one with the weapon "mulfunction" :) - mini-games, leaderboards and huge replayability.
Very intense, high paces shooter-platformer.

And my favorite - Co-Operative mode on one screen.
Reminds me good old days of arcade gaming. Best for parties.

It should be more popular, especially with that price, You won`t be sorry.
I recommend Jet Set Corps. TAU CETI E is my favorite level.
Game is difficult, requires learning patterns on each planet, coordination and arcade skills. Well done!

It`s surprising, not a small game You can expect from ZX Spectrum retro games, it has a lot of features, story, and high replayability.

What You get:
- Story mode (Old School) and Endless Runner mode (New School), even mini-game between levels.
- A lot of real planets, which is cool and adds to the realism to the story :)
- Co-Op for 2 Players! Great feature.
- Every planet and enemies are unique, so it`s engaging,
- Lots of guns! :)
- Special pickups like Hologram that helps gathering resources and Colonists - very useful!
- Art is very nice - modernized a little but with respect for ZX Spectrum,
- Cool sounds - auto-turret, shotgun and enemies juicy "splash" :)
- Replay value - You can come back just to play one level or try to beat High Scores in endless.
- Leaderboards - scores from other Players You to beat
Fun!

Downsides - Some gameplay music would be nice. But at the other hand it`s true to the original platform where music in gameplay was rare. Maybe in Jet Set Willy :)

Generally a great retro game with great attention to details. Lots of real planets with descriptions is a valuable addition. Two game modes possible - adventure and casual, co-op (!), fast arcade shooter.
I recommend it. [list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]
An obvious homage to the [b]ZX Spectrum[/b] era ..a borrowed, ahem, idea from "JetPac" (you could say rip-off, if in a bad mood) from 1983. It is basically the same gameplay where your jetman dude (choice for a dudette) is assembling his ship, collects fuel and lifts off. Added ideas: change extra weapons/add bombs/timer and a "newschool" mode that is an horizontal scroller (one way) where you still collect stuff etc but you constantly jetpack your way through baddies (same variety) and items.
[b]Some issues need addressing[/b]:
1. First of all don't make speeded up videos for your game. It's deceiving, irritating to the eye and doesn't give the correct idea of what the gameplay looks like.
2. The flying is heavy, slowish/sluggish and the gravity too strong, compared to how the meanies are moving.
3. The hitbox is fairly large making it easy to get hit even if it feels you weren't that close.
4. The sound effects are rough and not very pleasing to the ear. In particular the "whang-whang" sound in the menu and the laser, and..
5. ..DROP THE CAPITALS people. What is up with capitalised game names? There's no point to "stand out" because half the games come out in CAPITALS.. it's ANNOYING.. STOP IT. (See what I did there? ). Not even angry, just making a point. And it isn't 80s style. They had small letters back then too. And yes there were also capitalized name games too, idiotic trends aren't a new thing.
6. Too high a price for the experience. Find it at 2 gold coins or less and it's alright..

..which is the reason I, not wholehearedly, recommend but I'm partial to the retro-game genre and I don't have a problem with "pixel-art" like some others..
[b]Some fun to be had, more so if you're nostalgic about the era, but it's kind of a one-off. You come, you play, you go..[/b]

EDIT: [b]I am changing the review to negative because of the translations[/b]. You [b]NEED[/b] to use proper translators, i.e. people, to translate your game. Don't be lazy, cheap, because really bad machine translations are an insult to the languages. There may be others but least one language, namely Greek, is really an abomination of translation and an insult  to the language. [b]FIX IT[/b] and I will review and change my opinion accordingly.

[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![/b] Jet Pack with new levels and modes and same retro feel. Sexy game, very nostalgic, bonus with co-op! An excellent remake of the classic arcade game with nice gameplay. Some of the levels are really chellenging. I recommend to all fans of retro gaming. Memories of ZX Spectrum and Atari ..... very good playability! It is a nice ZXS color style game , smooth movement with colorful screen , funny control with ship parts collection , this game reminds me of the < Soft ÔºÜ Cuddly >1987 . I like the game , but I think some change will be better .
1 . Add some BGMs in game , when I played I feel lonely and empty .
2 . Add more acts . The spaceman and aliens kind of doll . They just fly around .
3 . It is cool the ship needs food , not only apple , Canned vegetable and Canned meat also yummy .
4 . This game need a strong theme , horror or funny .
5 . This game speed is fast , make it slow and stressful . Maybe one scary alien chased spaceman .
Then we got : A spaceman in different maps save people and find ship parts with limited ammo and a scary alien try to chased him , add some creepy music / Blood / Dead body / cult 
Ok~ here my crazy suggestions , anyway I hope your games be popular and better .

Happy new year in 2023 and really expect 3D vision haha

name: Blackwake Official Soundtrack
genres: Action, Casual, Indie, Strategy, Free To Play
short_description: The official soundtrack of Blackwake, composed by Garrett Beelow.
reviews:
Soundtrack is in wav format. An absolute fucking banger holy crap. Literally the reason I keep going back to this game. Amazing work Garrett This might as well be a tips jar for the devs, and hats off to them for such a good game. Definitely worth buying.
really great music Great music! A great indie soundtrack. Catchy tunes, very memorable, atmospheric, and follows in the patterns of Pirates of the Caribbean. Wanted some more Sea battle tunes while i shoot at my friendly's (sorry) But yeah devs deserve some love. Had to give a little tip to the devs...the soundtrack is great too tho :P A perfect mix of music from Pirates of the Caribbean and Black Sails amaizing game  :D

name: Skyfall
short_description: Play an exciting 2D old-school RPG in the classic style of Valiant - Resurrection by the same developers.
reviews:
Much better then I thought to begin with, long and fun. I played some game where I wished they would take longer....well Skyfall isn't one of them!
The game is ...there is no other word for it...boring.
Because items are rare and costly the usual gameplay is like this: going to the next dungeon, fighting 2 - 3 mobs.
Than back to the base with a free bed. Of course that is only if you played this on normal or hard...with difficult easy you can probably fight 4 mobs 

Don't waste your money on this one.

edit: and before you ask, I played this game offline so my real playtime is near 3 hours. I do recommend this game because I had a lot of fun playing it.  Scenery is good to look at and character portraits are well done.

BUT - I started the game in Normal difficulty, which I always do with RPGs.  Got to the first boss fight against orcs and I couldn't beat them at all.  The enemies don't respawn, so you can't go back and level up.  So I started the game again - this time in Easy mode.  No problems with the fights then!

I like the 3 separate teams you start off with, so they have different stories.

There are secret rooms to find which give good treasure/equipment.

I would recommend buying the guide (it's very cheap on Steam).  The guide shows secret room locations and also side quests which help levelling up a lot.  What I would like to see in the guide is a world map - I spent quite a while sailing round lost.

 great game good story line A cute little classic RPG.  Super easy mouse controls.  Fun game play.  Lack of a map and quest tracking takes a little bit away from it, sometimes you spend more time running around trying to figure out what to next than actually playing the game.  Overall a fun but frustrating game. Maps, actors (with the same default name) are default templates provided with RPG maker MV software, no map was designed from scratch. It¬¥s a sideview battle.

Game story boring. Just finish the game in 5 hrs.

IT¬¥S NOT WORTHY. I prefer aveyond. this is a great game - a lot of thought has gone into the concept- using 3 parties each with their own story is a great idea coming together as needed- great artwork and graphics- scenery and story are both acceptable and having a guide is another great help. some battles are quite hard but that is to be expected as with the ending. this is one of the better games I have played - would definitely recommend for rpg players

name: Wilderless
short_description: Wilderless is a walking/hiking/photography simulator set in a fantasy wilderness. Players can explore a beautiful, procedurally generated natural open world. Tons of options allow you to configure many aspects of the world, and you can choose your initial world seed to generate different worlds.
reviews:
The game is described as: "Explore a Massive Procedurally Generated Open World Wilderness." Unfortunately, I couldn‚Äôt find much of the "explore" part in it. The procedurally generated open world is indeed present, and the terrain generation works quite well. Exploring the world could have been interesting, but the keyboard-and-mouse controls, along with the HUD, are so poorly implemented that it‚Äôs impossible to engage with the experience. As a result, it‚Äôs hard to treat Wilderness as a proper game.
[olist]
[*]The camera has strange, restrictive movement.
[*]In bird flight mode, turning is jerky, and moving forward requires spamming the Space key, which is far from smooth.
[*]On-screen buttons frequently fail to respond to clicks.
[*]The interface sometimes switches to what seems to be a touch-screen layout, caused Esc and other inputs unresponsive and forcing me to quit with Alt+F4.
[*]The game runs poorly on my RTX 3060 even on low graphics settings.
[/olist]
This is not a game‚Äîit‚Äôs a project showcasing the creator‚Äôs procedural generation skills. However, due to the major issues with camera and controls, the promised "go anywhere, anytime" experience is out of reach, so I have to leave a negative review. I was left with a strong feeling that the game is mocking me‚Äîoffering a beautiful world while deliberately preventing me from exploring it with what feels like intentionally broken controls. A cute and relaxing walking simulator type game where you can just aimlessly explore a generated fantasy world. The game is in an early state and it shows in the funky animations, graphics, and collision detection, but I also see plenty of promise. My main gripes so far are with the UI, which feels optimised for mobile touch controls rather than mouse and keyboard. Overall, it's the kind of game you jump into when you don't want to use your tired head at the end of a long day and just want to chill, and I really like that. a little buggy but a beautiful relaxing game of casual exploration
 You can play as a dragon! 10/10 great game. This is more a virtual environment than a game right now, which is fine by me! I like cozy games and this right now is definitely one. You can walk around the world and collect objects which can be given to various animals who will then let you ride them. There are even pirate ships! Arr! its kinda fun. you can make a world of your liking Thumbs Up for amazing work for a single creator and good use of music in game.

But, 
Movement can be off with either keyboard/xbox controller with using Eagle or Ride on
Objects loading in Dungeons or can be mismatched and randomly sticking out of the wall, floor, water, ceiling....
Couple of times I had teleported on top of the dungeon/sewers yet still underground.
Objective: is there any? No Story? Meeting up with Dragon? Other than collecting flowers, mechanical bits and poo to ride on beasts... I see there is no purpose within the game. 
Glitches: Fast Travel is the worst, but glitches are everywhere... 
For now after lazily wandering around in zen, I am already bored and want to play something else that won't bug out on me.
 Really love my experience with it, is a unique concept and the art is really amazing, there's a good wholesome vibe about it that haven't found in other games!

100% would recommend. Not my normal type of game and generally not a normal type of game but I find that I enjoy it. It's similar to a game I love that I always have kept installed called FUGL (bird). Anyway the environment is very passive and the music is relaxing and it seems like the only current goal in EARLY ACCESS has been to collect spells and ride/pet the animals. It's really cute. I hope it gains traction so devs build an even greater experience. So far my favorite activity has been to ride the dragon which you can do by feeding it. There is nothing to kill and nothing seems to be able to kill you. The most difficulty I had was in the dungeon which was really not difficult. I purposely jumped into the lava to see if I'd die (the double jump and glide trivialize these simple trials), and you don't even after seventeen times. You vanish before you touch the lava and a red ball transports you to the last ledge. I wish more games let you just enjoy them this way. My biggest issue is with navigating the simple menu and graphic modifiers. I can't seem to follow a consistent graphic setting which is odd but then again, my machine is very dated and maybe the options are working flawlessly with an inept monkey (me) behind the controls. One example is that I somehow changed my head to a male head and then back to a female head but upon reentering the menu I can never change it to a male face/head again. The option has simply vanished.

I recommend this but please be respectful to the devs, as this early access title is still in the works.

(I love to spawn a shelter which can be anything from a covered wagon or a fully furnished house. lmao there are so many) Wilderless delivers an adorable art style in a small download.  The music is wonderful and I hope development continues because the game has enough foundations to become a great adventure game if a few small features are added and refined.

name: Mob Rule Classic
short_description: This is a dog-eat dog world of corruption, murder and sex ‚Äì and as the new kid on the block you‚Äôre looking a little like ‚Äòmilk on the bone‚Äô!
reviews:
Fun game Loved this game and was happy to find it on Steam.  Great old Mafia SIM City style game. Buy on steam download Pirate copy and play that Runs allot better.
this is still a grate game :D 
just remember that u need a Goodest boy on every property ! Played with Windows 10 and slowest mouse scroll speed (in game setting) just fine.
The scroll speed is little fast even with slowest setting but eventually you will get used to it, plus there's a minimap for you to click.
The game does crash though, guess the game couldn't handle 2 explosion at the same time. It is recommend to do a backup save after you proceed to next mission. Used to have this on CD, brings me back. Great game. Really fun, build your empire, cartoon graphics, great mob story, no-nonsense, easy to learn and enjoy playing A classic RTS you must play. I bought Mob Rule in a Jewel Case at a Pic N' Save as a child. It was bizarre to me then and it's bizarre to me now, but what a gem. An early game that made a lot of interesting game design choices that paid off big for the player, with enough tactics and nuance to be compelling. Finding out the devs took this formula to new games was exciting for me, but Mob Rule, even as their first iteration, has a unique charm to it. The best childhood game with fond memories ever! great

name: Super Punchman
short_description: The crash ... Not the best start of the day. In any case, for those who live on this planet... The time has come to destroy the monsters and fly home.
reviews:
its kinda like roblox Zzzzzzz...  I really wanted to like this game.  And dammit, it SHOULD be a game I like as I tend to like these kinds of move, dodge and directional shooting overhead kinda games.

But this one lacks anything to make it interesting or exciting and it gets boring as all hell within just a few minutes.

There's no weapon pick-ups that I saw in many levels of advancing, no power-ups, just mindless purchased assets that chase you around and around homing in on you as you run backwards in a circle shooting at them.  Zzzzzzz...


This game scored a 38% using my own scoring system, and honestly it's not even that good.  This feels more like a 2 out of 10.  Not recommended, even at a 80% discount, nope.  There's 100 MUCH better games like this that are done 10x better in the same price range.

highly recommended to people who want to experience this game without VR, for whatever reasons!! w

name: 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London
short_description: 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London Puzzles ‚Äì feel the spirit of London in jigsaws
reviews:
"1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London" is a basic browser/Flash/mobile-app like jigsaw puzzle game.  Solve various jigsaw puzzles made up from images that the "developer" stole off the Internet and used without crediting the actual creators, making this plagiarism, as well as an asset flip and a cash grab.

An example of the stolen, uncredited/plagiarised artwork is [url=https://www.alamy.com/stock-photo-william-shakespeare-in-period-clothing-holding-theatrical-masks-in-13086015.html]"William Shakespeare In Period Clothing"[/url], stolen and used without any apparent permissions or rights from the photographer, "Canva PTY LTD" via Alamy.  Sure, the image rights may allow some stock images to be used without credit (although there's no reason to believe so in this case), and claiming credit for the work of others, as is happening here, is unethical, and the creative and intellectual bankruptcy going on here is unacceptable.

So what we have here is a basic jigsaw puzzle engine that's been skinned with a bunch of photos stolen off the internet and used without attribution.  The icing on the cake is the "developer" here has copy + pasted + reskinned this same asset onto Steam [i]a lot[/i]. 

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this game an insane SEVENTY SIX TIMES onto Steam with minor reskins... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of Creobit's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] 1001 Black Raven Jigsaw
[*] 1001 Jigsaw American Puzzles
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Castles And Palaces 1, 2, 3 and 4
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Detective 1, 2 + 3
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Home Sweet Home Wedding Ceremony 
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Legends of Mystery 1 through 6
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour Africa
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour Asia
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour: Europe
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. 6 Magic Elements
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Cute Cats 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Earth Chronicles 1 through 9
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Home Sweet Home 1, 2 + 3
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Home Sweet Home. Back from Vacation
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Ice Age
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Interior Design
[*] 1001 JIGSAW. MYTHS OF ANCIENT GREECE
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Wild Animals
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: Australian Puzzles
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: France
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: Great America
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London
[*] Alice's Jigsaw Time Travel 1 + 2
[*] Alice's Jigsaw. Wonderland Chronicles 1 + 2
[*] Caribbean Jigsaw
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Christmas 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Easter 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 1, 2, 3 and 4
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Thanksgiving Day 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Valentine's day
[*] Jigsaw Boom 1 + 2
[*] Jigsaw Puzzle Beach Season 1 + 2
[*] Jigsaw Tour
[*] Pirate Jigsaw
[*] Royal Jigsaw 1, 2, 3, + 4
[*] Tasty Jigsaw: Happy Hour 1 + 2
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes this might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 5 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

"1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London" has the farcical price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam. This publisher 8floor managed to arranged 1 card game and then copy-paste it with different sfx, wallpapers and made 200+ games. ++  Lot of customization, number of pieces, regularity of pieces, rotated pieces
++  Clasical pieces
++  Nice and lot of pictures
-?   Probably bit better snapping, i mean some option to make it easier, piece must be placed quite precisely. Just small thing on that puzzle serie beauty. fun little jigsaw puizzles it is worth a sale i did get it on discount Have to agree with the original reviewer. Most of this publisher's puzzle sets are pretty good. They do sometimes reuse music from set to set (this shares music with at least the America set) and a few of the included photos are odd. Yes, I suppose you could see University grads in London, but it's not a thing tourists would usually be looking for.

Overall, it includes all the bells and whistles I like. Puzzles can be made to have more or less pieces, you're free to have a ghost image under the puzzle or the photo itself. That can even be resized. Magnifying glass, and pieces can lock down. Sparkles on the cursor, 500 puzzles with a nice mix of animals, scenery and food along with a scattering of other things. 

Some photos are quite pretty, some seem a little bit like filler, but you should find quite a few you like.I'd say pick it up on sale and realize it is London and has a lot of highlights of the city, but if you were thinking of specific stores or musicals it won't include that. Though, to be fair, there are plenty of corgis and cats. I do recommend this game for those who like virtual jigsaw puzzles.  I enjoy how this company's jigsaw puzzles work.  I like being able to push a button and sort out the border pieces (you just have to start with the border).  I like having the ghost image to place pieces on top of  when I need it and I like being able to choose how many pieces there are in the puzzle.  And I got it on sale which is always a good thing.  Not sure how some of the pictures relate to London but its all good.

reviews: i recommend adding a massive update that happens over a long period of time were you add a bunch of new species to play as, for example Asian marauder ants, carpenter ants, different skins for different species of the ants, and more i also recommend added bigger ants for smaller colonies like bull ants and dinosaur ants, i love how this game brings the best out of the ant world but it has some work to be done. Nice little way to boost support for the game, the worker skin is neat and the artist did an amazing job on the screen desk top background art. My only nit pick is that the soundtrack feature is very cool, I just wished it had a setting that allowed you to change the back ground music in the title screen, but that is just my opinion. i enjoy this pack but pls add a bull ant to go with the pack pls see this Great way to support the devs. Love the new myrmecia ereptors! Good I'm happy with my purchase. That's all I have to say lmao. love the myrmecia skin how to use wallpaper? i like ants How to activate Myrmecia skin?

name: Cris Tales
short_description: Cris Tales is a gorgeous, indie love letter to classic JRPGs with a new perspective. Peer into the past, act in the present, and watch as your choices dynamically change the future -- all on one screen as you play!
reviews:
If Cris Tales is a love letter to Classic Jrpgs, then i hope it got rejected. I think I'd only recommend Cristales for people new to the JRPG/turn-based RPG genre - it's very straightforward as an introduction to that type of game, and it'll likely be enjoyable without being too difficult or frustrating. If you want something gorgeous to look at but not super stressful or difficult, I'm sure you'll have a good time.

Overall I'd say Cristales shines brightly in terms of the art style, concept, and music to an extent, but the execution really left some things to be desired. First and foremost I felt that the core fighting mechanic was underwhelming, and the time-manipulation specifically was a bit of a miss. Since only Crisbell can do the time shift and it uses up your turn, the entire process feels clunky and requires a good deal of set up to pull off. The results are also unimpressive, especially during boss fights. A large number of enemies (bosses and otherwise) are completely immune to statuses, which all but nullifies the effectiveness of the time manipulation. All in all I felt like it was more gimmicky than actually necessary to the combat, which is a shame because it's a very unique idea. 

Story-wise I'd continue the theme of good concept but lackluster execution. The skeleton of an excellent story is there and it is intriguing, but there's not enough interaction with the world and NPCs to really flesh it out. Most of the game felt like the story was on rails and you only got to take a few steps from the track. I was really left wanting more in that area; I could see the tip of the iceberg and wanted to dive all the way to the bottom. I'm not exaggerating when I say they could have tripled the amount of side-quests and character interactions if they wanted to. This also meant that a lot of the main characters unfortunately felt pretty one-dimensional. We get glimpses of back story, but nothing that doesn't serve The Plot. Something akin to loyalty missions would have really helped in that area, especially since there are characters that are not unlocked until very late in the game. 

Finally I have to mention some general quality of life and bug issues. I won't get into details, but I think Cristales would have greatly benefited with more play testing just to sus out minor QOL changes that would make the game feel less clunky. There are also a few bugs here and there, the most egregious of which is when, for one particular area, the game warns you of a "point of no return", but the warning comes AFTER YOU ALREADY PASSED THE POINT OF NO RETURN!!! This means that once you see that warning, you are already locked out all the side quests in that area if you hadn't completed them, and it is completely unforgivable that they did not catch it in play testing. Thank goodness I don't worry about 100%ing achievements...

It probably sounds like I'm crapping all over this game, but to be clear I really did enjoy playing it. It's gorgeous, it's easy to pick up and learn, the world is unique and interesting, and every once in a while you can set up a very satisfying combat combo. It's also worth mentioning that the voice acting is excellent! The VAs all did a bang-up job and sounded wonderful! All that being said, I'm hoping that the Cristales team keeps up the good work and is able to learn some lessons that can be applied to their future projects. I'm definitely going to keep an eye out for new stuff from this team. TL;DR - The combat, puzzles and choices you make don't change or improve past what you get chapter, sometimes getting worse. It doesn't utilise its main mechanic well, discouraging it's use in combat the further you get.
Only selling point is it concept and good artwork

This... is a game that I really, REALLY wanted to like... but I just can't.
The moment I got through the start of the game, I was looking forward to how the combat could evolve, puzzles and seeing how your choices could effect the story you're being told, deciding what is right and whats wrong.

Unfortunately, even with my expectations being set to be a small expansion to what was shown... it wasn't.
Combat? Apart from being mainly tied to a single character mechanic and one other character singular skill... the time based part of it is not used well. In fact, your even punished for attempting it sometimes or prevented from using it all together... so whats the point in it if I have basically seen everything from the moment "chapter 1" starts. Doesn't help when you can also just win easily by have a single character carry with physical or magic damage extremely easily without ever using the time mechanic.

Puzzles? They expand on it slightly with restoring or decaying objects to progress... but sometimes this is used to just add slight padding... or to go "What was the point in that?" For example, you go across a suspended walk way, it collapses on you, you walk back up in ten seconds to restore it and proceed as if nothing happened.

Choices? This was the big part for me, since its constantly has the main character wonder if this was the right choice, and that choices will have consequences and you have to make what you believe is the best decision.

Only for the game to basically lie about that by having you get a third option if you do all of an areas sidequest where it basically gives you the best outcome with 0 consequences to the story... and the characters still wonder if it was the right choice when the main character literally sees everything is good now. On top of that, story wise, getting the third option for doing all the sidequests doesn't even make sense as some of them have 0 connection to why the third choice would exist.

I get it, bonus for players for going out of their way to do all the other content first, but you cant have the best option for deciding which thing to save be gate locked by helping with a float and fixing a romance which has 0 connection to the getting the third option to appear.

The only thing that has kept me going is HOPING the game gets better. But im 90% sure im about to finish the second to last part, and only one new thing has been introduced for puzzles and barely adds anything to it.
Im unfortunately extremely disappointing in this game, there's even more things that has frustrated me... but this review is already long enough, so I'll leave it at that. Just a really good story. Made me sad, happy and angry at times. Loved it. Absolutely beautiful art and design. Pretty decent game-play and a captivating story/world.

Also cute talking frog. 

There are a few moments where dialogue does not match text, but that's rare and does not detract from the game-play. 

 I admit I don't have too much experience or interest in RPGs but I had a lot of fun with this one both for the gameplay, and characters and story!

I liked it from early on but waited to finish it to leave a proper view and I can't say it lost my interest ever! The different strategies you can use with the different combinations of the characters is really fun. I loved exploring the world and the characters were so cute! The art style was very pretty and what caught my attention in the first place. It being fully voiced also a nice luxury, features some of my favorite actors too!

I def think it's worthy of a try! I was lucky enough to get it while it was on sale but I think it's well worth it's full price. i wanted to play this for so long because of the demo + trailers. but i give up right near the end LOL i can't deal with this game anymore. ended up watching the ending on utube

btw literally ripped the plot straight from bravely default. at least bravely did it well though

pros:
art style is beautiful. some fun dialogue, characters and story are OK but not horrible

cons:
- genuinely some of the worst boss battle designs i've ever seen in a video game. they're not even hard, they just take ten years especially in late game bc bosses keep regening and you don't do any damage despite maxing out weapons etc. also i feel like you'd genuinely be stuck on these bosses if you didn't look up what to do, because there's pretty much only one way to beat them and if you slightly mess it up... wellll have fun with another ten years working to beat it. 
- game is so slow. no sprint option while walking??
- introduces a cool time mechanic! (then proceeds to do nothing with it)
- like i said before characters just constantly feel so weak and half ur moves feel like they do nothing
- buggy animations

yeah idk try the game on sale if ur a fan of jrpgs, but don't expect perfection. i think the game had a lot of potential but i'm just really disappointed.  - Good art style
 - Underutilized main selling point
 - Boring combat
 - Shit story I put this game on my wish list a long time ago and was scared off by the mixed reviews.
Now that I played it, I think it's pretty good. Not $40 good, but still good.

Every single dialogue is voiced. Every. Single. One. Even for the smallest and most insignificant NPC. This is amazing for a small game like this. And all the voice talents do an amazing job.
Even though it is annoying at times when you're asked for the trillionth time "Do you wish to land here?"

The characters are good and the banter between them makes the game feel more alive. Willhelm necking Christopher or Zas casually speaking out loud what you think in front of your screen is just amazing. Cris herself is a little bit bland, but grows with her adventure.

The story itself is... okay. While nothing spectacular, it okay in its own right. It doesn't help that the whole story revolves around time, and there are only a handful of good time traveling stories in this world.

The game mechanics of each character are unique enough to try them, even though there is only one VIP in your group who will kill most enemies in one turn. Cris' whole mechanic with time shifting is interesting, but irrelevant for most enemies and even bosses later on, which is a shame.
The town riddles regarding time travel, while interesting in theory, are pretty easy and in almost all cases you are told exactly what you ""could"" do to proceed, which is exactly what you should do.

The OST is pretty good as well, some outstanding battle tracks are included.

So in short: If you want a short, small game with a unique experience, even if it is not the best out there, get this game on sale and have a good time :)


Final warning for completionist: Some achievements require reloading saves, one or two may be bugged. If you want to 100% this game, check a walkthrough beforehand. I recommend this game if you find it interesting or intriguing from the trailers, images, and/or content about it online. I'd get it on a discount just to experience the art. 

It's a very 'basic' game, but it does the basics competently enough and the new stuff is does try are good. Visually it's amazing. I spent a couple of hours just looking it at, traveling to each timeline to see how the art, world and characters change. It does the concept of time travel or seeing past/future really well, there's no overcomplication that can come from dabbling in this topic. 

The combat is alright. It isn't hard as some people make it up to be. The enemies are pretty simple once you get to learn them, and there's a small level of strategy with what moves to use and how to use the time abilities. I did a small amount of grinding and fought every battle I encountered and I managed just fine. 

The story and plot isn't anything to right home about. The writing in these kinda games can be an advantage but in this game they played it pretty safe, tho the voice acting is competent and can be really good at times. There's 1 small section at the end of the game that really surprised me in that it tackled a pretty heavy topic/story point and the voice acting for the NPC involved was top notch. 

Cons for the game are random encounters which some people can dislike. The plot was kinda whatever near the end, and it relies too much on going back to old areas to do stuff and fight similar enemies to ones you fought. There's 2 such sequences in the game and it really hurt the pacing, feels like it's just padding. Enemy design is also very limited, a lot of them, especially bosses, get reused. The game is short enough that it's not that big of a deal. You also move kinda slowly in the world and you do a lotta walking so the slowness really shows. 

There's a sidequest that's easily missable if you don't immediately go and get it, ruining your true ending/100% run.

name: The Rabbit and The Owl - Original Soundtrack
short_description: The Rabbit and The Owl Original Soundtrack contains over 50 minutes of music, produced by David Huff (producer and editor) and Patrick Neff (pianist) of Endlight Productions.
reviews: Really great piano music

name: Heat Wave DLC - x 3 pack
short_description: This DLC contains fireproof suits that prevent fire damage on Abby, Jack and Kenji and grant the ability to craft incendiary ammunition.On a tropical island night, all you need is some fireworks to bring a smile to your face, right? Well, now you can light ‚Äòem up all on your own.
reviews:
üíã it's getting HOT in here! it do get hot in these rhinos yes. Waste of money. Feels more like a pay to win DLC Û†Ä° This game seriously is tons of fun and selling at an impressive price, so all of it's little DLC's are worth it, adding even more fun to the game; However if money is tight, buying the How to Survive - Storm Warning Edition will save you quite a few bucks and you get everything the game has to offer.

Heat Wave DLC - x 3 pack is a combo that gives you all three original characters Flame resistant suites plus the skill to craft incendiary ammo for you weapons, They can either be bought separately or you get this x3 combo part of the Storm Warming Edition which saves you even a few more bucks.

These suites and ammo really does help on harder difficulties so a nice little add on for you here, this DLC doesn't add much but what it add is quite remarkable and bound to up your joy meter which is what counts if you ask me. This dlc is your opinion only if you want to be fire proof from setting yourself on fire and incendiary bullets go for it but to me a 1.99 is steep for what you get ... It gives you the ability to craft flaming bullets, an item that used to be rare and only attainable through quests due to its power, this DLC is nothing more than raw power available for purchase.  Basically a cheatcode for $1.99 waste of money

name: MEDIEVAL KNIGHTMARE
short_description: Hordes of monsters has invaded the village, the last opportunity to avoid them reach the king is you. Arm with weapons and fight the hordes solo or with a team.
reviews:
In a case of beast vs wall, trebuchet wins. 

For those who follow, let it be known that riding atop the backs of swine is excellent transportation. For our victory would not have been possible without the swine slopes. Graphics are ok, idea of the game is great too but you realize pretty quick that it isn't balanced that well. We managed to get past Wave 2 but it wasn't fun at all. The rats are always running towards the gate and not attacking the player. Also I didn't get any heal items or gold so I couldn't purchase something for progressing.
Not a terrible game but needs a lot of work to be enjoyable. no garbage game not worth the 2 dollars i got it for (was 50% off) The main menu look's ok, the non-boss enemies need tweaking like for example the vampires sometimes get stuck after jumping and sometimes they get stuck just on principle. The Bosses, like the skeleton mage is a badass and chases you funny same with the melee attack, The monster giant rats are annoying with the dodging and jumping and the poison, The skull zombie boss is ok, The black witch is just bad on the fact that when her health gets low enough she will go full nude and go's absolutely crazy on you with her semi medium range claw attacks and she is butt ugly in every way imaginable,
The demon bat is annoying the fact that it spits poison projectiles at you, flys and sometimes building to building creating this annoying sound,the Spider Queen is ok, but from a single player perspective the web projectile attack is quite irritating 
because you can't get out of it unless the duration expires or she kills you, now the furious werewolf likes to jump a lot, the forest troll is bit of a brutal boss because it throws these high damaging rocks at you apart from that
the boss is alright, now orc commander boss is a bit overpowered in the way that while engaging you, even if you created a lot of distance between you and the boss it teleports close you and starts whaling at you with he's weapon, 
now finally the elder forest dragon is going to be the irritating boss in the game because 1st it can spit fireballs directly behind it Self and 2nd the fire breath ability is so strong that if you don't have the strongest shield you will die
especially when your in melee range and 3rdly the fire breath attack can go through buildings. Now the weapons like axe feels under-powered, the sword feels strong, the spear feels a bit ok but it go's through stamina so quick even after
you drink the stamina potion it feels so stamina intensive to use long term and the crossbow is under-powered with the normal arrows (90), the fire arrows is average (50) and the explosive arrows are a bit good but you only have (35) of these at a time making the arrows feel wasteful to buy, fire bombs and poison bombs feel under-powered consider you can get the maximum of 3 while the healing bombs are good to buy, pig bait is ok, kamikaze dwarf is genius, pike barricades are ok, explosive barrels feel compulsory to use especially in horde 2 through your 1st and or 2nd attempt or (etc) to pass the level as the giant rats are way tougher then the zombies, the armour diversity is ok, there's No pause feature while in game the looting is so slow that you only have roughly 2 secs to loot as your kill as there is no take all feature in the looting tab, back to the monster giant rat boss that while inside the building closest to the gate if you go to the right corner when you get attacked without blocking you will phase through the wall and end up on the other side the gate so you can get free loot without the 1st gate falling, people are most likely wandering how i finished the game the elder forest dragon get stuck on the roof of the building closest to the 4th gate and i conveniently have a catapult with unlimited ammo witch BTW the wheels act like car wheels and does small damage to the dragon, the ballista also has unlimited ammo. Despite this review there is definitely potential for this game like in multiple playthroughs i keep seeing these blue bottles that i can only assume are mana bottle that could possibly mean players can use magic in the future witch would be cool for the game. I played the game solo just FYI. The boss music is badass. easily the greatest release of 2022, although wave 2 is near impossible there is so many rats don't buy this game its terrible
thanks  I like the graphics and the idea of the game, for the price it worth to play it, i think is a great start to a game. Of course it needs a lot of more work, but i see potential on this.

name: FSX: Steam Edition - Beechcraft¬Æ D17 Staggerwing
short_description: Developed by Alabeo, the FSX: Steam Edition rendition of the Beechcraft¬Æ D17 Staggerwing, is a beautifully detailed and accurate aircraft. The D17 has a distinctive and unusual staggered biplane configuration with the upper wing offset from the lower wing.
reviews:
Here is a hidden gem worth a second look. It‚Äôs a unique and beautiful aircraft with very forgiving flight characteristics. Nicely detailed all around and just a joy to fly. No autopilot though...
It‚Äôs surprisingly speedy for an old civilian biplane and capable of modest ranges with a full load. Great for short vfr trips on sunny days. Not bad at night either. Really Nice "Golden Age" Airplane, flies really nice VFR. No GPS, DME, and Single VOR reciever however, correct for this time period, but would have been nice to include modern GPS in menu's.  Single passenger door opening only in quick menu, no luggage or inspection door animations.   Nice add on for this is KTNP 29 palms, flight from KTNP to KSAN and/or KSEE really nice immersion experience.  Just tinkering with airplanes like this at KTNP is wonderfull with all the animation and air traffic taking place.  Pretend you have a rebuild radial engine with modern metalurgy, machining tolerances and materials, leave throtle at 95-100% prop at about 2200 rpm well within rating, and set cruise at 8000 ft or so via mixture, 25F off peak EGT ( by listening to engine ) Cyl head temp only in cockpit will not break 145C :)  About 46% mixture at 8K ft, on warm summer day and cruise at a nice 168 knots.  Attached vid shows internal construction of the Stagger Wing, (min 14:40) be really nice to redo this as a kit airplane with modern material ect.  really nice repaints found here aswell https://www.flightsim.com/vbfs/fslib.php?searchid=68750489   https://youtu.be/ZtQ992fCF6I?t=883 Lots of fun to fly and verly detailed - pilot visibillilty is challenging but that's the way it really was. Definitely would recommend this great classic if that's what you enjoy. VERY nice, very detailed almost all of the switches work flys like a beauty it is everything that I hope for in a fsx plane many nice liveries can fly fast or slow has all fuel selectors light switches mixture and that stuff that all work and it can land or takeoff in small places perfect for flying in city or out in the country

name: Marshall Mellow
short_description: Marshall Mellow is a game about jumping up blocks as they fall.
reviews:
Great game! Almost feels like a flash game, but updated with 3D graphics, physics and online support.

PROS:
- Fun gameplay loop that's a little bit different every time
- Difficulty increases as you play, "finishing" a level is actually very difficult but at the same time it doesn't take forever to master
- You can do multiplayer with people that don't own the game, by sharing the keyboard or using 2 controllers, and you can do this over the internet with steam remote play

CONS:
- Amount of content is exactly what you see in the trailer. It's infinitely replayable but beyond increasing your own skill it's not very deep

Overall I had a great time with this game and I think it's worth the price, especially if it's on sale.

name: Angrbotha Mountains
short_description: Angrbotha mountains is a short cinematic, story driven adventure RPG game. Regard it as a short solo RPG session with a game master. Levelling up, meet wandering creatures, putting the story together, making choices, exploring and finding items are important parts to put the events to rest.
reviews:
This game is quite frankly a mess and a bad one at that, the unskippable dialogues, the insane motionblur (or lag due to assetbloat), levelsystem that barely works and don't get me started on the puzzles that soft lock you, spent 20 min just looking for a key to progress through a door. 

The only real thing I would say was appreciative was the dwarven dialogue in that one book and the first person lighting in the caves 

And for the love of god please make a working brightness setting

name: Yukie: A Japanese Winter Fairy Tale
short_description: This is a theatrical story game. Lead the hero Yukiji on a journey of vengeance, to the snowy mountain where Yukie resides. The story will proceed in a movie-like fashion.
reviews:
neat little game, i kind of didn't understand half of what it was talking about but i enjoyed it. once you get the 4th or 5th sword the game kind of plays itself by the end. there's a few times where it doesn't tell you how to progress so you can get stuck in a battle for like 10 minutes before you realize you're supposed to flee. there's also a few fights where you can skip combat entirely by just talking until they leave. oh also the estimated time at the beginning of each chapter is wrong you can usually do chapters like 5 minutes faster than what it says This game deserves better recognition. It is truly impressive everything they did with only RPG Maker. If you feel discouraged by the negative reviews on Steam, be aware that most people did not even finish the game, and some others had compatibility issues that have mostly been fixed, the original game (before Steam release + english patch) is 11+ years old after all. And at the end of the day, you can always refund the $1.49 for a [spoiler]c[/spoiler]orn game if it's not akin to your taste. sadly its boring and has stupid battle system ‚£ø‚£ø‚°ª‚†ø‚£≥‚†∏‚¢ø‚°á‚¢á‚£ø‚°ß‚¢π‚†ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£æ‚£ø‚°á‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚£ø‚°ø‚°ê‚£Ø‚†Å ‚†Ñ‚†Ñ
