Well nope. As much as I wanted to play this unique-looking game it quickly went from "unpolished" to downright unplayable. First and foremost this game does have gameplay (as in you do move and fight) and that's where it went wrong for me. It crashed, it lagged, it froze which ruined the atmosphere and just made the whole experience not worth it. Boring, tedious game that tries to be deep. It has shallow characters and there's barely a story. Buy it if you like holding the arrow key down for fifteen minutes at a time listening to pointless exposition and tapping the z key when you hear a sound (which is this game's version of combat.) OH and if you mess up a fight, enjoy holding the arrow key down for fifteen more minutes, listening to the same repeated pointless exposition so you can retry it. A neat little storytelling experience held back by clunky controls and low rez art.  Gameplay elements of  ‚Äúmoving forward‚Äù, fight or flight choices,  and there is a bit of timing with sword swings.  Problem is, they are so low effort  that it detract from the overall experience.  The voice-over was nice. 
This would make a good  visual novel with the gamey bits stripped out. 
 I guess I'm playing a very different game to others because I found this game underwhelming, cliche and overtly sexist. I don't think I've ever written a negative review for a game before but I'm genuinely not sure how the developers justify it's existence.

The premise is that you must slay the beautiful ice maiden who captures the hearts of young men in order to curse the village with eternal winter, due to her irrational emotions at her love leaving. To do so, you must gather the swords of noble warriors who (to use the game's own words) died pitifully at the hands of a woman. So shameful! 

It's an incel wet dream complete with stereotypical Japanese tropes and a very basic battle system. I appreciate it was made in RPG Maker and wasn't expecting much graphics-wise but from the many positive reviews, I was expecting a game with a lot more substance than I was presented with. The walking is tedious, the battles repetitive. Don't get me started on the pointless 'Talk' feature which could have been developed into something charming/quirky but widely misses the mark. 

The only good point I can credit this game with is an atmospheric quality. The soundtrack, predominantly monochrome style and Japanese audio track complement each other nicely. Visual Novel where you lead Yukiji on a journey of vengeance, to the snowy mountain where Yukie resides.
Great story with beautiful art and good voice acting and music.
The combat is simple and interesting but gets some hard fights towards the end.
The story is short (around 2-3h) but i'd definitely recommend it. Definitely some frustration here (game seems a little too long given that the majority of your input is just pressing the left arrow to walk, or walk faster, and some input in combat was ignored).

name: Mhakna Gramura and Fairy Bell - Original Soundtrack
short_description: Original Soundtrack for Mhakna Gramura and Fairy Bell Includes the following tracks in WAV:
reviews:
$10USD for 33 minutes of music is a hard bargain, but if you've read the VN, you'd know the music is amazing. Whether or not it's worth the price is up to your discretion; I think it's worth it. I had the soundtrack free from patreon already, but I had to buy it just to show support because of how amazing it is. Every song fits perfectly to the situation in the game and conveys the feeling of what's happening amazingly. A deal of a soundtrack You know why this OST is 10 dollars? You know why I bought it?

...BECAUSE IT'S JUST THAT FUCKING GOOD.

Why am I even writing this review, if you read the VN, you KNOW how good the songs are! Get this now! 11 songs, each song is 91 cents!

name: Maneater: Truth Quest
short_description: Unlock the mystery of Plover Island in Truth Quest, a DLC expansion to the hit "ShaRkPG," Maneater. A new predator threatens your apex status‚Äîgrow bigger and evolve further to assert your dominance!
reviews:
A neat addition to extend your revenge venture on those puny humans. üòõ If you liked the original Maneater, you‚Äôll probably enjoy this. It‚Äôs basically more of the same: you‚Äôre still a shark, still eating everything in sight, and still leveling up. The new story is a bit wacky with some conspiracy theory vibes, and there‚Äôs a few new areas to explore, but it doesn‚Äôt really do anything groundbreaking.

Overall, if you loved Maneater, you‚Äôll have a good time with Truth Quest, but don‚Äôt expect it to reinvent the wheel. It‚Äôs a solid addition to an already entertaining game, but it doesn‚Äôt go beyond that. Worst DLC i have ever played. And i have played a lot of Ubisoft and EA games so that says something. Become the God of the Sea The game is great when it runs; ever since playing the dlc the game actually runs far worse. Fun dlc but horribly optimized. This DLC for Maneater is not as good as the main game, but it is fun and I would recommend playing Maneaster: Truth Quest.
 unreasonable difficulty spike. if not for the achievement i would never bother buying this It's just a DLC not an expansion, nerds It makes the game run even worse, especially during the human eating missions (which there are way too many of). It crashes way too often, do not buy. Truth Quest is very much more of the same; another area with its own collectables, as well as a few new things for the other areas, a few new evolutionary mutations, a new type of objective in the time trials that see you swimming and flying through rings (which i especially loved, it's a shame there's no way to replay them), and a few other things.

Most notably, however, is that this DLC is more difficult than the base game. While at max level in the base game you can reliably tear apart anything you come across, here you can have fully maxed level and mutations and still have trouble with the bosses. They come at you with far more than what base game offers and the battles can get quite chaotic and intense! Even the hunted wildlife, that now [spoiler] have some of your mutations [/spoiler] can be more of a challenge. It never feels unfair though; you just need a good grasp of the techniques, know when to retreat, etc.

I really enjoyed it and definitely recommend it, especially if you're looking for a bit more content or challenge on the base game. However, if you're not up for a challenge you might not enjoy it quite as much. And for anyone wondering, this very much feels more like a DLC that was made as a complete afterthought to the base game, not one of those where they've obviously held back a part of the base game to be DLC.

Also there was something about conspiracy theory or something but i wasn't really listening.

name: Cocaine Dealer
genres: Casual, Indie, Simulation, Strategy, Early Access
short_description: A clicker/management drug dealing simulator. Get your product cut and wrapped quickly and out on the streets. Build your crew, expand your operation, and climb the supply chain. Stay ahead of the cops, keep your crew in line, or pay the price.
reviews:
fun while it lasted but its been abandoned by the dev known as josh this had potential this could of been your gem your mona lisa but no no updates in little over 2 years so dont buy dont get excited Game is good but it needs updates. When i play now i can't send my first dealer on a run, bag or rest it just shows a red out arrow. When i go to sleep screen stays black i can pause & quit but not pause & save while screen is black. 

After a few weeks i had learned you must start all over again starting a new game just so the game doesn't freeze/black screen. Such a shame this game is abandoned. Had real fun with it until the gamebreaking bugs started to occur. Good, simple fun. ur mechs are broken when it comes to blending up ozs. the purity goes down even if ur doing them all to the same gram from the same batch so you can only bag up one by one After playing cocaine dealer for 1000 hours, I never expected it to be more than just a game. Little did I know, those virtual hours spent mastering the art of the trade would become the cornerstone of my real-world success.

In the digital realm, I was a kingpin, orchestrating deals, outmaneuvering rivals, and amassing virtual wealth with ease. But it wasn't until financial hardship knocked at my door that I realized the potential of my skills beyond the confines of the screen.

With bills piling up and desperation gnawing at my resolve, I made a daring decision. Armed with the knowledge and tactics honed in the virtual world, I ventured into the dangerous underworld of drug trafficking. It was a leap into the unknown, fueled by equal parts desperation and determination.

To my surprise, my virtual expertise translated seamlessly into the real world. I navigated the murky waters of the illicit drug trade with the finesse of a seasoned pro, leveraging my knowledge to secure deals, evade law enforcement, and outwit competitors.

As the profits rolled in, so did the risks. But with each hurdle I overcame, my confidence swelled, and my empire expanded. What started as a gamble born out of necessity soon blossomed into a lucrative enterprise, making me richer than I ever dared to dream.

Yet, amidst the wealth and success, a nagging sense of unease lingered. I couldn't shake the feeling that my newfound fortune came at a steep price ‚Äì not just in terms of the risks I took, but the lives I may have inadvertently destroyed.

Still, as I sit atop my throne of ill-gotten gains, I can't help but marvel at the irony of it all. After 1000 hours of playing cocaine dealer, I had become the real deal ‚Äì and in the process, I had transformed my life in ways I never thought possible. I like Coca example of a good game done bad, no challenges, if your dealer gets arrested you will pretty much get raided no matter how much u pay them or give bonus. if you get raided you pretty much get a game over with the 20% chance to hide your stuff. you either save your game every few mins and reload if you get raided or flush your drugs and hope you have enough money saved to reup Following my dads footsteps fun

name: Battle Forever
short_description: Battle Forever is an arcade Beat 'em Up which reminds you of the good old days in the penny arcade. Fight your way from left to right and leave no face unpunched! Four characters, 13 levels, a survival mode and a ton of fun awaits you!
reviews:
I saw Battle Forever at a cheap price a few months back, but held off on it until today. The forums are bare, and a couple of the reviews seem rather harsh. Surely the game can't be that bad.

Truth is, it isn't. However it isn't a great game either. You can tell a lot of passion went into it, as the graphics and sound, while not exceptional, do their job well enough. Considering one guy did it in maybe five months, it's pretty impressive honestly.

The gameplay itself is rather simple, but it is a beat 'em up so they are supposed to be simple. You move from left to right, beating up groups of enemies that come in five types with a combo, a heavy move, or a special move that you can constantly recharge and use over and over again. Along the way you fight several bosses, including 'The Bleeder' who sprays slime everywhere, 'Mike' (no seriously that's his name) who makes clones of himself, and the big bad, Professor S, the most evil of all scientists, who...randomly drops copy machines that shoot paper airplanes at you?

The story is clearly a bit tongue in cheek as you can't take it totally seriously. But that's fine, you don't come to this sort of game for a story. With that being said, one playthrough of this game will take you less then an hour. But there are four characters and a handful of achievements so you're gonna get about four, or maybe five hours, on a $2.00 (Canadian) purchase. That's not too bad for a game like this. You certainly won't be battling forever, but you'll get enough enjoyment out of it for your money.

An easy to play, time killing, not-quite-forever lasting recommendation. I was excited by the look of this game as back in the 90s I played the likes of Vigilante , Double Dragon and many other like these.

The gameplay  however is simply terrible. Controls, gameflow/sprites/scrolling and enemey AI just ruins everything. 

I cannot recommend this game to anyone. :-( Just asked for a refund. The free game this rips off, little fighter 2 (lf2.net), is 100 times better than this piece of crap.

lf2 has more characters, more special moves and smoother controls (imagaine that huh? an old a** game like lf2 has smoother controls than this crap).

don't waste your money

name: Hexwielder
short_description: Hexwielder is a bullet heaven that tasks you with mixing and matching characters, hexes and upgrades to create the ultimate monster slayer. Choose your character, wield arcane power, and pit yourself against hordes of monsters!
reviews:
This game is a lot of fun and just the kind of game I like with the upgrades and unlocking things. I keep thinking I'm just gonna play for a few minutes to kill some time and end up playing a lot longer than I anticipated. I can't wait to play some more and unlock more upgrades and characters now that I got the hang of it. It's exactly what it says it is, and it's pretty good. I do think the sorceress and alchemist start off pretty rough with their default abilities, but I could see both of them getting a lot better as you play and upgrade them. 

This is a little developer, and it's a passion project. Support small developers! They are the ones that actually love gaming and gamers, and aren't just in it for the money. 

Excited to see how this game progresses. It's great to play while listening to an audio book or YouTube video (peep MaddieDoesWhatSheWants for an awesome health journey that has deeply inspired me in my own challenges). 

I'll keep popping in to play this one! Really fun bullet heaven game! It's challenging without being too easy; the music is fun and upbeat. I like the creative upgrades and characters. Overall, a great game.

name: Empires Shall Fall
short_description: Empires Shall Fall is a turn-based tactics game set in a dieselpunk world. Upgrade your army and command your troops, then exploit terrain to eradicate your enemies with sheer power and sharp tactics.
reviews:
–í–æ–æ–±—â–µ-—Ç–æ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞, –Ω–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞—è. –ù–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–∫ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–µ—Ç, –º–∏—Å—Å–∏–∏ —â–µ–ª–∫–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –±–µ–∑ –∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö –ª–∏–±–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º. –ú–æ–∂–µ—Ç –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å –º–∏—Å—Å–∏–∏ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–µ–µ, –Ω–æ —è —É–∂–µ –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏ –Ω–∏–∫–∞–∫–æ–≥–æ —á–µ–ª–µ–Ω–¥–∂–∞. –ù–∞–¥–æ–µ–ª–æ –º–∏—Å—Å–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–∫–ª–∏–∫–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å. A fun little advance wars clone with well designed maps and a reasonable price. If you don't mind the graphics, it's definitely worth a buy.

I also love the boss units in the "Battle for Liberstadt" maps. They bring something unique to the table while not overstaying their welcome. OK, I didn't go deep into the game, I knew of all the mediocre stuff... BUT NO GRID??? How am I supposed to quickly count enemy ranges??? On one hand, I can't say the game was bad; some of the unit designs I thought were pretty good (namely the diesels), and the music is okay-ish. The faction-specific upgrades are also pretty nice, though there really should have been some better attempt at icon variety. 

On the other hand, I can't say I liked the campaign's story. The ending was lackluster imo; basically a worse variation of Iron Harvest's series of events (the last mission as a whole is the biggest offender of the bunch). 

The backdrops are...not very good in my opinion. Very dull palette, would really benefit from maybe grasslands or snowy terrain.

Character design was inconsistent for Blue League. I don't know why. All I know is we've got joan of arc, mechanic, and historically appropriate military CO for that faction. At least the Black Empire's ensemble have a consistent uniform of sorts. 

Really the game is just "okay". I wanted to like it but in the end I wasn't very invested in the game's story or general feel. Clearly there WAS an attempt at making an Advance Wars-esque game, but there's just a lot of things I felt should have been done better, most especially the ending for the game.

5/10 Game. Not terrible. Not really that interesting though. This feels like a romhack, and I mean that in a good way. A lot of care was taken in tinkering with the mechanics without changing the overall formula, and the result is an Advance Wars that's less spiky and wild, but still highly playable.

For all the custom art poured into Wargroove, I didn't really click with its mechanics and gamefeel. But this I like.

Some changes include:
-no fuel management, only ammo
-veterancy, giving you benefits for keeping a unit alive for a couple turns
-temporary customization points to spend before missions, letting you tailor your strategy instead of being forced into a particular CO's playstyle
-a lot of CO powers have been scaled back or given a secondary effect, and you pick a power from a list rather than just activating based on your star level (no iconic sami/eagle blitz, and the AoEs are less destructive, but the overall toolkit is wider)

In terms of writing, it doesn't seem to be Empires' primary focus, but I didn't mind Days Of Ruin and I don't mind this.

For a small team making a labor of love, this is a pretty big swing. And if you liked the feeling of just regular combat in Advance Wars, endure through the tutorial and get to the real stages. They're worth it.

Edit: Cleared the first real campaign. My opinion is basically unchanged. The tutorial campaign filters a lot of people, and I think this is a shame. The stages in the real campaign are solidly designed. Nothing too special, but they feel like they'd be at home in the first advance wars.

2nd Edit: Upgraded gunners feel kinda busted. They're Advance Wars' AA, but can attack without being countered, they're cheap, they can ford rivers and climb mountains, they give you resources when they kill, and four of them can pick apart a tank without taking damage. They make tanks more valuable just by existing, which sort of forces the meta back into its intended rocks-paper-scissors loop, but it's basically not worth taking the two other infantry types when gunners exist.

3rd Edit: Cleared all campaigns, into the bonus content now. With ten hours under my belt, I think I can say that this game really sticks its technicals but is a little afraid of getting creative. I think gunners being cheap multirole superunits kinda holds it back from finding a deeply sweaty pvp audience---although I could be wrong here---and I think the writing being scanter than Advance Wars' keeps the audience from really investing in its world and characters. However, these are quibbles. Advance Wars is one of those games that feels like it's really easy to make, and then the path to designing it is full of pitfalls. Even if it does nothing else, Empires avoids those pitfalls, and this is to its credit. I hope we get more from this series, and I hope it finds its own voice. A second title could be really impressive. More fun than expected, definitely worth the price. An okay Advance Wars knock off. Not going to set the world alight, but okay for a fun few sessions. Fun little game for the fans of the turn based combat genre.

If you liked advance wars, you will like this one. What a great game! Interesting gameplay, great balance in terms of different types of units, plus animations and visuals are super good. Story makes a lot of sense and soundtrack is hot. 
I could only wish there was more to this game, perhaps more campaign missions or more battle maps with higher difficulty, maybe more unique commanders with their own superpowers and benefits or even new playable faction like the one we fight in the last campaign mission.
But overall, I had a blast playing Empires Shall Fall. Perfect little AW clone. Not too difficult, not too hard. Fun map editor. Hopefully there will be a second game with more units and perhaps larger maps. Highly recommend for fans of the genre.

name: Chiyo
short_description: [Chiyo] is a first-person hardcore escape room horror game set in Japan's Edo era. As Idate Chiyo, a paranormal investigator possessing supernatural abilities, you are tasked with investigating an abandoned mansion and unveiling a family's dark history and it's ultimate secret.
reviews:
Playstation controller tutorials with XBone controller or keyboard+mouse.
Very large deadzone on control sticks makes them a pain to use.
Game tells me to inspect a book, but there's nothing there. very good game with a very bad checkpoint system. Bigger issue: you cannot go on if you quit the game at the beginning of the Eternal Season chapter, cause you will not have the Buddha statues already taken before. Game is buggy. The sound cut out on my machine early on and never came back. It is admittedly an inexpensive game, but I would still wait a while.

It has been a couple of weeks, but I had entered the house and solved one of the first puzzles. I opened a box after solving a combination lock. As I continued to move through the house, I opened a door and after that the sound cut out. As I said, it was pretty early in the game. Al I remember for sure is that it was very soon after I opened the box. Good luck on the game, I thought that it had a lot of promise. If you love difficult puzzles in formidable environments that take almost an hour (each ) to complete because you keep dying over and over while trying to figure it out, this game is for you. Chiyo was pretty creepy! The puzzles were difficult at first but once you figure out how things work it becomes a lot more fun. Highly recommend. 

Some things that are not clear from the beginning: using magic at all attracts the ghost, but there are certain sections where it is generally okay. They nailed the atmosphere of the levels, nowhere do I feel safe from the horrors lurking in who knows where. Would recommend for a friend. Decided to give this game go even though horror isn't my type of game. Going through the house was definitely creepy with all the noises and the wandering ghost in the hall way got me a couple times and some of the other ghost had me no my toes. Besides that, the puzzle were quite hard for me but when i solved it, i felt like a genius lmao

overall 7.5/10 Nice puzzle horror game
worth a try if you're into the genre
The graphic are good as well
i like there's no actual punish to the player even you fail to escape from the ghost, so i can focus on solving the puzzle xD
-----------------------------------
Hope the Devs could Optimize the game more, FPS drop badly on the mirror stage
(could be my own issue, my PC aint that great..)
Also sometime the respawn point for certain stage is confusing, i have to go back to the puzzle place instead of respawn at somewhere around it
There are some bugs here and there, but so far its not breaking the game and i could finish the game without much issue.

Looking forward for more story happen around Chiyo in the future :) This game is very scary. I always walk slowly before entering any room to avoid jump scare but unfortunately the ghost caught me. I cannot think of the puzzle very well because the ghost will come to me if i not doing anything. Overall the game is great for horror story plus puzzle game.

I am waiting for more from this game devs to develop another good game. Thanks devs for making great game to us. :) A pretty neat puzzle/horror game. It has a great atmosphere, interesting story, a wide variety of puzzles and great looking environments. 

I encountered a few bugs but from what I can see in the patch notes, they have all been fixed already and the devs seem to be working hard to improve the game. The main thing that I really disliked about the game is the checkpoint system because of which I had to repeat a couple puzzles. The other thing is the performance which was also far from ideal. Hopefully the devs can improve the game in this aspect as well. Finally, I believe that horror games work better if they are short but if you think differently, then you might consider the length of this game as a detriment.

All in all, the game is worth the price and there is also a demo version if you want to try it out.

name: Beat Saber - Nash Overstreet, Karra & Common Strangers - "What I Like"
short_description: Get the track 'What I Like' by Nash Overstreet, Karra & Common Strangers, slash the beats, and show the world how you rock! This track is part of Timbaland Music Pack, brought to you by BeatClub.
reviews: No 360 or 90 degree variations on these songs.  I assumed that new song packs would have these new song modes.  As others pointed out there needs to be more songs as well.  Seems like this song pack was just given half effort by the developers and rushed out the door. Music I would casually listen to on the radio while driving.  Not beat saber material.  I feel like they got away from their core, or ran out of steam.  I have to admit, the whole pack was a letdown.  And only 5 songs...   For a game that's been out for as long as it has been you would think that the library would be a bit bigger.  And they would have more features.  Like family profiles.  But back to the music pack.. sorry folks.. it's a dud... and that's saying allot being that I praised this game when I first got it. The reason why I like beatsaber is because it is really satisfying to go through blocks to the rythm, but lately the devs seem to lean more to the casuals with releasing a rock album and now a pop album, I could excuse the last album as it had a few songs that I liked, but this one is horrible. Whenever beatsaber comes out with a new album, I buy it on the spot as I'd like to support the creators of this amazing game, but also because it has in the past mostly been of better quality that the moddingcommunity has produced. I hope they release a jpop album in the future or another genre known for good beats, but I don't like the current direction they are going in Would not recommend any of the songs in this music pack. Found them boring to play and too easy compared to other levels in the game

name: Signals
short_description: Signals is a casual planet hopper strategy game. Explore systems, harvest resources and repair alien devices. You‚Äôll need to strategically work with the market to maximize your income while covering the cost of your operation in order to follow strange signals and discover what waits at the source.
reviews:
Game is fun. Very short, campaign is a couple of hours and pretty easy to figure out optimal strategy. Market feature is engaging though. Not a bad buy on sale. For achievement hunters, note that two of the cheevos appear to be busted now; can't complete the weekly change or improve score on same seed. If that were fixed would give wholehearted thumbs up here. Solid "meh"

It is not a bad game, but very casual gamer type game. Very basic civ builder, more like an idle game for a phone. Passable game I decided to not recommend. Content of the game is very limited, you can finish campaign in less than three hours, leaving you with "skirmish" maps. The idea is good, but there is just not enough content - 7 buildings, of which 4 you will be building just on the main planet. 

Generally you will cover all planets with solar panels and extractors. You will do the same with main planet, but then add few farms and domes and research center (no, there is no research in the game, it is just condition to finish mission). And thats all, game over. The UI is not exactly effective, resources are hard to see. 

Not terrible game and might appeal to casual gamer, but thats it. The fact that only 5.5 percent of players finished (3 hours) campaign is quite indicative. Signals started in an interesting fashion; dig materials to rebuild the device and move to the next sector; then the second and third levels bring on a time limit, and no further game mechanics are added. This leaves the game feeling shallow and empty, nothing to change stakes; in fact the stakes even lower once the second half of the game has no time limit. While this makes the game relaxing, it also leaves there not a lot there. There is a daily level you can play, but personally it takes too long for the enjoyment factor, as it encourages you to visit every single planet to try and gain the high score; which could take hours to do optimally.  I have to not recommend from the lack of depth. I wanted to like it, and it has some fun ideas. But the whole user experience feels very indistinct and vague. Half of the resources look the same on the map or with slight recolours, and feel like random mcguffins required for the plot rather than purposeful and different; the need to the put the trade post first isn't intuitive (maybe the first planet should start with one?) and the sense of base building or progression from extraction to research isn't there; and research buildings don't indicate the need for adjacency or build limits. There are just things and mechanics that exist in the game without being explained, and it doesn't make a lot of sense nor make for gameplay I found enjoyable.

It all made for a rather confusing experience, and even after watching the campaign playthrough I didn't find it as fun as I expected from the description. A pleasing aesthetic with chill tunes, but felt pretty lacking in gameplay and variety. It got pretty stale after about an hour, having completed four of the six "campaign" missions, and I just wasn't compelled enough to see the last couple of missions through.

What it does, it does well, but there's just not enough meat on the bone.  One of those games where there is little to grab you.  It's a short time-waster and not a bad concept I suppose, but there's really not much to it.  There's also a marked lack of assistance or in-game tutorial, which would be helpful.  I finished the first chapter easy enough and immediately into the 2nd chapter, I'm unable to place anything anywhere. No amount of messing with different things allowed me to do anything at all.  Not sure if it's a bug (there are a few) or not, but that was all it took to move on. Cute game but not nearly enough here to justify a ¬£7 price, I'd maybe recommend at ¬£1. I finished it in 20 minutes and did not feel like there was more to do. I don't really know how to feel about this game.

It was engaging enough to keep me until the campaign was over, the isometric look is simple yet conveying and the soundtrack was limited but not annoying. My problem comes with how I beat it since I'm really sure how it worked. By winging resource harvesting mostly it seemed to do what I was supposed to do yet there wasn't any kind of guide or tips regarding that aspect. As a result, by the end I didn't feel that much of an accomplishment.

Otherwise, if you like resource gathering games this may be up your alley. Just don't expect some of the achievement to work since the weekly challenges haven't been updated for a while.

name: Press F to pay respects
short_description: Press F to pay respects is the simple clicker game
reviews:
Recommending the clicker game, but not quite frankly satisfied with it.

Good things about this game:
- Press F to pay respects
- Heaven for achievement hunters
- Many achievements to unlock
- Very affordable price
- Quick game completion 

What i disliked:
- A lot of achievements marked as "community achievement" which are not defined as any sort of a fun achievement, and are just followed with a red question mark
- The "shop" in game does not work, so you can't purchase the upgrades
- Music is nice, but it loops like in many puzzle games, so you just turn it off
- Achievements can be buggy and takes a while for Steam to acknowledge you 100% the game

name: Grey Zone
short_description: Become a member of the first space expedition! Go through the path with the main character from the first landing to the final point. Take under your control the colonist Scipio and prove that it's hard for you to break!
reviews:
You go to a pizza place after your little league game.....you drop at least a dollar in quarters into tyhat one greasy arcade machine....... I spent less on this game and remember it more.  money well spent....also can't get past the the first map....not sure if I beat the game or what,.. at least game could of said cogratulation youre win or something Hello everyone!

I am trying to review some games that maybe haven't had enough attention and with no reviews in English, I thought Grey Zone was a good candidate.

But after purchasing the game with the intention of giving an informed review, I find it to be unplayable after only 15 minutes. I can no longer 'Start Game', it just crashes to desktop.

What I did get to play of Grey Zone was interesting, and I think there is a much larger game hidden behind the bugs (I hope so given the 300+mb download). At one point the Russian-English translation broke down completely in such a hilarious way that if I can ever get it to work again I will upload a screenshot.

The sound track is cool but you have to keep moving to avoid monotony.

The core game-play in Grey Zone is solid, the controls maybe aren't the best but I found myself getting better at a rate that matched the game's increasingly challenging arena style matches. I feel there could be a little more combat/cutscene in the first 15 minutes, but like I explained that is all I've been able to play.

Unfortunately I am not able to recommend buying this game as it's (at least in my case) still quite broken. 
I would love to re-review this title once this issue has been resolved. 

As a first release by developer A.Lepunov I feel Grey Zone has promise, But stability and localization are issues that need to be addressed. 

On the whole (at the moment considering the problems) 2/10

name: Learn Japanese To Survive - Hiragana Battle - Study Guide
short_description: The Hiragana Handbook is a very useful guide to reading and writing all 71 hiragana characters!
reviews:
Total crap. What a waste of time. It doesn't really say anything that you shouldn't already have written in your notes, and it's far more annoying to navigate than the notes you should be making throughout the game, but it's nice to have, I guess. The step by step drawing helps, even though you could probably find it online this follows along with the game. There does still have the fact that for non native English speakers the pronunciation it provides is relatively useless, but that is true for pretty much most attempts of trying to express foreign sounds. Oh, I also suggest you print with two pages per A4 paper, that helps.

Plus, the location of the file for me was:
C:\Arquivos de programas (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\HiraganaBattle\DLC

name: Kubinashi Recollection
short_description: In order to retrieve the lost memories, Sekibanki has a big adventure in the world of dreams! Use your "head" to fight your way through a stage full of various mechanisms. It's a 2D visual action puzzle game with a new sensation!
reviews:
have i beaten it? no, because im STUPID. but ill be damned if this game isnt good, i believe its gameplay is fun and requires a lot more thinking than necessary with puzzle games, and because sekibanki is here it's an automatic 10/10. good music too, i love ultramarine rain (but not more than dream fields obviously) a lot, and the spritework and art style of the game is charming, this is more of a brain exercise than school and college, play it NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A Seki out of Banki Got hooked on this game really fast, did nothing but play it for 4 days straight. Reminded me a lot of old platformers like Kirby's Adventure and classic flash games from the 2000s. Art is cute and the gameplay is super smooth, s ranks and other achievements are super demanding but there's a ton of cool tricks you can pull off to do it. Super fun game with a charming story to boot [table]

        [th]Game Genre[/th]
        [td]Puzzle Action[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]Story[/th]

    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]Music[/th]
        [td]‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table] 100/10 It has Sekibanki I HATE FAIRIES I HATE FAIRIES I HATE FAIRIES

Other than the fairies the game is very good. Head is required to beat this game. Cute puzzle platformer featuring my favourite Touhou character, Sekibanki! The gimmick of using her heads as platforms and projectiles is an incredible idea and allowed for unique and intricate puzzles. I completed all main stages with all puzzle pieces and have all the achievements.

The only real shortcoming this game has is that the later puzzles can get frustrating, but only because one mistake will make you have to restart the entire level, which, after spending 5 minutes getting to a point, can be annoying after a while. The puzzles by themselves are very well designed and don't allow for a lot of cheesing.

If there were two things I'd want to see improved in this game, it's:
- A save state system, so solving puzzles would be less frustrating in the later levels, and after you've figured the level out you could then restart from the beginning and properly clear it in a fast manner without having to experiment for solutions.
- Maybe allowing a "mercy frame" or two that lets you buffer a new jump input. Only being able to jump right after the moment you landed can make timing subsequent jumps difficult, letting you press the jump input a frame or two earlier would help immensely in making a row of jumps faster and more fluid.

With that said, I think the general concept, cute story, clever level ideas, charming art and amazing music in this game are incredible and fully worth what you pay, even when the game isn't on sale! I was honestly a bit sceptical at first, but seeing all the content this game has to offer made me realise that buying this game was a good choice. Bonus points for having very fun speedrun techniques, always great to see that in a game that includes a timer.

I bought this game while on sale, but honestly, I'd pay the full price for this. Full recommendation, even despite the shortcoming I mentioned. My 7- and 9-year-old daughters really love listening to music by Paradot („Å±„Çâ„Å©„Å£„Å®) on Youtube, and the adorable Touhou artwork that he does of Touhou characters. So when I came across this game, I thought the artwork of Sekibanki looked strangely familiar.... turns out that he did the music and probably the artwork for this game, and so I knew I had to get it!

It's exactly what you would expect from looking at it - a 2D puzzle platformer. The controls are tight and the level design is really excellent, I've been able to get all the collectibles so far even though several of them I thought were impossible at first.

It's not a particularly exciting game, but I've found it to be fun and relaxing. The cutscenes are also fun and super adorable. Sekibanki is clearly the most precious Touhou character and must be protected at all costs! i lost my head while playing this game
its fun, challenging 2d touhou puzzle game with cute art style. i personally dont have too much to say i tihnk its pretty good
8/10

name: Mystery Tales: Alaskan Wild Collector's Edition
short_description: Call on the animal spirits to help find your sister.
reviews:
A good story, good puzzles and hidden object games.  All the achievements worked.
This one is faster to 100% than most of this genre. Voices are very good in a silly way for all the characters, boat captain guy is peak. Collectible feature is pretty cool where you have to take pictures of wildlife you find. A rare Big Fish game with Steam achievements. The wild experience of the voice acting, bizarre story, and decent/laid back puzzles make this a great introduction to the HOG genre for a first time HOG gamer. 4.5 Star [h1]Entertaining... but not the evolution of fire![/h1]

The game is okay, but not a hit. The story is pretty campy, sadly, because they could have done a lot better.

With regards to the other two games, this probably is the best in the series... Even though the story is... well funny describes it pretty well - for that matter. The story is silly, but they usually are in these games. The setting is cool (pun intended), there's a good mix of HO scenes and puzzles. There were a few I found tedious, but you don't have to do every single one to get the achievements, just most of them. It's a pretty standard HOG, not the best, but still fun.

name: Planet Zoo: Africa Pack
short_description: Embark on an unforgettable African adventure with the Planet Zoo: Africa Pack! Adopt and raise five stunning new animals, master the challenge zoo set in an oasis bazaar, and build out the zoo of your dreams with over 180 beautiful new scenery pieces.
reviews:
TL;DR: 
Great pack with the animals and enrichment items being the main draw with a couple of unique or helpful scenery options. Also, the timed scenario statue is a Fennec Fox. I think the $9.99 price is okay, but I'd still get it on sale if possible as the main bulk add-on for this pack is the customizable scenery with some great animals. It doesn't need to be a big sale though.

Animals & Habitats:
This is a great pack for just the animals alone. I regularly like using the Fennec Foxes and Meerkats in my zoos. Guests are allowed to enter habitats with Meerkats, Penguins, and Fennec Foxes (though the foxes are a bit shy) and it's fun to create enclosures for them. The Scarab Beetle is also pretty useful in making money for zoos early on because of how quickly they reproduce and how many you can have. The Rhinos are cool too, but are usually a standalone species. You also get 4 new, cute enrichment items that can be used by a variety of animals outside of this pack (other than the tunnel, which is only used by 4 animals total). 

Scenery:
The theming of the scenery is decent, but I don't usually use many pieces from this for my builds. If you're regularly working with an African safari theme though, this is a great addition to maybe focus on Egyptian side of Africa. However, many of the scenery pieces are color customizable and can lead to lots of unique builds that you see in the workshop. Particularly, there are some painted wood beams where every piece of it is customizable to get the perfect wood colors. So if you work with wood a lot, this gives you some extra nice wood accents. There are also some arbor crosses that can be colored however you'd like and work great for fencing. So while there are some pieces that can work amazing with other themes, I still don't really use most of the pieces. 

Nature:
There is basically nothing in terms of plants from this pack. You get about 4 different trees of different sizes, but this doesn't really add to your foliage toolbox. It can make your desert and grassland biomes a tad more interesting, but it's quite barren otherwise. I wouldn't get this if you're hoping for more plant options. peak Beautiful DLC. cool Foxes are adorable. Meerkat, southern white rhino, African penguin, fennec fox, and sacred scarab beetle, a total of 4 habitat animals and 1 exhibit animal. This pack might not include as many different animals as the SEA pack, but I really like the choice of animals for this pack. Meerkats and fennec foxes are super cute and ‚Äòpopular‚Äô animals. The African penguin now makes it possible to have penguins in an outside habitat without running up the power bill, and we get a new rhino, which is always nice.

____________
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/45534557/]Follow my Curator[/url] Penguins. If a DLC for Planet Zoo has penguins, it's perfect. I'd pay to have every single penguin in the game. I friggen love the little dudes. Meerkat PENGUINS It is one of the ‚Äúmeh‚Äù packs of planet zoo since the animals are not the best picks the main problem is that the rhino is behind a pay wall‚Ä¶

name: Keiko Everlasting
short_description: When a sudden tragedy brings Keitaro‚Äôs life to a halt, he is forced to leave everything he knows behind. No sooner does he get back on his feet than is he swept off them by a mysterious girl. As they grow closer, she shows him how the darkest of times are temporary, while the brightest last forever.
reviews:
A novel where the end is worth it more than most of the journey leading towards it. The game definitely dragged during the first half, but got better during the event linking the halves and the second half. The characters look rather nice and the music is acceptable.

My biggest negatives are the complete lack of any CGs and... technical performance. Never thought I'd have to mention performance in terms of a VN, but the game appears unresponsive for seconds at a time whenever a large amount of characters appear and additionally when changing scenes with them. It also takes a considerable amount of time to even start up and save/load menu functionality breaks if you make the window fullscreen. I'm more bagging on TyranoBuilder at this point than the game, but it is easily the worst VN engine around. Supposedly it's the easiest to just start using, but it lacks so many QoL features that are default elsewhere.

That said, the ending is rather sweet, even if it's already stated on the store page. Voice acting is also a plus that wouldn't have expected to find here either. Before I start the review, one of the user-defined tags is "Visual Novel". It is not a visual novel, it is a kinetic novel, so there are no choices (just reading).

I liked the story. It was well written and quite enjoyable. However, it was very short. The music is good, but the use of it is the most important. And that's also well done. The art is good, but the placement and size of the sprites could be adjusted so that it "agrees" with the environment more.

Overall, it is a nice kinetic novel to read, and it's good for the price. It is on sale quite often, so it is a good idea to get it then, unless you want to support those who made Keiko Everlasting. An interesting story. The plot is decent, the characters fun (though some have names that are a bit similar). Thing is, there is no way to resize the window, and if you are looking for choices that matter... not here. So I picked this up for less than $1 and I must say it's enjoyable once you get into it, but the problem is the game doesn't do much in the way of storytelling and choices, so it feels like you just reading a book with no say for the first 20 minutes. Only then does your first choice come and it doesn't even have a impact on the story. The story is 95% told and 5% choices.

At least the voice acting is good for the price, but it's completely in Japanese with no way to change it. Only English subtitles are available, but as an anime lover I wasn't bothered by this. A really annoying thing is that the game runs at 720p windowed, which totally breaks immersion. No way to change the resolution (There is NO SETTINGS MENU!!) So the game runs fine, but the borders break the immersion. Also the names of the characters are Japanese. Would be totally fine if they weren't so similar to each other. You will have a hard time trying to remember who is who. Trust me.

Overall: 5.5/10 (Okay story, Decent voiceovers, Effort, Music is excellent. The game is cheap)  ||  (Bad UI, No Settings Menu, runs at 720p windowed, story dragged out)

AWWWW CUTE LIL FOX GIRL AND FOXES FLUFFS SO CUTE AWWWW :3 :3 :3 :3 :3 very scuffed but peak anyhow When I play KONKONKON, I COOMCOOMCOOM i don't like lesbians foxs Very cute and fun adventure. The characters are so cool and original. Another banger from Lu. Cheers!  https://youtu.be/uyP-On0p60Y Probably the worst game (unironically) that ive ever played. I want my 66 cents back. OK. This one's weird. It's obviously a thirst trap with the giant lady with the massive jugs and also the super sexualized unimaginably thicc fox with her lower body exposed. name: Terracotta - Shards of Doom
short_description: High Wizard Clayton has animated clay pots to attack people! Do you have what it takes to stop him? Travel across different worlds fighting High Wizard Clayton's pot army, discovering hidden pots and finding new weapons! Terracotta is a First Person Collectathon. Now go shatter some pots!
reviews:
I bought this game for full price at 4.99 USD. It takes less then an hour to finish, maybe a bit more if you are working towards 100 percenting this gem. It features a tutorial, a collection of 4 themed worlds, a few weapons with upgrades for each and 4 different and unique bosses. The games plays rather simply with your standard fair of WASD and mouse or full controller support.

    I was warned as I started that I would encounter many bugs, glitches, and an impassible crash on the second worlds boss. I'm glad to say I encountered no bugs, save for breaking the magical book weapon post game. It runs smooth and has a certain level of charm. Everything you fight is a pot including bosses, the merchant the big bad, and even yourself. I can say I had fun, even if I had wished the game was juicier and plump with more content.

    In the end, you can tell there was effort. In a Steam full of asset flips and big titty flops there was a degree of work put into this game. Even with this review (and this game even being bought for that matter) are being done only as a meme, I can't say it wasn't worth it. Over all I can without a doubt give this game 5 Depressed Developers out of 5.

name: Brutal Dinosaur
short_description: Brutal Dinosaur is a game that mixes two styles of games, beat em up and shooter in a unique way.
reviews:
You can tell when a game has been designed by someone who has a real passion for what they are doing. This game is a prime example. 
This is an independent game, which a very small team has put together. It does have a few technical issues, but these guys have shown willing to keep working on this game and keep bringing out updates. 
The real aspect of this game that shines is the very clear vision that Marcelo Tapia has for the universe which he has created. This is very clearly a comic book artist, wanting to bring his work to life and I respect that.
This is an ambitious project which is a lot of fun to play all in all.
Patience is needed, but I promised it's worth it.
GREAT GAME.
Makes me want to play more of Animas Games releases. The game is enthusiastic and super ultimate cool beyond comprehension! The art is amazing, the character designs and the backgrounds are so cool! There is constant variety with enormous bosses and crazy things happening always!

Combat is jank, but fun jank with many crazy moves with all characters that are exciting.

The only problem is the shooting sound is too loud for shooting mode! Please fix in a patch, because I want to keep replaying the game comfortably without super loud shooting sound.

Amazing super powered game, recommended if you're a fan of excitement! It used to promise. Another victim of the early access global disease.
The game has very good intentions. The graphics and visual elements, although it looks a bit unfinished/empty in some rooms, are looking very nice and original if you like hand-drawn 2D. If that's the case, you will love the game's visual identity! Although animations could be slightly more fluid, the game gets a point for this.
Two characters to choose from is a minimum and there's few changes of gameplay between them but that makes a bit of diversity, plus the fanservice is pretty high regarding the girl's outfit, and a third character should appear sometime in the future.
The mix beat'em all / shoot'em up is actually a very nice idea, and I feel like it could work. You press a button and then your character gets his gun and a crosshair appears and you can start shooting stuff in the air. That would be pretty cool if while you were doing that you could move your character ( a bit like in Wild Guns, when you move your crosshair right, you move right and vice-versa ), but instead your character stays absolutely still and you are just playing the sitting duck.
Now, ennemies. They have two major problems. First, they are so dumb they get away from the screen and never reappear. That's a problem when the requirement to get to the next room is to defeat every ennemy in the one you're in. That will make you restart the game a lot.
Secondly, they're almost invincible. If you already played a poorly coded beat'em all, you know what I'm talking about. Hitboxes are absolutely a mess to understand, and ennemies will quickly ( understand: instantly ) attack you when you are in range, and they will beat you to death from this point without giving you any chance to counter. And even if by luck you land the first hit on them, your punch animation will be longer than the ennemy's hurt animation and they will counter attack instantly, and punch you to death. That makes the game very frustrating since it's impossible to beat it without dying a lot.
Fun fact though, the devs seem to be aware of this last point since you have infinite lives for now. So you can just get killed by the first ennemy you encounter, respawn and try to beat him back. But sometimes you will just die 4-5 times against a single ennemy because you don't have invincibility frames to protect you, so if you lose your first attack, you basically die. That leads to ridiculous situations where you get in a room with 8 ennemies, you land one hit on a random ennemy, you get punched to death and die, you respawn, you land one hit, you die and so on...

These last points make the game unplayable in the present state. But once again, there are very good intentions behind the disaster, and I would really love it if the devs could make it playable someday because I'm sure it could be a great game. Let's cross fingers for the future, but releasing this at this point of development is simply absurd. I will keep an eye on it in the next months though. This game LOOKS good, but that is about it. Way too many issues for it to be actually fun. I wanted to like this, but in its current state its not that good of a game.

name: The Mystery Room
short_description: This game is a game where you solve the puzzle problem and escape the room. When you start the game, you will be able to solve the puzzle problem and ask for reasoning ability. Unlock all secrets in 8 rooms and escape. Tense music and a mysterious background await you. Puzzles of various difficulty await you.
reviews:
As everyone sees in the democlip - the graphic is not at all fitting today¬¥s standards even for a puzzle game. That would be okay, if the gameplay was good. But already in the first room the absence of user friendly playability makes it hard to get in the game. The music could also be better (to raise the athmosphere) but doesn¬¥t get into a symbiosis with the game. 

Overall the game makes it very hard to feel comfortable. Instead of using the mouse for everything (walk, take, use, inventory) like all the other games since at least a decade do, it throws you back to a time, when every action had it¬¥s own button. So the paste is very slow, actions take much longer and this really is an issue for you will have to do try and error a lot because not even the normal hints in the game are done very clearly. And for a puzzle game, try and error is okay at some point, but not too much cause it feels like guessing, rather than working with an idea.

If you can overlook the missing standard comfort functions, you do not need an athmospherical setup and it is on sale, you might give it a try -  and maybe if you do not expect too much. I was deeply disappointed because of reviews I read and expected a lot more.
 This game is pretty hard to finish because the absence of hint to resolve the puzzles.
You can  not save your progress so it is a shot deal or write down all info found to go faster each time you re-start.
Very dark 
You can't find help on the net except for one walkthrough with no comment and no explaination on how to find the solution of each puzzle.
I am glad I got it on special for cheap 1.14
Icouldn't find a web site for the developer or publisher
finish the game anyway jsut to see if it would change but no 
 I would cautiously recommend this game. The puzzles are of a good difficulty and there's enough of them to justify the price, but the translation is a little dicey and there are a few errors in the actual puzzles/hints themselves that are very misleading. This game is the first I've played that feels like a real life escape room. I considered the puzzles 40% cakewalk and 60% "holy shit, how the fuck do I get out of here? I'm so screwed." Great puzzles!

This game is a legitimate challenge. I was able to figure out most of the puzzles on my own, but I needed assistance on a few, and honestly, I still don't know some of the answers (the process of elimination got me through a couple of them).

The final puzzle is a bit of a letdown, but it may be due to the language barrier. The English translation is a bit misleading, but I was able to determine the correct answer regardless - I just didn't feel confident in my answer.

Overall, this game is outstanding, despite some of its noted flaws. If you love escape rooms, get a group of people (2-4, I'd say), buy this game, and spend an evening playing through it together. If I could erase my memory and go back to play it again, that's what I would have done.

If anything, add in a hint system to give the player a nudge in the right direction. That would make it a little bit more like many escape rooms (in America, at least), where limited hints are provided. Then again, the discussion boards on Steam should be enough to provide the helpful push to complete each challenge, so that isn't really a necessity.

name: Trove - Arcanium Expedition Pack
genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play

Enter this portal to the pixelated realms of the Sun Goddess with a heartbroken companion cube at your side, or share the mysterious contents of an orange box with a friend. Im new dont get it i got it and didnt recieve it i checked everywhere and nothing I bought this DLC 30 mins ago, but still havent got the items yet, pls fix.
