Let me tell you how to get and redeem your code :
1. Open Steam Library, click on Trove
2. Click on the Manage and then choose CD Keys (Here you will find your code) and copy it
3. Run Trove and then click on your ID then choose Redeem code, paste your code. And your DLC will be added to your account.
Hope this helpful bro :) üëç i dint got it For those few silly gamers out there still buying DLCs for Trove and come to the reviews wondering "How the HELL do I get my stuff???" LISTEN UP! Go to your Library, Right Click Trove, Manage, CD Keys. Copy that. Go to your launcher for Trove. Click your ID in the top right. Redeem code. All done. Back in game, just give it a quick refresh. Either close out or just load into another world. Done. Your welcome and enjoy your new stuff. i still have not got my pack in trove, i have the game and been playing it for a long time but i did not get what i paid for .

name: Evil Dead: The Game - Immortal Power Bundle
short_description: Grab a bundle of gory content celebrating the TV series, Ash vs Evil Dead! New Survivor: Ruby Knowby New Outfits: Ash: Party Animal Outfit Kelly: Scourge of Evil Outfit Pablo: Fish n Chips Outfit Puppeteer Demon Class: King of the White Frost Outfit
reviews:
Get groovy as Ruby -- the femme fatale deadite demon bitch from 'Ash vs. Evil Dead' -- who joins our ranks as a hero-type. . .for now.

The Ghostbeaters get some new threads with this DLC, as well. still hopeful for an Ash vs Evil Dead season 4 one way or another The only power I get out of this is no women

name: Motherless - What If? - Anamarija DLC
short_description: Motherless - What If?: AnamarijaThis DLC explores the unseen story of Anamarija, her struggles and unseen moments with Sunny, our MC.
reviews:
Everything you love about Motherless with extra pussy. These scenes mesh well with the main game plot, the models are the same hot ones, too, and the sex is great. I highly recommend this DLC to any fan of the series. And it's a nice way to encourage the dev to release more titles, too. ENG:
This small spin-off, lasting a little more than one chapter and accessible from the fork sign at the top of the main menu, next to the Halloween special, takes place during the events of the very first part of the first season of Motherless, when Natassija was still Sister Anamarija for our hero, starting shortly after the first confrontation between Sunny and Dick upon Booker and Shaniqua's return from home and showing us an extended version of what happened in this period of time until the meeting of the ex-nun with Valerie.

Perhaps due to the return to the paradigm of the first season, however, in this DLC, choices return to being present which at times influence the continuation of the story, giving the player back a bit of control over what, all things considered, passes from from initially being a multiple-choice visual novel, with even a couple of sandbox-style moments, to a more static kinetic novel of the second and third seasons.

It's a bit of a shame that, at the moment, this DLC is not listed together with all the others from Motherless - Season 1, but it has to be searched for separately, this certainly reduces its visibility on the store.

[spoiler]Personal note: obviously the best girl here can only be sister Anamarija, glasses included, whose ingenious ideas are at least remarkable, followed by Asia, who now we know could also be used as a bike air horn(y)-like doorbell.[/spoiler]

____


ITA:
Questo piccolo spin-off, della durata di un po' pi√π di un capitolo e accessibile dal cartello biforcazione nella parte alta del menu principale, a fianco dello speciale di Halloween, si colloca durante gli eventi della primissima parte della prima stagione di Motherless, quando Natassija era ancora sorella Anamarija per il nostro eroe, partendo da poco dopo il primo confronto tra Sunny e Dick al ritorno da casa di Booker e Shaniqua e mostrandoci una versione estesa quanto successo in questo lasso di tempo fino all'incontro dell'ex-suora con Valerie.

Forse a causa del ritorno al paradigma della prima stagione, per√≤, in questo DLC, tornano ad essere presenti delle scelte che a tratti influiscono sul proseguo della storia, restituendo al giocatore un po' di controllo su quella che, a conti fatti, passa dall'essere inizialmente una visual novel a scelta multipla, con addirittura un paio di momenti in stile sandbox, alla pi√π statica kinetic novel della seconda e terza stagione.

√à un po' un peccato che, al momento attuale, questo DLC non sia annoverato insieme a tutti gli altri di Motherless - Season 1, ma debba essere cercato a parte, questo ne riduce senz'altro la visibilit√† sullo store.

[spoiler]Nota personale: ovviamente qui la best girl non pu√≤ che essere sorella Anamarija, occhiali inclusi, le cui trovate geniali sono quantomeno rimarchevoli, seguita da Asia, che ora sappiamo potrebbe essere benissimo usata anche come campanello a trombetta.[/spoiler] I think Mr does good work so Ill leave a positive but this isnt worth it tbh
its like 10 minutes of content
buy if you want to support

Edit:
DLC was updated and now has good content

recommended

name: Deus Ex: Mankind Divided - System Rift
short_description: Discover the secrets hidden within the Palisade Blade in Deus Ex: Mankind Divided‚Äôs first story DLC.
reviews:
Overpriced, but if you get the Digital Deluxe Edition of the game (which you should) this is a pretty good 3-hour dlc. Worse than most sidequests. Boring identical-looking corridors. Felt like a chore. It's an ok DLC with enough content to justify its existence. It has some Thief vibes (because the whole DLC is literally bank robbery with a preparation phase included). It has a nice atmosphere, interesting characters, and a story that actually has a start and finish, unlike the original Mankind Divided. 

People here are mostly complaining about the price being too high, but the whole Deus Ex franchise is constantly on 85% discount, so I don't think it's a problem anymore. Is it worth you time though? I would definitely say "yes". Always wanted to get into this place. It's an Ok expansion, but it's not worth full price.
Get it for 75% or better deal. Not worth the full price, it only takes 2-3 hours to finish this. Other than that DLC is okay (not great, just okay), but I hate it that it's not tied to the base game playthrough, as there are not enough Praxis Kits/experience to actually have fun exploring it and if you don't pick up certain skills you're pretty much fucked at the end (if you're going for the achievments). It is not worth it, especially at full price. Even though, there is a new area, gameplay time is pretty short. There are not much new features for this DLC to be worth your money. Story of the game is pretty irrelevant to main game; it is just the unnecessary and boring foundation for Breach. Sadly, you need DLCs for achievements. h Wish this wasn't a tie-in to the weak online mode. [b]Pros:[/b]
+ Prequel for Deus Ex: Breach
+ Plot. Francis Pritchard back to the game
+ New locations in Prague

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Short story.
- Story is separate from the main game

[b]7/10[/b]

name: The Simulation
short_description: Welcome to the Simulation! A first person, physics simulation based puzzle game where you solve puzzles and answer riddles which will test your creativity and intelligence. Gain unique powers along the way. Each puzzle is different and there are multiple ways to solve them. Good Luck!
reviews: its a calming, intelligent puzzle game. Hope it improves more for full release. For the price point, it seems like a great game. So far its good. But i hope it could have more story. Keep it up! Nice game. Interesting and relaxing puzzle game. Great Work! it's good, but can sometimes get a bit frustrating at parts like where you have to jump over lasers. Overall, I like it.

name: DOGO
short_description: DOGO is a local-multiplayer, competitive platformer in which players compete in an ancient ritual to convert opposing cultures to their own alignment.
reviews: NOICE!! loads of gameplay super fun with fronds This is the kind of game where new secrets will be discovered decades from now, where articles of nostalgia and praise will be in abundance and people will rememeber fondly of the mysteries they encountered firsthand.

name: Pendula Swing - The Complete Journey
short_description: Explore a memorable 1920s fantasy world where you interact with, befriend and romance hundreds of characters with unique quests, as an already rich and famous heroine.
reviews:
I'd like to give it a recommendation cuz I really like the concept of being a retired female hero, also the world building and the music are above average. 
However, to be honest the overall playing experience wasn't very enjoyable. The quest lines are wayyy too straightforward, repetitive and plain. Sometimes almost feels as if the dialogue was AI generated based on the main script. 

me: Let me see the person who stole my stuff.
NPC:  NO! I shall protect him!
me: I just want to talk.
NPC: Okay, come on in.

That's literally what happened in the main storytelling, like seriously??? I was expecting a fun, swinging adventure but found myself bored, understimulated and frustrated. This game is very buggy to the point that important objects suddenly disappear, npc's repeat themselves or do not talk at all, etc making it impossible to continue and to get all the achievements. Music score and scenery is good, but the characters are ugly and the story is dull. It feels half-done.
--------------------------------------
Achievements/Completionist: FML :(


Do Not play this game if:

- You lack patience...
- You have better things to do
- You are a completionist when it comes to achievements
- You are looking for a fun Point&Click game, this game is neither


Play this game if:

- You want to experience the roaring 20s in a world where Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Goblins and Orcs co-exist


Verdict: 4/10 Such a vibe [b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]Great worldbuilding and 1920's atmosphere
    [*]Music and art help flesh out the world
    [*]Game depicts a diverse population and addresses relevant social issues without being contrived
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b] (mostly bugs)
[list]
    [*]Keys may disappear from inventory. This was not a game-breaking bug for me since it only happened twice during my playthrough and I didn't need those keys to proceed, but some areas will be inaccessible.
    [*]Players sometimes can't get back to the same dialogue option if they didn't exhaust the dialogue tree in one go. If you fail to get a quest during your first conversation with certain characters, you won't be able to get it for the rest of this playthrough.
    [*]There's no manual save option. If a key disappears or a quest is missed, players can't load previous saves.
    [*]Main character easily gets stuck. Can mostly be fixed by sending your animal companions away.
    [*]Some minor quests can't be completed since relevant dialogues simply don't pop up.
    [*]The game may crash on startup or take a long while to load.
    [*]Can't trigger the romance with [spoiler]Marla Lee[/spoiler].
    [*][spoiler]Two Aidans will appear in his room at the end of the game should the player choose to romance him. It's actually kind of hilarious but still, a bug. [/spoiler]
[/list]

I still would recommend this game to anyone who genuinely likes the 1920's vibe. I'll edit this comment if the bugs are fixed. confesso que comprei esse sem esperar muita coisa e acabou sendo uma surpresa maravilhosa pois fiquei MUITO  entretida! very fun and very good story line well done Don't buy this.
Glitches (some of which have been known about for years without being resolved), and no ability to save your game or have separate saves to protect against glitches. There is a reason that one of the two guides on steam is about how to save your game.

I like the idea, and I think I would enjoy the game if it weren't for the frequent glitches.
Like quests disappearing and having no way to continue the story, or conversations being unobtainable if you previously left the conversation before asking everything.

Or, the issue I just encountered after 4hrs of playtime, keys disappearing from your inventory. Meaning I can't get into the apartment where certain items are placed. This issue with keys has been known about for TWO YEARS. And they still have not fixed it. I love how many sidequests there are! If your favorite thing to do in RPGs is walk around and talk to NPCs (and romance them) this is the game for you.
I love the lore and the world building in this game, and how the creators mixed the 1920s with a fantasy setting. I also love how the main character is already an established hero (well at least to some races). It's nothing I've ever seen before and I found it super interesting! I highly recommend this game! I fell asleep several times while playing this glorified fetch quest galore. Rather primitive 2.5D graphics that made my computer work harder than some newest AAA games. 
Imagine badly written RPG without RPG and combat. That's what you get. Boring and illogical story with bland characters with no personality. Since there is no combat dialogues and story should be main focus but... dialogues are extremely short, there is often only one allowed path (why multiple choices if you are, in the end forced to go with only one of them?).

Get the game in sale - 5EUR max, do not ever pay full price.

name: SOULCALIBUR VI
short_description: Bring more than your fists to the fight! Featuring all-new battle mechanics and characters, SOULCALIBUR VI marks a new era of the historic franchise. Welcome back to the stage of history!
reviews:
People seem to not like this game, but not me. It still has core fighting mechanics as it's always had since it's origination. I assume people don't care for it because the game has been broken down and sold you via DLC (which is understandable). However, I still enjoy Soul Calibur and it runs amazing on my PC. High Fidelity Ninjy chops at 120fps. I get matches faster than in Tekken 8 wobblers Peak, underrated asf Good game, but held back by poor netcode and some strange design decisions. I had a game where the grinch faught dante from dantes inferno, how is this game not a must have Soulcalibur is one of the best series i've come to love. 6 has fun gameplay, fun story, and spectacular visuals~ Defo give it a try! If you like reading in your fighting games, then this game's story mode is for you. not for me tho . Graphics 8/10
Control 6/10
Difficulty 7/10
Addictedness 6/10
Age Rate - Any
Player Anger - Non
Pay To Win? - No
Play Without Friend - good
Cheater Rate - Non
Is It Worth It - YES i love it so much this game is a best fighter game EVER <3

name: Mushy Score
short_description: Fight endless waves of enemies for high score! In this platforming survival arena you collect points and survive long as you can. Play as a cute Mushy who adventures nearby forest and fights for their life. Can you survive long enough to get new high score?
reviews:
The pixel art graphics and soundtracks give the game a cool arcade vibe. 

It's super easy to learn the mechanics, and it gets more fun as you unlock more upgrades for your character. 

I had fun grinding for high scores and replaying on harder difficulties.

One thing that I found annoying was the jumping because you have to hold down to jump higher. While fighting many enemies at once I used to press space and release instantly, but the character barely leaves the ground. I believe it would have been better if the character would jump higher on normal press and go even higher if you hold. So far incredibly enjoyable! I loved the action 2D side scroller system combined with the tower defense one! Good little game, I like the kill summary when you die. Fun game where you shoot mobs and progress with perks after every level. Cute little roguelite/tower defense game. It was fun to experiment with all the different elements, depending on if you want to burn or slow enemies, etc. Fairly simple, but can be pretty hectic!

Had a good time with it for the modest asking price. Looking forward to more from this dev, Fun roguelike that my son and I really enjoyed! A fun little game.

It works out of the box on the SteamDeck.

It has an old school vibe, or vintage gaming by it's graphics and sound effects.

Seen the low price, it would be a shame to miss it ! I'm enjoying this game a lot so far. It has a nice retro feel to it. The music is great. The game mechanics are easy enough to learn to hit the ground running from the start. Great game, very entertaining and fun. It is really fun to play and try different elemental combos to kill enemies. 

I would recommend to give this game a try.

name: Mage
short_description: Dungeon exploring Wizard action! Learn spells, defeat bosses and escape the evil in this 2D metroidvania.
reviews:
I really enjoyed my experience with Mage, it's a fun little Metroidvania with nice little challenges to keep you engaged. I especially liked the last boss, which worked very well with the games mechanics. Mage is a fun little platformer which is great to play when you have a little bit of time to spare. The game feels simple to understand yet has a complex level layout which is extremely well thought out, similar to Metroid. The levels require you to go back and forth to discover secrets you may have missed, as well as to access new areas you could not before. This sense of exploration and adventure felt very rewarding, especially as your character becomes stronger. The bosses were also fun little fights to break up all of the exploring, and some of them had a surprising challenge to them.

Overall I definitely recommend Mage, it's unique, short, and has a lot to offer if you're looking for a small platformer game with a few unique mechanics and some funny commentary! Short and easy metroidvania that's surprisingly good! This is a good old-schooled game, if you want to experience old-schooled indie game this one is very good start Funny and cute game. The dialogue is well written and funny, puzzles are engaging and the story is interesting.
 great little game! Fun challenges and unique boss fights! :)

name: Ninja in Training
short_description: Becoming a Ninja usually takes years of practice and concentration. Thankfully, there's an easier way to become a pro! Practice hitting targets with shuriken in this casual Ninja Training game. You‚Äôll be a master in no time!
reviews: As someone who's very much into ninjas and VR games, I had high hopes. Unfortunately, this game is absolutely riddled with bugs and it's not worth playing. This game is extremely inconsistent with its shuriken physics, but the main issue is the  hand tracking is always broken. Move to a level, and suddenly all shuriken are flying backwards and you can't fix it. There's a reason it's so cheap, and that's because the developer knows how awful it is and hopes people won't refund a one dollar game. It's not worth the 75 cents I paid for it. DO NOT BUY!

name: Microcosmum: survival of cells - Campaign "Mutations"
genres: Action, Casual, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy
short_description: Additional campaign of 50 levels with new game content.
reviews:
Campaign Mutations cant be completed. Starting LVL 16 everything is frozen. I would HIGHLY recommend this game. Super relaxing ambient game. Not entirely sure what to call it as a genre, point and click strategy arcade? One of the only times I got all DLCs and finished them wishing for more. Hopefully they make a Microcosmum 2 or something like it. Nice addition to the game.

But the AI seem to have some problems with the modified organisms.
The ones who have more armor sometimes are too armored to be conquered by the AI at the first try. Awesome :)
Waiting for more!

name: My Boss' Wife is My Ex ~Reluctantly Drowning in Sex Deals After Hours~
short_description: My old girlfriend. The woman who had once dumped me, had of all things, become the president's wife at the place I worked at. An erotic visual novel from Appetite!
reviews: This story might turn out just the way you'd expect, and that's reaffirming in this uncertain world. Abuse the bosses wife, who happens to be an old girlfriend you thought about marrying before she told you to get lost, Ah, but  not before you made a sex video of the two of you shaking the paint off the walls. Now, she's married to the boss and she's also the Accounting Manager at your company, very tight with the T&E budget. With the old video in hand, it's payback time. Using good old fashion extortion she's forced to not only be your sex toy but a toy for your business clients to make sure you close your deals. How far can you go with this?  Final advice: "Don't use the internal phone line." Additional recommended reading: Company Handbook for Employees, How to Write an Effective Resume, The Ins and Outs of the Japanese Legal System.

name: Inversion Institute
short_description: A visual novel/puzzle game set in a medieval fantasy world. Using "Magic Ink," you will draw working logical gizmos and contraptions to solve problems for the Institute and surrounding townsfolk. With the help of other characters, you may even invent a machine that will change the world forever.
reviews: This is a really neat idea. The art is good, the music fits, and the gameplay is interesting.  Overall, a big thumbs-up.  I can't wait to see more.

name: Easy Red 2: Stalingrad
short_description: The Volga River is not lost yet! Come on comrades! With Easy Red 2: Stalingrad you will expand the front to the East for the first time, in the heart of the Soviet Union with new weapons, vehicles, uniforms and missions!
reviews:
Welcome to Stalingrad: where the buildings are rubble, the snow is made of sadness, and every hallway is a death trap.

Spawned in a basement. No idea how I got there.
Climbed three floors, got sniped by a man who blended into a wall like a Soviet chameleon.

Heard my squad shouting in Russian. Turned around ‚Äî they were gone.
Later found them in a closet, having a panic attack. One of them shot me in the leg "by accident." I believed him. I shouldn't have.

Threw a grenade through a window. Forgot it was barred. It bounced back.
I achieved peace.

Gun sounds? BANG
Explosions? BOOM
My brain? ???

Stalingrad isn‚Äôt a mission. It‚Äôs a lifestyle.

10/10 ‚Äî cold, loud, terrifying. Just like my ex‚Äôs apartment. Awesome DLC! love the russian guns R02 vibes with better Ai Really great DLC especially with the recent rework. Completed this DLC on soviet side. Was really happy with it. Meatgrinder in urban maps and some tank mayhem on open maps (although some open field maps were a bit boring). Really liked using katyusha and kv2. Urban fights really had cod2 and cod1 vibes. I‚Äôve never had more fun in an FPS than defending myself on the streets of Stalingrad. Countless waves run through the street toward me and what is left of my small fire team. All the guns firing creates a cacophony like no other in an FPS. As the smoke clears it is only me and a sole rifle man.  Not one step back! Best DLC of the collection good. hope that there would be more eastern front battles Buy it.

name: Fly Simulator
short_description: You work as a waiter and lead an uphill battle for their clients. You pushing back the flies from the food, otherwise you'll never get anything. Maybe you are a hungry insect trying to increase their population? Choose the opposing side. The war is already underway.
reviews:
bad game epic Fly Simulator ‚Äì A Swarm of Disappointment ü¶üüí•

Fly Simulator had me excited at first, thinking it would be a quirky and fun twist on simulation games. Instead, it feels like a chaotic mess with no real purpose or direction. The premise of fighting off flies as a waiter might sound interesting, but it quickly becomes tedious. You‚Äôre stuck swatting away the same relentless bugs over and over, with no real strategy or variety to keep things fresh. ü™∞

The controls are clunky, the gameplay lacks depth, and honestly, it feels more like a half-baked mobile game than anything worthy of your time. The whole "insect war" idea is lost in a swarm of frustration. If you're looking for a fun and engaging simulator, this one definitely misses the mark.

Created with <3 this game changed my entire outlook on life and is a masterpiece everyone should play it made me cry, laugh and everything in between buy this NOW!!11!11 THESE F U C K I N G FLIES KEEP EATING MY GODDAMN PIZZA'S MY BOSS WILL SHOOT MY ASS IF THESE FLYING TERRORISTS DON'T STOP 


edit: if you want level 9 and 10 fly achievement you will have to unlock them with a tool you can google search 

I tried for over 4 hours to mate to reach level 9 but it is simply not possible you will get stuck at 8 

I tried even with 2 level 8s still nothing even level 10 and 8 does not work.... fly.   human.    bugs.   death.    reproduction.     pizza.    

Excellent flug simulatorn....den kan man inte tro finns.... Short fun but not everlasting! If only there was more to this like being able to be a cashier customers coming in and out and the flies would probably be able to get mutated by eating the people's crap from the toilet it was to become a little bit bigger monstrous and they'll be able to eat people and you ask the employer has to fight them with all kinds of weapons and objects going out there some ideas! name: POG 2
short_description: Cute, minimal physical puzzle.
reviews:
This is a lovely little puzzle game‚Äîpeaceful, fun, and with just the right amount of challenge. It's not frustratingly difficult, but it definitely gets your brain working, making each completed level feel rewarding.

Honestly, I'm surprised at how affordable this is, considering the polish and quality far exceed many other games at this price point. The only drawback is the short length, as you'll likely finish it in 1-2 hours, but it's a great way to spend an afternoon.

If you're on the fence, I highly recommend giving it a shot‚Äînot just for the enjoyable experience, but also to support talented indie developers! POG 2 - cute, minimal physical puzzle. The player's goal - to keep the star-block on the star-platform for few seconds in order to pass the level.

In POG 2:
- 50 levels
- Minimalistic art
- Achievements
- Relax music

name: The Master Club
short_description: Play: - Air Hockey - Archery - Basketball - Bowling - Checkers - Chess - Football Table - Mini Golf - Pool Billiard - Rubiks Cube 2x2 - Rubiks Cube 3x3 - Solitaire - Table Tennis - Tennis - Tic Tac Toe On 5 different scenarios: - Day Outdoor - Night Outdoor - Hotel - Room - Bar
reviews: A cool game that interested me the other day. At this point in time, one of the best time killers. The game has a large number of minigames and places to play.I will especially note my favorite game in life, billiards, not being able to go to a billiard club because of quarantine, I can play it here. The game is definitely 10/10 Hi, guys! Its simple VR game with good visual objects. The Master Club - is a collection of the games. You can play basketball, try to solve Rubic`s cube or bowling. Most interesting for me it is Air Hockey! I like it in real life so in VR too! It`s nice casual games. Overall, the game has potential and is not a bad game for $5. The Master club is a collection of 9 games that, while temperamental, can be pretty fun if you're just playing casually and not seriously. There is just one thing as of now that I would add though if you plan to keep developing this game, which are: 1) a pointer that points to your cursor in the menus because it can get a little hard to see where the cursor is. With a little polish, this game could be really fun. 'The Master Club' is a collection of ten mini-games with a small number of options and environments to play them in. There is archery, pool, golf, bowling, air hockey to name just a few of them and there is even a Rubix cube for you to solve. While there is nothing here that stands out all the games work (just about) and you can find some enjoyment here, especially the air hockey. Sure, it lacks multiplayer support and any sort of spit and polish, but I feel with this game you get a small amount of fun for a small price and that is OK. Just don't go into this expecting anything special. If I could give this a neutral rating I would have, but it seemed a little harsh to give it the thumbs down given the small asking price.

name: Temporal Shift
short_description: The Arkona are on the attack. With every move they make they change the world; Devouring history as they go. Only the Brandt Foundation can stop them but not everything is as it seems to be. A darkness has come over Dr.Brandt and the world now seems to dance to his tune.
reviews:
this game dose not work... LOOKS LIKE THE DEVS TOOK THE MONEY AND RAN!!! DON'T BUY!!!

Developer took the money and ran. Developer asked for input to game on 7/23/15 and has not since replied in the forum or to the emails I have sent. Game still crashes, mouse works sometimes, graphics freak out on some levels. Game is not playable. They have another game that looks like a clone of this one called Defenders of Time. At least the option to buy it has been removed from it.

name: Prison Simulator Soundtrack
short_description: This soundtrack will take you back into the world of Prison Simulator. The soundtrack contains 19 tracks that you can hear in Prison Simulator.
reviews: cool music but expensive for only 30 min of content !

name: Marlene Betwixt
short_description: Marlene is a tense and immersive psychological horror story in which you star as the protagonist Ewan Brody. Ewan is on his way to visit his estranged sister at her remote cottage after hearing the news that his Niece Marlene has gone missing or possibly something worse. . .
reviews:
2/10 Pretty Rubbish quality
No option to use locomotion so movement is utterly rubbish, you just teleport around like an idiot, which really breaks immersion. Graphics are good. Clipping and object interaction is all over the place. This doesn't feel like a thing I should have paid for. If someone told me it was the work of a teenager, spending his free time on his computer putting a game together as the early efforts to start a career in game development, then I could at least respect his ambition.

But in the context of a fledgling VR market with genuinely good quality titles thin on the ground, I can't review this game except as the serious gamer I am.

This game is appalling. The plot is completely detached from the game, literally the plot could be anything and it would still "fit" this extremely basic piece of work. The game world is sparse, graphics are basic, game mechanics are basic, any logic to the puzzles is basic to non-existent.

 This will be a vague, scratchy review. I had played through this many months ago, and beat the episode, but it has been some time since then, and when I made the video, the game seemed slightly updated, but it glitched, and I could not complete it or show you the cool scene. That's more or less is the gist of my review. This game is a decent experience, maybe even a bit spooky, but the choreography is bad, and the game is a big buggy, so you might get frustrated and lose the vibe, or worse: have to restart it because something screwed up and you lost the key through the floor. The puzzle-age isn't that great either. It's basically pixel hunting. Look inside the vase in the office scene, and behind the blank prior to that in the shed scene. [i]It equally sucks to have to quit the game to find the spoilers because they hide stuff to make you use up your 2 hour refund window.[/i] The item you need is prolly in the corner, which isn't really a puzzle. Well worth the price, for sure. A gem if on sale or in a bundle. [spoiler]Overall, it compares well to Trespass Episode 1, which is another similar and buggy experience, but here, you are not being ripped off. There is no lady in this VR game though, just these giant eyeballs.[/spoiler][list][*][quote]
				Àêp4g_loveÀêÀêserpentÀêÀêserpentÀê‚†Ä‚†ÄÀêserpentÀêÀêserpentÀê‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†ÄÀêOutland_LightÀêÀêOutland_LightÀê‚†Ä‚†ÄÀêOutland_LightÀêÀêOutland_LightÀêÀêp4g_loveÀê

It's like a demo for VR that's really in love with picking up books and soda cans. The play is one pixel-hunt after another, and your reward for finding the pixel is a jump scare. The story is a cliche, the sounds and music are very primitive (free downloads, I think) and objects, including critical objects, can clip through floors and walls and get stuck.

Have you ever wanted to try and find the marble in the oatmeal, while dodgeballs rain down on your head? This game has that experience, for some reason.

An hour of gameplay, if you can plow through the frustration.

Play for free or maybe for a dollar, if you have literally nothing else to do. Definitely not worth $7. Very well done. Had a few jump scares and the atmosphere left me unsettled. I'm very curious about the next few installments and I'm looking forward to playing them

That being said...Don't play this game when you are at home alone, at night and with most of the lights off. Especially don't play this game if your husband comes home unexpectedly and thinks the best way to get your attention is to lightly touch your shoulder.  When you didn't hear him come home because you had headphones in.

I'm pretty sure he didn't scare me to death but I'm not positive yet. Great experience, very creepy. Works well with the Oculus. Looking forward to the next act! Do not buy this game. Way too buggy. Can't get past the first house, because items keep disappearing or i can't pick them up. Must move them with other stuff and sometimes FINALLY i am able to pick the required item up again. I'm sure a lot of time went into creating this game, but unfortunately I simply can't recommend it. It can be buggy sometimes and the puzzles are just meh..not to mention the way it looks. Marlene is a VR horror experience you have to try if you are into these kind of games. You know ;) the ones that give you goosebumps and make you feel like there is someone behind you D:

Im not a man of many words so if you want to see for yourself if this game is something for you, check out my VOD of it below. But yeah, a thumbs up from me here, looking forward to new episodes of this, hopefully coming soon.

Oh and the way I managed to get a certain item in this game has now been fixed ;D so good luck finding out the way to get it ;)

https://www.twitch.tv/brewsleetv/v/101487742 I have played this several times but only get stuck in the first building. Very frustrating with no obvious way to advance in the game. No sense of what the game is about and what I am trying to accomplish. This is frustarting and just get stuck in a couple of rooms with no way out. That is nad enough but again no flow here just a couple of spooky dudes and scence. They do not make anysense - is there a story? is there a game? is this a 5 minute walk around to get stuck in a building?

Only drawback is the use of red, I wish I could change colours for anyone who is RGB colour blind! Amazing ruleset! Great automation and tons of free extra content already available in the Forge.

name: Clicker: Glad Valakas
short_description: This game is about one of the most extraordinary streamers Runet, it is a clicker in which you have to stay by Glad Valakas.
reviews:
wtf is this trash? Clicker: Glad Valakas is a very poorly made clicker/number incrementer game with just a few little upgrade paths.  The game is just a joke game to lambast a popular streamer and has zero merit as an actual PC game for PC gamers, it's just shovelware polluting Steam.  There's also some achievement spam going on, but the achievements are all in Russian.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The artwork here is terrible, it's a blend of old retro pixel "art" used as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics, and some of the most amateurish MS-Paint style drawings (I won't deign to call these "illustrations").  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget to arrange someone who can do graphics properly, or lack of talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result of these decisions.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The game features mostly static, barely animated 2D images, the kind of thing you expect to see in browser/flash games.  While the artwork itself, while mediocre, might be considered passable, the visual presentation here is negligible, it might as well be a slideshow or a Youtube video.  Pac-Man, Space Invaders and Asteroids had more advanced animation and visuals going on than this game does.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Clicker: Glad Valakas is relatively cheap at $2 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

[b]Note:[/b] Valve have marked this game as "Profile Features Limited" at the time of this review.  This is usually caused by poor sales figures for the game (to date).  Until this status changes, this game will not count towards your Game Collector counts, achievements or any other Steam meta-accomplishments, nor can it be displayed in some profile showcases.  If these factors are important to you, it may be worth holding off before buying this game.

[b]Note:[/b] Because this is more of a "joke" game, intended to draw attention from controversy or in the hopes of going viral because it's "so bad it's good" (but it isn't good at all), there's nothing here to offer to serious gamers.  As usual, with most awful/joke games, all the comedians come out of the woodwork.  The vast majority of the reviews for this game are joke reviews, such as "this game cured my cancer, saved my marriage, changed my life" etc.  Because most of the reviews are as insincere as the game itself is, the positive review score for this game should be disregarded. This game is about one of the most extraordinary streamers Runet, it is a clicker in which you have to stay by Glad Valakas. You have to earn DP for which you can improve rooms, voice accompaniment, as well as increase the production of DP. Good luck!

Features:
- Clicker
- Steam achievements
- Nice graphic
- This game was created using Clickteam Fusion 2.5
- Cheat mode : Y I was confused and wondered wtf was happening, the entire time, but kept "playing" because achievements.... no idea wtf is happening Basically had no clue what I was supposed to do. I think I bought this game on sale for a really low price.
Completed it for the achievements, I like to complete games. Thanks for the [spoiler] press y [/spoiler] 'cheat' helped me with the tedious task of the last two missing achievements.

No translations, no subtitles. no clue what the game was about.

[b]would not recommend[/b], maybe only to get a new 100%'d game and achievements but there's easier and mostly more fun ways to get those. What is "Clicker: Glad Valakas"?

It's a mindless stupid clicker game. You click on the rolling face on the bottom to gain money, or on the activities when there is a green head above them. You use the money to upgrade "main" (increases your money gain from head clicking), upgrade the activities (seems to do absolutely nothing except possibly unlocking other sounds for the activities, so it just wastes money). Eventually you want to upgrade three rooms you have, and while you upgrade, click on every new thing once to get achievements.

Since the upgrades are expensive, you just click for hours, have no real motivation, and eventually learn that you can just cheat by pressing "Y", but that would feel really bad. So you just click on until you lose all motivation and write a review telling everyone what a horrible game this really is.

Do not buy! Not on a sale! Maybe get it for free, but never play, unless you want to suffer for achievements.

Recommended: No! There is almost no gameplay here. You'll just click an button for two hours in order to unlock all of the room addons, which are still graphics. The audio is annoying and contributes nothing. trash, just trash the exit button does not even work. they don't have any subtitles for English and when you hit the exit button the game starts saying things in what I  assume is Russian and there are not any English subtitles and it prevents you from leaving unless you close the tab yourself through task manager or pressing the X or the windows button to close the tab through the task bar. T.L.D.R: its trash, this is what happens when you mix bad game development with large amounts of vodka and bad decisions. ( the worst thing about this game is that you waste money on this dumpster fire)
