name: Shopping Center Tycoon
short_description: Shopping Center Tycoon Is : Market Simulation & Tycoon and Improve your market. Grow, Design and Manage your Shopping Center with the right Strategy.
reviews:
[h1]I can't recommend this game.[/h1]

It feels more like a concept than an actual game. I grasp the gameplay, if you can even call it that, but there's really nothing to do in the game other than stock shelves.
The art style is cute, though. I built my dream small & cute market. Graphics and Aesthetics are very nice. Quite varied in terms of achievements, replayable. This game is simple but addicting. Highly recommend if you need a good time waster. No employees, graphics are terrible, no zoom, no option to adjust speed. You have to spam click to restock everyday. It's good, a little slow cus you need to constantly watch and open the store to get money. But otherwise it reminds me of an idle store game, but every minute or so you need to open the store to continue. Another chill and fun game like the developer's other games. You should try and enjoy it. A cute and chill game. I enjoy building my little shop to sell various products. Decorations are also really cute and overall this game has a relaxing vibe. Great for relaxing after a long day. Cute graphics, easy gameplay. Chill game for hard times.... A fun tycoon game with sweet graphics that took me in with its atmosphere from the minute I started the game. I completed all achievements with great pleasure. It is a very fun market game, I can decorate my market as I want and sell the products I want. If I want, I can sell only fruits and vegetables, if I want, I can sell electronic goods, if I want, I can sell rings and earrings. I really enjoyed making money from trading and growing my market. The music and graphics are so cute.

name: Obscene Mansion
short_description: Obscene Mansion is an erotic detective story with elements of adventure. Reveal the secrets of the mansion and put the souls of the harlots to rest.
reviews:
Love the mansion but I could have used more things hidden around. Love the scenes but they are way too short and there's no scene gallery. Love the Idea and the gameplay but it's kind of half a game, everything that's there is finished but there needed to be more with the plot if you're gonna have it tease so much story stuff and a second phase of stuff to do in the mansion would have been nice. Still great though.

Runs in VR with UEVR like a champ. [h1]I... have no words for this one...[/h1]

It's just too absurd, even for my standard. It got potential to become something more if the developer are willing to make some adjustment. The premise of exorcising ghost through H is a bit uncommon as of now, but it works with these kind of game genre. But it just fall a bit short on the gameplay element. Here's a few things I suggest the developer implement:

[list]
[*] Implement randomizer for crystal spawn. You can make a few fixed spawn points dotted around the map and maybe put the game object inside an array so when a randomizer function pick a location from to spawn the crystal, it will be random. That way, the player will have to look the crystal every new playthrough.
[*] Give a few more scares that are not just sounds of troubled breathing. A few jumpscares here and there wouldn't hurt as long as it's not overused. I like one of the instances where you open the door and see one of the ghost just standing there. You can use that to your advantage and maybe put a few more of those around. Maybe it's looking at the player from afar, or maybe when the player turn their head the ghost are standing behind them
[*] Implement better textures. The textures for the male character is just horrible. from thigh down it looks like he is wearing stockings. A few of the ghosts faces also need a better texture overall.
[*] (Optional) Implement timer to pressure the player to move faster. The game is like a walk in the park without anything at stake. Make it so when exorcising the ghost the timer stop so the player can enjoy the scene but also pressuring the player to move quickly afterwards.
[*] There's already a gallery feature in the game, so why now scene viewer so the player can rewatch the scenes of their exorcism.
[/list]

Overall there's something unique here, but it's too undercook for my taste.

[b]5/10[/b] Run around with clunky controls, watch the most awkward, worst done H-Animations, be done with the game in 20 mins.

This really shouldnt be on steam. This game i pretty good. Its not very long and the scenes are pretty okay. The graphics and animations are ok as well. Sadly sometimes a litlle buggy but nothing game breaking. Its ok to buy for the full price. I wasnt really a fan of the phone call achievment. Its ok to buy Sounded interesting but the game is full of gamebreaking bugs,i had to start over like 3 times because of them and there was no save function either.
Got stuck near a wall in a bathroom that i couldnt move away from anymore,after drinking the bottle in the cellar and talking with one of the npc,s,the dialogue,,broke''and on the first attempt i was just sent back to the mansion despite me clicking on something different.
Sometimes the camera just bugs out and shows you a really odd angle but the most annoying bug of all,was when i cleared the game(or so i thought)and right before showing me the ending i was shown a empty bed and my character was somehow stuck....in front of it,on the floor,couldnt move,couldnt do anything,and there was no context as for why im even there or what happened.

Big no from my side. System: MSI-GE76 Raider 11UH
OS: Windows 10 22H2 Build 19045.2965

Obscene Mansion

This has to be one of the most unoptimized games I've ever played.
The strange thing about this one is I tried to set my Nvidia 3080 to cap the framerate at 60 and the game would not let me go below 120 at startup it was running at 600.

I did manage to change the scaleability settings (Not Ingame) they kept defaulting back to epic. I had to reconfigure the .ini which was annoying.

As for the game its was ok, never saw the end had to kill the game 3 times because of cpu and gpu overheating within 5 - 10 minutes even running my fans on maximum I was struggling to keep the heat down. Had no option other than to uninstall as its unlikely that it will ever see the optimization it needs. Nice short adult game. Done everything except secret achievement (something with calling phone) in 1 hour.

+
Graphics are not bad for it's price.
13 sex scenes.
Sounds and moans especially are nice.
Simple and enjoyable.
Low price.

-
Almost 0 story.
Some bugs: saw weird textures few times and if you open hint menu you won't be able to close it so you'll have to Alt+F4.
No interaction during sex, you can only move camera. This game is really boring.
At times it is more scary than exciting.
The scenes are not interesting at all. The gallery is only with the magazines without the scenes. What is the point .
Two or three replays and that's only because of the achievements, which are shorter each time.
Quite an uninteresting game. 
Always wanted to fuck ghosts [quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/9686972/]Follow "[b]First Person Exploration and Puzzle Games[/b]" for more games like this![/url][/quote]

This is... not the kind of game I normally review. I play and review almost exclusively first person exploration games. However in my obsession to play and classify them all, I'm sometimes forced to broaden my horizons.

Now let me be clear: I have no issues with sexy games. I love a good sex as much as the next guy. But it's also not what I'm looking for when reviewing this game, meaning I'm going to judge this in comparison to other first person exploration games, not other porn games. You can probably imagine how that's going to go.

The game works like this: you walk around a house looking for five crystals and five photographs. You then need to find the location of the photograph and place a crystal there, and an unskippable cutscene showing the character humping a girl will play.  After humping all five girls, you get to hump a sixth girl and the game ends.  There are the remnants of a storyline, but it's nothing worth mentioning. There are no voiceovers or puzzles.

The modeling and mapping are actually pretty good.  However the assets are identical to a number of other horror games I've played, leading me to believe they come from some asset pack on the Unreal store.  In fact, the layout of several of the rooms are exactly identical to the game Pacify, so even the rooms are probably pre-made.  I'm not against premade assets, but that level of unoriginality is a mark against the game for me.

Overall, I didn't think this game has much going for it. The gameplay is lackluster, the story is barebones, and the sex scenes aren't even appealing. You can skip this one.

name: Deadly Zone
short_description: Deadly Zone: Horror with first-person view
reviews:
YES, the truth is I don't know what to say about this game, I don't see the meaning of it, it's not because it's bad, but the truth is, there is nothing interesting in this and the truth is I was bored from the beginning, but I hope that they will soon get something or Some update that adds something entertaining, since the concept of the game is there, we just need to develop and improve it, I really hope they will soon get something to improve it because if it can become a good game, I hope and so be it. For now to wait, Keep improving the game, Greetings from Mexico The plot was shit, the map sucked balls, and the amount of rounds you need to put in a Z is retarded including head shots!!!!
p.s Make some better fucking maps already!!!! ok? It looks like am interesting game. I however cannot play it as it does not have an option for inverting the Y axis on the mouse. Although these are based on some of the assets from the same game Resilience Wave Survival
It has a baser for a good game.
At 79p or $1 its a good investment only if the developer puts a lot more work into it.
It has its bugs such as some of the functions like inspecting item and not being able to get out of the cycle or shootin undead and hits not registering.
Will recommend as hopefully the game will develop better in the future updates. The game is very early access. We all know the risks with buying early access but I have to say this might even be considered pre-alpha stage. The game has very little content as of me writing this review. The map is very small I have only came across two buildings. One being the building you see in the picture on the steam page. The other being a tower not too far from the first building.  There are no animals to hunt which per the description of the game it says ''variety of anmials'' to hunt.  In all honesty I can't say too much becuase the game lacks content.  
This is a game that you should wait until multiple updates come out before you buy. I do believe you will be upset if you spend money on it right now. 

One positive thing is it does run smooth for such an early access game. ive been playing steam games for years now. Im fully aware of the risk you take getting into an early access game, but this was just down right horrible.  
1. once you enter the game there is no way to exit the game without hitting the windows key and manually closing the game window.
2. the map is very very small with no boarder and if you fall off the map you just fall. no death, no restart. nothing, you just fall. then you have to revert to the first issue i posted. 
3. there are no animals in which to hunt for food so you can forget about that. and as i wondered the small map i saw nothing that would give you the food or water the survival part of the game demands of you.

right now i would not buy this game. with in 30 minutes i was asking for a refund. more time needs to be spent on this game development before i would ever suggest buying it, even at the 8.99 i paid for it. do not waste your money on this. the idea sounds good but they are far from a game that could be enjoyable, even in early release.

name: Tempopo
short_description: A psychedelic soundscape in the sky. Puzzle through the seasons by conducting chaotic Tempopo to rescue musical flowers. Design and populate your melodic garden, then let the music play!
reviews:
A nice puzzle game that looks daunting at first, but is honestly very inviting and intuitive. You'll find mechanics click very quickly only for the game to really ramp it up at the end. Don't worry though, there are hints to help you navigate even the most challenging puzzles out there!

Check it out, it's a pleasant and fun time :) recommending this because I like WitchBeam but with a very big caveat: this is strictly a game for kids, or for someone dipping their toes into puzzle games. because the solutions are extremely pre-canned, you aren't really solving puzzles so much as you're just doing trial-and-error runs until you've used the pre-set amount of items in the right location. you can set stuff down in the wrong place, but mistakes are immediately obvious and you can't use the wrong amount of items, because each level gives you exactly the amount for the exact solution they intend. i don't mind a puzzle game with exacting solutions, but i do mind there's no real way to mess things up because it makes the game incredibly simple and easy. There are plenty of things to like about Tempopo. The soundtrack is amazing and had me bouncing in my seat through every level. The developer states in the discussion forum that it's a game for all ages, but thematically, it's clearly aimed at kids: from the cartoon protagonist Hannah to her cutesy dancing friends. That's fine; it's obvious from the trailers that's what you're getting. Graphics are vibrant and smooth.

My disappointment is with the puzzles themselves. I love puzzle games and the thrill that comes with reasoning through a solution. The problem in Tempopo is that progression comes through too much trial-and-error. There's so much chaos in a condensed space, you really can't predict movement ahead of time so each solution comes down to placing your commands almost at random and seeing how much farther you get. Creature movement also seems random at times. ("Why did they turn right and not left?") I cleared levels, but half the time it felt like luck.

Tempopo has a lot in common with HUMANITY. But in my opinion, the latter does a better job of setting up a series of clear obstacles and rewarding logical planning to arrive at a solution. Success feels earned.

I can certainly see the appeal of Tempopo for some players, especially younger ones. It's just not my kind of puzzle game. Extremely good game. Tempopo is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Programming_game]programming game[/url], a subgenre of puzzle games. You have inputs (the pink Tempopo); you have to "alter their state" (grab flowers); and then you have to direct the Tempopo to the output square.

But, true to the game's (user-defined) Psychedelic tag, this carries much nicer and wackier vibes than more straightforward programming games. The music is also exceptional, and it's pretty easy to zone out while thinking about a tricky puzzle in the later sections.

The large amount of extra content. Tempopo's sandbox music editor (the Melody Garden) has *tons* of room for creative expression -- it's also a relatively early unlock. The various additional challenges are really cool, too: there are the official challenges from the devs in at least two forms, but (IMO) players can create/share their own unique challenges. Tempopo is a fun and challenging puzzle game by Witch Beam! I've been a huge fan of Witch Beam's previous two games (Assault Android Cactus and Unpacking) so when I've played the Tempopo demo back in PAX 2022,  I was hooked into it! After a few years of waiting... I can confirmed that it is worth the wait!

The game is like Lemmings mixed with Chu Chu Rocket as you place tiles/instructions on one of the 120 islands to guide your Tempopo whilst collecting the flowers that the protagonist (Hana) lost because she played a song so bad that it formed a tornado and blew them away! There are the directional arrows, lift, block, smash and push which may not seam like a lot but the possibilities are endless! There are moments that really had my head scratching, thankfully there is a hint system which tells you if you've an instruction you've placed is in the right spot.

I love the music theme in this game and the music itself is great as well! Hana is a conductor who lead the Tempopo who hop in sync of the music and the flowers they collect are also based on a music instrument which is rad! I love the cute art style as well!

It has a lot of puzzles spanning across 60 Islands for the main game and an additional 60 after completing the 60th Island totalling to 120! 

I highly recommend you to check it out! Delightful puzzle game, a real brain bender. The hints are nice for when you get really stuck, but it is very satisfying to figure things out. Puzzles are brilliantly designed, many of them give you red herrings for how you think you ought to solve them, but then when you discover the real solution, it's a real lightbulb moment. This is a really nice puzzle game! There's a lot of depth to how things can play out, but the clarity and appeal of the visuals and audio really makes things wonderful to pull off! The difficulty options also make it great for gamers of all skill levels. Solid puzzle game, but not surprised coming from devs who actually care about making things work properly. The first half is a bit straight forward and kind of easy, but the back half throws in some more challenges and a few noodle scratchers. Don't forget though, this isn't the most hardcore puzzle game in the world, but that's okay, it's still a lot of fun. 

Only criticism I have is that some of the music isn't really to my taste, but that's completely subjective. It's still produced well and does exactly what it says on the tin. There's a lot to dig into if you want one of the weirdest DAWs ever, which is nice, but not something I spent any time with. Oh, and the gamepad controls are a bit lacking in places - I personally hate using analog sticks to control an on-screen cursor, but the game works fine with a mouse... use ye a mouse.

For my money, it's worth it for the main 60 puzzles, which were enjoyable and challenging enough. Plus, I like how all of the solutions can be eventually nutted out with iteration alone, rather than arbitrary physics combinations that never feel purposeful. At least I know that i struggled because of my own dumb brain, and succeeded with the same dumb brain.

Poilished and well put together - exactly what I was expecting from this developer. I'm rotating multiple lemmings in my mind to the most lovely tune.

This runs great on Steamdeck! At time of writing, it has not been verified. A neat little indie gem that is absolutely worth a playthough.

name: Skyforge: Bounty Hunter Collector's Edition
genres: Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
short_description: Let the hunt begin! This Collector‚Äôs Edition unlocks the Bounty Hunter, a powerful new AOE damage-dealing class armed to the teeth with explosive weapons, plus trick anti-grav and shield gadgets. You'll also receive an exclusive Costume, Legendary Weapon, and a host of useful items:
reviews:
This class makes no difference to the game.

All they have for this is images because the gameplay for it is EXTREMELY SLOW Starting out and after farming your skills feels very lack luster later.

Your focus for this class is crit dmg. Because you HAVE TO DO MAJOR DMG with EVERY HIT since you seriously shoot slowly. Main attack has 20m range. Every skill seems to have a global cooldown. You left and right click have the same attack speed... as well as most of you others moves.

What they should have done is give you a reason to play it. Make it part of the story like the attempted to do with fire starter. But this feels like the skyforge team just put all their chips on the table cause they have no where else to go.

I spent the $35...and I wish I hadn't. I was so adamant about not spending but it was that or end up seeing other people buy this thing. I had to know if it was worth it. And its not.

The Weapon you get only increase your chance at activating you devine weapon. Its a weapon drop you can get from doing Pvp and losing. It increase your dmg output by a large amount... but even with that weapon I struggled to complete fights in game due to how slow the combat feels.

The Outfit you get from the DLC pretty much only changes the cloth on your head and cap to the dirty sand like yellow and you mask glow change to blue with a bit of yellow. Its like something you would get from completing the skill tree... only worse.

You can spend $15 and get 1 month of gameplay time on world of warcraft.. you don't even get 15 days of premium with this. Assuming premium is like 0.50 a day. That is $7.00 off the $35 price tag.

Lets say the outfight was worth about $5

The weapons was $10

That leaves $13 for Ether, Alerium, and Star of Rebrith.

Based on price tag...Honestly... you are getting a decent deal here... but at the same time you aren't because this content doesn't improve the game at all.

Story wise they new class tell you nothing new. And i feel like there are better options for combat be it close or long range. It doesn't feel nessesary.

Don't get this. I can not support this content any more then i already have. It didn't feel worth it. I am still very sad I got it... and even sadder this game seems like it won't ever be fun for me again.

name: Mutiny Island
short_description: Live like a pirate. Die like a pirate. Repeat! Mutiny Island is an open-world style pirate-themed game with light survival and RPG mechanics. Explore the Arbor Ocean at your own pace as you devise a plan to reclaim your ship, The Red Dawn, by any means!
reviews:
If the year was 1983, and this was a nintendo game, it would be good. Probably made in RPG maker modded for an ARPG. It's a good accomplishment, but the Action parts are not smooth. Not going to recommend this to others. I put in my refund request. Kudos to the team, I hope their next game is on a smoother engine. I found the start of the game quite hard yet fair. Though I have died countless times I am finding new ways to tackle each challenge and having a great sense of accomplishment in over coming them.
Graphics and game play overall suit this fun loving adventure yet I am looking forward to seeing what people can do with mods. The controls have been fine once left my keyboard and picked up a controller.
Overall this is a wonderful and fun game. I'm looking forward to sinking in a lot more time and taking The Red Dawn for myself.     
 This game could be so much better. I have warped to grey screen death countless times. I camped while being attacked by a skeleton, woke up on Davy Jones' ship surrounded by the undead, and glitched to the starting warp. Jumped through many stone walls diagonally, and fought tigers from vantage point because of it. In my short time with this piece i have seen so many classic mishaps that that in itself is making me appreciate it more.

It's $8, buggy as hell and absolutely wonderful.
 Very clunky, unforgiving, and buggy. There seems to be a lot of detail to explore and uncover in this game, but it's just not a well-built product.

name: MotoGP‚Ñ¢15 Red Bull Rookies Cup
short_description: The Red Bull Rookies Cup is a category that accompanies the MotoGP‚Ñ¢ at 7 races during the international championship. It was set up with the aim of training younger riders, and giving the most talented an opportunity to take part in the MotoGP‚Ñ¢ championship.
reviews: Absolutely superb game. You cannot ask for anymore. Gracias. Very much a recommended game for any motogp fan to try it out.

name: Scanner Sombre Original Soundtrack
short_description: The original soundtrack to Scanner Sombre composed by Alistair Lindsay.
reviews:
The soundtrack sounds really good and fits the game so well. Best chill music i every listen to. Spooky This soundtrack goes hard AF beautifully fits the game The 'behind the scenes' commentary at the end gave me the big sad. [h1]Scanner Sombre Original Soundtrack[/h1]

Very good music even for listening alone, without a game, just in the background.
 The music is so feeling and so silly, but great for me and great for everyone, thanks for free this soundtrack Yes!  I love the music in Scanner Sombre.  Thanks for releasing the OST!

name: Doraemon Dorayaki Shop Story
short_description: A simulation game where you create a wonderful sweets shop with Doraemon
reviews:
This game is so fun and addictive, you'd like to collect everything, try everything. Enjoy it so much! A simplistic but very grind-heavy game that is backed up by the sheer force of Doraemon and all of other Fujiko-san's other works. The nostalgia value factors heavily into this game as that is one of the strongest factor in the game. If you enjoy Fujiko-san's works or know a lot about them, you will be rewarded a lot for playing this.
I would not really recommend this to players who doesn't like grindy and passive gameplay, or people who is unfamiliar of Fujiko-san's works. However, if they have, at least, the basic knowledge of Doraemon, this game may be worth looking into. dammit, I played too much This is THE best Kairosoft game ever. I would of never imagined them teaming up with Doraemon, a franchise that I followed since I was like 2. And almost 5 decades later, I find myself completely nostalgic over this release. 

I highly recommend it not just for nostalgic reasons, but for gameplay as well. mercilessly bulldozing my neighborhood in the pursuit of expanding my dorayaki dynasty <3 I was salivating and creaming while playing this game. I've never sat so still while just fucking decorating my build and making sweets. I think this really shows how autistic I am. I suggest this game This game costs three times the normal kairosoft games but you definitely get what you paid for, which is at least 3 times the content, a lot of improved QoL compared to their other games, and also probably around 25 times the grind. There are lots of things to do, many, many characters to collect, sweets to discover and decorate, tons of things to upgrades and even mini games! Will get rather tiring towards end game if you are into getting 100% but I got everything in around 20 hours or so, so it's not too bad, though it can be rather mind numbling at times, lol. I also made a basic guide of some sort for the end game grind (how to get the doraemon statue) so check that one out if you are interested. Fujiko F. Fujio fan service at its finest A game that brings back childhood memory. Roller coaster tycoon vibes. Its how you manage dorayaki business

name: Recursion Vessel
short_description: Develop combat homunculi in an ethically dubious research institute. Strategically breed and sacrifice generations of experimental beings to defeat monsters within a time limit. Seven unique endings await as you navigate the complex moral landscape of scientific advancement.
reviews:
This would be more fun if the skills did anything interesting. Also, having the exact same image for the second tier of monsters feels like a huge missed opportunity to have more cool things. It IS cheap, but has a lot of issues.

https://youtu.be/9mZWxZ9ZHsA

name: Yet Another Zombie Defense HD
short_description: Top-down zombie shooter with tower defense elements featuring up to 4 players local and online co-op. Build your base by day, defend it by night, put your skills to the test to stay alive as long as possible! Darkness is coming. How long can YOU survive?
reviews:
Eat Lazers And Flames You Undead Freaks! This little game is not too bad at all. I have enjoyed every-time I boot up the game. it goes on sale for .67cents that is dirt cheap. This game is hard but I enjoyed it! and its co-op which makes it so much more fun than most of these games. This game is simple and to the point and can be a fun game to just play with a friend for a few minutes. I give this game a 7/10. nice A very boring game, gets boring in a couple of minutes. Not much time into it but I can already feel this game for what it is. And I think it is worth the 4$ :) There are worse ways to spend a dollar, but better ways to spend your time. It looks, sounds, and plays like a game jam project.

People seem to dig this with friends, so perhaps I'll revisit this game one day. I'll update my thoughts accordingly. Only 0.49$ with this game
Not bad at least it's underrated game Fun Wow, this game is simple and fun! Lately, I haven‚Äôt been into AAA games‚Äîthey take way too much time to get fun, and most of the enjoyment is locked behind the endgame grind. This little title, though, is perfect. I can hop in, play for 15-20 minutes, and head to bed. Plus, I even made back what I spent by selling the trading cards! Honestly, it‚Äôs the first game that‚Äôs paid me back faster than my ex ever did.

name: Commander Babes
short_description: From out of an old vase emerge two Sengoku Era generals but... they're hot babes?! Our protagonist Jun finds himself responsible for helping Uesugi Kenshin and Takeda Shingen adapt to modern Japan, as well as fulfilling their (after)life-long regret of not experiencing the joy of motherhood.
reviews:
Takeda Shingen was a gay guy and Uesugi Kenshin was a sexually ambiguous dude in real life. I like the way they are depicted in this vn much better, especially Kenshin. 

The writing is not perfect by any means, so I had to mentally rewrite it as I read.

The voice actresses for Kenshin and Shingen are very pleasant to listen to.

Kenshin is my favorite. This is, without a doubt, the worst game I have ever played. I sometimes buy these Japanese visual novels for a laugh; and while the concept of this one seemed to be fun and self-aware, the fact is that whoever wrote this trash took it 100% seriously.
With story and writing being the focus of these games (besides the hot fast oozing s-x), I'll start by saying that it is without a doubt the worst writing I've ever encountered in a video game, which includes the atrocity that was Dear Esther! Characters exist solely to spout sentences that convey no individual personality at all, while these sentences only exist to connect one disgusting h-ntai scene to the next. The writing and possibly translation was clearly done with a thesaurus in one hand and the other clutching their crotch, because the use of needless synonyms and typical thesaurus-words plugged into sentences that sound like they're copied straight from Wikipedia make this game read like it was written by a 14 year old in a single lunchbreak. I was only interested in the dialogue, skipping the s-x scenes as quickly as possible; but after a while, I started skipping dialogue as well, upon learning that this game truly has *nothing* interesting to offer me.
Meanwhile, the h-ntai scenes are all loathsome trash, all with the same despicable concept behind them: the thought that the ultimate wish of every woman is motherhood, and that they all have the same impregnation fantasy. This creepy, borderline fascist thought is the driving force behind what begrudgingly passes for a story: boring dialogue, copy-paste lewdness, boring dialogue, copy-paste lewdness, over, and over, and over again.
Finally, there's the sound. Even if you were trying to get your rocks of to this, the sound effects are just so gross and moist that they would be very distracting indeed, accompanied by the awful music, which consists of annoying, bleepy 30-second jingles that loop constantly, so that I found myself reaching for a podcast after only 20 minutes.

Commander Babes is a truly staggeringly awful game, with unlikable characters, messy dialogue, disgusting sound, and downright evil premise. If you simply must play one of these games, there are better ones out there (Try Ladykiller In A Bind; it's great!). Otherwise, go play Mass Effect, and then watch some free internet p-rn.

FINAL SCORE: 0/10 first game played from Cherry Kiss Games and gotta say i had fun with it though got a little bored at the end because it felt like it was just draggin' on that point. overall i enjoy their games and hope they keep goin' so as for this game: cool chicks, an interesting premise, and decent amount of content... just, i understand why the games are like this but: why can't they be fully uncensored!? The game meshes pretty well and voice actors are super good at this, I really recommend this due to the voice acting alone. The art is beautiful, plus lots of achievements, scenes and the plot is so funny I can't lmao..
The dialogues of this game are so amusing, you must see them.

Plot: 10/10
Characters: 10/10.
Art: 10/10.
Sounds: 10/10

Overall: 10/10
Is this score biased? Yes, this game was so funny that I can't judge it without being biased.
Still great though, you won't regret it.

Also I swear to god I heard that voice somewhere before in anime or sth. 
Still can't figure out from which anime, if you know, please tell me in the comments. Short H VN. Censored scenes with a decent story attached. Can be skipped. Should take less then an hour to complete if you are strictly reading everything. art is not good as other Unlike other reviewers for this game, I am not an erudite scholar who normally reads classic masterpieces, so I thought the story was clever and extremely well done for this genre. The battle towards the end of the story was especially strong emotionally. I don‚Äôt recall having a game of this type elicit such emotion and tension.

Regarding the pacing in the story, some other Cherry Kiss games drag the H scenes out to the point of monotony, so it was pleasing to see that they reigned things in a bit with Commander Babes, although they are still quite lengthy.

The English was pretty good and I also recall three or four places where they mixed up Kenshin‚Äôs and Shingen‚Äôs names, which could happen in any language. Maybe even the original script was not completely proofed.

Graphics are good, although they do the ‚Äúcell phone‚Äù treatment to the CGs to stretch them from 4:3 to 16:9. I do wish they didn‚Äôt have mosaic censorship, but that is in reality only a minor complaint with this game. Most of the mosaic censorship was blotting out are the protagonists ‚Äúweapon,‚Äù so it is not that bad, all things considered. 

Overall, I consider this a strong entry in the genre. Recommended. This game for those who want to F-word Japanese warlords of the past. it's shit Despite having multiple problems I recommend this game mainly to those who seek hentai games and those who are passionate about history.

My favorite part is probably about the characters due to the contrasting personalities of both heroines. The main character however does not seem interesting or great who has problems to decide, driven only by his instincts which might lead to emotional traumas.

The story about two Sengoku generals who appear in modern times (and as women no less) is interesting and entertaining especially when their personalities are clashing with the changes they perceive. This is however not well enough exploited and we are stuck with lacking context and not enough time between the +18 scenes for which the story seems to have been sacrificed. Furthermore the story could have been more interesting if we could choose only one girl (which has been hinted in the game) but instead the main character is unable to proceed this and chooses for a polygamy. The game could have used the choice so that the main character reflects why polygamy is not a good ending and why such relations are harmful such as Ernest Hemingway has explored in his Garden of Eden novel. Sure, at the end they might look happy but it makes one wonder if they will keep this bliss in the future or if he has doomed them all. The corrupted nature of polygamy is instead left to be studied by the gamers/readers but I am affraid that their concern lies somewhere else, which is rather evident.

My review is a positive one but there is one point that has made me hesitating whether I should not rather write it off as a negative one. This point is the experimentation with the female identity which has been very badly explored. Instead of this we receive misogynistic comments from both the heroines and the main character. It is understandable that the heroines are from a women-unfriendly era and are thus accustomed of such views but the main character does not stress enough that women have as much potential as men (but that the current society is still trying to repulse). This has clashed with my expectations that sword-wielding women would prove to be a sign of equality in this game and instead it has been the first cause of misogynism. Furthermore it is much too simple and ridiculous that women can only attain happiness by becoming mothers and submissive to their partners which has been brought forth in a too direct and simple way in this visual novel. 

So I come to the conclusion that this visual novel has very badly exploited its themes but due to the originality of the concept I do recommend it to experience it once but not to be reread.

name: Sorcery! Part 4
short_description: An epic adventure through an open world of monsters, traps and magic. Infiltrate the Fortress of Sorcerers, and create your own unique story where every decision you make is remembered, no matter how small. Cheat death, uncover ancient mysteries, and recover the Crown of Kings - if you can.
reviews:
I cant help but say this shit sucks. An excellent conclusion to an amazing series! The devs ended the series out on a hard note. The first and second game served as an introduction to the genre, the third game showed the players how the devs had mastered it, and this one is for the player to show the game how they've mastered it. The most important change to this game is that halfway through they remove the rewind mechanic a lot of players have depended on for a while. Some are bitter, and may call this cheap. Believe what you want about it, but the game WILL be hard, and WILL require you to restart the run a couple of times if you mess up somewhere. Getting the best ending possible will take plenty of effort. Buy this game expecting it to be a jarring change in difficulty, because it will be. I've enjoyed the entire series (which I started years ago and just finished part 4 today). I enjoyed the previous versions but this is the worst one. It's easy to get stuck, backtracking is often impossible, resources impossible to get at times. But the most frustrating thing is the designers decision to prevent backtracking making the game and unpleasant trial and error that kills all enthusiasm and interest. Pity really. ZAP just an awful ending to a fun story , their was 0 need to over complicate things. sending players back and hour because they are not allowed to save is not fun You cant rewind in this installment, and for A LOT OF PPL, it makes it impossible to play. I havnt even played it because of that, which is kind of stupid since i played the other three books to its fullest (found the best possible outcomes).

Please dont support this franchise (and the ego developers from INKLE) Fantastic series of games. Thanks Jerma. Now I can finish watching all his playthroughs as well. What a lovely chap The rewind mechanic saved you from a LOT of BS and tedium in previous games. Getting rid of it makes the game an absolute slog.
To get the best ending, you have to spend some time in a permadeath-esque state, where you can either rewind to the point where you went into this state and lose your chance at the best ending, or start completely over. If enough of the aforementioned BS happens between starting permadeath and the final stretch of the game, you have to start the game over. That stretch of time between CAN be fairly short, but there are a lot of potential combat encounters and other opportunities to die even if you make a beeline.
I really liked the last 3 games, but it's honestly kind of impressive how removing a single mechanic makes the game so irritating to play.

name: LOGistICAL - The Netherlands
short_description: LOGistICAL expands into Europe starting with the Netherlands Over 650 new towns to complete. Netherlands like what you have been doing down under and would like to use your services. We are overloaded with a national icon and need it distributed badly.
reviews:
This addon is better than the original game. The gameplay is the same, but the size and tuning of the country removes a big part of the boring parts from the original game:
[list]
[*] the country is not too big
[*] lots of towns everywhere
[*] no big empty places where you waste time zooming/scrolling
[*] no huge roads taking too long to build or too long to drive on
[*] the beginning provides some challenge (understand in which order things need to be unlocked)
[*] the size of industries does not exceed 4 or 6, so it doesn't take forever to upgrade
[*] the number of cities (600+) is more balanced with the amount of goods (100+). In Australia there were too many towns (or not enough goods)
[/list]

name: EARTH DEFENSE FORCE 5 - Air Raider Weapon: Singing and Dancing Pure Decoy Launcher Set of 8
short_description: A set of 8 types of special Decoy Launchers for Air Raiders. The device launches a balloon that blows up into a human shape, acting as a decoy to draw the enemy's attention.

they sing now They stick to people....

Just that information however you will. -PUT DIS ON FREEBIKE 
-ROAMING AROUND BATTLEFIELD WITHOUT HELPING YOUR TEAMMATE 
-PROFIT Absolutely worth it. Actually, buying the game for just this alone is already worth it. I haven't even launched the game since buying this dlc and writing this. Already worth my money.
EDF!
EDF!
EDF! A huge step up from 4.1. Effort was put into this DLC where the girls will hum their tunes, make small talk, or break into their musical routine, and the enemies will hunt them down instead of murdering you. Doesn't have Anju, but will save your life when trying to run from swarms. Be creative where you place them, just not on other player's backs or it might prevent them from killing stuff. Oops.
Best used directly on massive enemies to ruin their AI. I don't need weapons when I have singing dancing waifus. ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) Eru is bae.

The rest are ok. Yes.
Yes....
Just Yes. good songs, better than ranger's dlc decoys
