genres: Sexual Content, Nudity, Violent, Gore, Action, Casual, Indie
short_description: This DLC contains Age of Barbarians the Heavy Metal song and the Cover Art for the single.
reviews: As far as I can tell, yes the only way to view this specific content is on the splash page of Arena: an Age of Barbarians Story. Will re-edit my most once further information is provided. Maybe I'm stupid, but am I able to listen to this song anywhere, or is it just within the game? Aaawww yeah! Because we're living in the age of barbarians! That song is so badass, it kinda makes up for part of the game.

name: Watch Dogs : Legion - Season Pass
short_description: The Season Pass includes one major expansion with two episodes, extra missions, four iconic heroes and more!
reviews:
You four charater, 1 Aiden from Watch Dogs 1, 2 Wrench from Watch dogs 2 and 2 orginal ones, I dont know one of them but the other is crossover with assasin creed, you also get the bloodline dlc some decsec skins and the piece of resistances, Watch Dogs 1 with all dlc and shit, overall pretty good It's good if you want more characters to play, they're all have unique ability, and their clothes can be wear by other character. blood line keeps on crashing wtf! How can I use the assassin in story mode? low effort shit DLC that isn't worth its money Basicially 4 characters Aiden Pierce, Wrench, Assassin blood related to Jacob and Evie Frye, and a women with super powers.
Aiden Pierce: Unigue weapons with a reload ability that makes the weapon do more dmg, and slow mo ability that can only be activate if you are holding a gun and execute someone, and at the same time holding the aim button to slow time and shoot somebody. He also can deactivate all near devices like drones.
Wrench:Custom cargo drone that shoots non lethal bombs. Has unigue weapons like a grenade launcher and an assault rifle that can taser enemies, both non lethal. Also has a hammer named "Lady Smasher" that can be used to melee and have an ability to deactivate all nearby devices. Also has stun bombs.
Assassin Women: Has hidden blade that instant kills depending on the situation but also has an eagle drone that is stealthy and explodes when you want. Has hidden gun that shoots poison darts or bullets. Also includes a mission to unlock her.
Superpower Women: Can control enemies minds and use an ability to damage nearby enemies. Use takedowns to reset cooldowns to these abilities.

Also includes Watchdogs 1 Complete with all DLC's.
 just dont Terrible gaem If you don't own Watch Dogs 1, buy the gold edition when on sale instead. It'll be cheaper that way. You'll get WD3 + the Season Pass, and WD1 and all its DLCs. This has such bad value they literally had to include Watch Dogs 1 into it.

name: Oatmeal
short_description: A game about oatmeal
reviews:
Most infuriating 2 hours of my life (in a positive way). 1 of those hours was spent on the 100% of just the three stupid levels of World 8, so if you don't have that kind of patience you're in the wrong game. Oatmeal i love it i suck horribly Completed level 8 which was a bitch, skill issue to those that couldn't do it oatmeal oatmeal perfect oatmeal Surely eating a bowl of porridge can't be that hard, right?
Edit: It was hard to eat the porridge :( but I 100% the game!

name: Travelers in Space Crack
short_description: Travelers in Space Crack is a survive game in deep space. Explore in different galaxy through space cracks. To find and gather useful resource, to trade and make money are all important to develop your own fleets. And only through build massive fleets, you triumph over the unknown evil forces.
reviews:
good game but god it crashes SOO OFTEN!! i have to save so much to prevent losses, altogether i probably lost about 2.5 hours of play time to crashing Owned this game over a month now and haven't been able to play it. Apparently it only works on 1080p monitors and mine's a 1440p monitor. So, the buttons don't line up where they're supposed to. I've tried to work with the dev to resolve the issue but a month later it's not solved and I'm past the refund point now. The half hour I've spent in the game has just been searching for where I'm supposed to click to hit the buttons and sending screenshots to the dev, who appears to have given up on my issue and moved on.

Edit: It's been almost 2 months now. Still no fix for my issue. Also, the dev has responded to every negative comment except this one and hasn't replied to my discussion post in over a month. Seems like they want to just pretend my issue doesn't exist. I've also tested it on my second monitor, which is only 780p and it still has the same issue. The devs excuse for not being able to fix the issue was that they didn't have a 1440p monitor to test it on. Tutorial, UI and gfx gave me cancer I can't recommend this game, even at sale price.  It looks interesting, but my experience amounted to trying to figure out why the tutorial didn't present any actual information for a bit, thinking I was accidentally closing it somehow, then giving up on it and just starting to try to figure it out on my own and upgrade things for a while.  

The tutorial planet allowed me to interact with it, but there were two others I could see but not interact with.  I figured out I had to do planet upgrades to build more buildings.

The trade system makes no sense to me and seems to consist of a sailing ship landing on my planet and not being willing / able to buy resources I have in stock.

The UI offers no feedback or explanation beyond an error tone when you try to input commands that aren't allowed such as trying to conduct trades.  There are some explanatory windows on upgrades that explain roughly what things do, but it was all out of context and I had no real idea of what I was trying to accomplish except trying to progress toward something interesting happening which sadly I didn't encounter.  Eventually I unlocked a planet management building which essentially played the game for me and started building things I didn't find in my own exploration.

I played it for about half an hour and nothing really happened.  I am assuming at some point there will be some sort of enemy invasion, but I didn't have the patience to wait around for it to happen.

If this game were in early access, I'd probably be more willing to give it time, but as this is being presented as a finished game, I have to give it a negative because this is far too lacking in polish to be released in my opinion. Screenshots look interesting but tutorial is no bueno. Got as far as it explaining how to speed up time, then the instructions of what to do just stop?

Tried to play a game but without a tutorial it isn't intuitive, so refunded.

Also, somehow managed to get 46% of the achievements in 20 mins even although I had no idea what I was doing. a good game, interesting, and its old plus - you can create your own planet and play according to your own story, price -10/10, graphics - 8/10, plot - 10/10.
I advise everyone to play this game. The game draws you in from the first minutes, it's very interesting to explore all the planets and mechanics of the game. In addition, very beautiful graphics and drawing of planets. I recommend it to all lovers of economic strategies and space. Beautiful space and planet. Finally, the huge fleet defeated the BOSS.
The resource and factory speed can be adjusted a little faster.
Good game. Learning to survive in space. Travel in space. Explore different meteorites. You can build different types of buildings on your base. It's definitely worth playing. I love space. And I love strategy. Yes, and I am positive about simulators. And if you put everything together, it doesn't always work out well.
But in this case, we can say that it does not fail. Of course, it's a long way from the game of the year, but if the brother is counting that it's indie. That is very appropriate.
Pretty well shoved different chips from different games. There is of course a bit too much, in some moments, but everything is more or less harmonious.
The price does not bite, because it is a sin not to support young developers.

name: Valkyria Chronicles 4 - The Two Valkyria
short_description: This cataclysmic reunion of the two Valkyria will determine Crymaria's fate.
reviews:
This was quite the fun DLC! 

The story of it is you can play as either of the Valkyrias in a battle against the other one. You have to play as either side to fully unlock and finish the story and can take some getting used to. Especially as they appear as classes you already known (Selvaria being a Scout and Crymaria being a Grenadier) but after you get to see their amazing power for yourself, blowing tanks apart and groups of soldiers with little-to-no effort, you then get granted them as playable units!

Yes, you can have Selvaria and Crymaria the Valkyria as units (using up two command points instead of one, just like the story you play them in) and even the two girls that served under Belgar. Nikola and Chiara along with two copies of their crossbows which are single-shot but deal more damage than even the highest researched rifle. They'll turn any mission into a cake-walk. Especially Selvaria who not only takes very little damage from enemy attacks, but has a potential where she just fully restores her hitpoints anyway, making her a Goddess on the battlefield! For fun I even tested them out and found that Walz's black tank couldn't even stand up to two of her beam blasts, not even aiming at the radiator! That's how OP these units are! So they're certainly a lot of fun. Especially if you just wanted to finish a mission quickly and were pissed off with it. I don't blame anyone for taking advantage of the girls here.

Speaking of taking advantage, to add to this when you unlock them as playable units, you also gain some very sexy clothing for them all. Almost as a reference back to the beach DLC. For both the Valkyrias and the two that served Belgar as his lapdogs.

So this DLC was certainly quite fun, if short and a little cheaty, but it is still fun and ultimately you are the one to decide if you want to bring them in on a mission or not. This is post-game content. Another Extra Story with a two missions, and a bunch of character unlocks.

[spoiler]The two missions have you play as the comically overpowered Selvaria and Crymaria during a duel from two perspectives. You also get to use an Imperial Squad and a X-O squad to support them, but they do not really have any flavour. After finishing the Extra Story you get the two Valkyria along with Belgar's two agents added to Squad-E for use in any other mission - along with swimsuits for all of them.[/spoiler] ‚†Ä Fine map, okey story, great characters to use on the missions.
Also, it is kinda funny that faceless soldiers have names but in the Minerva's Squad Stories they don't even have names. Buy one and you get 2 waifu who will win the battle for you . 10/10 i will sacrifice half of my platoon for bikini again 965284 The characters it adds are so OP it makes getting A ranks across the board almost trivial should you decide to use them.  You get two Dunkles on top of the two permanently equipped on Nikola and Chiara which are great scout rifles. The units you get from this are ridiculously OP and the extra missions are kinda meh. They laughably try to balance the units by making them use 2 CP instead of one (like tanks in VC1), but just having them stand there is already OP as they take damage like nobody's business and shoot at anything wandering by. You can also tell the enemy AI have no idea how to deal with them, usually shooting them first like theyre random units standing in the middle of nowhere. Honestly, making them not able to take cover probably makes them more powerful because then maybe the enemy would aim for a less defended unit if they were crouched. And the CP cost would need to be something like 4 rather than 2 to even begin to balance.

Basically, this is cheat mode for 5 bucks. On console, I could maybe get behind that. But on PC? Just go download a trainer from MrAntiFun if you want to cheat. Nice to finally be on the other end of the magic ragnite steamroll everything stick....

name: FAIRY TAIL: Very Difficult Requests Set
short_description: A set that adds special requests that are more difficult than those in the main game.
reviews: Not worth to buy at all. It's an okay DLC if you get it alongside with the Season Pass, but not worth to buy seperate.

name: 3D Hardcore Cube 2
short_description: 3D Hardcore Cube 2 - is a continuation of a fascinating game about clever cube that moves through dangerous obstacles to the portal. In the new part of the game was implemented completely new physics control character. Were added sounds to improve the atmosphere of the game.
reviews:
5/10 This game test your skills & reaction to the very end. 30 Levels get harder and harder at level 25 you get really hardcore trouble but if you know how to manage it is possible to do. Good for mid skilled achievement hunters
 Garbage part 2 There is a bit of up and down in difficulty, and has some issues with controls in different parts, but overall a quick, fun game. 6/10 This second part has actually made improvements. The levels are now challenging and achievable, increasing it from 12 levels to 30. It also doesn't have unnecessary 1000+ achievements. About one hour of playtime to unlock all of the achievements in this one. I would still suggest to buy this only when it's on sale. This game was a lot better than the first, however there are still some levels where you cannot complete the level if your graphics is wrong. Other than that this game was quite easy and can be completed within 1 hour. This game thoroughly tests your skills and reaction time. With 30 increasingly challenging levels, you'll face hardcore trouble by level 25. However, with effective management, it's possible to overcome. Ideal for achievement hunters with intermediate skills. 3D Hardcore Cube 2 likes to incorporate all the levels from the first one into this game for a total of thirty levels.  After painfully restarting multiple times; my death counter closed in around five hundred.  There are a few levels that require precise jumping and timing to pass the level.  Overall this one is better because you can change the color of the white cubes in the background.  The physics are a bit more different in this game when moving, but the same bugs and glitches can be encountered.  Rate 7/10 based on difficulty, length and improvement of physics which slightly altered the RNG (random number generator) which still caused a bunch of unnecessary deaths.  The achievements in this game can be unlocked in one play through for 100% completion. "New physics" as related to the previous version of this title means "we made parabolic jump faster".
Apart from that, this is exactly the same bugged game. Getting stuck on a flat surface or getting thrown into a terrain cube (need to force-restart to unstuck) happens so often.
This game is hard, because you have to challenge bugs, as well as physics and logic that are totally different not only from reality, but a common gaming sense.

name: The Elder Goddess
short_description: "The Elder Goddess" is an open-world RPG game that contains adult content. You will play as the newly revived goddess Aphrodite, exploring the world and regions, defeating enemies, solving various puzzles, and earning rewards from treasure chests.
reviews:
The game may look amateuristic, but it's really a lot of fun. I had a great time playing it.

Pity that the dev didn't exploit the open world aspect some more; we tend to get only a single quest at once, most of the time. Hopefully, there'll be more side-quests in later versions.

One thing I like a lot about this game is that it's not one of them regular fuckfest games, which there are only too many of already; this game has an actual story and objective. It's a bit difficult to master, especially when facing many enemies, what bugs me it's the art and the language change fails to update during certain character conversations, has potential but need some more work to be worth it, I'll have to go with a 2/5. Art is kinda bad, clipping issues when 'interacting'. Some weird cell shading that gets annoying, and the character walks to the left of where you point to go so it gets disorientating over time. Takes a long time to go anywhere as well, thus the 'empty' of the map.

name: Soul Drifter
short_description: Soar into a gravity-defying parkour adventure. Run, jump, and glide through surreal landscapes and deadly factories on a mission to liberate captive souls.
reviews:
I am now scared of red glowing things and had a blast 10/10 lowest fov in the fps platformer history. vsync doesnt work so the fps goes up to 3000, which probably super great if you want coilwhine in your gpu. heavily scripted jumps. boring unreal tournament 3 visuals. little timmy's first udk game.

my favourite is the hands that glow with thousand suns, and they just make the picture vibrate. there should be a disclaimer about this in the intro section, or the glow should be lowered.

also not sure why does the mouse have filtering on, locks onto stuff randomly, and changes to 2x value during sprint.

cannot change binds? in 2025? dude this isnt a free jam game, you are asking real money for this.

someone should have tested the game before release. i think im gonna refund this.
 Good game but needs a few pieces to make it perfect. Beautiful visuals and great gameplay other than the below things to be honest. 

1. Needs a sprint toggle, my pinky hurt from this.
2. Add a prompt to the journals to close them. I had to slam my keyboard to find the button because it did not say "press ___ to close"

Honestly my only MAIN gripe is #1 it is frustrating to have to hold sprint for a platformer like this. yes, yes, very good Very good game! 

Graphics 8/10
Music 8/10
Gameplay and Level Design 9/10

It's a challenging first person platformer that gets progressively harder, but it's a joy to play because the controls are very good and it's satisfying to complete the hard parts. The game plays very well with a PS4 controller, I think I played 90% of the game with the controller, and 10% with mouse/KB (There are some very hard parts you need precision through laser tunnels and it's next to impossible trying to do it with the controller).

 I beat the game in 9 hours, I would gladly play much more! I hope for a Soul Drifter 2.

A couple of observations:

-I wished the devs worked a bit more on the lore, there are some datalogs you find in your path, but very few so the game doesn't have much of a story, and some of the logs had the exact same entry so that was a bit sloppy. 

-The ending is quite bad, you just enter a room and pull a lever, the screen goes all black and there are some explosions noises and the game ends. not a good ending for such a great game, I hope the devs work on that and update the game with a better ending

-ACHIEVEMENTS! The game does not have achievements, so there is no replay value. I don't see myself coming back to it if there is no new challenges to overcome. The game reaches a really nice flow state, feels really good when you figure out a section. souldrifter is a fun game with a unique world that lets you slide into the flow of playing thanks to the meditative and relaxed music and the beautiful world. A first person jump and run (and glide) game.
I like that the environment looks like it is underwater but is not underwater in the same time. 
The Sound is also nice.

The jump and run parts are not to hard and not to easy. 
I died a reasonable amount of times in each passage i think :D
Have not finished it yet thoo.

Nice little game.

What bad things can i say?
Well sometimes there was yellow text shown in front of a yellow background that made it a little hard to read but thats a very minor issue. Awesome game, really enjoying it so far. Very atmospheric design. Loved the mix between the magical landscapes and abandoned industrial areas. It's giving you an eerie feeling, which is also nicely supported by the stories around this beautiful worldbuilding. Good balance between casual platforming areas and some that are a little more of a challenge, but always managable without getting too frustrating. Great game. If you're into platformers don't miss out on this! Wonderful plattformer in a beautiful but strange world. Very nice level design and art. You'll definitely have fun with it and get into a good flow. This game makes addictive  #gowiththeflow

name: Casino Slot Machines - Arcade Casino
short_description: Casino Slot Machines - Arcade Casino This pack contains 8 new icons + new theme Enjoy the nice graphics and make big win!
reviews: Don't... Just don't.

name: Lighthouse of Guiding Flames
short_description: Ethani lost her way and ended up at the Lighthouse. Where did she come from and where should she go? Explore this fantasy Visual Novel to reveal her past and set sail once more...
reviews:
The art and music are really pretty but the way the story works (kinetic novel into visual novel) isn't a lot of fun and you'll spend an hour waiting to play the actual game. This was a fantastic game! It was so wholesome and I would play it again! It had a nice story and was exciting, too. [h1]Review with accompanying screenshots and videos in Sinical Network[/h1]
https://www.sinicalanimenetwork.com/post/lighthouse-of-guiding-flames-quick-thoughts

[i]Lighthouse of guiding flames[/i] is a fantasy visual novel with mystery and horror elements. It features the female protagonist Ethani who, over the course of 12 days, tells her story where she is chosen as a human sacrifice to appease a vengeful god in her remote village, goes to a lighthouse run by the keeper Astaban, meets a few people, and moves on in her life (or afterlife).

The story starts off slow at first as it recounts Ethani's story backwards from day 12 to 1. Then it gets better in the second part where her story is told from day 1 to day 12, and the player gets to choose various dialogue options leading to several different endings. I like the part where each choice towards a specific route has a special colour to help players reach that ending (yellow for run away, orange for fight, and red for accept fate). There also is a compass icon that will show the player's inclination towards a particular route and ending. And finally there is a published community guide to help players get all endings and achievements. In terms of artwork, it has a variety of nice, cute, and spooky CGs. The background music is good and appropriate for most of the scenes. I especially like [i]Timeless shore, Endless minute[/i], and [i]Guiding flame[/i] for the fantasy themes, as well as [i]I'll save you[/i] during the good endings as they feel rewarding.

There are a few cons though. I have come across a number of spelling errors during my playthrough in which some of them completely change the meaning, which detracts from the experience, although some of the patch note announcements have reported that the developer and translators are fixing them. In addition, none of the endings truly feel satisfying in the sense that there is no perfect ending. The hardest ending and achievement [i]Persistence Lights the Way[/i] can be difficult to figure out without referring to the guide, and it feels more disappointing than satisfying after attempting multiple playthroughs of the game.

Lastly, I purchased the soundtrack DLC on Steam but was disappointed to receive a blank folder and Steam music player wouldn't play any of the BGM. Hopefully, the developer can address this major fault sometime in the future.

After spending around 3 hours to get all endings and achievements, [i]Lighthouse of guiding flames[/i] is an interesting supernatural visual novel with plenty of background music and artwork at a reasonable price, although with a few faults. Therefore, I can recommend this game when it is at a discount to be more proportional to the playing time, or when the English translation is improved. With that being said, I do not recommend buying the soundtrack DLC on Steam until this major fault is addressed.

[h1]Recent updates[/h1]
The developer has patched the game on July 2022 and June 2024 to improve the English subtitles and make the soundtracks available again to those who purchased the soundtrack DLC on Steam.

[h1]For more reviews, join the groups and consider following the curator lists for Visual novel, JRPG, Anime and Life Needs a Little Sin[/h1]

https://steamcommunity.com/groups/vnislife

https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Sinical A surprisingly interesting little VN that offered something I don't typically get from VNs this size. A good, unique story that doesn't overstay its welcome. Only downside is this VN could REALLY use a copyeditor - the writing overall is good and competent, but there are tons of syntax errors ('and' is 'abd', 'a lot' becomes 'al ot', etc) that a copyeditor would catch. Doesn't hinder the story, but does take a layer of polish away from an otherwise hidden gem! I've been wanting to buy this game for a long one, and I honestly should've done that sooner. Despite a high number of spelling and grammatical errors, I can't complain about anything else. An interesting tale with an unconventional narrative, it can easily pull you into the disparaging situation that the main character faces. An enjoyable visual novel about a girl trying to do what's right versus what's expected of her. The characters are pleasing to look at, the chibi CGs are cute and there are plenty of great CGs as well. Definitely make sure to read it forwards after reading it backwards to fill in a lot of holes.

Beware that there are a lot of typos here. If I had to guess on average, there are 1-2 per 10-15 screens. It's not enough to really distract you from the story, but it is quite annoying to see just how many there are. This game was a nice surprise. With lower budget Indie Visual Novels, you never really know what to expect. Lighthouse is a charming title, with lovely music, some wonderful artwork and a compelling narrative. This should only take you about 5 or 6 hours to complete, but I left feeling completely satisfied.

The characters are delightful and there are some fun and silly scenes, but also a darker plot that slowly comes to light, as well as multiple endings that are all pretty in depth. The world feels deeper than I‚Äôd expect from a short title like this, and I think there‚Äôs plenty of material left for a sequel.

The first time you play the game, you actually go through the story in reverse, one day at a time, starting on Day 12, and then 11, etc. This is an unusual and memorable way to begin the narrative, but it works, and when you reach the end‚Ä¶. Or the beginning in this case, you can then play the game in the proper order. Now you‚Äôre able to make choices, see more detailed renditions of events, and send the story in different directions.

The main problem I had with this release is the grammar. The writing is actually very good, it flows well and the characters are interesting. But there are tons and tons of spelling and grammatical errors. I don‚Äôt know if there were time constraints, but it definitely felt like someone was in a hurry at some point during the localization process. But to me, the other aspects of the game more than make up for it.  
 Young Ethani finds herself washed up on unfamiliar shore. There is a Lighthouse, a beacon for those who have lost their way, its Keeper tells her. What happened to Ethani? And will she find her way after leaving this mystical place?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8HSI6B-SoDk

[h1]I liked...[/h1]
[list]
[*] The concept (the story is first told backwards as a kinetic novel, and then from the beginning, where the player can try and reach a better outcome‚ÄîI really enjoyed that)
[*] The choices (Ethani has some tough decisions to make, which keep the story interesting; also the game overall is easy to navigate, since you can see in which direction each choice leads)
[*] The characters
[*] The art and music[/list]

[h1]I didn't care for...[/h1]
[list]
[*] The tonal shifts (at times, the game drops into chibi comedic scenes or grimdark tragic teritorry, with little subtlety)
[*] The leaps of logic (a few plot points just don't feel very realistic, in my opinion)[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
The melancholic [i]Lighthouse of Guiding Flames[/i] is not the perfect visual novel, but it's an interesting one. The story can take you in very different directions depending on what choices you make, and some flaws of the plot do not take away from the message or overall experience. Recommended.

[i]For more EVN reviews, feel free to look at my curator page: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34616763-Azar-Reviews/]Azar Reviews[/url].[/i] This review contain some spoilers. Because it hard to told about game without spoil it main feature. 
In short this a dark fairytale about family, responsibility, homicide, religious conscience of different culture and a lot of tasty tea.

A bit longer:

Story itself is pretty simple. But the strongest part of this game is how it is told. After you will think about how this game ending is short and edgy, story will really start and turn the tables about your perception of characters. Not about Asteban, tho. He is the only constant in this world along with his magic Lighthouse.

You should definitely try it.

[quote]Your heart is shakin'
Your body's breakin'
but keep on going, going
no chance of stoppin'
Their eyes are watchin'
so keep on goin' goin'

We're at the point of no return.[/quote] There are a fair few endings, some of them are quite depressing. I like the system to tell you what ending you're heading towards. It was very useful. 

It was quite cute overall, even with the cursed sections. There was a good amount of variety in poses as well.

name: ZaBaTa!
short_description: ZaBaTa! is an online multiplayer game where you must find human players hidden among AI NPCs. Blend in, complete missions, and most importantly - don't get caught! Play ZaBaTa! with friends for even more fun.
reviews: Cannot connect to servers Fun game no doubt

name: Northgard
short_description: Northgard is a critically acclaimed strategy game based on Norse mythology. Lead your clan, uncover the secrets of a mysterious newfound continent and defeat your enemies to conquer the Throne!
reviews:
I tied to like this game, really, it has so much potential. But balance is awful! normal difficulty is boring, high is way to high and turn to waste of time. And if thats not enough, draconids clan runs on me on second winter, on normal difficulty, with imbalance broken units that stats are twice high of any i can get. Frustrating balance Sigma.. but please fix net code in Bifrost This game used to be pretty well balanced and fun to play, recent updates have made PvE basically unplayable.  Do not recommend wasting your time playing this game. . I bought the game on april 2024 sale and was able to play 1 multiplayer match, afterwards my country (Russia) was banned. DO NOT SALE YOUR GAME TO RUSSIANS IF YOU HATE THEM! I would recommend this game to everyone, especially if your name starts with J and ends with S.
The different clans add a lot of variety to the gameplay, as well as the different modes.

5/5, would play again. I have been playing strategy/building/resource management games for 40+ years and I cannot, in good faith, recommend Northgard to anyone who enjoys the genre. 
Loading the story mode I was met by a subtitled narrative and a list of instructions written in 4 point font impossible to read even on my giant monitors. I could not change the font size nor skip the introductory story. 
The first instruction I received was to click the build button but where was the build button? There wasn't one. I tried to move my villagers as an experiment in controlling the game and even that sucked. 
6 minutes into the game, I have exhausted my patience and am ready for something else. Its not a bad game but i do believe its trailers are misleading... its more of a lane style game very fixed on things you can do compared other RTS games. ... This is probably my favorite city/base builder of all time!

name: SW4-II - BGM Set 2
short_description: New music tracks will become available to play during battles. Those tracks have been arranged especially for this title.
reviews: 3/5 DLC

name: RPG World - Epic Mounts
short_description: Travel around RPG World games in style, Epic Mounts brings you 6 high-quality imaginative horses.
reviews: I gotta say that I love these mounts. If you are looking forward to varying mounts in your RPG projects I really recommend it. Each mount fits in whatever universe you plan to create (ice, fire, steampunk, etc.).

name: Dragon Age II DLC Bundle
short_description: Claim three expansions (The Exiled Prince, Legacy, & Mark of the Assassin), exclusive armor sets, unique weapons and more in your fight for the fate of Kirkwall.
reviews:
My favourite would be the Legacy DLC because it connects to the Inquisition storyline. Also, using mods will be able to bring along both of Hawke's siblings (Carver and Bethany, [spoiler]if you use mod that made the two of them survive Lothering[/spoiler]) to really know what happened with their father.

Mark of Assassin is decent. But would be good with Humorous Hawke. 

Had to downvote because of EA faulty game launcher. help! I have the DLC installed in my main menu, however, I don't know how to access it in-game 22232 where's My DLC????
 The DLC bundle is certainly a welcomed addition to DA2. More high quality voice acting and a great expansion to the lore. The DLC by itself is fun and I love it but accessing it is very unintuitive but the fault here lies with EA, not BioWare or Steam. Check the other reviews how to access it by logging with your EA acc. ENGLISH [SOLVED] + DEUTSCH [GEL√ñST]

[PROBLEM SOLVED!]

Log in to the game with your EA account
ATTENTION, the game is programmed incorrectly, the login does not work if your password contains special characters, unfortunately you have to change your password so that it consists of normal English letters and numbers, then you can log in to the game and restart and then everything is activated.
The password can be changed on the EA website, the EA application opens the window directly in the browser in which the password can be changed.

How pathetic!
Give likes and add a symbol below to make it easier for others to read and find. We all just want to chill and play, let's save others the stress with our hints. Wishing everyone the best

---------------------

[PROBLEM GEL√ñST!]

Im Spiel mit dem EA-Konto anmelden
ACHTUNG, das Spiel ist falsch programmiert, der Login funktioniert nicht, wenn euer Passwort Sonderzeichen enth√§lt, ihr m√ºsst leider euer Passwort √§ndern, so dass es aus normalen englischen Buchstaben und Zahlen besteht, dann k√∂nnt ihr euch damit im Spiel einloggen und neu starten und dann ist auch alles aktiviert.
Das Passwort kann auf der EA-Webseite ge√§ndert werden, die EA-Anwendung √∂ffnet direkt im Browser das Fenster, in dem das Passwort ge√§ndert werden kann.

Wie armselig!
Gib Likes und f√ºge unten ein Symbol ein, damit es f√ºr andere leichter zu lesen und zu finden ist. Wir wollen doch alle nur chillen und spielen, ersparen wir den anderen den Stress mit unseren Hinweisen. W√ºnsche allen nur das Beste DA2 has a fair bit of content to add to the game to make it better, Legacy and the Exiled Prince alone are two fantastic additions, Legacy adding a bunch of Grey Warden stuff and lore, and introducing a very interesting villain to the series, and Exiled Prince adds an extra companion named Sebastian. He's one of my favourite characters in the game, though very much the DA2 version of Sera, a lot of people super hate him and a lot of people super like him, it's a swing!

Mark of the Assassin is.. alright. The story I thought was interesting, and it had some puzzles to work through that weren't too terrible, and you do get a fun cameo from Origins before Bioware butchered his character in Trespasser. The companion you get for the dlc though Talis is uh.. okay, I guess? I liked the idea of the character, but the execution Bioware played out with her never really hit the mark in my eyes. do NOT play mark of the assassin it is a hideous dlc. legacy is good but mark of the assassin is such a tumor on my game now that i have to leave the review as negative. Absolutely crazy that I couldn't finish Origins due to the insane crashing and I can't finish Dragon Age II with DLC content because they're unauthorized. I've tried a lot including logging into my EA account, logging out then back in, uninstalling and reinstalling the game, syncing on DA Keep, nothing worked. DAI is the only functional game, but that could be because I played on PlayStation instead of through Steam/EA. I might just have to abandon these earlier games and jump over to Veilguard which is unfortunate because I was enjoying these (DLCs broke in Act 3 and my loads became unloadable).

name: DumbBots
short_description: Create an AI for your DumbBots to help them achieve victory! Learn the basics of coding with guns, explosions, and ragdolls.
reviews:
One of the MOST FUN and entertaining programming games! 

It is ridiculusly fun and teaching U basics of coding - variables, loops, functions in a hilarious way.

The Mincraft style graphics would be appealing for the kids.

–°–∞–º–∞—è –≤–µ—Å–µ–ª–∞—è –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é, –≤ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–µ –ú–∞–π–Ω–∫—Ä–∞—Ñ—Ç–∞, –æ–±—É—á–∞—é—â–∞—è –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–º –ø–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö, —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤, —Ü–∏–∫–æ—Ä–≤ –∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–π. ded game Great game. Didn't let me down. Great game, have been waiting for its release for awhile and has exceeded my expectations, easy to learn/simple programming that results in crucial changes to how the bots handle a situation, really fun, especially good if you want to start learning programming or as a fun way to use your knowledge for the programmers out there

Conclusion: Buy it. Worth. Fun! My brain feels bigger and seems to have more folds since I started playing! If you enjoy logic puzzles you'll enjoy this. It's a perfect sandbox to be able to see [on a basic level] what goes into logic of computer-controlled characters in video games. There are simple logic blocks to start with, and advanced ones that can create a very 'intelligent' DumbBot. Have you ever had a dream where the MCP from TRON zapped you into the computer, but instead of playing games to survive you had to tell the other programs how to play the games? And you were actually Neo from The Matrix and were really good at it?

No? Just me?

Anyway, long story short, this game is literally a dream come true.

EDIT: After having played a few more hours I would like to add that the music and general atmosphere is great, and that if you like any of the other programming games on Steam you will probably like this game as well.

Rather than a puzzle game, this is a problem-solving game. There are always multiple correct solutions, even in most of the tutorial levels. But some solutions are more efficient than others. Some solutions are cooler than others. Some solutions allow you to win just in the nick of time. 

Instead of abstract visualizations, you get cool action scenes and can usually tell when your program went horribly wrong or triumphantly right. Waiting for an interpreter to step through all the cycles in a test case is fine, but watching your little dudes triumph over each challenge by doing what you told them to do is just that much more spectacular.

There is no linear "main campaign", but a large variety of levels to beat, grouped into various categories. The first level of a category is usually the easiest, but you can tackle them in any order. If you get tired of survival, try a heist. If you get tired of heists, try a deathmatch. Beat all the levels? Open up the scenario editor and make one of your own.

name: Don't Panic!
short_description: Don't Panic! a logical strategy with top view. Your goal is to kill all the people on the level by limited number of zombies.
reviews:
I fucking love games that make you lose to RNG in 80% of the cases. That got boring really fast. Don't waste your money on this. $1 is way too much. Boring and uninspired is about the best way to describe this. 0/10 This is more a puzzle game where you need to understand where the zombies would go.Even if their traiectory is to the closest human sometimes they just go to an other human which is further.I finished this game in 2 hours and [h1]I LOVE IT[/h1]!I got it for 20 cents because of an discount ticket for crafting a badge.BUT...the placement is somewhat buggy and the zombies are walking over the boosters.But with that exception 8/10! This is barely a puzzle and barely needs strategic thinking. But it's completely open. You can solve levels in many ways. More to say, you can try to solve it the same way many times and sometimes you will succeed and other time - not. Because units make a lot of random and position-based decisions. It feels like you playing cellular automata, that's what I like here. And that's the only reason to play. It is cheap as a dirt. Easy, funny, casual. So, if you like such things, you can buy it. Just wait for a sale.
But if you are not into random mechanics and self-oscillations - do not. Because:
- Units are pinpoint small and you will need to click them
- Music is inappropriate
- No zombie sounds, no any sounds. And this is a huge problem.
- It feels like completely DIY
- It is short. But you will not ask for more

So, I vote up, this is my decision. But you better avoid it. This is a waste of your money dont buy it 60 levels for 49 cents (on sale) you can't go wrong. This is a very basic game seems like a high school project, but it is fully finished and exactly what you would expect from the store page and price. Deploy a set amount of zombies to infect humans and then use some actions while they are roaming.  Took 79 minutes to beat.

name: God Monster
short_description: „ÄäGod Monster„Äã is a unique aesthetic 3d Xianxia game! The perfect combination of real-time competition and turn-based system!
reviews:
Chinese grindan MMO, the likes of which can be found everywhere. Notably, the controls in this one basically don't work, and one of the early story missions can't be completed because the last enemy falls off the map but you still have to kill them to proceed. Also the translation is gibberish, but that was probably implied in "Chinese grindan MMO."

Also there's a cash shop because of course there is. It's in RMB though so it's hilariously cheap, but the fact the game is nonworking and terrible more than makes up for this.

Not recommended for anyone. the game has potential but in its current state it needs a big patch because its buggy glitchy badly translated and misses allot of basic options it needs 
also feels abandoned since theres no support ingame

name: akeytsu Indie 2017
genres: Animation & Modeling, Design & Illustration, Education, Software Training, Video Production, Web Publishing
short_description: Disruptive, fast and easy Akeytsu provides a very simple access to create 3D animation. It offers the most intuitive and innovative character animation and rigging features for the game and Indie game creators.
reviews:
Lovely software, very simple and easy to use. The software lacks many features and the developers are not trying to release update and instead they release it as a new software. I do not recommend buying either this version or next versions  since any software from this developer has high possibility to become abandoneware in a short time. Yes, I like Akeytsu. Rigging is not that perfect, but animating is better than animating of any other software I used. There's no joking, no additional pressing, confirming and similar unnecessary elements that I don't need since I can fix my mistake with just CTRL+Z. Great job, Nukeygara, IK system is amazing! Very cool software, has its kinks and flaws but overall really good, especialy if you have never animated or rigged before. Really really like it. 
IK system is nice and easy to controll\create.
Wights painting is handy. 
Automatically creating gameready root bones.
Exporting smoothly.
-
Would be great to see:
Thickier rotation arrows!
Abylity to select two IKs dummies from two different rigs.
Separate size options for IK dummies
Morph targets support and timelined curves controller.
Simple texture manager maybe.

This is it. This application makes animating fun again and is seriously underrated. The very fact you can skip the control creation process and instead directly animating on the models is a god send. I stopped using maya or blender for animation creation and i use this exclusively for my 3d animation needs for my game projects. Its ideal for organic animations like character and creature animation creation. The only con currently is the limitation of modifying the curves of the rotations. The flexibility of modifying the graph curves for locomotion is not present in rotation. Other than that it is fantastic. Love it! Just love it!! Finally a tool focusing JUST on animating....Fresh and focused but deep enough to get serious work done! Awesome tool for animation. It is entirely focused on rigging and animating and making it as seamless as possible. I was able to speed up my production pipeline a LOT! The rigging process is very simple and effective. The same with the animation.
I think it needs some more tools for facial animations, but i was able to work it out with the current tools. Really great software with some handy autmation that makes it quicker to animate things like walk cycles. Worth 100%. Really great animation software for indie. Works with Unreal4 and Unity.

name: GameMaster: MAGUS
genres: Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy, Early Access
short_description: GameMaster: Magus is a unique RPG simulation, bringing you the ultimate role to play in RPG games: The Game Master
reviews:
Great idea and looks truly to be a solid start at development. I encountered no bugs in my short play time, I'll probably put another hour into it just out of curiosity. 

The problems are simple:

1) Lack of updates
2) Lack of explanations about what's currently in the game, how to properly structure quests, events, etc.
3) Lack of information from the dev.

It's obvious that this is a solo dev or small team and normally I'd hold off on the negative with that in mind. But I've owned it a year and there's been nothing done in that time that I can see so it's most likely a dead project. Seems like an awesome idea and seems like it was off to a solid start so I'm not sure why it hasn't improved. Time, money, health, who knows, but there isn't enough here to justify buying it at any price without some signs of life from the developer. He responded to other reviews so maybe he'll respond here. If it gets updated I'll be more than happy to review it again at that time. This review should hopefully serve to enlighten those on the fence about this game; as has been mentioned before it is hard to figure out what this game is without actually playing it. I also would point out that this review is not a hard pass, as there is limited potential, I suppose.

TL;DR: Gameplay is shallow and repetitive, with no reason to care about anything in the world. All you do is place cards to level up to unlock more cards to place, and ultimately for what purpose? The game doesn't say.

In depth review below:

As one reviewer stated, there is hardly any gameplay to speak of here; the entirety of the gameplay is as follows: You start off with a hand of cards and a small portion of the map revealed, which you can place on locations for adventurers to complete. By successfully completing said cards the adventurers will gain gold and gems for you that fill 2 bars, when these bars are filled you can click them to level up; each time you do so you get to pick 1 of 3 cards to unlock. The stragegy aspect, if you could call it that, is that once your hand is depleted you have to pay gold to draw more cards, either a full hand or one by one, thus lowering the gold bar. 

Cards range from +1 cards such as location or adventurers which allow you to summon additional adventurers or unlock additional locations on the map, monster cards for your adventurers to fight, tasks for your adventurers to do, a +time bonus to extend the timer of the cards you put down, a rarity type to change the rarity, and a class type to match it to a specific class. There are also bigger chained quests that you can place on towns, each quest has slots for the location (which can only be placed on its specific location) an event, like Pirates or the like, a class slot, and a time bonus slot. Below these slots you can place as many cards, such as challenges or monsters, as you want. There seems to be a cost associated with this, but I couldn't swear to it, and the more cards the more difficult the quest and the greater reward.

These quests also have a timer, but you activate it when you are ready to do so, as with every other quest the adventurers will either do them or they won't, and other than matching a certain class with what you put down you have no control over this whatsoever. There are also specific story quests which require specific cards to complete, you then play whatever cards don't need to be saved while gathering the cards you do need; once you have  them you assemble the quest, click the timer, and hope for the best; as before they will either do them or they won't; if they can't complete said quest (or don't bother to) and the time expires, then you get to do it all over again until they succeed. It is also worth noting on these chained quests that once a card is added to it, it CANNOT be removed, and until the quest runs its course you will never draw said cards again unless you have multiple copies. So if you accidently place a card down on one of these quests, or change your mind at any time, tough luck, although these quests can also be dismissed if you so choose.

The biggest flaw that I see is that due to the lack of interaction with the world, there is plenty of information provided about things, but no reason to care. Towns give vague information and list things such as trainable skills and the goods they have, the adventurers list character traits and attributes and weapons, but there is no reason to care in the slightest about any of that because ultimately it doesn't really mean anything. The location of where you place cards doesn't really matter, I assume it might as you unlock more of the map if you wanted to try to entice a particular character to do a particular quest for some reason, as then you'd place it close to them, but other than that it doesn't really matter.

Adventurers can be renamed, which is a nice touch, but honestly I couldn't be bothered to care about whatever their name was in the first place, let alone come up with a new one. They can also form opinions of other adventurers, which is meaningless other than just to be there. The crux of the game is this; loads of meaningless information that is just there to be there. There is no reason to care about any of it, those I suppose these small details are a nice touch as well as far as fleshing out the world.

Ultimately my time in the game ( which was all spent in the tutorial, mind you) consisted of playing cards at random, just willy nilly, and not giving two shits if the adventurers completed them or not. If I had a class modifier or a rarity modifier I used it, and if I had a location I would just pile them on the chained quest. Ultimately I had to quit because of a bug of some sort that has caused the game to crash upon reloading my save, but I was stuck anyways due to be poorly given directions; there is a quest in which all it says is "Find a way to cause your adventurers to pass your hardest quest yet", and the few times I initiated the quest after gathering the requisite cards, they largely ignored it all together, and when they did try they failed it, but I was not clear in what way they had failed; it might be their stats weren't high enough, therefore I think I needed to use some of the required cards and use them to get their stats up, and then attempt it when I thought they were ready. Not that I really felt the motivation to do that; like I said I couldn't be bothered to care if they succeeded or not, as all I would have gotten for my troubles anyways would be more cards to put down randomly to see if they did them or not. Ultimately what little gameplay there is is very repetitive; to be honest I don't have a problem with that, however, what is the point? Do I just play cards and level up endlessly until I get bored? Is there some ultimate endgame goal to strive for, or do I win once I reace a certain level, or what? The game does not expain what the ultimate point of the game is, it just says that the bigger quests tell a story, but let me tell you, english is clearly not this guys first language, so often times it is hard to make sense of what he is even saying.

There is also a sandbox mode where apparantly you play with everything already unlocked from the get go, which sounds even more pointless to me, because unlocking cards by leveling up is all there is to do in this game. Play cards to level up to unlock more cards to play to level up more, to unlock even MORE cards to play, but for what?

Given that if I were to continue to play I would have to start over again, that is a no for me, and I have since requested a refund. I would consider repurchasing this again, but NOT at full price; if you charge a premium price, I expect a premium product. This is not.

A word of advice to the developers concerning the level up bars, there needs to be better feedback than just flashing when it is time to level up; far too often I had filled the bars and didn't realize it, causing me to waste my time, unless the gold and gems you earn after that point carry over (I couldn't tell). If they don't, they should. Perhaps a non-intrusive sound effect would be nice. From the screenshots I couldn't tell what's the gameplay about, but given they wrote "Magus is a unique RPG simulation, bringing you the ultimate role to play in RPG games: The Game Master", I thought it would be similar to a Dungeon Keeper game.

However, it's barely an RPG and barely a card playing game. User interaction is limited to placing cards onto the playfield (cities and locations on the map), and that's it, literally. Then it turns into a waiting game where you look at giant men running around a huge map from location to location and "completing quests", then you get more cards to put on the playfield.. 

There is also a fog of war, even though you don't have an opponent or any reason to worry about not getting information from a region. 

In all game modes you are going to be spending time looking on a big empty map, there are no battles to be fought, no cities to explore, nothing, you control nothing, neither a unit like in a HoMM game, nor a single character, and you can't manage anything other than which card to put on the screen. 

-sidenote, AFAIK, MAGUS is played with dice, not cards, and in this version you are being told that there is a diceroll, but just as with everything else, you have no say in it, not even a dice roll animation or anything -

I can't recommend it, actually I would advise everyone to wait until the game is out of EA, because as it is now, there is barely anything in it to play with. It's also hard to look at, the art style and the presentation is dull and repetitive, it's basically a handful of assets all around a huge terrain.

But, if you love reading, there is plenty of text about cities, with generic information like how much fish they have and info on Economy, Army and whatnot (not that it's relevant, since you don't know what those mean, and there is no way you can interact with the cities other than placing cards on them).

It would be also nice to get gameplay videos from the devs because it is really really hard to know what you are getting into right now.

For those who would like to play card games, Gwent and Heartstone are out and free, for DM roleplaying, you are better off with War for the Overworld or, you know, Dungeon Keeper. Edit #1: There is a bug reporting window now, so thats a step forward.


Can't say I would reccomend this game for a good deal of reasons.

1: The tutorial doesn't explain what everything does and why you need to do it.
     - Don't even get me started on all the typos and grammar issues either.
2: You can literally get adventurers that deal no damage to monsters, thus making them unable to deal with monsters at all.
     - This means they can't kill monsters you place down whatsoever, making monster cards unuseable.
3: Quests have a habit of breaking and getting stuck on a 0 timer. 
     -  The dismiss button is nice and all but if it doesn't get rid of bugged quests that are stuck on a zero timer, there isn't much you can do but restart the game with a new save or give up on that area slot completely. Not to mention that you won't be able to use any of the cards in that bugged quest ever again in that save unless you get another copy of it. [b]This is game breaking.[/b]
4: Heroes will permanently stop moving if you don't place down quests for them constantly.
     -  This is also game breaking. If your heroes don't do quests you can't progress in the game.
5: There isn't a whole lot of flavor to this game yet. So far it is the same thing no matter what areas you unlock or where your heroes go.
     -   You unlock random cards by leveling through a sort of random lottery system> You place those cards down on the map and start the timer for them> Heroes then attempt them or ignore them if they think that it's too hard for them> Then you rinse and repeat this for the entire game. There is nothing else. It's litterally a clicker game.
6: You have to follow quest requirements to the letter in this game.
     -   If it says you need particular cards and you don't have them or roll them in the slots on level up you're screwed untill you do. This causes uneccessary grinding for cards.


Listen Devs. If you want this to be a fun game you need to do some things.

- Make progression fun and less repetitive. This can be done with a simple skill tree that always unlocks cards upon reaching a certain level. You can also allow players to upgrade the base rarity type of a card by spending gold instead of using rarity cards. Then, make those rarity cards into effect cards that chang the attributes of the cards they are attatched to. (Think auto healing a hero after an objective is completed, or giving hereos item drops.) Don't forget that combining cards to get new and/or better cards should also be an option.

- Get rid of hardline objectives and make them more freeform. There was nothing more annoying besides the bugs in this game than having to follow cookie cutter instructions about what quests I should make. This can be done by giving out quests that try to get you to achieve a resource goal for a quest instead of forcing players to use specific cards. Even just allowing players to use more cards that weren't listed on the quest requirements would be nice.

- Obviously, fix the bugs that people find! Give people a way to report them when they find them too! Not a good game... tutorial needs a lot of work. Doesn't explain things clearly enough.

name: Sweet Home Puzzle
short_description: Absolute fan or simple puzzle enthusiast? Sweet Home Puzzle will satisfy you! Choose your puzzle from more than 100 images, choose your music and play relaxed like at home.
reviews:
Awesome Jigsaw Puzzle game  ! It is exactly what i was looking for : interface is nice and simple to use. Landscapes puzzle are magnificent, soundtrack is relaxing, The system of boxes is really useful when I play with a lot of pieces and be able to customizing hotkeys is really appreciated. I also enjoy reading the description of my image puzzle. 
I usually play with 150/250 pieces but when I have more time I do the 400 pieces ... I don't know if I would be able to finish the 1500 pieces , it scares me a bit.... 
So now I just wait for the puzzle of the week and maybe some DLCs to pursue the pleasure...

name: Sniper Ghost Warrior Contracts 2 - Crossbow Carnage Weapons Pack
short_description: Strap on a new armory and surprise your enemies with the Crossbow Carnage DLC pack. With four brand-new weapons and a stealthy Zeb-bruh gun skin, enemies won‚Äôt know you‚Äôre coming until the bolt lands in their face.
reviews:
I got this mostly for the crossbow but was disappointed.
The main thing is that despite saying in stats that it does more damage than the bow, when I get a solid body shot the standard guys don't die. If the only way to consistently get silent kills with it is to use gas arrows then i should just use the bow cause it gets 10 more of each arrow. Whats the point off a crossbow so weak a bow beats it. It could be forgiven if it was a sidearm but it's a secondary weapon. From what I read in other reviews it might have been a one shot kill when first released but now it's pointless.
Crossbow Carnage, more like Crossbow Calamity. I bought the Crossbow Carnage Weapons Pack on sale.  At first I did not like using the crossbow.  However, I told myself that I would stick with it for a few region(s) play-through.  I'm glad that I did.  The Crossbow has become one of my all time favorites.  I can take out an entire squad without much effort and in short time.  Love it!  Just takes time to get use to, like anything else. Actually pretty cool weapon pack! I wish the crossbow was a bit more satisfying to use but overall its pretty fun. Sniper looks cool and the revolver is pretty sick avoid. 

sniper isn't anything special

pistol can't be suppressed so it's just a novelty

and while the crossbow is nice for the special ammo, it's extremely inconsistent in terms of its damage. even though the damage bar is maxed out, it struggles to consistently kill enemies in the torso at ~20 meters. there's also horrible trigger delay where the bolt doesn't fire until 0.2-0.3 seconds after you click your mouse. 

if you need the special ammo just buy the bow with in game cash. Crossbow is great, I've mainly used the gas bolts as another alternative to get rid of heavies early game, and the Car_K8 never leaves my side, silenced mid range AR is a definite for my play style.

The sniper is decent for a light with a nice spread of special ammo, not tried the revolver as i prefer silenced weapons, overall well worth the ¬£2.89 i paid on sale The crossbow in this DLC seems buggy. I cannot get reliable performance out of it except at point blank range. I expected to be able to get out to 100m with it using Kentucky Windage adjustments. Sadly, unlike the bow, I cannot depend on the results. The bow however is sweet and you quickly get a feel for its reach and limitations.

The 550-TRV is a nice, quick moving, .308 with a deep bass note to the suppressor. Nice addition to the light sniper rifles.

 I have not used the rest of the weapons from this pack so I cannot help you out there.

I've got mixed feelings about this DLC. Since the crossbow is the main focus of the pack I cannot recommend it. If however you want the 550 then I'd say get it. SILENT HUNTER CROSSBOW: Silent but it shoots very slow. It¬¥s ok but not the most efficient weapon.

550_TRV: A very good light sniper. Good at short range.

CAR_K8: It¬¥s very good in combination with a silencer. 

 MAD SHERIFF 9: Not the best weapon for stealth. But it looks cool. crossbow doesn't go through helmets (not tying to go off reality but damage) and rifle grabs enemy attention way better than my pistol or even my sniper guess i'm going back to the o'l silenced shotgun for stealth. Defiantly worthwhile to pick up, the Revolver is a really handy little guy while the Crossbow delivers a strong alternative to the Bow. The Assault rifle is well placed in recoil and sports a handy fast mag along with a silencer to keep you in the shadows without creating too many gaps in your armour should you get in a tough situation.

My only gripe is the Sniper. It is a nice little trinket, but doesn't really provide a strong feel to its light counterparts.
For anyone wondering, it contains Tagging, EMP, and Lure. It's an amazing Utility rifle, that's for sure. But that's as far as it can really stand. cant find crossbow dlc in game

name: Witches' Legacy: The Charleston Curse Collector's Edition
short_description: End the Charleston Curse before it wipes out an entire family and save a young girl in Witches‚Äô Legacy: The Charleston Curse!
reviews:
Variety Another 4:3 stretched to 16:9 with dismal results. It feels like the game file is inflated to over 1 Gb to appear the size of a more modern game. It sure doesn't appear in the graphics quality. And it uses a live action character amid all the animation. it always looks so tacky.  The interface has about 20% of the functionality of a modern game. Don't bother even on sale. The other games in this series are amazing, but this one sucks and isn't that great. The hidden objects blend together and overall the game lacks the fun that exist in the other ones. 5 stars Yes, this is an older game. No morphing objects, no collectibles, no fast track map (no map at all actually). That said, if you like HOGs you'll like this one! The scenes (art) are wonderfully drawn and the music is suitably creepy as you progress through the even creepier story. The HO scenes--there's a lot--are very well hidden and take careful observation. You will have to do a lot of backtracking as you earn items used to to unlock things in various rooms, but that's part of the charm imo (You can use the hint button to quickly go from room to room to where your next task is, which is very helpful). I have always appreciated these older games and this one is up near the top!.

EDIT: I am playing the next game in the series (Witches Legacy, Lair of the Witch Queen) and I can tell you it's been updated with morphing objects, puzzle pieces, a fast track map and even an imp who helps with tasks. The story continues--not nearly as creepy--following basically the same format. There are a lot more games to play in this series and I see no reason not to continue--they are entertaining at the least! The first game of Witches' Legacy series, was released in 2012. The story starts off with you discovering you are the only living family of an orphan girl named Lynn, your Charlestons family was killed off by a witch which you must save the young orphan from. The gameplay is like any classic HOG filled with multiple hidden object scenes that are recycled even if you took the item in the previous search.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2922441629

The artwork is still beautiful, although there are some live-acton cutscenes that look cheap and dated, but it is still an excellent game to play if you enjoy old HOGs. The main menu theme music is still as eerie as I remember, I love it, and enjoyed the soundtracks of the game.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2922443820

There is a bonus chapter that gives a good addition to the main story, Lynn will be the main character of the rest of the series. I wished the game has achievements or an option to download the soundtracks. The journal looked so good, it gives a good insight into the story and when you collect the pieces of paper, it will give you a clue of what you should do to some of the puzzles. Speaking of the puzzles, they were nice and some of them are unique. None of them is difficult though.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2520127687

Pros:
+Very nice soundtracks.
+Beautiful graphics.
+Creepy and very interesting story
+OK voiceovers.
+Very beautiful and helpful journal.

Cons:
-No steam achievements. 
-No fast traveling map.
-Dated-looking live-action cutscenes.

I recommend it to people who enjoy classic HOGs and don't get bored with the multiple hidden object scenes they'll encounter.

name: Rocksmith¬Æ 2014 ‚Äì Breaking Benjamin - ‚ÄúBlow Me Away (ft. Valora)‚Äù
short_description: Play "Blow Me Away (ft. Valora)" by Breaking Benjamin on any electric guitar or bass. This song includes a new Authentic Tone.
reviews:
Why on earth would they put the shitty version in the game? it is not showing up ?
 This version of the song "Blow Me Away" is what put Breaking Benjamin on hiatus and led to the eventual firing of the other band members. The original is better in every way. This is a badly mixed version that technically shouldn't even legally exist because Ben Burnley didn't release the rights to his vocals for this mix. I didn't realize that this was the Valora version until post-purchase. I don't want money back as much as I want the original song instead. I love the original version of this song as I first heard it playing Halo 2 over a decade ago as a kid. I'd never heard the Valora version and I have no idea why Rocksmith felt this version was in any way shape or form better; because it's not. Valora (if that's her name) is a shitty singer who comes in at crutial moments when a deep voice is necessary and instead replaces it with her high pitched pop-style singing. All the lyrics about anger, rage, and etc are sung by her and it's so wrong that it's almost laughable. I suggest you listen to this song before you buy it; and please Rocksmith give us the original - REAL - version of this song.

name: SCP-087: Recovered document
short_description: SCP-087: Recovered documents - first-person horror, that tells the story of a classified object.
reviews:
too long too boring add excitment Both one of the best and worst times I have had in a creepy, dark stairway. Idk its cheap and its literally what most scp 087 games are, walking down a staircase for five minutes. kinda sucks for 5 bucks, would be better if f2p honestly its not worth it. the "game" is actually well done. you will notice I put game in quotation marks. that's because this isn't a game. it's a demo, or a proof of concept. at floor 32 you encounter the face and the game ends whether your light is on or off, whether you are looking in it's direction or not. the game mechanic of having a battery for the flash light is pointless as you will reach the face long before it runs out, and that is unfortunate because it would effectively add tension to the game if this was a game. there are the beginnings of a good tension based survival horror game here. I do not recommend this game because they are charging for it and in my opinion they should not be. My god is it boring, worse than the free version from years ago. this game gives me a lot of happiness,it let know that even if i am disabled,i should be brave to go down the stairs,and also let me know what shit feels to go down the stairs ten minutes,i still hope the game is finished soon! [h1] NOT WORTH THE SPACE ON YOUR HARD DRIVE [/h1]

The game seemed interesting, so I purchased it when it was on sale.  I was dead wrong.  Played it the other night and after about 5 minutes of movie footage with miserable audio, I was graced by being allowed to walk down flights of stairs.  No Running, no jumping, just walking along very slowly.  The walking gets incredibly tedious after about 6 minutes, but just before you are about to exit the game...something happens to keep you sucked in.  You're enticed after finally seeing something that pulls you right back in, but all for naught.  

If you've read this far and would like to have the entire game described, keep reading.  [b] WARNING: SPOILERS [/b]

[spoiler]  Once you start walking down stairs and....nothing happens for about 6 minutes.  There is some incredibly uninteresting chatter between your character and someone on the other end(presumably the guy from the movie sequences) who tells you to keep going.  Eventually, you start to see a shadow of a generic person every other flight, and then you hear a baby crying off in the distance. The atmosphere is now really thick and you're all eyes and ears, just waiting for things to start to really happen.  [i] What is this shadow and why does it seem to be following me?  Why is there a baby down here, and why is it crying? [/i]  You keep going and eventually, stop caring about the shadow as it does nothing but run away whenever you get close to it. After about 16-20 minutes TOTAL GAME TIME, you are confronted with the stairs trailing off into nothing with a barely visible face staring at you from the dark.  Your character talks about it being creepy and scaring the hell out of you, then the screen goes static and your character screams.  THAT is the end of the game. [/spoiler] 

I'm sure the developer will be adding things eventually, so keep your eyes on this one in the future...the [b] far [/b] future. Right now, though, I wouldn't even wait until it goes on sale.  This is literally a 20 minute demo of what [i] could [/i] be a decent game, but you have to pay for it. This game sucks, it's not scary at all, and the shadow that's supposed to scare you is always the same. I've lost my time and my money. [h1] Boring [/h1]

It`s always the same boring game. You walk down the staircase for five minuts pass out, do it again. You don`t make any progress and it gets boring really fast...

name: Spider: Rite of the Shrouded Moon - Soundtrack
short_description: Day and Night Soundtracks for Spider: Rite of the Shrouded Moon
reviews:
I feel like this soundtrack fits the game perfectly with the ambiance and overall feel of the game. The upbeat but sometimes mysterious music sets a perfect mood for playing this game on a rainy night in game as well as in real life. Make sure to check those little bushes for crickets!

Good soundtrack I rate it 10/10! I can't really say how appropriate this music is to the game it accompanies...largely because I haven't played so much as five minutes of said game yet. But I CAN say, for such a moody-lookin' game, this sure-as-sh*t ain't a moody f*ckin' soundtrack.

   Look, it's fine. It's sufficiently melodic, very well produced, and offers a whole lotta tracks for not a lotta cash. I guess that, er, "chilled urban grooves" (taking a punt here) just ain't my cup of tea. I bought this soundtrack in the hopes that it would at least be at the cuter end of spooky, but it's nothing of the sort. 

   I'll give it a thumb-up, but only barely, and would only seriously recommend it to anyone whose musical tastes never swerve from the dead-set middle of the road.

   Verdict: 5.5/10.

(PS If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my two Curator pages: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9284586-ReviewsJustfortheHELLofit/
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10868048-Truly-Horrible-Horror-Games/?appid=398210
Cheers!) It's bomb ass

reviews:
[h1]At a Glance[/h1]
[table]
    [tr]
        [td](Adult) Content[/td]
        [td](FxM) Sexual content.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Censorship?[/td]
        [td]No. Woot! Woot![/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Hours of Gameplay[/td]
        [td]One hour.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Modding Support?[/td]
        [td]No.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Patch Available?[/td]
        [td]Instructions in full review.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[b]Fraulein Lolita~First Date With You~[/b] is a lewd card game about winning (and ultimately BANGIN') a nice lolita.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Play a hand of cards to create combos and advance a relationship meter to unlock a series of lewd cutscenes. Each card can only be played during certain events, and the results of each play are determined by a roll of one or more dice. Should you fail your roles, you will be penalized. The idea is to play your cards in such a way that you maximize the number of dice you get to roll, also making careful use of "poker chips" which allow you to play cards twice in a row. 

[h1]Story[/h1]
[i]To my understanding,[/i] the game revolves around an unnamed protagonist and a woman he met at a festival, Luo Li. She has survived a tumultuous childhood, and he hopes to find his way to her heart (and lady lips). Apparently, her idea of dating involves some sort of bizarre card game. But hey, I ain't complaining!

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The titlescreen is promising, though I couldn't read any of it (seeing how I don't read Chinese). From the options menu you can adjust audio preferences, or toggle the introductory tutorial on/off. I enjoyed the user-interface, I thought it look polished. However, the in-game visuals were a mixed bag. I wasn't fond of clashing textures; there are a combination of anime-styled images and textures and real-life photographs. The models didn't always look like they belong together, the clipping was out of hand, and the main character's face was a different color from the rest of her body.

Kind of reminds me of the [b]Skyrim[/b] "grey face bug"!

[b]- The Goods-[/b]
There are a few sex-scenes to see, which are unlocked as you fill-out the heart at the top of the screen. Each scene involves the female protagonist and a shadowy apparition (to represent the male protagonist). The female looks pretty alright, but the man is dreadful. Her genitalia does not take to his hot dog wiener very well, which causes it to become horribly disfigured. If I saw somebody with a coochie like Luo's, I'd be on the phone with the hospital! I thought the animations were serviceable, but there were some wonky hair physics.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
I can't say I recommend this game, though if you're a Chinese reader you'd certainly enjoy this game more. I found the gameplay to be tedious, and the application itself is super buggy. The protagonists and interactive objects spawn in strange areas, and there were multiple times that the female protagonist spawned in doubles. Mashing through the text boxes and animations wasn't very fun, and I would have liked to have been able to skip them; they got old fast. The randomized outcome of events meant that some of my playthroughs were wastes of time, because the game decided to give me one too many snake eyes. 

[table][tr][td][url=https://wombattrap.com/review/fraulein-lolita-first-date-with-you/]To read the full length review, click here![/url][/td][/tr][/table]
