name: Helltown
short_description: Deliver packages to the weirdly happy folk of Little Vale and discover the terrifying secrets they hide. Are you brave enough to face the many monsters and sinister locations of this first-person horror adventure game? There's only one way to find out...
reviews:
great horror game but i feel some things was missing from the itch.io like something about some dog ending I do really like this game, you can see I got 100% in it. It is a VERY short game and as much as I like it, I wouldn't say it is worth $10. I would wait for this game to go on sale.
 The changes are just enough to still get me 
 it's just ok I guess Great game with one hot Nun. Sexy demon nun really cool story and awesome atmosphere. i was able to launch a man into the stratosphere with a garbage can in the first part of the game. 10/10 Man, I was really conflicted with this one. I feel bad thumbing it down to, especially with how responsive the devs are in the discussion threads and reviews.

Props to you, and I respect your effort.

The below will sound very nit-picky but is meant for the devs since they seem they care

----

Summary of my Experience that led to the thumbs down:

I beat the Revival and got ending 1, if I hadn't got this ending, I probably would have been a happy camper, thumbed up the game and moved on. Instead I got extremely annoyed for 2 major reasons.
- At no point did it feel like I was entering the "Final Area", which checkpoint locks you, meaning i would have to go through 70% of the game again to get back to the non-linear part to get other endings. (I didn't look them up afterwards but I did look up the one I was going for which was ending 5, and the game kinda misdirected me, saying go into the cabin when the ritual starts, the only that started was stairs extended to a new area, which I thought would lead back out, hence annoyance)
- I'm really over this whole alternate ending thing some games have. Because if you get the subpar ending, your whole experience feels immediately cheapened and wasted. Ending 1 is that ending. It's abrupt, left field, short, zero satisfaction. I like Endings that play into the actions you make, but are all fairly similar, not based around oh I got checkpoint locked, because I went through one wrong loading screen at the wrong time, or I didn't find 3 random items hidden in some corner far from the player starting point at some random instance out of a few instances. The only time I want this, is when I mega love a game, which has happened like 3 times. Easter Eggs, hidden secrets are fine, but when it covers up the juicy good bits of a story, it's in the wrong direction.

So with my satisfaction left empty and bitter, I turned to trying to look up the endings but couldnt find a straight to the point video with the Revival update. I found one of the old version of the game, and skipped through it to see what the experience was like and how it differed.
I read a review talking about how they preferred the previous version, which surprised the developer, they claimed the pacing and structure didn't change much. I was more inclined to believe the dev. Until I watched this youtube video which showed all the endings and a rough gameplay/story break down.


[h1] The 2 versions are dramatically different experiential and story wise.[/h1]


This led me to indecision, do I waste time replaying the game when I really dont want to, to get a different ending. Or do I play the old version.

I decided to play the old Version.

To Summarize: The old version did need a big update. It suffered from a lack of audio, pretty much across the board, and some weird pacing decisions which I'm assuming is based around Student project and Time. I got about 70% of the way through the old version before I stopped, I felt like I saw enough to give my review at this point.

----

I will breakdown here a comparison of the 2 versions of what is better and worse in both versions


Revival: ====
Pros: 
- Visual updates & visuals overall are really good
- Dialogue system improvements are across the board better
- Gameplay improvements
- Levels and some areas you can explore more of
- Cutting to the next chapter is less abrupt (This was really bad in the Original)
- Soundtrack is incredible in setting the tone
- Talking about the black roses and the people in the woods going missing mentioned by Neil, was really cool

Cons:
- Story is not subtle, it literally ruins the plot in like 5 secs of the game if you talk to every NPC, if you have watched a lot of horror, it's not hard to surmise who/what lilth is. To the point this isn't a spoiler.
- AI doesn't get better
- The game is too short to have such a dramatical shift in visuals and tone. It goes from feeling like you are in a 1960s version of the Nun Movie, to Silent Hill meets Hellraiser. This contrast doesn't feel good at all, and feels weird. The Original's hell looks much more natural for what you would expect in the game.
- Lilth is not scary. Not in the slightest. It's not subjective. The Nun is more of an interesting movie with horror elements, not a scary movie. But in the original where it feels like a demonic entity and Lilth are working together to haunt this town and the player, actually feels very eerie, and since the story in the original isn't direct you are asking questions like what is going on, who is that, what the hell is that.... In this one when you see lilth since they show you her in the first 5 secs and then you learn her name in the first 5 mins you are like Oh lilth. Oh Hi Lilth.
- Charon is a furry now

Neutrals:
- Level Design: The level design in hell, gets better, but it also is 3 times bigger, confusing because the visual change is so stark different. I didn't realize i was in a mirror world till I explored a lot more.

Original: ====

Pros:
- Actually has some horror and eeriness to it. Actual Horror. 
- Intro: The horror it starts at the beginning in your dream. You are being followed by a cloaked figure that disappears, but gets closer as you get closer to the exit. (The knocking in the Revival was a great touch but everything else wasn't as good) Then you wake up at NIGHT, not in the morning on a bright sunny day, you then have to go back to sleep and this sense of Will I go back to that nightmare?
- When you escape the park, you are surrounded by ghostly figures that have a really cool visual effect if you get close to them. This was really cool and more effective player of putting the player in a eerie situation and guiding them where you want but still allowing for a little exploration. (This was too short but this was an overall issue of the original.)
- This one is big. The NPC Dialogue and placement is much more logically placed to guide the player to places of intrigue. And to ask questions about what is going on. The old lady mentions something went wrong in the past, and is facing towards a cabin. Neil is being questioned and warned, then disappears the next day and no one claims to know a neil.
- Postman Job. The game stuck better to doing your job instead of a random delivery job in the second day of revival.
- Finding the homeless guy dead on the slab, this is just empty in Revival, but having that connection because i found the homeless guy and a bit of his story and then seeing that conclusion was great.

Cons:
- Chapters are very abrupt and short
- The game is just much shorter inbetween each segment and overall, there isn't enough time to let things sink in
- Soundtrack  is just missing and is painstakingly felt
- sfx are just not as good in most cases, but in some are still good and subtle. I think I actually prefer a lot of the SFX in the horror scenarios, like in the park, there were a lot less random sounds that were just confusing me, and actually drawing me to the horror spots. But in other cases there were some spots just missing sounds or not properly tuned or as strong
- Lighting wasn't as good
- Some people you couldn't talk to
- Gameplay and animation issues
- Checkpoints were even further apart causing you to start over really far back

----

My unsolicited Recommendations of how this should have been handled. Would have been to take some of the changes of Revival (Soundtrack, sfx improvements, some visual improvements (Better Animations, Lighting, meshes and textures, extend the levels to let the player explore more and not have as abrupt ends to each chapter). Release this as a patch, aka Remaster.

But the changes to the story, lilth, and the silent hill aspects, is such a different game, that it should have been a spin off/spiritual successor, this would have allowed for basically new sales/marketing/first day release.

(Hit Char limit, I really do hope this helps, Best Regards) I really love the setting, atmosphere, and story of Helltown. The town itself is beautiful and the retro graphics give the game a really unique look. I have played both the original and the revival, and both have pros and cons. For instance, in the original version, the danger seems to be a little less immediate and story details are more ambiguous. In the revival, one of the first people I talked to on day 1 mentioned Lillith, which makes it more evident that there is a cult/something weird happening in Little Vale. I liked the improvements in the revival and how certain sections and enemies were made easier to deal with (ex.: the part where you find the keys in the graveyard). There were some changes that left me a little confused. Where did the homeless man's dog go on the 2nd day? Also, the original version's dog ending was one of my favorite video game endings ever, so I was sad that it was not in the revival. I'm not sure which version of Helltown I like more, but I definitely had a good time playing and recommend both versions. I can see there is something special about this game, and would love to see more stuff like it. I actually think that Helltown would make a very good horror movie too! Never got to play the original due to it not working on my PC, but seeing as the remake was given to everyone who owned the original I gave this a shot last night.  I can confidently say that this was pretty fun, I did wind up using a guide to get a few of the other endings, and it took me around 4hrs to actually get all of them. The presentation is really really nice looking and the actual story is really fun even if you see everything coming a mile away.  

It was definitely worth a good evening sharing some spooky content with my community, I'm not sure how it holds up to the original but I do think this remake here was a lot of fun.

name: Space Food Truck
short_description: Space Food Truck is a cooperative, culinary scifi adventure. 1-4 players take on unique roles aboard the Galaxy Gourmet. Their mission: explore a vast, procedurally-generated galaxy in search of exotic ingredients, craft delicious recipes, and withstand the untold dangers of deep space.
reviews:
Games is fine. The game is a buggy mess that creates more frustration then it does enjoyment. Its built like rogue-like, so the bugs are compounded by game design that basically comes down to rng. Some strategy can be used but for the most part a run can fall apart fast, and then it dies a slow, boring death. Great deck builder!! Its a cute game, but gets really complicated really fast with the crew crisis things and the fact that every turn, you draw a ship event card and its almost always bad, just like the demo video says. Weird that they would hit you negatively almost 75% of the time. I have played 3 rounds so far and not made it more than the first recipe. Overall would not recommend, its a bit over complicated in places where it makes the game feel like the devs dont want you to win at all Quirky deckbuilder, will continue playing later and upgrade the review.

It kind of feels like Pandemic + Deckbuilding + FTL. 

I recommend :+1: An innovative deckbuilder, with an innovation that has put a number of people off: you're forced to buy a card every turn.  (Also, the four decks in parallel thing is potentially a bit rough, although it was manageable for me.)  This means that managing bloat is very important  But with that in mind, I was able to win my second game (the first was spent learning things I might have learned from watching the video tutorial), and it was a perfectly enjoyable 3 hours.  I'm not sure that I want to go back to it (but I'm not sure I won't), but it's genuinely innovative and was worth the low price. I have played one single game of Space Food Truck.
In order to complete game, which we lost (but that's irrelevant), every single player had to disconnect and reconnect over 6 times each, more for some because the game de-synched WITHOUT WARNING.  If not for us being on Discord and updating each other EVERY SINGLE PLAYER TURN we never would have known that quests were either complete or incomplete.

Additionally, we would get stuck on black screens, waiting for player turns to end (that had already completed their turn minutes ago), watching phantom turns (things that didn't actually happen) etc.

This game is dog water.  Do NOT spend your money on it.  The concept is fine, and if they simply programmed a game that didn't suck, it would be great, just like Slay the Spire or Across the Obelisk.  But they didn't.  It's a buggy, unreliable mess. A cautious thumbs-down for now. 
Despite being a decent-looking deck-builder with graphics and mechanics more similar to Monster Train than Slay the Spire, the obscure UI makes it quite difficult. There are tons of elements that are not explained and a tutorial gameplay scenario is lacking. I haven't been able to get far on the easiest of difficulties. The sole developer has not been seen or heard of for years, so the remaining bugs are almost certainly not going to be fixed. 
But if you can fiddle through the obscurities and suboptimalities and are willing to give it a try, it does look promising. If you like deck building games, this is well thought through, the design, graphics and music are very nice! Considering this was made by 2 people (is that correct?), this is a pretty polished result.
I just wish there were stuffs to unlock when beating the game. That would make the replayability rely on more than choosing a harder difficulty tier.

 This game is very quirky and memorable. The roles and co-op nature of the game are very dynamic. As rogue-like co-op card games go, this one is decent enough on it's own. However, this game suffers greatly from both the RNG elements of a deck builder, and the events system. There's a solved amount of strategy, especially with the forced purchase mechanic.

The forced purchase mechanic is the worst thing I've ever had to deal with. You're being taxed for not staying on top of the cruelties of the universe. There's a bit of bias here, I'm mainly just frustrated on how much this game attacked me with little agency to stop it.

Lastly, unless you're playing solo, the multiplayer is extremely buggy with the UI and connection. You'll find yourself full restarting with your whole co-op crew quite often. It's a seven year old game with major issues like this.

name: MORDER
short_description: MORDER is a stealth-shooter game where you play either as a hired killer or a security agent. Be quick and sneaky, or deliver chaos and destroy the opposition, or maybe you will defend the innocent with your life. It's your choice.
reviews:
Okey, where to start .... game it's really fun with friends, the idea it's very interesting and doens't ask for a super pc to play it fluid. BUT the game needs more development, single player is coming ( hope so ) on the discussion they say that "they are just 2 guys" So I think this games deserve a try This game is actually fun! I cant wait for it to get crowded but meanwhile playing with friends is a lot of fun. 
Hope it gets developed further and polished as it has a lot of potencial to improve. The idea behind it is brilliant!

name: Inspector Waffles Early Days
short_description: A top-down detective adventure with point-and-click mechanics, inspired by classic Game Boy games. Follow Waffles in his first days as an inspector who wants to prove to everyone that he is more than just a rookie. But beware‚Ä¶ Your future worst enemy is hiding in the shadows.
reviews:
Very cozy and nostalgic, rather short game, loved the soundtrack ^^ Good old days when Inspector Waffles was a strict anti-milk-drinker and played by the rules ^^ Very short but charming point-and-click adventure game with a lovely retro-Game Boy aesthetic. The game is prequel to the prior Inspector Waffles game, but it completely stands on its own and if you haven't played it, there will be zero issues just playing this. 

But back to the point, love the charming characters and writing in this game, and the length is perfect, not too long or short. Easy recommend to any point-and-click adventure fans or fans of games like the Ace Attorney/Phoenix Wright series, even more casual ones since there's definitely nothing too demanding, zero-way to soft-lock yourself, and what you need to progress an investigation is never more than a minute or two away at absolute most. Cute! A bit different than the first game, they went with a game boy aesthetics for better or worse, instead of a more traditional point and click. While it does give the game a unique style, and feel, it also makes the gameplay a bit jank, due to the limitations the game impose on itself while adhering to a specific style, that limits what can be done.

Main problem is the text that is quite annoying to read since so few characters fit on the screen. The controls are also stiff, you movie in a grid and there are invisible walls everywhere even if it looks like you can walk past something and it's pretty hard to see what some things are (something the game makes some tongue-in-cheek jokes about). Nothing major, and it was a intentional design choice so you can't fault the game for it, other than point them out you can make of it what you want. If you think you will hate the gameplay due to how it looks, you probably will, and on the other hand, if you love this style, you will love the game. It has the same charm and silly cat/dog jokes as the first game,

The actual cases are fairly easy, but the side quest where there is one part of the big puzzle in each map has some head scratching parts. As long as you don't report in to your partner, you can still find it even after solving the case, so you can't really lock yourself out, and it's pretty obvious what are part of that puzzle and what is part of your main case.

I liked the game overall, but I can't say I loved the choice for going for a game boy color style, might very well be that I don't have nostalgia for the format, so that's partially on me. Great prequel to the first game, love the game boy vibes. Prequel to Inspector Waffles as the title says, but in 8-bit gameboy style. The cases are simple to solve since there is no penalty for choosing the wrong clue during questionings. All the difficluty comes from solving the optional Mad Catter plotline puzzles that happen during each case. Missing one stage means You have to restart a finished case.

While I had fun I hope potential future games return to traditional point and click. Similar to the first Inspector Waffles game, the second game was fun to play. It is actually a prequel in which we follow Waffles during his early days as a police inspector, when he confronted his arch nemesis Snowflake with his partner Pancakes. The story is spread over several standalone cases which progressively converge to the main storyline. For each case, the player needs to collect clues and interrogate suspects to deduce the solution. The investigation mechanics are simple and cannot get too difficult, due to the limited number of choices, but trying to piece the solution without clicking at random is engaging and at times surprisingly thoughtful.

Before playing, I had two main reservations. First, I was divided about the Game Boy aesthetics, especially the sound effects, which sounded pretty garish to my ears. Pretty quickly though I got used to both, even if I still preferred the aesthetics of the first game. Second, I was curious if the story would keep my attention, as we knew where things would turn out from the first game. Indeed, I would have appreciated some further twists or side material but the story was well crafted and I can't really complain. 

Ultimately, the only standout flaw of the game is that it is unsure at times if it wants to be funnier or more serious / darker. I think this was also an issue with the first game. For example, [spoiler] the first cases about the video games and the magnets are humorous but the tone changes quickly in the next case, which features drugs and a murder. The game tries to present Snowflakes as a Hannibal Lecter character, but I had to squint a lot to see him as this kind of threat. Finally, the characterisation of Waffles and Pancakes becomes more serious later on but I felt it could have been utilised more.[/spoiler] Still, these are minor issues. I would enjoy following Waffles in subsequent adventures! Inspector Waffles: Early Days the highly anticipated (at list by me) prequel to Inspector Waffles delivers great cases to investigate. In this gameboy color game you collect evidence and use logical reasoning to figure out details of the crime who? how? why? etc. The beloved quirky puns of first game return with many pop-cultural references to 80s and 90s movies with great 90's vibes ( based on tech and cars ). The game is not only satisfying prequel, but works as a solid stand alone story. I loved the waffles characterisation as newbie investigator and a gamer, as well as his relationships, backstory and milk plot element make him relatable protagonist. I didn't manage to solve what I assume was an easter egg puzzle in case 4, so will definitively replay it at some point. I highly recommend it for fans of fuzzy detectives and pun enjoyers, as well as anyone that likes to investigates and vibe to chill retro aesthetics. Also giving my best to the developer Yann, I have played every game you have realised including those on itch,io, and I'm looking with anticipation to whatever your next endever is going to be as I have enjoyed all of them, so whether its going to be related to inspector waffles, or a a complitly new story looking forward to it. I'm really enjoying my time with Inspector Waffles. The game is very charming and chilled out. It has a great pace and the difficulty is perfect for a relaxed gaming session. I think the mix of adventure game play and the overhead perspective works really well, too. Makes you of the good old days when you just finished homework, put fresh batteries into your Game Boy Color and forget about all your problems for at least a little while. Wonderful experience.

name: Roses and Gems
short_description: Roses and Gems is a difficult sandbox platformer all about avoiding the inevitable, Death. Build constructs, traps and fight to keep the ancient machine safe. In the end, your home will be destroyed, and you'll die, but it just means you get to start a new dem... Adventure all over again!
reviews:
This is the best game ever made
 A very hard riddle

name: Trainz 2019 DLC: C&O Hinton Division
short_description: Hinton Division, one of the major coal producing areas for the C&O, starting just west of Thurmond, WV through to Hinton, WV and also includes the Laurel Creek Sub Division, and parts of the Piney Creek Sub, Rend Sub and Loup Creek Sub.
reviews: Pretty decent, especially with all the C&O content available to mix in with it. Overall the route is really well done, but in the quick drive sessions none of the coal tipples are operational? Not sure how to fix that. but kind of making a mine run and dropping off empties to pick up empties.

name: THE DREADFUL SPACE
short_description: A very action space war game, the mission is to fight the ships from other planets, the game requires a lot of skill to get rid of enemy shots and counterattack with all the cool features you can get in the game. The combat is intense and very agile, confronting your skills as a Battleship player.
reviews:
You have to destroy airships with laser beams. The idea is far from new, but worth playing. Good and dynamic game, especially at a low price 	Simple, but at the same time interesting indie action The game is crazy, I really enjoyed it! Now speaking of liking the ship game, this one I almost don't drop very good, I highly recommend it.
The game has a very good gameplay, many enemies, it's a lot of action and requires a lot of skill to escape enemy shots, the graphics are beautiful, I loved getting the medals when you destroy an enemy.

I really liked it, great. Well worth the entrance fee. The game is great, I really enjoyed it! It's an arcade style game, it reminds me a lot of spaceship games that I played in arcades, good graphics and the gameplay is great, I loved the game I highly recommend it.

Worth the price of admission, the game surprises! It's a great spaceship game. THE DREADFUL SPACE is overall not a bad fast paced space war game where the objective is to fight ships from other planets the game requires a lot of skill to get rid of enemy shots and counterattack with all the cool features you can get in game. I really liked this game. In general, I like this genre of games and everything here is implemented very worthily. Good graphics, interesting options for weapons, opponents. The game is well designed, easy control and nice animation. Recommended
 A game in retro style where we have to shoot down enemy ships. Dynamic gameplay and nostalgia - that's how you can characterize this game. I hope that game cards and beautiful backgrounds with emoticons will be introduced into it. It is look like an old shooter games on phones in 2010s. That time was so good and all my friends has played games like this one. Excellent technical performance of the bonus system in the game, the passage of levels is interesting, the game will clearly return you to your youth, and if you have not played such games before, then I recommend you, 100% you will have a great time! Good old game from the 90s, but with new graphics. Nostalgia really hit me. Enjoyed playing it. The price tag is nice.
Recommend.

name: MachineryWorld
short_description: This game is a sci-fi action role-playing game From assembly to painting, you can greatly customize your character
reviews:
the graphic on this game is awesome.. i will recommend.. keep develop I really want to recommend it, but at the moment it's unplayable unless you speak Chinese. Yes, it has subtitles but not enough, there are still entire segments that are in Chinese, as well as incorrect translations (IE: Characters naming you "Light" but then calling you "Wright"). 

I'd strongly urge anyone who wants to play it to wait until it's had more time to be developed and translated.

name: Garbage Packer
short_description: Garbage Packer is a physics-based garbage truck simulator where you experience what it is like to drive a garbage truck!
reviews:
fun so realistic
 g Game loaded but lacked keyboard controls Refunded Great simulator and honestly the best trash truck sim anyone has made. This game is exactly what you would imagine if you wanted to jump in the rig. I hope the dev keeps updating the game! 

Recommendations for the dev:

Fix the center of gravity for the truck (seems too light when turning and driving, maybe add some weight)

Add a mini map with plots where the trash bins are, maybe a route

For the future:
Hopefully add a bigger town for the front end loader with shopping plazas (strip mall etc)

Maybe a city with some traffic lights and traffic 

Add an option to configure a joystick for some realism to control the arms in the game

Great job overall! Very fun, I love this game because the trash physics I REALLY LIKE THIS ! i have been waiting for a gamae like this for a long time this game has slot of potential i do enjoy it. tho still needs a lot of work YES GREAT GAME BUT I THINK IT NEEDS AN SIDE LOADER TRUCK IN A BIGGER CITY\MAP BUT I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS GAME TO OTHERS the front loader is very hard for me use i think the controls need to different to the the other truck

also you said fixes more likes bugs when i load into the game the sun makes my screen go orange and when i move my mouse it lags

name: EARTH DEFENSE FORCE: IRON RAIN - Item: Wrapping Pickup Truck
short_description: A gorgeous wrapping truck which the characters of "NatsuIro High-School" are printed.
reviews: Why are there anime cars in EDF? Who knows, but they're here and they're perfect

name: King's Quest - Chapter 5: The Good Knight
short_description: In his latest adventure, King Graham tells of his final battle with the Goblin Sorcerer Manannan and his final adventure.
reviews:
It's all right as games go.
But, boy, it gets increasingly depressing and sad. This chapter gets the series back up with much better puzzle solving in a more open ended type of solving the puzzle which is what Kings Quest is about, some puzzles are really challenging, and the story kept me glued for the start of the final chapter to the last part.
I loved that they managed to do a lot and still confide themselves on the trope of King Graham being old. 10/10 creativity.
There are some meta-commentary from the developers saying they would fix the previous stories(chapters) now which I found funny actually, even though chapter 2 and 4 would need a complete rework.
This chapter hits hard if you liked any of it's characters in any of the previous chapters and, without spoiling anything, I was hoping that the narrator at the end would change and when it happened it was perfect.
I truly hope we have a continue with this series if they learn from the mistakes of chapter 2 and 4, and keep the emotional growth from the story moments in chapters 1, 3, 5.
Unfortunately chapter 1 is the best. Really  good retro games..been playing  this collection  since it first came out years ago. A very melancholy retreading of chapter one‚Äôs environments plus a few more memorable bits and an adequately satisfying finale. The gameplay and puzzles aren‚Äôt particularly strong this time and feel, well, a bit old. That leaves it up to the narrative and somber music to carry the experience, which they certainly do. Even though the chapter has a weak start, the feels hit hard later on. It‚Äôs always emotionally gripping to watch a well-traveled character deal with ‚Äòend-of-life‚Äô exhaustion and desperation as they come to terms with what leaving behind a legacy means to them. There‚Äôs absolutely no reason to overlook the final chapter if you‚Äôve already made it this far into King‚Äôs Quest. I wish I had played a [spoiler]VGA 2D game like shown in one of the parts[/spoiler] instead of the whole game. Chapter 5 - SKIP IT, if you can.  We don't get to see the dragon again!!! >:(

Pros: 

Open-ended ending
Nostalgic at times
Funny achievements


Cons:

Short
Confusing - was this suppose to be Alzheimer awareness?
Very Linear - no choices
No dragon! for me the third and forth chapter were bad ,boring and linear this chapter correct the mistakes of the previous two by being realy interesting, good narrated, had great story telling and emotional value .
great conclusion and realy good adventure game A great conclusion to a great game.
Like the best chapters, Chapter 5 made me laugh, made me think and made me feel for the characters.

I've been invested in the chapters, but I dont think I was as emotional as the game wanted me to be. I will say overall its not perfect, but I've really really enjoyed this series. Haven't come across a game yet that has been so compelling in so many ways: art style, voice acting, puzzles, story and characters.

Really hope Odd Gentleman continue with the series. This was an acceptable ending for this well made game. I actually thought this was one of the stronger chapters emotionally. It has some fun nods to the previous games, and it seemed to be a more balanced chapter in terms of puzzles versus adventuring. If what I played at the end was the playable epilogue, those that were concerned about not getting to play it because they bought the game in parts, you're not really missing much. It really didn't need to be playable at all and really doesn't add much to what we already knew from the rest of the game. EDIT: So the epilogue was released a little later than my initial review. The epilogue does have more content to it.

name: Panzer Corps 2
short_description: Panzer Corps 2 is the ultimate Second World War strategy game! Enjoy the time-proven gameplay formula which has been appreciated by millions of players over the years, brought to a whole new level of refinement up to the latest technical standards.
reviews:
For all PG fans, one of the greatest game in this genre! 
 it's so much junk and not as good as the previous game, it isn't user friendly and the graphics are garbage PanzerGeneral Great game easy hot keys and visuals are solid, currently just doing campaign. Almost to many vehicles and units to pick from but I like it very much. If you like a good World War II tactical strategy game; this is for you! Just like Panzer General and sequels many years ago; it engrosses you in the background of your mission(s) and has some unique story twists that you may not see coming; but are very relevant to your current campaign.

PROS: See above; in addition I love the carry-through of your forces to the next campaign and the progression with veterancy; the addition of green recruits and based upon their survival also becoming veterans of your forces and campaigns. Medals and heroes are rewarding. See what I did there? lol

CONS: I had one bug; but think I borked a command at one point and the next mission wouldn't load. Had to come up with a work-around last year. I forgot what I did but believe I found the answer on the Steam Disccussions. So if you encounter that it may help.

OVERALL: 9/10 in implementation and playthrough. I would like to see additional mini-campaigns added in between the overall scope of the campaign and maybe a bit of overall strategic narrative (ie briefings with the Commanders of the Army(ies) that you are part of. ie a staff briefing like before a major operation starts with realistic maps and units represented. Be nice to see who I'm fighting alongside (off-map) and perhaps get an overall update(s) as you go along based upon how well my campaign is going and it's overall strategic impact on other armies / corps along the front line and / or army group.

Thanks for the overall solid product! Great Hex based Wargame. total classic legend of a game you like tanks and hex strategy this is king . the thing that sets it apart and above the competition is your tanks level up with experience and can be used through out the game. earning credits each mission to invest in more the next battle . FUN AND CHALLENGING Really liking this game.  It is like Advanced Squad Leader on the pc.  I used to play the Talon Soft hex games but they don't seem to want to work on windows anymore. Game is slanted too much to the AI opponent towards the end game missions. Meager amount of upgrade slots. Unrealistic combat outcomes. No way should an elite Panther unit be kicked around by M3 Stuarts. Ain't happening.  Fun up to a point. I can see spending $20 om the base game but would stay away from all the redundant DLC's. Graphics are very good and adds something to the combat but to be honest if you have the original Panzercorp stick with that.

name: World War II GI
short_description: WWII GI is the invasion of Normandy. The paranoia. The fear. the intensity that was D-Day. You will experience it first hand.
reviews:
Another terrible game from the same developers of NAM.

Player will run out of ammo very quickly. So I died a lot of times in the first mission.

These trash games ruin the reputation of Build engine. How is Nam better than this and how did this come out in 1999 when Half-Life was out for a year and Perfect Dark, Return to Castle Wolfenstein, and Halo: Combat Evolved came out within a couple of years later? This game is suckass because of many details in this game Not pogalicious Fantastic use of the Build Engine. Great maps with lots of awesome vistas, battles and unique scripted elements. Go back to 1944 in 1998 and relive WORLD WAR 2 and fight the nazi axis powers!

USA! 10/10 [h1]Rating[/h1]
2/10

[h1]Intro[/h1]
It's exactly the same as NAM, it's just that the setting is World War. Virtually nothing was done to make an improvemnt over that game. Once again, I recommend playing Duke Nukem 3D, Ion Fury and/or Shadow Warrior instead.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
+ Decent weapon variety.
+ Weapons have good impact.

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Poor level design.
- Poor aesthetics and graphics.
- Random explosions can kill you.
- Every enemy is an overpowered hit-scanner.

Eduke32: https://www.eduke32.com/ More difficult and polished than Nam/Napalm. For some reason it bugs out with wasd.
If you shift your wasd over to esdf, use right click for either jump or crouch. 
There is a terrific game here you have to pry it out and once its going the old school cannot be matched. This is a build engine game. (Duke Nukem 3D, Shadow Warrior, Blood, etc.)...
WW2-GI is a pseudo-sequel/pseudo-remake of an earlier total conversion for Duke Nukem 3D called Platoon TC. this is a great game Do not buy this, there are plenty of Duke Nukem style shooters AND World War II shooters out there which are more fun, more accessible and more graphically pleasing - even in early 1990-s standards.
By "accessible" I mean a game that is actually playable by a person who is not a hardcore FPS player, who doesn't do anything in their free time apart from playing FPS. I can play Doom on Medium just fine, but in this game I'm instantly killed and the graphical glitches don't motivate me to proceed figuring out what am I doing wrong.

name: Shio
short_description: ‚ÄúShio‚Äù is a challenging platformer game in which you deep and moving story by jumping from lantern to lantern. If you are big fan of Super Meat Boy, you will like Shio as well!
reviews:
Quite challenging, even for skilled platform players. Not that long, but the collectables and secrets will extend your playtime, if that's your jam. Otherwise, an interesting narrative keeps things lively. For the price, especially on sale, totally worth it. Jumpy jumpy This is one of those chinese plattformers, which looks quiet nice, has an ok level design, some interessting mechanics, but totally lacks any polish in regards of physics. One jump button, always the same the jump. No small jump, no slow or fast jump mechanics, no regrabs. No run or ducking mechanics. Nothing. This makes the game quiet easy as a plattformer, but also boring, as you click only one button the whole game. That's a very common issue in many chinese 2D-plattformer, and I hope the developers some day starts studing games like, Super Mario World or Celeste.

Some other technical issues. The german translation is utterly useless. It's just a very bad machine translation. Nothing makes sense, not even the first screen. Not that any dialogs are needed to play the game, but if you are kind of interessted in the story of the game: Learn english or chinese. Can't say anything about the other languages, but i wouldn't think, that they are any more usefull than the german. Such a shame. As the game doesn't get updates anymore, there is no hope, that it will be fixed in the future.

Aside from that, this game has one major technical issue. No V-Sync support or anything like it. If you don't lock your FPS in settings of your graphic card, this games takes every frame it gets and runs with like 800 FPS on modern hardware, which is kind of stupid and just waste of energy.

Can't really recommand this game, as it has so many flaws, but if you are lucky and catch this game in sell for a small bug, well enjoy the game. It's not that bad. so special game Really enjoyed this game! Decent difficulty, not as hard as say cuphead, Celeste, super meatboy etc. But a decent difficulty to keep you trying without loading your crap lol. Recommend especially when on sale nobody cares about your garbage story
otherwise good game Shio is a true platformer that is challenging, beautiful and simple. If you can get it on sale ($6.78AUD) you'll get an incredible game and experience if you're a fan of the genre but you wont be ripped off if you get it at full price.

the things i want to clarify about this game, as a 2d platformer game, the difficulty is balanced and not even hard at all, i don't know why most of the dislike review said its too hard, since this game is easier than most of the hard 2d platformer in steam

the game have 2 difficulty, easy and hard mode, i never tried easy mode, but already completed all the total time achievements in hard mode, so i think this game is friendly enough as a 2d platformer

overall the level design is ok, not so fun and not so bad 

the things i want to tell to people who want to buy this game:

this game can't rebind keys to most of the "function keys" (arrows and shift etc..)
this game can't control the heights of your jumps

name: Born of Bread - Artbook
short_description: Discover Born of Bread's wonderful world with its Digital Artbook.
reviews: I'm this game's biggest hater. I really enjoyed this art book, it offers a more in-dept look into the characters and art direction of the game as well as behind the scenes content, If you're a fan of art books I recommend getting this one

name: Supporter Pack - Official Sound Track
short_description: This DLC contains the full original soundtrack from Automation: The Car Company Tycoon Game, comprising three songs per decade from the 1940s right through to the 2010s.
reviews: just beard from Killrob that the composer is sending the revenues from his music is going to help fight Australian wildfires, so that made this 100% worth the $5 (although steam takes 30%) Good Music Worth the 4,99‚Ç¨ sadly it's not looping.

name: Stronghold: Warlords - The Mongol Empire Campaign
short_description: The Mongol Empire Campaign expands the base Stronghold: Warlords game with six missions, two new warlords and extra achievements. Play as emperor Kublai Khan as you relive famous sieges, civil war and skirmishes against the Song Dynasty.
reviews: Must have üëç Kublai Khans campaign is in my opinion the most refined and fun of all the campaigns for Stronghold Warlords. Warmly recommended for those that enjoy the singleplayer! It's a good dlc. But I'm downvoting because, what once was a great company, won't fix their game before making dlc and it's egregious. You can burn down a whole town in the first mission, nice.

name: Dungeons of Aether
short_description: Delve into Dungeons of Aether, a turn-based dungeon crawler set in the Rivals of Aether universe. Control four new heroes as they uncover the mysteries of the Julesvale Caverns in Story Mode or test your mettle in the grueling Challenge Dungeons.
reviews:
I love having every fight last 20 turns if I don't want to just go soaking up hits here and there because the dice pool decides to be really wholesome over and over again and make the game a stalemate.
It had potential, I want to like it, but I just don't. It's just not fun. The gameplay is pretty boring, the dungeons are pretty boring since there's so little enemy variety. It gets better later but it's mainly just "early enemy but it has more health or regenerates stamina (which makes stalemates last even longer). 
I gave it a long break and came back to it and faced the same problems I did back when it first came out. The characters have fun personalities (except Hamir) but it doesn't make up for the fact that the gameplay loop makes me want to slam my head into my desk. Especially since there's pretty much no meta-progression, so what I do on one character doesn't really matter since I'm forced to play all of them and upgrades cost quite a hefty amount.
Maybe get the game if it's on sale and you're really desperate but I really don't think it's worth 20 CAD. i dont even like turn based strategy and this was peak

soundtrack carried This game was really fun to find out what can click at a moment's notice. Every fight can potentially feel different depending on what you got on you and I think that's really neat. My biggest complaint is that the game is so short. The story could also use more time with the characters and their development. But what was there was a really solid experience! I'd love for a sequel in any shape or form. I've yet to try the challenge mode but I absolutely love the gameplay so I'll probably be back to try it out. this is game is really really cool, its quite complicated to understand at first, at least for me it was, but once you get the hang of it its really fun, and the story so far is super interesting Love getting more characterization for our favorite Aetherians, and with a great combat system and art style! Game's really good. Music's great, the sprite work is incredible, the story is fine but its mechanics are fun. The fights are incredibly challenging due to the luck based behavior of dice. Most turns you'll be scrambling just to protect yourself, until you get a good roll for either a set up turn or actual hit. If you treat the combat in this game as more of a battle of attrition, it becomes a very particular kind of fun that I really enjoy that I haven't seen anywhere else. The game gets very easy once you get your builds going, and even the final boss fight ends in a few turns if you know what you're doing. Also, save scumming is really easy, so having fun is easy. Genuinely challenging, to downright frustrating at points...

However, despite that, 10/10 game. Great characters, great gameplay, great writing, great humor, great story, just GREAT EVERYTHING.

Even more fun when you play with a group of friends all doing voices!

Genuinely peak game, would recommend to anyone! this game feels like constant work
the campaign feels very slow, you have to do one character at a time and cant keep playing the one you want
the idea is cool in theory, but once you play a bit more it gets tedious
getting constantly fucked by rng and having to play so defensively most of the time until you can finally hit a random enemy, it just ain't fun for me If you're not in love with dice combat and being unable to actually walk from one room to another, this game will not be for you. You know, this game is pretty spiffy. Great art of critter people, neat game design idea, I like it. Really, the draft system stands out, never seen a thing like it. I think that in itself is worthy of parse. Bare in mind this is coming from the perspective of a person. Some say its too defensive, I found it to be a good balance when I focused on my resources. But by no means perfect, I'd love to see a second one with a bit more refinement for sure. This is coming from someone that has only played the campaign though.

name: Ni no Kuni Wrath of the White Witch‚Ñ¢ Remastered
short_description: Journey back to the other world in Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch‚Ñ¢ Remastered. LEVEL-5‚Äôs classic tale returns better than ever, with improved graphics and performance.
reviews:
Honestly, I was really enjoying the game. The mechanics, story, visual art, everything was very elegant and eye-catching. But as the story progressed, I realized that it was increasingly necessary for me to set up my tent in a field and start grinding excessively. As the game progressed, it became more and more evident. Tired of grinding, I changed the difficulty to easy so I could have a little novelty and advance, ok, it lasted well for maybe 10 hours, until I went back to grinding again. Honestly, if it weren't for already being on the last mission, I would have abandoned this game, absurd repetitiveness and all the mechanics that had excited me in the beginning started to seem tiresome to use 300 times in a row to get +1 lvl. i remember watching stampy play this game bro. <3 10 stars why cant you block with more than one person at a time in a boss fight .why is there a delay on spells.why is the AI dumb as fuck.sets too go all in .ai stands in fire and dies.what the hell is the share hp mp crap huh.... - The opening to this game is almost text book in inability to deliver an engaging experience and frankly, flat out incompetence. Five five feet. Cut-scene. Walk five feet. Cut-scene. It never ends. 2 hours into the game, It is still forcing me to walk five feet. . . cut-scene. 

The story within those cut scenes is extremely boiler plate. It would be serviceable if was in service to game play, but it's the focus in a languid and beleaguered way. Just in terms of competent writing, you need to cut down what's here significantly or write better. Yes, they did get Studio Ghibli to make cut scenes and those are charming, but even those are clearly from the same story board. If this was repacked in some way and you told someone this was a Ghibli movie, they would call you a liar. Everything is obviouis, slow, and boring. 

But what about that game play when it does happen? The combat system is very older RPG which a little bit of freedom of movement and extra systems tacked on. It feels like unnecessary clutter-- busy work in the fight to make it feel more complicated or keep the player busy. I would have preferred pure turn based just to shave down the nonsense I need to keep track of. Even systems like being able to move and dodge attacks while you select your own isn't meaningful, because the game is not that hard. 

Are there positives? Sure. The game features a pokemon-like system of obtaining and training new critters. These are fun and are functionally the same as new playable character in combat, they aren't implemented in any meaningful way, in fact, I'd say it's pretty clunky with a stamina system that forces you to continually change them out with each other and the human characters. 

There's a tiny amount of exploration. Tasks to do. The larger exploration and goals are not what I'd call robust. 

The graphics can look nice at time. I was impressed by the towns especially. There was some weirdness to the cutscenes. The game functionally has 3 art styles. The main game, the 3d cut scenes, and the ghibli animations. The 3d cutscenes stand out as wonky and unusually poorly done. There would be weird lighting changes that clash with where you just were in the 3D game world. 

So that's a lot, but I really don't have a lot of positives to say. It's what looks like a ridiculously high budget game with zero aspirations, attention to detail, or inspiration. 

4/10 at best. This charming, timeless action-RPG exudes the Studio Ghibli vibe and incorporates a coming-of-age story in an isekai setting. The mix of turn-based & real-time combat with creature collection also adds to its unique flavor. Two thumbs up üëçüëç :) This game's difficulty is very balance if you don't grind too much. The aspect of raising familiars is pure fun. My characters' level at the final boss are 45 45 and early 50ish on that last character. Definitely recommended for everyone even if you're not an rpg fan. I'm gonna be honest: The concept of a Studio Ghibli RPG does not make up for the fact the not-action-but-also-not-turn-based combat is more of a pain than it is fun. The world also didn't really grab me.

name: Flurius
short_description: This is what happens when you do not brush your teeth.
reviews:
Meh, just kinda boring bad bad bad I'll be the first person to tell you there's just not enough Brazilian dentistry themed games on Steam, but Flurius is not what Tim "Tencent" Sweeney had in mind when he made the Unreal Engine.  This is a garbage low poly 3D rendered 2D retro shooter with a tooth-and-gum theme and a little mouthwash powered jetpack.  Mouthwash powered jetpack.  Yeah, me neither.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The game features lazy low-polygon "retro" assets, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the 1990s.  It's unclear why the developers weren't able to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets for the game, and also irrelevant... what matters is that this looks bad as a result of their decisions, a compromise PC gamers shouldn't have to put up with.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 2 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

Flurius is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.
 teeth

name: Command Center Earth
short_description: Save Earth from total annihilation by drifting a missile through a variety of unique and punishingly difficult asteroid fields.
reviews:
you ever just wanna go drifting

but in space Some chill space drifting that slowly layers on the challenge.
A great way to kill some time and zone out, especially on the Steam Deck.
The 25 levels actually flew by pretty fast! I'd love to see more levels added or a sequel. Good game!
(And too short.) Simple gameplay and fun to play! On this Fourth of July don't forget to be grateful for your freedom because of the heroic efforts of Captain Steven Hiller and David Levison. Without them we would not have an Earth to call home. And so akin to their efforts I login daily to protect my planet from the incoming meteors by firing missiles non-stop into the vastness of space. Command Center Earth makes me a hero. You can be a hero too - give Earth a fighting chance! This game an an absolute gem! At first, the game presents a bit of a challenge as you get accustomed to the controls. However, once you get the hang of it, it's hard to put down. I enjoyed this game more than I thought I would and looking forward to more added content. Really fun and challenging! This game is perfect for late night play sessions when you‚Äôre watching a show and don‚Äôt want to be too invested in either thing. Good addictive gameplay and simple mechanics. Can‚Äôt ask for more. 

Definitely going to be a must-have for the SD. I'm just going to be honest here, the guy that built this is my husband üòÖ. But damn if this game still doesn't kick @$$!

I'm a big fan of the friend leaderboards for each level despite the fact that my husband crushes my times on every level lol.

I know he's working on getting level routes implemented which I'm really pumped about!

name: Devil Slayer - Raksasi: Digital Artbook
short_description: "Devil Slayer - Raksasi: Digital Artbook" contains hundreds of beautiful images related to the game setting. (File formats: JPG and PNG)
reviews:
always need more Raksasi Precious. I bought the Artbook as a way to say thank you for an awesome game. looks nice anime waifus Aloha, this is my review for the art book for Devil Slayer Raksasi, that I bought because I loved the game!The Good: hot waifu pictures, lots of hot waifu pictures.The Bad: need more waifu pictures.The Ugly: nothing, its perfect. This is the first digital artbook that I willingly bough

10/10 would come (and buy) again Usually I really love artbook DLC, but I cannot recommend this one at all. A rip off.

Other artbooks have resolutions at 2000px+ , but the images are low resolution crap, with portraits having a resolution around 600px, and other images around 1000px height at MAX. This is web images, not artbook quality. 

You can literally screenshot the game and get the same image/res. Very good art book with design description and nice art work. Digital Artbook is released to celebrate version 1.0 of Devil Slayer Raksasi. It contains over hundreds of high-resolution images and in-game assets in both JPG and PNG format. This includes something from development concept to upcoming / unreleased contents (which plan to update from v1.0). So, there will be spoiler too.

If you enjoy the rouge-like gameplay of Raksasi or adore the aesthetic of fantasy oriental design and mythology, this DLC is an appreciation to further support 3-man developers that they put into game during early access development.

You can find artwork in game folder (right click to game in library > Manage > Browse local files). Note: All documentary is written in Chinese language.

name: Kaiju Princess 2
short_description: Journey across the galaxy with a cute kaiju and her ravenous appetite as you collect ingredients to cook up the ultimate feast!
reviews:
I've played through all the previous games. Before I get into the actual review, let's review the positive and negative changes:

+ Incredibly well-written story, even more so than the previous two
+ Extremely fleshed-out characters
+ Lots of fun references to other media and games (NieR: Automata and JoJo's Bizarre Adventure being two)
+ Realistic MC that isn't just using the princess for seggs
+ Poochi Q's personality is really complex, with foreshadowing
+ absolutely BANGER OST. For Kaiju Princess 1, it was Shining Star by Koichi Morita but now it's an actual commissioned song like for The Arrogant Kaiju Princess.
+ Much more streamlined UI
+ Much better exploration system. 
+ Fun af to guess food recipes when they aren't found, and Poochi's reactions are priceless too
+ Throwback to KP1 where Xao would do the nasty with the MC
+ Throwback to KP1's ending, which honestly made me the happiest I've been for a while
+ Roughly 10 hours of gameplay (not including plenty of seggs) for 15.30. Even at full price it's worth it
+ Exceptionally cute outfits that strike a balance between lewd and modest (compared to the previous two)
+ Throwback to the Magical Girl outfit from Kaiju Princess 1
+ More interaction options
+ cute cooking simulator
+ Addition of anal and oral during H-mode
+ Better orgasm effects during H-CG

- Removed L & R hand individual control
- Removed "cum inside/outside" option during H-CG

Now, on to the actual review. Going over each aspect:

The most important factor: the story.
In contrast to KP1's meagre plotline and TAKPATDS' all-over-the-place isekai style, this storyline hits the mark. Why? Because of the reasons above: Poochi being an incredibly well-written and complex character that is clearly dealing with seperation anxiety, as well as coming to terms with her own immortality; the MC not straight up abusing her sexually or using her solely for sex like the previous ones, instead slowly warming up to her which is FAR more realistic, and teasing her plenty while she has the most adorable reactions; the side characters being of an interesting variety and always returning (Type V being based off Elva from Project QT, Yagi being a ex-turned-friend, Georgie being a gyaru and Nyan being a crazy-ass catgirl). 

I'd like to say that the characters are all unique, and the fact that they returned to help the MC meet Poochi to comfort her was also really nice. "There are no enemies, only new friends" about describes it.

tl;dr, well-written story, characters and a hentai MC that isn't a cunt? Sign me up!
Overall: 10/10, 10/10. Anyone who disagrees can go suck one.

Next, let's talk about the lewds, since that's what many of you horny fucks would want. (I bought it for the story and I don't have any regrets, it's like reading a manga that keeps on giving). 

The H-CG: Splendid. Different sorts of poses and clothes with Poochi with her as the star of the show, in different places and even a threesome with Type-V. The nightly seggs from KP1 (Xao sneaking in to pleasure herself with the MC's pp) was brought back as a bonus to the costume and other character CGs, and fits with the gluttony aspect (she be drinking the forbidden milkshake now). Overall, I'll give this a 10/10. 
The H-mode (Sex function): Even with the removal of L/R hands, the seggsmode is still GREAT. Three positions (same as TAKPATDS), same toys, nicer UI. In addition, more items to assist in grinding achievements, and clothing is saved for Poochi's dialogue box sprite as long as it isn't a Carnival or lore-important cutscene. Overall still 10/10, I want to give her all the praise she deserves and hug her pain away.
The non-Poochi H-CG: absolute fire. Go watch them for yourself, it's great. 10/10.

tl;dr horny people will like this game. 10/10 overall

Actions (e.g. shop, exploration, cooking):
So much more improved. The feeding mechanic was brought back to make it incredibly integral to gameplay, as well as even more streamlined, pretty and interesting with a wide variety of stat-boosting dishes that all looked really freaking delicious. (Mr. Chef, teach me your ways!) Exploration was also so much more fun with a turn-based RPG that allows people like me who love overkill to absolutely demolish bosses. The shop also appears on the planet for discounted items, which helps when you don't have enough money for full-price items. 

Even as grindy as the gameplay is, you don't feel worn out AT ALL. In fact you'll wish that it'd never end! And there's no relationship rank requirement every Carnival which makes it less stressful. A 10/10 and marked improvement from the previous games.

Ending: Just play it then watch the ending. It's seriously beautiful. 
Also, Poochi Q is my fav princess. she's just like me, for reals. 10/10

Overall: 10/10. Play the previous two, they're worth it too. Support these amazing devs.
Let's see what they come up with next, I can't wait :3 i like the game but theres a critical issue that wont let you save or load my game Cons:

* No English language for the spoken dialogue. 
* I miss the ponytail hairstyle from the Arrogant Kaiju Princess (I will refer to that game as Kaiju Princess 1.5 or KP 1.5 from here forward to shorten it) as it is not present in this game and was definitely the most attractive on Daigneux IMO.
* Daigneux from KP 1.5 is just sexier, so I do still prefer her by far over Poochi Q even though Poochi Q is still pretty darn attractive. 
* The outfits for Poochi Q are nowhere near as sexy & enjoyable as in KP1.5 for Daigneux - man, Daigneux had several outfits that were off the charts.
* No nipple or belly piercings / sexy tattoos - hopefully the next one will have such options. 

Pros:

* Upgraded visual support from previous games (now has 120fps support). 
* Has difficulty settings this time around to make things easier for folks who struggle with the time management / battle portions of the game. (honestly even on the normal difficulty setting, this game was over-the-top simple, so even if you struggled on a previous game, try this one on normal, I never lost a single battle at all on the first try). KP 1.5 was actually difficult in some areas where you had to really focus on managing your army, etc. but KP2 is SIGNIFICANTLY easier. 
* This is the 3rd game in the series and the developer has done a nice job improving the interface - it's very smooth and easier to navigate. All the games are similar with little tweaks and changes to keep things interesting. 
* Have to compliment the design of the character Yagi as well - she was just as sexy as Poochi Q if not more-so. 
* Developer did a better job of incorporating intimacy scenes into the narrative in this game with regard to the side girls - in KP 1.5 the side girl scenes felt more forced than anything else without a whole lot of believable context. This game does that a LOT better. 
* Better animation quality in the intimate scenes than previous games in the franchise. 
* Even better scenes in general than KP 1.5 in terms of just the scene designs / creativity. 
* No woke nonsense. 
* No additional DRM.
* No Epic Online Services. 
* No censorship that I am aware of. 

Gameplay Style: Point and click exploration, time management, managing attributes during explorations (food energy). The game is mostly on rails, so you won't have to make a lot of choices, just mostly manage Poochi Q's food energy while trying to boost the relationship, etc. 

Game Length: ~13-15 Hours. 

Final Rating: 7.5/10. It's a good, solid game and it's better than the original Kaiju Princess, but not by a lot. I personally thought The Arrogant Kaiju Princess & The Detective Servant was significantly better. Not only was Daigneux more attractive by far in that game than Poochi Q is in this game, but the story was better. If the developer reads the feedback at all, I personally would hope for a sequel to Arrogant Kaiju Princess for the next game. This one was still good, and I'd recommend picking it up if you like the series, but it just wasn't as good as Arrogant Kaiju Princess. DAWG
WHY IS THIS SO PEAK FOR AN HENTAI GAME ?! Story is actually interesting , H scenes are well made and i'm all for Min-Maxing runs and exploration i swear there be more deadly sins type shit I do highly recommend the game, but would recommend setting the difficulty on easy as it would take you twice as long to finish otherwise and the combat gets old very quickly.

Game is fun for what it is, but I would recommend to get it when on a discount as the scenes (as good as they are) are a little too one note. I play all Kaiju Princess series on my main account, so what?
