name: Death of a Wish
short_description: THE NEO-SANCTUM SHALL FALL. Claim retribution against the theocratic Faiths as you master vicious hack-and-slash combat in this action-RPG where style is salvation.
reviews:
unique and memorable game Plays like a dream -- smooth, intense, fast -- with nightmarish visual and musical style, and an amazingly touching story. I rarely see a game that fits together so beautifully; it's a perfectly cut gem. I cannot give it high enough praise. Best top-down, stylish action game I ever played--plus it's got the angriest (complimentary) art style to go with its hyper-violent take on the downfall of a cruel, overbearing institution that's so good to tear to bloody pieces I always forget to do a review for this game, but I have been shilling it since release, so I figured I would now.  I pretty much just want to say thank you to Melessthan3.

This game and Lucah were so good.  The customization of the combat in this game was so beautiful. Man, we need more games that play like this.

- Parrying and then doing a big bang when broken NEVER got old.  Not to mention swapping mid combo.
- The S Rank incentive (and that beautiful sound) the soulslike tension that comes from trying to make it through a dozen difficult encounters without taking damage, so you can survive when it matters most and keep corruption low for the whole game (legitimately redoing half the game after I knew how to get to the ends of the chapters so I could end them all with no more than 1 fight loss per chapter)
- The familiar mixing to make my break per second and single shot damage so satisfyingly high, and the  stance switching in mid combo that brought some Character action energy into the game if you really were trying to stunt.
- The characters were more fleshed out and strongly developed, and the presentation of the game really allowed your imagination to do things with the world you explored that I never would've expected.  I was always invested in what came next

There's so much.   M<3, I love your work.  This is an S-Tier game to me.   Thank you, and please keep making games like this. They removed the stamina bar from the first game. It's all I needed. An amazing follow-up to an amazing game.

The meatiness of the first game gives way to more of a bakers kind of feeling: appears simple at first, but as you learn the ingredients and ratios and techniques the experience changes completely.
At least 5 different playstyles (stun/dodge + slash/nuke & God Eater ranged pew pew), 
Huge amount of weapons and other customization options to tailor the above to a fine point.
Great number of both optional and mandatory boss fights.
Incredible normal enemy variety; in not just looks, but behaviour, vulnerability, and attacks too.

few complaints:

[spoiler]After defeating Michael [/spoiler] you get a hint as to where to go, but if you're taking your time w/ the game you're not going to know what they are pointing at.  Was personally lost for a few hours.

There is a huge power differential in dedicating Chris to one playstyle versus building him to be versatile, and changing between these builds is rather tedious, disincentiving experimenting with the different playstyles.

The customization is much too precise.
ex: there are 6 main weapons, each with 3 branches, leading to a total of ~24 weapons; there are also about as many 'prayer card' attachments to further fine tune those weapons.

Difficulty curve is a bit erratic and oftentimes normal enemy encounters can be harder than the actual bosses

Combat mechanics can stack too many multipliers on top of one another.
You can go a couple of runs finding an enemy or boss to be spongey if you play standard.
Then, if you play beautifully, stacking up multipliers and keeping a combo up, your foe just melts. Genuinely peak. Less than 100 reviews on here for a game of this quality? There is no justice Its good. More of lucah. very cool

name: The Crust Complete Soundtrack Pack
short_description: Dive into the harsh world of The Crust with the original soundtrack from the game, including a few bonus tracks. All tracks are mastered and mixed for the digital version of the album, delivered in various formats (320kbps .MP3, .WAV, .FLAC).
reviews:
Excellent sound Track!! Great soundtrack all in all, but the one track I wanted is not included. Super dissapointing!
So be aware that not all tracks are there... Great soundtrack but still missing the best tracks (in my opinion). I still recommend it however. No all soundtracks are included :(((

name: Three Days
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy
short_description: You are a lead scientist working for the SCP foundation on a super-secret project [SCP-2432]. Something goes terribly wrong and the ship you are on containing the SCP explodes, and you wake up on a distant island surrounded by a vivid environment. Get ready to survive, fight for your life and finally escape the horrors of the island.
reviews:
‚Äé I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you. Hey guys! üòä I was really excited before I tried this game, I thought it would offer a different experience. However, some aspects of the game left me a little disappointed. ü§î

In the beginning, the atmosphere of the game was really immersive and managed to draw me in. The graphics and sound design were outstanding! üëå However, as the game progressed, some repetitive elements and limitations in enemy designs distracted me. üéÆüíî

Character development and storytelling seemed a bit incomplete to me. While I was hoping for a more in-depth connection, the emotional development of the characters was not sufficiently handled. This made the game experience a bit superficial. üòï

However, the puzzles and difficulty levels the game offered were quite enjoyable! üß©üîç Also, the overall concept of the game still continues to impress me.

All in all, "Three Days" was a game of mixed feelings for me. While it has some great aspects, its shortcomings cannot be ignored. Maybe in the future updates or additional content will enrich the game experience. üåüüëç

*Ã°ÕålÃ°*Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã¥Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã¥Ã°Ã°Õ°|Ã≤Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤|Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã¥Ã¥Ã¥Ã°Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ°Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ°*Ã°Ã°Ã°Ã° Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã¥ Ã°Ã°Õ°|Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤|Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã° Ã¥Ã°Ã¥Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ°Ã°. _|Ã≤Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤|Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã°Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ° Ã¥Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã¥ Ã°Ã°Ã°*lÃ°Ã°Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã°Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã¥Ã° Ã°Õ°|Ã≤Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° | Ã°_Ã¥Ã° Ã¥Ã°Ã¥Ã¥Ã° Ã°Õå*Ã°ÕålÃ°*Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã¥Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã¥Ã°Ã°Õ°|Ã≤Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤|Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã¥Ã¥Ã¥Ã°Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ°Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ°*Ã°Ã°Ã°Ã° Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã¥ Ã°Ã°Õ°|Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤|Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã° Ã¥Ã°Ã¥Ã° Ã°ÕålÃ°Ã°. _|Ã≤Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤‚ñ´Ã≤Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ°œÄÃ≤Ã≤Õ°Õ°Õ° Ã≤Ã≤Õ°‚ñ´Ã≤Ã≤Õ°Õ° Ã≤|Ã°Ã° Ã°Ã° Ã¥Ã°Ã°ƒ±Ã¥Ã° Three Days is a 2D retro pixel top down survival/crafting game with a simple enough premise, you're stuck on some SCP related island and you have three days to go through the tech tree high enough to build yourself a raft from various resources on the island so you can escape.  The premise isn't bad, but the lazy, low quality technical implementation is (remember, this is on Steam against games like Rust, Ark: Survival Evolved, Subnautica, Valheim... the list goes on). 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The game only displays in 4:3 pillarboxed aspect ratio.  It's possible they developed this using an old CRT they found in a dumpster, or this game has been specifically designed for people gaming on PC's from 1995... either way, this isn't really acceptable in the modern era of PC gaming.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers.

Some of the defects in the game can be attributed to the choice of using the GameMaker Studio construction kit/toolset.  This is a very poor quality toolset favoured by amateur developers as it's cheap and requires little in the way of development skill, but unfortunately has very limited capabilities.  Just as you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear, you can't make a great video game if you use a terrible engine.  GameMaker Studio is most commonly used to make retro pixel shovelware and cash grabs.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Three Days is relatively cheap at $3 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend. asd It is called Three Days, but all I got from it are three trading cards. wfsaddfa Three Days

10/10 Game has potential, but it's current state is much of an early access, because there is many bugs and exploits and things that needs to be reworked.

The main objective of the game is to build a boat withing 72 hours and GTFO from the island.

The tutorial in main menu instantly drops you in game after you read everything, without allowing you to choose what mode you wish to play. Also, in my opinion, tutorial would be more better if it was a mini-level where you do step-by-step crafting to learn the basics. 

The crafting system is complex and you don't know what to craft first - i recommend before jumping into game to have a look into craft sheet in the main menu and ignore warnings to see the basic stuff you need to survive the first night, i.e. at least learn how to craft campfire and spear. 

At day you're free to explore and find a perfect spot to build a base and get some food, and by base i mean a location with plenty of woods and rocks around and set up a campfire that will scare the night monsters away from it.
The speach bubbles of main characters hints what materials you must combine together to craft something but it is pretty random and sometimes annoying because the game HUD is pretty large and you cant see much things around you.
So, coming back to crafting, it would be much better if at least the bubbles would show images instead of text because reading takes longer time and time here running extremely fast and you dont have such time to think. Besides there is a bug happening where your character literally spams a lot of different texts in one speech sequence, and the bubble itself change colors like green when its day but its actually night.

Pressing Escape button during the game doesn't pause the game, it still keeps running even in background leaving you vulnerable even in easy mode. There is no saving features as well.

The combat is just crafting a spear or spikes, hold them with LMB and aim at your enemies while keeping them at distance. That's it. Often you might lose the spear on the ground due to the limited range of dragging the items but you can find it with a tether between the character and the item when you're close.

Some objects in game are really small and hard to see, like fish scale and glue. I think adding the background color behind them like shadow or icon might help to see them.

And few more bugs i've encountered during gameplay:
-I've managed to craft a boat and it had that windows saying "press E to escape", but spamming E led to nothing, big dissapointing bug. But i've managed to replay again pretty simple on easy and normal modes about 4 times, it worked;
-The daytime should be much longer and the skills that slows time should be removed, because in the night, the creatures that run away from lights are hanging on the edge of the light radius trying to get you if you're close enough, and because its so easy to kill them that way, you can get huge EXP drops and unlock all skills in 5 minutes, including those that slows time by ~50% and this thing leads to the very very very long first night. This is problematic for the shark spawn rates that drops material needed for escaping;
- Creatures killed in night respawns very often near the player and manage to successfully attack the player before retreating;
-Also if you wander from the campfire in night you might see that those creatures are not afraid of lights at all, they walk bravely around the base and they only becomes afraid if you're close to it and run away;
-Walls do nothing;
-fishing nets are almost useless, i mean it kills small fishes when they bumb into it (sometimes) but i was thinking it could collect fish over time and make stuff easier;
-Collected pages menu have duplicates among them;
-Ending scenes does not unlock in main menu unlockables;

Hard mode is currently impossible because you start at starving and dehydrated state (and put in dying state in 10 seconds) with slow movement speed and you die like in ~20 seconds which is actually the time to walk to the closest tree/rock, break it down and craft a shovel // spear, it's pure RNG that the tree and the rock will spawn near campfire.

Another  thing is that you can die randomly by a thunder during rains, which is annoying when you almost done building stuff.

Overall, i like it. I think it can be better. So far it's interesting. The crafting system, while new and interesting, has a lot more issues then benefits. Like dragging a thing to another thing to make a new thing is nice but if you are even a little bit too close to something that that thing can combine with [strike]boom your day is borked[/strike]. 
I have been told that if you middle click on a crafted object it will be un-crafted. This can make the game's crafting better but with the time table being so fast seconds crafting and un-crafting could get you mauled by shadow chickens. (which was fun to type)

The graphics are something that could be over looked but with how little is on the screen as it is it would have been nice to have some better looking sprites.

This game is tagged as a "Casual" game however that is not true. This is a game with a far bit of difficulty. Although the difficultly is high it is the lack of enjoyment out of said difficultly that makes me not recommend this game.

Bottom line is this I can not recommend this game to most people as it will have very little reward for getting past the difficulty and the fact that it is tagged as casual when it is clearly not. Unless you are a lover of getting your rump kicked because of poor mechanics DO NOT buy this game.

name: Nightmare at the lighthouse
short_description: Nightmare at the lighthouse,the game starts with our hero working,then someone came, and this is where everything started.He have a mission, and until he complete his mission, he goes through danger's and horror, but before he discover what is happening in that lighthouse,everything is possible!
reviews:
Camera is terrible and the game runs like a donkey. wow. amazing game. played with my manfriend and we were both really rootin for the main cahracter. so many good spooks, scares and slime. am refunding Random crashes. It's like a freshman high school programming project somehow got uploaded on Steam as a finished product.

The broken english and sincerity in how ***SPOOOOKYYYYY*** it is hits so-bad-it's-entertaining levels occasionally but unfortunately not enough to justify anything other than a joke purchase with Steam bucks. I could only play this game for around 10 minutes or so before the wierd ass graphics started to hurt my eyes. Also there are alot of grammer and spelling errors in this game.

name: WARNO - Digital Guides
short_description: The Digital Guides give an unrivaled insight into WARNO‚Äôs conventional World War III as terrifyingly unleashed in 1989. Two e-books with close to 200 pages contain designer notes, background lore, division descriptions, gameplay tips, recommended books, and much more.
reviews:
You don't need this. The tips are solid but basic and some content is outdated, but there is some stuff about video game development if anyone would like to read those comments. At the time of writing this I have read ca 75% of the Digital guides.
This is just a nice way to give a small amount of money to the developers. Well, I guess I shouldn't have been surprised that you need to pay Eugen 10 bucks extra for a PDF of the game's manual. How is this not included in the base game? SO MUCH GREED.

They actually think the complete game is worth over 92.97 euros? I am gonna pay 100 bucks for a VIDEO GAME? Are they out of their minds?

Worst game ever.  No effort, totally random crap.  Worthless.  I will never buy Gachimuchi anything again. Hot Load ‚ôÇ‚ôÇ‚ôÇ‚ôÇ Roberta Gachimucci. Reading and voting games. If you did something wrong

Then I feel right here. Good game. There's nothing to tell Bill Herrington. China is difficult. The last voice of Nigeria. However, the people of Pobimuchi know this and have no knowledge or heart.

Overall, this is an exciting game. But wait. Yes, about the meeting. Starting. 0/10 I don't care. I miss Billy Farrington and the new members ‚ôÇDO‚ôÇYOU‚ôÇLIKE‚ôÇWHAT‚ôÇYOU‚ôÇSEEÔªø?

Thank you GOD BLESS. üò≥ very nice I, Billy Herrington, stand here today, humbled by the task before us, mindful of the sacrifices borne by our Nico Nico ancestors.

We are in the midst of a crisis. Nico Nico Douga is at war against a far-reaching storm of disturbance and deletion. Nico Nico's economy is badly weakened: a consequence of carelessness and irresponsibility on the part of acknowledgement, but also on the collective failure to make hard choices and to prepare for a new, MAD age.

Today, I say to you, that the challenges are real, and they are many. They will not be easily met, or in a short span of time, but know this, Nico Nico: they will be met. In reaffirming the greatness of our site, we understand that greatness is never given, our journey has never been one of shortcuts. It has not been for the faint-hearted, or who seek the fleshly pleasures. Rather, it has been the risk-takers, the wasted genii, the creators of MAD things. For us, they toiled in sweatshops, endured the lash of the spanking. Time and again, these men struggled, and sacrificed, so that we might ... LIVE BETTER.

We remain the most powerful site on the Internet, our minds no less inventive, and services no less needed than they were last week, or yesterday, or the day before the day after tomorrow. Starting today, we must pull up our pants, dust ourselves off, and begin again the work of remaking Nico Nico Douga.

Now, there are some who question the scale of our ambitions, who suggest our server system cannot tolerate too many movies. Their memories are short, for they have forgotten what Nico Nico already has done, what free men can achieve when imagination is joined to common purpose.

And so, to all the people who are watching this video, from the grandest cities, to the small villages where IKZO was born, know that Nico Nico is a friend to every man, who seeks the future of love and peace. Now we will begin to responsibly leave authorized common materials to Nico Nico people, and forge a hard-earned peace in this MAD world.

What is required of us now is a new era of responsibility. This is the price, and the promise, of Nico NiCommons citizenship. Nico Nico Douga, in the face of common dangers, in this winter of our hardship, let us remember these timeless words: ASS, WE CAN.

Let it be said by our children's children, that when we were tested by DOS attacks, when we were refused by YouTube, that we did not turn back, nor did we falter, and we carried forth that great gift of freedom be delivered, and safely to future generations.

Thank you. God bless, and God bless Nico Nico Douga.

name: RPG Maker MV - Nostalgia Graphics Pack
short_description: Travel way, way back in time to the beginning of the gaming era with this fantastic set of resources that are reminiscent of old school gameboy RPGs.
reviews:
While a little less Gamboy looking and more Gameboy Advanced looking, this DLC offers tons of bang for your buck. Assuming you get it on sale. 20 dollars is pretty steep for this.

Personally, the tilesets are a bit more detailed than I prefer, but the character models, enemy sprites, and music all add up to make it 100% worth it to me. EDIT: I have just found out where it is and i disagree with my old self. dlc is missing and does not show up in dlc folder

name: Street Level: Windows Edition
short_description: A fast paced cyberpunk card game!
reviews:
thumbs up. is it a great game? idk . but is it a game that you can have fun with, absolutely Great game. I beat it in about 1 hour, but it was a solid experience. It is sort of like that old TI-83 game Drug War, but with a cyberpunk theme. The whole game is just choosing "yes" or "no" to jobs, or fights, or to buy upgrades, etc. There is actually depth here, though, even with just 2 choices and the game can get intense. For the price and about an hour of time, seems worth it. One note, there is no save games and there seems to be a bug where the game loses control if you alt-tab. So you have to beat it in one sitting. You hit yes or no and then text appears. I.... I said the whole thing about the game now.

FULL REVIEW: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=moZ5UCoNtBg This game is an RNG adventure where your only options are to choose yes or no to the randomly provided action.  Actions provided include: upgrading stats, performing jobs, fights, healing, and chance encounters with local establishments.  

Probably one of the more difficult (see: frustrating) parts of the game is dying because you have no way to control when you can heal.  You have to wait until the heal prompt randomly pops up.  

The only other downside is that there's no way to turn the music off.  The music isn't terrible for the first couple of minutes, but I've got a playlist I'd rather listen to and no way of disabling the in-game music.

The game has potential to be a great little time-sink, but I think it's got some work ahead of it to truly BE great.  My recommendation comes with the caveat that the music be an optional thing. I beat it in 10 minutes - but could probably be entertaining for 30.  For 2 bucks, it's not buggy or overly complex, and will kill some time.  It's lack of depth and of the actions really meaning much (I just hit yes until my health was low, then paid for health, then hit yes on the jobs again) keep it from being a solid game, but for the pricepoint of 2 bucks, I'd recommend it for someone wanting to kill some time. Not a bad little game. I recommend it. It's a nice little time killer at a cheap price. The art work is simple, but It works for what the game is (And seeing as how I love neon and cyberpunk, I like it). It's a little tricky trying understand how some of the cards are going to behave, but I can see the appeal from a immersion aspect. It does feel like it's building a rudimentary world in a way.  There is a fair bit of reading on the cards, but once you get into the groove you begin to recognize them by appearance and can play it fast. I recommend it, and taking it for what it is, I give it a sold 7.5/10.

name: Odd Woods
short_description: Odd Woods is a survival crafting game in a forest environment. Build your base during the day to withstand the attacks of horror creatures at night. Explore, farm and hunt wildlife to survive another day.
reviews:
Challenging and realistically fun I am really enjoying this game. The environment really is the star of this game. I do understand that it is still in early access, and right now it is still "bare bones". However it does not take from the experience of playing. The map is huge the monsters are creative and the crafting survival is fun. 
Check it out for the price it is a great Early Access play. nope ! not yet anyway. So far, I'm enjoying this game. The premise of the game is tried and true. A base-builder, nightly horde defense game with necessary exploration. The creature design, uncertain of if they are assets or not, are terrifying. The game is still in early access and I'm excited to see what the dev does with it. The game is genuinely scary once night rolls around and it's easy to lose track of time (which is a good thing) while out wandering and exploring. If I had to offer feedback, I would suggest providing more base-building parts, perhaps more folklore monsters/cryptids and create a larger map with more POIs. There is a means of travelling faster than on foot; I feel as though there needs to be more (interesting) reasons to travel further out. Creating a larger map with more POIs sounds like the remedy for me. Also, the eating/drinking mechanic seems kind of brutal. There is a short buffer window where, after, if you haven't consumed water or proteins/carbs after your thirst/hunger meters have depleted, you drop dead. This isn't necessarily game-breaking with it's current settings, but it does take some of the fun and immersion out of the game as the real threats should be more focused on the monsters and not satiation. You shouldn't drop-dead after not having drunken or eaten anything within a 24-hour time period. I'm not saying it needs to be completely realistic, but it's currently unenjoyably harsh. Again, this is just my opinion, but I feel far more nervous about food and water than I do about the monsters, which says something as the monsters and the nighttime are genuinely terrifying and fun.

The ambiance of the game is unique compared to other games in the survival building genre and that, to me, is what really makes the game standout the most.

I'm hoping the dev does something to balance the food and drinking system. The game is fun and, compared to most other survival crafting horror games, scary. The dev has something special here with some additional content and fine-tuning. I would recommend strongly if you're a fan of survival horror crafting games. While the game has a modest offering, the developer‚Äôs tireless efforts have transformed it significantly.  from its initial release  It's a Good game give it a try. Note the game is still in very early access,
please bare that in mind. This game may seem like a simple survival game, as its a bit limited on building, crafting and such, but to be honest its very well done. The mechanics of the game seem to be well done along with the graphics are smooth and during my game play on it had no issues with graphics on highest setting. It can be a bit of a grind, especially with the limited storage and low stack count, but with the option to place things to build in a blueprint form and just load resources on the go finishing base building, storage racks and more, it honestly wasn't to bad. I really enjoyed the challenge of the enemy waves at night, some of them a bit tough, while others being easy, all on normal difficulty. This game really does have a unique concept to a survival game and has been fun, and hope to see it further grow, adding more to the game, for added play ability. Highly recommend this to anyone who loves survival games for sure. Odd Woods
to gather resources to build during the day to be repaired for the night attacks  
to grow food ,hunt,cook ,craft 

could do with a backpack or a way of making one

the game shows promise and potential It needs a lot more work but I feel it could be a good game. I'll be watchin. This game is not worth more than $1 its current state, as of Nov 10 2023. It needs a lot more work, in every area of the game, before being released to the public. A much better option is Mist Survival. Giving this a thumbs up for now cause it has potential however it still needs work

name: Armor Clash
short_description: Armor Clash is an RTS game of modern warfare, containing classic features like base building, unit training etc. Players can pick modern armors such as M1A2, T-14 to form identical legions. With realistic effects and fast paced battle, players will enjoy commanding their armored forces to break down the enemy.
reviews:
Pros:
1) A little bit of base building.
2) A decent variety of units.
3) Experienced based global abilities per game.
4) Can pick your loadout( or what your able to build in game) out of/before game and save 3 different loadouts.
5) Suprisingly for once, good scale.

What it needs:
1) Better environmental system of advantages and disadvantages. Height, cover, obstacles( firing lanes), and concealment.
2) Repair system.
3) Unit Vetrancy.
4) More variety of same type of units. Both in the armory and what your able to build. You should be able to build a couple different kind tanks, with differnt versions of each kind.
5) The armory needs at least 10x the selection for each unit. And it may need a point system in in of itself, to minimize exploitation, the cost of the unit in game might be enough to offset this, but I am not so sure.
6) More structures and implacements.
7) Bigger maps.
8) A little bit more zoom out.

Cons:
1) No campaign. For this type of game, its not really a con for me, but I know for a lot of people it is a deal breaker. Thanks but no thanks For the money it is worth it. I have enjoyed it thoroughly for the money spent. GOOOOOOOOOOOOD This game is not worth $20 in its current state. I don't regret my purchase, but I will generally support any rts game, that I think has potential, and this game does have that.

Pros:
1) A little bit of base building.
2) A decent variety of units.
3) Experienced based global abilities per game.
4) Can pick your loadout( or what your able to build in game) out of/before game and save 3 different loadouts.
5) Suprisingly for once, good scale.

What it needs:
1) Better environmental system of advantages and disadvantages. Height, cover, obstacles( firing lanes), and concealment.
2) Repair system.
3) Unit Vetrancy.
4) More variety of same type of units. Both in the armory and what your able to build. You should be able to build a couple different kind tanks, with differnt versions of each kind.
5) The armory needs at least 10x the selection for each unit. And it may need a point system in in of itself, to minimize exploitation, the cost of the unit in game might be enough to offset this, but I am not so sure.
6) More structures and implacements.
7) Bigger maps.
8) A little bit more zoom out.

Cons:
1) No campaign. For this type of game, its not really a con for me, but I know for a lot of people it is a deal breaker.
2) A lack of everything I stated it needs. :)

Overall its playable in its current state, and while I recomend the game, I do so only to those that understand what an early access/alpha/beta means and the kind of support and patience that indie/one person developers need. I will edit later accordingly. its good but number 2 LOOKS better irealy want 2 its a great game i love how i can customise my army and stuff great job from one dev good rts Just An Awsome Game Made By One Man amazing game the graphics game play one of the best rts games ever!!!! Okay for a $1

name: End of the Road VR
short_description: End of the Road VR, a Virtual Reality adventure horror. A game set in an atmospheric environment in a dark misty forest where your goal is to explore your surroundings and survive. Experience the horror from an intense VR perspective.
reviews:
ÊääËê•Âú∞Áî®Â±±Âõ¥Ëµ∑Êù•ÔºåÊêúÈõÜÂ§ö‰∏™ÈÅìÂÖ∑ÔºåÊâçËÉΩÈÄÉË∑ëÔºå 4/10
Graphics and sound are a bit pants. THis game is not well optimised and did not run well on my 2080 ti.
There are a few scares here, but there is no real game to speak of. You wonder aimlessly in a forest with a lamp until something gets you. I don't recommend this. THere are a lot better games out there. [h1] Experienced on the Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers [/h1]

The game took me about 50 minutes to complete. It does save your progress at certain checkpoints. However, you need to discover some items before the game saves. I think the game is probably closer to 30 minutes long but I was pretty dumb and didn't read carefully some notes I should have read that would have saved me a lot of headache. So please learn from my mistake and read everything!

The graphics and sounds are subpar. This game has an odd locomotion system. You basically look in the direction you want to go and then press left joystick to walk and press both left and right to walk faster. So you'll want to always be using both joysticks to move faster. Unfortunately, there is no smooth turning so you'll have to physically turn if you want to head the opposite direction. 

This game starts out by looking for clues in the cabin to find out what happened. Once you find the clues you'll be given general directions of where the next clue should be located. There are some jumpscares along the way. Meanwhile, you're supposed to avoid a monster walking around on the loose. If you have your light on, it attracts the monster. I found that I could see perfectly fine without the lantern so it wasn't as scary as it should have been.

This game does have some very gory scenes. Unfortunately, because of the bad graphics they look more like ketchup or tomato paste with deformed crash test dummies. Still, if you can forgive the visual fidelity, it's pretty gruesome. I did like the fog effect in the woods, that actually looked pretty cool. 

I liked the experience. I wasn't expecting much for the .99 cents sale price I paid on the VR Spring Sale on Steam. So it met my expectations. I definitely recommend this for any horror fan. This game has the right atmosphere and has a very slow and deliberate pace that just messes with your head.

Rate 6/10. Cool spoiler alert: [spoiler] You get to commit suicide by hanging if you want to quit the game! [/spoiler] This "game" is just an environment. There was one scare that was kind of cool, but other than that it's just a creepy cabin-in-the-woods setting at night.

name: Boring in paradise
short_description: Two arcade games in one: "Antipain" & "Antitrolley". The first is a pseudo-three-dimensional runner. The second is "anti-G.T.A.", which deals with the "trolley problem".
reviews:
Not worth the money kinda weird but not exciting in the least. "Boring in paradise" is a godawfully badly made collection of two crap minigames slapped together terribly with the blight on gaming that is GameMaker Studio (from Yoyogames)... yes, the Comic Sans of the game construction kit world.  There's a 2D top down car driving game, where if you hit a pedestrian, and you're epileptic, the developer tries to kill you.  There's no forewarning about the strobing flashes that occur, so if you're sensitive to those kinds of things, absolutely avoid this game.  There's also a very lame "dodging" game where you move left or right to try avoid the word "Pain", which is representative of the experience of trying to play garbage shovelware made with GameMaker Studio.  I've reviewed well over 500 games made with GameMaker Studio, and they've all been awful.  This game is square in the middle of typical for GMS. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to try to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics, at least it looks like that's what they were trying to do.  I don't know if there's a way to describe "art" that looks almost like it's pixel, but so badly made that it doesn't even make it that far.  It's clear that this is due to lack of budget or talent, and the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers.

Some of the defects in the game can be attributed to the choice of using the GameMaker Studio construction kit/toolset.  This is a very poor quality toolset favoured by amateur developers as it's cheap and requires little in the way of development skill, but unfortunately has very limited capabilities.  Just as you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear, you can't make a great video game if you use a terrible engine.  GameMaker Studio is often used to make retro pixel shovelware and cash grabs.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected in the general public reception.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the game all-time peak player count was only ONE player.  That's right, only one person ever played this at a time.  When I played this for the purposes of reviewing it, I equalled the peak player count for the game.  OUCH.  The only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from, the overwhelming lack of interest in the game is to be expected.  Gamers just didn't take this low quality game seriously, and for good reason.

Boring in paradise is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

[b]Note:[/b] Valve have marked this game as "Profile Features Limited" at the time of this review.  This is usually caused by poor sales figures for the game (to date).  Until this status changes, this game will not count towards your Game Collector counts, achievements or any other Steam meta-accomplishments, nor can it be displayed in some profile showcases.  If these factors are important to you, it may be worth holding off before buying this game.

name: Chromatic Fantasy
short_description: Charming and challenging puzzle game, in which fantasy creatures are trying to escape the dungeon imprisonment. Interactions between characters and obstacles are determined by their color.
reviews:
üëç I took upon the challenge...and failed miserably ^^"
Although my own ineptitude is not a reason to downvote something, it just means it's not my genre and I should let that sink in.
But my own shortcomings aside this little puzzle game features adorable dragons as main cast, plenty of flavor, soothing music, no time limits, ability to undo all the moves done and lots of puzzles based on movement that only stops when encountering an obstacle with a few twists like managing colored gates. Sound very simple and the rules indeed are. The difficulty comes with the execution and to my surprise it is indeed very difficult to create a proper path with often the dragons themselves being the stopping blocks so another can reach its destination.
There are aids in the game in case of being stuck but their usage is limited with charges and to regain them one has to return to previous level where they were used and beat it without using help. I'm very confident that all levels are perfectly doable without helping tools (using them denies you score after all) but I've ran out of ideas and charges myself making me hard stuck. It is certainly something for true puzzle enthusiasts and my brain proven too smooth. If I ever happen to be escaping a puzzle dungeon
I'll be mining my way out with my head banging against some wall ^^'
In the meantime I'll be joining the 56% with only 2 achievements out of 30 ^.=.^" I love this game.  It is a thinkers game that gives you time and opportunities to think.  I like that you can restart the levels as often as you need.  The levels get challenging very quickly.  I like that I don't have to take the time to go through a large number of easy levels before the real game begins.  Another great feature is the ability to undo several moves.  Not sure if this is unlimited, but is a great advantage to be able to go back some steps and not have to redo the whole level.  The music is relaxing and enhances the atmosphere of thinking and problem solving.   Clever and challenging puzzles, with no time limit.  I highly recommend this game.

name: Svarog's Dream - Return of the Old Gods Expansion
short_description: Bringing more action, expanding on the story, and everything else you liked in the core game.
reviews:
Recommended. Adds a lot of flavor. Everything an expansion should be - expanding content, classes, loot variety, and more. I hope there are more expansions of this caliber for Svarog's Dream in the future. It adds a lot of stuff and u notice a small amount of it right away. Thanks! This is a good game with responsive developers. What makes it stand out is superb story, as a lot of thought and effort was put into the main story line. Improves the main game in every way, absolutely worth it! I like the worldbuilding and the overall main quest line.
And the ironman-by-default approach is really intriguing, because it had me be a lot more careful about what I do.
It's on the jankier side, but in a lovable way. yup. Very smooth gameplay experience! Everything works beautifully and looks great. The new classes are awesome~ can't wait to dig into another great run

The donkey or the dog? It enhances and expands the amazing base game. So go for it. Consider that this expansion and even the main game cost less than silly cosmetics in other ARPGs! I did a very fun and thorough play through of the original game, and I am already digging into the game with the expansion. The devs have also been doing steady free improvements all year so you will be pleasantly surprised to return to it.

This game has a super relaxing atmosphere and a fun open world to explore that has some Witcher and Skyrim feel to it. I also really love hunting and alchemy. If you like games like Grim Dawn or PoE, you‚Äôll likely enjoy this game.

The main game with discount is cheaper than a fast food meal and the expansion is cheaper than a fancy coffee drink. This is a great value for gameplay.

Do yourself a favor and give the game a try!

name: qop 3
short_description: qop 3 is a minimalistic puzzle which goal is to get the cube to finish using 4 directions in space.
reviews:
I originally got this game specifically for the achievements, but the sliding puzzles are pretty solid! ^^ Similar like the ZUP-Series. Simple controls, brian game.

Good! üëç More trophies, more trophies fore me! Cheers The Steam-achievements just destroy your ears
tinnitus/10 elesqueremnoscontrolar-dasilva ‚úîÔ∏è Great game, various minimalistic puzzles that are not that hard to solve, the difficulty increases with the levels passed, but still managable to win it. Many achievements as well for you to add to your achievement count. I recommend this game, 10/10! Qop 3 - a really nice puzzle game with quick and easy achievements. It took me around 25 minutes to complete, with guides available as well. Simple
Clever
Quality

name: Metric Racer
short_description: Race through future cities and across the surface of other planets to out run, out maneuver and out pace your competition. Metric Racer, a fast paced, cartoon shaded futuristic racer.
reviews:
This game is great. The textures loaded. The ships moved. The pause menu opened. The resolutions can technically be changed. I'm amazed the game doesn't uninstall every single software on my computer and sets it on fire, very impressive. Abandoned Early Access game.
Do not buy if you are not okay with unfinished product. This game has come a long way, there's been a number of improvements, the handling is better, there's more tracks available now and the overall feel of the game has been polished with better controller support all around.
Worth checking out. If you want a high speed hover racer that doesnt suck, go play Redout. This game feels sloppy and awkward. You cant even drift or slide, the menus are buggy and break, controls are stiff, awkward and glitchy. It's effectively unplayable with a controller as well.

Theres no ability to strafe your craft, and the same button for right/left airbrakes, if you double tap them by accident, effectively 'teleports' your ship a short ways in that direction... often right into walls. The maps boosts are exactly the same as well, they dont give you a speed boost or anything, they just teleport you forward a bit. It makes the game feel awful and buggy. 

Seriously, just go play Redout, or wait for Redout 2. Impossible to control with a game pad. Bit messy but it's got potential. There's something off about this game, and I can't quite put my finger on it, but whatever it is gives me a headache. While this game is far from finished, I like the physics so far. It has a feel of Wipeout Fusion and a little bit of Pacer, while the tracks remind me of Redout. While the ship currently jitters a bit on corners, giving it a less solid feel, and there is currently no pitch control, I like the direction this is going in. Music is good, suits the game's aesthetics well. Like Redout, this game looks better in motion than it does in stills. I think it is worth the money and will be keeping a close eye on this one. [h1] has potential, but approach with caution[/h1]

it's in very very early access. but this show some promisse already. i'm surprised it didn't show on my radar sooner for an AG-racer fan like me. however, i must stress that the content of some tracks in the game is very, very incomplete. with some of them being unplayable (Terraformer is a good example on it). water surfaces are glitchy, and the ships needs more grip in my honest opnion... since, there seems to be no "brake" to speak of (you can decelerate if you let go of trottle tho, but the deceleration is very steep, so my strategy is to have a fine control on the trigger buttons, be tapping or gently pressing it on curves, to get the maximum my ship can give). lots of placeholders and stuff to be completed yet, but hey... it's a very early access game, so it is to be expected. 8 months on Early Access tho i think is a steep deadline in my opnion given the current situation of the world. if i were the developer i would give me more time... maybe an year or two given the pandemic, i mean, even without the pandemic i would give more time for the project to mature, if i was the head of it.

i'll give it a cautious recommendation for now. what i saw caught my atention but a lot of work needs to be done to solidify this project. so i'll show my support here. So far, this game has been highly unstable. Sometimes on some courses that I have raced on, I would constantly fly off the course for no reason. There would also be times where the main menu wouldn't load after a race. You could still go through it, but you would not be able to tell where you are in the menu since everything is black. I would suggest leaving this alone for at least a few years when its more successful. I just don't want to play a game that's just unstable and glitched.

name: Bad cat Sam
short_description: The cat, named serious Sam, is very upset when the house is in order and everything is in its place. Help Sam get inner peace.
reviews:
Cat is always cute. But his game is very boring. and poor controls -> not recommended. I made it to lvl 7 when it started to get tricky. I think a tutorial or at least hints would be a good thing, so you know when you get caught and when you can sneak by etc. It gets very frustrating that when you get caught you need to watch that scene to the end every time, would be nice if you could just press esc and restart or at least fast forward that part. Zoom out function to see the whole house would also be useful.
I find the game a bit to hard and time consuming when you need to watch the catch scene all the time, I can't really see kids enjoy the game with these difficulties but maybe I'm wrong. I do recommend it because it was still fun and a cheap game. The graphic isn't very appealing and feels a bit lackluster in my opinion.
I tried it because I like games where you have to sneak around and create a mess without being caught, but it didn't feel very engaging to play, and on harder stages of the game where you have trouble making it further, it just pairs with the frustration of the game being lackluster, so I didn't continue after the short time I played.

Others may forgive these parts of the game, but I couldn't, so I can't recommend the game, as there are more enjoyable games in this genre out there. ahahah, you wouldn't wish such a cat on anyone, but it's fun to be this cat. We bring the owner to the rage and substitute the dog to the fullest)))) 10 naughty cats out of 10 An interesting logic game, besides with a cat in the title role. If you ever wanted to be in the shoes of a bad cat living in the house?
Then 16 levels in this game will help you fulfill your wish A good parody of how to get a neighbor, now the second part can be released. Tom and jerry style It's like in the game "how to get a neighbor" to pass the time playing for a fat cat is the very thing. It's funny. I cried. The cat is bad. It seems to be all this, but in its own way. Played with the child, and probably will play again. A kind and fun game about a bully cat. I recommend it. Simulator of my cat's life at home :D

name: TerraTech - Kickstarter Skin Pack
short_description: This DLC pack contains 5 unique GSO skins that work across all game modes.
reviews:
Awesome If you aren't going to use GSO tech, then this is not for you. It only suits it if only you like all these GSO skins, which you most likely won't use simply because GSO has crap-tier everything except for the rockets and the big berta for oneshotting weak tech. If you are into them, however, go for it all you want. worth
i love charities Love the skins, plus Good cause epic New skins for ye olde boring GSO blocks and it is for charity. No reason not to get this tbh. Nice skins for a nice cause its for charity and we get some amazing skins for it
 Two things in +
1. It's nice pack allowing you to coloristically add GSO parts to others (the black + gold is really nice by itself)
2. Charity This is worth it, it goes to a relevant charity and gives you some dope items as a reward. I would encourage anyone to purchase this item if they have money to donate

name: The Great War 1918
short_description: TGW 1918 is a WW1 modification for Company of Heroes, focusing on the last year of the First World War. Currently it features the British Expeditionary Force and the German Empire as opposing factions; however new nations will be brought over time, such as France and Austria-Hungary.
reviews:
TO SLOW It is like the base game but with more stalemates. Same problems as "Europe at war"

"Game cannot run.  You have another game launch in progress".
 Love this mod and love the troop models. Computer still spams mortars and AT guns though Very good mod! and even if it's still not complete (only brittish and germans exist), it's amazing and it will be even more awesome when the french (and even later the austro-hungarians) are added :D GAS GAS GAS It's a great game it requires a lot of thinking sometime when in a staelmate similar to the real war and also apparently the Dev are back and are continuing the mod so far they made some announcement and I can't wait once they add the French faction so do not worry perople. THE MOD IS STILL ALIVE! :D

name: Nanairo Reincarnation
short_description: Join spirit detective Kagami Makoto and his demon familiars as they hunt down the wandering ghosts disrupting the peace of his small town.
reviews:
See demons and ghost right there? Smash em!!!

This VN start slow,but gonna get interesting once you got in Complication, so be patient reading it till get that. 

There are 4 heroines here(Well I am disappointed demons are not romancable, well they are your slave so...), all of them still talking about spiritual thing that happen to 'that girl'
1. Iyo : To be honest,I don't know why her route exist. Like... her route only there for she got smashed
2. Yumi : She is what you call natural beauty, shy, long hair, and moreover ex that don't want separated with you. [spoiler] All of her route is talking about her past with MC [/spoiler]. She is my best girl here.
3. Azusa : Police detective that will help you a lot in this story. Her route to be honest bland. All of her route just talking about how old woman never find a true love or something. Well at least, here, we can romance that type of girl. 
4. Kotori : She basically the main and center heroine. Her route is mostly talking about life and how she waste it and regret it. She is the sweetest one than other heroine. Her route is full of wholesomeness, till the end chapter [spoiler] gonna hit you so hard [/spoiler]

I am not really good reviewing this one. But if you need VN that not in school. Here is your choices. Meet the loli baba, high school girl, ex- that have nee-san body, and old lady who never be loved, they are gather in this VN to be romanced

Overall the storytelling in this VN was soo good that make me absorbed in their story. I am just a bit disappointed this VN was short. Kikyou is my fav!

The soundtrack is pretty good! The characters are all lovable and the artworks is sooo good, the artist does improve a lot since this game came out though.

If you like spiritual stuff then this is good for you, I like youkai stuff, there is also ghost/spirit in this which I am quite spook out to be honest because I am not good with ghost stuff....

Overall the story is quite good since it got mystery and detective stuff in it. Got hook to the story till the end and it left me an impact.

trying to get all endings now.

What makes me buy this? Honestly the artworks itself makes me buy it when I first saw this.

EDIT : I got all the endings now, Surprisingly serious at times story from 1 of my favorite writers, artist, and 2 of my favorite VA‚Äôs. Really enjoyed this but my main gripe is I wish it had more unique routes without so much overlap between them.

8/10 A heart whelming VN.

Is worth it. Great VN. Sure, as usual the H-scenes sound like a chipmunk drowning in a bucket of Elmer's Glue but the story is very entertaining.
The (free) H-scene patch is probably  a must since the scenes are central to the story. I love this visual novel. But I again must comment on the dyeing of black hair to become blonde. Kurokami (black hair) must be bleached to become Kinpatsu (gold or blonde) hair. 

Sometimes the wording is awkward because the writer will use a word that isn't correct or one that conveys the wrong idea. 

Umu (yes, right, yep, uh-huh, good, etc.) is translated as harumph, which is jarring and does not feel right. Iyo is not Sheogorath.

The writer treats the reader like they are some idiot who cannot understand any Japanese whatsoever and writes whatever they think is "cool."

Unfortunately the R18+ patch isn't working for me so I missed out on the action. Pretty cool game from the creator of 9-nine- and Liminal Border. It might appear light-hearted at first glance, but it actually has pretty much everything possible, because Kazuki Fumi writes thrilling mystery, funny comedy, and touching drama. It's not perfect, and I'd wish for better side routes (go straight for Kotori during your first playthrough and think about the rest later) and better foreshadowing for the culprit, but overall it's still a strong emotional story Come for the plot, stay for the story. goodbyes and the bittersweet memories that linger, with a lot of h-scenes
if you get the patch, the cgs are high quality and maybe a little unruly at times, but with that in mind, there are some very enduring moments considering this genre of game
plot points aren't too complex, but can really hit home at times
a solid 7.5/10 maybe I am a furry

short_description: DASH, BOOST, DRIFT, SHOOT! A challenging space shooter with tons of eye candy. A game to master for the highest score or to have a break with while waiting for other games or just to have some couch co-op fun.
reviews:
Before I forget: Burst Drive is like Space Smash!
Heartily recommended.
