name: GoFetch
short_description: Who's a good dog? YOU ARE! In GoFetch you get to be the dog and get the ball. Race through different terrain and mazes in a variety of unique maps, get the ball and bring it back! Many different dogs with different colors!
reviews:
No multiplayer ,lame gameplay, lame dog selection, and worst of all 



no sex A pretty peculiar game for reminiscing the dead of your long lost man‚Äôs best friend. I really like the idea of playing fetch as a dog.
I wish it felt more dog like instead of just a minimap quest through a maze.
The content that is here is pretty good but could be much better with some polish.

https://youtu.be/4NH6DtUwZ9A .

name: Evil Genius 2: World Domination
short_description: A satirical spy-fi lair builder where YOU are the criminal mastermind! Construct your base, train your minions, defend your operations from the Forces of Justice, and achieve global domination!
reviews:
Really fun, if you have time to kill I have nothing bad to say about. It is on the simpler side, don't expect Stellaris out of this. 4 / 10
TLDR:  Tedious.
Moments of fun like delicious sprinkles on a birthday cake made of porridge and gravel.  
Starts off well but, the longer you play, the less sprinkles there are.  Mainly just waiting (and porridge)...  Waiting for the loooooonng drawn-out story beats and tech tree advances to drop.  Meanwhile you fiddle with your base layout and fight off wave-after-wave of easy-beat mook invaders which at some point suddenly become MASSIVELY OP - with absolutely NO mid point transition.  I mean I guess I could start again or possibly reload a save from back when I cared...  Nah.  Life is too short.  Go out and touch some grass.  Uninstall. Overall good game, you'll have fun; especially if you're into dungeon building games. A bit lackluster if you compare it with EG1. Greetings Evil Geniuses (2),

This is a base builder with a twist. You are evil. Love it !

Lots of satire, good graphics, intelligent re-play scheme. :)

10/10. Buy. I love causing pure chaos in my lair, making everyone fight to the death and to see who comes out on top and letting the winner walk all the way up to my inner sanctum just to be turned to gold, forever idolized as my number one minion... I really enjoy my time playing this game. Poorly written, designed and thought out, internally inconsistent

does run well on steamdeck tho It's sad to see, the game is mostly there, and then all parts just don't click into place. A real bummer. This game was fun at first but the further you get into it the more you observe the lazy game design. 

1. Mobs of investigators and soldiers just come through the same entrance over and over. 
2. World map is too needy. 
3. A lot of copy and paste side quests. 
4. Some units are pretty bugged and don't offer enough control over. 


Only worth it on a super special...

Unforunately they missed the mark on this one. Farily fun but not recommended. 6/10. I dont know why, but the game is not so fun, unlike EG1. The first EG got alot of things we could do and also there is a mod that can support the game. However, unfortunately, for this game it does not able to support mods, much things worse, you can make a multi-level base but you limit the minions up to 300 only? I mean it is too small and inconvenience, you are as a EG should have more armies and able to get alot of them to work and finish the mission quickly instead had to wait and segregate them accordingly and had to micromanage all the time.

name: Matchbox‚Ñ¢ Driving Adventures
short_description: Jump into your vehicle and use your imagination to tackle missions and win races. Navigate dynamic landscapes, earn medals, and Drive Your Adventure.
reviews: TRASH. This game is really fun, it‚Äôs cool to see the matchbox cars in a video game and the adventure mode is pretty good. A solid game with a good choice of Matchbox vehicles to race. I played using the Steam Deck and it works great. If you are a collector like myself, this might be a game you've really been waiting for. Worth checking out! I‚Äôm a 43 year old dude and this game reminds of the kind of game I would get as a kid back on Christmas morning. It‚Äôs not Forza Horizon but it‚Äôs a solid, fun driving and racing game that lets me start out driving a Mail vehicle (Ps, I‚Äôm a mailmanüòÜ). I got it on sale for $27.99 which I think is about as high as I‚Äôd go with this one. Also it plays and runs great on the Steam Deck. Pretty good looking game, all things considered. Do yourself a favor, be a kid again and give this one a tryüöóüöëüöê

name: Courtin' Cowboys
short_description: It's 1863 and you, the player, are traveling through the small western town of Summerfair. Meet up to 7 love interests and discover their deliciously dark pasts... as well as their current horrifying misdeeds.
reviews:
Jak I love you but Florence has my heart VERY GOOD AND YUMMY GAME William you have bewitched my body and my soul I'm pretty mixed on this one. But overall, good enough to get a positive from me. 

PROS 
- pleasant art 
- customization !! very cool 
- sfw mode 
- Dijon :D
- mini games
- multiple routes, very replayable 

CONS
- some of the characters had MUCH more content than others. 
- typos in the script
- felt rushed in some areas
- easy to softlock yourself
- hard to get every route without looking up a guide. 

Overal, pretty solid dating sim! Def an improvement from lovers trophy (still good, but this one is much more interactive) I'm looking forward to seeing Mr fish's future work :) Absolute fan. I just wish you could interact with Jak as much as you do with Dijon. Wish Amon was an option too One hundred and twenty one hours. 121 Hours. Is how many hours I have in Courtin' Cowboys, as of writing this review.

If you think thats because i enjoy the game, youd be... partially right!

Let me explain my experience.
Open the game. Of course. Play game, also of course. I'm talking to the characters and having a pretty good time! Theyre all interesting and fun to talk to, funny, overall well rounded! At least at first. 
Eventually you keep playing and you realize youre getting nowhere fast. You've romanced all the characters, but you know that isnt all there is to the game. Where are all the scenarios I'm missing? Are these few routes all there is to the game?

No! The issue is, um, theres no tutorial or explanation on what to do. And it'd seem obvious, go around talking to people and whatnot, but the issue is that for new players this system just isnt intuitive. To get certain specific character interactions you have to talk to specific characters in a specific order with specific responses. I thought it was just a me being stupid issue, but on the community here you can see others being confused too. This sucks majorly because theres so much stuff to see, but so many players may not have seen it all.

It might be better if the way you unlock new scenarios was interesting, but all you'll really be doing is banging different characters in different orders. With the same dialogue. And the same artwork. It's not really fun... Like seriously, you'll be seeing the same sex scenes over. and over. and over again. Just to get new sex scenes...? This game is nsfw, i get it, but that doesnt excuse the lack of variety to be seen. It also doesnt help that some of the art is really basic and not really interesting to look at over and over. If youve played you know the ones

This became really grating as I went on trying to get all the routes. Its unfortunate too because most routes focus on the same few characters. You'd better hope your favorite is Jak or Dijon, because they make up a majority of dialogue. Dont get me wrong, they are great characters! But theres so many others that are pushed to the wayside for seemingly no reason. You like Jade? She has one short little romance route and then in all others she dies. Magnolia? Much the same. Theres a difference between having main characters and whatever this is.
It also feels weird because the characters with the least dialogue and intrigue are the women... Jade especially is done dirty as the one trans character who also so happens to have the least amount of dialogue. Let our ladies have some more interactions, please? 

I could also go on about the grind that is 100%ing this game with all the money you have to collect and all the stuff you have to cook, but that's all optional, so it isnt a big deal but man it would be nice if the snake minigame gave you a liiiittle more money.

Speaking of money, 9$ for Courtin' Cowboys... Is it worth it? Wuhhhhh I dunnoooo... Im gonna say yes? I did really enjoy the characters, theyre the main driving point for me. If I hadnt got Courtin Cowboys I wouldve missed out on these guys that I actually really enjoy and continue to pine for. Even if the game drove me crazy trying to pry more content out of it... Id get it again. "This better not awaken anything in me..." 
(it did)
Typically don't play games with dark kinks, but I love a visual novel that adds extra fun stuff like character creation and mini games. Gave it a try and soon realize that this page wasn't lying when it said it wasn't like typical other dating games. 
You don't woe a character week by week by week, then get a cinematic ending. 
You end up talking to them one or two times, and soon are doing the dirties with them.
Each of the characters have their own lil personalities, some more charming than the others-some more mysterious that give hints that this world has a dark otherworldly presence that makes me sooo sad we don't learn more about. 
 The REAL fun is literally "f*cking around and finding out"-who you choose to court first might have certain(NERVOUS LAUGH) reactions to you courtin others. 
Experimenting who to sleep with, choosing different options in a character's routes, and discovering these events were very addicting and traumatizing. lol  Few of the complains I have is definitely the mini games, the snake game drags a bit and I have to mute the game and put my playlist with upbeat music so I don't zone out. And I don't know if it's cause I suck at the fishing game, but soo many times I end up running out of time before filling the bar. Cutting the bar down or making it that you get a fish every time but it's quality is depended on how far the bar is filled would have saved my slow ass. Clicking the berry bush, getting one random berry. then being kicked back out of the berry area is tedious to do over and over again until your energy runs out. Instead, the three bushes should be different  options on how many berries you want to collect, first one being 3 berry with the average energy cost, second being like 5 with half your energy , and last being 9-10 with all your energy cost or something.  
But other than the mini games and the short gameplay- if we ever get more Courtin Cowboy content I will slap my credit card on the table. Repeatedly. It's a dating sim with dark mysteries and cowboys. What not to love about it?

The story is really intresting and the different routes keep you busy. The art style is also great. I really hope to see more games like this! I wake up, I think about florence... I go to sleep, I think about florence.... (fishing rhythm game is also extremely addictive) Good.

name: Sokobos
short_description: Sokoban meets Greek tragedy! Sokobos is a minimalistic & challenging puzzle game that expands on the classic block-pushing formula.
reviews:
Very fun sokoban puzzle game. Do recommend! I have to admit to feeling proud for finally finishing this Ancient Greeks-themed sokoban game, but not because I've demonstrated great prowess or procedural insight - no, I'm proud because I've doggedly persevered for more than 49 hours spread over nearly a year to complete 90 levels (base game and DLC) in spite of my many false starts and failed strategies! So many times I've had the end of a level apparently in my grasp, only to realise that there's a fatal flaw. But the eventual successes were sweet, and never did I feel that the game itself was at fault, just my lack of skill and foresight. In fact, I found Sokobos to be a very clever and attractive game, with some novel mechanics (like having to make pieces the right colour by moving them over areas of paint), and with appropriate overarching mini-stories (building & decorating a temple, and negotiating a maze to try to get Aphrodite's approval for a marriage). All credit to the developer for producing very tricky but somehow compelling (rather than off-putting or discouraging) levels. Great devilish little puzzles that are satisfying to complete.  It rapidly throws in some complexity and difficulty, but never impossible - undo is unlimited, you can save your place and there is no time limit, so you can "try, try again" and it's really just a matter of getting your moves in the right order. Soothing yet challenging game.
Good level design, on point graphics with a nice atmosphere.
Recommended and worth the price. The game fully delivers on its promise to expand the classical Sokoban aka pushing blocks.
There's a lot of cool and interesting mechanics such as painting blocks, rotating them.
What I really like is that you don't just push boxes around instead you are assembling pillars, statues, benches, etc.

The art style is unique, reminds me of Baba Is You a little but most importantly it is very clear and readable. The story is also a very nice addition, especially for the Sokoban genre.

Easy recommend, especially for the low asking price, can't wait to play more. Very good puzzle game. Worth every cent you should buy it. The DLC is equally worth it. I've barely scratched the surface and already managed to get great challenges on early levels, but I already know I'll stay with this production for longer.
Great level design, artstyle very well fits itself in each aspect.
More games like this! Very nice Sokoban game with a few interesting mechanics!
Another great puzzle game by Daisy Games.
Definitely recommended, if you like Sokoban. Great Sokoban with a cool Greek theme. The game ramps up quick with absolutely brutal puzzles that'll leave you feeling like a genius when you solve them. Definitely worth checking out! Great game, quite hard. Neat style.

name: Undead
genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Strategy
short_description: Can you survive in this mystical world that conquered by Zombies? Pick your hero, upgrade your abilities, crush your enemies and zombies!
reviews:
legit no players, very boring. I got this game back in 2017 I think. its in my opinion a goog game but you will run into the problem that no one else thinks so so there is never any one online. Make shore to fix the graphics issue at the start by turning up video settings till you find the right one  and last and most importatly don't make my mistakes. Get the game witha freind to play it with. That is truly how to enjoy this game. Bye. P.S.
its more worth it when there is sale going on im sure you can wait. really shit game the game is fantastic but thers so few players Boring, sad, terrible, small, no players, asset flip? and not worth anybodys time

name: Fighting Clans
short_description: A true, FIRST VR Street Fight! You‚Äôre just a regular guy, doing your best to get by, but you made your choices and now you‚Äôre in debt to the mafia. The only way you are going to save yourself is to fight. Prepare to engage in combat with no limits, no rules. You fight to win, you win to survive.
reviews:
i take it back i hate it theres no street fighting moves that you can do, even though it was advertised that you could do them. the enemy just blocks everything and barely reacts to your punches, resulting in you having to do stupid shit to beat them. Abandonware. I only need 5 minutes to see how bad this game is.

First off, there are only 3 settings - Texture Quality, Post Processing Off or On and Effects. No sound, no shadows, shaders, model quality, no control remapping - nothing.

Secondly, there's no indication that the "other" modes aren't there or anything. You try to select them and nothing happens - so why not put a note saying "These are not in the game yet"?

Now, into the fighting - you are thrown in with no tutorial, no guidance, nothing. You have to figure out how to play this game yourself.

So there's me, wondering what do I do? I use the left stick, I can't move, I use the right stick, I can't turn around??? How come the enemy gets the ability to go around me but I don't get that same luxury?

The indicators of whether or not you've done damage or how much aren't there. You punched him but... Did it hit him? Did it hurt him? If so, how much did it hurt???

Then, there's the controls. You are not told what each button does but when you use it, it's still confusing. The only thing I figured out is that the face buttons on the right controller do a right kick (a detached foot comes up) and for the face buttons on the left one, you do a left kick. But both buttons work - is one a lower kick and a higher kick??? There's really no way to tell since it happens so fast.

Then there's also the indication that you are "tired" which is just a heavy breathing noise. Not sure how I'm meant to tell at what point I can't kick/punch, but apparently I'm meant to.

It also appears to be abandoned by the devs, who are updating a new game that they've released instead of finishing their current one.

Overall, I'd say this could be fun with polish, clear guidance and better design, but in the end it lacks all of those. If the developers want input they should contact me and I'd provide feedback. In a nutshell, the concept of the game is the only worthwhile part. The mechanics are completely unrealistic and totally not responsive. It's waaay too easy and punches are thrown and then land out of sync in totally unrealistic ways. I beat the entire game in less than 20 minutes, first try (and you probably will, too). The developers should try to get in touch with whoever made Thrill of the Fight. Those mechanics are the best I've experienced. I would not by this game unless some major work is done to improve the realism and responsiveness. As a lifelong martial art practitioner I enjoyed the simple gameplay and a real adrenaline rush associated with a sparring. Good cardio workout too. Looking forward to it being developed further; took me less than an hour to get through all the opponents, including generous breaks between fights. Attempted to play through this to find there is no locomotion nor turning so, I spent most of my time in game dangerously close to beating a wall. No instructions whatsoever, tried every button and couldn't manage to figure out how to kick.
I enjoyed the grappling of arms but it wouldnt last long due to my enemies always backing out of my reach, then when they come back into range I get hit by a series of unblockable attacks.
I love fighting games and I'd love to see this one improved upon later, but as it is now, its a swinging match. This is the best vr game in terms of price / quality. I recommend everyone to play this indie masterpiece at least once. This game is a let-down. The mecanics are non-intuitive and slow, and the game content is limited to 3 opponents, who are +/- identical. A let-down for sure, compared to e.g. "Thrill of the Fight". its a good game not much wrong with it, i suggest this to others who like this style

name: Moto Racer 4 - Season Pass
short_description: In a world where freestyle and risk-taking dominate, impose your riding style all around the world. Impress your opponents and win races with class!
reviews:
It's honestly overpriced in my opinion.
I have to give this my negative review.
Sure, it gives you a ton of cool things.
But it's mostly a bunch of uselessness.
Three new riders with two bikes each.
Six 'exclusive' horns, yea, that's great.
Do people even use those horns? No.
And three exclusive emblem stickers.
This is just a pointless customization.
It also gives you the two map packs.
Those maps are alright in my books.
It is cheaper to buy 'em individually.
This season pass is just overpriced.
I really don't recommend buying it.
Two DLC's are nice, others are bad.
And I'm giving it a negative review. "Season pass holders will have automatically all the new dlc planned for 2017 
- New game modes - New tracks"
As of May 2017, not a single word about any new content planned for this game. 
Thumbs down for the false advertising. Save your money and spend it elsewhere.

name: Lara Croft GoL: Hazardous Reunion - Challenge Pack 3
short_description: Four new challenge maps featuring mind-boggling puzzles, waves of intense combat action, and a fiery reunion with an old friend.
reviews:
This time we get 2 more horde maps with high scores to clear, one puzzle area to finish within 2 minutes and a chase sequence where a fish boss is following you. To get the objective there you need to collect enough points through gems you find along the way. This challenge pack is considerably more challenging than the previous 2. The horde maps are timed and very hectic. You‚Äôre basically forced to move around and keep a certain rhythm instead of cheesing it compared to the previous horde maps. Likewise, the chase map also got chaotic and very hectic. The puzzle area was very good, the kind that makes you feel smart once you finish it. But it does get a bit frustrating/challenging when you try to finish it within 2 minutes for the objective. 

This third pack seems like a natural conclusion in terms of being the most challenging pack and ending it with a boss. It was fun but I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs the best since I enjoyed challenge pack 2 a lot. It‚Äôs still worth looking into when it‚Äôs on sale and you want more Lara Croft. This "Challenge Pack" provides Four Challenge Tombs (2 Combat, 1 Puzzle and 1 "Hazard Traversal"):
[h1]Leglion's Lair[/h1]
Combat map with many large spike crusher traps which you can trigger and use to your advantage. Overall this combat arena doesn't really do anything different to the others, the only main difference here is that the arena is spider themed.
("Leglion" was an optional Boss battle in level 3: Spider Tomb)
[b]Note that combat arena tombs are quite simple as they have none of the following features:[/b]
Remaining enemy counter, Wave counter or a method to view your past high scores whilst playing the map.
[h1]Puzzle Soup[/h1]
The ONLY Puzzle map in this DLC and while it is good and definetely the trickiest of the DLC Puzzle tombs, it is still very short and doesn't introduce anything new like the Puzzles in the previous challenge pack (See "Blast Lifts" from my previous review). I enjoyed this Tomb apart from the final "puzzle" in the level.
[h1]Firefighters[/h1]
The final Combat map! This one is by far the most difficult and takes place in a Lava Arena with Small Mazes, Rotating Flamethrowers and delayed activation fire tiles. The Traps in this Tomb are very deadly to the enemies as well as the player themselves. Moving around the map is a must, as the tankier enemies will crowd and corner you very quickly. Ensure that you have already maxed out Relics, Artifacts and collected all weapons before attempting this map! I enjoyed this map but feel like it throws far too many enemies at you too quickly without time to gather ammo/health. This lack of breathing room makes the map much more stressful than it should have been.
[h1]Lava Chompy[/h1]
The final DLC map is a Hazard navigation tomb very similar to the "Jaws of Death" map from the main game. In fact, the boss from that level is reskinned here! (He has a very cool cracked molten lava style)
Difficulty-wise, this is easily the HARDEST tomb in the entire game (Including all the DLC). The clunky keyboard movement and ridiculous knockback from enemy projectiles will get you killed far MORE than the usual honest slip ups. I have no issues with any of the other maps in this game, but the difficulty spike in this tomb was absolutely insane. I recommend playing in Co-op, if you can be bothered. But I honestly would not recommend this final map to anyone who wants a fair and suitably challenging experience, as that is NOT what you will receive.
[h1]Overall Rating: 5/10 - Length of content = 18 to 30 minutes[/h1]
Puzzle Soup and Firefighters were the highlights for me. The other two maps were either too generic or plain unfair to enjoy.
Overall, I would recommend this pack solely to enjoyers of the combat in this game, as puzzle-wise, this Challenge Pack sucks (Only 1 [i]mediocre[/i] tomb).
If you enjoy Combat or Puzzles, I would recommend the following Challenge Packs:
[b]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/35138/Lara_Croft_GoL_Hazardous_Reunion__Challenge_Pack_3/]COMBAT ARENAS[/url]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/35136/Lara_Croft_GoL_All_the_Trappings__Challenge_Pack_1/]PUZZLE TOMBS[/url]
[/b] NICE Okay da Another challenge pack, but better than the second pack, at least. Also Recycled from main game. Got all the DLC from a bundle, they add a lot more content. Very Challenging! That's all I have to say. And this isn't the good type of challenging it's the bad type of challenging. 3 of the 4 challenges are pretty hard and are very hard to get the Top Challenge Spot. I like challenging but not like this. I'd say only get it if it's on Sale but I will Reccomend it simply because the Level Design is nice and it does offer great replay value, once you get the hang of how challenging these are. It's not worth it.

name: Drums of War
short_description: Drums of War is a VR music-driven action adventure game that is a cross between Overlord and Donkey Kong Jungle Beat. Bang on a virtual drum kit to move your orc and unleash a powerful arsenal of weaponry.
reviews:
I played this with my friend, I HAD to buy it! This game is really excellent! Great work Devs and THANK YOU!!!  I cant stop playing Drums of War,, anybody that does not have this game in their Library, well I'm truly sorry for ya, your missing out on astounding graphics, awesome beats during intense unique combat, plus so much more that are in this vr experience,  I'm actually gonna cut this review short so I can go back to playing it! I enjoyed this game. The drumming controls are straightforward and intuitive; I didn't have any problems moving around the game or fighting enemies. 

The gameplay is super fun, and combat has a surprising amount of depth with just two modes of fire and two modes of movement.

I highly recommend Drums of War for anyone who wants a fun, easy pickup and play VR game or a fun new party game to share with their friends.

name: Lost Records: Bloom & Rage Soundtrack
short_description: This carefully crafted dreampop and ambient soundtrack is steeped in nostalgia and ethereal vibes, with tracks that'll linger like memories long after summer.
reviews:
Great soundtrack for a great game <3 

SEE YOU IN HELL! One of the best soundtracks i ever heard in a game In hell
Time to repent
For the fear, the harassment, and the harm that you did

name: Dawn Awaits
short_description: The journey of a girl and her toy cat escaping a fractured home into a mesmerizing world of mirrored steps and emotional challenges.
reviews:
a short and sweet game about navigating trauma--really liked how they tied in the story to the platforming elements! The platforming itself is a bit challenging with some pretty tight jumps, but solving the puzzles and getting to the end is very rewarding! the journal entries are super pretty!! feeling very inspired for my own journal lolol. overall a very cute game with interesting ideas! I really love the storyline and the design of dual characters in this game! The artwork and sound effects build up tension and reveal a heart broken story gradually. The levels are definitely challenging, so I'm still enjoying the process. Looking forward to see the ending!

The game has a very novel mechanism, which tests the player's ability to switch attention. I especially like the diary part of the game. As an East Asian child, I can relate to many things...
At present, my expectation is that there could be more levels. I look forward to the subsequent DLC!
(I found that the developer liked and rewarded every comment, and she really loves the players)

name: Animals Memory: Horses
short_description: Animals Memory: Horses is a card game with pictures of different horses that will test your memory. The aim of the game is to find pairs of cards.
reviews:
Awesome! Cute Horses This is a classic memory game with animals. It also has easy achievements, however I would not recommend buying this game at full price, as it is quite expensive and goes onto 90% sale often. Animals Memory: Horses.

+ Easy completion. Animals Memory: Horses is a card game with pictures of different horses that will test your memory. The aim of the game is to find pairs of cards.

Game features:
- Different levels of difficulty. From simple to complex.
- 30 cards with images of horses.
- It develops memory and is suitable for children of all ages, babies, preschoolers, school children, teenagers and adults.
- 18 levels. Ranging from lightweight to large and complex levels. Animals Memory: Horses is the eighth game in the series that presents 18 unique memory tests displaying a selection of beautiful horses. There are 30 achievements which are connected to the amount of levels passed. This version of Animals Memory is on par with the difficulty of the cats version.  The sound track was definitely an improvement compared to the rest in the series.   Rate 7/10 based on difficulty and content provided.  The horses can easily be distinguished between others with a couple having similar colors, but differing positions which made it slightly helpful.  Will say though, this game was the best out of all Animals Memory games created by Laush Studio.  Looking forward to more games in the series and whatever else the developer has in store for us! A memory matching game about horses. Harder than others in the series (at least for me) because a lot of them are similar and I don't know any to begin with. It's OK, but an easy 100%. Well, not a bad game, unique, cool art. Great if you like horses or achievements I love dogs & dinos or even cats more, but its fine

name: The Turgenev Study
short_description: A unique arena game of dodging, harvesting and assimilating enemies under a microscope with a relaxing soundtrack.
reviews:
Cute little arcade game. Worth buying if you're interested in a unique spin on retro rogue-lites. I also recommend checking out Punkcake's other works; I really enjoy Shotgun King and Ecstatic. I think this game is a good example of how you can come up with a novel concept for a game not just by thinking what the player can do, but what they have to react to. The Turgenev Study was apparently part of a larger project where games had to have some sort of mechanic that revolved around it happening every ten seconds. It's this weird feeling where a game has action but it feels so relaxed at the same time, and having a mechanic that simultaneously defeats enemies while setting up for getting their abilities is fantastic. A single play session will likely last under three minutes or less until you get better at it, so yeah, it's hard, but still highly enjoyable to play.

High Score is currently 958 pts at wave 37. ooh this is intriguing
i like the theme and atmosphere If someone's complaining about this game and hasn't played for at least an hour, they quite simply don't know what they're talking about! (note: I've played for several hours on the itch version, I just bought it again on steam to support the devs!)

Punkcake are masters of making utterly unique -- mechanically as well as stylistically -- hopelessly addictive ("in a good way") gems, and this is another one of them. Just tons of smart little ideas, all intertwined, in a beautiful package. It starts very simple, and incrementally gets more complicated, forever (or at least, for a very long time -- I'm stuck on mission 15 or something). If you're bored of the missions, try playing for a highscore; it is, after all, an arcade-action game at the core.

If only there was a thumbstick-based control option, my stupid mouse-based RSI wouldn't be hurting so much. ;-; Punkcake's MO generally leads to all of their games (barring Shotgun King) to having this weird "undercooked" vibe to them, and The Turgenev Study is no exception to that issue. Don't get me wrong: the visuals and sound design are absolutely perfect and the "play and work out the mechanics" concept actually *functions* here unlike in Metavaxx... but man there's just this constant feeling that this game could be so much more than it is. 

So get this, you're this weird lil harvesting microbe trying to chomp down some tasty bacteria to research it. You got enemies that just constantly get in the way by not doing any damage to you but bumping you around, you got enemies that slowly creep over to you, enemies that rush you once you harvest something, enemies that just rush you in general always, the list goes on. Despite the general appearance of the game, it's NOT a "survive as long as you can" game (although you can play it that way), but rather a game where you are given three objectives and asked to complete them over the course of several games. Once those are complete, you unlock a new enemy type, or a new mechanic, and gain another three objectives. It works really well!

The problem is the game doesn't quite convey that properly for one thing but also you can only take two hits full stop before your game ends. Sure, you can unlock an enemy type that will give you more health but (a) that requires you to complete the THIRD (!) objective set, and (b) you have to not only harvest them once but then assimilate them just to gain one (1) extra set of two hits. You WILL die a lot in this game. The AI is *vicious*, and its not helped by the insane amount of "drone" enemies that can and will bounce you to the other side of the miniscule arena (which remains miniscule even once you expand it, frankly.) It's...frustrating. I want to progress but rarely am able to purely because its so obscenely difficult out the gate for no real reason and its completely at odds with its otherwise really pleasant and calming atmosphere.

I love it *purely* on the fact that they absolutely nailed the sheer style of this game, it's absolutely gorgeous and feels like a "bit Generations" game from the GBA. I just wish it would get more time to cook so it's not as actively annoying to play. Very more-ish. the game was fun but in a hour there was a glitch that caused the game to be stuck on a black screen and it wont go away even after unstalling and restalling  please fix this uhhhh....i started playing and time traveled 5 hours into the future...BE CAREFUL!

name: CONSORTIUM VR
short_description: You are Consortium Bishop Six, a celebrity peacekeeper in the year 2042. Choose to speak out loud using your own voice to shape relationships and navigate the story. Experience a VR murder mystery thriller aboard a futuristic aircraft with a narrative twist. Every choice counts.
reviews:
An immersive Sci-fi Murder Mystery VR game taken place in futuristic aircraft.  I haven't finished it yet but it feels great so far.

In term of the plot, this is giving me Murder on Orient Express vibe, and also Doctor Who vibe (Mummy on Orient Express and some other episodes). It's a good game.

You can select a choice by saying it out loud, and it doesn't have to match every words on the script. You can say something that has the same meaning and AI will (probably) select similar choice. 
An example of improvise gone-wrong-> Me:"Sorry I didn't know I can do that" >>> Game:"I can do whatever I want"
 Played on quest 3 through steam link, gtx 1080 (not ti)

A small immersive Sim lite game with a ton of emphasis on player choice. Branching dialogue options that can actually impact the story, as can your actions in gameplay.

Gameplay is first person, there are FPS mechanics but combat is avoidable depending on how you want to handle it.

Voice acting is for the most part really good (there's one monotone character- it might be on purpose). There's a nice diversity to the voices that first the theme of the game too -if your a fan of the next generation like I am you might like this game.

The lore is initially confusing (by design) but it gets spelled out as you progress and you have access to a database which is....dense, and I feel it could be organised better but it's not essential to the game and I barely used it, this is where the bulk of the controversial ai art can be found. 

The graphics are basic at best... But found it ran extremely well even on my aging rig, so this could easily be a plus. I never felt sick apart from one moment I got turned around in an optional maze.

There's an optional voice command system that allows you to speak out dialogue choices. On the default setting I didn't like reading this out verbatim as it broke the immersion but turn down the recognition setting and you can ad-lib the line to what feels natural and this was so much fun for immersion. I found it didn't work all of the time but most of the time.

As mentioned it's a small game but I feel the joy is in the replay ability and in failing/succeeding in  different ways.

Looking forwards to the sequel. This game is really fantastic so far. If you're looking for a run-and-gun shooter this isn't it, but if you're looking for a really cool immersive story to "live" through this is the game. I haven't completed it yet, and there are some controls that are a little rough around the edges (looking at you hand-orientation that uses primary hand and not the hand with the movement thumbstick).

So far this game has been great though. It's a futuristic murder mystery, and the incorporation of being able to speak your lines really brings it to life. There were moments that I honestly felt like I was really speaking to the characters, and it really helped to uphold the suspension of disbelief. 

If I make it through the whole thing and find something glaring I'll update the review, but 1.4 hours in and so far it's been quite a stellar experience. Really interesting game and talking via microphone works great! üòÑ
Also a lot of updates with improvements.

name: Big NEON Tower VS Tiny Square
short_description: Ride the vaporwaves as you outrun nefarious neon nuisances in this 90s inspired precision platformer. No sprint, no double-jump, and no floaty controls! Just quick deaths and generous respawn points. Can you reach the top of the tower and rescue your Pineapple?
reviews:
great game and a fun challenge and try to get all the achievements is a extra fun challenge Pokurwi mie Does anyone know the stats for the Dev achievements? Quick score: 3/5

Notes: Pretty much a pure improvement from the previous game "Big Tower Tiny Square" in terms of movement, level design, visuals. I completed it in about 50 minutes 150 deaths. Pretty average difficulty without any noticeable spikes.

Perhaps a tad overpriced considering its simplicity, but otherwise no complaints. Just a solid minimalist platformer. Good precision platformer with a nice twist Great game, best in the series IMO. It has great aesthetics, creative obstacles, and even the water sections are used in great ways! pineapple Fantastic game, great soundtrack, visually interesting. This is a great platformer that is much more difficult than it looks at first. I cannot recommend this game enough, especially for $5 big neon tower vs tiny suqare This is an excellent single-screen precision platformer. Difficult, but fair. Very polished. Highly recommended.

name: Sable's Grimoire
short_description: Sable's Grimoire is a visual novel featuring monster girls in a magic academy setting. Play as Sable, an aspiring magic researcher, as he get sucked into the daily lives and troubles of his demi-human classmates.
reviews:
Interesting story, and the romance is decent. It's kind of disappointing there's been no continuation of the stories for Eth or the spider-girl whose name I forget, because they were my favorite romances, but maybe that'll be addressed in the full sequel. Which I'm looking forward to.
Also, I have no recollection of having put 196 hours into this game. I have no doubt it's true, because computers are wrong a lot less often than I am, but... ¬øWhen'd that happen? 8/10 It is overall pretty good.  The MC can be annoying at times but it is not to the point that is drags down the rest of the cast. Already played it, but decided to also buy it on Steam in anticipation for the sequel, Sable's Grimoire 2. If Sable's Grimoire seems like the sort of thing that might interest you, I suggest you give it a try! Love this game, i hope it won't be long for Sable's grimoire 2 to come out. Fantastic art and and amazing fantasy story with secrets as well as well written characters. Though, it's my first time playing visual novels I do say this game has a lot to offer, as it has kept my eyes glued to the screen. it can be a bit overwhelming with exposition dump but that helps you become more invested and immersed in the world. Very cozy dating game with a fantasy feel. good Underrated VN. There's already many well-written reviews so, beh. It's great! I don't often write reviews, but this one deserves it.
I'm a bit of a visual novel enjoyer, and I've had several I like, dislike, and just managed to push through.
This one was genuinely one of the best I've played, and wish it got more of the recognition it deserves.
Our MC (Sable) isn't a blank slate, but has enough options it can still feel like you're living through his life. The side characters don't fall into being simple tropes, but rather each feel like a fleshed out person, and despite which route you follow, everyone remains relevant throughout the story. I have nothing but fond memories of my time exploring every route. Wholeheartedly recommend, sale or not.

I can't wait for Sable's Grimoire 2. Sable's Grimoire
Recommended
Length: Medium (10-30 Hours)
Number of Routes: 6 (5 Single, 1 Multi-character)
Length of Avg. Route: 3 Hours
Choices: Yes
Failure Possible: Yes
Character Rating: Good
Story Progression: Very Good
Chaotic Elements: Yes / Minor (can be avoided)		
Music Rating: Good
Achievement Difficulty: 1
Additional Thoughts:

With a pretty good story line with multiple endings (19 in total), good characters and a interesting setting. Overall it makes for a pretty decent novel. There is a post story segment in which setups some threads for the upcoming sequel.

name: PAC-MAN MUSEUM+
short_description: PAC-MAN MUSEUM+ includes 14 titles from the legendary PAC-MAN series! Play a variety of classic and nostalgic PAC-MAN games across many genres!
reviews:
i'd rather use mame Why didn't the Cowards at Namco give us Pac-Man 2 as well?

Pac and Pal is pretty cool. It drives me nuts that Namco hasn't released a full Namco Museum in this style. oh my god this game is so good. its such a smart idea on Bandai Namco's part by adding every single Pac-Man game ever made (expect ms pac man which is already on steam so why not add it there) Also the statues are cool also, this is a 9.5/10. Crazy how i saved $15 (as of now bc i bought the bundle on sale) and probs more not only including the steam games. Add ms pac man and then it will be a 10/10. this game is just bro I JUST LOVE THIS GAME SO MUCH like you can play 1980 pac man game pac in time more other ones there all pac man games its jsut like the best game i ever played in my life you egt coins for playing games and use those coins too buy stuff or even figures i got 2 golden firgures the same day in a row its a really fun game i recomend it too you people who are obsessed with pac man just like me and have fun with pac man museum + and good luck figuring out the controls but have fun and i hope you like it thanks! Nice game. Pac in Time pac man :D Pretty chill collection . I keep coming back to Pac Land This man is pretty pac

name: Star Trust - 3D Shooter Game
genres: Action, Casual, Indie, Free To Play
short_description: Fly with your spaceship, avoid obstacles and destroy monsters and powerful bosses. In this game you can shot with laser, missiles and powerful unique specials power of 9 different spaceships. In addition, those space ships have good mobility that you can use to avoid enemy attacks.
reviews:
Level 1 starts out pretty good. Level 2 and 4 need to be patched up asap. I'm giving it a thumbs up hoping they fix this because this game has the potential to be great. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GKPWK3RF6Cs&t=3s The menus look like copy and paste from a beginner tutorial, I don't think less effort could have been spent
There is no clue about keybinds. I couldn't work out from visual cues what was going on apart from the main laser

This is too much of a beginner effort to be on Steam and charging $.  Refunded

However there is the base of a good game in there, dev just needs to be less greedy and put some more work in before charging.  Keep at it, come back in 6 months.

name: 2089 - Space Divided
short_description: 2089 - Space Divided is a classic science fiction real-time strategy game in which you collect resources, build up your base, train troops and destroy your opponents with tactical skill.
reviews:
I love the old C&C games and I purchased this because there aren't many out there.

it is such a low cost and the roadmap is looking good. I hope the game does it and reaches the targets. All the basics are there for something good.

Buy it if you love Command and Conquer. broken, cant select anything through task windows.  theres no action menus, cant build anything/do anything. I can't recommend this game, in all honesty.

It's bogged down with poor pathing, terrible AI, and 20 year old graphics.

The voices are terrible and annoying after only 5 minutes.

The tech tree isn't at all interesting, despite being exceptionally limited.  

All units die like lvl 1 scouts in any other game would.   The turrets cannot traverse quickly enough to fire on most enemies, not just the fast-moving ones, and even with a wall of turrets, shield generators, and heavy tanks, you'll suffer significant losses in an average attack against your defensive lines.

The variety of units is more limited than the variety of buildings that you can make, which is ridiculous in such games.

The controls are terrible.  Repairing buildings may or may not work.  Your builders may or may not respond to instructions to build, and often just disregard build orders for some buildings while building others.  

All in all, this feels like an alpha build of a home-brewed game.  When I saw the demos, I was reminded of Cavedog's "total annihilation" and was extremely hopeful.  Instead, this is like the games that I used to see in the $5 bargain bin at a game shop and would try out, only to uninstall and dispose of.

I'll be refunding this game, and never looking back.

*edit:  I'm still baffled why a game that was released more than a year ago is still listed as "early access". Game visuals are good, but is very unbalanced. 

There are two factions in this game. The Andarer and the Redaxh.  The Andarer are the typical shield and arty faction (in theory). The Redaxh are alians with a big end game walker thing and tanks that shoot energy balls. 

When playing I noticed that the Andarer can build way more early game units than the Redaxh can and can easily overrun other factions with light tanks. Which seems a little odd since they are the ones with the tech to get arty. The Redaxh is dependant on one of the three resources so much that their early game is extremely limited until they get their tech center up and get some eco upgrades.

The problem comes in with how the projectiles work for the units. The Redaxh units all shoot slow projectiles including their defense towers. So the Andarer can just build 8 light tanks and go kill everything as long as the player micros good enough. It does not really matter what the enemy has, your tanks can move so fast that nothing can hit them. The starting workers are all ground units so you just micro past any defenses that the enemy has and just kill the eco and then you have won the game at that point. I found that when playing the Andarer that I had to just put limits on the light tanks that I can build and just not build them if i wanted the game to go past 7-10 minuets of stomping the opponent. Even in the end game you can just spam them because the cost is so cheap that you just over run the enemy base with this. 

The eco is not good for early game Redaxh and the light tank for Andarer is ridiculous, so I thought lets build some heavy tanks and see if it does the same thing. (Also tried this with Redaxh units and it work to some degree against the Andarer, but to a lesser degree because the projectile speed is higher for the Andarer units, so it is not as effective but still works.)
Yep! Just wiggle your units around a bit and all the projectiles miss you from enemy units and defense turrets. There needs to be something that allows the enemy to hit units that are quick. AOE seems to be an answer, but you really don't get any until later in the game for both factions. 

The air units can kind of be a counter, but again the projectile speed is so slow that you can not really touch anything if the opponent is paying attention at all and is moving their units. Also air is expensive to get and you will get run over fast if that is what you are using as defense early game. Gunships will not allow you to stop the enemy from killing off all of your eco. You can just run past them and ignore the air and then just go kill all of the opponents workers, and then they have no money to build anything else so an instant win there. 

This seems like the unit models and scale would work for a tower defense game, but in a game where you can micro units it does not work. The projectile speed needs to be adjusted for defenses as well as for the Redaxh units. I am mediocre at best at RTS games and I got board really quick with how the fights played out. 

It seems like a good game to keep on your watch list, but until there is some more polish with the unit balance and eco balance, and perhaps some more units added to the game (something to put a slow area effect on the enemy to make the projectiles have a chance to hit?) then I recommend other games such as Red Alert, Forged Alliance Forever, or Age or Empires, or Star Craft. Very unpolished but decent.  Very basic Classic RTS, doesnt have much flavor but im gonna vote it up because it is a solid return to the basics for old farts like me.  Im sure itll be good when finished. Great game with lots of potential. It makes some things different that really bothered me in other RTS games. I am excited for the upcoming addition of multiplayer and the developer team's ambitious plans for the game. The dev team is also easy acessibil over discord so you can get them feedback, they are really nice team and it's rare to see this level of engagement and dedication from a developer team. Overall, I highly recommend checking it out. Summary: A lot of potential and similarities with "Command and Conquer" and "Supreme Commander", the graphics are ok, no multiplayer for the moment, it lacks optimization and has some bugs, but if they add more stuff it will be a lot of fun. If you can afford it, buy it, help this game to mature as a good RTS!

At the time of this review the game was just released as early access 2 days ago, I played the demo first and as I saw potential I bought it. 
The game clearly lacks a lot of content, but it already has some basic things, and the essence of the game I liked a lot, reminding me of Command and Conquer (as many say), but more than anything it reminded me of my hours and hours of Supreme Commander, a game I love and highly recommend.

For being made by such a small development team, the game is great and I hope they can keep improving it and adding content, since at the moment you can only play with 2 factions and in single player skirmishes against the AI, and a mode to resist waves. No multiplayer for the moment. I found 2 or 3 bugs but it is understandable for the magnitude of the project.

The game lacks optimization, playing in a 2vs2 game, when about 20 minutes have passed and there are many units in the game, the game begins to lose fps abruptly, and in some moments the units take about 5 seconds to respond to movement orders. 

The above described happened to me with the graphics in "Very Low" and 1920x1080 resolution, and the RAM consumption of the game was around 11 GB. If I raised the graphic quality I saw that it even required 17 GB of RAM.

Here are my specs for reference:
OS: Windows 10 x64
Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 5600x
Memory: 32 GB of RAM
Graphics: Nvidia GTX 1050ti (4GB of VRAM)

I send my best wishes to the development team so they can continue with the project, I can't wait to be able to play the full game! Solid RTS, like a Mix from Starcraft and Command and Conquer. Has a lot of potential.
Im looking forward for future updates and the multiplayer. The KI is very intelligent and is hard to beat - TRY IT!

name: Miner Mayhem
short_description: Pickaxe ready? Coal, iron, gold & diamond! 18 Miners to unlock! Get chopping in this action packed, arcade style game.
reviews:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

 Very good Û†Ä° The developers of Miner Mayhem did nothing more than slap a Minecraft-style coat of paint on Timberman: The sprites have the same style, the gameplay is exactly the same, and the backgrounds are a lot more ugly than Timberman.
