name: The Dungeon Of Naheulbeuk: The Amulet Of Chaos
short_description: Step into the wacky heroic fantasy universe of the Dungeon of Naheulbeuk. Lead a team of unlikely and clumsy heroes in an epic and challenging tactical RPG. Live an adventure filled with humor, surprises and silly encounters.
reviews:
The game itself is quite entertaining. I suppose it could even be great, if I spoke French.

Hell, if they had just removed all cutscenes and character-interactions, even the so-called "English" version could have been fine... But, as it stands, most of the text and voice-acting in the non-French version is significantly worse than even google-translate would have been.

On a technical/mechanical level, I would be interested in their new game, as well. But, as I still do not speak French, I will be avoiding this publisher. Tr√®s grand fan de Naheulbeuk depuis 20 ans j'ai mis bcp de temps √† essayer ce jeu en me disant qu'il ne serait qu'un pr√©texte √† du fan service. Quelle erreur ! C'est non seulement tr√®s dr√¥le et tr√®s fid√®le √† la saga mp3 mais c'est avant tout un excellent rpg tactique. Bcp de m√©caniques tr√®s int√©ressantes, des combats exigeants, surtout √† haute difficult√©, et une narration tr√®s solide entre les combats pour donner du liant. On sent que le budget √©tait limit√© mais l'humour d'un c√¥t√© et le syst√®me de combat d'un autre c√¥t√© sont irr√©prochables. √áa me donne tr√®s envie d'une suite avec plus d'exploration et plus de personnages jouables, un peu √† l'image de la saison 2 de la saga. Really liked this game and all there is about it, the combat was great, the banter between the group, the level design, the variety of enemies and so on.. The base game was cool, the DLC's were nice add-ons.
Recommended for all my turn-based RPG enthousiasts! Pretty fun game. Tactics are decent, and there's that hottie Felicia Day who voices one of the characters. On the other hand - very silly. Bought this on discount and it is *definitely* worth it.  Kudos to the Devs! Fun combat, funny dialogue and interesting characters (makes sense, it's based on an audiobook) with good banter. Pretty art and good voice acting as well. I like it. Ce jeu est vraiment cool.
Je retrouve l'ambiance du Donjon de Nahalbeuk et c'est un r√©gale.
L'√©criture de l'histoire est digne de ce qu'√† produit Pen of Chaos et le gameplay est vraiment tr√®s bien. J'appr√©cie vraiment y jouer. I highly recommend this game to any fan of turn based tactical combat. I love the cartooney graphics as well as the adult humor between characters. The combat is fun and easy to pick up. The only downers I have to say after completing the game is that for me, the switches and other door opening devices were easy to overlook (maybe a camera angle problem) and the story left me a little underwhelmed. That being said, I'd still say play this game! One of the few I've picked up and finished recently. I had a lot of fun playing this game. 
Felt like a parody of old tabletop games and also a great game in its own right This worth its money, cool voices, above average gameplay and really really funny!

name: Terminal 81R
short_description: In 2016, a young Uruguayan travels to the neighborhood of 'Terminal 81' a place marked by violence, inequality, and vice, where a dangerous human trafficking network operates. Determined to find his sister, the young man ventures into the perilous and dark world of Terminal 81.
reviews:
I really have mixed feelings about this one.

In one hand, it is not a bad game. But on the other hand, I felt that this game was longer than it should have been.
The game has some new minigames here and there, but most of them don't add that much to say that it is a "better" game than the original 'Terminal 81.'
In fact, I think that this is even inferior in some aspects, because it ends up feeling more monotonous and repetitive than the first one.
The driving mechanics are not very good, and I ALWAYS preferred to walk than to ride the bike.

I also felt that wasting so much time talking to every random character walking on the street wasn't necessary either; most of the conversations are uninteresting and shallow anyway.
__________________________________________________________

UPDATE: I just finished the game (I got one of the bad endings).
I must say that the last part where you are stuck in the abandoned building with the two flashlight guys was fun but also frustrating.

That being said, this game has some really nice moments, and the story actually got more interesting by the end.
In fact, it actually had a very sad plot-twist that I was not expecting, and it is something that you cannot change, regardless of how many different decisions you take in the game.
You could get a "good ending," but the outcome remains the same.
It's pretty sad, but I'm personally a fan of sad endings, so this actually made me increase my rating a little bit.
The story of this game ended up being superior to the original, so now I give it a 7.5/10 to this one.

At this point, I really cannot say which of these two games is better or worse.
The first game is superior in some aspects, but inferior in others; the same goes with this one. 
So, I think this is basically a tie. 

Well, after this long review, I would honestly love to see a 3rd 'Terminal 81' in the future.
I would definitely play it.

name: Zeko
short_description: A calm and cute original puzzle game. Clear stages to unlock the next one. Each stage has its own challenge.
reviews: Zeko is a puzzle game in a match style and they did a great job, the gameplay is very simplistic but still nice. If you are a fan of puzzle games check it out. Zeko is an original puzzle game that's fun to play.

name: Covenant: Project Zero
short_description: Covenant: Project Zero is a space opera set in a universe where interstellar corporations and big money interests run everything. Embark on an action-packed adventure as Captain John Covenant, accompanied by a band of rag-tag misfits, to confront the dark evil lurking in the universe.
reviews:
Covenant: Project Zero effortlessly channels the nostalgia of storytelling-focused adventure games, taking players on a captivating journey of discovery. With its original artwork and enchanting music, the game creates an immersive experience that encourages exploration to uncover its intriguing story. 
While offering challenges for arcade gamers and a variety of puzzles, it shines as a story-driven adventure, reminiscent of the golden age of point-and-click games. Its rich narratives, stunning graphics, and mesmerizing music make it a must-play for fans of the genre. I wholeheartedly recommend this nostalgic gem. [b] Project Zero [/b] successfully blends RPG elements with its action-adventure gameplay. The multiple equipments allowed me to customize the character to my preferred playstyle. The game offered a vast universe to explore, filled with engaging side quests and memorable encounters. [u] RPG lovers won't be disappointed. [/u] The narrative in Covenant: Project Zero was gripping from start to finish. The game's graphics were great and the controls are smooth. It's a testament to the game's ability to be great even with simple questliens. this game blends action and strategy seamlessly. I enjoyed planning out my crew's movements, managing resources, and making critical decisions that influenced the outcome of the story. The strategic depth added a satisfying challenge to the game. It's a strategic masterpiece. Covenant: Project Zero is a love letter to science fiction fans. The attention to detail in the lore and world-building is remarkable. The game delves into complex themes and levels, providing a thought-provoking experience. It's a game that sci-fi enthusiasts like me will deeply appreciate. As a seasoned gamer, This game satisfied my craving for an epic space adventure. The combat mechanics were challenging yet rewarding. The game truly captured the essence of a space opera. It's a must-play for any serious gamer. I enjoyed playing Project Zero during my downtime. The storyline was intriguing, and I appreciated the immersive space and worlds. The controls were easy to pick up, and I didn't feel overwhelmed by the gameplay. It's a solid choice for a relaxed gaming experience. I'm only a few chapters in but so far i highly recommend this game. The art, music, and gameplay combine to a really atmospheric experience. The story is intriguing and action is fun. If you're a fan of shoot em ups, point and click adventures, or solid original stories, this has it.

name: Giant Celebration
short_description: Play at human scale or shrink down to the size of a toy! Giant Celebration is a VR hidden object game with a unique scale mechanic to let you play from any point of view. Help a lost dog find its owner; Reunite a chef with his unattended food cart; Get the band back together; Search living dioramas!
reviews:
Very mellow and relaxing hidden object game where you explore various levels looking for different objects and people. Basic concept that is fun in its own right but then they add the scaling mechanic where the player can shrink down very tiny and get to places they couldn't before, like Ant-Man! Really fun to explore the levels and have to play with your scale to find everything, makes you think in a different way. Also always appreciate a VR game where I can play at any pace I want, which this definitely is.

Good buy, I am enjoying it and there is always more stuff to find!

name: Hope of Humanity
short_description: Engage in the construction of your station from a variety of different modules. Create your space fleet. Protect your base from enemies...
reviews:
abandoned, broken "...Nice idea, wish it played as fast & smooth as the gif images on the steam store page!"

honestly not a lot going for it, even after reading other reviews and thinking that one should take a look...

- screen resolution is unchangeable (if it is, it's not in-game!)
- fonts are non-scaleable, thus on newer monitors, you'll need to be practically nose-to-screen to read anything
- like other reviews have stated, this is pre-alpha stage, ie wait for some proper development (like the release of more than just skirmish mode)
- stupidly slow even on a reasonable pc (suggests either code is too spacious or incompatible due to programming language issues)

as the last update was over a year ago, and the latest one just happens to be the release of wallpapers, you're better off skipping this game for another year or two (assuming the developers are planning to return from a year-long hiatus etc) Just so you know.
This game is a virus.
If not then i'd be plenty of suprise because my anti-virus is usually right.
Just be careful. I felt like i was becoming claustrophobic with some mild catatonia while trying to play this game. super confusing, nothing really teaches you anything..... and you have to read print that is so small.... that it feels rushed.

couldnt figure the game out at all.

 Game freezes up every five minutes of gameplay!!!!!!

this alpha release is trash for testing.. Would be nice if their was a tutorial, or training button accually worked in the game? Other than that, i have no flippin clue on what to do, or how to do it? People like to hear what to do, or how to do it from the game. In my years as a gamer, i have never had to read so much learning curve  on a game like this one. If i don't figure it out soon, i will be refunding that simple. L.E.
Game is dead. Don't buy.

...........
Initial review:

Looks promising and, even more promising, is the patch release rate I'm seeing so I won't ask for a refund.
Certainly in need of a 'tutorial' type of help, even if it's in the form of overlayers with text that describe a bit more the relation between modules, etc. 
If development continues at this rate I will certainly be happy I've grabbed it now as it certainly worths more once polished.

If you're buying it now don't expect to play some sort of "space Skyrim" level of details in the next 5 mins, look at it as supporting a developer that puts out weekly updates. Hope of humanity is to difficult to play without a working tutorial. ..
tutorial inside only tell you 1 thing.. 

but it might be a fun game later on :) this games video looks fun to play I like toe idea of building a base and mining etc, but in the cuurent state I will have to warn anyone that this game is not what the video shows not even close, not to mention there is no tutorial now I have been fiddling around but I cant figure out heads from tale, 

The english thing I can look past since they did say the translation is not done but I always wonder what goes through a developers mind when you try to launch a game when the main accept language in the world is not even in your game, to me it feels like yoru aiming low or dont care.

Wont refund, as I do support there idea, but will keep this as a negative rating till I see some form of improvement. The game has some promise, and i'll definitely give it another try later on to update this review if things improve but this has definitely entered early access WAY too early in development. To the devs: I would highly recommend (if you even can...) to take this out of early access until you have fleshed things out a bit more, otherwise you are going to ruin the chances of this game doing well.

The current pros/cons
- i love the idea (although I wasn't actually able to properly experience it, so I can't 100% confirm that the game plays as is advertised)
- initially looks pretty promising visually
- nice audio from what I have heard so far

The cons:
- zero tutorial or ANY form of guide/help, for a game that is designed to have complexity (an example of why this shouldn't be in early access yet)
- although it boasts english support, certain sections of the game are not translated to english, particularly parts that look to be quite important. This might actually be why I felt like there was zero guide/help at the beginning. Community hub posts suggests this issue will be fixed, but again another example that this shouldn't be available yet!
- the performance of the game is absolutely terrible. It is stated currently that the game does need optimization, however it's rediculous to release it when it performs as bad as it does. I get to roughly 30-40 enemies on the screen and the game dips to very low fps, making it virtually unplayable, and my PC can handle high-end games normally very well.

Again, I will come back and update this if the game improves, which I hope it does because the idea does seem really cool. However, right now, for the sake of giving this game a chance, don't pick it up until it shows evidence of improvement!

name: Total War: Shogun 2 - Blood Pack DLC
short_description: The Total War battle engine has been re-engineered for the ultimate in visceral conflict. Intricate new animations enable your Samurai to carve a bloody, limb-strewn path through enemy armies. name: The Coma: Cutting Class
short_description: The Coma: Cutting Class is a survival horror adventure game. You are Youngho, a Korean high school student trapped and relentlessly pursued by a psychotic killer in the hellish corridors of Sehwa High. Run, hide, explore, and survive while piecing together the mystery of how and why you're here.
reviews:
Gut art. Great audio, great visuals, great story and cute characteers. But can't play because of poor keyboard mapping with no controller support, the school layout is hard to navigate because each classroom on each floor looks the same. Very, very good game
 Nice horror 2D closet hiding simulator 2k17. best game. I love the art in this 2D horror game! Everything is pretty much on spot.
The story and lore is very interesting and fresh.

The only thing that I didn't like is the run & hide mechanic.
It works well at the beginning, but I found it very boring when it happens a lot
later on cause you don't do anything when you hide. You just wait until everything is clear.

Well, I enjoyed it very much. If you hate school, but like spooky stuff then go for it ;) Fun game! A little like a 2-D version of Silent Hill but with more humor.

(DANGER: Minor spoiler below)






The only frustrating part for me was the maze near the end that you were forced to traverse where your teacher was constantly on your ass. It almost stopped the game for me but the story was compelling enough to go on. Looking forward to a sequel! I love it.
Give us a sequel.
:) I'm getting chased by a hot teacher that wants to cut me.  
If only my real life teachers wanted me this badly.
I can dig it. It's not a terrible game however it becomes very tedious as you end up just running everywhere pressed 'E', the story is very short/basic and the horror element is lost very early in the game. I only recommend this game if it's on sale for around ¬£2.99.

name: Aliens: Fireteam Elite - UACM Frontline Pack
short_description: Advance to the frontlines with the latest in combat technologies. Prepare for tomorrow's battlegrounds with the UACM Frontline Pack - over 25 items including class kit skins, weapon colors, head accessories, emotes and more!
reviews:
Finally...armor benefiting a Marine! A frontline re-supply of cosmetics, including a HALO-style vac-suit for every class, and a snazzy boonie cover for your noggin'. That armor looks great. In space, no one can hear you scream. Cool outfits. has the best marine drip in the game Good. Some neato skins, but way to expensive for a barelly abandonned game... *Included as part of the Deluxe Edition*

Greetings! A quick DLC Review for the UACM Frontline Pack on Aliens: Fireteam Elite which is a small cosmetic (mostly) pack. For the most part I do not have an issue with cosmetics and hold the ‚Äòif you like the game buy the DLC‚Äô approach, does this follow that line? Let‚Äôs discuss.

Gear Up Marines: This DLC includes several new helmets, outfits, weapon skins, emotes and decals. It also comes with some in game currency (both types) and consumables. Unlike the previous DLC I did find myself using these Skins, specifically the MK.75 Suits. I will say that the skins are adequately done and detailed but found the weapon decals overly pointless due to the size.

Just like the previous DLC this is not going to have any real effect on your game.  However, I will recommend it if you grab it on a sale but it would still be better to just get the Deluxe Edition (while on sale) and save some money for what is primarily cosmetic. Enjoy!
 Not cause I have an issue with it but at A:FE current state this should be free. Well made skins though.

Overall, poorly made and clunky satire game about being clumsy. i bought this as a child and thought it would be good.

name: STONE
short_description: STONE is a single-player third-person interactive story, where a hungover koala detective wakes to find his lover Alex has been kidnapped. Walk, talk, drink, dance, smoke, watch, sauna, trip and find Alex. An Aussie stoner noir story game by Convict Games.
reviews:
Very short game about an LGBT Koala that lost his lover.

Had to replay the Epilogue like 4 times before it would register the last two achievements.

Would I recommend the game ?
Not really , but I'll still give it a positive review because Aussie developers , Aussie lingo and a bad ass koala named Stone. stone is my pookie my babygirl my one and only my loser failboy i love him So............this is not a great game, and it has numerous flaws.........but it's also not entirely awful (I seriously wouldn't recommend you buy it mind you, unless it's on a [b][u]DEEP[/u][/b] sale!

This is a third-person "mystery" where  you play a hard partying koala trying to track down his missing lover, although for all intents and purposes it's essentially a visual novel as there is no real detecting to do, and there certainly aren't multiple outcomes or anything like that.  Just wander around (and the objectives in the upper left of the screen certainly leave no mystery about what you're to do next) and click your mouse and/or press E and the story will unfold.

*[b]Positives[/b]*

-Story-  It's actually not a bad story, and if the game were put together competently (hint:  It's not) this would be a lot more compelling of a game.

-Graphics-  They're not great, but they're colourful and the models for the various animals are decent, and there's even a few nice little graphical touches, like how the screen develops a blur if you have too many drinks (not that it lasts beyond the building you're in.....just leave and, BOOM, instant sobriety).

-Music/Movies-  The soundtrack is decent (even if there's WAY too much crappy hip-hop and techno shite compared to the amount of rock music) and there's opportunities to watch entire public domain movies at the theatre or on your television (NIght of the LIving Dead, etc.) which is a nice touch.

*[b]Negatives[/b]*

-Voice Acting-  How on bloody earth can a game made in Australia feature such weak, inconsistently accented voice acting?!?!?  I mean, you're hiring Aussies to do your voices, hire someone for the main character that actually sounds like an Ozzie 100% of the time rather than drifting in and out of some bizarre, almost Australian accent similar to Kevin Kostner's attempts at an English accent in that shite Robin Hood movie from decades ago.  Some of the characters are okay, but even the ones with decent (and consistent!) accents deliver some of the weakest line readings in video game history.  Truly not good

-Voice Syncing-  It's terrible.  Really.  Old Japanese kaiju movies had better, more synced up dubbing than this.  It's distractingly bad.

-Pacing-  It's soooooooooo slow, and I don't just mean in terms of plot progression, I mean character movement, line delivery, huge pauses between lines, everything that could make the game feel punchier and more responsive feels like treacle.

-Character Freedom-  Despite the fact that there's multiple locations on the world map, three of them are meaningless (the record store just allows you to listen to music, the theatre just plays a movie for you to watch, and the sauna just features the protagonist sitting in a steam filled room) and the rest have perfunctory interactions (with badly, sloooooooooooooooowly delivered, poorly read dialogue) that will only occur if it's that time in the story-line.....otherwise there's nothing to do beyond progress the plot).

So, it has some good points (decent story-line if someone else was writing and delivering the dialogue, colourful graphics with some nice touches, and some potential to interact with a wide selection of music and movies within the game), but the rest is dragged down with a bloody anchor by the rather poor voice acting, line delivery, lack of in-game freedom, lethargic dialogue and a raft of minor narrative issues.  At least it's over quickly and there's no bugs that I encountered.... ........... ..........................

Sadly not recommended. It might have been because I was playing under Proton, but the game misbehaved at several level transitions. (2 of the Steam achievements failed to trigger.) The actual gameplay wasn't much, which would be excusable if the narrative part was great, but it was just okay. I did enjoy the twist ending though.
If you're looking at this thinking you'd love to roleplay as an inebriated koala, maybe go for something like VRChat instead? This is a walking simulator with few decision branches. With memory loss likely in cahoots with the groggy slushing in his head, the PI koala wakes to find his boyfriend missing. it seems both yesterday and today are co-conspirators of the same hangover, playing out tumultuous loops in his mind! will the stoned Dick crack the case ..or crack A case and watch night of the living dead while blitzed off his gourde?

interesting enough game that travels a short distance but packs for the winter!
Art is good. game moves smoothly (no run). voice over is all on point, it is mostly casual down beat conversing, with askew personal sequences and revelation.
true to say that it is not really a puzzle game, it is mostly concerned with telling story. 
so i guess depending on your preference you could consider it a really casual game or an incredibly well stocked novel or visual/audio presentation.
It has packed not only a pretty dam fair selection of rock hip hop and other music but also has roughly 2 plates of cb-cookies worth of actual full movies you can watch in game! (noice!)
although the dude acheivment doesnt unlock for me.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3168503975
it was a steep hard climb to emotional high ground and I was looking for a sniper! As an Australian, it was a no brainer to pick up a game about a rough around the edges Koala on a mission to solve a mystery. I finally decided to give it a go after it sat in my library for a while, and while it wasn't what I expected, I genuinely enjoyed the experience that Stone had to offer. 

I should emphasise that this game is very much an experience and not a traditional noir game. You won't be solving puzzles or trying to choose the right responses, but exploring the universe that the devs built, while following along in the player-guided narrative. 

I really enjoyed the music and how it helped create distinct atmospheres in each location. I will definitely be following up on some of my favourite tracks from this game. 

The characters are the heart and soul of this game. If you're Australian, and visited some of the smaller towns out of the big city, than these personalities are definitely ones you'd come across. It was comforting and comical, with dialogue definitely something you'd hear if you eavesdropped at a bar - maybe minus kidnapping discussion. 

This game might be a bit more difficult to digest if you're not Australian, and expecting more of a 'game' than a visual novel. But if you're willing to give it a shot, it's certainly a ride! 

Thanks to the devs and everyone involved! I look forward to your future projects and can't wait to see what you produce in the future! I'm 50/50 really... On the one hand it is really cute and feels very personal on some levels. I think the devs mean really well. And the soundtrack is super.
However, the writing would have needed to be a little bit more snappy, at times the voice lines overlap, the mystery is easily figured out, and the overall tempo is off.
It could have been elevated with better voice actors, but hey, it is what it is. It's pretty unique I'd say, and I appreciate that. But it could had been so much more. I love detective games and I love LGBTQIA+ plots, but this ain't it.

This game is let down by overly simplistic graphics, annoying club music, lazy writing, and poor voice acting. It does have some classic films you can watch, but if I wanted to watch a movie, I'd be doing that, not playing a game.

3/10. It gave me a headache. This is a simplistic single-player story game where you play as a hungover/stoned "ex-detective" Koala named Stone trying to find out about a friend that has been kidnapped. The writing leans from predictable to average at best and isn¬¥t a very memorable experience in general BUT the soundtrack is amazing and for me, that¬¥s worth the purchase of this game (at least on sale). 

The soundtrack on this game makes it more interesting to explore/reach 100% completion. The game somehow wasn¬¥t boring and it definitely has a style to it. Just a slightly above average game.

My final rating for this game is a (low) 6/10. Not worth more than $1.  Took 1.9hrs to 100% .  Really simple and kind of boring, the soundtrack is good though.

name: Rawyokan
short_description: One button fighting game inspired by the classics.
reviews: good game and fun too

name: Arevan
short_description: Arevan is an adventure RPG with an original storyline, enjoyable features and interesting game play. Travel with Maurean as he makes his way through challenging puzzles, gut-wrenching monsters, and intriguing side quests.
reviews:
[h2]Arevan[/h2]

Has a total of [b]7[/b] trading cards. Game is unplayable due to lag Just another boring RPG, nothing special. Just skip it. I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you. RPG Maker strikes again!

Arevan is one of hundreds of low effort retro-pixel RPG Maker asset/construction kit flips spamming the Steam catalog, made with the RPG Maker video game construction kit... in their own words, "Our easy to use tools are simple enough for a child."  Like all RPG Maker "games", this is essentially a bunch of low quality/canned assets from RPG Maker coupled with a cringeworthy high school anime club fan fiction.

As with all RPG Maker games, the poor quality engine displays badly in fullscreen and doesn't have full HD support or any graphics tweaking options, making this unacceptable for any dedicated modern PC gamer.  The point can be made that the intention of RPG Maker is to make demos and small games to pass around friends, and shouldn't be used for "professional" game development.

This time Andorlea/Warfare/SimProse/whatever other shell account this guy uses to try hide his identity has once more stamped out a painfully generic copy + paste RPG Maker asset flip.  This time we're investigating a murder in one of the most incredibly, painfully generic fantasy settings imaginable.  If RPG Maker had generic plots, the developer here would rip those off, too.  It's horribly basic, riddled with grammatical and spelling errors, full of stock copy + pasted RPG Maker assets... no real game development has taken place here, this is just a cash grab, it's shovelware polluting Steam for profit.  This "developer" has dumped over 100 copy+pasted RPG Maker asset flips onto Steam, and keeps pumping out minimum viable product RPG Maker asset flips as rapidly as possible to try gouge gamers.

We must ask why this ongoing pollution has any serious value for gamers or the gaming industry.  This kind of cash grab construction kit shovelware from bad actors like Andorlea gives amateur developers a bad name.  This pollution takes marketing space away from genuine indie developers who are doing the right thing, and making real games instead of copying+pasting premade assets in a children's video game construction kit.  It makes it harder for gamers to find genuinely made games.  This pollution is harmful to Steam, to gamers and the gaming industry.

Like most RPG Maker shovelware and asset flips, the game features extremely low quality copy + pasted 2D retro pixel art, looks awful, and has even worse gameplay.  RPG Maker is an absolutely terrible construction kit, and never results in games of any reasonable quality or value to gamers.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this only appears around the same time that trading cards were applied to the game... so this is just card idlers getting their cards and moving on.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Arevan has the laughable, eye-watering price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.  Gamers who want a good retro JRPG experience would be better off playing the originals, like Final Fantasy, Star Ocean or Chrono Trigger.
 Average classic RPG 
xaaaxaaxxaaxaxaxxa
 Just another RPG game that you should probably avoid. Recommended for game farming Cool classic RPG. The world are wide and there are lot of things and places to explore. The story is deep and twisted. Even tho sometimes it was hard to find the quest items, but u can finish them all by doing some exploring and talking to a lot of NPC because their quests sometimes solve other quest. Overall it was a fun experience with this game.

name: Highborn
short_description: This witty, wacky, turn-based strategy game is now available for Steam. In Highborn, you‚Äôre treated to a strategy game that offers an intelligent, tactical experience without the frenetic play of a traditional RTS.
reviews:
I've had this game sitting in my library for about 10 years, and I finally decided to play it. I'm glad I did. It may be old, but it's a lot of fun to play. I ended up buying all 3 chapters because I enjoyed it so much.

The scenarios are interesting to play, the characters are unique, and the humor is goofy. The jokes either made me smile or roll my eyes at the corniness. This game definitely does not take itself too seriously, and occasionally makes fun of itself. I found the normal difficulty level to be too easy, so I had to play everything on hard for the right challenge. The graphics may not be the latest and fanciest compared to the latest games out there, but they're certainly good enough.

I did encounter a couple annoying bugs. There are a couple scenarios where critical units disappear when I saved the game and reloaded later, making it impossible to finish the level. This was solved by restarting the level, but it was a bummer to have to play it over again. I recommend finishing each level in one sitting, which generally takes no more than a couple hours. 

At the current price, this game is well worth the money, so there's little to lose in trying it out. An old nostalgia dose for me, remember playing this when i was just a child, doesnt disappoint. Oh, you're interested in buying this? Just don't. I normally give games a little longer to improve, but it was clearly going nowhere good. Play a free version of snake on your phone rather than this. Stare at a wall and analyse the paint instead. It's not a game, so much as a really long tutorial with no real challenge or fun.

Also, the base game has achievements you can't unlock, without purchasing DLC content. Simple but fun game, enjoyed all three chapters. Turn based combat is easy to pick up and just deep enough that how you use the units matters.  Dialog is very funny and makes fun of itself the whole way through. Example, "How did you know I was the villain? Well you are on the box art for the game! Oh I hate when they just give it away like that, where's the suspense." Is good. fun little hex game Awesome game. 
Fun simple combat, bright old school visuals, and hilariously cheesy and cliched plot.
An infinite amount of fun and silliness for a great price.
9.5/10
(Loses half a mark for occasional difficulty spikes) [h1]Details[/h1]
[quote]
[h1]Myth-ic Aspriations: a wry comic turn-based gem of a game.[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=130069577
You are a muscle-bound knight reuniting a fractured kingdom to defeat the dark forces of the evil lich. Daft plot, but solid turn-based wargame strategy to be had. On top of this, you can earn heaps of achievements and bonuses from completing quests in a variety of ways - so one for the completionist as well. Very highly recommended.

Pros:

Cons:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1748252200
