name: Clay Monkey: The Master Potter and The Kiln God
short_description: Clay Monkey is a top-down exploration game based on sourcing materials from the earth to make ceramic art that will be displayed in a final art exhibition. With a dream, not just a monkey; an artist.
reviews: More straightforward than mist monkey, with pretty clear instructions throughout. I think I preferred the openness of mist monkey, but clay monkey is really enjoyable as well -- it's super relaxing, with beautiful artwork and lovely sounds. I would absolutely recommend this game if you're looking for something relaxing, and it's probably easier to get into than mist monkey, but if you enjoy clay monkey I would really recommend mist monkey too! I didn't have high expectations and I was rewarded. Enjoyed it. pretty neat little game I checked out the kickstarter. Turns out the solo dev is a ceramics professor. I am taking a ceramics class so I got this game for fun and I actually learned a lot. It was pretty relaxing too. it gives off feelings of tranquility and peace. the art and music are really nice. in my opinion this game is truly wonderful. i think everyone should play it. 10/10 would clay monkey again Super cool game. Gives me "A Short Hike Vibes" but more zelday. I hope more people find it. I actually learned art appreciation and ceramics stuff.

name: Solaria Moon
short_description: Solaria Moon is a space adventure in 3D with an outstanding script full of challenging puzzles to solve and mysteries to uncover.
reviews:
This is a short, mediocre and unoptimized 3D indie adventure game with tedious and repetitive puzzles, bad controls, and bad voice acting in a spaceship setting. You play a young female computer engineer who woke up from hybernation because of a malfunction in the spaceship, and she decided to find out what is going on with the ship in which one of your crewmates has disappeared and two of them are deceased. story sounds like bad Alien-inspired fan fiction, and the game feels also really low budget, and my patience ran out after two hours, and I decided to uninstall this game. Bad controls, Boring and insipid. Very basic puzzle/adventure game. Graphics & story mediocre; the characters were poorly-developed and two-dimensional. Puzzles OK but mostly tedious, math- or sequence-based puzzles. You can beat this game in an hour or two, tops. Game is short.

Voice acting is bad.
 
The puzzles are stupid, nonsensical and feel out of place in a spaceship environment.

The game camera is annoyingly jumpy

Pass. Not recommended, only for the die hard sci-fi adventure game fans imo.

I will start by saying that the game has some good moments, I managed to play it through and liked some of what the devs made here, but overall it was a letdown. The biggest selling points are the graphics, standard sci-fi setting and the low price. The game play, controls, short length and a few bugs here and there were the biggest downfalls. It just didn't feel clean and I sort of forced my way through until the end. Left/right controls turn the camera instead of strafing.
Some puzzles are too easy.  Some are too hard in the sense that there is a large number of possible combinations and I could not find a deduction path.  I had to either resort to randomly hitting buttons or even to do some Python programming to find the solutions. Attractive space feeling, unrealistic, but a nice and relaxing playthrue to my likes. Short, amateur, just a trivial space mystery story, without lore or history depth. 

The wriddles are based of a handful of repeated grid technics, and they have no logical connection with the environment or story, but thats OK for me regarding I treated the game as a 'relaxing casual break' of my main gaming endenvours of the time. The wriddles do challenge a bit the gamer intelligence, but after using pen and paper to structure down the logic of even the harder ones, they pose no threat any more. It feels like inteligence and creativity is less usefull than organised observation of the pazzle patterns to finally solve the matrix. In any case, they wriddles were interesting enouph to keep me playing the game. But regardless the short duration of the game, if a x3 expansion was relesased with the same logic of pazzles, I feel I would got bored of them.

Not a bad game, but since there is no 'middle grade' in STEAM, I will not recommend this since I feel it is too short for its original money price. Nice effort from the development team, but I believe there are other better amateur adventures out there. If you look for a casual space short episode, purchase Solaria Moon when on sales. But the few evenings gameplay cannot compete with other 10euro projects that offer moth-long entertaintment. It`s not a perfect game, but very enjoyable.

You wake up from hibernation in a space station. some of the crew died, one fled before you woke up. The game happens inside the station and while you investigate what happened to the programmed hibernation to fail you start to discover there might be a strange reason behind all that`s happening.

I found the game quite enjoyable: reasonable grapichs, relaxing music that matches the overall "isolated in space" atmosphere the game wants to convey, a lot of puzzles. The game is quite short (although worth the price you pay for) and the story let me down near the end. Some people might like it better than I did.

I also liked that when the character speaks there is a little portrait like a spaceship log, and the main character's voice is really well dubbed. You can't say that about the other crew members, but it doesn't take you away from the immersion.

Give it a go, it's well worth it. I rather liked Solaria moon. It's a modest game to be sure, and to enjoy it, it's good to come with modest expectations. This indie space adventure does a good job recreating the kind of bright and sterile sci-fi interiors, reminiscent of Star Trek or 2001: A Space Odyssey, and for me, this already puts things in the right atmosphere. The puzzles are focused not so much on inventory manipulation as on pulling levers and pushing buttons in the right sequence, sliding tiles around etc. I'm usually not a big fan of these, but they were well done in this game, and mostly not too hard. All in all, it took me 3 hours to play through this game and for the 99 cents I paid on sale, I consider that decent. For the full price, though, (currently $9.99), this game might underwhelm. It took 10 minutes for me to ragequit. I don't think a game has ever pissed me off this fast. This review gets a little salty, but rest assured that I'm not exaggerating. This game is bad.

First off, the protagonist is a psychopath. Her peers literally die during a catastrophe (a retarded one, mind you--the system has an error and reboots, and somehow a measly minute off of life support is enough to kill everyone, even though they could easily be woken up and immediately ready to walk), and her reaction is to monologue about it out loud, to nobody (talking to herself), in a monotone voice that conveys zero emotion. Hey, you know what? I tend to think aloud too, but at least my reaction to someone's death isn't casually stating the obvious for absolutely nobody to hear and then moving on without even taking a moment of silence to let the situation sink in. Aside from the horrible voice acting, that is just not an appropriate response at all, when your peers died and you narrowly survived. Casually stating "they are dead because of a system error and the other guy is missing" (which by the way, was ALREADY CONVEYED BY THE CUTSCENE BEFORE THAT! Show, don't tell) is not what a human being's reaction would be. A human being's reaction to that situation is "OH FUCK EVERYBODY'S DEAD AND I ALMOST DIED AND I'M ALONE, THIS IS HORRIBLE". is this character even fucking human?

After that, I was tasked with picking up clothes, something that our lone protagonist who is completely alone in the ship should not even care about, and yet she was so insistent on getting clothes that I couldn't do anything else until I looked at virtually everything in the room before finding the stupid locker where her clothes were. Why? What is the point of this? Why not just make that a cutscene?

After that, the game ended, because the only way forward is to solve a tedious rubix-cube-like puzzle that's not fun or interesting whatsoever, and I cannot will myself to spend any more time trying to sort the pieces in order. And what does this even have to do with the game? For a 3D game with FPS controls (and ugly troll doll-looking characters who don't act like human beings and can't voice act to save their lives), a random puzzle doesn't make sense.

Okay, so apparently this is a puzzle game. At least partly. Probably something like the witness. But the puzzles are garbage and un-fun, so that's actually worse. What the witness gets right that this game gets wrong is that the puzzles, while difficult, are actually *interesting*. A puzzle-piece swapper that is somehow the security authentication system for deactivating the sleeper pods to already-dead characters and plays like a rubix cube is NEITHER interesting nor fun. It's actually aggravating because what the hell is the purpose of shutting off life support when the goal is to escape the room? There's nothing else to do in the room, so that puzzle must be the way forward, and yet I don't understand why I'm doing it. Not only is this puzzle--the FIRST PUZZLE--too difficult to solve in a timely manner (give me a break, I suck at rubix cubes), but my efforts in trying to solve it feel pointless.

And that clusterfuck is just the first couple minutes. I know I only played that couple of minutes, but you have to understand that first impressions are everything, and this game sets a very bad one. People say you can't judge a book by its cover, but in reality, 99% of the time, you can. Crap is easier to spot given experience. And boy, is this game ever a trainwreck.

Oh, also the controls are bad, apparently. I wasn't paying attention to that because I was busy having my mind blown by everything else that was awful about the game. Had I stuck around long enough to experience the A/D-turning-instead-of-strafing everyone else is talking about, I would be complaining about that, too. As you can see, I only scratched the surface of this abomination.

It's almost like in my 10 minutes of playtime, I tested the game more thoroughly than the devs/QA team did. You know that one guy in the QA team? The guy who nags you on a daily basis about how your puzzles are poorly designed and the tasks don't make sense? Polish this, bugfix that? You should have listened to that guy.

I don't really have any comments on the other aspects of the games. The music is clearly unmemorable because I don't remember any music, and the graphics are whatever. As I said in an aside somewhere above, the characters are ugly troll-doll-looking things. And I say that because just look at the hair-do on the protag. What is going on up there?

name: EARTH DEFENSE FORCE: WORLD BROTHERS - Additional Mission Pack: Another ResCUBE
short_description: This is an additional mission pack featuring new enemies that do not appear in the base game. Contains over 10 advanced missions designed for elite soldiers. That long-awaited creepy-crawly enemy that EDF enlistees were waiting for is finally here.
reviews:
I bought this DLC quite awhile ago and I only just got around to finishing it. While short (clocking in at only 11 missions), this mission pack offers some of the most solid missions in the whole game. It's also nice that they went ahead and threw some new weapons in this DLC as well. If you enjoyed the main game, you'll enjoy this. The new weapons from this DLC are pretty neat (having Lionic missiles that are beacon-guided rather than laser-guided is sweet). I'm honestly not sold on most of the missions, I don't think they add much to the game (other than being higher difficulty), but the final two (of 11) are just total chaos, in the best way possible. If you thought the base game was easy and had no challenge then this mission pack is like getting hit with a wet towel from behind in a gym's locker room. Get it if you want a real challenge As with all EDF games, it's usually a good bet to buy the extra mission packs. 

This extra mission pack features its own self contained story, and the ability to find weapon packs hidden throughout the DLC specific levels along with characters. While no new characters are added to the roster, all the new weapons introduced are a real joy to play around with. 

The DLC also adds a new difficulty level, which may as well be called 'Get ready to load up your underwear' mode because man its a nightmare. Add on to the fact that these new 11 levels are more challenging than anything you've seen in the base game and also include some real explosive banger moments that will have you cheering, especially if you're playing with friends. 

An absolute solid buy. More of virtually the same. Don't be fooled by the weapons crates; they don't drop and are essentially the same as rescuing a member, but without the chance you'll obtain a new accessory.  If you liked the base game, you'll probably enjoy this expansion.  EDF EDF EDF by the way the centipedes are creeeeeeeeeeeeeepy! The dlc is pretty good but it's really hard. Just like edf 2 its good. and its very very hard.

name: Gatedelvers
short_description: A dungeon-crawling, world-hopping roguelike adventure! Grab your friends, stick dynamite to your sword, throw candles at your foes and die in various exciting ways!
reviews:
Very fun :) AMazing game! Not even kidding this is such a hidden gem. Everyone know loves this genre needs this game, it 10/10 Good game! Really fun game to play with friends This game is an absolute blast! The dev is also extremely responsive and even plays with players sometimes. Thank you so much for the fun times! A wacky, fun online co-op roguelite dungeon crawler that embodies the philosophy of interactivity, emergent depth, and pure fun over balance. The variety of items, enemies, characters, and passive skills along with just how much was taken into account with how they interact and how often you'll be surprised to see them do new things you've never seen before even many hours in really makes this something you'll find yourself coming back to frequently.

Its early access state means it's quite buggy and incomplete but there's still a lot of fun to be had even in its current state. It's a Roguelite top-down game with solid physics and an interesting mechanic where you can 'infuse' items with other items which grant it specific bonuses. You unlock more slots for these infusions the more bosses you defeat, and there's strategy (and some luck) involved with buildcrafting due to the card and infusion system. You can also curse items to purify them which has a chance to grant them lesser/greater enchantments as well as unique enchantments for specific items, such as a rock getting the Myriad enchantment which lets me indulge in my caveman fantasy of just throwing rocks at everything because now you throw infinite shadow rocks at people. There's also a lot of potential for co-op shenanigans where you and your buddy can cooperate to complement each other's builds.

All in all, great game, has rough edges due to being early access but it has amazingly solid ideas and a dev who actually cares about it. Plays pretty great in co-op too! Great foundation for a really solid co-op game!! The physics and systems are really slick and movement feels great. Not a vast amount of content available yet, but there are semi-regular patches.
Solo play has a bit of a steep learning curve, expect to die a lot on level 1, get the hang of it, and then rarely drop a run afterwards. Co-op mitigates this with a generous respawn system, but you may find yourself dying to the sheer chaos. Feels like a mix of Spiral Knights and Spelunky.
If you feel like adding a promising project to your library and supporting a small dev, give this one a shot! Fun and relatively unknown game In my opinion, a stunningly beautiful and immensely enjoyable game. 

Think 3D Spelunky with lots of verticality and fun ways of moving forward with leveling, gear and skills. But that much is an underestimation. Gatedelvers definitely has its own unique and undeniably captivating charm. You can easily tell that it was crafted with love.

The content available in the game has been enough for me to clock in at 36 hours so far. I am eagerly waiting for more to be added. It is already a wonderful game in its current state and can only get better.

name: Holiday Jigsaw Easter 3
short_description: Holiday Jigsaw. Easter 3: 500 holiday photos will provide many memorable experiences this year!
reviews:
"Holiday Jigsaw Easter 3" is a basic browser/Flash/mobile-app like jigsaw puzzle game.  Solve various jigsaw puzzles made up from images that the "developer" stole off the Internet and used without crediting the actual creators, making this plagiarism, as well as an asset flip and a cash grab.

An example of the stolen, uncredited/plagiarised artwork is [url=https://www.123rf.com/photo_17726116_colorful-flowers-decoration-with-blue-wall-background.html]"Colourful Flowers Decoration With Blue Wall Background"[/url], stolen and used without any apparent permissions or rights from the photographer, "Tul" via stock image site, 123RF.  Sure, the image rights may allow some stock images to be used without credit (although there's no reason to believe so in this case), and claiming credit for the work of others, as is happening here, is unethical, and the creative and intellectual bankruptcy going on here is unacceptable.

So what we have here is a basic jigsaw puzzle engine that's been skinned with a bunch of photos stolen off the internet and used without attribution.  The icing on the cake is the "developer" here has copy + pasted + reskinned this same asset onto Steam [i]a lot[/i]. 

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this game an insane SEVENTY SIX TIMES onto Steam with minor reskins... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of Creobit's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] 1001 Black Raven Jigsaw
[*] 1001 Jigsaw American Puzzles
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Castles And Palaces 1, 2, 3 and 4
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Detective 1, 2 + 3
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Home Sweet Home Wedding Ceremony 
[*] 1001 Jigsaw Legends of Mystery 1 through 6
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour Africa
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour Asia
[*] 1001 Jigsaw World Tour: Europe
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. 6 Magic Elements
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Cute Cats 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Earth Chronicles 1 through 9
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Home Sweet Home 1, 2 + 3
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Home Sweet Home. Back from Vacation
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Ice Age
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Interior Design
[*] 1001 JIGSAW. MYTHS OF ANCIENT GREECE
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. Wild Animals
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: Australian Puzzles
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: France
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: Great America
[*] 1001 Jigsaw. World Tour: London
[*] Alice's Jigsaw Time Travel 1 + 2
[*] Alice's Jigsaw. Wonderland Chronicles 1 + 2
[*] Caribbean Jigsaw
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Christmas 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Easter 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Halloween 1, 2, 3 and 4
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Thanksgiving Day 1, 2 + 3
[*] Holiday Jigsaw Valentine's day
[*] Jigsaw Boom 1 + 2
[*] Jigsaw Puzzle Beach Season 1 + 2
[*] Jigsaw Tour
[*] Pirate Jigsaw
[*] Royal Jigsaw 1, 2, 3, + 4
[*] Tasty Jigsaw: Happy Hour 1 + 2
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes this might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 2 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

"Holiday Jigsaw Easter 3" has the farcical price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.

name: BIT.TRIP.FATE Soundtrack
short_description: BIT.TRIP FATE takes CommanderVideo to a darker place. The rhythms are heavy; the sound unlike anything he's ever heard. Now you too can explore an unfamiliar and hypnotic genre mash-up wherein dubstep and chipmusic flirt with, and intoxicate your senses.
reviews:
:( BIT.TRIP.FATE Soundtrack is the soundtrack to BIT.TRIP FATE, the fifth game in the BIT.TRIP series. It can be sampled prior to purchase at the developer's Bandcamp page: http://gaijingames.bandcamp.com/album/bit-trip-fate-original-soundtrack

Unlike the other BIT.TRIP games, FATE's soundtrack is less intrinsically tied to the player action, so the songs work a little better outside of the game environment. It's a fine, if short, soundtrack.

Similar to the other BIT.TRIP soundtracks, half of the tracks are very short - the noises for completing or failing a level, etc, so there's only five "full" tracks on the album. I recommend looking at the price accordingly.

name: My Dream Setup - Garage DLC
short_description: Do you want to create your dream Garage? With the Garage DLC it's now possible. You can create any garage you want. Any size, any color combination, any budget, with car or motorcycle - it's all up to you.
reviews:
This DLC is very raw, the cars arent at scale. Porsche is bigger than Charger!!!!
And the elevators are there, yes you can use the seccond floor, but its really hard to do it, its badly implemented. I think devs should work in it to fix it. I cant reccomend it at this state nice dlc

YOU GUYS ACTUALLY LISTENED. I think it was around Spring or Summer of 2024 when I requested for a Garage DLC and YOU GUYS ACTUALLY DID IT. I know im late to this because it was released in November of 2024 and its now Jan of 2025, but hey college got in the way and this is a very nice way for a car enthusiast to relax from the struggles of the world with out playing other types of car games. Now its time to learn how to 3D model my 2016 Subaru WRX into the game. Great idea! The best DLC!
It's a pity that popular tools like a table saw, drill press, welder, larger compressor or lathe are missing. A real carpenter's table would also be useful. love it how do i put it in the game hej AMAZING You should charge more for your DLCs The dlc is awesome, but I would like more garage stuff. Example stuff from mechanic workshop Cool DLC! 10/10

name: Finesse
short_description: Jump your way to glory in this gravity-defying arcade platformer. Lasers attack the player from all sides, high and low, at merciless speeds. With well-timed moves, however, they zoom by without leaving a scratch. Survive to win fans, prizes, and more opportunities to dodge things.
reviews:
super fun and chill game. the highlight is the music which makes me dance and replicate dodging lasers irl like every level has an absolute banger going on. charming little game with nice graphics!! Fun Times!!  
Great controls, toe tapping beats, vibrate graphics and a cast of characters with the most stylish outfits
Jumping lasers doesn't get much better than this.

name: Santa's Christmas Solitaire 3
short_description: Santa's Christmas Solitaire 3 offers a new festive story, unique game modes, and a Christmas shop to aid Santa‚Äôs quest
reviews:
Santa's Christmas Solitaire 3 is a very pleasant Christmas solitaire game!! There are some wonderful festive scenes. Made by good developers who actively support the game. [i]Santa‚Äôs Christmas Solitaire 3[/i] is a solitaire game brimming with holiday goodness. A great story with beautiful artwork to get you into the Christmas mood. 

[h2][u]Gameplay & Features[/u][/h2]

Settings include; Full screen or windowed, system cursor or choose your own, audio controls, background brightness, card score effects (on or off), background effects (on or off), hidden objects (on or off) and the ability to skip the intro. Also chose from numerous gorgeous card backs! 

[u]Highlights[/u]

* Festive story that is well voice acted
* Holiday music to get you into the Christmas spirit 
* Mini games including Freeplay, TriPeaks, Blackjack, Slots and Five Peaks. You can turn off the mini-games if you wish in the settings menu. As well as the mini-game timer. 
* 4 difficulty modes (relaxed, casual, normal and hard)
* 24 chapters (like an advent calendar) with 10 levels within each chapter
* Lots of power ups to buy 

üéÑ  Achievements and a wallpaper gallery have been added to the game! Thank you devs.

[i]Highlighting the gorgeous artwork[/i]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3394636988
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3394636905

[h2][u]Overall Experience[/u][/h2]

I have enjoyed all of Revills previous Christmas solitaire games throughout the years and was delighted to see a new installment this year. And this one does not disappoint. It is very festive with gorgeous artwork, a great story and music to get you into the Christmas spirit. 

I admit Christmas is now past but as long as snow is on the ground (I am in Canada so we see snow for months following the big day) I continue to enjoy my Christmas games. For lovers of Christmas and solitaire this one is a must buy. ‚ùÑÔ∏è

The aesthetics and expressiveness of this work are quite powerful. It presents various contents in a comic-like form, and the character creation as well as the elaboration of the characters' backstories are truly wonderful (the only pity is that I couldn't find more stories about the villains). I really like this game. It's a pity that there isn't a good enough guide currently, and it seems that it will still take some time before the official version is available. However, just judging from this trailer and these elaborate promotional photos, I'm already eager to buy it! I also really like the sexual elements added by the author. It's not a forced addition but rather a story where they blend and complement each other. It's been a long time since I came across such a story and work. It's both a spiritual enjoyment and can bring great satisfaction on the sensual side. I'm still exploring the content of the game, looking forward to the subsequent official version and the guide. The author is amazing, and I hope he can keep it up! I will keep on supporting!
Again, this is not just a simple game to me, it is an unique and excellent artistic work. Love it A difficult, sexy, deep puzzle game that stands out for being so dark in tone. If you like sexy vampires and big, strong men with troubled pasts, this is the game for you!

its not a game This game was not great. name: Color by Number - Pixel Draw
short_description: Color by Number - Pixel Draw is an addictive anti-stress pixel art game. Choose from a variety of fun pixel images and follow the numbers to bring them to life. Pixel Coloring has never been this easy!
reviews:
Individual clicks are required to fill each colour box. You can't just click and drag like in the far superior Coloring Pixels or autofill all directly attached same numbered boxes like in any of the Coloring Game games, all of which are available on Steam.

I'm not looking to get a repetitive stress injury from clicking for every box, thanks. let me paint broadly or in batches if I want to. The main game is not bad overall, there are both interesting pictures and not so interesting ones, but what bothered me was the lack of achievements, while the free alternatives have them.
Expansion Pack 1, it's terrible, uninteresting pictures, lots of food, stones, etc. pretty fun dont know why people gave it negative reviews although your hand can get tired from all the clicking
 Good time waster. Don't buy the expansions because you'll be coloring repeats of pictures already colored. I love coloring pixel games and I have a ton of other similar games in my library already. But this one is garbage, thanks to the awful controls. I don't need the smoothest controls and I can forgive a lot in coloring games (I still found enjoyment in other average coloring games), but I can barely finish the first picture in this one. Because for some stupid reason the left mouse button doesn't just color in the pixels, it ALSO is used for moving the picture around.

Let me explain why that is a big problem. In other coloring pixel type games you use the left mouse button to color pixels and the right mouse button to move the picture. Meaning you can just pick a color, hold down the left mouse button and move the cursor around to color plenty of pixels at once to speed thing up and make it easier on your fingers. And once you're done with the first part of the picture and need to move to the next uncolored section, you press in the right mouse button, move the picture to the uncolored section and start the same process over again. Simple. Easy.

In this game though, when you hold in the left mouse button to fill in more then one pixel at a time, instead of coloring the pixels normally, you just move the picture all over uncontrollably. So if you wanna finish a picture, you will have to color in each individual pixel one at a time. All because of the tedious controls. And no, you can't change them. There are exactly two options in the settings. Enable/Disable sounds and enable/disable music. That's it. That's all the settings you can change. Heck, unlike other coloring games you can't even use the mouse wheel to zoom in and out, you just have to use a slider at the top of the screen. Oh and the game also doesn't have an official exit game button, you just have to press the ESC key, meaning that if you press escape expecting to pull up the options, you just close down your game instead.

Just get another coloring pixel game instead. There are plenty on Steam to choose from. This has been a blast playing, like paint by numbers when I was a kid. And with the DLC's they go from very simple to more complicated with much detail. I really enjoy this game bought all expansions I do one or two a day lots to choose from with their DLC 's and other games with the guns and monsters just good work.  Pixel Draw really is an addictive anti-stress pixel art game.  A really good one! i opened it and when i try to scroll down it barely moves at all. does anyone have a fix for this?

if this gets fixed it seems plenty fair for $2

if this does not get fixed then i would question the devs and not recommend Pictures are really nice but I'm really upset that I cannot recommend this game.

I bought it for my 4 and 5 y/o kids.
I was expecting it to be an advanced clone of their favorite "Sandbox" game on Android.
It looks nearly the same as mentioned above Sandbox but unfortunately, the gameplay is much worse:

1. There is no way to paint more pixels by double click
2. The DLC does not extend your library - There are just separate games with different pictures.
3. Not sure is it because of the DLC I've downloaded but the basic version does not start out of the box (had to move directories on my disk) as it cannot find the exe file - the path is invalid.

Because of the 1. It is not playable for even for the very patient kids.
I hope it will change in the future...

name: Staffer Reborn
short_description: Staffer Reborn is a game of supernatural abilities and logical deduction set in 1960s America. It tells the story of a man trapped in a cycle of death and resurrection caused by his supernatural ability and the investigator who was recruited to help.
reviews:
A bit short but give us a good side story to the first game *sudden realization* fun and short spin off for those who played the first staffer case and want more. I can't wait for staffer case 2 to come out now... Well-written sequel to Staffer Case It was cool, but I beat it within 3 hours. a very charming game with an interesting concept executed well despite the short play-through time It's short, but a nice story nonetheless. I don't think you'll enjoy it as much without finishing the original game (Staffer Case) first, A succinct visual novel experience that delivers a number of very satisfying reveals. I also appreciate the monochromatic visuals, making the red accents stand out. Unsure how I felt about some of the events in the ending, but that feels more to taste than anything else. started/finished on : 15.12.2024

a girl who bossed too hard. you gotta play the first game to understand whats going on but this was very enjoyable and the end had me giggling and kicking my feet. it's a semi sequel to staffer case, as in it explains a certain ending in the first game.

the gameplay itself is a more shortened version of the original, where the clue combination makes you do just 1 clue instead of 2 in the original.

i think it goes without saying that one would have to pplay staffer case before this one. not just that, though, the side stories as well.

You Czechs actually passed an anti-China resolution and intervened in China's Taiwan Strait affairs? How can the confidence and ability of a small country be mixed with other countries' affairs? For the sake of freedom and democracy? What does the freedom and democracy of others have to do with you? What does the freedom and democracy of other countries have to do with you? Are you God?
Make your game well, please stay away from politics. super bug not buy

name: FSX Steam Edition: Robinson R44 Add-On
short_description: The R44 is a lightweight, versatile, piston-powered four seat helicopter renowned for its economical, reliable, and safe operation. With its sleek design, impressive speed, and unparalleled reliability the R44 delivers the performance of a turbine helicopter at an affordable piston price.
reviews:
wow terrible graphics can not see instruments properly i just paid for this addon Steam is absolute garbage. I wish I had never installed it. I only have it to use the latest version of FSX, and constant unwanted updates from Steam have made the game almost unplayable. I just paid for the R44 add on from Steam and I don't have it and can't download it, despite Steam saying "R44 Add-On is already in your Steam library". Now I'm going to have to go pay for this add on again somewhere else in order to download it. I love this helicopter. It is really stable and a delight to fly. Loads of liveries and 3 variants. The ones with the pop out floats are my fave, but all are just as great. The only thing I don‚Äôt like very much are the goofy expressions on the people on board. Hardly a knock against the pack overall. If you want a new helicopter and are used to only the stock ones, this is perfect! Actually anybody interested in a new ‚Äòcopter should consider buying. It‚Äôs worth every penny. Before i start off my review i'd like to note i have never flown a helicopter outside of the simulator so i have no idea on if the flightmodel is realistic, that said i'll start my review.

The R44 presented in here including all the details shown above are all there, their is indeed a checklist, animated pilot/passangers and a heck of a lot of liverys.  At first it was pretty hard to controle as the helicopter seems to be nose-heavy so you have to apply a lot of cyclic to keep her level.  When it comes to flight characteristics i have to say i enjoy it very much, as i said i have no experience with real helicopters so i can't say the accuracy is or isn't there compared to the real R44 but that being said it seems that the helicopter acts likes a normal helicopter would and not like the default rotorwing aircraft such as the default R22.  Overall i found this to be my favorite helicopter in my hanger and the speed and good handling makes it for a enjoyable sightseeing helicopter.

name: Warhammer: Chaos & Conquest - Tzeentch Warlord Bundle
genres: Massively Multiplayer, Simulation, Strategy, Free To Play
short_description: Spread Chaos across the Old World and unleash the combined power of Tzeentch's mightiest servants!
reviews: All of the DLC for this game through steam is terrible in terms of value.

name: Monaco Soundtrack by Austin Wintory
short_description: A crazy ragtime-inspired 2-disc collection from Grammy-nominated composer Austin Wintory, with guest performers Laura Vall, Viking Jesus, Chipzel and more.
reviews:
Nice stealthy tunes. bought the game on 3 different steam accounts, not doing it again but there's a reason I've done it thrice. Ripping good tunes, great background music and somehow during the Steam sale buying this made buying the game cheaper than if I bought just the game? Don't ask questions, just take the money and run. Contains the full OST (2 "discs") In both MP3 and FLAC format. The albums a tad disorganised (both versions are in the same folder) but apart from that.. No complaints.

Good quality audio and all 34 tracks are there in [b].../common/monaco/soundtrack[/b] :cleanfloppy: Worth purchasing as a bundle along with the main game. Awesome soundtrack. LOVE THIS BUY IT PLZ IT IS SSSSOOOOO GOOOD!!!!!!!! Not only do you get a great soundtrack, you get a second album's worth of bonus tracks and covers! Definitely worth. Great, great OST.

name: Delphinia Chronicle
short_description: Fully developed PC Action RPG game! All we need is your vote and steady interest!! Any questions are welcomed!
reviews:
How To Beat Mission Man Prepared For Battle Final Mission? Otherwise game is very good! Sorry not much I can say that others didn't already cover. Game needs some work that's for sure..... [b]Worth It? NO[/b]

[h1]LIKES[/h1]
[list]
[*]Weapons and armor change your appearance
[*]Combat while straight forward, can be mind-numbingly fun
[*]Simple but effective art style
[/list]

[h1]DISLIKES[/h1]
[list]
[*]Looks, feels, and controls like a mobile port
[*]No re-bindable keys means your skills are always on keys 3-8 and potions are 1-2
[*]No resolution options (fixed to a small window)
[*]Delay when picking up each piece of loot making looting a slow and frustrating experience
[*]Not all menu functions have shortcut keys, ESC doesn't always take you back to previous screen
[*]Poorly implemented inventory system
[*]Navigating UI is frustrating and counterintuitive, built for mobile not PC
[*]Gameplay is fumbly
[/list]

[h1]The Final Word[/h1]

Delphinia Chronicle looked like a neat little action RPG with glorious loot -- it called to me -- I picked it up and started playing.

"Why is it in a small window? Can I make this full-screen?"

I furiously searched for the options menu and it was no where to be found. I pressed ALT-ENTER, nothing. Okay, let's keep going.

I created my character then found myself in what I figured was the Town HUB.

"Hey, there's the menu button!" *click* nothing *click click* nothing happens.

Turns out you need to complete the tutorial before you can access any in-game options. *sigh* 

The tutorial was surprisingly decent -- teaching me how to equip and enhance loot, trying out different character skills, etc. However, I quickly learned navigating menus and inventory panels was infuriating. The tutorial failed to properly teach combat and all the keys, although I eventually figured it out -- later to learn the keys could not be changed.

Tutorial finished, on to a scenario -- fought some baddies, leveled up, and gained a couple skills. All the while loot is dropping everywhere, but there's an odd 2-second delay between picking up each item, making looting a slow and painful process in what is supposed to be a fast-paced Action RPG.

First impressions are everything, and Delphinia Chronicle was a major disappointment, even at its affordable price point.

Get me out of here. Uninstalled. Refunded.

[url=http://discoverplayshare.com/review/delphinia-chronicle]Read the Full Review[/url] Do not buy this game. This is a poorly ported. It's very buggy and not worth $5 at it's current state. I'm asking for a refund.  This game belongs on a mobile device and not PC. Controls are horrible. Some of the buttons don't work such as the menu button, inbox, etc., chatting with the NPC isn't intuitive, my character likes run backwards, a lot of typos, no walkthrough or guide when starting out, when the character are speaking... it does a "spelling bee style" by spelling out each character of each word... just a terrible choice of animation/transition. Graphically, it looks nice but that's all it has going for it. Wasd controls are so bad its insane. You copycat Dungeon fighter for literally everything except the controls, and in place of it you add this??? And I can't change it at all? Speaking of controls they are really buggy, and sometime you attack in the wrong direction.

For loot there no intresting effects on weapons, even legendaries, just attack increases. Its so dull. Also whats the point when you can just get all your endgame weapons with cash?

No reason to play over Dungeon Fighter, why isnt this early acess? It's ethier terrible or incomplete. Not even worth a Dollar DLC to get cash INGAME not working. I Bought 3 hours ago and they send nothing. I dont know, its lagging all the time if u want to Loot something/sometimes u need 10 second to loot. The game itself freezes somtimes when a Quest triggers. I'm gonna refund this...

Positive is the Audio! Nice music. Option to take itens sometimes simply " freeze" and you can¬¥t take de item sometimes ( this is laughable for a 2017 game).
Can you make it fullscreen?
Will there be an option to change controls in the future? 
Beside minor details, game os really really good! ***This is the first and (possibly the only) negative review I posted on steam, most of time I don't bother posting negative reviews, but this time I felt like I have social responsibilities to let people know what they will run into buying this game.***




This is a cheap mobile game diectly ported to pc.

The UI of this game is clearly specifically designed for mobiles (touch devices), and there is differences/experience/expectations between mobile and desktop. Take, for example, the character‚Äôs skills are shown in round button (I literally want to touch my monitor to cast the spell), but instead you figure out you should press 3, 4, 5, 6 on your keyboard. Same thing goes to the menu and all the sub menu.

The graphics, judging from a PC game point of view, looks weird to me in a way that even though the surroundings, characters, and enemies are all in one screen, there isn‚Äôt many interactions between them, and it gives me the feeling of stiffing when it comes to the combat system. It is further penalized by the poor/low frame drawing; the animation is not smooth.

I do want to say that I only played this game for only 10 mins in scenario mode, however it should give me a rough idea what I am getting into. I will probably consider playing on an ipad but definitely not on a pc.

name: On the front line
short_description: "On the front line" - tank simulator. Action takes place during World War II. Battles are unilaterally - for the Red Army. Action in the game takes place on two large locations. Sequential execution of combat missions.

name: Whirligig Media Player
short_description: A versatile VR and desktop media player for watching 2D, 3D, and 360¬∞ videos with customizable playback, projection modes, and full stereoscopic support.
reviews:
this is one of the mostly 90% working VR video viewer that works in linux out of the box with 0 extra tinkering vs any other apps. This app has gone down in quality, continuous issues plague each version. Great for Academic research. I overlooked this application a while ago, at the time it didn't work for my needs and refunded it. That said as I was using DEO VIdeo CPU Gobbler taking 50% sometimes even 100 percent of my CPU, it had to go.

Tried Whirligig and it was way more usable, lightweight and the biggest selling point is it doesn't grind my computer to a halt.
Respect to the developer for taking constructive feedback and making an insane application, has a lot of features other media players don't, I haven't run across any that autoplay the next file. That said its not really plug in play, you kind of have to mess around with it to get what you want and luckily thats where the save/load presets come in handy.

Things I like
Autoplay 
Cosmetic Controllers
Customization of backgrounds
Lightweight
Random file feature, however i wish you could go back instead of that being random but maybe thats just me. like if you pressed Left on the left control stick.
Slideshow

However I do have some requests, Pausing once a menu has opened is really quite annoying, [strike] like if you skip ahead in the progress bar it pauses it [/strike] there's ways to prevent this from happening like binding Up on the left controller to pause play and that's really the biggest complaint or lack of feature from me. 

png webp gif and ( i cant remember if jpeg was one of them) files don't seem to open hopefully that's fixed in the future.

and lastly clicking on shortcuts in the explorer menu specifically the premade ones for clicking on Videos, Downloads or Images can and will break you from interacting with other media, if you try and go to one of your Shortcut 1-10 the files show up for a split second and disappear. which can be annoying cause you can fix the problem not knowing what you did or it doesn't fix at all.

Also I don't know how to reprogram any of the Shortcuts 1 through 10 Has more options for controls than other players, but no proper Index Controller integration (the touch pad is tread as 1 singular button wth), also the tilt control can't be changed from 0,5 increments and give me motion sickness because it's so unsmooth.
Also: why do i have to set the proper 180¬∞ SBS individually for every video.
Way too clunky all in all 58008/10 Deo VR started with low framerates and stuttering badly on loads of videos so I tried this out and it plays them all brilliantly. 

The UI takes a bit of getting used to but overall excellent. well worth the money for such a well put together video player. the developer is also very active with updating and improving the software Don't buy this. Really. I had so many problems with this one app..Images looking blurry, no slideshow option, weird controls and it was hell.

I have an Oculus quest 2 and I bought "VR MEDIA VIEWER" which cost more than this but was worth it. If you are like me and want to have a lot of control over your VR images and videos and enjoy having a slideshow function then Whirligig is not the route to take.

name: Desire Den
short_description: Step into a fantasy unlike any other and interact with unique creatures all looking for one thing. A good time.
reviews:
game is good but could use some Lesbian only areas and some bdsm stuff and other stuff What I write for this review is the experience I had with the game, everybody will experience things differently. This is my honest review if you don't like it well tough. Also no game is safe from a review whether its alpha, beta, early access or full release, now onto the review. Also this review is for PC version only.

Desire Den is anthropomorphic sex club game. You can play 3 different characters, a male (Blue Boy), female (Lilly) & a shemale (Pinky). There are intractable characters you can do sex scenes with as each playable characters. However two of the playable characters ( can interact with 5 character (Blue Boy & Lilly) while the other playable character (Pinky) can only interact with 3 characters. 

Issues With Game
1. The main menu mouse arrow sometimes dont appear, you have to hit ESC to make it appear & doing this can sometimes make the arrow stay active on your screen which causes an issue with walking a round, mainly when looking around.
2. The intractable furry Desiree can be interacted with two times when playing with Blue Boy & Lilly but than disappear but when playing as Pinky Desiree is only intractable one time but doesnt disappear.
3. When playing as Lilly & interacting with Lucid, the game will freeze.
4. When playing as Lilly & interacting with Ivarra, the "special blend" cigarette isnt placed in Lilly mouth properly due to her height.
5. Chat selecting will cause camera to move.
6. Sex scenes that say right click character+drag character only works on 1 the scenes when there are two scenes that offer the option
7. Johnny (the bartender) doesnt do anything special, can only talk to him. 
8. Lucid is a one time interaction with all characters.
9. Aleph's dialog is a bit slow & stops talking at wrong times. 
10. The hologram isnt worth obtaining since the sex animation is the same for all three playable characters. 

The only positive things about this game is the music & the okay graphics & thats it. I see what the devs are trying to do here but the game on pc just doesnt offer a lot of verity to do. Everything is basically the same scenes just different genders. I think the game could be good if there were more stuff to do, more intractable characters & better sex scenes.  As for now the game is a 4/10, making it below average game.

Thats the Pony review for Desire Den (pc version) Wolf Dick! Sheath! Knot! all these years later....you made the vr a $30 cash grab. YIKES I want my money back, the store page said vr yet it doesn't support it Yeah, definitely don't waste your time or money with this one. There's like, five unique scenes, max, all of which have mediocre looking animations at best. Game *has* potential, but it really just appears as a cash grab in its current state. All the assets in the game are from free models in unity or other random sources. The kobold model obviously being from kobold kare. I can only call this game as pre-alpha. When listening to the speech it sounds like General AI dialogue. Game is listed as VR however does not work with the VR.  Opening screen does not show you cursor so you're left guessing where you're at when you're trying to select play or options. Options do not show key bindings so you know how to interact when trying to interact it to a dead end point and repeats. thou the animated parts are good there is not a lot to do so i do not recommend this to any one and there is no saving the game No matter how long I hold down the E key it doesn't seem to work, something must be wrong. so i havent played all too much but so far its defiantly a work in progress.. i do like it and see lots of updates down the road.. but keep up the work dev! 

bugs i encountered.. camera not moving scenes to see the action.. and chat opitions not showing up

Things i hope for: maybe a character customization.. male and female choices and maybe more rooms

name: Save Jesus
short_description: Someone is trying to murder Jesus. Disguised as Caesar with the Roman Empire by his side, an evil impostor from the future has set hundreds of deadly traps. Redirect the traps, kill the Romans and protect Jesus!
reviews:
This game saved me I love this game I LOVE JESUS SO MUCH. This game reminds me of when i was a wee lad at bible camp but 10 times better. The pure quality and accuracy of this game makes it a 10/10. Addictive religious puzzle game: janky mechanics, luck-based outcomes, repetitive achievements, surprisingly engaging despite low expectations. game of the year
 Gross! Very historically accurate game to what actually happened in the Bible. The Christian church is apostate and against the 10 commandments. They teach the opposite of what the Messiah did, preaching faith alone, OSAS, pretrib rapture nonsense, and they're promoting pagan idolatry like Christmas and Easter. Google the origins of these holidays, it's all ancient Roman and Babylonian god worship that the Lord hates, found nowhere in the Bible. If you want to be saved then you need to actually start obeying the instruction of God, which means not being a partaker of this stuff and keeping the 10 commandments. The church follows the Roman Empire's 321 AD Sunday law instead of the actual Saturday Sabbath commandment, which is the same problem Christ had with the Pharisees:

Mark 7:6-7
6 He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
7 Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.

We're supposed to follow the Messiah in truth. Flee from the lies of the church and repent. We can't break the Sabbath, eat abominations like pork and shellfish, or be a partaker of worldly idolatry like praying to wood statues or crosses or christmas and easter. Yeshua, the Messiah, taught you how to be great in the kingdom:

Matthew 5:19
19 Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

Loving your neighbor means to rebuke sinners so they repent:

Leviticus 19:17-18
17 Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.
18 Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the Lord.

But the hippie Jesus church prefers tolerance which is why they're going to be destroyed 100% Love I'm not that much into physics puzzles, but this was fun.
Must be Jesus. you cant sex jesus 100% completing this made my brain rot. 10/10.

name: Mosaic of The Pharaohs
short_description: Mosaic of The Pharaohs is a picross/minesweeper hybrid featuring a single ENORMOUS puzzle inspired by Egyptology
reviews:
Another amazing mega pixels game! I've loved all of these in this series and they're an auto-buy for me. This one took me 19 hours to play through the first time and is great for having something to do while listening to audiobooks or podcasts! Really fun and addicting puzzle. Takes quite awhile to finish so there's a lot of content here for the price. Another fantastic mosaic puzzle. Lots of cool facts and beautiful art. This game was quite fun and relaxing for the most part.  It took awhile for me to get the hang of patterns and I found that I had to step away from the game quite a bit as it was tiring. Certainly fun to play but do not expect to complete it in one sitting. Essentially as cool as the other Mosaic games: Very chill, cool facts, and a mid difficulty level that is neither hard nor trivial.

There is a small bug where the formatting of the text isn‚Äôt right, as words are enclosed in underscores but no formatting is applied; But that‚Äôs barely an inconvenience. So yeah, complete recommendation if you'd like a chill-vibe puzzle game to pass some time while watching/listening to something else on the side. 
 thank you for making the glow toggleable! I have poor eyesight and really appreciate that :) love these games!! very relaxing to play. 

Edit: thanks for adding the glow toggle! much easier to look at now. EDIT: The issue has been fixed, thank u!

The yellow color is way too bright and weirdly illuminated. It's extremely harsh and tiring for ur eyes and I would prefer it to be similar to how it looks on the store page pictures
Otherwise the game is good and similar to the previous games, but at least currently it's extremely hard to recommend it because of the color Edit: The fact that the brightness can be lowered is a nice feature, much appreciated! :) Mark Ffrench has done it again. If you're unsure wether to buy this game, go play 2024: Mosaic Retrospective first, and then come back and buy this game.

 better than space marine 2 it is a good game but the update is not that creative lately. Game is pretty terrible Underrated. Looks and plays like a mobile game port of Left 4 Dead 2 G√úZEL

name: Hot Pool
short_description: Adult people gathered at a hot pool party with boundless flirting and sex. Your goal is to arrange the characters according to their sexual orientation (including LGBT).
reviews:
This game is life changing. before this game my professor told me to seek therapy after listing to family guy "i got a glock in my rari" on repeat for 4 days straight, but after playing hit game "hot pool" i don't think its necessary anymore. The game beams with life, every level you can see the care and time hit studio VirtexUniverse took in creating a masterclass of game. This game should be studied for generations, its a shame that its being sold for the price it is, I would pay one hundred fold for the same game. The puzzles created in this game is quite possibly the best in all of game development and it shows, segregating people based on gender and sexuality is just what the american dream was founded upon. I would love to show my support to hit studio VertexUniverse in any way possible. I stumbled upon this game though hit steam catalog "Trans-tastic Games" and they frankly did not recommend it. I am pleased to report they are indeed wrong on all accounts, and frankly that catalog is down right un-patriotic, and i will NOT be supporting it any longer. Bravo to Vertex, you deserved  all 72 Canadian cents I gave you <3 As an aspergic gay guy, I am so thrilled to play Sexual Segregation: The Game. Just segregate out the gays and lesbians, put the heterosexuals in groups to the side, lump all the FTM-/MTF- people together, ensure the MTF+/FTM+ people are paired off (Because they're somehow more picky than MTF-/FTM- people?) and then dump the bisexuals into whatever space remains. Easy!

If you too feel you would make a great social planner, and you believe in complete sexual segregation, then this game is perfect for you! :U

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1546840372

name: The King's Feast
short_description: Take hold of the King‚Äôs Sword and its path as it flies through a bustling and grand feast. Choose to go the distance or smite as many of King‚Äôs conspirators as possible! No matter which you choose, there will be total chaos. Go forth, and make it a feast to remember!
reviews:
For the low price, I had a good amount of fun with it. Nothing livens up a feast like that man of the people,. the King, throwing his sword down the length of what must surely be the record holder for longest dining table. Making a game of how far it will travel and how many peasants will lose their heads. The next dish to be served is lamprey pie, so it's a kindness, really.

There is not much depth to it, once you craft a new sword with the finest blade, handguard, handle, and pommel available. And get a feel for the controls that fine-tune the sword's flight path, learning which objects on the table will bounce the sword and extend a "run." But by the time I reached that point, I felt like I'd gotten my money's worth. Pros:
- Fun and kind of addictive! Just had to keep throwing my sword and letting the high-speed, sword-tossing chaos ensue. 
- I like that I can use a keyboard & mouse or a controller to move the sword around.  
- The customization for making your own swords is pretty awesome. Note: Hopefully, they will keep adding more parts to further customize things.

Cons:
- A few graphical glitches but nothing too serious.
- Some of the menus and text can blend in with the backgrounds, I missed a few things on my first play sessions.

name: Victoria 3: Trade Ships Bonus Pack
short_description: This pack includes three new ship designs for the on-map representation of commercial vessels crossing the trade lanes of the globe.
reviews:
Not really any problem with the ships, what I have an issue with is the description of this bonus pack. 

"an art pack immediately available for free to everyone who buys the Victoria 3: Expansion Pass"

This is blatant predatory text and shows just how corrupted Paradox is. You are literally paying 36 USD to get this bonus pack, it is by no means "free". This is the same exact vibe of Creative Assembly boasting about releasing a [b]free update[/b] for a total war game. I like it. ship More Boats! BOATS (Read in Matt Berry's voice) WE SHALL HAVE MORE BOATS FOR TRADE AND EEMMMMPPIIIIRREEE!!! Free Ships!

name: Hot Guns: International Missions
short_description: Your conventional methods of operation are "shoot first then shoot again!"
reviews:
Inferior al anterior Mission Ammunition (y eso que copia niveles enteros). Pero entretiene, y aunque sea algo m√°s caro que el anterior, sigue siendo muy barato. Wow! incredible game, so funny to play that you can't stop playing it. t's very similar to Prison Run and Gun and it remembered me to another great game: Not a Hero.

PROS: very fun to play + explosions + weapons + levels are quite varied and well done + responsive controls + catchy music
 
CONS: you die sooooo many times and start the level again and again muy divertido .. Kleines aber feines Run & Gun, das auf mich wie eine Mischung aus Meat Boy und Broforce wirkt. Dank des durchdachten Leveldesigns, dem geschmeidigen Handling und der immer wieder am√ºsanten wie chaotischen Kettenreaktionen hatte ich selbst nach zig Neustarts noch ein L√§cheln im Gesicht. Die Optik ist zwar simpel, konnte bei mir aber mit ein paar charmanten Animationen, lustigen Ragdoll-Effekten, wuchtigen Explosionen und netten 2,5D-Tricksereien punkten. √úbrigens perfekt f√ºr das Steam Deck

Einen ausf√ºhrlicheren Text zum Spiel findet ihr auf meinem Blog:
[url=https://polygonien.de/2024/10/hot-guns-oder-meat-boy-x-broforce/]https://polygonien.de/2024/10/hot-guns-oder-meat-boy-x-broforce/[/url] Reminds me of both Hotline Miami and especially Door Kickers: Action Squad.
Great layer of pixel-art combat, mixed with that gruelling difficulty of only being able to take one shot (unless you follow the construction-site health & safety protocol).

Thank heck there was at least a single guide for the hidden secrets. Would have taken me forever to find my way around every sneaky corner that might find you an extra coin or two. Although, it is in German. <-< - difficult 
- multiplayer 
- price [i] My Experience [/i]

I recently played through this with a friend and we had a pretty good time. If you were just to read the game's name and description, you might get the idea that [b]Hot Guns[/b] is fast-paced and adrenaline-fueled, but that would be incorrect. To achieve any kind of success, you'll generally want to approach obstacles and enemies in a slow, measured, and considered way.

Your character can take at most two hits, and this is only if you've found a helmet. It's very easy to accidentally stumble into a bit of fire from one of the game's many explosions, and this will send you right back to the beginning of the level. Sometimes you'll die to a quick influx of enemies, only knowing where they'll spawn from on your second attempt. The number of guns you have equipped affects your jump height, and you'll often have to drop all of your weapons in order to grab the corner of a high ledge. It's worth noting that your gun flies at a slightly upwards angle behind you when you unequip it - sometimes, you can jump and throw your gun up on a ledge this way before jumping up yourself, so you won't be quite so helpless when you encounter the game's next baddie.

My main gripes concerning the title were:
[list]
[*] It took us quite a while to realize that the storehouse is where we're meant to spend the money we're earning in levels. Perhaps the game could give a prompt at the end of each level or section asking if players would like to visit the storehouse and acquire new weaponry.
[*] What on earth is the suitcase that you pick up in some of the levels? What does it do?
[*] In one of the levels there is a lift, and it took us FOREVER to figure out what we were supposed to do here. You'll need to hop on the platform up and to the left of the lift, shoot the cover off of a switch that is attached to a pole, and then pass the switch while jumping to flip it and activate the elevator.
[/list]

Despite these gripes, I can definitely recommend [b]Hot Guns[/b] to play cooperatively through Remote Play Together on Steam. It's not the strongest recommendation, but if you play it slowly and thoughtfully, you'll definitely feel a sense of accomplishment upon completion. come on ... it's Hot Guns :D An addictive game, where chaos reigns supreme. If your go-to attitude is "shoot first, ask questions never" then, honestly, you might have some issues, regardless, this will be the perfect game for you. You can team up with friends to grab even more cash to upgrade your weapons further. It's cheaply priced and has plenty of achievements to kill time completing. Ehh..
Core game mechanic of weapons keeping you from jumping high is not a great choice, and weapons looking similar plus duel wielding/weapon swapping being a pain only exacerbates things. Also, purchasing weapons is pointless when you just drop them 4 seconds into a level. The game sort of hits its stride a few worlds in, but there are only 2 or 3 excellent levels that make the gun-jump mechanic seem worthwhile. It's kinda short but I wish it had been shorter, which is not a good thing. Visuals are really fantastic though, only thing that's positive across the board. Quite impressive combination of 3d assets and spritework. In no way a substitute for good game design though.
NGL I played this and forgot it so hard 2 months later I didn't even know what it was in my steam library. I was stunned to see my playtime was 2 hours, it felt like 5.

P.S. Next time you make a game don't put a giant cool gatling gun in it that only appears once, and when it does i have to immediately drop it to jump over a gap, not even getting to shoot an enemy with it once. Was this a joke?? What on earth were you thinking.

I won't remember how much this game irritated me, because I simply won't remember it at all.
4/10, play something else.

name: Viktor OST
short_description: The complete original soundtrack from the game, Viktor.
reviews:
6/10 MMMMMMMMETALLLLLLLLLLLLL!!!

   Kinda like DragonForce - minus the questionably "girly" vocals - this soundtrack just flat-out ROCKS. That's all there is to it.

   Lots of double-kick, lots of keyboards, and no end of head-banging guitar riffage. Sure, every track sounds much the same - just like a DragonForce album - but you'll get what you get and you'll bloody well like it, Sonny-Jim! 

   A super-easy recommend to all you metalheads out there, especially at such a ludicrously low price for eighteen tracks of slightly below-average song length.

   Verdict: 8.5/10.

(PS If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my two Curator pages: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9284586-ReviewsJustfortheHELLofit/
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10868048-Truly-Horrible-Horror-Games/?appid=398210
Cheers!) I really enjoy the music from this game.  It's good, solid music that fits the setting while being rockin'.  Some tracks sound like they're inspired by, but not copying, Castlevania.  Nine stolen cheese wheels out of ten!
