‚òê 10 its gameplay looks like a joke its fun This game is looks very nice , however the gameplay is awful. 

It consist of 90% "exploration" in here you really discover health increases, new "skills", and more uses of those "skills".

Then it is 10% boss fights. This boss fights are fun, they are not mechanically hard but they are a good visual experience, and is the best parts of the game.  

Now, this game is tedious you move like a slug, and THERE IS NO SPRINT BUTTON. The only way to go faster is to use your a limited skill that you obtain. To obtain this skill you have to go through a maze like area. Aside from just guessing which route is correct there is nothing else in the game play area to do. 
If this game had a mode where you just fight the bosses then this game would be excellent. The game would then take like 30 minutes to finish since they are rather easy. But alt east the game would be for 100% of its run time. 

Dont play it, just watch a video of it, if you are interested. Good short game. 
S+ Tier Art style.
S Tier Music.
1 level could be better but the rest were great. Another level had a bug that required a restart but that's an outlier.
Mechanics felt highly responsive and there was animation cancelling, though cycling powers mid combat feels clunky; it should be just number keys instead (with an option to scroll through accessibility settings if needed).
Teaches Norse mythology which is cool. Narration was great throughout

9.35/10 will recommend.
 The art style is incredible and the combat is both dynamic and challenging. It satisfies both the itch for a comfort game but also a game I need to beat my head against for a little while. I can't speak highly enough of the dev team's commitment to the lore; having the dialog in Icelandinc is *brilliant*. I got this for about $2, which is the only reason I won't refund it.

This is almost not even a game.  That doesn't mean there wasn't passion here though... in fact quite the opposite.  But just not for a game.

It's kind of like someone said "hey, wouldn't it be cool to have a story with really unique music, and authentic icelandic voiceovers?  We could get deep into Norse myth in a way that others haven't, and really show off the beauty of that ancient religion!"  

And they did just that... and did it well, for the most part.  But somewhere along the line they kind of... forgot about the game?

Honestly this is a walking simulator.  The scenery is all hand drawn but it's still... samey for a lot of the map, which is also quite maze-like.  Also, you move pretty slow.  But there's every now and then some really cool scenery or rune or something and a tidbit of Norse myth delivered through some actually really great icelandic voiceover work.

But it's still not a game, really.  There's very little to do.  There's a few token bosses thrown in, probably because they wanted to label it an action game instead of what it really is, which is a Norse maze simulator.

There's so many games in this space.  This one, while artistic, just doesn't command the time that pretty much any other title will. I really want to like this game so let me say I would finish the game if it wasn't so slow. 
This is an exploration game with occasional combat, but it only has combat abilities and nothing to help explore... at least just give the player the ability to sprint when there are no enemies around. 
Sad that the care, passion and effort that went into the art is ruined by the lack of mechanics that would make it enjoyable to experience the game.

name: Slay the Spire - Soundtrack
short_description: Includes the Slay the Spire Original Soundtrack with music by Clark Aboud in MP3 format.
reviews:
Solid game; banging soundtrack. Need I say more? No, but I will.

To 90% of the bad reviews on this product: the fact that you couldn't spend 30 seconds to look up or click around on Steam to find out how to view a soundtrack saddens me. Your research and intuition skills are genuinely terrible and you should be ashamed of them rofl. It's literally under the View menu, and in BP there's a Soundtrack section in your library.
So in essence: no you of course don't deserve a refund; you have your soundtrack. Found I was listening to these on YT a ton, so I decided I'd spend the... only $3? Definitely worth it. No FLAC, just mp3, not that I care.

If you're wondering why the reviews for this sit at "mixed," here's a quick, translated summary:

- "This isn't additional content for the game; it's a soundtrack! What a scam!"
- "I can't find the Steam Soundtracks menu. What a scam!"
- "I listened to the music while I played the game, didn't like it, and then... bought the soundtrack." i dont know if this is a peak game that comes with an incredible soundtrack or the oposite Fantastic soundtrack all the way through. Don't understand the negative reviews at all, I think it fits the game perfect. It's beautiful, it's not too in your face, and it's full of pleasant, ear-wormy melodies. To be honest, I agree with the sentiment that not all parts of this soundtrack perfectly suit the game it's set in (Slay the Spire).
(Slower, jumpier tracks like "Battle trance" do definitely work for a card game but as some others have said, most are a bit less 'think and attack' and more 'storm the castle sword in hand' that set perhaps a different tone than you'd except for what you're seeing.)

However, I'll be damned if these tracks aren't earworms.
I really like "The Beyond" and I keep coming back to the tracks on youtube to play in the background when working, so I do like their pacing as standalones. Would like the soundtrack for myself offline and to support a little.

I also noticed Clark Aboud also did the soundtrack for another game on Steam called "Kind Words" and that has some catchy ones too (see "Summer Triangle"), so regardless of the suitability of the music, there's clearly talent there methinks! I don't understand the reviews, who buys the soundtrack for a game if they don't like the music?

I bought this for the simple and easy reason that Slay the spire gave me hundreds of hours of fun, and I wanted to support the devs a little more. I don't really like it. It tries to keep you on the edge of your seat, as if a pitch battle is going on. This game is basically a really slow, long, complicated puzzle. It needs mellow puzzle music, background music, thinking music. Not something that hits you over the head and demands your attention. 

For an action movie, this is a good soundtrack. But not for playing StS. quality music YES Clearly I didn't get enough of this from playing the game

name: Âí∏È±ºÊÆø‰∏ã / My journey
short_description: This is a Interactive Live-Action Game. You will travel back in time to become a noble Highness and experience the local customs and practices of ancient times. A series of your choices will influence the development trajectory of this world.
reviews:
One of the S tier FMV game. good story and beautiful FL. 9/10 There is english subtitle very high production and well made, story is kinda nonsensical but is still enjoyable.
best is all actress are so pretty! worth to buy. ÂæàÂ•Ω Wow, i was expecting just another fmv but instead i got a full on period drama/wuxia story with great acting. 10/10 Definitely recommend!
 Great FMV with high-quality production, excellent actresses, and an engaging story. The comedy is spot-on, the duration is just right, and the overall production is top-notch. Highly recommended! This the sixth FMV games I finished till the end and kind of hybrid because although it‚Äôs having subtitle, sometimes I used the Chinese subtitle instead because sometimes the sub is not correct, therefore I played using miclink and yaoudao, a software to translate with better grammar accuracy.

On to the game, since March 14 2025 update, I don't experience any technical issue while playing this game whether it the loading, unsynchronized audio, lagging, stuttering or unable to login.

As usual I play this game using Seagate external hard disk with 5 tb capacity. 

There are many minus points about this game but there are more plus points that should cover the minus.

[B]Minus points[/b]

[olist]
[*] English subtitle sometimes inaccurate
      The subtitle quality generally is good but sometimes it has incorrect grammar but still acceptable.
[*] Weird story writing
     The story sometimes feels weird and not very clear although it has important and meaningful messages
[*] Story lacking
      There are many points of the story that need further elaboration to make it more clear for example [spoiler]when the Main Character investigating the organization, the thing he did is unclear and not like usual investigation but instead enjoying himself[/spoiler] also the last combat could be more elaborated with more scenes
[*] Less satisfying combat sequence
      The combat could be better if it implements QTE during the combat scenes
[*] No achievement
    The lacks of achievement will makes players unlikely will progress through every scene of the story as there is lacks of reward for them to achieve.
[/olist]

[B]Plus points[/b], the reason why I still recommend this game 

[olist]
[*]  Great acting
     The actress did amazing acting to bring the story in to live especially :  [list][*][b] ÁéãÊ•†Ê•† ‚Äì W√°ng n√°n n√°n [/b] (played as [i] S≈´ z«ê m√≤ [/i] ‚Äì the girl who plays music instrument), [*][b] ÊûóÂ¶çÊüî ‚Äì L√≠n y√°n r√≥u[/b] (played as [i] L«ê w«én w«én [/i]) ‚Äì the girls often wear red, [*][b] ÈæöËä≥Â¶Æ ‚Äì G≈çng fang nƒ´ [/b] (played as [i] Y√® y«î [/i] ‚Äì the bodyguard), [*][b] Á´†ÂáØÁé• ‚Äì Cheung Hoi Yuet[/b] ( played as [i] Y«ên r√°n[/i]- the silk merchant), [*][b] ÂàòÊü†ÁÜπ - Li√∫n√≠ngxƒ´ [/b] (played as [i] GƒÅo yu√® [/i] ‚Äì the Governor Wife) [/list] and even supporting actress such as [b] ‰ΩïÈõ®Ê°ê  - H√© y«î t√≥ng [/b] (played as [i]Aunt Lan[/i] ‚Äì Ê®ìÊúàÊúõ‚Äôs manager)
[*] Great Music
      The music in this game including the instrumental are very good and enjoyable to listen to.
[*] Great outfit
      The wardrobe team deserve praise for the amazing and beautiful outfit.
[*] Lots of important messages
     Such as "knowledge will change destiny" which highlight the importance of education and literacy and "what the most important is the citizen wealth and quality of life".
[*] Detailed production with great environment
The environment is very well created and makes you feels really at China during kingdom era and the props it‚Äôs made very detail such as books with the contents really related to the story
[*] The [spoiler] Ê®ìÊúàÊúõ [/spoiler] transformation that improve the quality of life of the girls living there is great idea although many of the implementation is a bit weird but it gives the girls who looked down in society a better way to earn money.
[/olist]

Based on all mentioned above, I can give this game a score of [b]80/100[/b] because despite its minus it's has many plus value for anyone played the game.

Thank you for Â§ßËÅ™ÊòéÂ∑•‰ΩúÂÆ§, the developer of this game that despite needed some fix and polish has made the game enjoyable enough and gives some important messages to it's players.

For the next production, I hope the story will have better writing and implementation while for me [b] the acting of the actress (specifically mentioned above), the environment and details are already great [/b] and should be maintained. Good game. Highly recommended. i simply love the story - the beauties of cos without saying! Looking forward to more productions from this company - maybe extra DLCs such as before & after this story will be good... willing to pay... Do include other NPCs as well might be fun too! Looking forward! i like the story it's good immersive game actually.
but, on the otherhand when you get the branch option maybe you don't need to end it fast, and can shot a short video how it's react and got end in it. the overall game is soo goood. i'm highly recommend this game for who you are like to in depth the story.
hope you can  have a sequel for better game experience and make it more enjoyable for the branch option story

reviews:
The only positive is that, if you buy one of these you get it in all three games. Not that it should matter since this should be in the base game anyway and it doesn't even look that good! Bought it, but this is the biggest scam ever. But its also vital to the games. Gonna be real, the blood still looks like shit, I use a mod to make it more reasonable and detailed. I buy no other SEGA/CA titles because garbage like this is always tied in with would.. otherwise be a good shell of a game (Don't forget the other ninety plus lord packs, like we had in Rome 2, and Attila.) I will not buy Thrones of Brittania, I will not buy Three Kingdoms, I will not buy Pharaoh, and I love my history bs, I love Call to arms and Men of War Assault Squad 2! But definitely makes you not like the company doing trash like this. should be base game [h1][b]Total War: WARHAMMER - Blood for the Blood God[/b][/h1]
This should be a toggleable option in the game itself and not a paid DLC.
If the developers truly want to put it in the shop as DLC it should be free & available for everyone.

The only good thing about this is that you will get [i]Total War: WARHAMMER III: Blood for the Blood God III[/i] for free if you own this or [i]Total War: WARHAMMER II - Blood for the Blood God II[/i].

‚ú® If you want to read through my [i]Total War: WARHAMMER[/i] review click [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/GoldxDog/recommended/364360]here[/url]. ‚ú® thumbs down should always be free, making this a paid DLC for every total war title is ridiculous paid gore is lame

name: Ascii the Brave Cat
short_description: Ascii the Brave Cat is a retro-style 2D action game with awesome new mechanics, cute characters, and memorable gameplay. Meet the never seen puzzles, collect upgrade items, fight creative funny bosses, and push yourself beyond the limit to save someone (or something) you love.
reviews:
I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it. It‚Äôs completely broken. The game just gets stuck on the title screen and doesn‚Äôt respond to anything, no keyboard, no controller‚Äînothing. Hard, when I got the achievement for beating stage 3 only 8.2% of people had got it. But this game is very fun and overall pretty well made (Stage 4 mini boss sucks though) Tough game but really good! I really enjoyed the music and the gameplay tho. I like the fact that its got some anime elements and that its a side-scrolling platformer, I also like the graphics! Although some enemies were a PAIN to take down, but I think this whole thing is pretty creative! This game is very close to being a great, polished 16-bit-style platformer, but there are some major quality-of-life issues that render it close to unplayable. I leave this feedback in the hopes that it inspires the developer to make some improvements, because I truly do like the game that Ascii the Brave Cat is aspiring to be. The graphics are colorful and appealing and the overall game design is thoughtful and creative.

In a nutshell, the game is too hard, not in a "Nintendo hard" throwback sense, but in a completely unnecessary and frustrating way. I say this as someone who, though I'm no kaizo mario master, finds most retro throwback games like Shovel Knight and Cyber Shadow to be far too easy. 

Overall, Ascii feels like a game that has only been playtested by the developer, who has first-hand knowledge of what to expect on every level, and not by any actual players. There are jumps that will almost certainly be missed the first time through, enemies that appear out of nowhere that cannot be avoided without memorization (and sometimes still not even then). This would be acceptable and par for the course in a game with generous lives or continues, but Ascii limits players to 3 lives max before game over. I don't mean that the game starts you off with 3 lives; I mean that you can NEVER have more than 3 lives maximum at a time. If you obtain a 1-up and you already have 3 lives, it counts for nothing. (You can collect gems and buy an upgrade that allows you to have 4 lives max, but that's it.) This is beyond absurd for a game that relies so much on trial-and-error experimentation; there are parts where you can accidentally eliminate a crucial platform block and thus create a dead-end, necessitating that you kill yourself and start over. Imagine playing something like I Wanna Be The Guy but you have to start from the beginning after dying three times. I honestly can't think of any other game I've ever played with this severe of a limitation on player lives. There are slot machine bonus games strewn throughout the levels and hitting the jackpot of three 1-ups is nearly always meaningless because of the cap on player's lives.

A related problem is the controls. As another reviewer says, the jumping feels stiff. If a lot of retro platformers are too "floaty," Ascii has the opposite problem and feels much too heavy. After every jump you always feel like you've just barely graced the lip of each platform and even the most simple traversal can feel laborious. (I would never have guessed a game that looks as cute and lightweight as this would have my hands cramping as much as it has.) The game offers full controller support but doesn't feel like it has really thought through how it plays with controller vs. keyboard (and a retro platformer like this should be designed with a controller in mind first and foremost!). For instance, there's a ground-pound style move that is crucial for reaching some platformers by bouncing off floating enemies, performed by pressing "down" mid-air. On a D-Pad or analog stick, it's impossible to both hold down and give enough weight left or right to "steer" off of a ground pound's bounce. You'll need to remap one of your shoulder buttons to "down" for it to really work, but you'll want to also keep your regular down button, too, for climbing ladders and navigating menus. Maybe that doesn't seem like a big deal, but to me it exemplifies the additional thought that needs to go into the way the game controls.

To their credit, the developer is active and responsive and seems to have an idea of the game's difficulty. They've offered cheat codes in the community board to mitigate some of the game's frustrations. But even these cheats themselves have frustrating and unnecessary limits. They'll "cost" you 500 gems every time, so you'll find yourself grinding for gems just to be able to afford to consistently restore your 2 or 3 available lives after hitting a tricky segment so you can keep progressing in a level without starting all the way over. 

All in all, I really want to play and enjoy this game. Even after getting frustrated and giving up the first time, I found myself back at it later in the day. However, when I caught myself grinding for gems just to be able to afford enough cheat codes to have a shot at beating the second level, I had to walk away. I only make these criticisms in the hopes that the game is eventually revised into something reasonably accessible. I will happily boot up the game and change my review when this happens.

UPDATE 3.3.21 - The developer has very thoughtfully responded to my review and is continuing to work on the game. I'm going to upgrade this to recommended, because I believe it is at heart a fun game and that it will hopefully get even better and more accessible. This is a fun platformer that you can tell the developer really cared about. 

However, at this time, the jumping feels very stiff.

name: Hexcells
short_description: Hexcells is an ambient logic puzzle game for PC, Mac and Linux.
reviews: A high level minesweeper/sudoku player might be bored with the levels, but I recommend this game for the other 99.9% of humanity, great fun! My most recent playthrough while perfecting every level before moving on took 3.5 hours. Hexcells is a simple logic puzzle game, easy to complete and plenty of achievements to gather fun but short Short, sweet and to the point. Minesweeper with flare. The penultimate level was jokes! The puzzles, ambient music, color schemes, key sounds and the use of honeycomb like structures makes for a very well-rounded game. If one liked Minesweeper, then this might run it back for them. Worth a try. short logic puzzle game you'll easily get a few hours out of, easily worth the price when on sale It's a really nice (and surprisingly difficult at times) puzzle game. I didn't expect nonograms x minesweeper to work so well! Decent hex minesweeper style game, no guessing required.  Finished 100% achievements in under 2.5 hours.  Feels pretty zen, though a bit stressful if you are trying to finish levels with 0 mistakes. This short and comfy puzzle game based on minesweeper has quite a bit going for it. From the minimalist and smooth presentation to the various mechanics it introduces, it features an hour of casual gameplay to do as a distraction or in a coffee break. Considering the potential the game has in terms of level design I do wish it was longer but I can't complain much considering its price. Fantastic.

name: Lingyao Garden | ËôöÁ©∫ÁÅµËçØÂõ≠
genres: Casual, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Early Access
short_description: He mistakenly entered the secret realm of the void with abundant aura, met the seriously injured female master, and then embarked on the life of cultivating pills
reviews: It's a good game, I really like it..

name: Red Pippy
short_description: Red Pippy is a 2D pixel art platformer starring a red bird who dreams of flying high! Before taking off, he must train with his wise master, facing challenges filled with obstacles and enemies that will test his strength, endurance, and courage.
reviews:
Really fun game! It‚Äôs a 2D pixel art platformer, just the way I like it. There are bosses, puzzles, and power-ups! I highly recommend it! Hope there‚Äôs a sequel! :) Adorable, reminds me of older gameboy games. Indie devs starting out and made a birb game. Flap and try to fly.

There are about 4 gimmicks:
1. Hover (available throughout except the water stages)
2. Swim (be in a bubble, left and right move you up. Only available in water stages)
3. Swap gravity (only available in city stages)
4. Boost dash (only available in the last 10 levels)

Very quick game. Every 10 levels have their own theme/enemies. It can be minutely frustrating, but it's simple fun. Worth 4 USD.

Devs, keep making games, keep updating your games. Don't stop. Main feedback I have is to allow for custom keybindings, I like to play with a single hand with wasd controls. Maybe add in a few easter eggs with special achievements to add some more replay value. Could also consider adding more hazards to each level after the first loop, call it "hard mode".

Look forward to what you make next. A love letter to the golden era of gaming, no ads, no mtx, I love it.
Check out my video review on YT @mistermelancholy7698

name: Swatcher
genres: Design & Illustration, Photo Editing, Web Publishing
short_description: Swatcher is a color palette creation tool with a variety of features to streamline, organize and automate the process for you.
reviews:
biggest upside is that you can make sets of colours that will all get along very well between each other, no matter the hue. the rest of its features are all upsides and deserve appreciation.

sometimes you end up with colours that look very alike but have slightly different HSV numbers, but it's not that big of a deal when you manually curate colours anyway.

its only downside is that it lags the more colours one works with (uses a lot of memory regardless of that). scrumptious W Kinda wonky but does the job well when you get used to it I've used it for years as a quick time saver. It just works.  If you're bad with color combinations like I am, I recommend it. Took me a little while to understand the program but it's simple and yet extremely useful once you know what it can do. The only thing that I missing in it is a screen color picker or a photo hex picker. No new features in years, there are dozens of free web-services that offer much more features with better UI.  deadass i do not even remember why tfk i got this piece of shit this app amazing, as a person who dosent like keeping images of color pallets in my folders i like this At first it got a little confusing, as someone who would use Digital Art Software and Video Editing Software without any knowledge, it took me around 10 minutes to get all the ins and outs of the program, which wasn‚Äôt half bad in all honesty. 
I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth the initial $5 but getting this on sale for $0.49 seems to be alright. However, despite it‚Äôs neat color Palette board and strong GUI, I could just use the Colors in the Art Software I have, and even ones they have on the internet for free, which I have also tried and found with good results. I used GIMP (Art Software) for a bit and it worked like any other Software I‚Äôve used.
It‚Äôs nice have some features of it on standby but from where it stands I would only recommend it if it was a $1 or cheaper.
At least it works as intended, my initial thought was that it would help port the color I wanted to use into the Software that I‚Äôm working with, but that was just an expectation I shouldn‚Äôt have set.

name: Pride of Nations: The Scramble for Africa
short_description: The Scramble for Africa is the longest scenario for Pride of Nations yet. Taking place for 40 years starting in 1880, the rapid colonization of Africa by European powers is underway.With most major powers operating with a strong industrial base, it‚Äôs time to set your sights abroad.
reviews:
[b]Smoothness[/b]

I must say that this runs pretty smoothly on my PC and it seems that the devs have really improved stability in the recent patches. Turns last no more than about 30-40 seconds for me which is definitely good for a game like this.

[b]The setting and features[/b]

The setting is great, the Great Powers have their own goals and agendas, there are tons of different units and I love how you are sending expeditions to the colonies as units and then using decisions to influence how those develop. The colonization is definitely something amazing here.

The military system is simply amazing with enough units to make your head spin. Overall, it is a very good and tested system for military matters and it is a much better game than Victoria 2 and Hearts of Iron when it comes to military things and the depiction of 19th/ early 20th century conflicts and WW1. It suits how armies were moved and organized back then.

The setting, however, is not perfect. In 1880 Napoleon was no longer the leader of France, and definitely not a president of the Republic, 

[b]Summary[/b]

Give this game a chance and try it. It works really well now and it can certainly be much more fun than Victoria II. Scramble for Africa, like its base, Pride of Nations, are simply great games for their realism and historical accuracy. One must be patient to play and not be goal oriented: just enjoy playing. Only defect I found in Scramble is that on the window 1 of government they still have the leaders of 1850, so Napoleon III is still president on France in 1880 (in reality exiled in England or dead), Tsar Nicholas I still in Russia (dead in 1880), and so on.
The diplomacy part needs a lot of work. Everything is too rigid. It is impossible to form alliances.

name: Lost Angel
short_description: Lost Angel is the first feature-length interactive FMV(full motion video) made in Korea. We invite you to the dangerous journey of influencer Alex, who is on a trip to Korea!! Your choice will soon become a new story for this film.
reviews:
This game is definitely unpolished, including language errors in both spoken dialogue and subtitle text errors. The story is kind of stupid, but in a B movie kind of way; definitely not a deal breaker. Honestly, the biggest knock against this game is that is lacks any kind of skip or fast forward feature when re-watching scenes you've seen before; the game has 9 endings, so you'll theoretically want to replay it several times to see the different endings and different branches of the story.

As someone who has some fondness for FMVs and their jank, this one just crossed the threshold into 'do not recommend' for me. However, if you're a real FMV lover, maybe you ought to get it anyway, given the overall sparsity of the genre. The FMV is so good, actresses are pretty, story is not good I had play worse FMV games, 5/10. Actors are not good at all and the history is not very bad, but choices really matter and change things. Like I had write, a fair pass! It was a pretty decent movie. Was laughing at some parts that were meant to be serious, but I like for what it was. Gets a pass from me. A fun comedic movie to watch while high Highly recommended if you love trashy acting and b-movies. I love FMV games, I almost bought and played every full-motion video game on steam. To my disappointment, Lost Angel didn't meet my expectation, especially with the topic of the game itself. When you read the game information about the main character, a youtube influencer getting involved in a dangerous conspiracy, you'd think it will be an exciting story, but once they mentioned the Covid-19 virus, it all went down and started to become a cheap story- not that it wasn't from the beginning due to the mediocre acting.   
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2402022618

The acting is not my favorite part of this game, especially the Korean actresses, if it wasn't for the subtitles I wouldn't know what they are saying. I didn't notice any soundtrack that stuck in my head during my gameplay. I have played it a couple of times to try to get different endings and to give an honest review. The choices you make do matter and it will change the course of the story, there are some major choices, and some of them are just normal and don't affect much on the story. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2402026951

Pros:
+Multiple endings.
+You can skip seen scenes.
+Steam achievements.

Cons:
- Quite short.
- Mediocre acting.
- Cliche story.
- No manual save.

I still wonder why they choose this title name for the game? it is not related to the story at all unless they mean the cure is the Angel.  I'm sorry I can't recommend this game, it is also quite expensive to what it gives. 

[quote]ùêπùëúùëü ùëöùëúùëüùëí ùëüùëíùë£ùëñùëíùë§ùë† ùëêùò©ùëíùëêùëò ùëöùë¶ ùëêùë¢ùëüùëéùë°ùëúùëü ùëùùëéùëîùëí [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32399565/]ùêπùëíùëíùëõùëé'ùë† ùê∂ùò©ùëúùëñùëêùëí[/url][/quote] The acting isn't the best, and the current tagging is ridiculous (survival strategy hidden object god game, really?), but I'm still giving thumbs up to anything that helps the FMV revival that's been going on lately. Also, I still like playing it so far! Overall, I'm mostly thumbs in the middle with this one, but leaning partially down. It's an ambitious effort which I appreciate, and I got relative enjoyment out of my playthrough. The issue: a game like this relies on the player wanting to repeat the game, going back through the other branches of the story and trying to obtain all the various endings (there are 9). Having finished one ending, I have almost no desire to pick it up and play back through. Putting in close to around 90 minutes on this game, that's simply not quite enough to justify the purchase. 

The story plays out like a B-movie thriller; there's some secret conspiracy involving the coronavirus "cure" (which I'm pretty sure just means vaccine, not sure why they kept saying cure over and over), you're some cheesy youtuber who gets involved with two women in the middle of it all, you get chased a bunch, chaos ensues. The story is sort of ludicrous but in an entertaining way, and the acting is generally bad but it does give you some laughs which doesn't hurt. There are definite things of value at play, there's just not enough, and the choices are so bare bones you only feel moderately invested. Thumbs down, but wishing the developers the best going forward, as there's potential here. the plot is a bit far-fetched and the acting isn't perfect (especially when they fall down), but overall an entertaining game with many branches and choices that change the course of events

name: IL-2 Sturmovik: Yak-9T Series 1 Collector Plane
short_description: Yak-9T was capable of not only engaging bombers and various ground targets, but could also hold its own as a dogfighter.
reviews:
37mm presents a compelling argument against Fascism. At least it's not a LaGG-3.

Great fighter, will do what it's told, one well placed 37mm shot will destroy artillery, planes and other tanks, but you only have 30 rounds and a very limited summpy of 12.7mm ammunition to support it.
It does lack ground attack capabilities, making it mostly a pure fighter.

Overall a great plane. This plane is something else. It rewards patience and marksmanship with a devastating NS-37 mm cannon that will cut almost any aircraft in two. The Yak-9 itself is a really decent aircraft capable of holding its own against any German aircraft. The Yak-9T however adds that extra punch that other aircraft in the VVS just don't have.

Pros: 
- Powerful NS-37 mm cannon on the Yak-9 which adds the ability to pulverize any German plane which gets in your way
- The Yak-9 itself is a really capable aircraft. The NS-37 gun on it makes it even more deadly
- it can be a great ground attack aircraft

Cons: 
- Slightly more heavy then the regular Yak-9
- That ammo count is really low, meaning that you really have to hit what you're shooting at. 
- If the NS-37 runs out of ammo ( which it will above the Kuban with the massive dogfights that occur ) you will have to rely on the 12.7 UB machine guns. The Yak-9 regular has other weapons which work well with the UB guns, but on their own they are not the most powerful. 

Final thoughts: This is probably my favorite aircraft in the game. There is no feeling like just hitting the trigger and splinting a fighter or bomber in half with a short burst. I believe this is a must have for any allies or VVS player. A fat Yak-9 is a Friend of Mine ~Soviet Proverb Pros:
Another high quality plane from these great devs.
Very maneuverable for a plane that has a 37mil cannon onboard
Almost identical engine management to most of the other Yaks (7B being the exception) so if you already know how to fly one, you can fly them all

Cons:
Very limited to air only, has no ground attack capability other than its guns. This is historically accurate though but just saying, it is not a do-it-all plane. Unlike the regular 9, this one has the 37mm gun which is great. The HE rounds can destroy normal artillery in one well placed hit and the gun being center mounted in the nose makes it accurate. The AP rounds can disable some tanks if you wanna use it as a tank buster, just come in from the back end.
Really doesn't feel that much different than the 7B or the 1B for that matter, overall. The improvements are not too noticeable. This one is all about that big gun
Similar to other Yaks (except the first one), it has extremely limited ammo. You'll run dry in no time.

Overall worth it, to have a maneuverable Yak with a 37mm gun. Presents a huge improvement over that tank of a LaGG. I don't know about it,
Though the LAGG is pretty good for a One Sortie 1 Kill Wonder.
I will place it in one of my other 200 accounts.
Oh it makes me laugh.
 The One Punch Man of the VVS I've only flown this bird once, but I gotta say: I'm a fan. The ammo count may look low, but place your shots carefully, and you'll be fine. The 37mm is a peach. Get in close and route one shot right down sweet Jerry's pooper, and it's flight over. The flight dynamics are very similar to the 7B but feels a bit heavier, while faster with a solid dive. The visibility is similar to the 1B with a slight reduction in low 10 - 2 o'clock visibility due to the set back cockpit. You get a vertical speed indicator in the cockpit which is nice, but hard to remember it's there after not having it in the other Yaks.

All in all, this is a good plane and I'm anxious to get some more hours in it.

name: Highschool Romance
short_description: Can you find love as the only boy in an all-girls school? Find out, in this slice-of-life visual novel game with multiple endings.
reviews:
Crossdressing: The Visual novel! 

I kid you not that is the whole game. You are an effeminate looking guy who crossdresses and gets into risque situations with 2 highschool girls and your principle. I can only recommend this game if you have a thing for feminization or crossdressing yourself. Nothing particularly interesting happens as it can be summed up as typical highschool events with the occasional reminder that yes, you are a guy dressed as a girl and you don't want anyone else to know but after interacting with you for like 5 mins. they will know. Selina doesn't even look like she was drawn the same way as the rest of the game. Seriously wait until this is on sale for like $5 if you are curious but don't expect a masterpiece; just girls in their bras, panties, some kissing and if you go for Lea a maid scene. Impressively silly Incredible gameplay. Very exciting, really had me on the edge of my seat. My favorite part is when this is crazy I was literally lifting really heavy weights and fell and this weird shit installed bro no what bro This is such a lovely experience. For those who think this is a hentai game, it's not. There's *some* exposure of skin, but I would say it's good for people in their late teens, no genitalia or anything. It's just a short story about choosing your crush, assisting them and building a relationship with them. The dialogue is very cute and I love the main character's femininity in it. This is the gayest, sexiest non-sex non-gay game ever created. It's cute, trans-coded, hot, and a blast to play. 

A must-have for cute queer transfems out there. 

Though I will say, it's a bit disappointing the main character is only a femboy. No other complaints.

name: HIVESWAP: ACT 1
short_description: A hand-drawn tribute to hilarious '90s adventure games (with none of the accompanying frustration). Play as Joey Claire, a puzzle-solving teen snatched out of her time (1994) and place (Earth) and stranded on a hostile alien planet on the brink of rebellion.
reviews:
Guys this game cured my seriousness, its generally good fun A very charming and beautifully drawn and written little point-and-click adventure game that is a must-play for any devoted Homestuck fan, in my opinion. The attention to detail is astounding; you can literally use any object on anything in the environment (which is BURSTING with things to examine) and get a bespoke, specific joke about each combination. And they're all hilarious. That may not sound that impressive until you see just how cluttered Half-Harley Manor is. That Homestuck prose/dialogue charm is definitely still at work here, and every character is instantly lovable. I had this in my wishlist for eons. Man, what a total letdown.

This is an extremely short point & click which felt more like a prologue than an actual chapter, there's adventure games out there available for free with more content and gameplay. Even if you consider Hiveswap as a prologue, it barely counts as an introduction to the Homestuck universe and its quirks since its the sort of story that would make little  sense to anyone outside of the fandom. Hiveswap is aimed only for fans with an unsatiable craving for any new speck of media related to the comic --- and I say, even for diehard fans this would be an OMEGA disappointment.

The visuals are nice and while the game isn't even 2 hours long, there are plenty of animated scenes and quirky dialogue. Problem is, everything is super straightforward with zero problem solving or meaningful player input so the experience is mid to a point this could had been turned into a visual novel and little would had been lost. There are zero puzzles.

I could say that the set up of Hiveswap is a bit interesting, but let's be realistic here: more than half of a decade has passed since the first chapter got released and this game barely had content at all. The chances of the third chapter ever seeing the light of the day are dismal and looking at the premise and lenght story of this first chapter, at minimum this project would need a total of six chapters to be completed. I can't help but think it would be better if Hiveswap got reworked into a comic, animation or anything else so it could spark some interest for the series again.

6/10. Just a very forgettable game Play the game. 8e the 8itch Great animation and a super fun story line, this game deserves more hype for sure! I really appreciate such a beautiful art style, the simple controls make it easy to explore the game and interact with your surroundings, 10/10!! :) it's goofy, has a great style to it and the puzzles are fun but what more can I say then it's homestuck Good My favorite quote of the game, 
"You realize this PIGEON is now the toughest son of a bitch you've ever heard of." contains batteries 10/10

name: Mad Tower Tycoon
short_description: Design your own skyscraper with more than 100 Floors. Rent offices, apartments or shops and build a financially lucrative skyscraper. Build cinemas, bars or a theater to satisfy your visitors and create an effective transport system with elevators and stairs.
reviews: great game thanks Why does a developer go to such lengths to make a good game only to ignore the need for some kind of manual or effective tutorial to play the game.   Your given all kinds of stats and info with no instruction on how best to utilize the info.  This is just plain lazy in my opinion.  I would have given this game a big thumbs up if I wasn't forced to guess as to what the info given to me meant.  Such a bummer. This is basically SIM Tower from the 90's... If you liked that game you will like this game.  IF you missed out on playing SIM Tower this is basically a skyscraper building game with the challenge of managing your funds (build units that provide rent), traffic (stairs and elevators), and managing all of the rent-unit's (offices, apartments, and shops) needs for traffic (too many or too few is bad depending on the unit type), noise control, and services (trash removal, security, storage, banks, etc...).  If you like planning and building games (think vertical city within a tower) you should like this one.  The ultimate goal is to build a  100 floors and place a chapel or two on top of you skyscraper. its only 4 years old when it feels like 16 Great game that rivals even Sim Tower from back in the day. Fun game, well thought out mechanics and gameplay elements. Just needs Eggcode to come back and give this game some QoL updates and maybe some small DLC releases. Like opening up the game to workshop to let players make new content to extend the life of the game... A simple little time waster that looks kind of pretty too. Reminds me of Sim tower from my younger days (yes I'm old) Developers, please make more games like this. Take an old classic -- SimTower -- make it a little better and more modern, offer a nice clear progression and win in a reasonable amount of time. We don't need every game to be live service or infinite content drip. Just make something fun for 10-20 hours, and then make a sequel in a few years. Good work here, had a great time. I normally don't review games but I have to add my 2 cents to this one. First to all those who complained about the differences compared to the original Sim tower game , This is not the original and it has been some time since we all lost years of our lives playing the Sim games of old and changes happen.  The creator of this game is to be praised for capturing the basic ascetics of the original and after just under 2 hours play , I can tell you I will be losing a lot of hours in this game. The changes are not game breaking and do not detract from the original. If you have fond memories of all those sim games from yesteryear then you are in for a treat with this one. Play and have fun. This is a good game if you ever enjoyed Sim Tower back in the day.  I like simple simulation games like this and I thnk the developers did a pretty good job.  You'll still find some bugs here and there but overall I think they got it right.  If you can find it on sale, it's an even better bargain. SimTower üëç

name: Legendary Heroes Survivors
short_description: Slay thousands of monsters and survive until you defeat the ultimate boss. Legendary Heroes Survivors is a rogue-lite game where your character development choices will help you quickly overcome hundreds of monsters that attack you, reach the boss, and defeat it.
reviews:
I like it Fun, addictive little game! looks almost identical to one i played on the iPhone many years ago, so probably a steram port which is awesome. Keep the updates coming! Aesthetically looks great but as far as the mechanics/options available it feels rather limited, most of the characters feel like reskins. Definitely worth the 3$ but I definitely didn't get invested enough to try every character or make it to the end. Survivors, pure and simple. This game deserves more attention than it gets, while the game loop right now seems a bit repetitive and progress is relatively slow, it is early access after all and assuming we get a bunch more content as time goes on this one could be a great little gem. Right now besides the starter skill most classes feel similar simply because there's a lack of variety in the skills they get, I expect this to get updated but it's still good fun even as it is. Maybe I am biased but in my opinion the fact I've played this for a good few hours now and not seen any crashes or obvious bugs is impressive.

If you like the survivors genre you're almost certainly going to enjoy this, the game loop is your usual kill, level up, die (or complete the stage!), repeat but your characters have a meta level which slowly but surely makes them easier and more efficient to play.

It's also a cool twist that your attack skills at level 6 become an awakened version with big damage, really makes you want to get each of them that far to see what they're like. I kind of wish the passives had an awakened version too but I'm pretty sure they don't right now, hope that gets added for some more OP build fun.

At this price point it is a great game, just give it a go! A fairly decent little survivor bullet heaven with clear, cute graphics and animations. Good feedback on dealt and received hits. Interresting progressing as you permanently levelup with a Novice character in missions where you spend stats strengthening your character. While normal mission levelup is the traditional random skills and passives you can choose from. The game offer a basic Meta progress also with passive upgrades. The price is very affordable.
Recommended little game in the genre. good exp for playing dev update for more good exp Good game, It's fun and easy to understand, making me lost track of time for a while.

Still needs more balance and variety of skill. ‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ô ‡∏î‡∏π‡∏î‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏¢‡πÑ‡∏õ‡πÄ‡∏•‡∏¢

name: Hell Blasters
short_description: Hell Blasters is a bullet hell shoot 'em up where you can blast the bullet hell away!
reviews:
I'd recommend anyone to play this cool shooter, especially if they have any type of mental issue. Hell Blasters is a more of a classic shmup borders bullet hells to match its gimmick of managing the players bullet canceling shots and bombs.  Which may be polarizing for an otherwise mediocre shooter.

Hell Blasters is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up that offers the player a wider 'Rapid' shot as well as a slower moving, narrower focused 'Shot' for its basic attacks.  A nitpick of mine would have called 'Shot' Focus instead, as I am too conditioned from Psikyo Games to think of Shot as anything but tap to fire or hold down for charged shot.  In addition to these attacks, the player has limited resource bullet canceling large damage bomb attacks common to STGs.  

What really sets Hell Blasters apart from most shmups is the 'SPC' or what I assume is special attack.  This is limited attack based on a recharge meter.  It seems to deliver additional damage, but more importantly, it cancels enemy shots regardless of color.  As orange bullets are basically popcorn enemies, that become rarer the higher the diifculty.  Where as purple enemy shots aren't canceled by the players normal attacks. 

It's using this bullet canceling special that the player has to master as some bullet patterns don't appear to be dodgable at all. Though, this may happen more frequently due to poor player routing or memorization of the stage that actually getting trapped.  This bullet cancel special does make fights, particularly boss fights, much easier even if they aren't needed to get out of a jam.  And I think the game's overall enjoyment hinges on this mechanic.  I personally don't care for it much.  I'd rather search for a path to avoid taking damage rather than have a weapon that clears one for me.

Otherwise, I don't see much to Hell Blasters to hold interest.  The enemies and bullet patterns beyond making use of the games' gimmick aren't anything special or that memorable.  They aren't bad by any stretch.  They just don't push anything.  The graphics aren't particularly interesting with what feels like 8/16 bit backgrounds with Flash sprites/elements for the ships. And the Flash animation elements largely being simple shapes of various triangles, rectangles and circles.  Defeating the stage bosses are particularly underwhelming consisting of some flashing and an image of the a wrecked part of the boss.  

I found the music and sound fine.  The music particular was good with a few tracks, but nothing overly standout.  Nice little chip tune type stuff that works well for the game.  I've certainly heard worse from the era of games I feel Hell Blasters is trying to invoke.

Overall, I don't think Hell Blasters is a bad game.  It's just not one that I particularly enjoyed.  Well, beyond the Journalist difficulty level, that's funny.  While it's pretty simple.  Which I want in my shmups.  I didn't care for shifting away from dodging to properly making use of your bullet cancel special to clear path mechanic.  If that's sounds neat to you, than I actually recommend it.  But since Steam doesn't have a neutral option, I'm going to give it a thumbs down.  Due to Hell Blasters ultimately not being that fun to me. Very tightly made indie shmup, you can tell the developer is an avid shmup player.  The controls and mechanics are spot on,  although the balancing between the selectable characters is a bit off.  

On top of the usual arcade mode there is practice mode, a very addictive score attack mode, and a content rich story mode which also functions as a training mode.  

The art style is basic but charming and very functional.  Same as the music which is retro style but very good. I have owned and played a ridiculous amount of shmups over the years.  This one keeps calling me back. Not sure why but it scratches some primordial itch.  New arrange mode is the tits as well! Fantastic vertical shmup with great scoring mechanics and challenging gameplay. The story mode is a great way of framing a training mode. The music is also excellent. 

The score attack mode is tons of fun too. Feels like the greatest master system game ever made. And that soundtrack is just amazing. The Boss Theme in particular is such a banger. If you like bullet hell, or shmups or even if you have never played a shmup before, this is an easy buy. Support your indie shmup devs Don't be fooled by the NES-like aesthetics. This is a modern bullet hell shmup with an emphasis on chaining kills (and cancelling bullets), in order to get higher scores (and also there's no screen flickering involved). There's also a good amount of fun game modes including Arcade mode, two characters, a Caravan mode (Score Attack) and even a pretty innovative Story mode. 
The latter can be seen as huge a tutorial not only for the game, but in some ways the entire shmup genre itself. Here you get to play through small sections of the game, are given instructions and are being taught the basic principles of the game as well advanced scoring mechanics. And the story also has many nods to famous shmup classics.

Although I'm not a fan of the entire 8-bit design, the game's look can be quite charming and some tunes are pretty decent. Moreover it features an awesome 9:16 tate mode for fullscreen vertical shmupping. Also the visibility of the bullets is good and it plays very vell.

And by the way, you can participate in the currently running running Caravan Competition run by Shmup Junkie by playing the free demo. I'm fairly new to playing shoot em ups (shmups) to actually be good at them rather than just credit feed my way through an arcade game. I wanted to get into 'bullet hell' shmups but the games are really intimidating. This game was recommended because the designer is an accomplished bullet hell player who made the gameplay the top priority - and made it so you can use the story mode to actually learn to play a bullet hell.

It's been an absolute blast and the story mode really delivers bite sized chunks of training and the arcade so you can practice them and learn how to deal with the enemies. 

I'm also participating in an online score attack competition for the game that is incredibly fun and I don't normally play for score, only survival. 

While the graphics are rudimentary, the bosses have a nice charm to them, the 8bit soundtrack is actually quite good, but most importantly the gameplay is REALLY on point and I'm absolutely loving it as someone just learning to play a bullet hell. This is the Bluesmobile of shmups. It may not look like much on the outside, but it's got the cop motor, cop tires, and probably even the cig lighter. Great level design & bullet patterns, a ton of modes, leader board & replays, great shmup tunes, it's all there. Great work, devs!

name: keyg: the last prison
short_description: Explore a world like no other, where your keyboard becomes a level, and each key represents a room on that level. You‚Äôll face various logic puzzles, challenging arcade levels, cunning enemies, and unexpected surprises.
reviews:
This game is only playing keyboard Well making game.
Good making funny adventure puzzle game.
 good Sure, I guess I dislike it.
I understand that this is an indie game, but I felt frustrated completing it. 

It's not responsive especially if you try to enter a fast keyboard sequence. And the way it makes the game harder (which is lame) is through speeding up the gameplay  [spoiler] (especially during the 2nd playthrough) [/spoiler]. With a mix of unpolished stuff included, I do not recommend this game. Interesting gameplay and quite hard i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

keyg is a puzzle game in which you maneuver around using the keys on the keyboard, moving from Q to W, and so on and so forth. there are varying levels of complexity. full price is $5, but i got this for 90% off (49 cents) and i could not recommend that deal enough. this isn't the best cheap puzzle game you'll find on steam, but it definitely is one of the better ones that you should buy. top tier üóø Original concept but boring and tiresome. Pretty bad game. Not a puzzle game, just an arcade one. So nop, not for me despite the puzzle game tag.
By that i mean, i could have liked a puzzle game with a SMALL emphasis on action. Action here is the main word and puzzle is far far far beyond. Quite original controls. Not easy to get used to, but certainly a great change from most standard games. It's almost free, so it's certainly worth its cost. Is it fun? Perhaps after one plays for a long enough amount of time and get fully used to how the player is controlled, but I'll recommend it regardless for its unique control style and low cost. The way I see it, keyg is a puzzle game that relies a lot on knowledge and very major experience with puzzles like these. It has a simple yet smooth style to it, and somewhat meh but fitting music to go with it. However, there are a few things that can be done better.

Hint System / Difficulty Change
I think it would be a bit better if a hint system could be added, or a sort of difficulty changer, as a lot of this took some intense brain power and a bit of guide reading. It seems that this can rely on some forms of knowledge that not everyone may know, like roman numerals, as well as a few things you may need to take a guess on. A lot of this was guessing because the clues for the levels weren't very helpful, though it is nice that difficulty was provided. It also becomes a bit annoying how in the reaction time levels I have to repeat it around 30 times just because I got clipped right at the last section or my game couldn't react fast enough to realize there was an open space to move through. Speaking of, this moves me to my next suggestion:

Please Fix the (somewhat) Lag
The lag in question isn't really lag, but more of a problem that the game can't react fast enough to. If I try to move fast in a level where I have to be quick, I bump into an open doorway like it was a normal wall and have to spam the button to really get in. This isn't that important of a problem because you can just spam the button to get through, but I do recommend that it's fixed.

That's just about it, actually, everything else I really enjoy. Good style, good music, great story, but the gameplay could be better.

I would still recommend, 7/10.

name: The Kotonoha Sisters and the Legend of Lysant Island
short_description: This game is a turn-based action RPG that moves around in a 3D space where you can enjoy various scenery with cute 2D characters. Operate the Kotonoha sisters and explore a fun and mysterious island!
reviews:
Áê¥ËëâÂßâÂ¶π„Ç´„ÉØ„Ç§„Ç§„É§„ÉÉ„Çø„ÉºÔºÅ„Å®„Å£„Å¶„ÇÇÈù¢ÁôΩ„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô......ÔºÅ Loved every bit of this game. 

There's even Chocomint Ice! To say that this game is a hidden gem would not be an overstatement at all. ITS A GREAT GAME IF ONLY IT WAS IN ENGILSH fun. but it's in chinese For those who don't know, The Kotonoha Sisters are characters made by A.I. Inc, and where first released as voice-banks for the Japanese voice synthesis program VOICEROID. They also have voice-banks for A.I. Voice, NEUTRINO, and SynthesizerV.

The game is solid! The fights are cool and the use of VOICEROID is very creative. I only speak a bit of Japanese, so I can only understand a portion of it, but it's still very fun! [h1]ÊúÄ OF THE È´ò[/h1]

The Kotonoha Sisters and the Legend of Lysant Island is something truly special. I'm a huge fan of doujin gaming and love to see the passion and creativity that small development teams often bring, and this game easily ranks amongst the best of them, if not the very best I've ever played. 

Created entirely by the talented uwag0-sensei, this game is an adorable homage to the Paper Mario series starring the cute voiceroid twins Akane and Aoi Kotonoha. If you're not familiar with the voiceroid scene or the characterizations of Aoi and Akane, that's entirely okay as the game stands more than strong enough on its own merits (but I would nevertheless highly recommend checking out GYARI's songs "Akane-chan Will Listen to Whatever You Have to Say" and "Aoi-chan Is Going to Eat Chocomint No Matter What" as they absolutely influenced some aspects of the game!)

The game begins with our two protagonists marooned inside their own hotel room. They had won a winter trip to "The Land Blessed by the Goddess of the Sun," Lysant, worked part time jobs to save up enough spending money, and were excited to enjoy ~Endless Summer Fever~ at the beach, but when they arrived at the country, they're greeted by endless rain. And since it doesn't normally rain in Lysant, the airport only sold expensive decorative umbrellas and they could only afford one for the two of them. And the hotel doesn't even have an indoor pool to enjoy! 

Exasperated that their entire trip was about to become a washout, they ask a hotel attendant if there's anything remotely summer-esque they can do. There wasn't -- but they learn of a festival being held that day as part of a ceremony back to ancient times when it rained just like this, where the Goddess of the Sun confronted a rain demon causing the endless torrential downpour and was ultimately sealed away with it. As a tradition, the villagers choose someone to play the role of the Sun Goddess during the festival in hopes of abating the rain. 

During this ceremony, lightning strikes and the skies miraculously clear, returning the sunny weather to the village -- except Aoi is now unexpectedly possessed by the Goddess of the Sun herself. Immensely confused, the Goddess quickly tries to pretend like nothing is wrong, but realizes that the seal on her had been broken -- and along with it, the rain demon's must have been as well. She quickly assumes Aoi's identity and pretends to be Akari's sister so as to not worry her, but realizes that other parts of the island must still be raining, so she must convince Akari to go on an adventure with her to seal the rain god away under the guise of going sightseeing. As the game progresses, you become increasingly entangled with a religious sect of the island who worship the rain god, Reavy Hain (subtle!)

The game is predominantly a light hearted comedy, much in the same way Paper Mario is. uwag0-sensei clearly put a lot of thought and love into the script, and the two sisters (or one sister and one goddess) play off each other incredibly well. I'm not the sort to laugh out loud much, but, well, I laughed out loud quite a lot during the game. There's rarely a dull moment to be had. 

But what I find interesting is that the game also has a serious side to it. There's an actual legitimate story told, and, despite starring the often wacky Kotonoha sisters, I was surprisingly invested. Sure, most of the antagonists are borderline jokes themselves, and there's always something to lighten the mood (with the exception of the main villain themselves, at least!) To me, it feels like it was a bold move to flesh out the story and setting as much as the game did, and it's one I strongly feel worked out very well in the game's favor. 

Ultimately, it works because Lysant as a setting is actually interesting! One aspect of the game I adore is that it really puts a lot of effort into the smaller details, and it's those sorts of games that really come together in the end and make a memorable experience. There's lots of NPCs in the game who basically don't have anything to do with the main questline, but have their own personal little stories that progress as you do throughout the game. They never amount to much of anything, but it adds just a small enough touch to the world to make the island and its culture feel alive. All of them have their own unique sprites and manners of speaking, and most of them are pretty cute in their own way, too! 

There's tons of hidden collectibles to find in just about every area, and they'll often make you think of clever ways you can maneuver the terrain to get to them, too! Small things like that add up to a very enjoyable experience!

Speaking of culture, the island actually has its own language, too! The Goddess of the Sun can understand the language, but Akane cannot at all. Aoi can understand a tiny bit. The game appropriately gives you three options for how it displays the foreign language, including an option to have all of it display no matter what. As someone who is not a native Japanese speaker, I found the option to display all the dialogue in Japanese at all times pretty helpful -- besides, there's some great dialogue you might miss otherwise, so I think it's probably the best option overall no matter how good your Japanese is or isn't.

Battles are few in number but surprisingly fun to play. Aoi/Goddess can only cast spells and can't be interrupted while doing so -- Akane will get an increasingly larger inventory of weapons and shields to deal with different enemy attacks and fend them off long enough so Aoi can cast a spell. Most often, the most effective approach is using Akane's umbrella to parry an enemy at just the right time to not only nullify damage, but deal damage to the enemy (one of the only ways Akane can actually do so, I might add.) Enemies are permanently dead when you defeat them, so you don't get tired of fighting the same enemy over and over and over again. Enemies also have different random patterns to try and psyche you out, which can keep you on your toes even during a rare repeat battle. It is not a super difficult game, although the final boss can be surprisingly tough (but there's plenty of ways to cheese them!) 

I'd be remiss to not stress just how important the cute aesthetic is to the core of this game. Nearly every Japanese review of the game has the word 'kawaii' written in it at least half a dozen times. They're not wrong. This game is absolutely adorable. Not just the characters. Everything from the dialogue, the sound design, the music, the atmosphere, this game absolutely nails the kawaii-aesthetic in ways that just about nothing else does. The creator REALLY understands cute, and cute is king behind every single design decision in this game. If your heart doesn't sing when, upon drinking some juice, the two sisters make an audible "aa-- goku goku!" sound, I might suspect you're not human.

Clocking in at around 15-20 hours, the game does not overextend its welcome, feeling complete and satisfactory with a nice ending to boot. A tremendous amount of passion was clearly poured into the creation of this game and it overwhelmingly paid off. Though I've written far more than I intended to, I still don't think it conveys just how much I enjoyed this game. If I could convince one person to give it a shot, I think it'd be worth it. I at least want to let the author know how much their work is appreciated!

The game is, unfortunately, only available in Japanese as of this moment - the creator is on the record saying there are no plans for an English release, as it is presumably very difficult for a one-man development team to commission and fund it, especially for a game like this with so much dialogue, but it would absolutely be my dream job to help translate it someday! For those who can read Japanese, especially voiceroid/paper mario fans, you owe it to yourself to try the cutest, most charming game of our time. cute artsyle and a nice battle system Pretty decent game. 
The OST is nice to listen to, the art style is appealing to look at, and the game play hardly gets repetitive.
Getting lost is rather easy when you can't understand the language but the game is rather simple enough that just looking around or using a translation app can skip around that issue.
Game time should span around six hours if you don't run into save issues, so I would say it's worth the price for what it gives. its good turn based rpg only problem with the game it has no english so you cant tell what there saying or the story unless you just wanna make it up from the pictures in the beginning of the game

Get it if you want to kill an hour and have fun! It was ok... It could be worse! Even though it's just 2 bucks, it's a very boring game and doesn't really have much about it. Personally can't say I'm a fan, but hey, it's cheap so if you think you'd like it, go on ahead. The sound is good and the graphics are ok but size is an issue - tiny resolution that looks bad scaled to fullscreen. Oldschool arcade style progression; play until you die and enter your initials via high score table.. though the 'continue' feature lets you resume where you'd left off, score intact ;) The gameplay is not great. You simply move the tanks around avoiding bullets while they auto-fire on enemies. Two tanks at once just doesn't make sense.. too much going on to control both, unless you have two heads.. which I don't. The game play is just not very engaging
 The idea is rather nice, it just does not work.
You somehow need to control 2 tanks but the controls have a bit of lag. This game is going to be brutal on your mouse and/or you'll suck at it :D
Even with the low price the game comes at I can not recommend it for PC players. Terrible controls make it almost unplayable First level already is not possible to win without using "friendly fire" of the enemy, i.e. positioning in a way that the enemies kill each other. Not a good starting level.
But the most problematic thing is the control scheme. To move a tank it is necessar to click it first and then click the target location. Afterwards the tank is deselected, i.e. it is necessary to click again to reselect. This makes the control nonfun.
Note that in the current version the resolution is fixed to 1024x something, leaving a lot of space around the battlefield.

name: SNUSE 221
short_description: Hey. My name is *&#!$. Today I will tell you a little story of my life. I will tell about my fears, experiences. You will see many beautiful places I visited. You will have to solve many mysteries and secrets that are in my subconscious.
reviews:
Generic horror garbage with a complete black screen intro for a stupid amount of time.
Expect shitty jump scares
Expect loud noises
Expect something bad This game has no menu screen and no exit option. After five levels it just repeats.
The atmosphere visually is like in the screenshots, although the game is not as suspensful and quick as promised in the video.
The low resolution and motion blur was rather offputting.
I, being a gamedev myself, don't want to say much bad about any game, so I will give it a thumb up.

name: The Scrap
short_description: The Scrap is an independent third-person shooter that takes place in a futuristic world inhabited by robots.
reviews: This game deserves some credit. Yes there isn't checkpoints but you don't need them since levels are short and not difficult. Yes the FPS is a consistent 30-45 and hangs on explosions but it is playable. This game is gorgeous and FUN. It is short but that's great since it is so unoptimized. Someone should offer to fix this for them.  it's genious! This is a low budget third person shooter where you play as a robot shooting other robots. There are only four short levels and then a boss fight. Shots from enemies do way too much damage and there are no difficulty settings. There is also no way to manually save or checkpoints. So, you will have to start each level entirely over when killed. You also cannot remap the controls and the voice acting is computer generated. I also experienced some massive frame rate drops, like below 10 fps, in the final boss level during the constant explosions. Overall, I found this to be a fairly cheap and janky experience. I cannot recommend this game, as I would rather play better shooters. This game unfortunately disappointed me, especially for the price. It is a beautiful game, absolutely gorgeous in my opinion and runs really well for the graphics quality. That's about the end of my praise though. The customizations options are very limited. There aren't many graphics options, but there is just enough I guess. There is no key or controller remapping. The designated key maps in the menu aren't what they actually are in game. Oh, and the voice acting left a lot to be desired. It wasn't just that they had a heavy Russian accent, that's fine. The voices just sounded kind of harsh, and not warm enough. They don't fit into the game smoothly. I could easily look past the few issues I've listed so far. They aren't a huge deal, although many games that are half the price or less can get all of that right. What I can't look past comes down to how the game plays. It's not very smooth and the controls and actions are a bit confusing. Firing guns does feel quite good, but movement and aiming are just off. I quit the game on level 2 after my character got stuck in the "cover" position. I feel like this game really should be in beta or early access at least.  It just doesn't have the level of polish that a fully released $15 game should have. Of course I don't expect AAA levels of quality at this price, but I do expect it to feel good to play. Hopefully the developer sticks with the game and gives it some much needed love through some patches. I would be willing to play it again, but not in its current state. I would actually love to play it again if it felt better to play. I'm a sucker for eye-candy and this game has tons of it! Has potential but feels like it's still in early access. The combat feels punchy but the cover system didn't always protect me and I got hit a lot whilst peeking. The harder aliens you encounter deal too much damage, so it's a shame you can't keep the med packs for when you actually need them. Some of the dialogue from the robots get cut short and the music starts and stops abruptly, so there's some cleaning up needed there. There's also no resolution setting in the menu either, so you can only play in what I assume is 1080p. I only played this for 15 minutes so maybe there's more to this game but from what I experienced there's not much to interact with. Graphics and models are nice but it didn't sell it for me.

6.5/10 cut scenes dont work on Steamdeck.. Inorganic slideshow with non-existent story, and none of the choices they claim. in terms of graphic 10/10, character looks great, good mini games n personnally, I loved the s@x scenes Waste of money. Do not buy it. The scenes are all incredibly basic. The story doesn't have any logical flow and reads like something a 12 year old would write. It's just bad. nonsense One of the worst games out there. 47 Minutes stolen from my life hoping it gets better. It is unpolished and the scenes are just trash. There are so much better games out there for the money. The idea was good the game not so much. Save your money for one of the other games. Or just go to Po..hub.....it`s is for free and you don`t need to skip so much. If you are looking for a game with a deep story and stunning graphics - pass by. This is my best team I've ever worked with. Emotions are running high. Beautiful and enjoyable game!

name: Golden Treasure: The Great Green Soundtrack
short_description: Experience the Music of the Green. Golden Treasure is a game for those who carry dragons in their hearts. Hunt, explore, survive, and become Great among the True Children of Sun and Earth.
reviews:
Bought this to support the devs love this game and hope they can keep making such amazing games. I found some of the music on Spotify, but i only bought the soundtrack so i could hear some of the music i couldn't find on Spotify. I'm glad i'll be able to listen to this music where ever i go, and listen to the relaxing atmosphere of the great green. I love this soundtrack, especially "Winter." They did a fantastic job! Lyrical and dreamlike beyond compare.
Reminding me always of my life as The Golden Treasure in the wondrous Great Green.

May we all be blessed. Love this music, it is beautiful, and every aspect of this game is an art piece itself. My thanks to Jim and Dylan for this wonderful soundtrack. Very soothing.

The soundtrack can be found in the game files.

name: Aya's Journey
short_description: Guide Aya through a perilous journey in this haunting 2D sidescroller puzzle game. Overcome deadly obstacles, face inner demons, and unravel the secrets of her dark world. Will you help her escape the shadows?
reviews:
Well...I don‚Äôt understand why there are so many negative reviews, everyone compares it to some kind of Limbo or something like that, I‚Äôve never played it so I have no idea what it is, so whether it‚Äôs a good thing to compare or not no need
So, what exactly is about the game? Simple for 30-60 minutes, I'm confused by "To be continued at the end" but that's okay. Complex? No, simple, easy riddles and obstacles, you just need to understand the timings. Something else? Well, it‚Äôs a little buggy in terms of control, it doesn‚Äôt respond to the ESC, you can only get out with Alt+F4, and nothing else, is it worth the money? I honestly don‚Äôt even remember when I bought it, but I think it all depends on what you are waiting for, I would play purely for fun, besides, it is often discounted for less than a dollar Aya's Journey is a "template" flip.  The Russian asset flip scammer behind this filled out a basic template in the craptastic Cocos2D (a blight on gaming), changed the name/reskinned a couple of things, and put it on Steam as if it was their own game.

Aya's Journey is an unabashed, lazy ripoff of Limbo (Copyright Playdead/Microsoft Game Studios, 2010).  Many lazy "amateur" developers don't pay attention to their obligations under copyright law, and often steal the ideas of actual, real game developers without credit, such as the "developer" here has done.  At this stage no legal action has been taken by Playdead/Microsoft Game Studios against the "developer" here, but it's never off the table, as previous copyright law cases have shown.

Putting aside the unethical intellectual bankruptcy of stealing someone else's game concept for profit, this is also breaking that unwritten law of stealing other people's game ideas... you should at least try to do better than the game you're ripping off.  Aya's Journey is considerably worse than Limbo.

Boogygames Studios have shown a repeat pattern of unethically dumping other people's work onto Steam as a cheap, nasty cash grab, through this account or through closely linked/alt accounts.  Here's some examples so you can see for yourself:
[list]
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/973200]Case Simulator Weapons and Armors[/url]" = [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/packs/yet-another-case-opener-91635]Yet Another Case Opener[/url] developed by NeraQuam

    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/707610]Food Mahjong[/url]" = [url=https://marketplace.yoyogames.com/assets/3337/mahjong-game-engine]Mahjong Game Engine[/url] developed by SmallBigSquare
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/713590]Hidden Object - Food[/url]" = [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/systems/hidden-object-game-template-19394]Hidden Object Game Template[/url] developed by Puppeteer
    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/714570]Hidden Object - Tools[/url]" = [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/systems/hidden-object-game-template-19394]Hidden Object Game Template[/url] developed by Puppeteer

    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/681150]Rainbow Duck[/url]" = [url=https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/packs/switch-the-gravity-63196]Switch The Gravity[/url] developed by App Advisory
