    [*] "[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/709940]Weapon and Armor: Mahjong[/url]" = [url=https://marketplace.yoyogames.com/assets/3337/mahjong-game-engine]Mahjong Game Engine[/url] developed by SmallBigSquare
[/list]

Taking this shovelware seriously as if it was a genuine attempt to make a game, it doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The implementation here is of such poor quality, the developer couldn't work out how to make the game display in fullscreen, it only runs in a window.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 3 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from, the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

Aya's Journey is relatively cheap at $3 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, and the questionable ethical nature of the developer and/or their associates (as outlined above), this is impossible to recommend. I've played like 10 minutes, the rest of the time the game was running on the background because there is no music so I never noticed it's there. So yeah, problem number 1 - there's no music on Linux. Which makes the whole experience more dark than fun. Also, so far it's like some neurotic Super Mario. Jump up and down, die, again, die, again, etc. Moving with the arrows is a bit unnatural after all the games using wasd and also so far it's hard to measure the jump well. As a whole, for now, it looks too hard to me. Of course, after 10 mins I cannot claim I know the game, I'll give it probably another half an hour, but so far it's just not so fun to play it. I got to the part where you spend 20-30 seconds lugging a box up a hill to do 1 difficult jump. It was instantly extremely tedious and annoying... This game ain¬¥t definitely like Limbo. It¬¥s just a jump game that looks like it. If you wanna run, jump and die thousand times because of the bugs in this game, go for it. The game is not finished and I don¬¥t think they¬¥ll fix something in the future. Don¬¥t buy it. This game so want to be LIMBO, but lacks any of the heart and cleverness of that particular gem.
It has annoying platforming, with sudden meaningless deaths (why does touching a boulder after it has stopped rolling kill me?).
I couldn't even work up the enthusiasm to finish it. This is a change in pace for me, because I genuinely hate writing this review.
I've wondered why the 'Limbo' style games never caught on. Until now. This game is like Death Stranding, except bad. Bad in an irredeemable way. I don't even think it matters what I say, because this game seems to be in eternal 'Early Access.' It's very likely the 2 people working on this game (that's not a joke), gave up on this project as no progress has been made in 3 years. 
But hey that's what happens when you allow 2 people to run a game company with ADHD. (that's a zinger).
This game was made with paint, and runs at 60 frames. Only problem is that at most, any given object has 2 frames. Including our Limbo rip off. Of which, you can't tell if they are looking into the awful repeating background or blinking every second. 
You know what made Limbo's dark atmosphere great? It blended well, it was quiet, it allowed the curiosity of the player to do the work for it. This game just throws a bunch of random fucking RNG puzzels at you, without the slightest hint of how to complete them. GOOD THING THE GAME HAS A NO LAG JUMP THAT YOU CAN DO ON ANY SURFACE REGUARDLESS OF SLOPE. Does this game need work? Yes, it needs to be blessed, because I gave it to the end, I ACTUALLY PLAYED THIS GAME, and I have nothing but resentment for the 2 ass hats who made this game look like it might be good. 
SPOILER: [spoiler] IT'S NOT [/spoiler]
Oh also, here's a first, this "music" is great for 1 minute of reveal trailer nonsense, but a single track for an hour, makes me want to rip my ears off, shove them into YOUR ASS, so I can listen to the sweet sweet release that is the SHIT OF THIS GAME. 
Please, developers, please actually work on this game?
Yeah? Got questions on how to improve it? I got tons of suggestions, but this isn't an "Aya's Journey suggestion." It's a review, and as they say in Poland:
It's shit. I enjoyed it. It's a simple game. I'm a simple man. Terrible game. Stay away! It is just a ripoff of Limbo {which is a suberb game!} but this game has NONE of the good points from Limbo. It just looks like Limbo. This game is a total ripoff, it's not fun, you die without warning, you can't go back, the kid is like 3 feet tall but can jump 15 feet into the air, it's not at all cute, fun or entertaining. All Thumbs Down. Looks like a rip off of Limbo but doesn't play like Limbo.  Very unpolished game.  Maybe the devs will prove me wrong but as of now IMO its not worth playing.

name: TAL: Arctic
short_description: TAL: Arctic - In this game you need help an unknown creature to go in the magic portal across many mazes.
reviews:
60 lvl's seems excessive. after about 40 i was dragging. you can "occasionally" find these little "glowy orbs" that you can use to buy 2 other skins. dont bother getting all of them because i discovered that after you buy the skins you end up with 5 left over. no footprints either. music is nice. no reward at the end, you do get an "achivment" after Every Single Level. then you get an achiv for getting all the skins. thats it. also seems meh to have to buy x5 games at 99cents each. why not make chapters? why not a timed option? why not an element of danger towards the end lvl's? nice relaxing game (to a point) but becomes a headache later. do less levels, add some mods, add a timed mode, make an ending of some kind (even if it's just a picture) just something. A game that requires literally a second or two of mentally calculating a path to the exit before an EXCRUCIATINGLY LONG WAIT as you control the sprite for it to eventually get there. If the speed of it was 10x as fast, then it would be an easy completionist game. Its a short and easy maze game. 1 level 1 minute, boom. :D fast completing game... really F A S  T . 
no obstacles no enemies.. nothing... 
 I can't say I recommend this game.  If you already own it or are getting it as part of a bundle it may be worth playing through for the achievements but the game itself is boring and fast to complete.  There are no obstacles or enemies and the mazes weren't challenging. Fun little maze game.  I love the music it makes everything creepy vibe. red skin looks like devil but i am not even sure what that creature is but looks cool. I wish that there was option to use arrow keys, it would be amazing if that creature moved faster and cough up in corners less often Amazing gameplay, 10/10 graphics, challenging maps, great enemies, epic storyline, best soundtrack of the year.
12/10 would buy again. 6/10

name: Dungeon Marathon
short_description: Dungeon Marathon is a new style of game where you must run through Dungeons, no fighting allowed!
reviews:
Out of all the Dungeon Marathon Games I've Played this one is the worst... I have nothing to compare it to. The barbarian run animation alone is worth the positive review. Fun game and intend to play more. √â aquele tipo de jogo que quando vc faz alguma coisa vem uma satisfa√ß√£o acompanhada. Por exemplo: O barulho de pegar a ma√ß√£; Passa a fase com 3 estrelas; Toda hora √© uma 'quase' morte e toda vez que vc escapa √© satisfat√≥rio; entre outros....

O game tem um climinha de zoeira que faz ganhar muitos pontos em carisma! 
Em rela√ß√£o aos achievements, tive somente algum desafio no que tem que zerar no modo hard.

O principal ponto forte do game seria a divers√£o! 
Recomendo muito! I enjoy the other Retro Army games quite a bit and definitely recommend people check out Super Trench Attack! However, this game, despite being dirt cheap, didn't fill me with a ton of joy. It works, plays okay, looks okay, and is exactly what it is described as. However, the inventory isn't explained as well as it could and the levels are a repetitive slog. This is made all the more annoying on Normal and Hard difficulties since collecting apples, think pellets in Pacman, also increases a poison meter for your selected character. What that means is that if you are aiming for 100% on Achievements, you will likely have your characters die off, not be able to revive them, and have to wipe the save and start all over again. I played on Normal and that happened to me in the last dungeon/gym. So I wiped my save and started on Easy where the poison meter is absent. Was able to get 3 stars on all dungeons that I could find, yet there didn't seem to be an ending, even a cut to credits, that I could find. Very glad I didn't waste more time trying to beat the game entirely on Normal or Hard. Not a terrible game, but not one that I'd recommend. Top-notch. Simple but fun! It has a solid challenge curve that builds up as you play. A lot of room to develop your skill to get good at this and max your ranking and unlock everything. Simple ,cheap, and fun. Dungeon Marathon
fast game with modern day graphics with easy controls that moves from location A to B to C and so on,

good game.
Personal Suggested Purchase Price: $0.49 Or Less During Sale
 So... Dungeon Marathon, neat.

Honestly this is probably one of my least favorite Retro Army games... and yet I enjoy keeping it as part of my collection.

I would call this a speed run game except it isn't, it's more of a...run around and collect apples while avoiding enemies maze game.  Like Pac Man except you're playing probably the most obliviously stupid fantasy heroes of the land.  I get my good brand of juvenile humor I expect from Retro Army but like any Retro Army game I also get the seeping dark undertones that add a twist to the gameplay.

The freaking apples. [spoiler] Not really much of a spoiler, but I would leave you to enjoy the realization that the apples from the mysterious gender indeterminate "gym" owner are also poisonous and will eventually kill you when your "poison meter" reaches 100%.  The good news is you can buy a detox potion...for 1000G which you'll only get by being good at eating Apples...see the dilemma? [/spoiler]

And so that's what this game comes down to, managing 4 runners while trying to beat the game and not completely screw yourself in the process.  The control and collisions are a little weird sometimes but you can get quickly used to it.

A decent time waster if nothing else. [h1]Review # 45[/h1]
[b]TL;DR[/b] 3 buff bois with no gym membership out of 10 
[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
	[*]Pixelated graphics are always welcome 
	[*]Able to realize its own inadequacies ( at least I hope it was self aware humor) 
	
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
	[*] Hit box detection
	[*] Boring gameplay (sorry but that‚Äôs being honest) 
        [*] Possible seizure alert in the opening screen 
	
[/list]
[b]Impressions of the game[/b] 
The biggest reason I‚Äôm giving this game such a low score is because of its premise. I initially was intrigued by a game that was a ‚Äúdungeon‚Äù esq. game with no combat however I quickly found out that the two didn‚Äôt mix as well as I thought. I get that one of its biggest marketing points was just this (see game description) however, if that is the case then the gameplay must feel tight and the hit detection must be nearly perfect. Neither of these two criteria were met. Often times I felt my character was sliding rather than running. Im sure there is fun to be had here for some but, I can definitely say that it is not my forte. If you are still interested I would highly recommend getting it when it is dirt cheap only.

name: Heroes of Scene
genres: Free To Play, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Strategy
short_description: Heroes of scene is a multiplayer strategy game with an indirect control. You are in charge of the Kingdom of live toys. Build your own castle and summon toy warriors and spells to win!
reviews: ......................... Nice game all play I've tried to give this game a fair chance. It has a huge potential to be a great game. BUT it's extremely frustrating to play. Your 2 choices of playing it, are vs other humans, or vs AI. And when you fight the AI, they tend to have like 3-4 units for every 1 unit you make, destroying you 95% of the time. I've played probably 10 games, and I think I only won 1 of them, maybe 2. There is just too strong of a momentum curve vs. the AI.
